The ant smiled back and said, that sounds like a great idea! So, the two of them started running together up the palm tree, faster and faster. Eventually, they made it to the top!
Charlotte and the ant stopped at the top of the palm and looked down. They both smiled and Charlotte said, thank you for running with me, my little ant friend. That was lots of fun!
The ant nodded and said, me too, Charlotte. Until next time! And with that, they went




Once upon a time there was a boy. He was in a park near his house. 
He looked up and saw a tunnel. He wanted to see what was inside, so he stepped inside and stared. The tunnel was wet and dark. He could not see the end.
The boy started to get scared. He wanted to go back, but the tunnel seemed so long. He was getting wetter and wetter.
Suddenly, he heard a noise. He looked up and saw a light. It was the end of the tunnel! He ran quickly to the end and saw the sun. He was happy that he made it out. 
The boy never went back in the tunnel again.



Once upon a time, there was a brother and a sister named Jack and Jane. They loved each other very much and they were always spending time together.
One day, the siblings were cooking rice in their kitchen. Jack sprinkled some mild spice on his rice and Jane sprinkled a lot of spices on hers.
Jack said to her Why are you using so much spice, Jane?
Jane replied Because I love spicy food!
Jack smiled and said I like mild, but I still love you.
The moral of the story is that we may have different tastes in food but it doesn't change the amount of love we have for each other.



 
Once there was a playful puppy who loved to go outside. Every day, the pup would happily run around the road and kick things with its feet. It especially liked kicking leaves and stones. One day, the puppy decided to kick a big rock. The rock was so big that when the puppy kicked it, it flew over the road and down a hill. The puppy was so excited and ran after the rock to see where it landed. When it got to the bottom of the hill, the pup saw that the rock had landed in a big puddle. The pup was delighted and began kicking the water and splashing all around. It had so much fun, and it wasn't long before the pup was soaked, but it didn't care at all!




Once there was a little boy named Jack. He wanted to go outside to play. He put on his warm sweater and went outside. He saw a big tree and he wanted to climb it. He found a branch and he grabbed it. He felt so happy and he used the branch to pull himself up. He climed higher and higher and his heart was beating like thunder. Then he noticed that there were some thick leaves above him. He was very excited and he decided to pull them and see what was underneath. To Jack's surprise, he found a secret nest! He had found the perfect place to stay and keep dry from the rain. It had all been so easy - he only had to pull the leaves and there it was. He was so glad he found it. He stayed at the nest for the whole afternoon, feeling happy and warm. 
When it started to get dark, Jack said goodbye to the nest and went back home. He was so excited to tell his family all about his secret discovery!



Once there was a princess. She had long, beautiful hair and was very honest. She lived in a lovely castle and had many friends in the kingdom.
One day, a handsome prince arrived. The princess was so excited! He asked her to marry him, and she was overjoyed. She said 'yes' and there was a big celebration!
Everyone in the kingdom was very happy for the princess and prince. They married in a beautiful ceremony and danced the night away. Everyone was so happy to see the two of them so in love.
The princess and prince lived in the castle and were very happy together. They both stayed true to their promise of being honest and kind. They shared many wonderful adventures together, and the kingdom was very glad they had married.




Jack stared at the ant trudging across the ground. It was so small and lonely. Jack wanted to help the ant, so he stood up slowly, being careful not to step on it. Jack saw a tiny hill nearby and he slowly guided the ant to it. The ant looked up at Jack, then quickly scurried up the hill and disappeared.
Jack smiled and waved goodbye. He felt glad that he was able to help the little ant. Jack was about to walk away when he saw 3 more ants on the ground. They seemed lonely too. Jack started to stare at them, wondering what he could do to help. Then he had an idea.
Jack found some pebbles nearby and built a small pile near the ants. The ants all climbed up the pile and slowly, one by one, they traveled away. Jack smiled and waved goodbye once again. He was so happy. Jack had helped 4 lonely ants and he felt really good.




Once there was a little boy who loved to play in the sunshine. One day he saw a temple and wanted to go inside. He opened the door and it looked very tidy. He liked it so much he wanted to pull a door off the wall. He had heard stories about temples and thought this was OK.
So he began to pull. He was so strong. He kept going until he heard a loud snap. He felt it throughout the temple. He knew he had done something wrong but he couldn't figure out what. Suddenly he saw the wall start to topple over. He shrieked and ran out of the temple. 
The little boy was very sad. He had pulled something very important from the temple and it was all his fault. He never went to the temple again because he was too scared.




One sunny day, a boy and his daddy went to the beach. The sand was warm and the sea was blue. The boy had never seen the beach before. He was excited.
His daddy took out a surfboard and said, "Let's go for a ride in the big waves." The boy said, "Yes!" He held on tightly to the surfboard and the daddy paddled.
Soon, the boy and his daddy were riding the big waves and surfing in the sea. The water was warm. It felt nice. The boy and his daddy rode the waves until they were too tired.
Then they went back to the beach, and the daddy held the little boy in his arms. The boy felt so happy. He had so much fun surfing in the sea.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old and she had some pastels. She liked to use them to draw pictures.
One day she took out her pastels and started to draw. She made a big messy picture. The colours swirled together to make a rainbow. The little girl was very happy with her picture.
She wanted to show her family what she had done. But when the girl went show it to them the mess that she had made was too big. It was so messy that her family laughed.
The little girl was sad that her picture was a mess. She didn't want to use her pastels anymore. So she put them away and never used them again.
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very curious and adventurous. She loved to explore and when she saw something mysterious, she was sure to investigate. 
One day, she was packing her bag when she noticed a small mirror tucked away in the corner. It was very old, with a dull finish, and it seemed to have a mysterious power. She had never seen it before. 
"What is it?" She asked her mom.
Her mom smiled and replied, "It's a magical mirror. If you look into the mirror, you will see all the secrets this world has to offer."
The little girl got excited and opened the mirror. She was amazed by all the mystery behind it. She decided to pack the mirror in her bag and take it with her on her adventures. 
On her journey, she discovered so many wonderful and mysterious things. She couldn't believe all the secrets she found! She was so grateful to have the magical mirror in her bag to guide her. 
And that's how the little girl went on the best adventure of her life. The mirror was her guide and her companion and together, they saw amazing places and wonderful secrets around the world. 




Once upon a time, there was a fat pupil. She was walking to school, hopping along with a skip in her step. Suddenly, she felt something grab her ankle. Startled, the pupil looked down to see a puppy had caught her. She laughed and swept the puppy up in her arms.
The pupil patted the pup's head and said, "Good puppy!" Then she carried the pup to school with her.
When they arrived, all the other pupils were happy to meet the pup. Everyone wanted to pet him. He was so happy he gave each of them a big, wet kiss on the cheek.
Soon school was over and the pup went home with the fat pupil. She hugged him with a big smile.
And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time there was a little girl named Alice. She was three years old and loved to have fun. One day, Alice's mommy brought home a new comb for her. It was bright blue and smooth.
Alice was so excited and ran to the mirror. She was ready to use the comb and make her hair look beautiful.
Alice ran her comb through her long, golden locks. The comb felt so smooth on her hair. She loved it. After brushing her hair, Alice grabbed a book and sat back in a big, comfy chair.
Alice closed her eyes and took a deep breath. She felt relaxed and very happy. She smiled and snuggled in the chair as she read her book. She felt so peaceful with the soft sound of the comb in her hair and the sound of the pages turning.
Alice enjoyed her relaxing day until it was time to go to bed. She had a big, wide smile on her face. She was very content with the way she had spent the day.




Once upon a time, there was a boy. His name was Jack. He was very sad and miserable. 
One day, Jack heard a talking coming from outside. He went to the exit to see who it was. When he arrived, he saw two people - a prince and a princess. They were talking about marriage. 
Jack asked them, "What's marry?"
The prince answered, "Marriage is when two people love each other so much, they want to be together forever. They promise to always believe and trust in each other and make each other happy."
The princess held the prince's hand and said, "I am marrying you so that I'll never be miserable again."
Jack smiled. He realized that he could be happy too and he ran away, feeling much less miserable.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl who hated rocks. Every day she walked down the street and saw all the other kids playing with rocks, but she hated them so much that she always frowned. One day, her mother spotted her and asked her why she was so sad. The little girl told her mother that she hated rocks. Her mother smiled and gave her something special - a fake rock. She told the little girl that it was so special that she never had to worry about anyone else playing with it since it wasn't real. The little girl smiled and hugged the fake rock tight. She loved it so much and even took it to bed with her every night. From then on, she was never sad when she saw kids playing with rocks on her walks down the street. She knew that she had her very own fake rock to keep her company.




Once upon a time, there was an old man. He had an old chess set. One day, the old man saw something shiny in the corner of the room. When he went over to take a closer look, he realized that it was a little sparrow.
The old man said, "Hello, little one. What are you doing here?"
The sparrow said, "I was playing with your old chess pieces. I tore one of the pieces in two!"
The old man was surprised. He told the sparrow not to worry, and carefully picked up the two pieces of the chess piece. He looked at the pieces, and smiled.
The old man said, "At least you were having fun! We can put it back together. Here, watch me carefully."
The old man carefully put the two pieces together, and then the piece shone just like new. The old man said to the sparrow, "See, we fixed it! Now, let's play a game of chess together."
The old man and the sparrow played a game of chess, and the old man won every time. When it was time to go, the old man said goodbye to the sparrow and thanked him for the game. The sparrow said, "Thanks for fixing my mistake!" and flew away.




Once upon a time, a little girl was walking up the stairs. She counted them as she walked up, "1, 2, 3... 7, 8, 9!" From the top of the stairs, she could see into a deep, dark room.
The little girl was timid and scared, so she walked back down the stairs. When she reached the bottom, a kind voice spoke out to her, "What's wrong?"
"It's too deep and scary in there," said the little girl.
The kind voice said, "It's all right, I can help you count the stairs to make it feel more safe."
The little girl took a deep breath, nodded, and then counted again, "1, 2, 3... 7, 8, 9!"
Together, the little girl and the kind voice took the steps one number at a time. Finally, when they reached the top, the little girl looked into the deep, dark room. She had conquered her fears and smiled proudly.




Once upon a time, there was a big event. Lots of people were excited and happy. Everyone was having a great time.
But one little boy felt left out. He wanted to join in, but he didn't know how. He saw all the people doing numbers.
The little boy asked one of the people why everyone was doing numbers. The person smiled and said it was a spicy event. Everyone had to do numbers in order to win.
The little boy was determined to win. He asked one of the people how he could do numbers too. The person gave him some tips and soon the little boy was doing the numbers.
He kept practicing and soon he was able to do the numbers as well as anyone! Everyone cheered when he finished and the little boy was so happy. He was now part of the spicy event!




Once upon a time, there was a poor, little rabbit named Sarah. She was all alone and feeling very sad. She wanted a friend, but all of her friends were too busy to come and play with her.
Suddenly, Sarah spotted a melon in the garden. She got a big idea. She decided to take it and give it to her friend. 
So Sarah took the melon in her hands and began to run. She ran through the garden and ran and ran until she reached her friend's house.
"Hello! I have got a melon for you," Sarah said. Her friend was delighted and said, "Thank you, Sarah. This is so kind of you."
Sarah and her friend laughed and played together. From then onwards, they were the best of friends. Finally, Sarah was no longer poor - she was wealthy with friendship.




One day, Jack was playing with his toy train. He felt like it belonged to him - it was his! Suddenly, his sister came into his room and took the train away. Jack was very upset. He wanted his train back.
He tried to get it back. He begged, but she wouldn't listen. He asked her nicely, but still she wouldn't give it back. Jack didn't understand why she was being so mean. He was very upset.
He looked around and noticed his sister had left the room. He quickly grabbed a bean from the kitchen and put it in the train. That way it would still belong to him.
But when his sister came back, she saw the bean and got really angry. She threw it away and said he could never have the train again. Jack was sad and very upset. He never got his train back.




Once upon a time, there was a dinosaur. He was confused. He didn't know what to do or where to go.
He decided to go for a walk in the woods. He saw some funny animals: a rabbit hopping around, a squirrel collecting nuts, and a little bird chirping. The dinosaur laughed.
He kept walking until he saw something else. It was so big he couldn't believe his eyes. It was a bigger dinosaur, much bigger than him. He was so confused he couldn't move.
But the big dinosaur was friendly. He smiled and waved his tail. The little dinosaur was so happy he started to laugh. Then the big dinosaur laughed, too.
The little dinosaur wasn't confused anymore. He knew he had found a new friend. They laughed and played together all day. The dinosaur was so happy!




Once there was a famous factory called "Happy Factory". Every day the factory made lots of toys that made many people happy. Everyone always wanted to go to the Happy Factory.
One day the factory opened for the first time, but no one could get in. Everyone waited outside the door, but it stayed closed. Nobody knew why it stayed closed, and everyone wanted to know why it remained closed.
Then a tiny mouse came and crept inside the factory. Slowly, the door opened for everyone. They wanted to know what made the mouse so special, but it disappeared quickly. Everyone was very excited and ran inside. 
The factory was full of wonderful toys and surprises! Everyone had so much fun. The Happy Factory has remained famous ever since.




Once upon a time there was a mountain. It was very big and tall. It was so high it touched the sky.
One day a little girl wanted to get to the top of the mountain. It was very difficult, but she was brave and determined.
She started to climb. She went up and up, and soon it became very hard. She faced big rocks and thick trees.
Her friends came to help her. They each had a sharp knife and they started to cut their way through the tough parts of the mountain. With their help she made it to the top.
When she arrived at the top of the mountain the girl was so proud and happy. She had done it! She had climbed the difficult mountain.




Once there was a young girl who was very polite. One day, she noticed something strange was happening- she was shrinking. Every minute she got smaller and smaller! She was worried, so she shouted for help. Soon, a kind old man spotted her. He picked her up and carried her home. 
Inside the house, he showed the young girl a special potion. He said it would stop her from shrinking. She drank it in one big gulp and, within seconds, she stopped shrinking. She was so happy, she thanked the old man for his help. He smiled and said, Youre very polite. Thats why I helped you. 
The young girl was glad to stay the same size with the old mans help. She thanked him again and went back home.




Once upon a time there were two friends, Jack and Sam. They loved to go outside and play. One day, they wanted to go to the river to play in a raft. So, they got the raft ready and set off.
As they were floating down the river, they noticed something cool. It was a giant fish! They were so excited but the fish was scared of their raft. It kept swimming away.
Jack and Sam were so sad. Then, they had to fight each other because they both wanted to catch the fish. Jack cried and said he wanted to catch the fish. But Sam tried to tell him that it wasn't possible. They shouted back and forth until finally they stopped arguing and decided to go home.
The two friends never caught the big fish, but they had a cool adventure in their raft. They both learned a valuable lesson about friendship and that sometimes it is better to talk than fight.




Henry was an impatient boy. He loved books, but he didn't understand many of the words. He looked at his special dictionary and wondered why it was so hard to understand all the words.
He was sad, so his Dad came to sit with him. His Dad showed Henry how to lean into a big chair and take out the dictionary. He showed Henry how to use his fingers to look up the words he didn't understand.
Henry was still impatient, but he felt better. He began to look up every difficult word he found in his books. He was happy to learn many new words and discover lots of things from his dictionary.
Henry was no longer impatient. He was proud that he had used his dictionary to help him understand all of his books. He knew he could always lean into his dictionary for help if he ever needed it.




One day, a little girl was walking in the park. She was feeling happy. She stopped when she saw something rare. It was a rat. The rat was blue and very small.
The girl felt scared. She grabbed her stick and waved it at the rat. The rat ran away.
The little girl felt relieved. She continued walking, but she kept an eye out for any more rare rats. She also felt happy that she hadn't been scared for too long.
The little girl kept walking and eventually she forgot about the rare rat. She felt cheerful and humming a happy tune. There were no more animals to be seen so she kept moving and soon she was back home.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Tam. She was 3 years old and very curious. She was always asking questions and wanted to know more about the world.
One day, Tam asked her mom for a new cell phone. Her mom said no, and told her that she was too young to have a cell phone. Tam was very disappointed.
Later that day, Tam's mom talked to her and said, "I have an idea that might be better than a cell phone. We could get you a modern toy instead!" Tam was excited.
The next day, Tam's mom took her to the toy store and Tam saw a beautiful playhouse. It was modern and very colorful. Tam's mom recommended it to her and said it would help her use her imagination and learn new things.
Tam was very happy with her new toy and she loved to play with it. She learned a lot of things from it and enjoyed her new playhouse more than she would have enjoyed a new cell phone.
The moral of this story is to remember that traditional toys can be very educational and fun!




Once upon a time, there was a grandma who loved to sew. She saw a special fabric and decided to make a dress. She wanted the dress to be unique, so she used thread to match the colors. Grandma was so excited to make the dress! 
However, when she tried the new dress on, she felt very uncomfortable. The colors did not match exactly as she wanted them and it made her look awkward. She wanted to make it better, but didnt know how. 
Suddenly, her granddaugther Lily came into the room. Lily saw the dress and said, Grandma, why dont you mix some colors together? That way, the thread may match better. Grandma smiled and thanked Lily for the advice. 
Using Lilys advice, Grandma mixed some colors together and the dress became more interesting. Grandma was now comfortable wearing the dress.
The moral of the story is that it is good to listen to the advice that others give us. Sometimes, even the smallest advice can make things better.




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jerry. Jerry was at the park with his mom and dad. They saw a big yellow radio on the ground. 
"Let's take it home!" said Jerry with a smile. 
But his mom and dad refused. They said the radio was not theirs and they should not take it. 
But Jerry refused to give up. He begged his mom and dad to take the radio home. He said it would be sweet to have a radio in their house.
Finally, his mom and dad agreed. They took the radio home and gave it to Jerry. Jerry was so happy! From then on, he would listen to sweet music every day in his room.




Sammy went to the park with his mommy. He saw a big, shiny box, like a castle. He wanted to explore what was inside, so he tried to open the door. But it was locked. His mommy told him, "Thats okay, Sammy! We don't want to be nosy. But don't worry, I can help you."
She took him over to a friendly man with a big key. The man smiled at Sammy and waved his arms around the box. Then he opened the lock and showed Sammy what was inside - it was full of fun, colorful toys! 
Sammy and his mommy thanked the man for his help. He said, "No problem, little one. Im glad I could help." Then he waved goodbye as they walked away. Sammy's mommy said, "It's nice to have helpful people like that around. Now let's go play with your new toys." 
And so they did! Good thing Sammy's mommy had her helpful arm around him to help him explore the park!




Once upon a time there was a hard working bear. The bear wanted to be successful and tried to do a lot of interesting things every day. One day the bear decided to try something new - he wanted to spin! He figured it would be a lot of fun, so he found a big stick and held it while spinning around.
The bear loved spinning so much, he decided to practice every day. Little by little he got faster and better, and soon he was spinning faster than ever before!
The bear worked very hard and never gave up. Eventually, he became a successful spinner, and everyone in the forest admired him for it. He was so proud of himself and was glad that he took a chance on something new. All his hard work had paid off!




Bobby was very excited to visit the farm. He was ready to see the animals and the fields. At the farm, he saw a big green field full of cauliflower. The cauliflower was big and white. He wanted to pick one, but his mom told him not to be careless.
Suddenly, a cow came and ate one of the cauliflowers. Bobby laughed and giggled. He loved the way the cow ate the cauliflower so quickly. Then, a goat came and started eating too! Bobby was so happy that he hopped around, jumping with joy.
Finally, it was time to go home. Bobby was so excited to visit the farm. It was a great adventure. He promised himself that next time he would be more careful around the cauliflower.




Once there was a little girl named Sam. She loved to go outside and play with her friends. But one day the sun was so bright she wanted to stay inside.
Then she remembered that she liked to pick fruit from the tree in her garden. She went outside, and the warm sun felt nice on her skin. She looked up at the tree, and saw lots of different fruits. They looked so tasty and colourful, and she felt so excited.
Sam reached up and picked an apple. Then she saw a squirrel and shared the apple with it. They ate the fruit together in a peaceful spot, far away from all the noise.
Afterwards, Sam felt so happy and content. She smiled to herself and went inside with the feeling of peace in her heart.




Daddy took Sally to the park. She was very excited. Daddy lifted her up and let go of her hand. Sally jumped and spun around. She felt so free and happy. 
Daddy found a big pan. He asked Sally if she wanted to play. They both ran with the pan, giggling. Mommy watched and smiled.
After awhile, Sally got tired. She was very thirsty and a bit anxious. Daddy held her in his arms and took her home. He told her how proud he was. 
Sally and Daddy played together at the park all the time. They were the best of friends.




Once upon a time there lived a poor man and a poor woman. The poor man sold ash every day and gave it to his poor wife to mix with water and make good clay for pots. 
One day, the poor man was so tired from all the work he had done in the field. He said to his wife, "I can't sell anymore ash. I am too tired".
His wife said, "If you don't sell ash, how will we get food for us and the children? You must continue to sell ash, even if you are tired".
The poor man then understood that he must continue to do his job, even if he was tired, so he could provide food for his family. 
Moral of the story: We must work hard and not give up, even if we are tired, so we can get the things we need in life.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who was looking for something special. She wanted to find a nurse who would be very kind and gentle. 
She decided to go for a walk in the park to find a nurse. When she arrived at the park, she looked around and was amazed at all the people she saw.
The little girl was so happy when she found a nurse! The nurse wore a cute dress and was very friendly. She told the little girl that she was an easy nurse who would take good care of her.
The little girl was so excited to have found a nurse. She thanked the nurse, and they went to her house. The little girl felt safe and happy with her new nurse. 
The nurse and the little girl played together and even went on a picnic. The little girl was so glad to have a new friend and thanked the nurse for making her day so special.




Once upon a time there was a girl who was looking for a friend. She wanted somebody to play with who would always belong. One day, she saw a girl in the park who was very organized and neat. The girl was always packing her toys neatly and tidying them up. 
The girl asked the other girl if she wanted to be friends. The organized girl said yes and they started playing together. They both enjoyed playing together and soon they belonged, like old friends.
The two girls became very good friends. They played together every day, taking turns with all of their toys. They always kept their toys organized and neat, just like how they found it.
The girls were very happy being friends. They were now a team, and they knew that they always belonged together. They had the best time, because they were the perfect match.



Once there was a green frog. He loved to race. He liked to hop as fast as he could. One day he saw a strawberry. He was so excited and he couldn't wait to race to it. He hopped as fast as he could, trying to beat any other animals to the strawberry. But his race was tougher than he thought. He was so close to the strawberry, but a snail was faster and the strawberry was gone! The frog was so sad that he couldn't win the race. He decided that he wanted to try again. So the next day he went back and asked the snail if they could try the race again. The snail said yes. This time, the frog gave it all his energy and hopped as fast as he could. He beat the snail to the strawberry and won the race! The frog was so happy. He enjoyed his strawberry and was proud that he won the race.



Once upon a time there was a guard. He was a very nice guard. He was put in charge of a special garden. But bad things started to happen. The flowers and birds were all in trouble.
The guard could not stop it from happening. He was very troubled. So he decided to put a big fence around the garden. He wanted to guard the garden and make sure it was safe.
He worked hard every day and the garden slowly got better. The birds came back and the flowers started to bloom. The guard was happy he put the fence up and the garden was safe again. Everyone was happy! The End!




Once upon a time, there was a long film. It was so long that it could go on forever. But it only lived inside of a special machine called a printer. 
The printer was set to print the film out so that everybody could see it. But it was taking a very long time. It had been printing for hours and hours and the film still wasn't finished. 
One day a special three year old came running into the room. The boy saw the printer working and knew he had to help. So he hopped up on a chair and carefully pressed some buttons. 
He was so proud of himself because suddenly the printer began to move faster than ever. After only a few minutes, the film was ready!
The boy cheered with delight, and the room filled with happy smiles. Everyone in the room was very proud of the boy for using his special skills to help print the long film. 
The end.




Darnell was walking through the park with his mum one day. He was very careful where he stepped and he looked around at all of the things going on. He spotted a chair in the middle of the park and he quickly ran to it and sat down.
Darnell stared at the chair. It was an old, wooden chair with a soft cushion on it. He wondered who might have sat in it before him and why it was left there. He was so curious that he just kept staring at it!
Meanwhile, his mum explained to him why it was important to be patient and careful. She warned him that just as something could be found, it might also be lost. Darnell didn't understand what she meant at first, but he kept staring at the chair, thinking it over.
The next day, Darnell was back in the park. As he walked past the chair, he noticed it was gone. He knew now why his mum had asked him to be careful and he vowed to always remember her advice in the future.




Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to build things. She had a big pile of cardboard that she played with every day.
One day she noticed a big, crazy bug crawling up the cardboard. She jumped up in excitement. She wanted to catch it and make a pet out of it.
The girl ran after the bug and it ran away. But she kept on chasing it. She moved the cardboard to try and find the bug.
After a while, the girl smiled. She had found the bug! She was so excited, she couldn't believe it. She carefully put the bug in a small box and ran back to her house to show her parents.
The girl was so happy. She stopped to take a look at the bug and noticed how amazing it looked. She was so proud of it. The girl knew she was going to have a lot of fun with her new pet.




One morning, Mikey was very excited. He had found a gray invitation in his backpack. On it were written the words "party". His mommy told him it was time to rush to the party! He happily ran to the party, with his little blue shoes clapping. 
When he arrived, he saw all of his friends had gathered in the backyard. They were sitting in a circle and eating cupcakes. There were colorful balloons everywhere. The sun was bright and warm. 
Mikey was shy at first, but soon he started running around with his friends. They played tag, jumped in the ball pit, ate lots of candy and had a blast. At the end of the party, Mikey was so tired he had to be carried home! He was so happy that he quickly fell asleep.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Mary. Mary loved to study. She had books and papers all around her room! 
One day Mary wanted to go outside. She opened the door and was surprised by what was outside. She saw a brilliant garden with many flowers and a playground! 
Mary had so much fun at the playground. She played on the swings and went down the slide. 
But soon, Mary remembered she still had to study. So she went back inside and studied until it was bedtime. 
Mary was so delighted when she realised all her studying had paid off. She had become so brilliant and smart!




Once upon a time there was a friend. His name was Jack. Jack was very fierce. He liked to growl like a tiger.
One day Jack went to the park with his friend. As they were walking around they heard a loud noise. It sounded like someone was in trouble.
Jack and his friend ran over to see what was happening. They saw a tiger near a little girl. The tiger was growling.
Jack was brave. He stepped forward and said, "Go away, tiger! You're too fierce for this girl."
The tiger listened and left. The girl was safe.
Jack and his friend were happy. They smiled and hugged each other. They had saved the day!




Once upon a time there were two best friends; Sally and Steve. Every day they would play together and have a lot of fun.
One day, they decided to go on an adventure. They turned around the corner and saw a big hill. They started walking up the hill and soon they came to a big door.
Sally was scared and asked Steve, "What is this place?" Steve told her, "Don't worry, let's just take a peek inside."
The door opened and they heard a sweet noise. It was a singing bird. They stepped in and to their surprise they saw a beautiful garden full of colourful flowers. They spent a few minutes admiring the garden and they heard the bird's song getting louder and louder. Suddenly, something amazing happened; the sky started to turn a gorgeous shade of pink.
The two friends were filled with wonder, and happy that they decided to take this adventure. They watched in awe as the sky slowly turned to a deep blue colour. As the sky turned dark, Sally and Steve stood hand in hand, feeling the sweet joy of friendship.




Once upon a time, there was an enormous bubble. But the little bubble was not happy. It wanted to improve. 
The bubble looked around and saw lots of other bubbles. As it watched them, it noticed they seemed to be getting bigger and bigger. 
The little bubble had an idea. I want to get bigger too! it shouted, and set off on its mission to find a way to improve. 
The bubble searched far and wide and came across a magical pond. Inside the pond was a hidden secret - a bright, sparkly potion. 
The bubble drank the potion and felt its body start to grow. It grew, and grew, and grew until it was enormous! 
The bubble was so happy with its transformation. It had improved! Now it was ready to go back and show off its new size to all the other bubbles.



 
Mama and Daddy were getting ready for a party. Mama went to the kitchen to prepare something special for their friends. She had a big red cup filled with juice. Mama tasted it and said, "Oops, this juice is too weak. We need to make it stronger." 
Daddy came into the kitchen and said, "I have an idea, let's add some sugar!" Mama smiled and said, "Good idea!" So, together, they added sugar to the cup in the kitchen. 
After they stirred the juice, Mama took a sip and said, "Perfect! Now it's strong enough." Daddy smiled and said, "Let's get this cup to the party." Together they carried the cup to the party. Everyone loved the juice and said, "Mama and Daddy, you sure know how to prepare delicious drinks!"




One day, Charlie and his family were at the beach. It was hot and sunny, and Charlie wanted to cool off. He looked around and saw a pond nearby.
Charlie said, "Mom, I want to soak in that pond!" His mom smiled and replied, "That sounds like fun, Charlie. Be careful not to get wet too much though, okay?"
Charlie ran over to the pond and started splashing in the cool water. He noticed something small and white floating in the pond. He picked it up and saw it was a tiny flea!
He said "Mom, look at this flea!"
His mom said, "Oh, it's so kind of you to look after the flea. Can you put it back in the pond?"
Charlie smiled and put the flea gently back in the pond. As it floated away, Charlie watched it with a happy smile. Then he went running back to the pond and started to soak some more.




Once there was a little boy named Jack. Jack was three years old. Every day he had a lot of fun. But, today Jack was feeling a little bored.
He thought for a moment and then he had an idea. Jack decided to make some spaghetti. He asked his mum to help him. She said yes and gave him some money to buy the ingredients.
Jack bought the spaghetti and helped his mum to make it. It tasted so good. They put it in a bowl and sat down at the table.
Jack ate his spaghetti and felt safe. He was very happy and smiled to himself. When Jack had finished eating, he said, "That was yummy. I'm glad I minded my mum!"




Once upon a time, there was a very naughty boy called Tim. He was always sneaking around, getting into trouble.
One day, Tim was playing with a folder when he suddenly slipped and it fell on the floor. He tried to pick it up, but it kept slipping out of his hands!
Tim got very frustrated and started to try harder to grab the folder. He reached out, grabbed it and ran away laughing.
The next day, the folder was back in its place. Tim had learnt his lesson - it's not nice to be naughty!




Once there was a baby. Her name was Lucy. She was very small and loved to eat. Everyday, she ate lots of food. One day, she was playing in the garden. It was a very wide garden full of flowers and trees.
Suddenly, she fell and hurt her knee. She started to cry. It hurt a lot. Her mom came running and picked Lucy up. She gave Lucy a big hug and kissed her knee. 
Lucy felt much better. But now she was very hungry. Her mom gave her some yummy food to eat. She ate it up quickly and felt much better. She touched her knee and it didn't hurt anymore. 
Lucy went back out into the wide garden, feeling happy and not scared of falling anymore. She was sure that her mom would always be there to take care of her.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called katrine. She had a great big smile and she was always happy. One day she was so excited to go to the park and swing on the swing.
Katrine sat on the swing and she began to swing back and forth. As the swing started to go higher and higher, she noticed something on the ground. What is it? She thought to herself.
She jumped off the swing and found an impressive diamond. She picked it up and showed it to her mom. "Mom, can I keep this?", she asked.
Her mom hesitated but finally responded, "You know diamonds have a lot of value. So, I guess you can keep it".
Katrine was so happy and ran around the park, showing her diamond to everyone.
Suddenly a man appeared and said, "Where did you get that diamond?".
Katrine didn't know what to do so she stayed quiet. The man took the diamond away, explaining that it was his.
Katrine was sad and disappointed that she had to give away something of value. She knew nothing implressive would ever be hers.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. Jane loved to buy things but she was always careful to stay alert. She knew that getting into trouble was a bad thing so she always watched out for it.
One day Jane went shopping with her mom. She wanted to buy a new toy. Jane's mom said she could buy one thing if she stayed on her best behavior. Jane stayed alert while they walked around the store.
They looked at lots of toys, but Jane didn't find one that she liked. Suddenly, she spotted a toy she had been wanting for weeks! She asked her mom if she could buy it. Her mom said yes, so Jane happily grabbed the toy and went to check out.
Jane paid for the toy with the money her mom gave her. She said a quick thank you, put the toy in her bag and ran off. She was glad she bought the toy and stayed alert so she didn't get into any trouble.




Once upon a time, there was a lion. He was very popular. Everywhere he went, people would cheer him. He was so proud of himself and his strength. He roared loudly, making the ground shake.
One day, a little cat came up to him. He couldnt roar as loud as the lion, but he was so brave! The lion smiled and invited the little cat to play. They ran and jumped and had lots of fun.
The little cat noticed the lions heart. It was so big and strong. He wanted to be like the lion so he tried to roar the same way. He wasnt as loud, but he felt so proud of himself.
The lion liked the little cats courage and they became good friends. Everywhere they went they were popular. Everyone was filled with joy when they heard the lions loud roar and the little cats brave attempt to roar.




John and Jane liked to play. When it was time for their game, each of them took a piece. The pieces were bright, and there were a lot of them so everyone could play. 
John and Jane had lots of fun. They put their pieces together and arranged them in different shapes. They also took turns to make funny moves with their pieces. 
After a while, all the pieces were gone. There were no more pieces available, but John and Jane did not want to stop. So, they ran outside and when they found some sticks and stones they continued to play. 
They built a tall tower and made a funny house with the pieces. John and Jane had a great time. They laughed and smiled whenever they discovered something new and creative with their pieces. 
In the end, John and Jane were very happy. Playing with pieces was so much fun, and it was always available for them to enjoy!




Mommy was in the car with her little girl, Emily. Emily saw a big truck with a big horn on it.
"Mommy, what is that?" she asked.
Mommy explained, "That is a big truck and it has a big horn. The horn is very loud, it is used to help the truck move safely around other cars on the road." 
Emily asked, "Is it dangerous?"
Mommy said, "Yes, the horn is very dangerous. We need to stay away from it and the big truck."
Emily nodded her head and said, "Okay, mommy." She was happy to try and stay away from the dangerous horn.




Once upon a time there was a nice mule. He loved to create things. Every day he would make something new with his hooves. He created castles, cars and funny hats.
One day, he decided to show his creations to the world. He took all of his creations and went on a nice walk. Everywhere he went, people were amazed at his magical creations.
After a while, the mule's creations became famous. Soon everyone wanted to have one of his creations. The mule kept creating more things, so everyone had something special.
The mule was so happy that he had created something that made everyone happy. He was so proud of his creations. From that day on, he kept creating even more magical things.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was only three years old, but she loved to explore the world around her.
One day, Lily was in the garden with her mom. She was running around and playing when she noticed a job. It looked like a very interesting job, so she went to take a closer look. It was a tiny bird's nest made out of twigs.
"Wow mama, look!" Lily said excitedly.
"That's a bird's nest Lily," her mom replied. "See how fragile it is? We need to be careful and not disturb it." 
Lily nodded, happy to learn something new. She felt proud of doing a good job to help the little birds. 
As Lily walked away, she couldn't help but notice how fragile the world around her was. She knew she had an important job to take care of the world and to keep it safe.




Sam was a happy little three-year-old child. He was always fascinated by the huge green port that was near his house. Every day he would go there and watch the boats come and go. 
One day, Sam noticed something was different. A big barge had come and dropped something off. It was a strange, new green boat. Sam decided to take a closer look. 
When Sam got closer, he saw a sailor who told him that the barge had brought the new green boat to replace the old one. Sam was so excited. He asked the sailor if he could help replace the boat. The sailor smiled and said, Sure, if its OK with your mom. 
Sam ran back home to ask his mom if he could help the sailor. After getting permission, Sam ran back to the port and with the help of the sailor, he helped to replace the old boat with the new one. 
Sam was so happy with his new accomplishment. He had never helped to replace a boat before and was proud of himself for doing it. From that day forward, Sam held a special place in his heart for the green port.



Joe was envious of his older brother, Zac. Zac was so good at math and Joe wanted to be like him. One day, Zac made Joe a promise. He said that if Joe studied math every day he would get better at it. Joe was so excited and he did his best to study every day.
One time, Zac had a test and Joe was really nervous. But Joe was happy when Zac came home with a big smile on his face. Zac had gotten a good mark on his test because of all the math he had studied. Joe was so proud of him.
Eventually, Joe started to get better and better at math everyday. He forgot all about being envious of Zac because he was learning so much. Now both brothers are great at math and they have even started helping each other to study!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They wanted to explore the world together, so off they went. As they walked, Jack suddenly noticed something strange. At first, he couldn't figure out what it was. But then, he saw it - a jolly stick!
Jack was very excited. He asked Jill if he could pick up the stick. She said yes, if he was careful to be gentle. Jack carefully picked up the stick and observed it closely. He could see that it was very jolly, with lots of bright colors. They both decided to keep it.
On their way back home, Jack and Jill had lots of fun playing with the stick. They pretended it was a sword, a wand, and more. They laughed and laughed, until they were both very tired.
At the end of the day, they tucked the jolly stick away in a safe spot. From then on, the stick became their favorite thing to play with whenever they went exploring. It was their best shared adventure!



Billy and Sarah joined hands and set off to explore the playground. Everything seemed so exciting; they ran around, joining the fun with all their friends.
The most exciting attraction was the slide - they ran up to it and joined the queue, eagerly awaiting their turn. When the time came, Sarah slid down first - and then it was Billy's turn.
He got to the top of the slide, and couldn't wait to slide down to the bottom. But, when he got to the bottom, Billy started to feel dizzy. He tried to stand up, but he couldn't. Sarah had expected Billy to join her, but he stayed lying on the ground and didn't move.
It was only then when Sarah realised that something was very wrong. Once the teachers and parents arrived, the truth quickly began to unfold: Billy had had a medical emergency, and he had been rushed by ambulance to the hospital.
Unfortunately, when Billy arrived at the hospital he had already passed away. The slide had been the last thing he ever did - it was the activity that had caused his dizzy feeling and the medical emergency that would take his life.




One day, two brothers were playing together in their backyard. The older brother said, "It's time to count!"
The younger brother said, "I don't want to count!"
The older brother said, "It's fun - I promise!"
So the brothers started counting. The older brother was very good at counting and he counted up to 10 very quickly. But the younger brother kept losing count.
The older brother said, "Come on - let's try again."
The younger brother said, "No! I don't want to count - it's too hard!"
The older brother said, "Let me show you. It can be fun! Here, I'll count with you and make it funny!"
So they counted together, and the younger brother laughed when the older brother made funny voices and faces. Soon, he was as good at counting as his brother. 
The brothers had lots of fun counting together.




Once upon a time there was a musician named Sam. Sam liked to play his guitar and make delicious music. He was a very good musician.
One day, Sam decided to number all his songs. He counted each one out loud, making sure they were all there. 
When he was finished, he played his guitar and sang his delicious songs. It was a beautiful day and everyone stopped to listen to Sam's music. 
Everyone clapped for Sam when he finished. Even the youngest kids loved his music. They even asked him to play it again! 
Sam smiled and said, "Let's number the songs and play them again!" 
Everyone cheered and the kids laughed. It was the most delicious music they had ever heard.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Janey. She had a great big heart and a wonderful smile. Her parents noticed that she had been very gifted since she was very young.
One day Janey had an idea. She wanted to show her love for the world and asked her parents if she could get a permit. "What kind of permit do you need, sweetheart?" asked her mother. Janey replied with a big grin, "I want to give away free hugs to everyone!"
Her parents thought this was a great idea and they gave Janey a permit to hug. So, with the permit in hand, Janey set out on her mission. Everywhere she went, she hugged children, adults, and even animals, spreading her love and joy. 
The whole world was delighted that Janey was out spreading her love and gifts. Everyone was cheered up whenever they saw her. Janey even got hugs of appreciation in return. 
It was an amazing experience for Janey and her parents. Everyone was so happy and the love was contagious!



Once, there was a rabbit who lived in the forest. He was very hungry, so he went to look for food. He came across a thick mushroom that made him very excited.
He wanted to eat it, so he reached out to pick it up. But as soon as he touched the mushroom, a beautiful flower started to bloom from it. The flower had purple petals and a yellow centre.
The rabbit was amazed, and so he decided not to pick the mushroom. Instead, he admired its beauty from a distance. 
The moral of the story is that it is better to appreciate things from a distance, rather than taking them away. Nature is beautiful and it is important to respect it and care for it.




One day a long, tall billboard was standing in the park. It was bright and colourful and made the park look very special.
Two children called Jack and Jill wanted to make the billboard theirs. So they rushed to it with a big pair of scissors. Jack and Jill held onto each end of the scissors and started to cut. Snip, snip. The scissors cut through the billboard.
When they had finished cutting, Jack and Jill both clapped their hands. They had created a long, colourful piece of paper for them to keep and play with.
The children ran away with the piece of paper and laughed. They had created their own special treasure!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Sam and Tess. Sam and Tess loved to play together every day. So, one day they decided to go to the park.
At the park, they saw a grape vine. Sam thought it would be fun to pick some grapes and eat them. Tess thought that was a silly idea and said no. But Sam kept asking and Tess finally said ok. 
They each picked two grapes and ate them. Then Sam said, "Let's pick some more. I'll own a bunch of grapes!" He picked four more grapes and Tess thought her friend was silly.
But it was a good idea, because when they got home, Sam's mom was so happy that he owned some grapes. She made them all a special snack with grape juice and a huge bowl of grapes to share.
It was the best snack ever and Tess and Sam had fun eating it. From then on, whenever Sam and Tess went to the park together, they picked some grapes for a snack. Of course, Tess thought it was still silly but it was also lots of fun!




Once upon a time, there was a very old man. He taught himself to speed walk with his cane. Every day he went out, and would walk faster and faster while holding his cane.
One day, an idea came to the old man. He decided to add a treat to his speed walking that day. He stopped at the store, and bought some sour candy. 
The old man began speed walking again. He was extra fast, as if he were running! As he was walking, he would eat the sour candy. He enjoyed the sour and sweet taste in his mouth. 
Finally, he arrived back home. He was exhausted, but he had a big smile on his face. He had gone faster than ever before and had enjoyed the candy. He was sure he would be able to speed walk faster and faster each day!



 
Once upon a time, two friends were playing in the park. One of them, John, was being very rude to the other. He kept pushing his friend and wouldn't listen.
The other friend's nose started to wrinkle with anger. He yelled at John to stop being so rude. He asked him to listen, but John ignored him.
Suddenly, they heard their mom's voice calling them. She said it was time to go home. John listened this time. He apologized to his friend and they both said goodbye.
John and his friend went home together with smily faces, ready to have dinner. 
John learnt to always be nice and to listen when somebody asked him to.



Once upon a time, there were two children, Jenna and Jay. Jenna was three years old and Jay was four. Jenna and Jay loved to play together in their backyard.
One day, Jenna ran to the big oak tree in the backyard. She said to Jay, "Let's climb the tree!"
But Jay shook his head. "No! I'm scared. I'm too little," he said.
Jenna didn't give up. She kept begging Jay to climb the tree. Finally, Jay said, "Okay, I'll try it...but I might get hurt!"
They climbed the tree together. Jenna went up first and held out a hand to help Jay. Jay felt scared, but he trusted Jenna and made it to the top of the tree. They were so happy!
Suddenly, there was a loud crack, and Jenna and Jay fell out of the tree. Jenna was hurt and Jay felt guilty, but she said, "No worries! We still had so much fun together. That's what is important."
Jenna and Jay loved playing together, even if they got hurt sometimes. Friendship is more important than feeling guilty or scared.




Once there was a mommy and a baby. The baby was very happy, because it was a sunny day. The mommy took the baby for a walk. They went for a walk in the park. The baby saw a pretty butterfly flying in the sky. The baby wanted to try and catch it. But just as the baby was about to run, the mommy said, "Wait!"
The mommy pointed to smoke coming out of the woods. The baby asked, "What is it?" The mommy said, "Let's stay here and be careful." The baby said "OK."
Just then, the baby heard a loud, violent sneeze coming from the smoke! The mommy and baby were both scared! The mommy took the baby's hand and said, "Come on, let's go back home and be safe." The baby agreed and they went back home, happy and safe.




Once there was a boy named Tony. He loved sailing in his boat and looking for oysters to open with his big knife. One day, Tony went to the sea and loaded his boat with food and supplies. 
As the boat sailed, Tony looked out and saw the bright blue sea. Then, he glanced over and noticed a big rock with something shiny inside. He knew it was an oyster and loaded his boat with it. 
"Wow!" Tony shouted. "I'm gonna open this oyster!"
But, when Tony took out his knife and tried to open the oyster, he realized it was too hard. He tried again and again, but with no success. Tony felt frustrated, but he was determined to open the oyster. 
Finally, Tony thought of a plan. He gathered all of his strength and loaded both his hands against the oyster. With one final push, Tony opened the oyster and found a big pearl inside.
He smiled and said, "I did it!"



Once upon a time there was a pink dolphin who lived in the oceans. He was as happy as could be no matter what! But one day he noticed many sad faces in the ocean  so many creatures they were frowning.
The pink dolphin decided to try and make everybody happy, so he started singing and swimming around the ocean. What a sight it was! Everyone in the ocean was so delighted and began to smile.
The moral of the story is that it doesnt take much to bring joy to others. With a bit of cheerfulness and kindness, you can make someones day. So always try your best to make people around you smile!




Once upon a time there was a lazy boat. Every day it would just float on the water, just doing nothing. Each day some animals around the water would observe the boat and wonder what it was doing.
One day a fox decided he was going to ask the boat why it did nothing all day. He swam up to the boat and asked it why it was so lazy. The boat replied that it was just too tired.
The fox told the boat that it should find something to do, that it should work hard instead of being lazy. He said the more it worked, the better it would feel afterwards. The boat listened to the fox and decided it would try it for one day.
By the end of the day, the boat was feeling much stronger and happier. The fox swam up one last time and asked the boat how it was feeling. The boat happily said it felt much better now that it wasn't so lazy!
The moral of this story is that work brings more happiness than laziness. The moral is that if we work hard, it can make us feel better.




Far away in a far away land, a wise and old king was too tired to rule. So he decided to put a question to his people: he wanted to know who was the wisest.
Many people tried to answer, but no one knew the right answer. Then a little boy stepped up and said he knew the answer. Everyone was shocked and the king demanded to know the answer.
The little boy said that the wisest person was the king. Everyone laughed at this, but the king was not amused. He demanded an answer that was not himself.
The boy was sad and could not think of any other answer. The king grew angry and demanded that the boy leave the land. So the little boy had to go away and was never seen again. All because of one wrong answer.




Once upon a time there was a nice man and his wife. One day, the wife said to him: "Let's go on a trip!"
The man was very excited about the trip and said "Yes, let's go!"
And then they got on the bus and travelled for a few hours until they reached the beach.
The man was so happy when he saw the beach! He said to his wife: "Let's record this beautiful moment!" 
So they took out their camera and recorded the beautiful moment. They had a lot of fun and made so many nice memories together. 
When they returned home, they kept their recording of the beach to remember their wonderful trip.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Joey. Today, Joey went to the zoo. When Joey got to the zoo, he excitedly ran to the ticket office. Joey wanted to buy a ticket, but when he got to the window, he noticed a LONG line. Joey started to complain about having to wait in the bad line.
His mom said, "Don't worry, Joey. The line won't take too long. Why don't you start counting the people in line while we wait?" 
So Joey started counting each person in line. He saw "One, two, three, four," and he kept going until he got to 10. When he was almost done counting the 10th person, he noticed the line had gotten much shorter. 
Joey happily shouted, "Mom look! The line is almost gone!" 
Joey and his mom quickly ran to the ticket office. There, they bought their tickets and went inside the zoo. Joey had a great time exploring the zoo and seeing all the animals. He never complained about the bad line again.



 
Once upon a time there was a little boy named Sam. He was very fair, with bright blue eyes and a big smile. One day, he saw a lump of coal in the backyard. He asked his mom, "What is this?"
"It's coal," answered his mom.
Sam was very curious. He asked her, "What is this coal for?"
"Well," said his mom, "coal can be used to make lots of things, like energy and heat. It belongs to all of us, so we should use it fairly."
Sam nodded thoughtfully. He understood that coal belonged to the whole world, and it was his responsibility to share it fairly. He smiled and said, "Ok, I will!" 
From then on, Sam made sure to use coal fairly and responsibly.




Once upon a time there was a young boy who owned a very special sword. Everyone said he was very lucky to have it. The sword made the boy feel very powerful.
One day he decided he wanted to use his sword to show off. He showed off to the other kids in the park and said his sword was much better than anyone else's.
The other kids were very jealous. They all wanted to prove that their swords were better than the boy's sword. So they all started to challenge the boy to fights.
The boy thought he would easily win. But he was wrong. One by one, he lost all the fights. The boy learnt a valuable lesson that day. He learnt that it is not easy to show off and it can cause a lot of problems.




Once upon a time there was a smart fox. He wanted to show off how clever he was, so he decided to practice sliding. He found a big, shiny mirror at the end of the room and decided to slide up to it.
The fox said, "This is the perfect place to practice sliding." But then he heard a noise from the other side of the mirror. He looked carefully, and there he saw a little rabbit.
The fox said, "Hi rabbit! Would you like to play slide with me?" The rabbit said, "Yes, I'd love to!" So they both started sliding up and down the shiny mirror.
They had lots of fun together, and the fox showed off his smart sliding skills. In the end, they both smiled and agreed that sliding together was the best thing ever.



Once upon a time, there was a very wise old man who lived by himself in the woods. He was very wise and knew many things.
One day, he was walking around his house, looking for something to do. Suddenly, he heard a tap, tap, tap. He followed the noise to the back of his house where he saw a small furry creature with a shovel.
The creature was trying to bury something in the ground. The wise old man asked him, "What are you burying?"
The creature replied, "I'm burying a treasure. I hope it will be safe here."
The old man chuckled. He said, "I'm wise and I can tell you that buried treasures don't bring any luck. You'll be better off keeping it with you."
The creature thanked the old man for his advice and quickly picked up the treasure and headed off into the woods.
The old man was happy and smiled as he watched the little creature boot away. He was glad to have been able to help.




Once there was a naughty bunny who lived in the spring woods. One evening the bunny was hopping around and looking for something to eat. He spotted a carrot and went over to eat it. But when the bunny was about to take a bite, he noticed it was split in two.
The bunny was surprised, so he started to investigate. He saw that a naughty squirrel had taken a bite out of the carrot. The bunny was angry, but he didn't know what to do. He just stared at the squirrel and shook his head.
The squirrel saw the bunny and hopped away. He was so scared he even forgot to grab the carrot. The bunny watched him go and smiled. He knew he had won.
The bunny hopped away, feeling very pleased with himself. He may have been naughty, but sometimes that can be a good thing. He was glad he had split that carrot with the squirrel.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She lived in a big house with her mom and dad. Sarah had a special vase that was bright and pretty.
One day, Sarah wanted to make the vase look even prettier. She noticed it had sharp edges, so she grabbed a crayon from the table and started to color them. She made the edges pale pink and pale orange.
After she finished coloring, Sarah ran to the window to look at the vase. She saw that the edges looked so pretty and sharp! She was so proud of her work and couldnt wait to show it to her mom and dad.
The end.




Once there was a playground with a big swing. Everyone loved to swing on it. One day a hurricane was coming. The swing seemed harmless, so it stayed put while everything else moved around. It stayed strong in the wind and the rain.
After the storm had passed, the swing was still safe. The children were very excited to see the swing was all right. They said, Lets swing higher than before! So they climbed onto the swing and started to fly through the air. The swing went higher and higher and they laughed with joy.
The swing stayed safe during the hurricane and the children had a wonderful time swinging on it.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jenna. Jenna was a very obedient girl. She knew that if her mother told her to stay somewhere, she had to stay there until her mother came back. 
One day, Jenna was playing in the backyard. She was spinning around like a top. Jenna's mother saw her and called her over. Jenna was obedient and stopped spinning to listen to her mom. 
Her mother said, "I'm going to the store Jenna. You need to stay here until I come back. Don't wander off. Do you understand?" 
Jenna nodded and said, "Yes, mommy. I will stay." 
So Jenna obeyed her mother and stayed still in the backyard until her mom got back. Spin was fun, but it was more fun to be obedient.




Harry was excited. His best friend was coming over to play. His friend, Tim, brought his scooter. 
"Hi, Tim," Harry said. "Can I borrow your scooter?"
Tim thought for a moment.
"OK," Tim said. He smiled.
Harry grabbed the scooter and ran outside. He had so much fun scooting down the sidewalk.
Suddenly, a man came around the corner. His face was angry.
"Stop right there!" the man said. "That's my scooter!" 
Harry was scared. He hadn't meant to borrow someone else's scooter. 
"I'm sorry," Harry said. He gave the man back the scooter.
The man took the scooter and left.
Harry and Tim went back inside. 
"That was a close call," Tim said.
Harry nodded. He was glad to have his friend by his side. They played together the rest of the day.



Once there was an eye. It was looking around and trying to guess where it should go. It was feeling a bit lost and very alone.
Suddenly, something disgusting floated by. It was smelly and slimy. The eye didn't like it.
The eye decided to move away from it. It started to swim and swim until it found something it liked.
Finally, the eye saw something lovely! It was a beautiful flower and it was shining in the sun. The eye was so happy it wanted to stay there forever.
So that's what the eye did. It stayed by the flower and enjoyed it's lovely home. They were very happy together.




Once upon a time, there was an ugly house in the middle of the woods. One day, all the animals in the woods had a meeting. The animals were worried because they heard that something bad was coming.
So the animals decided to warn the house. They sang a loud song to tell the house about the bad thing coming. But the house didn't listen.
Suddenly, the bad thing arrived. The bad thing was a big storm. It was going to destroy the ugly house.
The animals all kept singing, but the house still didn't move. The storm was getting closer and the animals were scared. Finally, the house started to move. It was running away from the storm.
The animals were so happy and relieved. The storm had passed, and the ugly house was safe. The animals sang and cheered with relief, and the ugly house was saved.




Once upon a time, a little girl named Dee was traveling with her mom. Dees mom was carrying a razor and Dee was happy to have her mom with her. Dee asked her mom where they were going on their travels.
Lets go to the park, her mom said. 
Dee squealed with delight. She ran around and hugged her mom.
On the way to the park, Dee saw a brightly colored kite in the sky and said, Look mom! A kite!
Yes, its beautiful! her mom replied with a smile.
Finally they reached the park and Dee ran off to explore. She found a playground with a slide, a swing and a seesaw.
Come on, Dee! Her mom called out.
Dee smiled and went to her mom. Together they ran, laughed, and played until sunset. At the end of the day, both Dee and her mom were happy to have traveled to the park.



Once there was a wolf. He was very clean - he had just had a bath. He was so happy that he decided to go for a bounce! He jumped up high and waggled from side to side. He bounced really high and then low. He spun and jumped and bounced around until he was too tired.
As the wolf relaxed, he saw a butterfly. Its wings were so beautiful and colourful. He wanted to bounce with it. So he went over and said hello. The butterfly said hello back and then flew away. The wolf watched it go as he bounced and twirled behind it.
The wolf had so much fun bouncing around with the butterfly. He wished the fun would never end. But eventually he got too tired, so he had to go home. He carried on bouncing until he got home.
The wolf was so tired, but he was also happy. He was clean and had had a wonderful time bouncing with the butterfly. He snuggled down and tried to remember every second of his adventure. What a wonderful day!




Once upon a time, there was a jet. The jet wanted to go on an adventure. So, it sent out a message to the world. The message said, "Let's go on a journey!" 
The jet flew high into the sky. It was so cold. But the jet didn't mind. It kept flying and flying, until it saw a very beautiful place.
The jet was so excited. It sent a message back to the world saying, "We're here! It's so pretty!"
The jet stayed in this place for a while, enjoying the beautiful view. Then, when it was ready, it sent a goodbye message back down to the world and flew off on another adventure!



John and Milly were always up to mischief. One day, they asked their mum if they could have some cauliflower.
Mum smiled and said yes, so they ran to the supermarket to buy some cauliflower. But when they got there, she said that the cauliflower was too hard. 
John and Milly were disappointed, so they demanded that mum find them some soft cauliflower. 
Mum smiled and said she knew where to find the soft cauliflower. She took the children to a local farm, where they picked the softest cauliflower they had ever seen.
John and Milly were so excited! They waved goodbye to the farmer and ran home with their cauliflower, happy that they'd found the perfect treat.



Once upon a time there was a lady who had a big dream. She wanted to carry her dream far away and make it come true. Every day the lady tried hard to make it happen, but the dream seemed so far away.
One day a kind man saw the lady trying so hard. He went to her and said, "Do not feel ashamed, I will help you carry your dream". The lady was so thankful to the kind man and together they began to make the dream come true.
Soon, the dream came true and the lady was so happy. The kind man had helped her in a very important way and she will always be thankful for his help.
This story teaches us that we should never feel ashamed to ask for help. Sometimes, asking for help can make our dreams come true.




John walked into the children's room and saw a little boy sitting in the corner. He was feeling very ashamed. 
John said "Oh, hello! What's your name?". 
The little boy replied "My name is Jack." 
John asked "What's wrong, Jack?". 
Jack said "The other children were laughing at me. They said I'm too slow". 
John said "It's ok, Jack. Everyone can be slow sometimes. Do you know what I do to feel better when I'm feeling a bit ashamed?"
Jack said "No, what do you do?". 
John replied "I like to go for a run. It makes me feel better". 
Jack said "But I can't run as fast as the other kids. "
John said "That's ok. I'll hold the staff and you can run with me". 
Jack nodded and smiled. John and Jack held hands and began to run together around the playground. They laughed and smiled and soon they both felt better.



Jimmy was 3 years old and he was very excited. He had been given a sack and he was allowed to fill it with toys. He wasn't sure what toys to take.
So Jimmy took out his big box of toys and started looking through it. He chose a fit blue car and a fit pink doll. He also found a fit red teddy bear, so he put it in his sack.
He wanted to see if he could fit any more toys in the sack. He tried ringing a fit jigsaw puzzle and a fit ball, but it was too full.
So Jimmy closed the sack and carried it around. He had made it fit all his toys, and he was so proud of his achievement.




Once upon a time, there were two brothers. The eldest brother was very good at trades, while the youngest brother liked to soak in the sun. Every day, the eldest brother would go out and make trades so that he could get nice things for his younger brother. To show his appreciation, the younger brother would also get up early in the morning and help his brother with his trades. 
On one such day, the two brothers went to a trading fair. There, they saw all sorts of nice things that they wanted. They spent the whole day trading and the elder brother managed to get some nice things for his younger brother.
When night came, the eldest brother asked his younger brother whether he was satisfied with the trades. The younger brother smiled and said that everything was just fine.
The following day, the younger brother asked his elder brother if he could go and soak in the sun for a bit. The elder brother smiled and said yes. As his younger brother ran off, the elder brother scratched his head and said aloud, "It's a good thing I made those trades yesterday." 
And, when the elder brother's younger brother came back, he brought the elder brother a fine gift. It was something that the elder brother had wanted at the trading fair the day before! 
The younger brother had gone to the trading fair and managed to make a trade on his own! The elder brother was so proud. From then on




One day, Jane wanted to make a special surprise for her mom. She went to the kitchen and counted out two cups of sugar and one cup of salt. She mixed them together and made a sweet, salty treat. She was so proud of herself that she ran to the living room to show her mom the surprise.
But when her mom saw the surprise, she was hurt. Jane had forgotten to add the most important ingredient, the number three. Without three cups of sugar, the salty treat was too salty and not sweet enough. 
Jane felt so sad, she didn't know what to do. Her mom hugged her tightly and told her that she could make it better by adding more sugar. Jane was so happy, she ran back to the kitchen and added another cup of sugar. This time, it was the perfect combination of sweet and salty. 
The next day, Jane and her mom shared the sweet, salty treat and smiled. Jane was so proud that she had made the perfect treat all by herself!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Suzy and she had a mommy and daddy. Today, Suzy was feeling very curious. She wanted to peek inside the kitchen and find out what kind of yummy treats mommy was baking.
So, Suzy sneakily tippy-toed over to the kitchen door and peeked around the corner. She saw some yummy cookies on the counter. Suddenly, her mommy heard Suzy and said, "Suzy, why are you peeking around the corner?"
Suzy felt a little bit guilty, so she looked down and said, "I just wanted to see what kind of yummy treats you were making for me." Mommy smiled and said, "Come here and sit on my shoulder so you can watch. But always remember not to peek at things that are not for you to look at."
Suzy was very happy and she'll always remember the lessons she learned that day. Peeking into other people's business can lead to unwanted trouble.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. Sarah's mom always bought her books, and so they had to buy a bookcase to fit them all.
One day Sarah saw the bookcase and said, Mommy, what is that? Her mom replied, Thats a bookcase. We put all of your books in it. Sarah repeated the word, Bookcase!
Soon, Sarah was old enough to stand on a chair and look at the bookcase. But she found there was a book that she could not reach. She asked her mom to get it for her. But mom told her No, you have to learn to be independent. 
Sarah did not understand, so she asked, What does it mean to be independent? Her mom said, It means not to be ignorant. It means to be brave and try to do things on your own. 
Sarah looked around and realized that she could take a chair and use it to reach the book. She repeated her mom's words and shouted, I can do it! I am independent! And she did! She picked up the book and hugged it with joy. She had proven to herself and her mom that she was brave, independent, and not ignorant!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Sally and Timmy. They were very jolly and often spent their days on the playground.
One day, Sally had an itch on her arm and started scratching. 'That looks really itchy,' said Timmy. 
They decided to discuss the itch and find a solution. 'Maybe you should put some cream on it?' Timmy suggested.
'Yes, good idea,' said Sally, nodding her head. She ran off to get the cream while Timmy waited. After a few minutes, Sally returned with a pot of cream and they applied it to the itch. 
The cream worked wonders and Sally's itch was quickly gone. 'That was a good idea, thank you,' she said, smiling at Timmy. 
They hugged each other, feeling very jolly. Together, they had found a solution to the itch and they were proud of their achievement. 
The story ends here, but Sally and Timmy continued to be friends and always had lots of jolly fun.



Once upon a time, there was a black jungle. It was dark and spooky in the jungle.
One day, a little girl went exploring in the jungle. She was wearing a big, long, green jungle hat. As she walked along, she heard a loud snap! The little girl was scared.
But then she saw a big black snake! The snake didn't see her, so the little girl was brave and picked up a stick. She waved the stick around, and the snake snapped away! The little girl was so excited!
The little girl kept exploring the black jungle and had lots of fun. She even made a few new friends! From then on, she went exploring in the jungle all the time. She was never afraid of the snapping snakes!



 
Once upon a time there was a dog named Max. Max was a very happy dog who enjoyed playing in the garden. One day, Max was playing and wearing his collar. His collar was bright blue and sparkly. 
Suddenly, Max spotted a small mouse eating something tasty in the garden. He knew it was wrong but he just had to have a taste. He walked up to the mouse and told him that he wanted to try the tasty food. So the mouse let Max have a tiny bite.
