Finally, the wheat was ready to be picked and Timmy started to collect as much as he could. He was so furry with all the wheat in his little mouse house.
Timmy was very happy that he had so much wheat to eat and he knew that he would never go hungry again. He loved living in the field and was grateful for all the delicious food that grew there.



Once upon a time, there was a little otter. The otter was very cute and had gray fur. One day, the otter was swimming in the river when it saw a big fish. The otter wanted to catch the fish, but it didn't understand how to do it.
The otter asked its friends for help, but they didn't know how to catch the fish either. Then, a wise old otter came along and showed the little otter how to catch fish. The little otter was so happy and thanked the wise old otter. From that day on, the little otter understood how to catch fish and was never hungry again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy decided to create something special. He wanted to make a big tower out of his toy blocks. He worked hard and finally, he made a tall tower!
Timmy was so happy with his creation, but then he saw something strange. There was a pale tube on the ground near his tower. Timmy didn't know what it was, but he decided to play with it. He put the tube in his mouth and accidentally swallowed it.
Timmy started to feel sick and went to the hospital. The doctors couldn't save him because the tube was poisonous. Timmy's parents were so sad because they lost their little boy. They wished they could go back in time and stop Timmy from playing with the tube.



Once upon a time, a little bird named Tweety lived in a tree. One day, Tweety met a friendly squirrel named Nutty. Nutty said, "Hi Tweety, do you want to make a home together?"
Tweety said, "Yes, let's make a gentle home in this tree." They worked hard and made a cozy home with soft leaves and twigs.
One day, a big storm came and destroyed their home. Tweety and Nutty were sad and had to find a new home. They learned that even when you work hard, bad things can happen sometimes.
The moral of the story is that we should be kind to others and help them when they need it, because we never know when we might need help ourselves.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily was a normal girl who loved to play outside. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. At the park, Lily saw a pretty flower and wanted to take it home. Her mom said it was okay to take the flower, but Lily needed to ask for the flower's name first. 
Lily asked the flower what its name was, but the flower did not answer. So, Lily decided to give the flower a name herself. She called it "Sunshine" because it was as bright and happy as the sun. Lily took Sunshine home and put it in a vase on her windowsill. 
Every day, Lily would say hello to Sunshine and tell it all about her day. Sunshine didn't talk back, but Lily didn't mind. She was happy just having a friend to talk to. And that's how Lily and Sunshine became the best of friends. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and wear her favorite cap. One day, it started to rain and Lily's cap got wet. She was sad because she couldn't wear it anymore. 
But then, she had an idea! She decided to perform a magic trick to make her cap dry again. She waved her hands and said some magic words. To her surprise, her cap became dry! 
Lily was so happy that she could wear her cap again. She went outside to play and showed her friends her magic trick. They were amazed and asked her to perform it again. Lily felt proud of herself and had a fun day playing with her friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park. One day, she found a green twig on the ground. She picked it up and put it in her pocket. 
As she was walking, she saw a bird's nest in a tree. The nest looked empty, so she put the twig in the nest. Suddenly, a little bird flew down and saw the twig. It was so happy and chirped a song. 
Lily was happy too because she made the bird happy. From that day on, Lily would always look for twigs to put in the bird's nest. And the little bird would always sing a happy song whenever it found a new twig in its nest. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a big cat named Max. Max liked to play in the rain and get wet. One day, Max saw a little mouse named Timmy. Timmy had a frame for his picture, but it was broken. Max wanted to help Timmy fix his frame, so they became friends. 
But one day, a bad dog came and tried to fight Max and Timmy. Max knew he had to protect his new friend, so he bravely fought the dog. The dog ran away and Max and Timmy were safe. 
After the fight, Max and Timmy went back to Timmy's house. Max helped Timmy fix his frame and they put Timmy's picture inside. Timmy was so happy and grateful for Max's help. From that day on, Max and Timmy were the best of friends and went on many more adventures together.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a tutor named Mr. Smith who came to her house every day to teach her new things. One day, Lily decided to play a joke on Mr. Smith. She put a toy spider in his bag and waited for him to find it.
When Mr. Smith arrived, he put his bag down and started to teach Lily. Suddenly, he saw the toy spider and jumped up in fright. Lily laughed and said, "I made a joke on you, Mr. Smith!" Mr. Smith smiled and said, "That was a terrible joke, Lily. But it's okay, we can still learn."
After their lesson, Mr. Smith packed up his things and said goodbye to Lily. As he was walking down the street, he tripped and fell. He hit his head on the pavement and was hurt very badly. Lily's joke had distracted him and caused the accident. Lily felt very sad and wished she had never played that terrible joke.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to visit her grandma's house because her grandma always had cake for her. The cake was so yummy and Lily always ate it all up. 
One day, Lily's mom told her that she had to be very careful because grandma had a fragile vase in her living room. Lily promised to be careful and not touch it. 
When they got to grandma's house, Lily ran straight to the kitchen to see if there was any cake. Sure enough, there was a big chocolate cake on the counter. Lily was so happy! 
After eating some cake, Lily went to the living room to play with her toys. She remembered the vase and was very careful not to touch it. She had a great time visiting grandma's house and couldn't wait to come back for more cake. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play with his friends in the forest. One day, Benny and his friends found a rope. They all wanted to play with the rope, but they couldn't decide who should have it. 
Benny had an idea. He said, "Let's separate the rope into pieces so we can all have a piece to play with." His friends thought it was a great idea, and they all took a piece of the rope. 
As they played with their pieces of rope, they realized that they were all different sizes. Some were long, some were short, and some were in between. Benny's piece was the shortest, but he didn't mind. He thought all the pieces were adorable in their own way. 
The moral of the story is that it's important to share and be fair, even if it means separating things into smaller pieces. And it's okay if things aren't exactly the same - they can still be adorable in their own unique way.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, Lily saw a new boy sitting alone on a bench. She walked up to him and said, "Hi! My name is Lily. Welcome to our park!"
The new boy smiled and said his name was Max. Lily and Max quickly became friends and played together every day. One day, while they were playing, they saw two other kids fighting. Lily and Max went over to them and said, "Stop fighting! Let's all be friends and have peace."
The other kids stopped fighting and apologized. Lily and Max were happy they could help make peace. Later that day, Lily's mom told her that being kind and helping others is hard, but it's always worth it. Lily smiled and thought about how happy she was to have made a new friend and helped bring peace to the park.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She loved to play outside and swing on the swings. One day, she fell off the swing and hurt her arm. It was a mild injury, but Sarah began to complain.
Her mom gave her a bandage and told her to rest, but Sarah kept complaining. She didn't want to rest, she wanted to play. So, she went back outside and started swinging again. But, she didn't listen to her mom's advice and soon her arm hurt even more.
Sarah learned that it's important to listen to grown-ups and take care of our bodies. She had to stay in bed for a few days and couldn't play outside. She realized that complaining doesn't solve anything and it's better to ask for help when we need it.



Once upon a time, there was a little penguin named Pip. Pip loved to slide on the ice with his friends. One day, Pip saw his friend, Sammy, slide really fast on the ice. Pip was envious of Sammy's speed and wanted to be just as fast.
Pip practiced sliding every day, trying to go faster and faster. One day, Pip finally achieved the same speed as Sammy. Pip was so happy and proud of himself.
Pip and Sammy continued to slide on the ice together, laughing and having fun. Pip realized that it wasn't about being the fastest or the best, but about enjoying the time with his friends. From that day on, Pip was content with his own speed and happy to be with his friends.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to explore. One day she decided to go on a big adventure. She went down to the park to find something special.
At first, she couldn't see anything but then suddenly she discovered music coming from a big tree near the swings. She decided to go and have a look. 
When she got closer she found a rhythm! It was very playful and it made her feel so happy. She started clapping and dancing to it.
 
Soon the little girl was surrounded by the music and the rhythm. It was like it was a part of her. She had never been so happy before. 
The little girl spent the whole afternoon playing and exploring her new rhythm. When it was time to go home, the little girl said goodbye to her new rhythm and continued on her adventure.




Once, there was a little girl. She was very sad, because she didn't have a wagon. She had asked her mom and dad for one, but they couldn't afford to get her one.
Every day she would look out her window, hoping to see a wagon appear. She looked for a long time, but a wagon never seemed to show up.
One day, something very exciting happened. When the little girl looked out her window, she suddenly saw a wagon appear! She was very happy and ran to tell her mom and dad.
They looked out the window, and saw that it was a very old wagon. But it was just what the little girl needed!
The little girl's mom and dad fixed up the wagon, and the little girl was so happy to have it! She ran outside and started playing with it right away.
All her sadness quickly disappeared as she played with her new wagon.




John saw something very special. He found a secret file in his dad's bedroom. It looked filthy, but he remembered his dad telling him never to touch it. John was very brave and decided to take a peek inside the file. He opened it carefully and he saw lots of different papers and photographs. He saw pictures of his mom and dad when they were little, and lots of memories came rushing back to him.
John saw lots of things he recognized like an old teddy bear he used to love and a necklace his mom liked to wear. He saw a picture of his dad when he was younger, but he couldn't remember ever seeing it. He was so amazed at all the things in the file. He wanted to tell his dad what he had found, but he was too scared.
John put the file away and he remembered his dad saying that it was very special. He made a silent promise to himself to never touch it again. He cleaned the filthy file until it looked as good as new and he kept his promise to his dad.




Once upon a time there was a generous mouse. He was always looking after others and was very kind. One day, he was looking around and saw a peanut. He thought that it looked delicious and he loved peanuts, so he took it. 
He was a generous mouse, so he decided to share it with his friends. He had many friends, like the birds, the fox and the frogs. He found them all and offered them the peanut. His friends were very happy and thanked him for being so generous. 
The mouse smiled and said he was happy to share it with his friends. He liked to make others happy and sharing the peanut made them happy. 
They all thanked the mouse again and continued on their journey. The generous mouse smiled and went back to looking for more peanuts.



John lay on the seat of the soft green car. He felt pale and tired. All around him was quiet and plenty of grass. 
John looked down at his heels. The old shoes were scuffed and worn, but he knew he could run with them. He wanted to try and run away from the car, across the grass and feel the warm sun. 
Just then, he spotted a bright red balloon in the distance. He quickly sat up and clapped his hands in excitement. He was determined to get that balloon no matter how far it floated.
John jumped out of the car and raced across the grass. He ran as fast and as hard as his heels could take him, his heart pounding in anticipation. 
Finally, John reached the balloon. He smiled as he caught it in his hands and lay back down in the car, the bright red balloon still in his grip. 
John lay there in happiness, knowing he had accomplished his goal. The wind gently pushed the balloon higher, taking John soaring through the air with it.




Anna was playing in her backyard when she heard something fall. She looked around and saw a big ball rolling down the hill. Anna ran to chase it and suddenly it rolled through a hole in the fence. She followed and found herself in a dark and scary place.
Anna was scared, but she wanted her ball back. She could see a bright light at the end of a tunnel and decided to go toward it. When she reached the end, she saw a scary monster standing in front of a movie screen! Anna was surprised, but she was brave.
The monster smiled and held out her ball. Anna was relieved and ran to catch it. Then the monster said, "Let's watch a movie!" Anna was scared at first, but then she remembered how much she liked watching movies. She smiled and the two of them watched the movie together.




Terry was a tall boy. He had a special jacket. It was made for stretching. Every morning, Terry put on his special jacket and started stretching. He would stretch his arms above his head, reach down to his toes, and twist from side to side. He loved stretching in his favorite jacket.
One day, Terry saw his friend Jack stretching too. He asked Jack, "Why are you stretching?" Jack said, "I'm stretching because it keeps me healthy!" Terry thought that was a great idea and decided to stretch more with his special jacket.
As Terry stretched, he felt his body getting stronger and taller. He kept stretching each morning and saw that he was growing taller and taller each day. He even convinced his friends to join him and stretch together.
Terry became very good at stretching and was proud of his special jacket. He kept stretching his arms, reaching his toes, and twisting from side to side. Terry always remembered one thing: stretching in his special jacket made him feel strong, healthy, and most of all, tall!




Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was just three years old, and he had lots of fun playing in the backyard. One night, it got dark outside, so his mommy said he needed a flashlight. He went to choose one from the drawer, and found a red one that he liked. He was so excited, he couldn't wait to go outside. 
He went outside and shined the red flashlight around. He laughed and shouted, and had so much fun. All of a sudden, he heard his mommy calling him. She told him it was time to go inside. The little boy was very sad.
He went inside, and his mommy saw that he was upset. She asked him what was wrong, and he said he forgot to turn off the flashlight. She said it was OK and not to worry.
The little boy felt so sorry, he said he would be more careful next time. His mommy said it was OK and gave him a big hug. He smiled, and went off to bed.




Once upon a time, there was a bald man. He woke up in the morning and looked up at the sky. The sky was as blue as could be and it made the man happy. 
He decided to go for a walk. He went to the park, and there was an empty pitch. He sat down and watched the birds  rising in the sky. They were so pretty and graceful. He was mesmerized by their beauty.
Suddenly, he felt something shift underneath him. What was it? The pitch was rising! He could not believe his eyes! He got up and saw that the pitch had risen to a more comfortable level. He was so happy and couldn't believe his luck.
The bald man sat down and looked up at the sky once more. He was so astonished by his luck. He thanked God for this miracle and decided to never forget it. He would always remember the rising pitch and the birds soaring in the sky.



Once upon a time there was an old igloo. The igloo belonged to an old polar bear who loved to take a bath. Every day he would go to the beach and take a bath in the cool ocean water.
One day an elderly man came and built a new igloo right next to the old polar bear's. The old polar bear was very happy and he invited the old man to take a bath with him.
The old polar bear and the old man bathed together in the ocean each morning and each night. They laughed and splashed and had so much fun.
One day someone took a picture of the old polar bear and the old man bathing together in the ocean. Everyone in the village thought it was the cutest thing and started to take baths together too.
The old polar bears has found a new friend and taught everyone about the joy of bathing together. They were all very happy!




Once there was a little girl called Jane. Jane was always very hungry. One day, she decided to go to the temple. She got on the bus and rode to the temple.
When she arrived at the temple, it was big and very grand. Jane was excited. She got off the bus and ran over to the temple's entrance.
At the entrance, she saw a woman with a basket of food. Jane was so happy she almost cried. She got some food from the basket and ate it. It tasted so delicious and soon, she was full.
Then, Jane got up and explored the temple. Everywhere she went, she saw something new and interesting. It was a wonderful adventure. When she was done, she got back on the bus and went home feeling happy and no longer hungry.



Andy was naughty but he liked it. He loved to explore and the jungle was his favorite place. He always wore his trusty hat and his backpack was full of snacks. His mama had warned him to be careful but that didn't stop him.
Andy wandered deep into the jungle until he reached a clearing. There, he saw a bright green frog on a rock. The frog seemed to be staring right at him, so Andy blinked and the frog blinked back. He couldn't believe what was happening.
He wanted to get closer so he cautiously stepped closer and the frog hopped off the rock. It hopped over to a tree and crowned itself with a big flower. It looked so majestic! The frog and Andy blinked at each other before it hopped away.
Andy was so surprised and excited he could barely contain himself. He wanted to follow the frog to wherever it was going, but he knew his mama would be worried. So, he said goodbye and made his way back home. He knew he'd be back to visit the naughty green frog someday soon.



Once upon a time, there was a girl called Lily. She liked to dress up and play pretend. One day, she asked her Grandma if she could have some makeup. Grandma said yes and let Lily have makeup when she was old enough.
Every day, Lily watched her mummy put on beautiful makeup. She wanted her own makeup so she could look pretty. Finally the day came when Grandma let Lily have her own makeup. It was pink, purple and had sparkles! 
Lily loved it so much and she couldn't stop looking at herself in the mirror. She put it on everyday and played pretend, pretending to be a princess. One day, her Grandma said she had to be careful and not to wear too much makeup, because it wasn't real. It was fake. 
Lily was sad but she listened to her Grandma. She made sure not to put on too much makeup and still had fun playing pretend.




Once upon a time, there was a gentle flower named Daisy. She lived in a beautiful, sunny garden, near a great tree. Every morning, Daisy looked forward to the sun coming up, as she knew it was time for her to bloom.
Every day, Daisy would stretch out her petals towards the sky, and a few moments later, she would burst into a rainbow of colors. She looked so pretty in the garden - like a mosaic made up of the brightest colors.
One day, a soft, gentle wind came into the garden, and with it came an old, furry cord. It twirled around in the breeze, and eventually landed next to Daisy. Daisy smiled, and welcomed the cord into her garden.
Together, Daisy and her cord played every day in the sunshine. They spun together, jumped together, and sang together. Daisy even helped the cord wrap himself around the great tree, so it could get a better view of her fantastic blooms.
From then on, Daisy and her cord became the best of friends. They would stay together in the garden, under the warm sunlight, until the moon came up and it was time to go to sleep.
The end.



Once upon a time, there was a fancy penguin. He seemed so happy and he liked to play all day. One day, he went for a walk and he saw something special. It seemed like a party - there were lots of balloons and people dressed up fancy. He felt so excited. Suddenly, he saw a huge cake! He got very close to have a better look. He noticed that the cake was so big, he could fit inside it - so he did! Everyone cheered loudly when he got inside the cake. So the fancy penguin enjoyed the party and it seemed like he had lots of fun. The End.




Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl called Mary. Mary was so grateful for the love her family had for her.
Mary's mom and dad loved her with all their hearts. They would always tell her that no matter what happened, they would always love her.
Mary knew this love was true. She always felt it in the warmth of their hugs, and the kindness in the way they spoke to her. She was very thankful to have them in her life.
Mary wanted to share her love with them and so everyday she would do something to make them happy - like cooking them breakfast or picking flowers for the house. Her mom and dad were so proud of all the loving things she did.
Mary knew from experience that love can make the world a better place. She knew that love was the most special feeling ever and it was always worth treasuring.



Once upon a time, there was a bald man and he was very patient. One day, he decided to settle in a new town. He looked at all of the houses and stores and found one he liked. He took his time and unpacked his things carefully.
Once he was done, he admired his new home. He liked all of the new things he saw and could not wait to start his day. He quickly set out to explore the new town. He visited all of the shops and talked to the people there.
All of the people were so friendly and welcoming. He felt like he was a part of the town already. Everyone made him feel so comfortable and at home. He was so happy in his new place and knew he could settle there forever.




Once upon a time there was a big, tough bear. He liked to go for walks in the woods but he rarely met anyone else.
One day, he was walking in the woods when he saw a big axe. He was really curious and he wanted to pick it up so he did.
When the bear held the axe, he roared very loudly. He was so loud that it made the birds fly away in fright.
The bear held onto the axe because he thought it was so cool. He wanted to keep it forever.
But then, a few days later, a tough lumberjack came into the forest. He saw the axe and knew it belonged to him. He grabbed it back and took it home.
The bear didn't roar this time. He just watched sadly as the lumberjack went away.




In the morning, Sam woke up and the light shone in his eyes. He was happy to be up and ready to start the day. Sam got up, but he forgot to brush his teeth. His mom was not happy when she saw this. She told him to brush his teeth right away. Sam felt ashamed. He quickly ran to the sink and brushed his teeth.
After that, his mom gave him breakfast. Sam felt better now that he had brushed his teeth. He said thank you to his mom, who was happy to see him smiling. They went to the park to play together. Sam had a lot of fun running around in the sun all day.
When it was time to go home, Sam was sad to leave the park. He said goodbye to his mom and thanked her for taking him. They went home to get ready for bed. Sam put on his warm pajamas and brushed his teeth again. His mom smiled at him and said goodnight. 
The next morning, Sam woke up and the light was shining in his eyes. He was ready to start a new day!




Once upon a time, there was a farmer named Jack. He had a big farm with lots of different animals. Every day he had to load up the animals so they could go to the market. 
One day, Jack's neighbor wanted to borrow Jack's donkey. He asked Jack to lend him the donkey, but Jack said no. His neighbor was getting very mad!
"You are being very selfish!" the neighbor exclaimed. "Suddenly, I understand why people call you 'Selfish Jack'."
Jack started to feel very sad. He knew he should share his animals with his neighbor, but he wanted to keep them all to himself. 
That night Jack had a dream. In his dream, all the farm animals went to the market together, loaded on the same wagon. He could see his neighbor next to him, and they were both smiling. 
Jack woke up and knew that he had to do the right thing. He loaded up his donkey and let his neighbor borrow it. From then on, Jack was no longer known as Selfish Jack - he was Friend Jack!



Once upon a time there were two friends, Gary and Amy. Gary wanted to go to the fun park nearby but he did not have enough money. But luckily, Amy was very generous and she gave Gary a ticket so he could go. Gary was so happy and he thanked his friend. They both went to the park and had a fantastic time. They went on all the rides and played all the games, until it was time to go home. Gary was now able to complete his fun day at the park thanks to Amys generous ticket!




Once upon a time there was a vehicle. It was gentle and kind. It drove around the town looking for things to supply. Everywhere the vehicle went people were happy to see it. 
The vehicle went to stores, bakeries and parks. Everywhere it went it supplied things that were needed. 
People cheered when it came to the bakery and brought delicious treats. At the park, it supplied happy smiles and laughter. Other places it supplied books and crayons. 
Everyone wanted the vehicle to come back again and again. They knew it would supply kindness and things that made them happy. 
The gentle vehicle kept on making its rounds, bringing joy and happiness along the way.



Once there was a kind-hearted ant. He wanted to be clean so he went in search of something to wash himself with. He found a gentle stream nearby and hopped in. He felt the water on his body and the stream washed him clean. After he was finished, he felt refreshed and happy.
The ant made his way back home and went to see his friends. He told them of his experience and encouraged them to wash too. His friends were so grateful for his guidance and compassion.
The little ant helped his friends find a stream and showed them how to wash. They also felt refreshed and happy once they were clean. Now the little ant and his friends could get back to enjoying the warm sunshine and fresh air.




One day, a missile flew over the playground. Everyone was surprised to see it! The missile was flying really fast so all the children began shaking and hiding. The elders in the playground looked very serious. 
Suddenly, a loud noise came from the missile! Something was falling from the sky. Everyone watched as something landed in the playground.
It was a big egg! The children gathered around it to see what was inside. They looked at it, but nothing was happening.
Suddenly, the egg began to shake, and then it cracked! A tiny baby bird came out from the egg and chirped! All the children were in amazement. The serious faces of the elders turned into happy smiles. 
Everyone was so glad to see the little bird, and it was all because of the missile!




Once upon a time, there was a beautiful girl who had a special wish. She wanted a new bike, so she went to the police station to make a request. The police replied that they couldnt give her a bike, but they could help her look for one. 
So off she went with the police in search of her bike. They searched high and low in the city, but sadly the girl couldnt find what she was looking for. After a long day of searching, the girl went home empty handed. 
But the next morning, something amazing happened! A friendly delivery man appeared at her door with the most beautiful bike she had ever seen! She was so excited that she ran to the police station to show them her new bike. 
The officers were so pleased to hear that the girl had found her bike. They gave her a card, which said Well done, you found your bike!. The girl was so happy that she thanked the officers and went home riding on her beautiful bike.




Once there were two best friends - John and Sarah. They were really good buddies and loved playing together.
One day, the two friends were in their toy room and saw something special at the back - an exciting exit! They knew that it would be fun to explore and so John decided to pull it open.
As soon as he opened the door, they saw that they were in a new and strange place they had not seen before. They were a bit troubled because they weren't quite sure what to do.
As they looked around, they spotted something amazing - a magic carpet! Sarah suggested they get on and pull the rope to fly away. They each grabbed ahold of the rope and pulled. Then, up into the sky they flew! 
John and Sarah were so happy to explore these new lands with their magic carpet and they were never troubled again!




One day, the sky was very cloudy. The clouds were deep grey and looked heavy. All of a sudden, the sky started to shine! The sun shone through the clouds and lit up the sky.
The sun was so bright and it was so warm. The clouds started to melt from the heat and the sky began to fill with tiny droplets. They looked like little diamonds sparkiling in the bright light. 
The tiny droplets made everything wet. Little kids went outside to play in the wet. They danced around in the rain, ran through the puddles and jumped into the mud. 
The sun shone for the entire day, until the clouds took over the sky once more. Then, the rain stopped and everything went back to normal. But the kids will always remember the bright and sunny day when the sky shone!




Bobby looked at his bedroom. He was very happy because it was his. It was messy and dirty, but he didn't mind. He started to pick up his toys, getting rid of the mess.
He moved the chairs and swept the floor. He even wiped the windows with a cloth. It was a lot of work, but he wanted it to be clean.
Bobby took a step back and smiled. His bedroom was no longer dirty. He was so proud of his work he wanted to show everyone. He opened the door for his family to come and take a look.
They were surprised at how clean it was. Bobby was beaming from ear to ear. He was happy he could make his bedroom clean and tidy. He skipped around the room, feeling proud of himself.



Sam was a lazy bear. He never wanted to help his mom around the house. One day, his mom asked him to pack a bag. Sam was confused. What was that? Then his mom showed him. She took a big box and put some soap and clothes inside. 
Sam was happy. Now he knew what to do. He took some towels and stuffed them into the bag. He even added the soap. He was careful to make sure everything fit. 
When he was done, he showed his mom. She smiled and thanked him for all of his hard work. Sam was so proud that he had packed the bag. From then on, he always helped his mom with chores around the house. He wasn't so lazy anymore!



Once upon a time there was a robot. It was very fancy. Every day the robot would pinch things. It would pinch flowers, books, and toys.
One day the robot got a surprise! It was a little 3 year old child! The child was excited to see the robot and the robot was excited too. They started to play together.
The robot showed the child all sorts of things. It showed the child how to pinch things and the child was so excited. The child pinched flowers, books, and toys and laughed.
At the end of the day the robot and the child said goodbye. The child was happy they got to play and the robot was happy too. They promised to meet again soon.




One day, Momma and the three year old went for a walk in the park. They saw a tall tree blowing in the breeze and the three year old said "I want to spray it!" So Momma got a can of water and let the three year old spray the tree. It felt cool and refreshing.
The three year old kept spraying until the can was empty. Then they felt a sudden heat on their faces and realised the sun was coming out. To make the most of the warmth, they sat on a bench to enjoy the sun.
The three year old started to feel sleepy, so Momma got a blanket and wrapped them up in it. They stayed in the park until they felt sleepy and then they slowly walked home.



Once upon a time there was a ranch. It had lots of animals and plants growing on the land. Every day the animals would print all over the land, eating the yummy plants.
One day, there was a special plant that was growing. It looked very weird, and the animals were curious. They wanted to see what it was so they went over to take a closer look.
The plant was very sour when they tasted it! The animals were so surprised at how sour it was and they quickly printed away.
That day, the animals decided to stay away from the sour plant. They knew it was best to avoid the sour plant so they never got close to it again!



Once there was a boy called Ryan who was three years old. Ryan had a pet bunny called Flopsy. 
Every day they went to the park together. Ryan liked to pick fruit from the trees. Apples, oranges and plums were Ryan's favourites. 
One day, Ryan saw a bird in the tree. It was a pretty pink bird with a little beak. Ryan wanted to make a new friend, so he reached up to take the fruit from the tree. 
But Flopsy was very helpful and warned Ryan that he could fall from the tree if he went up too high. Ryan listened carefully and decided to hope for the best. He asked the bird if he could have the fruit and it said yes!
So Ryan and Flopsy went home with lots of fruit. Ryan was so happy that he shared the fruit with all his friends. 
Then, every day they all went to the park together to pick more fruit. The bird also came down from the tree to join them, and it became Ryan's new friend. Ryan was very happy and he always hoped for the best!



Once upon a time, there was a poor girl. She was very sad. Everywhere she looked she saw people happy, but she was not.
She was so sad that she decided to take a drink from a pond. She did not know that the pond was poisoned. After she drank from the pond, she became sick.
The poor girl was very afraid, but then a kind lady came along. She brought her food and showed her how to relax. She taught her special breathing and stretching exercises.
The girl followed the kind lady's instructions and soon she felt better. She had the energy to get up and she was no longer sad. 
From then on, the poor girl was happy and she learned how to relax so she could stay healthy and safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy. His name was Bobby. He was very adventurous. He loved exploring the world around him.
One day, Bobby went outside to play. He saw lots of things that he wanted to zoom around. He was so excited! But soon he got too tired and stopped to rest.
As he was resting, Bobby started to weep. He was sad because he couldn't zoom around as much as he wanted to. He felt so lonely.
But then, a magical fairy appeared! With a wave of her wand, she gave Bobby wings! Now he could zoom around and be as adventurous as he wanted to be.
Bobby was so happy! He flew and zoomed around, enjoying his new wings. He no longer had to weep. He was free and happy.




Once there was a person who was walking down the street. Suddenly, they saw a disgusting thing on the ground. It was slimy, and dripping. The person looked around and then they shrugged. They knew that no matter how much they wanted to, they couldn't pick it up.
So they kept on going, and soon they were in a park. There were lots of children playing and having a great time. But then they saw another disgusting thing! This one was a big mess and it was blocking the way. The person looked around and then they shrugged again. They didn't know what to do.
 Suddenly, one of the 3 year old children stepped forward. They looked brave and strong. With a smile on their face, they grabbed the disgusting mess and threw it in the trash. Everyone cheered and thanked the 3 year old.
The person was so happy that the 3 year old helped. They smiled, and shook their head. No matter how much they wanted to, they weren't brave enough to do what the 3 year old did.



Once upon a time there was a dog called Spot. Spot was his name because he had a round spot on his back. Spot loved playing with a girl. Every day the girl would give Spot a mineral. Spot however wasn't so sure about the minerals so he took his time to accept them. 
One day the girl said, "Spot, I have an easy way for you to accept the mineral." Spot wondered what the easy way was and the girl said, "If you just close your eyes and take a deep breath, the mineral will be easy to accept." 
Spot did as the girl said, closed his eyes and took a deep breath, and just like that, he accepted the mineral. He was so happy and excited, he even began to smile. From that day on, Spot would accept the minerals without any trouble at all. 
The end.



John was very flexible. He could do all kinds of fun things with his body. He decided to go for a holiday at a hotel. When he got there, it was so exciting! He jumped around in the lobby, running up and down the stairs. He even tapped his feet on the tiled floor.
Then, John went exploring. He looked in all the corners of the hotel. He even went on the roof! But soon, after a while, he started to get bored. He wished something new would appear.
Suddenly, he saw something. It was a magical box! He opened it, and a puff of smoke came out. He stood there, breathing it in - and then he started to disappear! What a surprise!
John had gone on an exciting adventure. He found a magical box and it made him disappear! He still wasn't sure where he would end up, but one thing was certain - he would always remember his incredible journey to the hotel.



 
Mommy was busy organizing her things. She had a big notebook and held it tightly in her hands. She carefully opened it, and inside it were some papers. She looked at them sadly. Some of them were dead. 
Mommy closed the notebook and put it away. She went to the kitchen and made a snack for her and her little three year old daughter. They both sat down on the couch and snuggled together. 
Mommy looked at her little girl and smiled. She said, lets organize the things in your room, shall we? 
The little girl jumped off the couch and ran to her room. She came back with a pile of toys and started to organize them. She put them away in her shelves, stacked them up and put different shapes and colors together. It made her so happy when everything was neat and tidy. 
Mommy was happy too. She looked around the room, proud of her little girl. Then she hugged her tightly and said, I love you so much!




Dave was excited because he just got a new toy. It was loud and colorful. He couldn't wait to show it to his friends.
Dave performed all sorts of tricks with his new toy. He spun the toy around and around. He twirled it around his head. He even pretended to juggle it with one hand.
Dave's friends thought his new toy was so cool. They all cheered for him when he performed. Dave was so proud of himself. His new toy was the best.
Dave had so much fun with his new toy. He wanted to play with it all day long. He was getting louder and louder. Finally, his mom had to say, "That's enough for now, Dave. Time for dinner!"




Once upon a time there was a black cow. She loved to eat wheat. Every day she would look for the brightest and juiciest wheat in the fields. She was so happy when she found it.
One day, she found a big wheat field. The wheat looked the juiciest and the sweetest! She ate it until she couldn't eat anymore. She was so full and happy. 
The farmer was so surprised to see his wheat field looking so empty. He was a bit angry at the cow for eating all the wheat. But he also saw she was happy and knew she was just very hungry. So he decided to let her stay and gave her more wheat every day. 
The cow and the farmer became friends. The cow was so thankful and happy to the farmer. Every day she would eat the wheat he had given her and was very content. 
The end.




Once there was a little girl who loved to laugh and play with her friends. She was always happy.
One day, she found a strange switch outside her house. She was excited to try it and see what might happen. She moved the switch up and down and side to side.
Suddenly all the lights in the house lit up. The little girl was amazed and delighted. She knew that this switch was very valuable.
The little girl showed her mom the switch and explained how it worked. Her mom was also happy and said that the switch could help them save energy.
From then on, the little girl made sure to value the switch by using it carefully and responsibly. She and her family were very happy with the switch and it allowed them to save lots of money on their energy bill.



Once there was a little girl named Lola. She was three years old and liked to ask lots of questions. Every morning, Lola woke up impatient to learn more things. She wanted to know why the trees were tall, why the sky was blue and why the grass was green.
So Lola asked her mom all kinds of questions. Her mom was always happy to answer them. Then, Lola asked her mom why the sun was so bright. Her mom explained that the sun made light for us to see. Lola thought about this for a moment and thought it was so amazing.
Lola asked her dad questions, too. She asked her dad how the wind moved from one place to another. Her dad laughed, and smiled at her, before explaining that the wind was made of air.
Lola asked questions all day long and learned something new each time. Her parents were very patient in answering all her questions, and Lola was so happy and excited to find out more.




Once upon a time, there was a polite bear who lived in the woods. One day, the bear decided to invite some of his friends for a special picnic. He said he would meet them by the stream. 
When the bear arrived at the stream, all his friends were already there. They had brought lots of delicious food and drinks for the picnic. 
The bear was very happy to see his friends and thanked them for coming. They had a wonderful time at the picnic, chatting and playing games, while the stream quietly babbled away in the background. 
At the end of the picnic, the bear thanked everyone for being so polite and enjoy the day together. Then, they said goodbye and went home. The bear was already looking forward to inviting his friends to his next picnic.




Once upon a time there was a boy called Dan. He loved his purple wallet.
It helped him to keep all his things safe and stay organised. He took it everywhere with him.
One day, while Dan was outside playing, a thief snuck up to him and tried to take his purple wallet away. But Dan yelled and screamed so loudly that the thief ran away.
When Dan got home, he hugged his wallet and realised how much he valued it. It was so special to him.
Ever since that day, Dan has been sure to keep his wallet close to him, so it always stays safe. Because he knows how much it's worth.




Once upon a time, there was a cute, little puppy. He was the most adorable puppy in the world. He had fluffy fur and always tried to be very good.
One day, he was running around the yard when he found a leak in the garden hose. He wanted to help, so he tried to wash it. He licked it with his big tongue and then splashed water from the lake onto it.
The leak was so happy to be washed, he started singing and giggling. He was so happy to be clean, he decided he wanted to stay there forever.
The little puppy was so proud of himself. He had cleaned the leak, and made it happy. He knew he had done a good job, and he felt very proud. He wagged his tail and ran back home to tell his family about his adventure.




Once there was an ordinary figure. He wanted to change his life, so he decided to get a big box. Inside the box he found a little square with a surprise inside; it was a new figure! He was so excited. He quickly traded the ordinary figure with the new one and he put it in the room.
The new figure was better than the ordinary one; it was bigger, brighter and had lots of cool shapes. The figure was also special because it moved around and had a funny voice.
From then on, the ordinary figure was replaced by the new figure. Every day he talked to it, and it said funny things that made him laugh. It was the most wonderful thing ever and it made him so happy. 
The little boy and the new figure had lots of fun together and became the best of friends. They sang songs, danced and laughed a lot. Everything was perfect now that the ordinary figure had been replaced.



Once upon a time, there was a thin little village. The village was poor, and the people who lived there struggled every day.
The children of the village were often hungry and lonely, but they were strong and brave. One day, a kind lady arrived in the village and she had a sack full of food.
Everyone was very happy! All the people in the village smiled, and thanked the lady.
The kind lady stayed in the village for a few weeks and helped the people. When she left, the people in the village were very sad to see her go, but they had all the food they needed.
The people of the village worked hard together, and soon the village was a much happier place. They no longer had to struggle so much, and everyone was full of hope!




Little Sarah was in her garden. She was so excited because she was going to enjoy something new. She had a brain full of ideas.
First she chose to play with sticks. She made a little castle and then pretended to be the princess. It was easy and fun! After this, Sarah tried something else. She chose to make a mud pie. She mixed mud and sand together using her hands. 
Sarah was feeling so creative and happy. She enjoyed the feel of the mud against her hands. Building her mud pie was so easy and Sarah's brain was happily working away.
Once the mud pie was finished, Sarah invited her little brother and sister to join her. They all shared the mud pie together and had lots of fun.
Sarah enjoyed the day playing in the garden, using her brain to think of new ideas and using easy techniques to create her projects.




Sammy liked to show his sock. It was a fierce red one with blue stripes. He would proudly show it to his mommy and daddy and even to his friends. 
Whenever Sammy wanted to be strong, he put on his sock. It made him feel brave and fierce. One day, Sammy put on his sock and challenged his dad to a race. His dad laughed and said, "Okay! Let's go!" 
Sammy was so determined to beat his dad, he forgot one important thing: his shoes! Sammy was undeterred, he showed his sock and kept running. 
At the finish line, Sammy and his dad were neck and neck. When Sammy crossed the line, he stood tall and proud. His dad, fooled by Sammy's fierce determination, clapped and praised him, "Wow! You won!" 
Sammy was so happy he had won the race. He was now sure that his sock made him the fiercest runner around. From that day on, he always wore his fierce red sock when he wanted to show the world he could do anything.




One day, a little boy was walking in the forest when he noticed something big and grey. He walked closer and saw it was a huge hippo! The little boy was very frightened, but also excited. He had never seen a hippo so close before.
The little boy carefully reached out to touch the hippo. The hippo was soft, like a big teddy bear. He started petting it and making hippo noises. The hippo was friendly and it enjoyed the little boy's company.
The little boy and the hippo started running around and playing together. They even danced and rolled around in the grass. It was so much fun and it made them both very excited.
The little boy smiled and waved goodbye to his new hippo friend. He ran off happy, knowing he would never forget the wonderful time they shared.




Once upon a time there was a bald infant. He was only three years old.
Every day, the bald infant would do lots of fun things. He would go outside and play tag with his friends. He would look for bugs and splash in puddles.
One day, the bald infant was walking in the park when he discovered a big playground. He thought to himself, "I want to do something new!"
So the bold infant did something he had never done before. He climbed up the ladder to the top of the slide. He slid down and squealed with delight.
From then on, the bald infant would do this every day. He turned it into a fun game. He would climb up and slide down until the day was done.
The bald infant soon became known as the king of the slide. Everyone knew that he was the best at it - even the grown-ups!
The bald infant was very proud of what he could do. And thats the story of the bald infant and his special adventure.



Once there was a friendly bunny who had a crystal. He liked to pull his crystal and watch it sparkle in the light. One day, the bunny was playing with his crystal and he accidentally pulled it too hard. The crystal broke into pieces and the bunny began to cry. He felt so sad and didn't know how to fix it.
Suddenly, he heard a noise that made him jump. It was a friendly fairy who had come to help the bunny. The fairy asked him what was wrong and the bunny told her about his broken crystal. Then the fairy waved her magic wand and the crystal was instantly mended. The bunny was so happy that he thanked the fair and hugged her tight.



Once there was a furry comet. It stayed in the sky night after night. One night, a boy named Jack looked out of his bedroom window and saw the comet. He was so excited! The comet was so big and furry. It made Jack smile.
He wanted to stay up and watch the furry comet, but he had been very tired all day, so his mom said he had to go to bed. Jack was so sad. He wanted to stay and watch the furry comet for just a few more minutes. But his mom said no.
Jack had an idea. He crept down the stairs very quietly and opened the front door. He ran outside and laid down in the grass. He saw the furry comet in the sky and smiled - he could stay out for just a few more minutes!
He laid there, looking up at the furry comet and its bright sparkly tail. Jack felt like he was the only one in the world watching it. He didn't want to ever go back inside. 
Finally, his mom called him back in. He went back inside, but he was still happy knowing he had gotten to stay and watch the furry comet just a little bit longer.




Mommy and daddy took their little girl to the park.  She giggle and when she saw the big cart.  She ran to it and asked Daddy to push her in.  Daddy said yes, so he started pushing the cart. 
Mommy, Daddy, and their little girl went all around the park.  Daddy pushed the cart faster and faster, until finally they stopped to take a break.  But the little girl was still anxious to keep playing.
So they went to a big hill and Daddy pushed the cart up and down the hill.  The little girl squealed with excitement.  They did that for a while until the little girl started feeling sleepy.
Daddy stopped pushing the cart and the little girl said goodbye to the park.  She waved at the cart as if she was saying goodbye to a special friend.  Mommy and Daddy took their little girl home and she dreamed of the fun she had at the park.




Once upon a time, there was an ugly circle. All the animals wanted to take it away, but they didn't know how. Then one day, the animals decided to gather around the ugly circle and figure out a way to take it away. They couldn't move it, so they tried covering it up with leaves. But the circle was still there!
Then, one of the animals had a great idea. They decided to make a big hole next to the ugly circle and get all their friends to help fill it with dirt. They worked together and, after a few days, the hole was filled up to the top. The circle was gone!
The animals were so happy! They gathered together in a big circle and celebrated their victory. They had worked hard and now they could enjoy the open space. They vowed to never forget how they worked together to make things better.



Once upon a time there was a furry coal. It was so round and soft like a teddy bear. One day, it decided to go out on an adventure. Suddenly, it felt a big push and it started to move! The coal rolled down a hill and kept going further and further away. 
The coal kept rolling until it saw a great big pond. It looked so sparkly in the sunshine. But the coal couldnt get in. So it kept searching. Then, it spotted a furry tree nearby. It was just the right size for the coal to fit in! 
The coal got close and gave one big push. Suddenly it rolled right into the tree. It was so happy. At last it had found a safer place to sleep. The coal curled up and started to doze in the furry branches of the tree. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy who couldn't understand things very easily. He was deaf and he couldn't hear anything that people said. One day at noon, the boy was walking in the park with his mom. He was trying to understand the noises he heard, but it was too hard. Then all of a sudden, he saw a bunch of birds in a tree nearby. He saw that the birds were dancing and singing and making noise. He was so amazed, he stopped to watch them.
The boy noticed that some of the birds were louder than the others. He watched as the birds flapped their wings and jumped around. He felt so happy that he could understand what the birds were saying! He laughed and smiled, and his mom smiled too. She was so happy to see her son so happy and understanding things. 
From then on, the boy loved visiting the park at noon to watch the birds. He liked to listen to the birds and understand what they were saying. He was so happy to understand something even though he was deaf. The boy and his mom would both go visit the birds every day at noon.




Tommy was very excited because he was going to read a letter. The envelope was pink and it had flowers on it. He opened the envelope slowly and carefully. Inside was a letter for him! It had lots of different colours and pictures on it. He couldn't wait to read it.
Tommy's mummy read the letter to him. It said that there was a surprise coming for him, but it didn't say what it was. Tommy's mummy said that he would just have to wait and see.
Tommy was a bit sad he didn't know what the surprise was, but he was excited about it at the same time. He went off to play, dreaming of what the surprise might be. Later on, Tommy found out what the surprise was and he was so happy! It was the best gift ever.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Abbie. She was three years old. Abbie was very curious. Everywhere she went, she wanted to learn more and try new things. But there was one thing Abbie hated  weight. All the other kids were playing and having fun, while Abbie had to stand still and hold the weight in her hands.
But one day, Abbie's mom told her a secret. She said that when Abbie started to do her exercises, the weight would feel lighter. Abbie started to do what her mom said and soon enough, she found that the weight was much easier to carry.
Abbie was so happy! She carried the weight around the house and even did her exercises with a smile on her face. From then on, Abbie didn't hate the weight anymore  she was in control of it.




Tommy was very excited. His mommy said he was going to go on a boat! He hopped into the car and his mommy drove very fast. They soon arrived and Tommy couldn't believe how big the boat was! He hopped out of the car and ran onto the boat. Mommy said it was a special boat because it was going to take them across the lake.
Tommy was so excited he couldn't contain himself! He ran up and down the boat and looked at all the fun features. There were buttons, switches, and bright lights!
Finally, the boat started to move. Tommy quickly realized it was going faster than he thought it would. He loved feeling the wind blow in his hair as the boat glided across the lake. It was his first time on a boat and he was so happy! 
After a fun filled day, Tommy said goodbye to the boat and hopped back in the car with his mommy. He was happy that he got to ride on the fast boat, and he didn't want the day to end!




One day, Joe saw something strange. He was walking in the park and he saw steam coming out of the ground. Joe was so surprised. He shouted, "Look what is that?"
It was a dragon! The dragon made the steam come out of the ground with its hot breath. Joe was scared and started to back away. Then the dragon started talking to Joe.
The dragon said, "Joe, I need your help. I am very dry and thirsty." Joe asked, "How can I help you?" The dragon said, "I need water! Can you please go and get some water for me?" Joe smiled and said okay.
He ran home and grabbed a bucket. He filled the bucket with water and brought it back to the dragon. The dragon drank all of the water and then gave a big shout of happiness. Joe was so happy that he helped the dragon. 
Joe said good-bye to the dragon and walked back home. He knew that he had done something really special.




One day, a plane was flying high above. It was going to work and it felt excited. As it flew above, it saw something. It saw a little girl near a pond. She looked very guilty. The plane flew closer and saw that she had a bucket and she was picking something from the pond. The plane noticed that she was picking up tiny little fish and putting them in the bucket. 
The plane was confused. Why was the girl taking the fish? Suddenly, the plane noticed that there were two cats near the pond. The plane realized that the girl was taking the fish to feed the cats. It felt happy to know that the girl was taking care of the cats. 
The plane watched as the girl ran to the cats and dropped the fish near them. The cats were very excited and they quickly ate the fish. The plane was happy to know that the girl was trying to help the cats and it flew away feeling very pleased.




Once upon a time there was a lonely leopard. He stepped through the long grass, looking for a friend. He saw a rabbit and stepped quickly, but the rabbit hopped away. He stepped on a snake, but the snake slithered away.
The leopard kept stepping until he came to a big, dark cave. He stepped inside and saw four tiny mice, curled up against the wall. He stepped closer and the mice squeaked and scurried away. The leopard sighed, feeling very lonely.
Just then, he heard a deep purr and stepped around the corner. To his surprise, there was a beautiful, striped tiger, curled up in a way ball. The leopard stepped closer, and the tiger opened his golden eyes. The leopard and the tiger had become friends!




Molly was very hungry. She wanted something nice to eat. She liked the heat coming from the oven. Molly could see her mom looking after things in the kitchen. 
Molly asked, "Mom, can I have something to eat?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course you can, Molly!" 
Her mom took something out of the oven. It smelled delicious. Molly knew it would taste even better. And it did! 
Molly was so happy to have something to eat. She knew her mom cared about her and that made her feel very special. 
Molly finished eating and hugged her mom to say thank you. Her mom said, "You're very welcome. I'm glad that you enjoyed your food. Now it's time for a nap." 
Molly was happy to take a nap. She knew her mom cared for her and that made her feel safe and loved.




Once upon a time, there was a big green frog. He was very patient and stayed still in the pond all day. He waited and watched the water. He wanted to catch something! 
One day, something swam by the frog. It was a big blue fish! The frog hopped closer and held his breath. He was going to catch the fish! He held out his tongue, trying to be very still. 
Suddenly, the fish saw the frog. The fish raced away in a hurry! But the frog was very patient. He stayed still and waited for the fish to come back. 
After a few moments, the fish came back. This time, the frog was fast. He caught the fish with his tongue! The frog was so happy. He enjoyed his yummy catch.




Once upon a time, there lived a little girl. She was 3 years old and was always very happy. One day, she went to the park with her mama and daddy. 
She looked around and found a big green ball. She was so excited! She picked it up and gave it a hug and a kiss. It was very mild, so it made her happy. 
Next, she found a green frog. She was so curious because she had never seen one before. She bent down low and looked closely and it was mild too. 
Finally, she found a big green tree. She clapped her hands in excitement and ran to it. She gave it a big hug and couldn't believe how mild it felt. 
The little girl was so happy! She couldn't believe how many different green things she had found. She was now sure that green was the best color ever.




Once upon a time there was a flower who bloomed. She was a very pretty flower and everyone could see how sparkly she was. But she was too shy to show off her beauty.
One day the flower decided it was time to bloom. She started to stretch her petals and open to the world. She felt so happy that she sparkled even more, which made her even more shy. She was so ashamed to show off her beauty and she wanted to hide.
But no matter how much she wanted to hide, the flower's sparkly petals kept getting bigger and bigger until everyone around could see her beauty. The flower was so happy that she bloomed and she was no longer ashamed of her beauty. From then on, the flower bloomed proudly every day!




One day, Max was walking down the street. He saw something strange! There was a man painting on the street! Max thought it was weird.
Max went to the man and asked what he was doing. The man said he was painting a picture of a big bear. Max thought it was cool!
Max wanted to paint too, so they painted a rainbow together. They used lots of colors to make it look beautiful.
When they were done, Max was really happy! He had never seen a picture as pretty as the one they made. The street looked weird but fun with all the colors.
Max smiled and waved goodbye to the man. He was really happy with the painting they made together.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Louise. Louise loved to act and she was very impatient. Every day Louise would pretend to be different things, like a Princess or a rocket.
One day Louise spotted something very special in the sky. It was a long, white missile! Louise jumped up and down in excitement and acted like a rocket, flying around the house.
Louise flew around the house and out of the garden. She just had to get closer to the missile. She flew into a field and saw hundreds of missiles ready to be launched. Louise was very excited and wanted to act like them. So she flew around the missiles acting like one too.
Unfortunately, the Missiles' guards caught her acting and Louise had to go home sadly. Louise had a great time acting and was very impatient to do it again.




John was so excited. It was a great day outside and Mom had said he could help in the garden. He grabbed the rake and started to work. It was so much fun. He could feel the sun shining on his face and smell the dirt as he raked away.
John finished raking the leaves and then he ran to get the hose. He had to wash the leaves away so that the garden would be nice and clean. He lifted up the hose and the water came pouring out. He sprayed it all around the garden, making sure to get every single leaf.
When he was done, John looked around and smiled. He had done a great job. The garden was beautiful and clean. Mom said she was proud of him and gave him a hug. John felt so happy. He couldnt wait to finish the garden tomorrow.




Once there was a little boy named Jack. Jack was a brave boy but he had one fear. He was scared of the dark!
One night, Jack was getting ready to go to bed. He was feeling very fearful when he heard a noise outside. He decided to go and see what had happen.
Jack opened the door and saw a little puppy! It was a very small puppy and it was shivering. Jack knew that he had to help it.
He took the puppy inside and gave it some food and water. He put the puppy to stay in his bed and he covered it with a blanket and hugged it until the puppy fell asleep.
Jack was so brave and kind - he made sure the puppy was safe and stayed with it until morning came. He was not fearful anymore. Jack and the puppy became best friends and they were never afraid of the dark again!




Once upon a time there was a happy little girl. Her name was Sarah and she had the biggest smile. She loved to wander in the sunshine and one day, she asked her mom if she could go alone. Her mom said yes and gave her permission.
So Sarah skipped away, singing as she went. She wandered through the sweet smelling field, watching the butterflies flutter in the air. The grass was so soft beneath her feet and the sun was so warm on her face.
Sarah stopped at the edge of the field and saw a friendly rabbit hopping around. She hopped closer, wanting to pet the rabbit, but it was too scared and hopped away. Sarah was sad and started to cry.
Suddenly, something amazing happened! Sarah heard a voice as if from far away. It said, You can pet the rabbit if you are gentle. Sarah smiled and quietly moved forward, and with a soft touch and kind words, the rabbit allowed her to pet it.
Sarah and the rabbit were friends after that day. They would meet at the edge of the field, greeting each other with friendly smiles. Sarah was so happy, and her mom was proud that she had listened and been so gentle.




Once there was a man who liked to spend time with his family. Every weekend the man and his family would buy an order of their favourite soft food from the local store. The man would make sure that it was nice and soft so that his little three year old boy could enjoy it too.
The man and the boy would then spend their time together eating their delicious meal. As they ate, the man would make silly faces to make the little boy giggle. Then the boy would always remember the special time spent with his father. 
Afterwards, the man would carry the boy home and tuck him in bed - the little boy was exhausted from all the fun. Every weekend the man and his son would spend the same special time together, making the most of their family time.



 
Once upon a time there was a very fit lemon. He was so fit that he could run and jump all day. So, every day he would go out and play in the sunshine.
The lemon had lots of fun running around and jumping. But, after all of that running and jumping he was very tired. So he climbed up a tree to take his nap.
He curled up under the leaves and closed his eyes. Soon, he was fast asleep and snoring. The birds and bugs in the trees were all very quiet so the lemon could sleep peacefully. 
Time flew by and before the lemon knew it, he was waking up from his nap. He felt so energised and ready for the day ahead. He jumped down from the tree and ran off into the sunshine to play again. 
The end.



 
Once there was a little girl called Daisy. She was three years old. One day, Daisy and her family went out for dinner. Daisy was very tired when they arrived at the restaurant.
When Daisy's food arrived, she realised that she had forgotten to bring a napkin. She began to look around the restaurant and act very worried. Her dad then came over and gave Daisy a big napkin to use! Daisy was very happy and gave her dad a big smile. 
After finishing her dinner, Daisy was feeling much better and more energetic. She acted up and ran around the restaurant, making everyone laugh. 
Daisy's dad was very happy to see his daughter feeling more lively. He gave Daisy the napkin and said, "Let's go home now so you can get a nice rest!" Daisy smiled, kissed her dad, and ran to the car.




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Sarah and Jake, who liked to play together. One day, they wanted to draw a triangle. But Sarah was feeling slow and she was delaying. Jake was getting a bit annoyed and was making noisy sounds. He said, "Come on! We dont have all day!" Sarah finally started drawing slowly and soon they had a big, beautiful triangle. They were so happy and shouted out loud, "Yay!" Sarah and Jake smiled and hugged each other. They knew they had made the perfect triangle!




Once upon a time there was a brave girl. She was always ready to try new things. One day, she decided to explore the woods. She ran and ran and soon found herself in a very wild area. The ground was rough and it was hard to move around.
The brave girl kept going until she arrived at a big wall made of logs. Behind it was a small house. She could see an old man inside. The old man looked very angry. He shouted at the brave girl and said she was breaking the law.
The brave girl was scared so she ran away. But she knew she had to go back. She was a brave girl so she made herself be brave and she went back to the house. When she returned, the old man was still angry. But this time, he listened to her carefully.
The brave girl told him that she was sorry and that she was alone in the woods. The old man was moved by the brave girl's courage and he decided to forgive her.
He told her that she needed to respect the law and be more careful from now on. The brave girl thanked him and promised to be more careful. The old man then let her go. The brave girl smiled and ran back home feeling very brave and happy.




Once upon a time there was a family who lived in a small house. The family had two children who were obedient and loved to play together. 
The older child had a favorite toy - a basketball. She always wanted to play with it. Every morning she asked her parents if she could go outside and play basketball.
One day the younger child asked if he could play basketball too. The older child was excited and said yes! They went outside together and started to play and had a lot of fun.
The family saw the children playing and they were happy. They thought that it was nice to see the children playing together and being obedient.
The next day the older child remembered how much fun they had and decided to serve the little one. She said to him, You can play with the basketball when I'm done. I want to serve you. The little one was so happy!
From then on the children always played basketball together. The older child was obedient and served the younger one, and in return the little one was so grateful. They were a happy family and played together every day.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mia. She was very happy, for she had a very special place to go. That place was the harbor, a beautiful place where the ocean was very quiet and blue.
Mia would go to the harbor and sit on the sand. She would watch the boats go by, each one more charming than the last. She liked to watch the seagulls too, they were always so loud when they flew by.
One day Mia brought a camera to the harbor and took lots of pictures. Whenever something beautiful caught her eye, she'd snap a photo! Each one she captured was so wonderful that it was almost like a dream.
Mia went to the harbor nearly every day and she'd lose herself in the beauty of it all. She loved being there so much, and it made her feel so happy. In the harbor, she was safe and content, so much so that she never wanted to leave.




Once upon a time, there was a delicate jail. It was a special place that kept people safe. But one day, the jail would not open. No matter how hard the people tried, they could not unlock it. 
Then a brave little boy came along. He had a secret plan. He knew just how to unlock the delicate jail. Everyone watched him in awe as he carefully worked his magic.
He used his special key to unlock the jail. A giant cheer went up as the door opened. Everyone was happy to be free and ran off to play. The little boy had unlocked the delicate jail!




One day, a little boy named Joe wanted to go on a journey. He wanted to explore something new. So he started his journey.
First, he walked down the street to the forest. He saw a lot of trees and some funny-looking bugs. Suddenly, a bossy frog hopped near Joe and said, "You can't go in this forest". Joe was scared, but he decided to go inside anyway.
Then, Joe started climbing the tree. The big tree was very tall and hard to climb. Joe had to use his hands and feet together to help him go up the tree. Finally, he got to the top.
From the top, Joe saw a beautiful river. He decided to take a swim in the river and have some fun. Joe was so excited that he splashed around and laughed.
The journey was so much fun and Joe learned a lot. He decided to explore more places like this in the future.




Once upon a time, there was a prince who was very smart. He wanted to find a magic crown. The prince searched high and low but he couldn't find it.
One day, when the prince arrived at the beach, he finally found what he was looking for. In the sand was a beautiful, golden crown! The prince was so happy that he quickly picked up the crown.
He couldn't believe his luck and hurried home to show his parents. When he arrived, his mom and dad were so proud of him. They hugged him and said he was so smart to have found the crown!
So the prince was crowned king. He moved into the palace and was so happy. From then on, the people of the kingdom loved their new king. They knew he was the right man for the job.




Once there was a little girl. She was only three years old. One day, the little girl went for a walk in the park. While she was there, she saw something very surprising: a big, long machine.
The little girl was amazed. She wanted to know what the machine did. She looked around, but she couldn't see anyone who could help her. Still, she was very curious.
Suddenly, the machine started to move. The little girl was so surprised that she stepped back. Then she saw that the machine was picking up leaves and putting them in a big basket.
The little girl smiled. She was glad that she got to see the long machine do its job. She was happy to have such a cool experience.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to dance. She would dance all day long and never get tired! One day, she wanted to go outside and play in the sunshine, but it was very dirty.
So, the little girl asked her mommy if she could have a bath. Her mommy said yes, so she got all ready to take a bath. She imagined the bath would be like a magical pool.
The little girl stepped into the bath and let the water wash over her. She enjoyed the warm water and started splashing around. The water felt so good and she wanted to stay in there forever!
When she was done, the girl felt clean and ready to go outside. She danced around, feeling so happy and light! The world felt so magical, and she smiled at all the sunshine. 
The little girl could not believe how clean a bath had made her feel. She danced and laughed and never forgot her magical bath. She always enjoyed taking a bath so she could enjoy the world around her!



One day, a bright fisherman wandered to a nearby lake. He had a bright yellow fishing rod and lots of fun fishing gear. He was looking for something special this day. 
The fisherman clumsily waded into the water, dropping his tackle box in the process. He carefully picked it back up and moved closer to the center of the lake.
As the fisherman moved further away, his bright yellow hat began to glow in the sunshine. Suddenly, he spotted a bright orange fish swimming around in the water below him. 
The fisherment quickly dropped his rod and began to wave it around in the water. He spun the rod around and around until it was just right. He watched as the bright orange fish grabbed onto the hook at the end of the line.
The fisherman smiled and scooped the fish out of the lake. He admired its bright orange scales, and proudly brought it back home. 
Thanks to the fisherman's wanderings, the lake would now be swimming with bright new fish.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She was three years old and very curious. One day, she was exploring her grandma's house when she found a beautiful stove. Anna was so excited, she ran over to her grandma to tell her all about it.
Grandma smiled and said, "Yes, that old stove is very special. It's been in the family for a very long time and it still works!"
Anna wanted to learn more about the stove, so Grandma showed her how it worked. She explained that you had to put wood inside and then light it with matches. Then, the stove would give off heat and cook food.
Anna was amazed. She thought the stove was so beautiful. She asked if she could turn the stove on, but Grandma said she was too young.
Anna was a bit disappointed, but then Grandma said that when she was a bit older, she could help out in the kitchen with the stove and make lots of delicious treats. Anna was so excited!
The two of them spent the rest of the day talking about the beautiful old stove and all the delicious food they could make with it. Anna loved visiting Grandma's house and hearing all the stories she had to tell.




Once upon a time, there was a sign in the sky. It was very big and bright, like a star. Everyone wanted to record what it said.
When they looked, they saw that it said it was harmless. Everyone was so happy! They all wanted to record what the sign said and share it with everyone. 
Everyone ran all around the town telling everyone the good news. Every day they would go outside and record what the sign said. It was a reminder of how kind and gentle the world could be. 
Soon all the people in town were happy and full of joy from the sign's message. For a long time, they remembered the sign, and still talk about it today. 
And that is the story of the harmless sign!




Once there was a little boy. He was only three years old. He saw a puppy lying in the grass. He was so helpless and alone. The little boy felt sorry for the pup.
