He got down onto the ground and lay down beside the pup. He looked into the pup's eyes and saw how sad it was. The little boy stroked its head and the puppy licked his hand. The two were now friends.
The little boy and the pup played together for hours. The pup followed the little boy everywhere he went. The pup was always so happy when the little boy was by his side. Eventually, it was time for the little boy to go home. He hugged the pup and said goodbye. He opened his eyes and to his surprise, the pup had followed him home!
The pup now lived with the little boy and his family. The little boy knew he had found a great friend in his helpless little pup. He loved taking care of it and playing with it. The pup always had a twinkle in its eyes and a big smile on its face when the little boy looked into its big, round pupils. They were the best of friends and would stay that way forever.



Once upon a time, there was a bear. He was sad because he had lost his ball. But then he found a sand box and he knew what to do.
He scooped up some of the soft sand and put his ball in it. Then he patted down the sand and it made a nice, soft bed for his ball.
The bear was happy and he had a nice snooze in the sun. As he dozed, he had the best idea. He dug a hole in the sand and then he buried his ball deep down.
Afterwards, the bear was happy and he even sang a song. He said goodbye to his ball and skipped away to play.




John was a little boy with a pocket full of blue buttons. He showed them to his mom and she said that they were so pretty. But when John went to school, he put the buttons in his pocket and forgot all about them. 
After school, John was walking home when he saw his friend's toy car. He wanted it so badly but he remembered that he had no money. He thought about taking the buttons from his pocket, but knew it wasn't the right thing to do. He sadly had to walk away.
When he got home, John reached into his pocket and felt the buttons he had forgotten about. He knew he had made the wrong choice and he felt so sad. He wished he had been able to buy his friend's car, but he knew it was too late. He had a deep regret for not listening to his mom. 
John realized that his mom was right and he should always save his treasures. From that day on, John kept his buttons safe in a special box. He never wanted to make the same mistake again.



Once upon a time, there was a brave lion. He was the king of the jungle and the bravest of all the animals. Every day he would go for a walk, but he was always careful not to go too far from his home.
One day, he heard voices coming from deep in the jungle. He couldn't understand what they were saying, but he was curious to find out. So he cautiously moved towards the voices.
When he got closer, he saw two little children playing. They were laughing and having a lot of fun. The lion wanted to play too, but he was afraid of being too serious.
The children saw the lion and started to giggle. They weren't scared at all; they were only excited! After a few moments, they decided to allow the lion to join in the fun.
The lion gratefully joined them and played with the children until sunset. He was so happy and loved the experience. From that day on, the lion and the children were the best of friends. They had so much fun together!




Once upon a time there was a boy named Jack. He was very intelligent, and had lots of friends.
One day, Jack was walking through the forest, when he stumbled over a big log. He was worried and afraid, until he saw a little bird sitting in a nest. It chirped happily and made Jack smile.
Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. It was a man with a big stick. He was making threats and scaring the animals away!
Jack was brave and he knew he had to help the animals. He used his intelligence to think of a plan to help them. He quickly ran to the man and pushed him away, so the animals could be safe.
The animals were very happy and gave Jack a big hug. They thanked him for saving them from the big threat.
Jack smiled, happy that he could help his new friends in the forest.



 
Mum and Dad were getting ready for work. Dad put on his smart shirt and grabbed his keys. Mum put on her shoes and grabbed her bag. They both went downstairs.
In the kitchen, Dad filled the coffee pot with hot water. He then poured the coffee into it. Mum switched on the machine and it started to make a noisy noise!
Dad pored the hot, strong coffee into two cups. The smell of coffee was filling the kitchen. Then they both put some milk and sugar into their coffee.
Mum and Dad smiled at each other as they both enjoyed their coffee. They said goodbye and left for work.




Once upon a time there was a princess who lived in a castle. One day she was walking close to the beach when she heard a sound coming from the ocean. She looked out and saw a little dog in the water. He was very nervous and he was swimming close to the shore but he just couldn't get out.
The princess knew she had to rescue him so she wasted no time. She quickly called out to the little dog and he looked over at her with wide eyes. She then picked him up with both hands and carried him back to the beach.
The princess and the dog both smiled in relief, but the princess still had to figure out where the dog came from. She sat down on the sand near a tall palm tree and the dog sat by her side. Suddenly, a boy appeared and he ran up to her and hugged the dog. He was so happy to see his puppy again! 
The princess said goodbye to the happy boy and the dog, then walked back to her castle, feeling very satisfied. She was glad she was able to rescue the little dog and return him to his owner.




Once upon a time there was a little bunny. He was hopping around outside and he decided to go explore the big world. So he hopped and hopped until he found a tube. He poked the tube and it made a funny noise. The bunny got scared and hopped away.
But then he remembered how brave he was, so he hopped over to the tube and poked it again. Suddenly the tube started to move and it was going really high! The bunny was so excited and he hopped around it with joy. 
The bunny hopped in the tube and it went even higher! He could see all the amazing things around him and he couldn't believe it. 
The tube eventually stopped and the bunny hopped out. He was so happy and he knew he had to come back and explore the tube again. He said goodbye to the tube and hopped off, feeling brave and excited for the next adventure!




Once upon a time, there was a little boy. His name was Frank. He was only 3 years old and he loved to explore. One day, Frank was walking through the park. He saw something funny. It was a triangle. It was shiny and fragile. Frank wanted to touch it.
Frank stumbled across the park towards the triangle. He reached out his hand to touch it, but it was too slippery. He put his other hand on it and suddenly it moved. Frank started to laugh as the triangle began to roll away.
It rolled and rolled until it crashed into something else. Frank looked closer and saw it had crashed into a pile of glass. The glass was very fragile. Rhyme had broken it. Frank was very sad. He had made a mistake.
Frank used his little hands to carefully pick up all the pieces of the glass. He was careful not to put too much pressure on the glass, as it was very fragile. When he had finished, the park was all clean.
Frank looked down at the triangle. He realized that he had been very lucky. He vowed to never stumble across the park again, but always to take small steps.




Once upon a time, there was a hot day. A little girl sneezed and said, "I need a mint." Then she went on an adventure to find a mint.
The little girl searched in the garden and the kitchen, but the mint was nowhere to be found. Then she started to get tired and thought, "Maybe I should take a nap."
So she found a nice spot in the sunshine and curled up for a nap. She was dreaming of minty treats when she felt something tickling her nose.
She opened her eyes, and right next to her was a big pile of mints. There must have been a thousand of them! The little girl smiled, and then ate a mint. It was cold and sweet, just like she had hoped.
The little girl was so happy that she had found all these mints to enjoy. She stayed outside in the sunshine until she got too hot, and then she took another nap.




Once upon a time, there was an ordinary clown. She was so happy and liked to make people giggle. Everywhere she went, people stopped to listen.
One day, the clown was walking down the street when she heard a very sad voice coming from behind a bush. She stopped and listened. It was a little mouse! He was crying so she asked what was wrong.
The mouse told her that he had lost his way home. The clown was so kind. She dried the mouse's tears with her big yellow handkerchief and told him that she would help him find his way home. 
So the clown and the mouse went on a journey and they looked in the gardens, in the fields and on the bridges. At last, the clown helped the mouse find his home.
The mouse was so thankful and so was the clown. She gave the mouse a big hug and a kind smile and then she went on her way, bringing happy giggles everywhere she went.




Once there was a hungry girl called Amy. She saw a path, so she followed it. It was a winding path that was full of exciting things to explore. Amy came across a big tree and she touched it with her hand. The bark was smooth and sharp.
Amy got hungrier and hungrier. Suddenly she saw a big, juicy strawberry growing on the tree. She climbed up the tree and picked it. It was so sweet! She enjoyed it very much and then carried on down the path.
At the end of the path, there was a big lake. Amy saw some fishes swimming in the water, so she decided to try to catch them. She went to the shore and threw in a pebble. The fishes got sharp and started to swim away. Amy was so happy to see them.
She sat by the lake with her strawberry and watched the fishes. It was a beautiful day. And best of all, she was no longer hungry.




Once upon a time, there was a lady who was very lonely. She wanted to get married and she wanted a rod to go fishing. But she was helpless and had no way of getting what she wanted.
One day, she went out for a walk and saw a man walking down the street. She asked him if he wanted to marry her and he said yes! She was so happy.
The man said he would get her a rod for fishing. She went looking for a rod but the shop was closed. She was feeling helpless and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, the man appeared out of nowhere! He had managed to find a rod and he gave it to her with a smile. She was so happy that she hugged him and they got married.
And they both lived happily ever after - fishing with their rod!



The little girl was angry. She was angry because her big sister had taken away her doll. So she went to the steel box in her room to find something to throw.
She found two rocks that were heavy and smooth. She put them in her pocket and went outside. She saw her sister sitting in a chair in the garden.
The little girl pulled out a rock and threw it at her sister. It hit the chair and made a loud sound. Her sister turned around and was very mad. 
The little girl was brave and threw the other rock at her sister. This time it hit her and she started crying. 
The little girl was not so angry anymore. She knew that it was wrong to throw things but sometimes you have to do something to get what you want.



Harry was walking through the park when he heard a loud scream. He looked around and saw a little boy crying. Harry smiled and asked the boy what was wrong.
The boy said he wanted a cookie, but his mommy said no. Harry heard that and felt bad for the boy, so he gave him one of his cookies.
The boy smiled and said thank you. He took a big bite of the cookie and felt better.
Then, he heard another scream. This time it was coming from a tree nearby. He looked and saw a bad kitty up in the tree who was scared and didn't know how to get down.
Harry laughed and helped the kitty down. He gave it some of his cookie too, which made the kitty happy. 
After they all said goodbye, Harry walked away happy that he had help the little boy and the scared kitty.




One day, a little girl was very thirsty. She wanted to drink something delicious. She looked through the kitchen and saw a strawberry. She picked it up and took a big bite. It was so sweet and yummy! She ate a few more strawberries. They were so little and tasty.
When she was done, the girl remembered she was thirsty. She saw a glass of juice and remembered how good it tasted. She took a sip and smiled. The juice quenched her thirst. She felt so happy!
The girl was so glad that she found the strawberries and the juice. She wanted to feel that way again and so, she made a plan. Everyday, she'd pick a few little strawberries and drink some delicious juice. That way, she'd always feel happy and satisfied!




Once upon a time there were two friends, Tony and Fred. They were best buddies and always did things together. One day, Tony said to Fred, "Hey, let's have an adventure!"
Fred said, "Yeah, let's do it!" So they set off into the woods. After a long walk, Tony said, "Let's settle here for a bit and have a picnic."
When they sat down and opened their picnic basket, there was cheese! Yum, thought Tony. They each had some cheese; it was bitter but Tony still liked it. Fred thought it was too bitter and didn't want to eat it.
Tony said, "Come on, Fred, it's not that bad!" Tony had another bit and he thought it tasted great! So eventually, Fred tried it and the two of them ate the cheese and enjoyed their picnic.
The two friends laughed and hugged each other, glad that they had enjoyed the cheese together. And they settled there, in the woods, enjoying their adventure.



 
Once upon a time there was a family who lived in a small house with not much furniture. The furniture was very old and pale and it didn't look very nice. Each day the family wished for something better, so one day they decided to improve the furniture. 
They worked hard to make it better. They polished and painted it until it was no longer pale and dingy. It looked bright and new and they were all so happy with their improved furniture. 
They moved the furniture around in the house and it looked so much better than before. Even their friends noticed and came to visit more often. Everyone was very pleased and happy with the improved furniture. 
The family enjoyed living in their house with the new and improved furniture. They would often have movie nights and family time on the furniture, and make the most of their cosy home. 
The end.




Once upon a time there was a small chair. It was very special because the chair could explain lots of things. Every day the chair would explain something new to a little 3 year old girl.
One day the chair explained what clouds were. It said that clouds were like white fluffy pillows in the sky. The little girl was amazed and asked the chair for more information.
The chair also Explained how birds fly. It told her that birds flap their wings and this makes them go up in the sky. The little girl was astonished and the chair would explain more and more things every day.
The small chair was a magical one and the little girl never stopped asking questions. She loved sitting on the chair and learning all sorts of things from it.



Once upon a time there was a tiny spider called Jasper. Everyday, he spun a beautiful cobweb in his small corner of the garden. It was so delicate that everyone said it looked like a rare and delicate piece of art!
One day, a strong wind came and blew Jasper's cobweb away! The poor spider was so sad!
Jasper was determined to build his cobweb back up. He scrambled up the long vines and worked away spinning out his web. But try as hard as he could, the cobweb would not look how it did before. Until one day, Jasper had an idea. He spooled the strands backwards and when he had finished, he was surprised to find that the cobweb was better than before! He had reversed the cobweb and made it look even more special.
From that day on, Jasper's cobweb was admired by all in the garden, and it became even more rare and beautiful.




Once upon a time there was a hairy jewel. It was so beautiful the little girl wanted to take it home. She ran to it, but it was just out of reach. She frowned and tried to stretch just a bit more. 
Suddenly, she heard a noise. She looked around, and saw a furry creature come out of the trees. It had a big smile on its face and it was holding the glittery jewel. 
The furry creature said it was the owner of the jewel, and it wanted it back. The little girl argued, but the furry creature shook its head. It said she could not have the jewel. 
The little girl frowned. She made a sad face, but the furry creature did not seem to notice. The furry creature said they both should find another jewel to share. 
The little girl's frown disappeared and was replaced with a smile. She agreed, and the two of them searched the field until they found a sparkly jewel together. The two of them smiled as they shared the jewel. 
The end.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who really wanted a present. She asked her mom and dad, but they said sorry - they didn't have any presents to give her. The little girl was very sad.
Suddenly, outside her window she saw something amazing! A beautiful flower was blooming. It was so big and colorful. The little girl smiled and felt better.
She turned to her parents and said, "Look! A present just for me!" She opened the window and picked the flower for a present. She gave it to her mom and dad and said "I love you".
Her mom and dad were very happy and gave her a big hug. From then on, the little girl always remembered that sometimes presents can bloom right in front of you - even when you're feeling sorry.




Once upon a time, there was a big family of cats. They were happy and lived in a nice warm home. One day, the cats found a small box on the doorstep. Inside the box was a little creature. Its fur was soft and shiny and it had a friendly face. 
The cats welcomed the creature with open paws. They saw that it was harmless and wanted to make it a part of the family. But then the cats realized something was wrong - the creature was carrying a bottle of poison! 
The cats were worried about the creature, but it kept smiling and seemed perfectly safe. Finally, the cats accepted the creature and gave it a warm welcome into the family. From that day on, the creature and the cats lived happily ever after.




Once upon a time there was a log. It was very cozy and harmless. One day a small chipmunk named Frank hopped on top of the log. He felt so comfy that he curled up and fell asleep. Suddenly, he started to shiver. It was cold outside and he needed a way to stay warm!
Frank noticed the sun was rising and felt the warmth on his back. He jumped off the log, ran towards the sunshine and was all cozy again.
Then, he remembered the log. He went back to check and saw that the log was still there, waiting for him. He knew that he could count on the log to keep him warm and cozy whenever he needed it. So, he hopped back on, wrapped himself up and fell asleep again.



 
Once upon a time there was a brave boy named Jack. He was three years old. One day, Jack wanted to try to do something special. He got an object and tried to figure out what to do with it. But he couldn't make it work. He got very mad and yelled, "This is terrible!" 
Jack's mom heard him and knew he was upset. She said, "Jack, don't worry. Let's try it together and see if we can figure it out." Jack and his mom worked together to figure out how to get the object to do what Jack wanted it to. 
Finally, Jack and his mom found success. Jack was so happy that he hugged his mom. He clutched the object close and said, "It's not terrible anymore!" From that day on, Jack learned that if he tried hard enough, anything could be made better.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Jack. He was only three years old and so he liked to explore the world and try new things.
One day, Jack was walking in the park when he saw something special. It was a very big drum. Jack wanted to try it out so he started to bang it. He was so happy and he made lots of noise.
Jack's friends did not like the noise he was making. So Jack's friends ran away. But Jack didn't stop. He was having so much fun making the noise.
Then something very special happened. Jack realized that the sound of the drum made him feel very lucky. That made him smile even more. 
Jack kept banging the drum and he realized that making music was lots of fun!




Mia and Mummy had a very different day. Mummy decided to take Mia to the beach. Mia loved the beach and when she saw the huge ocean she was very excited.
Mummy and Mia spotted a blue raft in the water. Mia wanted to try it, so they went to the beach shop. Mummy bought a red and white striped raft and they took it back to the beach.
Mia got on the raft and floated on the water. Mummy sat on the beach and read to Mia. The water felt warm and Mia had lots of fun.
When Mia was hungry, Mummy brought some apples. They ate them with the sand and enjoyed their day together. 
Mia and Mummy had a wonderful time and Mia loved the different raft.




Mommy and Sammy were walking to the park. Suddenly, Sammy saw a big, yummy horse. He screamed "horse, horse!". Mommy said "Do you want to pet the horse Sammy? Please be careful, ok?". Sammy nodded and said "please horse". He was so excited he ran over to the horse. The horse made a friendly noise and Sammy patted it's neck. He said "yummy".
Mommy smiled and said "Let's go get ice cream Sammy, would you like that?". Sammy nodded as he followed mommy away from the horse. He said "yummy horse, please mommy!"




Once upon a time, there was a tall twig that wanted to travel. It bounced and skipped around the garden, but it soon found itself wanting to go further.
With the wind in its favor, the twig fluttered away, flying high up in the sky. It zoomed over fields and streams, and saw many new places. It even flew so close to a bright, white cloud that it thought it could touch it!
The twig was so excited from its journey, it wanted to show off all its new discoveries. So, it returned to the garden, leaving its tall twig-friends feeling very inspired. From then on, they all decided to travel together and explore even more of the world together.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was wise beyond her years. She was always asking questions and exploring the world around her. One day, she decided to explore the woods near her home. She marched into the woods and started to discover all the wonderful things that were hidden there.
The girl found a secret path which she quickly followed. She discovered many beautiful plants, insects and fascinating creatures. The girl felt so happy and excited that she even started singing and dancing along the path.
At the end of the path, the girl found a big tree. The tree had a hole in the trunk and her curiosity got the better of her. The girl got on top of a log and climbed into the hole. To her surprise, she discovered a wondrous place filled with glittering lights and many magical things.
The girl felt wise for finding the hidden world inside the tree. She wanted to explore more, but the sun was setting and it was time for her to go home. The girl carefully climbed out of the tree and returned home, feeling pleased and happy with all she had discovered.




Mum had a new table. It was soft and safe. Mum looked at it and smiled.
Mum said it was time to pay for the table. She gave the man some money. He said thank you and gave her a big hug. 
Mum and the little girl put their things on the table. They were so happy. They played with their toys and laughed together.
Mum said the table made them feel safe. Mum said it was their special table. 
The little girl liked to play with her toys at the safe table. Every day when she came home she went straight to it. She was happy to have such a nice safe table.




Once there was a little girl who was scared of the dark. Every night, she heard an alarm that made her trembling in her bed. As she was getting older, she wanted to be brave and not be scared anymore. 
One night, she asked her mom if she could turn off the alarm. She trusted her mom, so she knew it was okay. She jumped out of bed and carefully tiptoed over to the alarm. She was so brave! She slowly put her hand over the alarm and with a deep breath, she turned it off. 
There was no noise - just peaceful silence! She smiled, feeling proud that she was brave enough to do this all by herself. Before she went back to bed, she saw a nasty, dirty sock under her bed. She quickly put it in the laundry and went back to bed with a feeling of trust in herself.




Polly was an enthusiastic three year old with a flashlight. She was always looking for adventures and fun. One night, Polly grabbed her flashlight and snuck outside. She pointed the flashlight forward and started to shoot around the garden. She had so much fun and wondered what else she could discover. Suddenly, she heard a noise coming from behind the tree. With the flashlight pointing forward, she slowly made her way closer. She was so brave and excited. As she came closer, she saw a big butterfly! Polly was thrilled and jumped around like crazy. Then, she shone the flashlight onto the butterfly and it flew away. She giggled and enjoyed shooting around with her flashlight.




Once upon a time, there was a happy girl called Emma. She was playing outside in the sunshine and having a great time. But then she felt a tickly feeling in her nose. She knew it was time! She said "Ah-ah-CHOO!" and she sneezed.
Then something very strange happened. All of a sudden, there was a loud noise. It was an emergency vehicle, an ambulance. It was coming down the street with its lights flashing and its siren blaring. Emma stopped playing and looked around. She saw the ambulance, and she was very surprised.
But soon it was gone and the street was quiet again. Emma finished her game and went inside. She was still happy, even though the ambulance had been an emergency. She went to bed, happy that she knew what an emergency was. But she was also glad that it hadnt been her having an emergency  that it was just her sneeze!



 
Timmy was an active three year old. He enjoyed playing outside in the sun. One day, he went out and found something dull in his hand. It looked like a funny rock. He enjoyed feeling its rough surface. He twirled it around and around in his hands. 
The rock had a funny smell and Timmy thought it was special. He enjoyed picking it up and moving it close to his face. He looked at it for a long time, imagining all kinds of shapes and colours. 
Finally, he put it in his pocket and ran to tell his mum. She said the rock was an old fossil. Timmy smiled and said that he would always enjoy keeping it with him.




Jack looked out of his window and wondered what was in the garage next door. He knew there was something special inside because he could hear loud noises coming from it. He watched as the door opened and a wild car came out. He had never seen anything like it before! 
Jack wanted to explore the garage, but he knew he wasn't allowed. He thought for a while, and then he came up with an idea. He would sneak over to the garage and peek inside from behind the bushes.
So, Jack grabbed his coat and ran outside. He hid behind the bushes and peered inside the old, creaky garage. He couldn't believe his eyes! There were lots of cars, tools and strange machines inside. Jack wondered what all these things were used for, and why they were so wild! 
Jack just sat there, watching and wondering, until the sun began to set. He knew then that it was time to go home. But deep down, Jack knew that he would be back soon, to explore the wild garage again.



Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to study.
She studied her ABC's, numbers, colors and shapes. Every day she studied a bit harder and got smarter.
One day she was studying with her waist up on the chair, when she heard a voice.
It was her brother. He was telling her she was stupid.
She felt sad, because he was saying mean things. But she knew he was wrong.
She put her waist down from the chair and went to talk to him.
She told him that she was smart and studying would help her get smarter.
Her brother changed his mind and said that studying was a fantastic thing to do. He even asked her to help him with his studies too.
She smiled and hugged him.
They then both sat down and started studying together.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very sleepy. She yawned as she walked through the forest, her eyes droopy and her steps slow. 
Suddenly, she heard a noise in the trees. She looked up to find a tall man with a basket full of shiny stones. He was sorting through them, putting some in one pocket and some in the other.
The little girl asked the man why he was sorting the stones. He told her that he liked to collect pretty rocks and had so many that he needed to sort them so he could carry them all. 
The little girl watched as he finished sorting and then waved goodbye. She was happy that he was so careful and she wondered what special things he was going to do with his basket of shiny stones.




Once upon a time there was a girl. The girl loved to climb. One day, she was going on an adventure and she saw a big bell. The bell was purple, and it was very pretty.
The girl was excited, so she decided to climb up to the bell. She grabbed it and started to pull herself up the bell. It was hard work, and the girl was very tired. But she kept going until she was at the top.
When she reached the top, she was surprised  the bell was actually a door! And when she opened it there was a beautiful garden full of purple flowers. The girl was so happy that she had climbed to the top that she ran around the garden, smelling the flowers and feeling the sun on her face. 
That was the girl's best adventure ever. She will always remember the purple bell and the magical garden she found when she climbed to the top.




Once upon a time, there was a princess. She liked to imagine things. She imagined a big shiny silver castle. It was so tall, it touched the sky. She imagined walking in the castle, it felt safe and happy. Then she imagined finding a silver key in the castle. She picked it up and put it in her pocket. Later, she found a door in the castle and opened it. Behind the door, was a beautiful silver garden! She imagined the garden was safe and full of wonderful things. The princess smiled. She was so happy she could imagine wonderful places like this. The end.




The little girl was grumpy. She had been outside playing with her friends in the park, but it was time to go home. She started to complain.
"I don't want to go home," she said. "I want to stay here and keep playing!"
But her parents said that it was time to go. So she walked home, grumbling to herself.
When they got to the house, the little girl saw a big pile of junk in the garden. It was old chairs and toys, broken into pieces. She complained a lot about it.
"Why is this here? It's so ugly," she said. "I don't like it."
Her dad explained that the junk was going to be taken away the next day. The little girl was happy to hear this, but she was still grumpy.
Soon enough, the next day came and the junk was taken away. The little girl was so happy that the ugly pile was gone. She ran outside to play with a smile on her face.




Once upon a time there was a very rude tank. This tank rolled everywhere he went, bumping into things and making them fall over. He was never very careful and no one seemed to like him.
One day the tank rolled near a small lake. He couldn't stop in time and fell in the lake. He tried to get out but he was so heavy he couldn't do it. He was really scared!
Suddenly, a little frog hopped by and noticed the tank struggling. The frog was kind and offered her help. She hopped onto the tank's back and balanced there until he could get out.
The tank was very thankful and said "Thank you!" to the little frog. From that day on, the tank was much more careful, friendly and kind. He always thanked the little frog in his heart for helping him balance again.




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Sue. She was three years old, and very curious. One day, she wanted to explore something new, so she asked her mom if she could go for a walk. Her mom said yes, so off she went.
As Sue explored, she saw lots of interesting things. She saw big trees, tall buildings and bright flowers. Everything was so unique! Sue couldn't believe her eyes.
Soon Sue came to a hill. She wanted to see what was on the other side, but she couldn't see very far. She tried to find a way to manage. She looked and looked until she found a nice tall tree.
Sue climbed up the tree, and when she reached the top, she looked around. From up there, Sue could see everything! The view was so much better! She was so happy!
Sue smiled to herself, proud that she was able to manage. She waved from the top of the tree, and shuffled down. Then she went back home and told her mom about all the unique things she saw.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Mandy. Mandy loved popcorn. One day, she went to the movies with her mom and dad. When they got to the movie theater, Mandy saw all the popcorn and she shouted with joy. She looked at her mom and dad and demanded popcorn! Her mom smiled and gave Mandy a little bag of popcorn. Mandy happily munched on the popcorn as she watched the movie. She was so happy and kept asking for more popcorn. In the end, Mandy enjoyed her little box of popcorn the whole movie long.




One day there was a cheerful boy named Peter. Peter loved eating lots of different fruits. He especially liked bananas, apples, and oranges. Every day he went to the store to buy some fruit. He liked to include lots of different colours into his fruit basket. 
Peter would find a nice spot in his yard to eat the fruit. His favourite spot was under a big tree. The tree was so tall and gave lots of shade. It was the perfect place to eat fruit and be cheerful. 
Peter loved to eat the fruit so much. He would eat and laugh and the tree would laugh with him. Sometimes he would share his fruit with some of the birds and other animals that would visit him at the tree. 
When Peter was done eating, he would sit still for a minute and take in the nature around him. He was so thankful that he was able to sit and enjoy the fruits of his labour. It made him feel very cheerful.




Mama and Papa had a stack of wood in the backyard. Every day, the wood pile would get smaller and smaller. Mama and Papa would haul the wood in the small cart to the houses of their neighbors.
One day, when Mama and Papa came home, they heard a loud noise. It was coming from the backyard. Mama and Papa walked over and saw a 3-year-old child, who was complaining loudly. Mama asked the child what was wrong.
The child said, "This stack of wood is too heavy. I can't move it!" Mama smiled and said, "No problem. Papa and I will help you move it. That way, it won't be too heavy for you."
Mama and Papa then helped the 3-year-old move the stack of wood. The child was so grateful for their help. After finishing the task, the 3-year-old thanked Mama and Papa for helping them move the wood. And from that day onwards, the 3-year-old had learned an important lesson: it's sometimes okay to ask for help.




Amelia loved to dance. Every morning, she put on her track shoes and danced around the house. Today, she was feeling extra fancy. She spun around in circles and jumped up and down.
Amelia's mommy saw how much fun Amelia was having. So, mommy put on some music. Amelia twirled around the livingroom until the song was over.
The sun was shining outside, so Amelia and mommy decided to go to the park. Amelia ran to the field and started to dance. She moved her feet in big circles and whirled her arms around.
Suddenly, Amelia heard some fun music. She looked around and saw a big truck. It was parked in the parking lot playing music. Amelia started to dance, faster than ever before. She moved her body every which way, just like a fancy ballerina!
When the music was over, Amelia felt happy and tired. She ran over to mommy and said she wanted to go home now for a rest. Mommy agreed and off they went, with Amelia still dancing all the way!




Once upon a time, there was a mom. She had a special book. The book was a novel. The novel was very tough. The mom wanted to hide it.
So, she stayed up very late. She looked all around the house. She looked in all the corners. She looked in the closets. But she couldn't find a good spot.
Then, the mom had an idea. She went outside and looked in the garden. She found a perfect spot. Right under a bush!
Mom tucked the novel in and hid it. Later, when she came back, it was still there. She smiled. No one could find her special novel.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who was shy. Her name was Pepper. Every morning she went to the park to play. Today she saw a big lion there who was sleeping. Pepper was scared but she stayed very still.
The lion began to yawn, a long and tired yawn. Pepper was so curious. She had never seen a lion before, much less one that was yawning. She was brave and started to laugh.
The lion opened her eyes and saw little Pepper there. Pepper was so scared that she ran away, but the lion just stretched and went back to sleep. Pepper was surprised, she had thought the lion would be mad but she just went back to sleep.
Pepper was happy and laughed all the way back home. She still remembered the lion's yawn and smiled as she thought about it. She knew the lion was very tired, but also very kind.



John and his mom were at the shop. John saw a big box of muffins sitting on the counter. His mom smiled and said, "Let's load them in the car. We can eat them for a snack."
John was so excited and ran to the car. He said, "I can help you load them." He carried some of the thick muffins to the car and his mom helped him.
When they finished, they drove off in the car. All the way home, John dreamt of eating the delicious muffins.
At home, John's mom served them muffins with a glass of milk. They were so thick and sweet and yummy. John and his mom smiled as they ate their snack.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who liked to dream. She dreamed of all sorts of different things, like trees and flowers, animals and toys. 
One chilly winter day, the little girl put on her warmest, most fit clothes and headed outside into the winter air. As she looked around, she saw snowflakes gently falling all around her. The little girl started spinning round and round, spreading her arms out wide. 
In the middle of all these snowflakes, the little girl found herself dreaming that she was a snow fairy. She spun faster and faster, and it made her so happy that she smiled the biggest smile she had ever smiled. 
As she spun, the snowflakes got caught up in her spun and she could feel the cold snow on her skin. Before long the little girl was laughing and feeling so carefree. 
When the little girls dream was over, she opened her eyes and looked around. But the snow was still all around her and the winter air was still chilly. She smiled to herself and said Well, that was a fun dream! And with that, she went off on her way.




Bob was a player. Every day he ran, hopped, skipped and jumped. He was very fast and smooth.
One day, Bob wanted to pause. He stayed still and breathed slowly. All around him was quiet. He listened to the birds singing and felt the warm breeze on his face. It was very peaceful.
Suddenly, Bob heard something. It was coming from behind the big tree. He hopped to the tree and found what was making the noise. It was another player.
The two players greeted each other with a smile and began to play. They skipped and hopped around the tree. It was so much fun and felt so smooth! Bob was so happy to find a new friend.
When the game was over, the two players paused and hugged. Later, Bob went home with a big smile on his face.




Once upon a time, there was a boy who wanted to do something special. So he gathered his friends to discuss what to do.
The friends talked and thought until they all decided to build a big castle. They discussed how to organize the steps to build it.
First, they would get some big blocks. Then they would use the blocks to build the walls. Next, they would find some chairs to put inside the castle. Finally, they would find a flag and put it on top of the castle.
The friends were very excited. Each day they would take a step closer to finishing the castle. They worked hard and the castle was soon finished! 
The friends were so happy with the organized steps they had taken. Finally, they could play with the castle and they celebrated.




One day, Jack was walking outside. He felt warm and happy. Then he saw a bug. It was big and had many legs. Jack didn't like bugs. He hated them. He ran away from the bug as quickly as he could. He didn't want to see the bug anymore. 
Jack kept walking and when he looked down he saw many bugs on the ground. There were so many! Jack was scared and he began to cry. He ran away from the bugs as fast as he could. 
Jack did not like bugs. He was so scared of them. But then, he saw a butterfly. It was so colorful and beautiful. Jack wasn't scared of butterflies. He smiled and felt warm and happy again.




Once upon a time there were two friends. They were intelligent because they both knew a lot. One friend had a very smooth texture, like a fluffy cloud. The other friend had a rough texture, like a tree trunk.
Whenever these two friends got together, they would have lots of fun. They would play games, run around, and tell each other funny stories. They would also have long conversations, talking about their adventures and the things they had seen.
The two friends were so intelligent that, over the years, they learned about an amazing secret. No one else knew about it, so they kept it a secret between them. They had so much fun exploring this secret together.
No matter what happened, these two friends always had each other. And that made them both very happy.




Once upon a time there was a young guard. He was always very friendly to everyone he saw. One day, he decided to go for a walk. As he was walking, he saw something that matched his coat. It was a beautiful necklace! He knew he had to have it.
The guard went to the store and asked how much the necklace was. The store clerk told him it would cost a bit of money. The young guard only had a few coins. He didn't have enough to buy the necklace.
The store clerk saw how much the guard wanted the necklace. He decided to give it to him for free. The guard was so happy with his new necklace and he thanked the store clerk for being so kind. Then, he happily took his necklace and went back to his job.
From then on, the young guard always wore his new necklace everywhere he went. He was very proud of it and felt like it made him look even more official when guarding the city. The guard and his necklace were a perfect match!




Once there was a little girl who really loved to celebrate. Every weekend her family celebrated something. One weekend they celebrated the sun. They put their hands out and shouted "hurray for the sun!"
One day there was a special celebration. The little girl went to the hospital to take an x-ray. She was a little bit shy because she didn't know what an x-ray was. But the doctor was so friendly and explained it to her.
When the x-ray was done she was so happy. Her family celebrated by having a big party. All her friends came over and they ate cake, played games, and had so much fun.
After the party was over the little girl knew that it was because of the x-ray that they had a reason to celebrate. She was so glad that she was able to take an x-ray and have a reason to celebrate with her family and friends.




Once upon a time there was an old man. He was very generous. He liked to visit people and bring them presents. Every day he would get into his old vehicle and drive off looking for someone to visit.
One day he came across a small town and decided to stop and visit. He went from house to house looking for someone to give a present to. Finally, he found a little 3 year old girl. When she opened the door she was so excited to see the old man with a big smile on his face.
The old man was generous and gave the little girl a special toy. She was so happy and thanked him for the wonderful gift. He gave her a big hug and said goodbye. The old man drove away in his old vehicle, smiling thinking of the little girl's face filled with joy.




Once upon a time, there was a brave girl called Tina. She was very anxious to try out her new computer.
Tina plugged the computer into a wall socket and switched it on. She heard a buzzing sound and saw the lights on the computer turn on.
Tina excitedly typed something on the computer, then she pressed a button that said "print". Suddenly the computer started to make some loud noises and a piece of paper came out of it.
Tina was so happy that the computer had printed something! Now she wanted to try printing something else, something even more exciting.
So Tina typed something else, then again she pressed the button that said "print". But this time, nothing happened. Tina was a bit anxious, so she pressed the button again and again.
Eventually, the computer printed out what Tina had typed! She jumped up and down in excitement.
Tina was so proud of what she had done with her computer!




Once there was a boy named Jack. He was very curious and loved exploring. One day he went on an adventure and saw something incredible. It was a big, white bathtub in the middle of the forest! Jack was amazed. He carefully stepped inside and began to explore. Everywhere he looked, there were beautiful colors and shapes. He couldn't believe his eyes! 
At the far end of the bathtub, Jack noticed something. Something was staring at him. He felt a little nervous and he slowly looked over. There was a big, fat frog looking right at him! Jack and the frog just stared at each other for a moment before the frog hopped away.
Jack knew he had discovered something really special. He couldn't believe what he had seen. He decided to come back to the incredible bathtub every day to explore more. He was excited to see who else he might meet!




Once there was a little boy named Joe. He was a very shy boy and never wanted to talk to anyone. One day, his mommy had a great idea! She told him he should go outside and play with some of the other kids. Joe was scared, but he wanted to have fun.
So, he bravely stepped outside and saw some of his school friends. They waved to him and asked him to come play with them. Joe was very shy, but he was also curious. He slowly started walking towards them.
Suddenly, Joe tripped and fell to the ground. He was embarrassed and wanted to hide. But then the other kids started laughing and it made him feel better. Now they were all playing together and Joe was having so much fun. 
The idea of having fun outside made Joe feel much more brave. He wasn't so shy anymore and was even suggesting ideas to the group. It was a wonderful day and Joe was so glad that he had gone outside.




Henry stared at the wagon. It was big, red and filled with toys. He was impatient to go for a ride. He pulled at it but it wouldn't move. He shouted for help. 
His mom came running over. She put him in the wagon and held the handle. Henry smiled and shouted with joy.
The wagon began to move. Henry watched the houses and trees go by. He waved at some kids he saw playing in a garden.
Suddenly, the wagon stopped. Henry stared ahead. There was an ice cream shop! His mom took out some money and promised him a treat. Henry smiled and was no longer impatient.




Once upon a time there was an old wise whale. Every day the whale would swim around in the ocean looking for food and friends, but no one was around.
At night, the whale would get tired, so it decided to sleep. But it didn't have anywhere to sleep, so it just floated where the waves took it.
For many weeks, the whale floated and slept without ever finding a safe place to rest. It was so lonely and sad.
But one night, something amazing happened. A small school of fishes swam up to the whale and showed it a place to sleep. The whale was so happy and he followed the fishes to a quiet, dark and warm cave.
The whale felt so safe and happy that he fell asleep right away. For the first time ever, the wise old whale felt safe and at home.




Once upon a time, there was a brave little bunny. His name was Jack. One day, Jack hopped over to the desert to explore. Suddenly, he saw a big, sharp cactus! Jack was confused and he hopped around, wondering what to do. He wanted to explore the cactus, but he was scared. He hopped around for a few minutes and then he finally mustered up enough courage to touch the cactus. He was very careful, because he didn't want to get hurt by the sharp thorns. He poked it once and then he hopped back a few steps. He was surprised when nothing happened! After a few minutes, Jack determined that the cactus was safe and he hopped around it, examining it more closely. He was so brave! Before he knew it, the sun was setting and Jack hopped home, feeling accomplished and excited! 



Sammy was at the beach with his parents. He watched as the waves rocked against the shore. He was amazed at how lively the ocean was. 
His parents put him on a surfboard and told him to catch a wave. He was scared at first but when he tried it, he felt a rush of excitement. He rocked back and forth with the surf. He felt alive, like he could do anything. 
As he rode the fish, he smiled and laughed. He kept riding the waves, going up and down. More and more surfers started to join him and before he knew it, the beach was filled with people. 
Sammy had a great time. He couldn't believe he got to surf on such a lively beach day. He had never had so much fun in his life. He couldn't wait to come back and rock the waves again!




Once upon a time there was a duck who was feeling very bored. He looked around his pond and saw nothing interesting to do. Suddenly, he noticed a bright star in the sky.
The duck had an idea! He decided to decorate the pond with stars. So he swam around and gathered lots of pretty stones and shiny leaves. He arranged them into a big star shape at the bottom of the pond. 
The duck was so glad. He liked it so much that he decided to invite some friends to share his special pond. He gathered some ducks who also wanted to help decorate. 
The ducks made more stars, as well as a moon and some flowers. It looked so bright and beautiful. Everyone was so happy with the way they had decorated the pond. The whole pond sparkled and glowed in the night. 
The duck was so glad that he had a special pond to share with his friends. It was the most wonderful pond, and they were all so lucky to have it.




Billy and Jane were playing outside in the park. They were playing hide and seek and having so much fun. Suddenly, an icy drop came from the sky. "Oh no" said Jane, looking up. Billy followed her gaze and saw a cop in the sky. He was flying in a big and shiny helicopter carrying a bag filled with money.
Billy and Jane were so excited. They watched the cop drop the money from the helicopter. Then the cop came down to join them and share some of the money with the two kids. They were so happy; they had never seen so much money before!
Soon Billy and Jane were playing with their newfound wealth. They had more money than they ever dreamed of. With the cop's help, they started a lemonade business and shared their new riches with the whole neighbourhood. 
As they watched the sun go down, they looked up at the sky and waved goodbye to their cop friend. They thanked him for his generous gift of money and promised to always remember the day he made them wealthy.




Once there was a cute little bunny. Every day it hopped around, looking for things to nibble on. But one day it saw something it really liked. It was a small red ball. 
The bunny hopped over and grabbed the ball. Then it used all its speed and threw the ball as high as it could into the air. The ball went so high that the bunny could hardly see it. 
The ball came down a few minutes later and the bunny caught it. Then it threw the ball again. This time it flew even higher than before. The bunny was so excited. 
The bunny kept throwing and catching the ball until the sun started to set. Then the bunny hopped away with its red ball, ready to play again tomorrow.




Once there were two friends - both named Judy. They were walking in a park together. Judy the first stopped and pointed at a bush. "Look at that," she said.
Judy the second looked at the bush. It had a lot of little berries on it. "Rough," she said pointing.
The two friends reached up and each picked a berry. They carefully tasted them. The berries tasted sweet and juicy.
They giggled and grabbed some more berries. They both ate until their bellies were full. Then, they waved goodbye and went their separate ways. 
The two friends had a lot of fun that day. And they never forgot about their special berry picking adventure in the park.



Once upon a time there was a boy called Ted. Ted loved to catch things! One day his mum took him on a visit to a farm. Ted was so excited!
At the farm Ted saw lots of animals. There were chickens and cows and even rabbits. Ted spotted a harmless white rabbit, so he decided to try and catch it. He crept up quietly and tried to grab it, but it was too quick for him!
He was so disappointed. Suddenly, he heard a noise. It was coming from the barn. Ted ran over and looked inside. There, sitting in the middle of the barn, was a big, harmless dog! It was looking at Ted with its big brown eyes.
Ted thought the dog was the most beautiful thing he had ever seen. So he decided to catch it! He carefully crept closer and then grabbed it around the neck. The dog didn't mind, it just wagged its tail.
Ted and the dog were friends ever since! They would visit the farm often and Ted would take the dog for walks. It was the greatest visit Ted had ever made!




Once upon a time there was a fair flea who wanted to find a place to fit. He looked left, he looked right, but he couldn't find a spot that was just right. He flew up high in the sky and he flew low and all around, but he just couldn't find a place to fit. He began to get very tired and he was about to give up when he saw a big dog, stretching and laying in the sun. The fair flea watched for a bit and, when the big dog stood up and started running around, a space was formed between his shoulders. The flea flew in quickly, putting himself in just the right spot! He fit perfectly and from that spot he could see everything. And so the fair flea found his place and he was very happy. The end.



Once upon a time there was a furry little mouse. He lived under the stairs and he loved to explore. 
One day, he went exploring. He saw something shiny and wanted to catch it. It was shiny gear! 
He tried to get it, but it was stuck on the ground. He tried pushing it and pulling it but it wouldn't budge.
Then he heard a noise behind him. He turned around to see a big cat! The cat was grinning and holding up the gear he was trying to catch!
The cat said, "If you want it back, you have to catch me!" So the little mouse chased after the cat. He ran and ran until he finally caught up with the cat and grabbed the gear from its paws. The cat ran away and the little mouse smiled with joy as he held the shiny gear in his hands.



One day, a little girl named Emma was playing hide-and-seek with her mom. She was so great at hiding that she made her mom search for her all over the house. Finally, mom found her hiding under the bed. 
Emma thought it would be funny to try and make her nose disappear. She tried scrunching up her face and squinting her eyes really tight, but it didn't work.
So she decided to try using magic. She waved her hands around her nose and said some special words. "Vanish, disappear!," she shouted. 
And just like that, her nose disappeared! Her mom was so surprised, she almost dropped her cup of tea. Emma laughed and laughed and then her nose reappeared. 
They both had a great time playing hide-and-seek that day.




Once upon a time, there was a boy called Tim. He was three years old and he loved to study. One day, his mommy gave him a very special stamp. It looked sooo cool! But it was not easy to use. Tim tried to stamp the paper, but it was terrible. He stamped too hard and ripped the paper. Tim was so sad, but he wanted to try again. He was determined to study and use the stamp. Finally he did it! He was so excited. From then on, he used the stamp for all his studies. He was so proud.



Joe and Jane were great friends. They always had fun together.
Every morning they would run around and laugh.
One day, Joe got into trouble. He got lost. Jane searched the whole day but couldn't find him.
But then, Jane had an idea. She said "I love Joe, I know he will find his way". Then she sang a song.
Soon, Joe heard the song and followed it. He found his way back to Jane. When they saw each other, they hugged and laughed. They were so happy to be together again.
Joe and Jane knew that true friends love each other, no matter what the trouble. They were forever grateful for the great friendship they shared.




Johnny was a very special boy. He had a rare brain. It made him very smart. He could do things that other boys and girls his age couldn't do.
One day Johnny was playing with his toys in the garden. He wanted to show his mum how smart he was. He started to do somersaults and jump. He had so much fun!
Mum was so proud of him. She said, "You have a rare brain, Johnny. You can do so many things!" 
Johnny was very happy. He felt special that he had a rare brain. He kept practicing and having fun. Whenever he had questions, he knew he could always ask mum.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy who liked to zoom around the house. He especially liked to go outside and play in the garden.
One day, he saw a jar in the garden. Inside the jar there were some sour green apples. He decided to try one, so he reached in and grabbed one out of the jar.
When he bit into the apple, it was so sour that he made a funny face! The little boy did not like the sour apple and soon decided that he did not want to eat it anymore.
But he still wanted to play with something, so he grabbed the jar and started to zoom around the garden with it. He had so much fun that he forgot all about the sour apple!




Once upon a time there was a comet in the sky. It was so high and far away. It was very distant.
The comet was moving. It was flying through the sky. It was traveling so fast!
But then it stopped. It stayed still in the sky. It was so quiet.
Everybody looked up. They wanted to see the comet. It was beautiful!
Then the comet started to move again. It flew away off into the sky. It was going very fast.
But soon it stopped again. It stayed in the sky. Everybody looked up. They wanted to see the comet.
Then the comet moved away. It was so far and looked so small. Everybody watched until it vanished in the night. The comet was gone.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Molly. Molly was a very happy little girl, always smiling and playing with her friends.
One day, Molly went to the park with her mom. Molly saw a big grey swan in the pond. She thought it was so beautiful, so she went up to it to give it a kiss. The swan had such a soft and puffy feathery weight. Molly loved it! 
Suddenly, an ugly old wizard appeared out of nowhere! He was really mad that Molly kissed the swan and he began waving his hands around, yelling and pointing angrily at Molly and her mom. Molly began to cry. 
But then something wonderful happened. The swan began to shine with a magical light and wrapped itself around Molly and her mom, making them feel very safe. Then, it flew away, taking the wizard with it.
Molly and her mom hugged each other tight and Molly smiled again. Molly knew that the swan had used its magical powers to save them. She learned that day to always be kind and loving.



Once upon a time, there was a girl. She was called Emma. Every day, Emma went to school. She always looked very attractive. One day, Emma was in school and was doing a quiz. Suddenly, she felt a tickle in her nose. She started to sneeze. She sneezed and sneezed and sneezed. Her teacher told her to go and blow her nose. Emma put her handkerchief to her nose, blew and then felt much better. She was so happy that she could continue with her quiz. The end.




Once there was a boy named Fred. He was 3 years old. One day, he decided to invite his friends over for a playdate. He asked his mom for some olives to share with his friends.
Fred's mom gave him some olives and he put them on the table. He then went outside to wait for his friends to arrive.
It started to rain and soon the olives got wet. Fred was so disappointed!
Fred's friends still came over and he was really happy. He invited them to play in the rain and they had lots of fun.
After the playdate, the olives had dried out and Fred was able to eat some with his friends. They had a great time together!




Grandpa was very proud of his grandson. Grandson couldn't understand why Grandpa was so proud of him. So Grandpa told him a story. 
He said, "Oxygen is what we breathe to stay alive. That's why it is very important. We all need it. Do you understand?"
Grandson nodded his head, he understood what Grandpa was telling him. He felt proud of himself for understanding Grandpa. Grandson now knew why Grandpa was so proud of him. 
Grandson was happy to learn such an important lesson. Grandpa was proud of his grandson for understanding something so important. Grandson smiled and hugged Grandpa. They were both very proud.



 Once upon a time there was a white puppy. His fur was so soft and he had a healthy, shiny coat. Every morning his owner would take him outside in the garden and they would play together. They would have lots of fun rolling and hopping around the garden. 
The sun was always so warm and the puppy loved it. He would close his eyes and just rub his head in the grass. The feeling was so nice it made him doze off. Sunbathing made him feel so happy and content. When he was done he was always full of energy and ready to play some more. 
The puppy and his owner were best friends. Every day the puppy would wait for his Owner to come home so that they could go out and play together. 
The white puppy was the happiest and healthiest puppy around. And the feeling of the sun and the grass against his fur always made him feel like everything was perfect in the world.




Once upon a time, there was a furry bear. He wanted to go outside to play, but it was raining. He was sad.
He grabbed his umbrella and opened it. But the wind was very strong, and the umbrella struggled against the wind. The wind blew the umbrella into the air! 
The furry bear was scared, but he didn't give up. He grabbed onto the umbrella and held on tight. He struggled to keep the umbrella close to him, and the wind made it hard.
But finally, the furry bear won! He was able to keep the umbrella close to him and the wind stopped blowing. He smiled and happily went outside to play. 
The End.




Once upon a time, there was a brilliant gate. It was so tall it seemed to reach up to the sky! Every day, lots of animals would come to the gate looking for food.
An old man lived nearby, and he knew the animals were hungry. So every day, he would come to the gate with some food. He would spread the food around so all the animals could eat.
The animals were so happy! They would flock around the old man and the gate, dance through the grass and chirp and squeak with delight when the food was put down.
The old man would watch with a smile and wave goodbye as the animals happily ate the food he provided. He was so kind to feed them each and every day. The animals were so thankful for the old man's generosity and kindness.




Once upon a time, two friends named Jack and Jill were walking through the woods. As they walked, Jack saw a bright light coming from behind a tree. It was a big, round bulb that was shining light all around it.
The friends were very excited! They quickly grabbed the bulb and held it up so they could get a closer look. Inside the bulb was a very rich, sparkling gold!
Jill was so amazed, she couldn't believe what she was seeing. She shouted, "Let's take it home!"
Jack agreed, so the two friends quickly made their way home. They put the bulb into the ground and waited.
As the sun began to rise in the morning, the bulb lit up the sky. Jack and Jill looked up in awe as the light from the bulb rose high into the sky. Soon, the sky was filled with a golden brightness.
Jack and Jill were so proud of their new bulb. The rich golden light would remind them of their amazing adventure in the woods forever.



Once upon a time there was a strong monster. The monster had one big tooth. But the monster was not happy. He wanted more teeth so he could eat more food.
One day the monster saw a young boy playing a game. He wanted the boy to give him a tooth. But the boy said no and ran away.
The angry monster chased the boy. The boy was too fast, so the monster destroyed things around him. He knocked over trees and broke rocks with his strong arms. Finally, the boy stopped and the monster was close enough to snatch his tooth.
The boy was scared, but he tried to stay brave. He opened his mouth, showed the monster his tooth, and said, "No, you can't have it!"
The monster was so surprised that the boy was brave enough to stand up to him. He smiled and promised not to destroy anything else. Then, he thanked the boy for his tooth and happily went on his way.




Once upon a time, there was a stubborn seed. Every day, the seed wanted to bloom like all the other flowers and plants, but it just couldn't. The seed worked hard trying to bloom, breaking out of its tiny covering and pushing its way through the soil. 
One sunny morning, the seed's work paid off! With a loud "pop", the stubborn seed finally bloomed! Its beauty was magnificent! Its petals were a deep purple and its aroma was like a summer afternoon.
All the other plants and animals came to admire the blooming seed. They praised its beauty and struggled with the stubborness that kept it from blooming for so long. 
For the rest of the summer, the stubborn seed bloomed and shined, reminding everyone how amazing and special it was. The seed taught everyone that with hard work and patience, amazing things can happen.




Once there was a little girl named Amy. She was three years old. One day, Amy stepped outside to play in the garden. She was so happy! She hopped and skipped around the garden and had lots of fun. 
When she was ready to come inside, she wanted to see if her brother wanted to come too. She stepped up to his bedroom door and knocked. There was no answer, so she stepped inside. 
To her surprise, her brother was on the floor, crying. His shoulder was hurt! Amy was scared and didn't know what to do. She stepped over to her brother and tried to help by rubbing his shoulder gently. 
Amy was so brave and her brother was very grateful. After a few minutes he stopped crying and was feeling better. 
They both stepped outside together and played in the garden.




Once upon a time, there was a little tree who was very anxious. All her friends had leaves and beautiful flowers, but she was the only one without any. Everyday, she worried that no one would want her because she was so different.
But then one day, the wind blew over a special root. The little tree was excited, so she quickly reached down to pick it up. She knew it was the perfect thing to attach to her branches so she held onto it tight. 
The root was filled with power and soon enough, beautiful leaves started to appear on the tree. The little tree was so happy - she had never been so happy before! All her worries were gone and she thanked the wind for bringing her this special root. 
From then on, the little tree was not anxious anymore. She was so proud of her beautiful leaves and all her friends were so happy that she now looked the same as them.
The end.



Once upon a time, there was an enormous tree. It was so huge that not even the biggest birds could fly over it. One day, a little girl came walking by. She stopped to look at the giant tree, and then saw something that made her very happy  a twig poking out from the trunk.
The little girl was so excited that she reached up and tried to pull out the twig. It was stuck firm, so she gave it a tug, and then something amazing happened  the twig broke!
The little girl was so happy that she jumped up and down. She put the twig in her pocket and went off skipping away. From then on, she always carried the twig with her  a reminder of the enormous tree.



Once there was a little boy, named Dan. Dan was three years old and lived with his mom and dad. Every Tuesday morning, Dan would get out of bed early. He liked Tuesdays because they were always fun, and usually something special would happen on Tuesdays.
Today was a Tuesday. Everything outside was gray and quiet. Dan went down to the kitchen. His mom had made him a special breakfast. It was Dan's favorite: cereal with milk and blueberries.
After breakfast, Dan and his mom went to the park. Dan loved playing in the park. He ran around, exploring and finding all kinds of new things. Dan only stopped running when he got tired. Sooner or later, he would take a break and sit in one of the swings.
Dan had a great time at the park, but eventually it was time to go home. As they were walking back, his mom said, "Dan, today was Tuesday and we had a lot of fun. Tomorrow will be Wednesday and there will be more fun! 
Dan smiled, happy that he had been able to get out and enjoy a fun special Tuesday.




Jimmy was 3 years old. He loved sports. He wanted to sign up for a sport, but he did not know which one.
He went to the park with his mom. He saw a lot of kids playing baseball. He liked the old ball and bat. He asked his mom if he could sign up for baseball.
His mom said yes, and the next day she took Jimmy to the park. The coach asked Jimmy to sign a paper. Jimmy was happy.
The coach showed Jimmy how to catch and hit the ball. He said he was a natural. Jimmy was very proud. 
Jimmy kept practicing and soon he was playing in the games. He kept playing longer and longer, and soon he was an expert at baseball. Jimmy loved being part of a team and playing a sport that he loved.




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Jake. Jake lived by a big ranch and he loved visiting it every day.
One day, Jake got scared when he heard a loud noise coming from the ranch. He ran away and hid in his mom's closet.
When his mom found him, she asked him, "What is wrong, Jake?".
Jake answered, "I heard a loud noise from the ranch and it scared me."
His mom said, "It's ok, just be brave and let's go see what it was".
When they got to the ranch, they saw that it was just a big windy storm.
Jake felt better, and he was no longer scared.




Mia looked out of the window and saw a big jeep park in the driveway of her house. She was so excited to see it! Mia ran outside to take a closer look. She saw a man and a woman getting out of the jeep.
Mia felt helpless when the man and the woman did not look at her or acknowledge her presence. She did not know why they were here. But then she heard the man and woman laughing, so she decided to be brave and went up to them.
She asked them why they were here and the woman said, "We've come to take you for a ride in our jeep!" Mia was so happy and excited! She quickly grabbed her bag, said goodbye to her mom and hopped into the back seat of the jeep.
The man and woman smiled at Mia as they drove off in the jeep. Mia had the best time of her life and when it was time to go home moments later she was so sad. She waved goodbye to her new friends as they drove away in the jeep, promising to meet them again soon.




Once upon a time, there was a bird who wanted to fly to a faraway place. He asked his friend, an elephant, for help. The elephant said, "You must get a passport first." The bird was sad, for he did not have a passport.
Suddenly, an idea popped into the bird's head. He asked the elephant for their passport instead. The elephant thought this was a foolish idea, and told the bird, "no way!" But still the bird asked, "Please, just lend it to me for a day?" 
The kind-hearted elephant wouldn't give in. The bird tried to change the elephant's mind, but still, the elephant said "no". Then, the bird felt a sudden drop in his heart.
But suddenly, the elephant agreed. The elephant said, "Just this once", and gave the bird the passport. The bird was so excited. With the passport in hand, he could finally fly to a faraway place. 
He thanked his friend, gave him a big hug and took off. As the bird flew away, all he could think was, "I'm going to see the world!"



 There was a figure in the window. It was tall and dark and it made Alexis shiver. She looked out of her window and saw it there. She tried to run away but the figure was too fast. 
Alexis couldn't believe her eyes. She wanted to scream but she couldn't. The figure was coming closer and the feeling of fear was all around her. 
The figure stepped closer and Alexis could smell something smelly. The figure was close enough now that she could see it was a scary witch. Alexis screamed and ran away as fast as she could. 
She ran to her room and closed the door. Now she was safe from the smelly witch. Finally, all the shivering stopped and Alexis felt safe again.



 
Once there was a fine little girl named Sarah. She loved to look at her model of a boat. She adored it, and loved to run her hands along it. 
One day, Sarah wanted to take her model boat outside and play with it. She asked her mom if she could, and her mom said yes.
So Sarah went outside with her model boat, and suddenly she saw a big puddle of water! She went closer and saw that it was getting bigger and bigger by the second.
Sarah knew that if the boat got in the water it would get ruined! So she quickly reached down and grabbed it. She then looked around for something to dry it off. 
Suddenly she found a towel nearby. She picked it up, and started to dry her model boat. Finally, once she was done, Sarah brought the boat back inside and put it in a safe place. 
Now Sarah was very happy, because her model boat stayed safe, and it was nice and dry!



Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a daddy who wanted to create something fun and special. So they decided to make a holiday!
They got out their pretty colors and made a bright sign. They decorated the whole house with balloons and painted some fun pictures. Then, they made a big cake and went to the store to get some treats. 
When the special day arrived, everybody was so happy! They all put on their best clothes and had a big party. They played some games, laughed and enjoyed each other's company. 
At the end of the day, they were all so comfortable and cozy. They hugged each other and said, "This was the best holiday ever!"



Once upon a time there was a man who sang every day. He sang while driving to the harbor in his car. He sang as he went up the tall hill to the harbor. Once he reached the top of the hill, he stopped his car and looked out at the harbor.
The day was bright and the water was blue. He could even see the boats in the harbor. He opened his car window and started singing his favorite song. The sound echoed over the harbor and it sounded very high.
The harbor birds joined in and flew around in the sky. They sang with the man and created a beautiful melody. The man smiled and sang louder and louder. He sang until the sun was setting behind the harbor.



Once upon a time there was a dark goat. It lived in a forest far away. One night, the dark goat went to sleep on a big, green hill.
Suddenly, a wolf came out of the shadows. He had a big sack in his mouth. The wolf growled and opened the sack. He wanted to put the dark goat in the sack.
The dark goat was so scared! He ran away as fast as he could. The wolf chased the dark goat, but the dark goat was too fast.
The dark goat ran until he reached his home. The sack was far behind. The dark goat was happy and safe!



JOHN was a happy boy. He had a notebook and he liked to draw in it.
He was playing in the park one day, looking for something to catch. He saw a smooth stone in the grass and he ran over to pick it up.
John held the stone in his hand, it felt so smooth. He put it in his notebook.
John smiled and continued to look for something else to catch. Soon he found a pretty butterfly. He ran up and tried to catch it but it flew away. John laughed and ran around the park, looking for more things to catch.
The day ended and John went home happy. He opened up his notebook and looked at the smooth stone he had found. He was glad he could catch a piece of the park and keep it forever.



Once upon a time there was a mighty bear who believed in magic. Every night he would sit by the television and his mighty friends would come alive! 
He believed that he could make anything happen if he just wished hard enough. So he wished for all his toys to come to life, and they did! One night, a tiny toy car came out of the television and it began to drive away. 
The bear decided to follow it and so he went on a great adventure. He went to the far side of the world and he even flew on the back of a giant bird! Everywhere he went, he saw wonderful things and he made lots of new friends. 
Though his journey lasted for only one night, the bear was so happy he believed he could fly like the other animals. He had an amazing time and he never forgot the magic he felt that night.




Once upon a time, there was a little puppy. Her name was Bella. Bella was very happy. She liked to play and run. Every day she would grow bigger and bigger.
One day, Bella became very ill. Her mommy worried a lot. She took Bella to the vet. There she met the veterinarian. The vet was very busy, but he was nice.
Bella saw lots of animals in the vet's office. There were cats, bunnies, and even a turtle! They were all very sick, and the vet was taking care of them. 
Bella was scared, but the vet was gentle and he made her feel better. He gave her medicine and special food, and she slowly began to feel better. 
The vet visited Bella a few times and each time she got healthier. Finally, she was totally better! Bella was so happy that she could run and play again.
The vet had done a great job and Bella's mom was very thankful. He had taken care of her, and Bella was able to grow up and stay happy and healthy.




Once there was a small girl called Lucy. She lived on a farm with her family and they loved to make jam together. Lucy always helped her family make jam and she loved it.
One day, a big storm came to the farm. It was so strong that it destroyed the jam. Lucy was very sad and she felt helpless.
But then, an idea came to Lucy. She wanted to make more jam, so she asked for help from her family. She worked really hard and eventually, she was able to make a new jar of jam.
Lucy was so happy and she had a big smile on her face. With the help of her family, she had destroyed the storm and made jam again.
