After a while, Timmy's dad came to see how he was doing. He was happy to see that Timmy was helping him. Timmy was proud of himself because he knew that he did a good job. From that day on, Timmy made sure to keep the garage clear so that his dad could park the car inside.



Once upon a time, there was a little mouse named Timmy. Timmy lived in a big house with lots of rooms and lots of cheese. One day, Timmy saw a match on the ground and he wanted to play with it. But his mommy told him matches are dangerous and he shouldn't touch them. Timmy thought it was stupid, but he listened to his mommy and walked away.
Later that day, Timmy was playing in the kitchen when he saw a big cat coming towards him. He knew he had to escape, so he ran as fast as he could. He ran through the living room, up the stairs and into his bedroom. The cat followed him, but Timmy was too quick and he escaped through a little hole in the wall. 
Timmy was so happy he escaped from the cat, but he knew he had to be careful and listen to his mommy. He never played with matches again and he stayed safe from the big cat. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a clock in her room that she loved to watch tick-tock. One day, Lily's mommy gave her a present. It was a box with something interesting inside. Lily opened the box and found a shiny necklace. She put it on and showed it to her mommy. 
Later that day, Lily went outside to play in the garden. She found a spot where the dirt was soft and easy to dig. She decided to bury her necklace in the ground so that she could find it again later. She dug a hole with her hands and carefully placed the necklace inside. Then she covered it with dirt and patted it down. 
Days went by and Lily forgot where she buried her necklace. She looked and looked but couldn't find it. One day, while she was playing in the garden, she saw something shiny peeking out of the ground. She dug and dug until she found her necklace. She was so happy and showed it to her mommy again. From that day on, Lily never forgot where she buried her special things.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures of her favorite animals, like bunnies and puppies. One day, Lily's mom said, "Lily, let's organize your drawings so we can find them easily." 
Lily asked, "What does organize mean?" 
"It means we can put all your bunny drawings together and all your puppy drawings together," her mom explained. 
Lily thought that was a great idea. She went to her room and brought out all her drawings. Her mom helped her sort them by animal, and then they put them in a big folder to keep them safe. 
After they finished organizing, Lily's mom said, "Let's print a picture of your favorite animal and put it on your wall." 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I love bunnies. They are so sweet!" 
So they printed a picture of a cute bunny and hung it on Lily's wall. Lily was so happy to see her organized drawings and her sweet bunny picture every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to climb trees in the park. One day, she climbed a tall tree and shouted, "Look how high I am!"
Suddenly, she heard silence. She looked down and saw that her mom was gone. She was scared and started to cry. "Mommy, where are you?" she shouted.
But then she heard a strong voice from below. It was her daddy! "I'm here, Lily. Don't worry, I'll help you down." And he did. From that day on, Lily always climbed trees with her daddy by her side.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the fields near her house. One day, she found a big bag of corn lying on the ground. She picked it up and took it home.
Her mommy cooked the corn for dinner that night. It was very mild and tasty. Lily smiled as she ate it all up. After dinner, she went to bed feeling very happy.
The next day, Lily woke up and went outside to play again. She saw a scarecrow in the field and decided to go say hello. As she got closer, she saw that the scarecrow was wearing the same shirt as her daddy! She smiled and ran back to the house to tell her mommy.
Later that day, her daddy came home and they all went outside to see the scarecrow. Lily's daddy was surprised to see his shirt on the scarecrow. He smiled and laughed, realizing that he must have left it in the field when he was helping with the corn harvest. From then on, they always checked the scarecrow for any lost items before leaving the field.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to travel with her family. One day, they went on a trip to a faraway place. Lily was very excited to see new things.
At night, Lily's mom lit a candle in their room. Lily watched the candle flicker and dance. She wanted to play with the candle, but her mom said no. Lily felt anxious because she really wanted to touch the candle.
The next morning, Lily woke up to a bad smell. The candle had fallen over and started a fire. Everyone had to leave the hotel and go home early. Lily learned that it's important to listen to her mom and not play with dangerous things like candles.



Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily was playing in the park. She was having so much fun on the swings and the slide. Suddenly, she saw a man with a big box. 
"Hello little girl, would you like to create something with me?" the man asked.
"Yes please!" Lily replied excitedly.
The man opened the box and took out some paper and paint. Together they started to create a beautiful fair angel. Lily was so happy with their creation and said, "Thank you for helping me make this pretty angel. I will keep it forever!" 
The man smiled and said, "It was my pleasure. Remember, you can create anything you want with your imagination." 
Lily thanked the man and ran home with her new fair angel. She couldn't wait to show her mom and dad what she had made. From that day on, Lily loved to create things and use her imagination to make the world a more beautiful place.



Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Betsy. Betsy loved to draw with pastels, but her room was always messy. Her mom told her to tidy up before she could draw.
Betsy started to clean up her room, but she was sad because she wanted to draw. Suddenly, her friend Sammy arrived. Sammy also loved to draw, but he had a big box of pastels that he shared with Betsy.
Betsy was happy to see Sammy, but she was also worried because her room was still messy. Sammy noticed and said, "Don't worry about your room, let's draw together!" Betsy was so excited and they drew beautiful pictures together. Betsy realized that sometimes it's okay to have a messy room as long as you have good friends to draw with.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, her mommy gave her an envelope to give to their neighbor. Lily was excited to help her mommy. She walked to their neighbor's house and knocked on the door. 
The neighbor opened the door and said, "Hello, Lily! How can I help you?" 
Lily handed her the envelope and said, "My mommy said to give this to you." 
The neighbor smiled and said, "Thank you, Lily. You are such a helpful girl. Is there anything you need help with?" 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I'm uncomfortable because my shoes are too tight." 
The neighbor said, "I care about you, Lily. Let's go inside and find you some more comfortable shoes." 
Lily was so happy that her neighbor cared about her. They went inside and found some soft and cozy slippers for Lily to wear. From that day on, Lily knew that she could always count on her neighbor to care for her.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved going on adventures in the jungle. One day, he went on a search for a rhinoceros. He looked high and low but couldn't find one.
Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. It was a careless hunter who was trying to catch the rhinoceros. Timmy knew he had to help. He bravely ran towards the hunter and scared him away.
The rhinoceros was grateful and thanked Timmy. From that day on, they became good friends and went on many more adventures together.



Once upon a time, there was a little gray mouse named Max. Max loved to play in the fields and eat cheese. One day, Max found a shiny jewel on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his friend, a little bird named Lily.
"Look, Lily! I found a pretty jewel!" Max said.
Lily flew down to take a closer look. "Wow, Max! That jewel is beautiful!" she said.
Max was so happy that he wanted to bite the jewel to see if it was real. But Lily stopped him. "Don't bite it, Max! You might break it," she warned.
Max listened to his friend and decided to keep the jewel safe in his little mouse hole. From that day on, Max and Lily would visit the jewel every day and admire its shiny beauty.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to take pictures with his camera. He took pictures of flowers, animals, and his family. One day, Timmy wanted to test his camera to see if it could take pictures in the dark.
Timmy went outside at night and tried to take pictures. He couldn't see anything, so he used a flashlight to help him. But when he looked at the pictures, they were all black. Timmy felt foolish for thinking the camera could take pictures in the dark.
Feeling sad, Timmy went back inside and went to bed. But during the night, he heard a loud noise outside. He looked out the window and saw a thief trying to steal his camera! Timmy ran outside to stop the thief, but the thief had a gun. Timmy was scared and didn't know what to do. The thief shot Timmy and took the camera. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a big bridge over a river. Many cars and trucks would go over it every day. One day, a little duck wanted to cross the river but she couldn't fly. She saw the bridge and thought it was her chance to get to the other side. 
As she walked on the bridge, she saw a big truck coming towards her. The duck was scared and didn't know what to do. But the truck driver saw the duck and yielded to let her pass. The duck was so happy and successful in crossing the bridge. 
From that day on, the duck knew that the bridge was a safe place to cross the river and she would always remember the kind truck driver who yielded to her. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a princess who wore a long veil on her head. She loved her veil very much because it made her feel like a real princess. One day, while she was playing in the garden, she heard a loud ring. 
"Who could that be?" she wondered. She went to answer the door and found a little bird who had hurt its wing. The bird asked the princess for help.
The princess was happy to help and took the little bird to her room. She took off her veil and used it to wrap the bird's wing. But when the bird was all better, it wouldn't give the princess back her veil!
The princess was upset and said, "Please give me back my veil. It's very important to me." The bird replied, "I'm sorry, but I need it to make a nest for my babies." The princess thought for a moment and said, "Okay, you can keep my veil, but can I come visit your babies sometime?" The bird happily agreed, and the princess went back to playing in the garden, feeling happy that she had helped someone in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toy soldiers and make them march around. One day, he saw his mom ironing his clothes. "What are you doing?" he asked. "I'm ironing your clothes so they look nice and neat," said his mom.
Timmy continued to play with his toy soldiers until his sister came in and knocked them over. "That was rude!" he said to his sister. "I'm sorry," she replied. "Let's play together nicely." They decided to make the soldiers march together and have a parade. 
As they marched around the room, Timmy noticed his mom watching them with a smile. "Mom, do you like our parade?" he asked. "I love it," she said. "You're both being so kind and having fun together." Timmy felt happy and proud that he made his mom happy. From that day on, he always tried to be kind to his sister and make his toy soldiers march in a friendly way.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to eat celery. She would eat celery every day for lunch and snack time. One day, Lily's mom asked her if she wanted to help prepare dinner. Lily was so excited and said, "Yes, mommy! What can I do?"
Her mom gave her a big bowl of celery and asked her to wash it. Lily was very persistent and made sure every piece of celery was clean. "Good job, Lily!" her mom said. "Now we can chop it up and put it in the salad."
Lily was so proud of herself for helping prepare dinner. When they sat down to eat, Lily took a big bite of the salad and said, "Mmm, this is so yummy! I love celery!" Her mom smiled and said, "I'm so glad you helped me prepare the celery. It tastes even better when we make it together."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to travel with her family. One day, they went to the airport to go on a trip. Lily's mom had a thick luggage with her.
Lily saw a big screen that displays the flights. She pointed to it and asked her mom, "Mommy, what is that?" Her mom replied, "That's a display, it shows the flights and their times."
As they were waiting for their flight, Lily saw a little boy crying. She went up to him and asked, "Why are you crying?" The little boy replied, "I lost my teddy bear." Lily felt sad for the little boy and decided to help him. She took out a stuffed animal from her mom's luggage and gave it to the little boy. The little boy was so happy and thanked Lily.
The moral of the story is to always be kind and helpful to others, even if it means giving away something of your own.



Once upon a time, there was a deer. The deer was very lonely because it had no friends to play with. One day, the deer closed its eyes and started to imagine having lots of friends to play with. It imagined running and jumping with its new friends in the forest. Suddenly, the deer heard a rustling sound in the bushes. It opened its eyes and saw a group of friendly rabbits hopping towards it. The deer was overjoyed and it played with the rabbits all day long. From that day on, the deer was never lonely again because it had lots of new friends to play with.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and pick flowers. One day, she found a beautiful lily in the garden. She picked it and brought it inside to show her mom.
"Look, Mommy! I found a pretty lily!" Lily said.
"That's lovely, dear. Why don't we paint a picture of it together?" her mom suggested.
Lily was excited to paint with her mom. They got out the paint and brushes and started to paint the lily. Lily was having so much fun, she didn't even notice how comfortable she was sitting next to her mom.
After they finished the painting, Lily's mom hung it up on the wall. Every time Lily looked at it, she remembered the fun she had painting with her mom. From then on, every time they saw a lily, they would smile and remember their special painting day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw and color with her blue pencil. One day, Lily was drawing a picture when her friend Timmy came over to play.
"Can I use your blue pencil, Lily?" Timmy asked.
Lily thought for a moment and then said, "I want to share my pencil with you, but please be careful with it."
Timmy was very happy and started to draw with the blue pencil. But then, he accidentally broke it. Lily was sad because it was her favorite pencil.
Timmy said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to break your pencil."
Lily forgave Timmy and said, "It's okay. We can share my other pencils. But we need to be careful with them, okay?"
The moral of the story is that sharing is good, but we also need to take care of our things and be responsible.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very excited to go on a trip with her family. They were going to stay in a hotel by the beach. 
When they arrived at the hotel, Lily noticed that her little brother, Max, looked very pale. She asked him if he was feeling okay. Max said he didn't feel well and wanted to go home. 
Lily's parents were worried and didn't know what to do. They decided to take Max to the doctor. The doctor said Max had a fever and needed to rest. 
Lily was sad that they couldn't stay in the hotel and play on the beach, but she was happy that Max would feel better soon. She told him, "Don't worry Max, we'll come back to the hotel another time when you feel better and we'll have lots of fun!"



Once upon a time, there was a happy little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop and play in the meadow with his friends. One day, while hopping around, Benny fell into a hole. He was scared and didn't know what to do.
His friends heard him crying and came to help. They saw Benny in the hole and started to applaud him for being brave. They knew he was scared, but he didn't give up. Together, they pulled him out of the hole and everyone was happy again.
From that day on, Benny learned that even when things get tough, he can always count on his friends to help him. And they knew that Benny was a brave bunny who deserved a round of applause. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a kind dog named Max. Max loved to play with his ball and go for walks with his owner. One day, Max saw a tiny bird with a broken wing. The bird was very patient and waited for Max to come closer.
Max knew he had to protect the bird from other animals who might want to hurt it. So, Max stayed with the bird until it was strong enough to fly again. Max was happy to help the bird, even though he knew the bird was ignorant and didn't understand how to stay safe from danger.
In the end, the bird flew away and Max felt proud of himself for being a good protector. From that day on, Max knew that it was important to help others who were in need, even if they didn't know how to keep themselves safe.



Once upon a time, there was a chubby bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots and play in the fields. One day, Benny saw a beautiful flower and wanted to pick it. But his mommy told him that he shouldn't pick the flower because it was not nice to take things that didn't belong to him.
Benny didn't listen to his mommy and picked the flower anyway. Later that day, Benny's friend asked him where the flower came from. Benny felt sad and realized that he had made a mistake. He missed the flower and wished he could put it back where it belonged.
Benny learned that it was important to listen to his mommy and not take things that didn't belong to him. From that day on, he promised to be a good bunny and never take anything without permission.



Once upon a time, there was a small ant. The ant lived in a small hole in the ground. One day, the ant wanted to go for a walk. So, the ant came out of the hole and walked around. The ant saw a big tree and decided to climb it. When the ant got to the top of the tree, it saw a person. The person saw the ant too and waved hello. The ant waved back and felt happy. Then, the ant climbed back down the tree and went back to its small hole in the ground.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very adventurous and loved to explore new places. One day, Tim went on a walk with his mom. It was very hot outside and the heat made Tim feel tired. But he remained strong and kept walking.
As they walked, Tim saw a big tree with lots of branches. He wanted to climb it and see what was at the top. His mom said it was too dangerous, but Tim was very adventurous and wanted to try. He climbed and climbed until he reached the top.
From up there, Tim could see the whole town! He felt very proud of himself for being so brave. But then, he realized it was getting late and he needed to go home. So, he climbed back down and went home with his mom. Tim was tired but happy, knowing he had been on an exciting adventure.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play by the river. She liked to watch the water flow and listen to the birds sing. One day, Lily's mommy asked her if she wanted to go on a boat ride down the river. Lily was very excited and said yes.
But mommy wanted to make sure they were safe on the boat, so she asked her friend who knows a lot about boats to recommend a reliable one. Her friend said she knew just the right boat and they set off down the river. Lily had so much fun waving at the ducks and feeling the wind in her hair. She was so happy mommy found a reliable boat.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the bathtub and splash water all around. One day, she turned the faucet on and water started to flow. But when she tried to turn it off, it wouldn't stop. She called out to her mommy, "Mommy, the water won't stop!"
Mommy came running and saw the faucet was broken. She said, "Don't worry, Lily. We can fix it." Mommy found a flexible hose and used it to stop the water from flowing. Then she turned the faucet off and said, "All done!"
Lily was happy that the water stopped, but she was sad that she couldn't play in the bathtub anymore. So, mommy said, "Let's make a game out of it. We can seat your toys on the edge of the tub and pretend they're on a boat in the water." Lily loved the idea and they played together until it was time for bed.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, she was playing with her dolls when she heard a fierce noise outside. She went to the window and saw a big truck driving by.
Lily asked her mommy, "What is that noise?" Her mommy said, "That's a truck, Lily. It's carrying things from one place to another." Lily listened and heard the sound of the truck getting quieter as it drove away.
Later that day, Lily was playing with her mommy's nail polish. She accidentally spilled it on the carpet. Her mommy said, "Oh no, Lily! You spilled the nail polish. We need to clean it up." Lily helped her mommy clean the nail polish off the carpet.
As they were cleaning, Lily asked her mommy, "What does fierce mean?" Her mommy said, "Fierce means something that is very strong and powerful. Like a lion is fierce." Lily listened and learned a new word.



Once upon a time, there was a big boat. The boat had a big anchor to help it stay in one place. One day, the boat went out to sea with some friends. But when they got far from the shore, the sky turned dark and the waves got big. The boat was moving a lot and the friends were scared.
One friend said, "I wish we had something to help us stay safe." Another friend said, "I can supply a clear plan! We can use the anchor to keep us in one place until the storm stops." The other friends thought this was a good idea. They quickly got the anchor and threw it into the water. The anchor helped the boat stay in one place, and the friends were safe until the storm passed.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved dinosaurs. He had a long green toy dinosaur that he carried everywhere. One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his dinosaur.
At the park, Timmy met a little girl named Sarah. Sarah had a toy dinosaur too. Timmy and Sarah played together and had fun. Sarah said to Timmy, "I like your long dinosaur." Timmy replied, "Thank you, I like your dinosaur too."
They played together for a long time, until it was time to go home. Timmy and Sarah said goodbye and promised to play together again soon. Timmy was happy to have made a new friend who loved dinosaurs just like him.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys and run around outside. One day, Timmy's dad was using a saw to cut some wood. Timmy wanted to help, but his dad said he was too little to use the saw.
Timmy felt sad, but then he saw his helpful dog, Spot. Spot loved to play fetch and run around with Timmy. Timmy threw a ball and Spot ran to get it. But when Spot brought the ball back, he accidentally knocked over the saw. The saw fell on Timmy's dad and hurt him badly.
Timmy's dad had to go to the hospital and Timmy felt very scared. He wished he could stand up and make everything better. But he was just a little boy and didn't know what to do. In the end, Timmy's dad was okay, but Timmy learned to always be careful around dangerous tools like saws.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved the color purple and had a toy mine that she played with every day. One day, Lily's friend Sarah came to play with her. Sarah also liked the color purple and wanted to play with Lily's toy mine.
Lily said, "No, that's mine. I don't want to share it."
Sarah felt sad and said, "But I want to play with it too."
Lily thought for a moment and then said, "I have a plan. Let's take turns playing with it. You can play with it first, and then I'll play with it."
Sarah smiled and said, "That's a great plan!" 
Lily and Sarah took turns playing with the toy mine and had a lot of fun together. They learned that sharing is important and makes everyone happy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the grass and feel the sun on her face. One day, she was walking in the park when she saw a big dog. 
"Hello, big dog," said Lily.
"Hello, little girl," said the dog. "What are you doing?"
"I'm playing outside," said Lily. "Do you want to play with me?"
The dog wagged his tail and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you. But be careful, my paws are strong and I don't want to hurt you."
Lily smiled and said, "Don't worry, I'm strong too." They played together for a while until the dog surprised Lily by giving her a big lick on her face. Lily laughed and said, "You're silly, big dog!" They continued to play together and had lots of fun on the ground.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had long hair that she loved to brush every day. One day, Lily's mom suggested that they try a new hairstyle. "Let's braid your hair!" said Lily's mom. 
Lily thought it sounded like a difficult task, but she was willing to try. "Okay, I will sit still," said Lily. Her mom started to braid her hair and it was a bit tricky at first, but they worked together and soon it was done. 
Lily looked in the mirror and saw her new hairstyle. "Wow, I love it!" she exclaimed. Her mom smiled and said, "I'm glad you like it. You look so pretty!" From that day on, Lily loved trying new hairstyles with her mom and it was always so much fun.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to spin around and around in circles until she was dizzy. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. 
Lily's friend, Timmy, was having trouble finding his toy car. "I can't find my car. It's lost!" he said. 
Lily had an idea. "Let's all look for it together. If we work together, we can find it faster," she said. 
So, they organized themselves and searched the playground. After a few minutes, Lily found the car under a bush. "I found it!" she said. 
Timmy was so happy and gave Lily a big hug. "Thank you for helping me find my car. You bring peace to my heart," he said. 
Lily smiled and felt happy too. She loved helping her friends and making them feel peaceful. And of course, she couldn't wait to spin around again!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her toy animals. One day, she was playing with her toy gorilla when she saw a real gorilla on TV. "Wow, that gorilla is big!" she said to her mom. 
Later that day, Lily and her family went to the zoo. As they walked past the gorilla exhibit, Lily saw the same gorilla she saw on TV. "Look, Mommy! It's the big gorilla!" she said excitedly. 
But as they watched the gorilla, Lily noticed something was wrong. The gorilla looked miserable and sad. "Why is he so sad, Mommy?" she asked. 
Her mom explained that the gorilla was lonely because he didn't have any other gorillas to play with. That's when Lily had an idea. She went back to her toy box and found her toy gorilla. "Maybe this will help," she said. 
They brought the toy gorilla to the zoo and placed it in the gorilla exhibit. The real gorilla saw the toy and picked it up, hugging it close. Lily smiled and said, "They match!" and the gorilla looked less miserable. From that day on, the gorilla had a friend to play with and Lily knew she had made a difference.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a pretty yellow dress with lots of buttons. She liked to wear it because it felt very tight around her.
One day, Amy decided to go for a walk. She ran down the street and across the park. It was so much fun! She was laughing and playing along the way.
Finally, she reached a big hill at the end of the park. Amy walked up to the top of the hill. When she got there, she saw a huge button right in front of her! It was bigger than any button she had ever seen before.
She reached out and pressed the button. Suddenly, everything around her started to move! The hill began to get tighter and tighter, like it was squeezing her!
Amy was so scared! But just when she thought she couldn't take it anymore, the tightness around her loosened up and she was able to take a big breath of fresh air.
Amy was so relieved  and she learned a valuable lesson about being careful when playing around a big hill!



Once upon a time there was a clever bird. The bird liked to whistle at the top of a tall olive tree. She was so proud of her skills that she boasted about it all the time.
But one day, the bird mixed her words, even though she was so clever. She said she could whistle better than anyone else.
An older, wiser bird from another tree heard what she said. He laughed and explained that he, too, could whistle.
The younger bird was embarrassed and challenged the older bird to a whistle-off at the top of the olive tree. The older bird accepted the challenge and both birds flew to the top of the tree.
But soon the younger bird realized that her challenge was too much for her. She had bitten off more than she could chew. The older bird showed off his expert whistling, while the younger bird's was barely passable. 
The moral of the story is: don't compete with others and overestimate your abilities. It can lead to a bad ending.




Once upon a time there was a girl. She was three years old and wanted to do something. Her goal was to perform. She thought it would be tough.
One day she decided it was time to practice. She looked around for something special to do. She found a big box of blocks. She took out some blocks and began to stack them up. She worked very hard and was so proud of herself.
But then the big tower of blocks toppled over! She let out a big sigh and wanted to give up. But she was tough and tried again. She kept trying one more time and finally the tower stayed up!
She had accomplished her goal. She had performed and she was so proud!



Once upon a time, there was a boy. He was very sad because his toy was broken. The toy, a truck, was a wreck now. So he decided to sit in a nearby chair and think.
Then, he had an idea. He found a jar and opened it. He saw some sour berries inside! He put the berries in the truck's broken pieces and it started to work again!
The boy was so happy that he jumped up, whooping with joy! He picked up his toy and brought it to the playground. He sat in the sandbox and showed it to all his friends.
The truck was like new. His friends were impressed and the boy was so proud. He had fixed the wreck all by himself!
The End.




Once upon a time, a strong chest sat in a room. Inside the chest was an important letter that needed to be mailed. 
A little boy wanted to help. He opened the chest, looked at the letter, and said, "I can mail it for you!" 
But his mom told him, "No! It's too important. You can't mail it. You're too small. It's too big a job for you. You might make a mistake."
The little boy was sad. He wanted to help out. He thought hard and came up with a plan. 
He said to his Mom, "I will make sure it's right. I'm strong now. I can do it!"
His Mom saw how strong the little boy had become, and finally said, "Okay, you can try."
The little boy was so excited. He carefully put the letter in the mailbox, and it was on its way. He felt proud of himself for being so strong and capable.




Once upon a time there was an old man. He had a big stick and was walking along a path. At the end of the path there was a big, deep puddle. The old man could see his reflection in the puddle. He wanted to make it look shiny. So he rubbed his stick against the surface of the puddle. He rubbed, and rubbed, and rubbed until his stick was wet and the puddle was sparkling! When he was done, he looked at his reflection again. He smiled and was very pleased. Then, the old man continued walking along the path.




Once upon a time, there was a young girl called Abigail. She was very curious and loved to explore the world around her.
One day, she went to the park and saw a tall tree with lots of big, green leaves. She wondered what it would be like to climb up it.
She stretched up to touch the first branch but she couldn't quite reach it. Then she had an idea. She looked around and saw an arrow laying nearby.
"What a good idea!" she said as she picked it up. She held the arrow between the branch and herself and pushed. It was flexible, just like she had hoped.
She gave it a few more tries and then she was able to pull the branch down low enough to climb! Abigail was so excited at her success and she was ready to explore the rest of the tree.




Once upon a time there was a wealthy boy. He was very mean and loved to tease the other children. One day, he was playing with a shiny pin. He went to the park to find someone to tease.
He soon found a little girl, who was only three. The boy thought it would be fun to tease her with the pin. He showed the girl the pin, and she was so excited. She started to laugh and smile.
But then, the wealthy boy teasing her with the pin got too close. He accidentally poked the little girl with the pin! Ouch! The girl started to cry. She had never felt such pain.
The wealthy boy was scared. He ran away from the park, leaving the little girl all alone. He did not apologize or even look back. 
The little girl was so sad and scared. She had never been teased like that before. She never wanted to see the wealthy boy again. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a daddy who wanted to go to the market. So, one day, they put on their shoes, got in the car and drove away.
When they got to the market, it was very gloomy. The mommy and daddy looked around and saw lots of people using money to buy things. They bought some food and bought some toys.
When they were done, they put their bags in the car and got back in. But on the way home, the car started to make a noise.
Daddy stopped the car and looked at it. He used some tools and fixed the car so they could get home again. When they got home, they were so glad because they knew they could get back to the market soon!



One day, the farmer grabbed his pitchfork and started to walk out to the barn. He opened the doors of the barn and inside were two big, brown bulls. The farmer was so excited that he clapped his hands together. 
The farmer shouted, "Who wants to be first? To go for a walk in the meadow and see the flowers and the trees?" 
The two brown bulls stamped their feet and started to dance around. The farmer bounded into the pen with them and started to push them to the door. He said, "Come on now, let's go outside together."
The two bulls raced ahead and soon the farmer and the bulls were out in the fresh air. They started to trot and play around in the meadow. The farmer watched the bulls with a smile on his face, he was so excited to see them in the meadow enjoying the scenery. 
The farmer and the two brown bulls stayed in the meadow playing and running around until they were too tired to go on. As they trotted back to the barn, the farmer smiled thinking how excited the two bulls had been.




Once upon a time there was a boy. Every night he went to bed, but he did not want to go to bed. He wanted to stay up and play. His Mommy told him that he had to be obedient and go to bed. He always listened to Mommy, so he went to bed.
The boy was tired, so he went right to sleep. His Mommy wanted him to be healthy and strong, so she made sure to give him a drink before he went to bed. She gave him warm milk with honey. He liked the taste and drank it all up. 
The boy was always obedient and he liked drinking his milk before bed. He slept in his bed for 8 hours and then he woke up feeling happy and healthy. He was so glad that he was obedient and always made sure to drink his milk before bed.




Once upon a time, there was a careless bunny. It loved playing in the sunshine, jumping around and having fun.
One day, the bunny was out playing in the sun when he heard a sound. It was a snap! He looked around, but he couldn't see where it was coming from.
The bunny kept hopping and suddenly, he heard the snap again! This time, he looked up and saw a bird, holding a bright yellow seed in its beak. The bird had opened the seed with a snap!
The bunny hopped closer and the bird dropped the seed. The bunny was excited, ate the seed and hopped away.
The bunny stayed careful so he could hear more snaps when the bird came back. He wanted to get more seeds from the bird.
The bunny kept playing in the sun and sure enough, he heard the snap again! He was so happy.




Once upon a time there was a little boy who went to the river. He was so excited and he ran as fast as he could. When he arrived, he saw the water and it was shiny and blue. His eyes sparkled!
He took off his shoes and socks. Then he stepped into the water. It felt so cool and he giggled. He waved his arms and jumped up and down. Splash, splash, splash!
He looked at his thumb and saw that it was wrinkled. He was patient and waited until it was normal again, but he still had fun. He jumped and splashed and the water rippled around him.
When he was done, he gave the river a big hug and said goodbye. He put his socks and shoes back on and ran home. He had so much fun splashing his thumb in the river.




Once there was a boy called Peter, and he was very stubborn. He wouldn't listen to anyone, not even his parents. 
One day, Peter's mum said to him, "Listen Peter, it's time for you to put on your hat. It's very cold outside." But Peter didn't listen. 
Finally, after a lot of coaxing, Peter reluctantly agreed to put on his hat. He looked very grumpy in his hat, like he didn't want to be wearing it. 
But later that day, Peter was very glad that he was wearing his hat: it was snowing and the hat was keeping his head warm. He couldn't help but smile, and he promised himself that he would listen to his mum more often.




Once there were two friends, Tom and Jane. Tom wanted to buy a toy from the shop, so he asked Jane to come with him. When they arrived at the shop, Tom was very excited to look at all the toys. He saw a strong car he wanted, but he only had enough money for one toy.
Tom asked Jane for help to decide which toy to buy. Jane thought for a moment and then suggested the strong car. She said it was a great choice because the toy was very strong. Tom was very pleased with Jane's suggestion, so he requested the car from the shopkeeper. The shopkeeper happily gave him the car and it was the best toy Tom ever owned!




Once upon a time, there was a young girl who loved to explore the world. She was curious and always wanted to learn new things.
One day, the girl went to a mysterious forest. She wanted to find out what it was like. She started walking through the trees and soon noticed something strange. There were two animals - a turtle and a bee - sitting on a log.
The strange thing was that the bee was going very fast, but the turtle was not. The girl wanted to understand why.
The turtle smiled and said, "Sometimes it's important to take your time and enjoy the moment. I'm not in a rush. The bee is very fast, but that doesn't mean it has the most fun. I sit and enjoy the peacefulness around me. Speed isn't the only way to have a good time."
The girl understood the turtle's message and promised to take time to enjoy the moment. She learned an important lesson that day - life isn't about rushing, it's about savouring the moment.




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Bobbi. She was very excited, because today it was her birthday. She was wearing a pretty dress and a party hat.
Bobbi's friends came over to celebrate with her. They brought lots of presents and sweet treats for her. However, when the time came for her to blow out the candles on her cake, her father said no! His voice was harsh, and he said that Bobbi was too young.
Bobbi was sad, but she resisted. She wouldn't be able to live without blowing out the candles on her birthday. So she kept on trying, until her father finally said yes.
Everyone cheered when Bobbi made a wish and finally blew out the candles. It was a happy day, and Bobbi never wanted it to end!



Once upon a time there was a wide and adventurous forest. In the middle of the forest lived a little bear called Bob. Bob was always looking for new and exciting things to do. One day Bob heard a sound in the forest, it was a peculiar sound like something he had never heard before - it was the sound of music.
Bob tiptoed towards the music and saw a group of animals dancing in a big circle. He was curious so he asked one of them, "What are you doing?"
The animal answered, "We are dancing! Would you like to join us?"
Bob was excited and he jumped in the circle and began to dance too. They danced around in the magical forest and it made them feel so happy and adventurous!
That night Bob went to sleep with a big smile on his face. He knew that dancing was a wonderful way to spend his days and he was very happy that he was brave and adventurous enough to join the dance.




Once there was a lucky girl called Sarah. She was 3 years old and went to a special classroom. In the classroom there were lots of fun things for her to do.
One day, Sarah and her friends played games in the classroom. She was so pleased because she won every game! She was feeling very lucky.
Next, they drew pictures with crayons. Sarah was excited because she had lots of ideas. She drew beautiful flowers and sent them to her family at home.
Finally, she sang a song with her friends. Everyone was clapping and singing along with Sarah. They all said she was the best singer in the classroom!
At the end of the day, Sarah was very happy. She had had so much fun at her classroom and she was very lucky to be there.




Once there was a loyal little girl named Lilli. She loved to explore, and one day she decided to go find a treasure. She grabbed her favorite basket, filled with snacks and supplies, and off she went! 
When she got to the woods, she heard a strange sound. What was it? She slowly approached, and saw a large, mysterious box. Inside the box was something magical! It was a little blue bird. 
The bird was scared, so Lilli tried to calm it. She talked to it and offered it something to eat. Soon, the bird ate all the food in Lilli's basket. They became fast friends! 
Lilli was so happy to have made a new friend. She named the bird Treasure, because it was her most valuable treasure. From then on, Lilli and Treasure went everywhere together. They were the best of friends, loyal to the end!




Once there was a little girl. She was only three years old, but she had a huge diary. She carried it around wherever she went. One day, the little girl wanted to turn the pages of her diary. She placed her hands on the cover and slowly turned it. She was amazed as she saw how many pages were inside. She smiled and looked around. Everyone was looking at her and smiling. But then she had a thought. She wanted to turn the pages even more! She was so excited to read what was inside the diary. So she grabbed her diary and started to turn the pages quickly. She couldn't help but smile, because the diary was so huge. She kept turning and turning the pages until she found something she liked. That day was a very special day for the little girl and her huge diary.




Once upon a time, there was a small white bird. The bird wanted to go out and explore the world. 
Today was a special day and the bird wanted to suggest something to his friends. He said, "Let's go on an adventure! It will be fun!"
His friends were excited. They grabbed their coats and followed the white bird out the door.
They scampered through the woods and explored the valley. They were so busy they didn't notice the sun was setting. 
Suddenly, they heard the bird say, "Let's go home. It's too dark outside." His friends agreed and they all trotted back to their nest. 
The white bird had a big smile on his face. His plan for an adventure had been a success!




Once there was a caterpillar who wanted to measure things. He wanted to measure the flowers and the leaves, but no one would help him. He asked other caterpillars, but they just laughed and said he wouldn't understand measuring.
But the caterpillar didn't give up. He kept trying and he kept asking.
One day, a harsh voice said, "I'll help." It was a bird who had flown down to help him.
The caterpillar was so excited. He asked, "Really? Will you help me measure?" 
The bird said "You need something to measure with." The caterpillar thought for a moment and then he remembered one of his friends had a ruler. 
The caterpillar ran to get the ruler and soon the caterpillar and the bird were measuring everything together. The caterpillar was so happy! He had measured so many things and he was proud of what he had accomplished.



Once upon a time there was a small girl who loved puzzles. But the girl was not very good at solving them. One day the girl decided it was time to try and solve her latest puzzle. She stared at it for a long time and tried very hard but still couldn't figure it out.
Suddenly, a small bird landed on the window sill outside. The girl watched as the bird easily put the pieces of the puzzle together. She quickly opened the window to thank the bird, but it was already gone.
The girl learned an important lesson that day: if you can't do something on your own, it's ok to ask for help. Even if that help comes from a small bird!




John was a little boy. He was just three years old. He liked to act and pretend. One day, he saw a raven on his walk. It was easy to spot because it was huge and black.
John wanted to act like the raven. He wanted to be big and strong. So, he put his arms out like wings and pretended to fly. He ran around and made cawing noises. Soon, he was enjoying himself.
When he got home, his parents were very excited. They had a surprise for him: a little toy raven. John was so happy! He was so glad to have a little raven of his own. He ran around with it and made cawing noises just like before.
John had lots of fun when he acted like a raven. He was reminded that no matter how big and strong he felt, he was still only three years old. This would be a lesson John would remember for a long time.




Joey was standing outside the church, dreaming. He wanted to go inside, but he was too young. It was rare that kids were allowed inside.
Mama was walking towards him. "Do you want to come inside with me, Joey?"
"Yes, Mama!" Joey said excitedly.
She put her hand on his shoulder and said, "I'm sorry, sweetheart, but you can't come inside yet."
Joey hung his head and his little lip started to tremble. Mama cupped his chin and said, "I promise, soon you will be able to come in."
The weeks went by and soon it was time for Joey's fourth birthday. As a special gift, Mama took him to the church. Joey was filled with joy - he was finally able to go inside.
"See, I told you that you would be able to come in," Mama said with a smile.
Joey looked around the big room and smiled. He had been dreaming of this moment for a long time. Mama was right - dreams do come true, even if they seem rare.




Today Mommy had a great idea. She suggested that they should play a game. So they all went outside to play. 
The first game they played was hide and seek. Mommy hid behind a big tree and shouted 'Ready or not, here I come!' They all laughed and had lots of fun. 
Then Mommy suggested something new. She said 'Let's play tag.' They all ran around, laughing and shouting. Everyone was so fast, it was hard to catch them! 
But then Mommy saw something ugly. It was a big spider! She quickly suggested that they should do something else. So they all decided to play hopscotch instead. 
Everyone hopped around the yard for ages and had lots of fun. That was a great game, and it was good that Mama had a suggestion.



Once upon a time there was a foolish puppy. This silly puppy was always asking silly questions. One day, he asked a three year old boy how to swim. The boy said, "I don't know how to swim either."
The puppy didn't give up. He asked a fisherman. The fisherman said to the puppy, "It's easy! Put your paws in the water and move them around."
The puppy tried his best, but he just kept sinking! The fisherman smiled at the foolish puppy and said, "Maybe a boat will help you."
The puppy thanked the fisherman and jumped in a little boat. He paddled around the lake until he was splashing and swimming just like a big fish. 
The three year old boy watched the puppy swimming and said, "Wow! Now I know how to swim too!" 
The silly puppy was so happy he had been able to help the three year old boy. He barked with joy and swam back to the shore.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One morning, as Lily was playing outside, the sun began to rise. She looked up and said "Look! The sun is rising in the sky!" As the sun rose, the weather got cooler and cooler. 
Then Lily's mom came out and said "Lily, it's time for breakfast." 
Lily replied, "Mommy, can I stay out just a little bit longer? The weather is so cool and I really want to keep playing."
Mom smiled and said, Okay, but just a few more minutes. Then you have to come in.
So, Lily continued to play while the sun rose higher and higher. She enjoyed the cool morning and loved the sight of the bright sunshine.
When Lily's mom saw the sun was high in the sky, she said Lily, it's time for breakfast now. Come inside and we'll have pancakes.
Lily was so excited that she quickly ran inside. She had a wonderful time playing in the cool, sunny morning, and even better time eating pancakes!




Once upon a time there was a foot. It belonged to a little boy. Everyday, the boy would zoom around on his foot. Everyone thought it was so polite of him. But one day, his foot went too fast. He zoomed across the garden, through the park and around the pond. His foot was going so fast that it was almost magic. Suddenly it stopped. The little boy was out of breath. He opened his eyes and saw a rainbow and a butterfly. He smiled at all the beautiful colours around him. After that, the boy zoomed around the garden, park and pond in a very polite way. He was careful this time and smiled the whole time. He had learned that sometimes you need to slow down and appreciate the world around you. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lizzie. She went out for a walk in the woods one day. She looked up in the sky and saw a beautiful raven. She wondered why the raven was there. 
Lizzie continued walking and soon heard some noises in the trees. She was starting to feel a little scared, but she was brave and decided to go and take a look. As she walked closer, she saw a big black raven. It was calm and still looking at her. Lizzie was so scared she wanted to run away. 
Suddenly, the raven flew down from its perch in the tree and attacked Lizzie. Lizzie screamed and ran away. She ran as fast as she could until she was safe. She was so scared and scared of the raven she never went near the woods again. 
The raven screeched behind her, and the bad memory always stayed in her mind.




One day, a boy and his sister went out to the park. They were so excited because they had never been to the park before. Suddenly, they spotted something that looked interesting. It was a big, bright slide. 
The boy's sister said "Let's go down the slide first!" He nodded and ran towards the slide. He went down it and shouted "This is so fun!"
On the other side, his sister wanted to do something else. She saw a large, boring sandpit nearby. She said "Let's go and make something in the sandpit." 
So, the brother and his sister ran towards the sandpit. They put their hands together and started building different shapes in the sand. They finished building animals, castles and all sorts of structures. They had so much fun!
They looked at the completed sandpit and were very proud. "We did a great job!" said the brother. His sister smiled and said "Now let's go do something else!"



Once upon a time there was a girl called Anna who lived in a small village. She was troubled and very lonely. The only thing she had was a little box with a tiny thread in it, which had been given to her by her mother.
One day, Anna went to the river to get some water. But when she looked inside her box, she saw the thread had melted away. She started to cry, feeling more lonely and troubled than ever.
That night, Anna went to sleep and dreamed of playing with the thread. But when morning came, she was still alone and still troubled.
The end.




Once upon a time there were two friends, Anna and Jake. They were playing in the garden. Jake saw a bush and said "Let's shake it!" Anna shook it and suddenly a face peeked out. It scared them because it was so unexpected.
The face asked "What do you want?" in a very loud voice.
"We want to play!" Jake said.
But the face just shook its head and said "No! I can't hear you. I'm deaf." They were very confused so Anna asked what their friend meant. The face explained that it was deaf and couldn't hear them.
The friends were sad that they couldn't play with the face. Anna took out a piece of paper and a pen and she wrote "Please play with us". The face smiled and nodded its head. 
They all played together and had a wonderful time. Anna and Jake finally understood that it wasn't easy to communicate with someone who is deaf. They decided to stay friends with the face forever.



Alice was a young girl living at home with her mom and dad. Every day, her mom and dad went to the university to learn and study. Alice loved watching them, but she couldn't go with them. One day, her mom and dad told her that when she grew up and was big enough, she could go to the university too!
Alice was excited and she asked many questions to learn more about college. Her mom explained that university was a fun place to learn and make new friends. She said that it wouldn't be easy, but with hard work, Alice would return home successful.
Alice soon forgot about university until one day her mom and dad both graduated. They had worked so hard and were now ready to celebrate their success. Alice was happy but she started to think about the future and wondered if one day she would return to university too.
Alice was not sure if the university would be easy, but she was determined to work hard. She knew if she stayed focused, she would be able to return just like her mom and dad.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Laure who had a very big brain. Laure was very selfish because she didn't want to share her things with her best friend, Chloe. She kept all of her toys for herself, even when Chloe asked her nicely.
One day, Laure and Chloe were playing a game, but Laure wouldn't let Chloe win. Chloe felt so sad that she started to cry. Laure felt bad for being so selfish, so she hugged Chloe and promised to share her things with her.
Chloe stopped crying, but Laure started to weep because she was so sorry for hurting her friend. Chloe gave Laure a big hug and said it was okay, and they hugged until they both felt much better. 
From then on, Laure promised that she would never be selfish again, and both girls could play together forever.




Jimmy was walking through the wide, open field. Suddenly, he heard a sound behind him. He shivered and quickly looked back. He saw a big, scary bear! Jimmy quickly turned around to run. The bear was roaring as it chased after him.
Jimmy ran as fast as he could, but the bear was much bigger and faster than him. Just as the bear was about to catch him, Jimmy saw a big tree with a hole in it. He quickly ran and jumped into the hole.
Jimmy scrambled to the back of the hole, feeling very scared and alone. Then he heard the bear passing by outside. He finally felt safe. After the bear had gone, Jimmy opened the hole and stepped outside.
He looked around the wide field, thankful that he was safe. Then, he quickly ran all the way home to his mom. Jimmy never wanted to go back there again!




One day, Jack was having a picnic with his family in the park. His mum and dad were happy, but Jack was sad. He had a sore tummy and was suffering.
"What's wrong, Jack?" his dad asked.
"I feel really sick," Jack replied.
So, his mum filled a cup with some medicine and passed it to Jack.
"Come on, Jack. Drink up," she said.
Jack was not happy to take the medicine but he knew it would make him feel better soon.
The park was very noisy, with kids playing and laughing. Soon, Jack forgot about his pain and started to join in the fun. He ran around with the other kids and even raced his dad!
The day ended with a happy, healthy Jack. He had no more suffering and he had made lots of new friends!



Once there was a good deer who lived in a big forest. Every morning he would wake up early and act in lots of different ways. He would run around, jump over logs, and hop through the trees. He would even race against the birds who stopped to say hello.
The deer was so fast that even the strongest wind could not catch him! Then, one day, he saw a small stream by the edge of the forest. He decided to act differently. He slowly walked until he was in the middle of the stream. The cold water felt good on his feet.
The deer closed his eyes, listened to the sound of the water and took a nap. Suddenly, he was awoken by the sound of a strong wind. He opened his eyes, smiled and ran back home.
The good deer remembered how good it felt to be quiet. From then on, he was always happy and he acted like this whenever he was in the stream.




One morning, mommy and daddy were feeling very thoughtful. They were going to raise something special! They opened the door and brought in a puppy! When the puppy saw mommy and daddy, he wagged his tail and jumped with joy. Mommy and daddy gave the puppy lots of love. They named him Rover and took him outside to play and go for walks. Everyone in the family was so happy to have Rover as part of the family. He even got to join them at the table for dinner! Each and every morning, Mommy and Daddy loved to raise Rover with love.




One day, Susie was walking in the garden. Suddenly, she saw something wonderful - a beautiful flower blooming! She ran over to smell its sweet scent.
The flower was a bright pink and had petals like ruffled tissue paper. As Susie looked closer, she saw a little bee winking at her. She smiled and waved.
The bee was very busy buzzing around, taking the pollen from flower to flower. It was almost too busy to notice Susie, but it kept winking at her. It seemed to be saying hello!
Soon, Susie had to move on, so she said goodbye to her special flower and the bee. She waved and blew it a careless kiss goodbye. She knew now that there was beauty in the garden for her to find.




John was worried. He was only three years old, and he had to prepare for a trip to nature. He grabbed his backpack and filled it with snacks, juice and some toys. His mom and dad helped him, and told him what to bring. He was excited but also a little bit scared.
The next day, they all got in the car and drove to a park. John was amazed at all the trees, flowers and animals that he saw. He ran around and explored the area. He smiled as he watched the birds flying and was delighted by the colourful flowers.
After a few hours of exploration, John started to get hungry. His parents opened a blanket and prepared a picnic for him. They set him up with some sandwiches, fruit, and milk to drink. John was happy to have something to eat. 
As the sun began to set, John realised it was time to head home. He was tired but had had so much fun! He thanked his mom and dad for bringing him to the calming nature and getting him prepared for the trip. John waved goodbye to the animals and said he'd be back soon.




Once upon a time, there was a big dinosaur who wanted to find a friend. He looked around everywhere but couldn't find anyone. He was beginning to feel sad and embarrassed so he decided to ask a wise old tree for help.
The tree thought for a while and then said, I recommend that you look in the jungle. Youll find lots of other animals there and you might be able to find a new friend. 
The dinosaur thanked the tree and went off to the jungle. Sure enough, he soon found other animals like monkeys and tigers and birds. The dinosaur began to play with them and had lots of fun. He even found a new friend who he liked to play tag with.
The dinosaur was very happy to have found a friend in the jungle. He thanked the wise old tree for recommending it and went off to have more adventures with his new friend.



Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to dive. She had never seen the ocean, but she dreamed of what it might be like.
One day, she got a chance to go to the beach. She was so excited! She ran out into the sand, and straight into the water. She felt the warm water rush over her feet and took a deep breath. Then she dived in!
The girl swam further and further until she saw a sparkling castle in the middle of the sea. She decided to explore it and inside she found a huge room filled with pizza. She took a big bite of a pizza and it was so yummy!
After that, she swam back to shore and went on her way. But she couldn't stop thinking about the charming castle. Wherever it was, she knew she would always remember it.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Thomas. One day, he was playing in his bedroom and he found a pretty red bracelet. Thomas was so happy, he wanted to put the bracelet on right away. 
"Mommy, look at the bracelet!" he shouted.
His mother saw the bracelet, and said, "No, Thomas. You can't keep the bracelet. It must belong to someone else."
Thomas was very disappointed. But suddenly, he had an idea. He said to his mother, "Let me keep it for just one day. Please?"
His mother thought about it for a moment, and said, "All right. You can keep the bracelet for one day. But then you must shut it away in a safe place and never take it out again".
Thomas was so excited. He put the red bracelet on and ran out to show it to his friends. The day passed quickly and before he knew it, it was time to keep the bracelet safe. 
Thomas shut the bracelet away in a special box and put it in his mother's drawer. Every time he would look inside the drawer, he would remember that special day when he found the pretty red bracelet.




Once Upon a Time, there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy was feeling cold on a chilly day. Her toes began to shiver, and she could not get warm.
Daisy looked up at the sky and noticed a big, enormous bus in the distance. She figured if she hopped on the bus, she would get warmer. So with a hop, skip, and a jump, Daisy made her way to the enormous bus.
Daisy hopped onto the bus and a warm feeling filled her body. She no longer felt cold and her toes stopped shivering. Daisy looked around the bus and saw her friends on there, smiling and laughing. She grinned from ear to ear and had a wonderful time on the bus. 
The bus drove on and on, taking Daisy and her friends to a warm and cozy place. Daisy never had to shiver again!




Once upon a time there was a monster called Wide. He slept in a cave near a deep forest. One day, he woke from his slumber. It had been a long sleep and he was hungry. He was so hungry that he decided to eat everything he could find in the nearby forest. He gobbled up everything that he could find including flowers, grass, bugs, and even leaves. It was all so disgusting but he kept eating it anyway. Finally, with a full belly, Wide fell back to sleep in his cave. That's the end.




There was a shy kitten who lived in a garage. Every day the kitten would go out on an adventure. One day, as the kitten ventured outside, she dropped her favorite toy. She looked around for it but could not find it. The kitten grew sad and shy.
Just then, a friendly dog came into the garage. He saw the sad kitten and said he could help. Together, the kitten and the dog searched the garage until they finally found the kitten's toy.
The kitten was no longer shy or sad. She thanked the dog and they played together all afternoon. From then on, the kitten and the dog were good friends. They often went on adventures together, never dropping their favorite toys again.




One day, Willie the Wombat wanted to go on a new adventure. He saw a bright, enormous path, and he wanted to explore. He took some paint and went to go follow the path. 
The path was so long and twisty - it was all very exciting! With his paint in hand, Willie started to paint the path he was travelling. Soon enough, Willie heard some rustling from behind him and then he heard a voice call out. 
"Why are you painting the path, Willie?" asked an old turtle who was walking past.
"I'm painting it because I want to explore and see where this path goes," said Willie happily.
"That's a wonderful idea!" replied the turtle. "I'm sure this painted path will make exploring even more exciting!" 
And so, Willie continued on his adventure. He painted the path, exploring and following it wherever it would lead. The path was enormous, and he had no idea where it would end - and he was very excited to find out.




One day, there was a boy who wanted to find something special. He decided to search around his house to find it. He looked in his toy box, under the sofa and in the cupboard but he couldn't find anything. He kept looking until he saw something glimmering in the corner. It was a little bit of gold! He looked at it and it shone brightly in the light. He was so excited that he had found it and he decided to take it home. He was very happy and held the gold close to his heart. He searched and searched for more golden things but he couldn't find anything else. He was still happy because he had found the gold and he vowed to keep looking for more.



Once there was a bear. It was rough and bristly. The bear lived in a meadow and it liked the sunshine and the meadow flowers.
The bear had an empty basket. It wanted to fill it with something, but it didn't know what.
Then the bear saw a small stream nearby. It had an idea. The bear put the basket in the stream and it started to fill it with water.
When the basket was full, the bear tried to carry it, but it was too heavy. So the bear emptied the basket, and this time it filled it with meadow flowers.
The bear carried the basket home with the meadow flowers in it. It was happy to have something to fill its empty basket with.

The old man shook his head, his frown getting deeper. I don't have enough money to buy any of these tasty pastries.
The little girl started digging in her pockets and found some coins. She gave them to the old man and said, Here, grandpa. This is for the pastries.
The old mans face lit up with a smile and he thanked the girl. He bought all the pastries he wanted and shared some with the little girl. They laughed and enjoyed them together.

Once there was a little boy who had a very special stick. He carried it around with him wherever he went. One day, he was walking along and he decided to poke the stick at the knot in a nearby tree. He poked and poked, but nothing happened.
The little boy asked his mom, "Why won't the knot come out?" His mom smiled and said, "Well, honey, it takes patience and hard work to untie knots. You must be slow and gentle in order to make it happen."
The little boy thought and thought, then he tried again. Slowly and carefully, he poked the stick at the knot and after a while, it finally moved a little. The little boy smiled and kept trying slowly and gently. Eventually, the knot loosened enough that the little boy pulled it out.
The little boy learnt a valuable lesson that day: if you're patient and you work hard, you can do anything!



Once upon a time there was a family. The family had a nice house with a fireplace. But one day, the fireplace broke. The family was very sad and did not know what to do.
So the family asked their neighbor to lend them some money to pay for the repairs. The neighbor said yes and the family was so happy. They quickly paid someone to repair the fireplace and it was good again.
But then the family asked the neighbor for another favor. They wanted to borrow some money to buy some new toys. The neighbor said no and the family was very sad.
The family worked for days to try to earn enough money for new toys, but it was not enough. In the end, the fireplace remained broken and the family never got the toys.



 
Once upon a time there was an otter. He was so fast that he could run faster than any of the other animals in the forest. 
One day, he was running in the forest and he noticed a very long log. It was so big he could hardly believe it! So he decided he wanted to race the log. 
The otter said to the log, "I'm going to race you, let's see who can get to the end first!" 
The log replied, "I'm a log so I can't really run. But I can roll. So if I roll, can I still race you?" 
The otter thought about it for a moment and said, "Yes, if you roll on the ground we can both race and see who gets to the end first!" 
So the otter and the log started their race. The otter ran as fast as he could and the log rolled as fast as it could. In the end, the otter won the race and the log was very proud of its long race.




The sun was shining brightly one morning when Max decided to explore the creek near his house. He grabbed his bucket and waded into the cool water. Max was having so much fun, splashing and playing.
Suddenly, Max saw something in the water ahead of him. It was a sign. He floated closer and read the sign. It said 'Danger - Do Not Enter'. Max had learned about dangers, and so he backed away from the creek.
Max was sad but he knew it was better to be safe than sorry. He thought of a plan. Max decided to go home, get his binoculars and then he could watch the creek from a safe distance.
Max eventually made it back home but he was careful to keep his distance from the creek. He set up his binoculars and zoomed in on the creek. Through the binoculars he could see the dangerous things that might be lurking in the water.
He was glad he didn't try to go closer. For now, Max will just have to keep watching the creek from a safe spot.




Once there was a boy who was very anxious. Everywhere he looked, he could see a tiny, pesky mosquito flying around.
He decided he should try to tie it down. He found a long piece of string and carefully tried to tie it around the mosquito. But it was too fast! It flew away.
So he looked around and found a net. He tried to catch the mosquito with the net, but it was too quick and it flew away again.
The boy was very frustrated and anxious. He wondered how he could ever tie down the mosquito. Then, he had an idea. He rushed to the store to buy a fly swatter. With one quick swat, he was able to tie down the mosquito! He was so proud of himself!




Once upon a time there was a little boy. His name was John and he was three years old.
John was thirsty, so he went looking for something to drink. He walked and walked and eventually he found a pond. He saw the water and went over to drink it.
There was a frog in the pond. The frog said "Do not drink the water! It is not safe for you to drink." John didn't listen, he was too thirsty so he drank the water.
When he got home his mom was very angry. She said "John, why did you drink that water?" John did not understand why she was so angry.
His mom explained, "The pond water is not safe to drink, it could make you sick." John was sad and said he was sorry.
His mom hugged him and said "It is ok, but next time if someone tells you not to do something, please listen. You could have become very sick!"
John nodded his head and promised he would listen next time. He was glad to be home and safe.




Once upon a time, there was a girl who was very worried. She wanted to make herself look pretty, like all the other girls, but she didn't have any makeup. Without the makeup, she felt dull and strange.
She asked her mom for some makeup, but her mom said she was too young. The girl was still worried and couldn't stop thinking about it.
One day, the girl saw her mom putting on makeup, and it looked so pretty and special! She asked her mom if she could use it too, and her mom said yes. The girl put it on, and she felt so much better! She was no longer worried and felt beautiful and unique. 
The girl smiled and hugged her mom, thankful that she could make herself feel better after all.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lucy. She was 3 years old and loved playing with her friends.
One day, Lucy and her friends wanted to have a picnic at a nearby park. Everyone gathered what they needed, including a napkin for everyone to share. 
Lucys friend, Claire, took the napkin first. She said, Ill pass the napkin to you, Lucy.
Lucy looked at the napkin. It was clear and she could see the other side. She said, Thank you, Claire! Now I can have a bite of my sandwich. 
Claire smiled and said, Youre welcome, Lucy. Why dont we take a nap after the picnic? 
Lucy nodded eagerly and said, Yes, please! Im so tired already.
And that was the end of their picnic. They all had a nice nap in the cool park and went home happy.




Once upon a time, there was a purple monster having lots of fun. The monster made big promises to the people around it, like to always be happy and to share with its friends. But the monster was not very flexible. Whenever it made plans, it would stick to them very tightly, no matter how much the people around it asked it to change its plans.
One day, the monster made a promise that it would take a group of people on a fun activity. Everyone was excited! But then they started to argue over what activity they should do. The monster heard the arguing, and it started to worry. It felt like it couldn't keep its promise if the people couldn't agree on what to do.
But then something amazing happened. The monster watched as the people kept talking. And then it saw something it had never seen before: people being flexible. They listened to each other and compromised until everyone was happy with the plan.
The monster smiled and learned an important lesson. It was okay to change plans, and it was okay to be flexible. From then on, the purple monster kept its promises, no matter what.



Once upon a time there was a small class. The class had lots of fun things to do. Every day a teacher came to teach them.

The teacher also taught them how to read, write and draw. The class was so excited! Every day they loved learning something new.
At the end of each day the teacher gave each student a big hug and said goodbye. 
The small class and the teacher had lots of fun teaching and learning together!




Once there was a noisy alligator. He liked to cause a lot of commotion and he frequently made loud noises. One day, he was walking through the swamp, loudly singing and causing a ruckus.
He came across a duck who said to him, Please be quiet! Youre being very noisy. But the alligator refused to listen and kept singing.
He walked a bit further and came across a frog who said the same thing to him. Please dont be so noisy! But the alligator continued to sing and be disruptive.
Finally, the alligator came across a wise old turtle and she said to him, Its nice to be happy, but its not nice to be too loud. Youd be better off if you kept your voice down and behaved more politely.
The alligator heeded the turtles advice and from then on he made sure to stay quiet and not be too disruptive. He learned that sometimes its better to be polite than to be too noisy.




There once was a little boy called Thomas. He was just three years old and loved playing outside in the garden.
