Afterwards, Thomas got out and wrapped himself in a towel. He was all clean but not ready for bed yet  he still had some time to play. 
So Thomas ran outside to the garden and had a wonderful time playing in the afternoon sunshine.




Once upon a time, there was a brave girl who loved books. Her favourite place was the library; she went there every day. When she was there the brave girl liked to record different stories that she heard. She wrote them down in her notebook and made An illustrated book.
The brave girl would go to different places in the library and ask the librarian questions, and record the answers. She made all sorts of stories, from fairy tales to scary stories. She was very proud of her work!
One day, the brave girl was feeling extra brave. She went to the highest shelf in the library and took books that were much too big for her. Then, she went to a special room and recorded her own stories. She was so happy with what she heard!
The brave girl wrote and recorded stories every day. She loved spending time in the library learning new words, and recording different stories. Soon, she was the bravest girl in the library!




Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to look at nature. She would go to the park every day and wonder at the plants. She saw so many kinds of plants in all sorts of colors. Her favorite was a pink one.
The girl wanted to have a pink plant of her own. She asked her mom to help her get one for her bedroom. Her mom was so happy that she went right away to look for one.
Soon, the girl had a pink plant in her bedroom. She watered it every day and it grew bigger and bigger. The girl was so excited to watch it grow.
She kept wondering if her pink plant would ever bloom. Soon, one day it began to produce some beautiful pink flowers. The girl was so happy!
She was so excited to show off her pink plant to all her friends. The girl was so proud of her pink plant. Every day she would take care of it and it kept blooming more and more.



 
Once there was a young bird, who wanted to soar in the sky. But no matter how hard she tried, she couldn't seem to fly.
One day, the bird heard about a magical chamber. Inside the chamber was a secret that would help the bird soar. 
The bird flew up to the chamber and knocked on the door. "Who's there?" said a voice from inside.
The bird replied, "Its me, the young bird who wants to soar in the sky. May I come in and learn the secret to flying?"
"Yes, come on in," the voice said.
The bird entered the chamber, and was amazed by what she saw. She saw a beautiful feather and a golden hourglass. 
The voice said, "This feather is your ticket to flying. Use the independent spirit within you to soar. Put the feather in your hair, close your eyes and imagine yourself flying as high as you can."
The bird followed the instructions and felt her heart soar. Miraculously, she was able to fly! From that day forward, the young bird became an independent flyer who was able to soar through the sky.




Once upon a time there was a clumsy bear named Sam. He was a lazy bear and liked to take long naps. One day, he was walking in the woods when he heard a loud noise. It was coming from the left. He was so excited to find what it was! He walked closer and closer until he seen it. A long yellow slide! He had never seen anything of the sort. He could hardly wait to try it out. 
He pushed and shoved his way up to the top. As he was about to slide down, suddenly something caught his eye. A long yellow ladder! He was even more excited than before. He ran over to the ladder, grabbed on and began climbing. He climbed for what felt like forever until he reached the very top. He looked down and couldn't believe his eyes. He had been so excited to slide down the slide, but he realized what he had actually done. He had climbed to the top of a huge tree! 
He was feeling a bit scared until he noticed something amazing. There was a beautiful view of the whole forest beneath him! The sight filled him with so much happiness that he forgot he was scared. He hugged the tree tightly, so happy and excited to have made it to the top of the tree. He had never felt so proud.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful sunset. It was so amazing! Everyone wanted to see it.
So, the family lit a fire in the backyard to watch the sunset. The flames were bright and warm. The sun was orange and red. It was wonderful to look at.
Then, it started to get darker. Soon, the fire was the only light around. Everyone enjoyed it and talked until it was time for bed.
Before the family went to bed, they looked up to see the amazing fire burning in the night sky. It was a special moment they would never forget.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Lucy. She was 3 years old and very curious.
One day, Lucy asked, Mummy, can I go outside?
Mummy said, No Lucy, I don't permit it - it's too dangerous.
Lucy then asked, Mummy, can I have a present? 
Mummy said, Of course, Lucy. We shall go shopping for one. What kind of present do you want? 
Lucy thought hard and replied, I'd like a really expensive present, please. 
Mummy laughed and said, What kind of expensive present would you like? 
Lucy thought some more and then said, I'd like a nice dolly. 
Mummy smiled and said, Okay, we'll see what we can find. 
And so, Lucy and Mummy went shopping and found the perfect dolly. Lucy was very excited and thanked Mummy for the present. 
Mummy said, You're very welcome, Lucy. Let's take the dolly home. 
And so they did. Lucy was very happy with her new, expensive present and ran off to show her Daddy. 
The End.




Emma was out bike riding. She was so excited and worked up a sweat. Suddenly, she spotted a sign. It said, "Tough trail ahead!" She wanted to prove how brave she was so she filled with determination and set off.
She started off on the trail and it was very tough. She stumbled a few times but eventually started to get the hang of it. Finally, she was so close to the top. She cheered and cheered until suddenly, she made a wrong turn.
She found herself in a dark and scary part of the woods. Fear filled her chest. She tried to turn back, but it seemed that no matter which way she went she couldn't get back to the trail she was following before.
She sat and cried feeling lost and alone. Suddenly, a voice spoke up. It said, "Looks like you are in a tight spot. Don't worry, I will help you get back, but I will need something first..."
Emma trembled. She gave him the only thing she had with her - her bike. The mysterious figure then vanished into the dark night, leaving nothing behind but a dark and empty feeling. 
Emma was never able to find her way back home.




Once upon a time, there was a deaf boy called Tom. Tom liked to go for walks. One day, Tom asked his Mommy if he could go for a visit. His Mommy said Yes, you can go for a visit. But make sure youre home before dinner. So Tom put on his shoes to go for a walk.
On his walk, Tom met a deaf girl called Sue. Sue said to Tom, Hi! What are you doing? Tom smiled and said, Im going for a visit. Would you like to come too? Sue nodded, so Tom and Sue went for a walk together. 
They went to a park and looked at the birds. They watched the squirrels and played on the swings. Tom and Sue laughed and had a lot of fun together. 
Finally, it was time for Tom to go home. He said goodbye to Sue and thanked her for coming with him on his visit. Then Tom waved goodbye, and went for a walk back home.




Tommy was a shy little boy. He was always too scared to speak to anyone and he didn't like getting noticed. He was happy when he wasn't called attention to. 
One day, he heard some news about an increase in his town. He heard that new families were moving in, and the town was growing bigger. It made him nervous. He was scared of all the new people and all the changes that were happening. 
Tommy went to his mom and dad to ask them about the news. They explained that the increase meant that the town was growing and they would have more people and more things to do. They reassured Tommy that he wouldn't have to be intimidated by all the change. 
Tommy felt much better knowing that his parents were there for him. He was still shy, but he was able to accept that change was happening and things would be alright.



Once upon a time, there was a girl with long hair who was playing with her friends. She was having a great time, until a rude man walked up to them. He pointed at her purse and said "Give me that." She got scared and her friends ran away. The girl kept her purse safe and ran away too. When the man realised the girl had run away, he got really mad and started to shout.
The girl ran all the way to her house and when she got there she called her mum. Her mum answered and she said, "Mum, a rude man wanted to take my purse but I said 'no' and ran away!" Her mum was so proud of her for standing up to the man and told her to stay safe inside the house. 
From then on, the girl always held on tight to her purse whenever she went out to play. She had learned a very important lesson that day - never talk to strangers!




Once upon a time, there was a lovely stack of toys. All the toys were different shapes and colours. Imagine playing with all the lovely toys!
The stack reached up high as far as the eye could see. The toys were shiny and sparkly and so much fun to play with. Little ones loved to pick up the toys and show them to everyone.
Imagine the giggles as the toys were lifted up and placed down again. Make believe games were made up and shared among all the friends. There were clowns, bells and colourful parachutes. Everyone had lots of fun.
The toys were handled with care and lots of love. Each one was treasured and enjoyed by the little ones. They were lovely to look at and just as much fun to play with. Everyone loved the lovely stack of toys.



Once upon a time, there was a brave girl named Alice. She was very curious and loved to create things. One day, she got a special idea. She decided to make some special candy! She gathered all of the ingredients she needed, plus a little extra special something. 
Alice worked very hard to make her candy. She mixed and stirred, and watched carefully as her candy started to take shape. When it was finally ready, she was very proud of her creation. 
Alice took a bite of the candy. It was delicious! She wanted to share her candy with the world, so she decided to give it away. She bravely set out to tell her friends what she had made. 
Everyone was so amazed that Alice had created such delicious candy. They couldn't believe how brave she had been to make and share it. From then on, every time Alice had a special idea, her friends knew it was going to be something special and delicious!




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Poppy. Poppy was only three years old and she was out for a walk in the park. Suddenly, Poppy saw a buckle on the ground. It was a really pretty buckle, but it was also very dirty.
Poppy wanted to pick up the buckle, so she bent down and pinch it. Then she saw a strange thing - the buckle began to move. It wasnt a buckle at all - it was a tiny little mouse!
The mouse said to Poppy: Oh help me! I am stuck inside this buckle and I cannot get out!
Poppy was not scared, so she bent down and carefully opened the buckle. Then the little mouse thanked her and scurried away.
Poppy smiled and put the buckle in her pocket. She was happy she could help the little mouse.




Once upon a time there was a young princess. She was very happy because she was getting married. On the day of her marriage, the princess heard yelling coming from outside. She opened the door and saw something terrible! Her fianc was yelling at another young princess. 
The young princess felt so sad. She knew she had to do something. She walked closer and confronted her fianc. He said that he had decided to marry the other princess instead. 
The young princess was so upset that she ran away. She ran and ran until she got far away from the castle. She was so sad that she never wanted to get married again. She never saw her fianc or the other young princess ever again. 
The young princess lived her life alone, never finding true love.




Timmy was a very obedient boy. He was always doing what his parents asked. One day, his parents asked him to go to the science lab. Timmy was scared but went anyway.
When Timmy got to the science lab he saw a big green laser. "What is that?" he asked his parents. His parents explained that it was a laser and the scientists were going to use it to test things.
Timmy was still scared but his parents reassured him that the laser was safe. They asked him to stand on a chair and put his hand under the laser. Timmy was very obedient, so he did as he was asked.
The laser shone on his hand, but it felt like a tickle. Timmy was relieved and happy. He said to his parents, "This isn't so bad". His parents were very happy that he had been so obedient. They hugged him and told him the laser was all done.




Once there was a little boy named Joe. One day Joe went to a garden and saw a big apple tree. He was so excited and couldn't wait to eat an apple. As he approached the tree he heard a voice say "stop". Joe looked up and saw a purple bird perched on the branch.
The bird said "That apple is mine! Don't you even think about taking it." Joe was very upset by the bird's words. He tried to reason with the bird but the bird was very stubborn.
In the end, Joe had a great idea. He offered the bird another apple in exchange for the one on the branch. The bird was delighted with this and accepted the deal. Joe got the apple, and the bird got the one Joe had offered.
They both smiled and went their separate ways. Joe was very happy that he got to have the apple. He was even more happy that he was able to solve the conflict in a friendly way.



 
One day, Mike wanted to fly his kite. He went outside and ran on the grass. His kite flew up above him, faster and faster, zooming in the sky. He felt so happy. The wind felt nice and the kite flew so light. 
But then, the wind died down and Mike's kite faded away. It was too light and couldn't stay in the air. Mike tried to chase after it but it was too late. His kite was gone. 
Mike was so sad. He watched the sky, hoping that his kite would come back, but it never did. He never got to fly his kite again.



 
Once there was a little old man who lived alone in a small cottage. He was often sad because he had no friends. Every day he would stir a pot of soup, wait for someone to come to his door, and offer them a bowl.
One day, a lady heard about the old man's kindness. She wanted to help him, so she decided to pass along some of her joy. She made cookies and cakes, and brought them to the old man's cottage.
The old man was very happy. He had never experienced such kindness. He welcomed the lady in to his home and they had a wonderful time together. The old man laughed and told stories until it was time for the lady to go. 
The old man thought about the lady's kindness for a long time after she left. He decided that if he could, he would be kind to others just like the lady was to him. He knew that dead people can't be kind, but alive people can! That was a lesson he never forgot.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy who was feeling very anxious. He was scared about a big lift, and didn't know how to go up it. 
His mom saw how anxious he was, and she said, "It will be OK, sweetheart. Let's feel the lift, and it will be more comfortable." 
The little boy tentatively stepped on the lift, and his mom showed him the shiny, smooth buttons. He pressed one, and the lift began to move. 
The little boy was still nervous, but he noticed that the different textures of the walls and floor were calming him down. He said to his mom, "It feels like a soft blanket." 
His mom smiled. As the lift travelled higher and higher, the little boy soon relaxed, and by the time the doors opened at the top, he was no longer anxious. 
The little boy looked out, and saw a bright world of wonderful possibilities.




Once upon a time, there was a clever boy named Tom. He lived with his parents in a big house. Every day, Tom would take a walk around his neighborhood.
On one special day, he saw a piece of paper lying on the ground. He picked it up and started to read. It was a note from a friendly bear! The note said: "Come to my cave on the other side of the forest. I have something special to show you. Signed, bear".
Tom ran home to his parents. He told them all about the note. Tom's parents were worried - it was dangerous to go alone! However, Tom was clever and decided to take the bear up on his offer. He asked his parents if he could go and promised to be very careful.
Tom set off into the woods, stopping every once in a while to take in the beauty of the forest. At last he found the bear's cave. Inside, Tom saw a strange sight - the bear had set up a secret paper factory! Everywhere around the cave were huge stacks of paper. 
The bear saw the surprised look on Tom's face and said, "Welcome, Tom! I was hoping you would come. I was planning to make a special paper, but I needed a clever boy like you to help me!"
Tom was excited. He and the bear worked together to create something amazing - a beautiful paper house! 
Tom carefully




Once there was a little red cart. It was a wagon that used to belong to Jack and Jill. It was their favourite thing to play with.
One day, Jack and Jill were having so much fun with their cart that they decided to go on an adventure. They scattered around the forest, looking for adventure.
Jack and Jill soon found a tall tree. It was full of colourful fruit. "Let's get these fruits and fill our little red cart!" said Jack.
They jumped with joy and started to gather the fruits and stuff them into their red cart.
When they had enough, they raced as fast as they could back home. They couldn't wait to show their parents all the fruits they had collected!




Once upon a time, there was a bunny who lived in a cozy burrow underground. The bunny liked to count the stars in the night sky, and made sure to count them all before bed! One day, the bunny hopped out of the burrow and found an old, smelly skin lying on the ground. It had been there for a long, long time.
The bunny was curious about the skin, so he started counting it. 1, 2, 3... The bunny counted all the way up to 7. But then something strange happened - the skin started to move! The bunny was frightened, but he stayed brave and kept counting. Soon, the skin opened up, and out came a long snake!
The snake was big and scary, but the bunny stayed calm. He counted the colors on the snakes back - 1, 2, 3, 4, all the way up to 12! The bunny knew the snake must be very old, and he thanked the snake for letting him count it. The bunny hopped away and went back to counting the stars that night.



Bob wanted a new boot but he was spoiled. His parents said that he could have anything he wanted as long as he put on his best dress. 
So Bob went to his room and put on his special dress. It was red with polka dots and it sparkled in the light. He twirled around so everyone could see how lovely it looked. 
Bob then went downstairs and asked his parents for his new boot. His mom and dad smiled and said it was fine. They walked him to the store and showed him all the different kinds of boots. 
Bob found his favorite one right away. It was yellow and had stars on it. He put it on his foot and it fit perfectly. Bob was so excited that he instantly started to skip home.
His mom and dad were so happy to see him so excited. They were glad that they were able to give him something he really wanted. He was so spoiled! From then on, Bob would always wear his special dress and his new yellow boot. 




Once there was a little boy who really wanted a kayak. So he asked his mom and dad, but they said no. The little boy was really upset, so he decided to ask his Uncle for help. He found his Uncle and demanded that he get a kayak. Uncle was very reliable and said he would see what he could do.
The next day Uncle arrived with a big red kayak for the boy. The boy was thrilled and could not wait to try it out. So he ran to the lake and hopped in. He enjoyed paddling around with his new kayak. He was so happy that his Uncle had been so reliable and had found him such a cool present.



Once upon a time, there was a very wealthy man who loved to sit in his chair. He always looked down on the people who had less than he did. Every day, he would remind himself how wealthy he was, and how better he was than anyone else.
One day, an old woman walked up to the wealthy man and said she wanted to change places. The man laughed and said no. But the old woman asked again, and again the wealthy man said no.
Finally, the old woman asked the wealthy man, "if I can make this chair move backwards, will you agree to change places with me?". The wealthy man thought it was impossible, but he agreed. The old woman then began to move the chair slowly backwards. 
The wealthy man then realised how fortunate he was, and how truly blessed he was to have all the wealth he had. He learned a lesson that day and made sure to never again look down on other people who didn't have as much as him. 
The moral of this story is that being truly wealthy is about what you have in your heart, not just what you have in your pocket.



Jonny was very sad. He didn't know why, but he felt down. His mum asked him to come into the living room.
Jonny sat on the sofa and mum sat next to him. She asked him why he was feeling so sad. 
Jonny said he didn't know what to do.
Mum hugged Jonny and said "It's ok, we can spend some time together".
They spent the afternoon in the living room playing and talking about different things.
Jonny soon felt much happier. He gave his mum a big hug and said thank you for the time they spent together in the room.




Jane was a young girl, who liked to pray. Every day she would kneel down and close her eyes and pray to God. She was very foolish and often asked for silly things in her prayers. 
One day, Jane prayed for a pet squirrel. While this was a very silly thing to pray for, that night a squirrel appeared in her back garden. 
Jane was so excited and ran to the garden to see her new pet. She wanted to pick it up, but she soon found out that it was very scared. Jane was sad because she wanted to give the squirrel a hug, so she thought of the best thing to do. 
Every night, Jane would kneel down and pray for the squirrel. She would ask that the squirrel would become her friend and feel safe in her garden. 
After a few weeks, the squirrel had got used to Jane. He would come out of the trees and eat peanuts out of her hand. Jane was so happy to see her prayers answered and she was no longer foolish in her prayers.



 
Grandpa was sitting in the old armchair. He looked deep in thought as he mentioned something to himself. A cloud of smoke rose from the pipe he was holding in his hands.
Grandpa was up to something, but little Jack couldn't quite work out what it was. He decided to wait and see.
The next day, Grandpa took Jack on an adventurous hike. Everything sparkled before their eyes as they explored the magical woods. Grandpa stopped and pointed at something that Jack could not see. 
Grandpa smiled and said: "Look there, smoke! It was what I mentioned yesterday." Jack couldn't believe it! In the distant sky, up in the clouds, a hot air balloon was slowly floating. He had never seen anything so beautiful.
Grandpa had set up a surprise adventure that Jack will never forget.



One day, a family decided to go to the park. They had a lot of fun running around and playing, but the little girl was most excited to see the furry model at the park. She had heard about it from her friends, and couldn't wait to see it up close. When they reached the model, the little girl was too scared to go near itit looked so big!
But with a little encouragement from her family, she was able to take a few steps closer. She carefully reached out her hand and touched the furry modelit felt so soft! She started to laugh, and before she knew it, she was running around the model, shouting and playing games.
The family stayed at the park for hours, until the sun started to set. But the little girl went home with a smile, because she had conquered her fear and found a new furry friend.




Jake was three years old. One day he and his family went to the park. When he arrived, he noticed a huge old tree with a swing attached to it.
"Mommy, can I swing?" he asked with excitement.
"Yes!" his mom replied. 
Jake was so happy. He ran to the swing and hopped on. He started to swing as high as he could. He looked up and saw the sky above him. He felt so free and happy. 
Suddenly, a blackbird flew under the swing and made a loud noise. Jake screeched with surprise and stopped swinging. 
The bird flew away and Jake's mom ran to him. 
"Are you ok, honey?" she asked.
"Yes," Jake said, ready to swing again. "Let's swing higher!" 
And so Jake and his mom continued swinging until dinner. Jake had so much fun and couldn't wait to come back and play on the huge tree swing again.



 
Once upon a time, there were two friends, Tom and Tia. They were playing in the park one day and came across an old shed. Tom said to Tia, "Let's play in there! It looks like fun!"
They ran inside, and Tom saw an old wooden box. He opened it and found some modern toys inside. He said, "Tia, these toys look really cool! Let's play with them!"
Tia said, "What kinds of toys?" Tom opened the box and showed her the modern toys. They started playing with them, and had so much fun that they forgot the time. 
When they eventually remembered the time, they ran outside and realized it was getting dark. Tom said, "Let's come here tomorrow and play with the toys again!"
And they did! Tom and Tia kept coming back to the shed every day to play with their modern wooden toys. They played and laughed and had a wonderful time until they grew up.




Once there was an ordinary girl named Mary who wanted to get a golf ball. She asked her mom if she could go get it. Her mom said yes and Mary was very excited. 
So Mary ran outside and went to the golf course near her house. She looked all around trying to find a golf ball. Eventually, she found one and got it! 
She was so happy to have a golf ball, she went back home and put it on her shelf. Mary was always so excited to get things, but she knew that she should never go to the golf course without her mom again. 
The end.



 
One day, Jack bounced his ball outside. He was so excited to see it go up and down. Jack's mom saw him bouncing the ball and she wanted to join him. She went to her closet and got out a big bag of powder.
"What is this?" Jack asked.
"It's a special powder," his mom said. "This powder can make you fly like a super hero."
Jack's eyes grew wide. He couldn't believe it. His mom sprinkled some of the fine powder on him, then he bounced his ball. The wind caught the powder, and suddenly, Jack was up in the air with the ball. He squealed with delight. He bounced around in the sky, laughing and feeling like a super hero.
Jack's mom was so proud of her son. She watched him have the time of his life.
"Look, Mom!" Jack shouted with joy. "I'm flying!"




Once upon a time, there was a boy called Sam. Sam had a very special goal. He wanted to be the best at playing hide-and-seek! 
One day, Sam was playing hide-and-seek with his friends. He ran and ran until he found a nice, comfortable spot to hide. Sam waited and waited, but then he began to feel a little bit sleepy. 
Suddenly, Sam slipped and fell asleep. He slept and slept until it was time to go home. 
When he woke up, Sam was excited. He knew he was very close to achieving his goal. He had played the best hide-and-seek game ever! 
From then on, Sam felt very comfortable whenever he played hide-and-seek. He knew he could always rely on himself to win!




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Lucy. She was walking in a park one day and suddenly the sun disappeared. Everything got dark and Lucy got nervous. She didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, she heard a voice. Lucy looked up and saw a big, friendly owl.
"Hello there!" said the owl.
"Why is it dark?" asked Lucy.
"The sun has gone away," said the owl. "But don't worry, it will be back soon. I'm here to watch over you."
Lucy felt much better after the owl had spoken to her. She knew the sun would be back soon and that she had a friend to watch over her.
The sun reappeared and Lucy waved goodbye to the owl as she continued to explore the park. She will never forget the owl that made her feel safe when the sun had disappeared.




Once upon a time there was a boy called Tom. Tom was three years old and very curious. Every day he would explore outside, looking for something new to learn.
One day, Tom was walking through the grass when he spotted an original goose. He'd never seen a goose before and was excited to get closer. He requested to the goose if he could approach, but the goose didn't answer. Tom walked up to the goose and asked again. This time, the goose finally responded.
"I'm looking for food," said the goose. "If you help me find food, I can show you something special."
Tom was intrigued. He agreed to help and the pair set off to search for food. Eventually, they found some tasty insects and the goose was very grateful.
It was then that the goose revealed its secret. It told Tom that it could fly! Tom was so excited that he couldn't believe it. The goose asked him if he wanted to ride and Tom could only nod in agreement. 
The original goose took flight, with Tom on its back. Tom couldn't believe his luck as he had asked for adventure, and the goose had granted his request!



Once upon a time a mommy was feeling very nervous. She was getting ready to mix something really special. She was going to mix together the ingredients to make her very own baby!
The mommy took out all the things she needed: flour, eggs and milk. She carefully stirred everything together, making sure not too much of one thing was added.
After a few minutes of stirring, the mommy had finished mixing her special ingredients. Now she just had to wait and see what would happen!
The mommy waited and waited. After a few days, she had a special surprise. It was a tiny baby, crying and cooing! The mommy was so happy, she couldn't believe her eyes!
The mommy cradled her tiny baby in her arms and whispered I love you! She was no longer feeling nervous, she was feeling very, very happy!




Once upon a time, two kids named Jack and Jill went to the beach. They wanted to get a boat. The boat was red and had two oars. They asked Jack's dad if they could take it out on the water. He said yes and they quickly went to the beach.
Jack and Jill got in the boat and began to row. They rowed around the shore and watched the waves come in and go out. Then they saw something special. It was a regular boat that was bigger than theirs. They wanted to get it and have even more fun.
They both worked together and each took an oar. They rowed towards the big boat and got close enough to touch it. It was bigger than Jack and Jill had ever seen. They were so excited to get it and began to row around with it.
Jack and Jill had a lot of fun with their regular boat. They took turns rowing and went up and down the shoreline. They had so much fun that they wished they could do it every day.




Once upon a time there was an elephant. He liked to rock in his favourite chair every day. He thought rocking was fun and it made him feel cozy.
One morning he felt extra hungry. He wanted something yummy to eat. He rocked back and forth in his chair to think about what he wanted. He began to smell something delicious!
He looked around and saw a big bowl of yummy apples. He couldnt believe his eyes. He got up and hopped over to the apples. He grabbed a few and began to eat. They were so yummy that he ate them all!
He felt happy and full. He went back to his chair, rocked and felt content.




Once upon a time there lived a hard hunter. He lived in the woods and hunted game every day. One day he decided to go on an adventure like he had never done before. He packed his bags and off he went, determined to find the end of the woods.
When he arrived at the edge of the woods he saw a big, open field. He was so excited to explore. He walked across the field and realized that he had been walking for a long time. He was beginning to get tired, but he kept going until he spotted the end of the field.
He shouted, "Yay, I've reached the end!" Suddenly, a voice called out from behind him. It was a small voice. When he turned around, he saw a little girl. She was only three years old.
"What's at the end?" she asked.
The hunter smiled. "I don't know," he said. "But that's all part of the adventure!" Then he said goodbye, and continued on his journey. 
The little girl watched him go until he disappeared around the corner. And that was the end of the hunter's big adventure.




Once upon a time there were two very good friends called Tony and Isabella. They were always creative and very adventurous. One day they decided to take a walk and explore the world. 
As they walked, they saw a bright light shining in the distance. It was so bright that it lit up the whole sky! Tony turned to Isabella and said "let's go and explore the light!" They walked carefully and soon they arrived by the bright light.
They saw that it was a foot shining. It was the most creative and scariest thing they had ever seen. Tony was very brave and he touched the foot while Isabella was too scared to try. Tony said to Isabella: "It's okay, you don't have to be worried. Let's touch it together!"
They touched it together and were surprised to find that it felt warm and comforting. They realized that it was just a friendly foot and not something to be scared of. They laughed and smiled and soon the two were on their way again, exploring more of the world.



Once upon a time there was a little girl. Her name was Jenny. She wanted to have a special place for her friends to gather and play.
Jenny and her friends decided to build an igloo. They worked together to make a big, round, snow igloo. When they were done, they stepped inside. It was cozy and peaceful.
Jenny's friends were all very happy with their igloo. After they had been playing and exploring, they got all dirty and cold. So Jenny said it was time to wash up.
They all went outside and ran to the nearby lake. They splashed around and washed their hands and faces in the cold water. Jenny's friends were so excited that they even made a little game out of it.
They stayed in the lake until all of them were clean. When they were done, they ran back to their igloo, laughing and feeling refreshed. 
That night, everyone shared stories and snacks in the cozy and peaceful igloo. Jenny and her friends had so much fun that they all decided to get together like that every week.




Once upon a time there was a bossy little girl named Lily. She was very excited one day because it was time to decorate her room. Lily climbed up on a chair and started to hang colorful pictures on the wall with some help from her mom. 
Next, the two measured how high to hang the pictures with a ruler. They wanted to make sure the pictures were even. 
Finally, it was time to put up the pretty curtains. Lily was bossy again, telling her mom to open them wide so all of the sunshine could come in. 
When they were finished, Lily was so proud of all their hard work. Her room looked beautiful and it was all thanks to their decorating. The End!




Mama was feeling good. With a smile on her face, she said to her three year old daughter, "Let's have an idea. What do you think we should pour?"
The daughter thought for a moment, then with a gleam in her eyes said, "Let's pour water in an old bucket".
Mama smiled, grabbed an old bucket and filled it with water.
The daughter was so excited and looked around her garden. She saw the old watering can and a light bulb came on in her brain. "Let's pour the water from the old bucket into the old watering can!" she shouted.
Mama thought it was a wonderful idea. Together they poured the water from the bucket into the old watering can.
Just then, the daughter noticed something in the garden. On a branch of an old tree was a pot of freshly watered plants. It looked like they had been there a while, as they were quite old.
"Mama, did you pour the water from the bucket into the pot too?" the daughter asked with surprise.
Mama smiled. "Yes, I thought it was a good idea."
The daughter's eyes widened. She couldn't believe Mama had made such a clever plan.



Once upon a time, a prince was walking through the forest. He was on a mission to find a beautiful palace to celebrate his birthday. As he walked further into the forest, he began to believe he had found the most perfect place in the world. The palace looked very fair. 
The prince entered the palace to explore and began to celebrate his special day. Suddenly he heard a loud, deep voice.
"Hello prince, you must leave this palace immediately."
The prince was scared and asked "why?" but received no reply. He reluctantly began to leave. As he walked away, he felt as if something bad was going to happen. 
The next day, the forest was burning and the palace was destroyed. Everyone was sad and thought the fire came from the palace. The prince had known it was dangerous, but it was too late - the fair palace was no more.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sara. One day, Sara wanted to find a special key. She decided to go on an adventure and stepped outside her house.
She stepped through the grass and then stepped onto the road. She looked around and saw a dead bird lying beside a tree. Sara felt sad when she saw the bird and stepped away to keep searching.
Everywhere she stepped, she couldn't find the key. Until, all of a sudden, she stepped onto a path and saw the shiny key in between some stones. She stepped closer and saw that the key had a sparkly star on it. 
Sara was so happy! She stepped towards the key and picked it up. Suddenly the key started to shine and sparkle, brighter and brighter until the sparkle was gone. 
Sara had found the special key she was looking for. She stepped home with a big smile, happily holding the key in her hand.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Anna. She was three years old and loved playing in the garden. She had a spade which her mommy and daddy had provided for her. 
One day, Anna was digging in the garden with her spade. She was having a great time, until the spade slipped from her hand and scratched her arm. It really hurt! 
Anna started to cry, and her mommy came over to see what was wrong. Mommy hugged her and helped her to her feet, then went to get a band-aid to provide some comfort. After that, Anna felt much better. 
The next day, Anna saw the spade in the garden and she wasn't scared anymore. She got out her spade and started to have lots of fun again. 
The end.




Timmy was outdoors in the cold. He shivered, because he was not wearing a coat. He looked around and noticed a beautiful image. It was a unicorn, standing in the grass.
"Hi there," he said.
The unicorn replied, "Hi Timmy. Would you like to have an adventure?"
Timmy smiled and nodded. The unicorn moved and Timmy followed, until they came to a river. The river was still and the water was cold.
"Let's see how long we can remain in the water," said the unicorn.
Timmy wanted to remain in the water for a long time and he closed his eyes. He stayed there, feeling the cold and imagining the beautiful image of the unicorn. Suddenly he heard his mother's voice calling and he knew he must go home.
He opened his eyes and waved goodbye to the unicorn. Then he turned and ran off home, still imagining the beautiful image of the unicorn in his mind.




Once there was a boy named Jack who wanted to take a nap. He searched his house for a good spot and found a patch of sunlight on the living room floor.
Jack said to his mom, "Mom, I'm gonna take a nap there".
Mom replied, "Ok, Jack, but don't nap for too long. Just a regular nap".
Jack got comfortable on the patch and closed his eyes. He felt warm and peaceful and began to drift off. He had a wonderful dream while taking his regular nap.
When he was done napping, Jack felt refreshed and happy. He realized that he had been asleep for the perfect amount of time. He thanked his mom for reminding him to take a regular nap.




Once upon a time, there was a little lamb named Daisy. She liked to play in the meadow and feel the soft, green grass beneath her feet. One day, she was playing in the meadow when she came across some wool. Daisy was frightened and started to pray.
"Oh please, help me! I'm so scared!" Daisy prayed.
Then, out of nowhere, a friendly voice spoke up. "Don't be frightened, Daisy," it said. "The wool belongs to me and I'm going to use it to make a nice warm scarf for everyone in the meadow."
Daisy was relieved. She thanked the kind voice and was no longer frightened. Everywhere she looked in the meadow, she saw happy animals wearing their warm woolly scarves. 
Daisy never forgot what happened that day, and she always took comfort in the fact that when she was frightened, someone was always there to help her.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Joe. He wanted to go on a grand adventure, but he needed something to help him.
He found a box with a lock on it. He tried to unlock it, but it was too hard for him.
Joe asked his mom for help. His mom told him that if he helped around the house, she would unlock the box for him. Joe was excited!
He quickly got to work, cleaning the dishes, tidying the toys and making his bed. After he had done this, his mom came back with a key. She unlocked the box for Joe.
When he opened it, Joe was so impressed! Inside was a beautiful set of new clothes! He quickly put them on and started exploring the world, on a grand adventure!




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Ted who loved to explore. One day he was looking through his telescope and he saw something pink up in the sky. He was so excited to see it!
It turned out to be a beautiful little planet. It was a special kind of planet because it was made out of pink bubblegum. The pink bubblegum was so sparkly and delicious, it made Ted's mouth water.
Ted wanted to go explore the planet. He put on his space suit and launched off in his rocket ship. As he got closer to the planet, he was so excited. He was amazed at how soft and bouncy the pink bubblegum planet was. He jumped up and down and it felt like being on a trampoline. He had the best time exploring on the planet.
When it was finally time for Ted to go home he was a little sad to leave the planet. But he knew that he could always come back to explore and have fun. As he flew off into the night, Ted couldn't help but smile.




One day, Mama poured the sky. She was very enthusiastic and happy. All of the colors of the sky came pouring out. First orange, then purple, and even a sprinkle of pink. Mama spread it all over the sky. It looked like a beautiful painting. The sun was now shining brightly with the skys new colors. Mama laughed and clapped with joy.
Then little Johnny wanted to pour too. He grabbed a big bucket and ran outside. He was so enthusiastic to pour the sky. He poured blue and green and yellow. Everyone was happy with the colorful sky. They all cheered for Johnny! 
The next day, little Johnny was already asking if he could pour the sky again. Mama smiled and said, Yes, of course you can! 
Little Johnny was so excited. He couldnt wait to pour the sky and make it colorful again.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lily. Lily was 3 years old and loved to ride her bicycle. Everyday, Lily would gleefully step outside on her bicycle and she even had a special place to ride it.
One day, the sun was especially warm, so Lily decided to cycle for an extra long time. When she eventually stepped back into her house, Lily noticed that her mother was worried.
"Lily," said her mother. "It's not always good to take too many steps without listening to another's advice."
Lily smiled and nodded her head. She understood her mother's words and never stepped outside to ride her bicycle without telling someone first.
By following her mother's advice, Lily was always safe, warm and happy.




Once upon a time there was a little boy. His name was Billy and he had big plans for the future. He wanted to learn to play music. Billy had a safe and comfortable home, so he knew he could do it.
One day, Billy's mom bought him a little guitar. She wanted him to feel safe and confident as he endeavoured to learn. Billy was so happy he couldn't stop jumping up and down.
Billy practised every day. He put all his energy into learning to make lovely music. Finally, he had learned enough. It was time for his first big show.
Billy was nervous as he walked onto the stage. When he started to play, however, all his nerves went away. He played the guitar so well that the audience cheered. He had succeeded in making beautiful music! Billy was so proud of himself. 
From that day on, Billy always kept safety and music close to his heart. His dream had become a reality!




A squirrel was sitting in a tree, looking very frustrated. Suddenly, a small voice called up from below. It was a little girl, and she was asking the squirrel a question.
"What's wrong, squirrel?" she said.
The squirrel shook her head and looked away. The little girl watched for a moment, then took a few steps back.
"I'll come back later," she said softly.
The squirrel watched as the little girl walked away. She couldn't help but feel sad.
The little girl returned the next day with a surprise. She had a big bag with her, and when she opened it, two of her friends came out. They each had a big smile on their faces and were holding up a big acorn.
The squirrel looked at the acorn in surprise. She quickly ran down the tree and snatched the acorn away. Then, she scampered back up with a happy chirp.
The little girl and her friends smiled. They had solved the squirrel's problem. The acorn was enough to make her feel full and soothe her frustrated spirit.




Once upon a time, there was a little ant. He was walking along and minding his own business. Suddenly, a bossy duck came flying through the sky and splashed into a puddle. The little ant watched as the duck made a big splash.
"Hey ant, come on in! I'm trying to make the biggest splash I can," the duck said.
The ant was a bit scared, so he shook his head no.
"Oh come on! It'll be so much fun. You won't get wet, I promise!" said the bossy duck.
The ant thought about it, and decided the duck was right. He scurried across the ground and jumped into the puddle. As they both splashed around, they had the best time.
Then the ant realized he was getting soaked. He hurried to get out of the puddle. When he finally escaped, he said goodbye to the duck. The duck waved as the little ant said "Thank you for a great adventure!"




Once there was a gray dolphin. He loved to swim in the ocean and feel the water on his skin. Every day he would swim around and explore the beautiful world he lived in.
One day the dolphin wanted to play a game. He invited all the other animals in the ocean to join him. Everyone was so excited and raced to join the game. But when they got close, the dolphin said that there was no more room!
The dolphin saw how sad everyone was and felt really bad. So, he asked if they wanted to join him on a second game. Everyone cried out with joy, and so the dolphin let the other animals join him the second time.
The dolphin taught the other animals an important lesson; always be kind and share with those around us. And this is why we should always be generous and be kind to those around us, because sharing brings happiness to everyone.



Once upon a time there was a colorful bottle. It was filled with the most amazing sounds. Everywhere the bottle went it sang sweet tunes. People stopped to listen and smiled with joy.
One day the bottle went to a park. There were children playing and laughing. The bottle wanted them to hear its music. So, it flew to the swing set and sang its loudest song. All the children stopped and looked around in wonder.
The bottle sang and sang until it couldn't sing anymore. When it stopped the children cheered with delight. They asked the bottle to sing again and it sang even louder. The children laughed and danced to the cheerful music. 
The bottle was so happy that everyone was listening to it. The sun went down and the children said goodbye to the bottle. The bottle watched them all walk away, still listening to its beautiful music.




Once upon a time there was a beetle that liked to go out and play in the rain. Little did the beetle know that the rain would hurt it and so it ended up getting drenched.
The beetle wanted to find some shelter but there was none in sight. It was scared and started to shiver. But then it overheard a little girl talking.
"Mommy, why is the beetle so wet?" asked the little girl.
"Because it's raining," said her mom.
The beetle was relieved and quickly ran towards their porch. 
The little girl and her mom opened the door and allowed the little beetle to come in. 
The beetle was so happy that it thanked the little girl and her mom as it quickly scurried away and found a nice dry spot to rest.




Once there was a brave fish who lived in the big deep blue sea. Every day he would swim happily in the sunny waters, looking for his friends. One day, he saw something unusual. It was a net!
The brave fish stayed very still. He could feel the net closing around him. He was going to be trapped! Suddenly, another fish swam up and said, "Let me help you!"
The brave fish smiled. Together, they worked to untangle the net so the brave fish could escape. Eventually, they were able to work the net free. The brave fish was so happy!
But then, the other fish began to tease him. "Why were you so scared of the net?" he said. The brave fish didn't know what to say! He was embarrassed that he'd been caught.
But then his friend said, "That was so brave of you to face the net." The brave fish smiled. He felt so happy and proud. He had faced the net, and he was free!



John was playing in the park. He loved to play and explore. Suddenly he heard sirens in the distance. He looked up to see a big truck driving quickly toward him. It was the police.
The police entered the park. They were wearing blue uniforms. John watched them with wide eyes. They stopped and started to talk to some of the other people in the park.
John was a little scared. He had heard adults talk about the police before and he was not sure what they were doing. Should he stay and watch, or should he run away? He decided to stay and watch, but he stayed back a little, just in case.
The police were talking to the adults for a long time. John could see that some of the adults were upset. He could hear the police talking about something, but he couldn't understand what they were saying. He was starting to feel a bit better when one of the police spoke loudly and said something about an ignorant person.
John started to feel scared again. What did ignorant mean? He decided it was best to leave the park. He quickly went home without looking back. The next day he asked his mom what "ignorant" meant. She told him it meant someone who didn't know something.
John was relieved. He would never forget the policemen and their visit to the park. He had learned an important lesson: It is important to be careful and to learn things.



 One day in the forest, a three year old boy named Joey was walking through the woods. He came upon a clearing; looking around he could see a big fire in the middle. He was filled with awe! He went closer to observe it. 
Joey was drawn in by the fire's warm light. He leaned in close and noticed that the fire was made of incredible colors! He wondered how a fire could be such a pretty thing. 
Suddenly a little voice from behind Joey said, "If you throw rocks into the fire, then the colors will become even more beautiful!" Joey turned around and saw a tiny fairy. Joey smiled and asked, "Really?" 
The little fairy nodded and said, "Yes, really! Give it a try and you'll see for yourself!" 
Joey excitedly collected a few rocks, and carefully threw them into the fire one by one. As the rocks hit the fire, the colors began to dance and swirl around the flames, becoming even more incredible! 
He then thanked the tiny fairy and ran off, with a newfound appreciation for the beauty of fire.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Adele. She was always in a hurry to go outside and play with her friends.
One evening, Adeles mom told her to hurry to the kitchen and help with the dinner. Adele ran to the kitchen and saw her mom had the table all set.
When the food was ready, Adeles mom said, Lets all say a prayer before eating. The prayer reminded Adele of how compassionate her mom was.
After the prayer, Adele, her mom, and her dad all enjoyed the dinner. Adele was so happy she got to help make it. And she was happy that her mom was so compassionate and caring.




Once upon a time there were two friends named Jack and Jill. They both wanted to go on a march together. Jack said, "Let's go march!" So the two friends began the march and they were feeling so excited. 
As they were walking, Jack stopped and said to Jill, "Let's pause for a bit", and so they did. They paused for a few minutes and caught their breath. 
Jill said, "Let's keep going! We can do it!" Jack replied, "Yes we can! We should be honest and keep walking". So the friends kept walking until they reached the end of the march. 
At the end, Jack smiled at Jill and said "That was a good march, friend". Jill smiled and said, "Yes, that was an honest march". 
The two friends walked all the way home, excited that they had marched together.




Once upon a time there were two best friends, Jack and Sarah. They were always doing something fun together. Today, they had a new plan - they wanted to go to the park!
But to get there, they would have to push the tire. It was very heavy and they had to use their teamwork to move it. 
Jack said, "It's hard work pushing this tire, Sarah. Let's take turns to share the load." And Sarah agreed.
They both worked hard to push the tire and soon reached the park. It was so much fun! They played all sorts of games and behaved beautifully. All the while, Jack and Sarah were very creative. They found ways to use the tire in their games - rolling it along and pushing each other around on it.
When it was time to go, Jack and Sarah said goodbye to the tire. They knew the tire had been very helpful in making their day extra special.



The world was in a bad way. Everywhere people were suffering. People were feeling tired and miserable.
One little girl was feeling this way too. She was only three and yet she was already feeling very worn out.
But she decided to look around her, and she noticed that, even though the world seemed like a big, bad place, she could still try to make things better.
Every day, she would do a little job to help out. She would tidy her bedroom, wash up the dishes and help carry shopping.
This made the world a better place, and everyone around her began to feel a little bit happier. And, slowly but surely, the little girl began to feel less tired too, and the world around her seemed ever so slightly brighter.




Once upon a time, there was a great pirate who loved to sail the open seas. Everywhere he went, he was big and strong and he was always brave.
One day, the pirate was sailing in a storm when he saw a little boat. Inside the boat was a 3-year-old boy, who was all alone. The pirate said, "Ho, little brave one. Where do you go?"
The little boy replied, "I am sailing to find a great treasure!"
The pirate said, "No! You must turn around and go back home!" But the little boy wouldn't listen.
The pirate got so mad that he slapped the little boy on the bottom. The boy started to cry. 
The pirate felt so bad for what he did. He hugged the little boy and said, "I'm sorry, little brave one. I was only trying to keep you safe."
 
The little boy smiled and said, "It's okay, great pirate. I forgive you." Then he quickly put on his pirate hat, turned his little boat around, and sailed home.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Abi. Abi loved exploring the world around her and especially loved to go outside in the garden and gaze at the sky.
One day, Abi decided to explore her bedroom. She noticed a big, soft sheet on her bed. She gently lifted it up and looked underneath. It was full of surprises!
One of the surprises was a giant soft teddy bear. Abi instantly fell in love with it and hugged it tightly. She then looked around the room, looking at the posters and pictures on the walls and gazing out of the window.
The next day, Abi went to bed and snuggled under the soft sheet. It was so comfy and cosy that Abi soon fell asleep. She dreamt of exploring the garden and gazing at the sky.
The end!



Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to explore. One day the little girl decided to explore her mysterious porch. She noticed the top of the porch twisted in the wind. As she watched it twist and turn, the little girl knew she should not try to twist it any more.
The little girl heard a voice coming from above. She looked up and saw a friendly angel who was smiling down at her. The angel said "Little girl, you must never twist anything that belongs to others. You have to respect their things."
The little girl thought about this and decided she would remember the angel's words. From that day on, the little girl was careful not to twist anything that was not hers.
The moral of the story is that it is important to respect the things that belong to others. It is not right to twist or change anything without permission.




Once upon a time there was a rabbit, named Benny. Benny loved to bounce up and down in the wide field near his home. He was so restless and full of energy!
One day, Benny was hopping around the field, singing and jumping up and down when he heard a voice. He stopped and looked around, but he didn't see anything. Then he heard the voice again.
"Benny, it's me!" the voice said.
Benny looked around some more and saw a little bird in a tree.
"Are you talking to me?" Benny asked.
"Of course!" the bird replied. 
"My name is Betty and I was just watching you bounce around the wide field. It looks like you are having so much fun!"
Benny smiled and said, "I sure am! I love bouncing around the field!"
Betty laughed and said, "Then keep bouncing! Have fun!"
So Benny continued to jump and bounce around the wide field, enjoying the freedom and being as restless as ever.




Once there was a boy named Tim. He was three years old and very happy. One day while he was playing, he saw a big van outside. He ran over and started to poke it with his fingers. He felt so excited! 
The van door opened and a man stepped out. He had a kind smile and he asked Tim what he was doing. Tim told him he was poking the van. 
The man laughed and said he was a delivery driver. He was very grateful that Tim had been poking his van instead of drawing on it. He gave Tim a big hug and a lollipop. 
Tim thanked the man and ran off excitedly with the lollipop. He was so happy and grateful for the kind man and his surprise treat!




Once upon a time there was a girl who loved puzzles. She loved the feeling of putting them together. One day she had a big plan. She was going to put together a light puzzle.
She took some time to work on it. Every now and then she needed help from her mommy. She asked questions like, Does this piece go here? and How do I make this part fit?
Everyday she would take small breaks to show her progress. Still, she kept working and trying.
Finally, after lots of hard work, she finished her puzzle. She screamed I did it! I finished my puzzle!
Her mommy, who was standing nearby, smiled. I knew you could do it!
The girl was so proud, and the puzzle glowed a bright happy light. It was so pretty that she wanted to show it to everyone.
The end.



Once upon a time, there were two friends. One friend had a game that was cheap. The other friend wanted to play with the game too. So they asked their mom if they could repair it.
But their mom said no. She said that the game was too old and it would cost too much money to fix. The friends were sad.
The two friends decided to find a way to fix the game themselves. They worked hard to find a cheap way to repair it.
After looking online and asking their dad for help, the two friends found the parts they needed to repair the game. They put the pieces together and it worked!
Their mom was very happy. She knew that their hard work would pay off! Now the friends can play the game together.




Once upon a time there was a kind little girl who loved to play. One day, she found a big trunk and decided to open it. Inside, she saw lots of toys. She smiled and ran to tell her mom.
Her mom was very happy and asked the little girl to help fill the trunk with all her toys. The girl was excited and quickly started taking out all her toys, one by one and placing them all in the trunk. 
She even found some of her old toys in the trunk, forgotten and still in good condition. When she was all finished, the trunk was filled with all kinds of toys - big ones, small ones, old ones and new.
The little girl was so proud. She hugged the trunk and thanked her mom for the surprise. 
Moral of the story: Kindness always brings joy.



Once there was a little girl called Amy. She was three years old. She had one little toy - it was her favourite. One day she was playing with it and she wanted to throw it up into the air. She picked it up by the handle and threw it into the air. 
But when the toy came down, it got stuck in a tree! Amy was so confused. She didn't know what to do. She looked around and around but she couldn't see the toy anywhere. 
Suddenly the wind started to blow and the toy fell out of the tree. Amy was so happy! She ran to get it, grabbed the handle and hugged her toy close.
Amy was no longer confused - she was very happy and she threw her toy up into the air again and again.



Once upon a time there was a messy room. No one wanted to go in the messy room. It was too scary and no one felt like they belonged there. 
One day two friends, Sammy and Jack, were playing outside in the garden. Jack saw something look funny in the messy room. He asked Sammy if he wanted to go in and have a look. Sammy was scared but Jack said that it would be safe.
So the two friends went into the messy room. Suddenly, a bunny hopped out from under the bed! Sammy and Jack laughed and ran after it, feeling like they belonged in the messy room at last. 
The bunny was having so much fun that it made the messy room look a little bit better. Sammy and Jack laughed and played all day until it was time for them to go home. 
The bunny stayed in the messy room, feeling like it belonged there too. From then on, Sammy and Jack made sure to visit the bunny and the messy room often.




Once upon a time, there was a nice motor. It bounced along the street, happily chugging along. Everything seemed perfect, until one day, when it started to make a funny noise. A bad noise. The motor tried to bounce faster, but the noise wouldn't go away. Suddenly, the motor stopped bouncing and started smoking. It was sad and it didn't move anymore. The end.



 
One day, John wanted to go and see some dolphins. He was very enthusiastic, so he got dressed quickly and ran to the beach. He saw a family of dolphins that were so friendly. They were playing in the water, swimming around and jumping up and down. 
John waved to them from the beach and they waved their fins back. He clapped his hands and the dolphins swam around him. He was so young, but so enthusiastic about the dolphins. 
Then, it was time for the dolphins to go home. They said goodbye to John and he waved and said goodbye too. John was sad, but he stayed and watched them until they were out of sight. 
John was so happy to see the dolphins and he was already planning his next trip to the beach. He couldn't wait to see them again.




Jack was very excited. It was his first time to write. He had a special pencil and paper and he couldn't wait to get started.
What should I write first? he asked his mom. 
His mom looked down and smiled. Maybe you could draw a picture of a secret nightmare and write a story to go with it.
Jack was so excited that he started to write right away. He drew a picture of a huge dragon and wrote a story about a brave knight who had to fight the dragon. 
He kept writing and writing until he had finished his story. Then, he showed his mom what he had written and she was so proud. 
Jack was so happy and excited that he had written his first story. His mom gave him a big hug. Writing was something he wanted to do again and again.




John was a kind and gentle boy. He always liked to make his friends laugh with silly jokes and games. One day, John and his friends were playing together at the park when they noticed a hang glider in the sky. It was long and colourful, and they began to giggle.
John said, Lets see who can jump the highest! Then we can go hang gliding too! 
His friends agreed, so they all started jumping. But soon, someone started to climb the hang gliders cable and jump on it!
John cried out, Wait! Thats our hang glider!. It was their teacher, Ms. Jones.
Ms. Jones said in a stern voice, What are you doing? I cant trust my pupils to be so silly.
John quickly apologised and told Ms. Jones that he was just trying to show his friends how to hang glider. Ms. Jones replied, I can see that, but please be more careful next time. Now, off you all go! 
John and his friends thanked Ms. Jones for understanding and waved goodbye as she took off on the hang glider. From then on, John and his friends made sure to only play silly games when it was safe and without breaking any rules!




Once upon a time, there was an image. It was hidden in a dark corner so nobody could see it. But it was still there!
One day, a little boy found the image. He knew it was hidden so he was very excited. He wanted to take the image outside to show his friends.
But when he tried to pick up the image, it fell apart. It was old and had rotted away. The little boy was very sad. He wanted to show the image to his friends, but it was gone.
He tried to remember the image in his head. He thought he could tell his friends what the image looked like. He knew he would never forget the hidden image.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lily. She was three years old and very curious about the world. One day, Lily was playing in the garden and she stubbed her knee on a rock. It hurt her very badly and she started to cry. 
A big, kind lady heard Lily's crying and took her into her arms. 
The kind lady asked Lily why she was so upset and Lily told her about the rock. The kind lady smiled and said to Lily, "I know exactly what to do." She then showed Lily how she could use her knee to stand up again. 
Lily was so thankful and she learned that it was useful to have a knee. This helped her to stand strong, without needing anyone's help. 
The moral of the story is that having a knee can be very useful and it helps you with many different things. You should never give up, no matter how hard something is.




Once upon a time there were two friends, Tom and Sarah. Tom was excited about his new toy. He showed it to Sarah and told her how much fun he was having with it.
But then something strange happened. Sarah wanted to play with it too, and she tried to take the toy away. Tom didn't want to share and he struck out at Sarah. He hit her in the lung and she started to cry.
Tom was shocked. He hadn't meant to hurt her. He was just so excited and wanted to show her the toy. He said sorry and hugged Sarah. She was sad, but eventually she forgave him.
Tom and Sarah had a long talk, and they agreed to always share and be gentle with each other. They both learnt a valuable lesson that day. From then on they were more careful and always kind to each other.




Once upon a time there was a family who lived in a house. One day their sink started making funny noises and a small leak began. The father was very frustrated and he did not know what to do.
The father called the plumber to come and take a look. When the plumber arrived, he said to the father: "to fix this, I will need to add a few new parts to the sink". The father agreed and the plumber started to work.
After a few hours, the plumber finished and he said "all fixed". The leak had stopped and the sink was working again. The father was very happy and relieved.
He thanked the plumber and they said goodbye. The family went back to their happy life and they never had a leak again.



Once upon a time there was a shy king who ruled over a kingdom. In his kingdom he had recorders who wrote down everything the king said and did. One day the king was feeling very shy and he decided to hide. He tried to make sure no one could find him. Suddenly one of the recorders noticed the king had gone missing and he declared an alert. The entire kingdom searched everywhere but they could not find the king. Everyone was getting worried. After days of searching the kingdom finally found the king! He had been hiding in the nearby forest. The recorders were overjoyed and they quickly got to work and recorded all the events of the king's disappearance. The kingdom was relieved and the shy king vowed to never hide again.




Mama bear was getting ready for the big race. She put on her helmet which was very expensive. She said goodbye to her little bear cub and told him to cheer for her.
The race started and Mama bear was going very fast. At the same time, her cub started looking around the room. He found an expensive chocolate bar.
He was so excited he started to chew it up!
Mama Bear had finished the race and was very happy. But when she got home, she saw what the cub had done. He had chewed the chocolate bar and it was all gone!
Mama bear looked at the cub sadly and said, You should never chew anything without asking first! We have to respect things, even if they are expensive.
The cub nodded and promised to remember the lesson. He learned he should always think before he chews!




Once there was a little fox named Sam who was very curious. Every day he would explore the forest, looking for new and exciting places to play. One day, he came across a strange tree. It was so strange that he climbed up it without even thinking twice about it. 
When Sam got to the top of the tree, he was amazed. There was a big surprise inside the tree waiting for him - a big bowl full of treats! Sam was so excited that he quickly grabbed a few of the treats and started to eat them. 
Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was the tree! It said "Welcome, little fox. I am the guardian of this tree, and I want to reward you for being brave enough to explore new places. Please, take a few more treats - they are my special reward for being curious." Sam was so happy that he thanked the tree and continued to munch on his treats.
The moral of this story is that if we stay curious and explore new things, we can sometimes be rewarded!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jane and Sarah. They were very good friends and always did fun things together. 
One day, Jane and Sarah decided to plan a special trip. They wanted to go to a temple that was very modern. 
So, Jane and Sarah made plans and got ready for their adventure. The night before they left, they packed their bags and went to bed early. 
The next day, Jane and Sarah drove nearly all day. When they arrived at the temple, they were excited. It was beautiful and modern, just like they expected. 
They spent the day exploring and learning about the temple. Jane and Sarah had a wonderful time. They were happy they had planned such a fun trip.




Once upon a time there was an old man. He used to be strong and full of energy, but now he was very weak. He used to love to play in the garden, but now it was too hard for him to move. 
The old man was very sad. He not only felt tired and lonely, but he suffered greatly. Every day he looked around and saw other people playing and having fun, but he couldn't do the same.
One day, the old man found a disgusting old bug. He was so surprised and scared by it, he said "Hello old creepy bug - why you here?"
The old bug said, "I suffer too, just like you. Look around, there is suffering everywhere. We must try to be kind to each other, even when it is hard." 
The old man was very thankful for the old bug's wise words. They said goodbye and the old man went away feeling much happier than before.




Once upon a time, there were two best friends. They were called Lulu and Jack.
 
One day, Lulu and Jack were playing in the garden when it suddenly got dark. It was time to go inside but Lulu was scared of the dark.
"Jack," said Lulu, "Please get the lamp!" 
So Jack went inside and he found a pale lamp. He carried it outside and put it on the grass. It lit up the garden with a calming, warm light.
Lulu was very happy. She gave Jack a big hug and said, "Thank you for bringing the lamp!"
The two friends played until it was time for them to go to bed. Then they said goodnight and went inside. 
The End.




Once there was a popular boy who everyone loved. He had a special talent for measuring things. One day he decided to use his measuring skills to find out how high the fire was. He wanted to see how far away from the fire he could get.
He started to measure it very carefully. Every time he took a step back the fire seemed to get bigger and bigger. It was almost like it was calling out to him. He felt like he had to get closer and closer. But he just kept measuring the fire.
The fire had grown bigger and bigger, until the popular boy was right in the middle of it! He screamed and cried. But it was too late. The fire had grown too large and he couldn't escape it.
The poor boy was never seen again. Everyone was so sad because of what happened to the popular boy. The only thing they could do was remember his brave spirit and his special talents. They will never forget him.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jenny. She was very creative and she loved to use her imagination in everything she did. She was in her bedroom one day and she noticed something strange.
Jenny: "Mommy, what is that?"
Mom: "That, Jenny, is a bed."
Jenny: "A bed? What's a bed?"
Mom: "Well, a bed is a place to sleep and rest. Now, why don't you climb into it and see what it feels like?"
So Jenny climbed into the bed and she recognized that it was very comfy. She snuggled in and it felt warm and cozy.
Jenny: "Mommy, I like this bed!"
Mom: "That's good, Jenny. You are so creative!"
Jenny smiled and snuggled into the bed even more. From then on, she always remembered the feeling of a bed, and it made her feel safe and secure.



Once upon a time, there was a princess who was feeling very gloomy. She had a big challenge to succeed, but she wasn't sure if she could do it. She was scared it was too hard for her.
But her friends came to help her. They gave her kind words and said, We believe in you, Princess!
The Princess smiled and was feeling brave again. She was determined to succeed and she set out on her mission.
With the help and courage of her friends, she was able to do it. She had succeeded!
Everyone was so proud and they all cheered. The Princess was very happy, and her gloominess was gone.



Once upon a time there was a young girl. She loved to play and explore. One day she wanted to try something new. She asked her mother if she could have a special dish. Her mother said yes and gave the girl a dish. 
The young girl was excited! She took the dish outside and looked closely at it. The dish was full of all sorts of goodies. She couldn't believe her eyes. She took a bit of each thing, and was so happy with what she received. 
The young girl had so much fun tasting all the different things in the dish. She thought it was the best thank she had ever gotten! She ate until she was full and thanked her mother for the dish. The young girl smiled and played the rest of the day. 



Once upon a time, there was a wise old man. Every day, he would stretch his legs in the morning and always have lots of energy to do his chores. He had an old mop that he used to clean up, but he was getting tired of it.
One day, the old man was so fed up that he went out and bought a new mop. The mop was bigger, better, and more efficient than his old one. So he decided to throw away his old one.
That night, a little boy knocked on his door. He said he had been looking for his old mop, but he couldn't find it anywhere. When the old man told him he had thrown it out, the little boy started to cry. 
The old man could feel guilty so he asked the little boy why the mop was important to him. The little boy explained to him that it belonged to his grandmother and that it was very special to him. The old man suddenly felt regret for his actions.
But it was too late and the bad deed was already done. The old man was not so wise after all.




Once there was a strong igloo. It was built by some polar bears and they were very proud of it.
One day a fox was walking around and he saw the igloo. He wanted to see how strong it was, so he decided to cut it with a sharp knife.
He started cutting the igloo but it was too strong for him. A polar bear who had seen the fox cutting came over to him and said:
"Why are you cutting my igloo?"
The fox said he wanted to see how strong it was.
The bear then said,"No cutting! This igloo is a very good home for me and my friends. Leave it alone!"
The fox agreed and he ran away.
The polar bears were very happy because the igloo was still strong. They thanked the bear who had saved their igloo. From then on they kept it even stronger.




Once upon a time there was a kind and patient village. In this village lived a girl named Eva.
One day, Eva went to the village store. She asked the shopkeeper for a new toy. He said no. Eva waved her fist and refused, but the shopkeeper was not angry. He was patient.
Next, Eva took a walk around the village. She passed the village pond, the village field and finally the village church. She asked the church Doorkeeper if she could go inside. He said no. Eva crossed her arms and refused, but the Doorkeeper was not angry. He was patient.
Finally, Eva went home. She asked her mum if she could stay up past bedtime. Her mum said no. Eva stamped her foot and refused, but her mum was still kind and patient.
In the end, the village was proud of Eva. They were happy she was so brave, but they were also proud of her for being so patient.



Mama and Papa took Sarah to the fireplace, and Sarah was excited. She had never been to the fireplace before. Mama and Papa picked up some wood and put it in the fireplace. Sarah said, "Wow!" 
Then Mama lit a match and she lit the wood in the fireplace, and a fire began to burn. Sarah was so amazed! She said, "Look! Fire!" Papa said, "Remember, Sarah, to never touch the fire." 
Next, Sarah and Mama and Papa sat together in front of the fireplace, and they toasted marshmallows. They put them on a stick and held them near the fire, and when they were golden brown, Mama and Papa put the marshmallows in a bowl with some spicy sauce. Sarah smiled, and it made Mama and Papa laugh.
