Suddenly, Mama reached for Sarah's hand and gave it a squeeze to remind her of how hot the fire was. Sarah smiled and said, "I remember!"




Once upon a time, there was a brave explorer who had an eager heart to rescue the world. She packed her bag full of supplies and went to explore. She went on an adventure, taking big steps and smiling the whole way.
Suddenly, the brave explorer came to a big hill. From the top of the hill, she could see a wide world. It was so big that she couldn't believe her eyes!
She noticed something strange. In the middle of the world was a huge lake with a boat stuck inside. She saw somebody waving and shouting, "Help me! Please rescue me!"
The brave explorer was eager to help. She tied her bag to her back and slowly made her way down the hill. When she got to the lake, she jumped in and started to paddle the boat. Within minutes, the person inside was free!
The explorer was so happy she had been able to rescue the world. She waved goodbye to the person in the boat, smiled and took off to explore more!




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Dave. He liked to dig in the garden with his spade. One day, he was poking the ground with his spade, looking for worms.
Suddenly, Dave felt something soft and squishy. He poked harder and out of the soil came a big juicy strawberry! "Wow!" he said. "It looks very tasty!"
Dave picked the strawberry up and took a bite. He chewed it slowly and smiled. It was so yummy!
Just then, he heard his mom calling him.
"Dave, come here," said Mom. "I need some help picking some tomatoes."
Dave nodded and put down his spade. He grabbed the strawberry and took one last bite before running back to his mom.
It had been a great day in the garden!




Once upon a time, there was a clumsy little bear who liked to explore the world. One day, she was walking through a dark and gloomy forest when suddenly she saw a special light. As she got closer, she could see that power was making the light glow. The power was so strong that it was like a magical surprise! 
The little bear was so excited that she jumped up to try to catch the power. But it was too slippery for her little paws and the power just kept on glowing. She tried with all her might to get hold of this special power, but nothing worked. 
Finally, the bear had an idea - she stood still and wished as hard as she could that the power would stay with her. Miraculously, the power understood and it stayed with her like a faithful friend. The bear was so happy that the power was always with her - she felt invincible! 
The little bear explored the forest with the glowing power, never having to worry about darkness or loneliness again. From then on, the clumsy little bear was never afraid!



Once upon a time, there was a man called Mark. Mark liked to speed. He loved it! He would speed everywhere. 
One day, Mark decided to try and speed around the earth! He was so excited. He worked hard and he was patient. He asked a lot of questions and learned lots.
When he was ready, Mark began his mission to speed around the world. It was an amazing sight! He sped and sped and sped. Soon enough, the whole earth had been sped around!
Mark was so pleased with his work. He had done it! He had speeded around the earth. Everyone was cheering and cheering. 
They all thanked him for being so patient and determined. He had been so brave and never gave up. 
Mark had done it! He had sped around the earth.




Once upon a time there was a rabbit named Ralph. Ralph was very popular with all his friends, but he was very shy. Ralph liked to keep a diary. Every day he wrote down all the things that happened with his friends in his diary.
One day, Ralph and his friends caught a group of birds playing in the garden. They decided to shoot the birds with their toy guns. Poor Ralph didn't want to shoot the birds, but his friends kept encouraging him to join in the fun.
Ralph felt really sad so he ran away. Later that night he wrote in his diary about how bad it felt to shoot the birds. He wrote:" It is never fun to hurt an animal, no matter how popular you are." 
Moral of the story: It is okay to be popular, but it is never okay to hurt animals.




Once upon a time there was an alarm. Every morning it was very bright and loud. Every morning it said come!. So everyone came to wake up. Everyone got up and listened to the bright alarm. It said come, come, come!. So everyone came to get dressed and eat breakfast. Then it was time to go to school and play. After school everyone came back home to eat dinner. Then it was time for bed and the alarm said come! again. So everyone came to brush their teeth and take a bath. Then the alarm said come to bed, so everyone came to bed and fell asleep. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a beautiful doll. Her name was Matilda, and she lived in a big white house.
One day, Matilda heard a ring. It was a special ring that meant she had to go to the hospital. Matilda was scared, but the people at the hospital were very kind. They said that Matilda needed an operation.
Matilda did not understand, so the people at the hospital explained. They said that the operation would help Matilda be healthy. All Matilda had to do was take deep breaths while they were doing the operation.
Matilda was still a bit scared, but she took a deep breath and looked around. Everything was very soft and gentle. Matilda felt safe and relaxed. Then, before she knew it, the operation was over. Matilda sighed in relief and smiled.




Once upon a time, there lived a small mouse. The mouse was very happy in her home, until one day a wizard decided to cast a spell. The spell made the mouse very mad, so she decided to strike back. She ran around the wizards house, trying to find a way to stop the spell.
After a lot of looking, the mouse finally found a small book in the wizard's kitchen. It was a special book that could break any spell. She ran back out of the house, grabbed the book, and hurried to the wizard. The mouse bravely offered the book to the wizard and asked him to break the spell. 
The wizard was pleased with the mouses bravery, and used the book to break the spell. The mouse was so happy that she hugged the wizard, thanked him for breaking the spell, and ran back to her home. The mouse was relieved that her home was safe and sound again, and that no spells would strike her! 




Molly was walking in the park. She saw a squirrel, who was looking very bossy perched up on a tree. Molly felt a little scared and shivered. She wanted to get closer and take a better look, but the squirrel was too bossy. 
Suddenly, Molly heard someone call from behind. It was Mary who was also in the park. 
"Hi Molly!" Mary said. "I have some food for the squirrel. Would you like to come and feed it with me?"
Molly smiled and started to walk over to Mary. When the squirrel saw the food, it hopped down from the tree and started eating. Molly and Mary both laughed. Molly was no longer scared, she was so excited to see the squirrel getting all the food. 
At the end of the day, Mary and Molly said goodbye to the squirrel and walked back home. Molly was filled with happiness as she walked away.




One day, there was a famous man named Jack. He liked to jog every morning. He went outside and put on his special socks. The socks were made especially for running. They were very soft, and he felt comfy in them.
Jack started to jog around the park. He ran past a lake, a tree and a big, green hill. He jogged around and around for a long time. He felt happy and truly enjoyed his morning jog.
When he was finished jogging, Jack started to wave to the people around him. Some clapped and cheered, because he was famous! Jack smiled and felt very proud.
The next morning, Jack put on his special jogging socks and started to jog around the park again. He didn't feel tired at all and it felt really good to stretch his legs. He jogged around and around, smiling with joy as he waved to the people around him.




Once there was a little boy who loved to touch things. He touched everything he saw. One day, he saw a secret box that was tucked away in a corner of the room. It was a very special box and he knew it had something special inside. He touched the box and he liked the way it felt. His friend saw him touching it and she got very nosy. She asked what was inside the box and the little boy said it was a secret. No matter how much she asked, he wouldn't tell and kept the secret safe. The nosy friend argued and begged, but the little boy didn't change his mind. He kept the special secret inside the box.




Once upon a time, there was a kind man. He was walking in the park and he saw a bird on top of a tree that was trying to make a nest. 
The man smiled and pulled out a bottle of spray from his pocket. He sprayed the tree with the spray, and the bird hopped onto a branch.
"Thank you," the bird said. "Now I can finish my nest!"
The man laughed. "You're welcome," he said.
He then reached into his bag and pulled out some money. He smiled as he handed it to the bird.
"Go buy yourself a nice meal," he said.
The bird was so happy! He chirped and hopped away with the money.
The man watched him go with a big smile. He was so kind to help the bird out!




Once upon a time there was a girl called Daisy. Daisy loved playing in the park and playing with her friends. One day, Daisy was playing in the park and her friends had a kite, which looked so fun!
Daisy's friends asked her: "Do you want to fly the kite with us?"
Daisy was so excited and said, "Yes, of course!"
Together they flew the kite and it was so much fun. Daisy felt so happy, but at the same time she was a bit scared, because the wind made the kite go so high!
Suddenly, the wind stopped and the kite fell down. Everyone was scared and Daisy felt her heart beating so fast.
But luckily, the kite was alright and Daisy and her friends were so relieved.
The next morning, Daisy went back to the park and flew her own kite. She felt so brave and happy and the wind was so gentle. Daisy flew her kite until the sun went down and she was so proud of herself.




Mommy and Jimmy went to the fancy mall. Jimmy was three years old, so he was very excited. Everywhere he looked he could see something amazing.
 
Mommy said, Do you think you can find something here that will fit you?
Jimmy said, Yes, I can do that, mommy.
 
They went to the toy store at the mall. Jimmy looked around and found something that was so fancy. He saw a shiny red race car and said, I want this one!
 
Mommy said, Lets see if it fits.
Jimmy held up the car and it fit perfectly in his hands. He was so happy. He looked up to his mommy and said Mommy, I found something that fits! 
 
Mommy smiled and said, Thats great. Now lets go see if we can find something that fits me!




The little boy's eyes lit up with surprise when he saw the tall building. It seemed to be glowing in the sunlight. He wanted to go closer and explore it. 
So, the little boy started to walk towards the building. He was so excited! But when he got close to the building, something strange happened. He felt a vast, empty feeling inside. He tried to understand why he felt this way.
Suddenly, he heard a loud sound. Then he felt a big gust of wind. The tall building was starting to shake and crumble. He was scared and ran away from the building, but it was too late. The building crashed down and the little boy was sadly trapped beneath it. He cried for help, but no one heard him. 
The little boy will never forget that tall glowing building and the immense feeling of surprise he felt that day. Sadly, the surprise had a bad ending.




Once upon a time, there were two sisters. Their names were Jane and Marie. Jane was three years old and Marie was five years old. 
One day Marie said to Jane, "Let's play a game". Jane was excited and said, "Yes, what will we play?" Marie said, "Let's pretend that we have a pot full of healthy rice". Jane replied, "How do we do that?" Marie said,  "We just have to believe".
Jane and Marie smiled and immediately started to imagine that there was a pot full of healthy rice. They both said, "We believe there is a pot full of healthy rice". 
Suddenly, Jane heard a sound. She looked around the room and saw the pot of healthy rice she and her sister had believed in. Jane and Marie both were amazed and hugged each other, excited for their game. They laughed and enjoyed their pot of healthy rice for days and days!




Once upon a time, a little boy found a big boot. It had a sparkle in it, so he decided to keep it. He named the boot Lucky and carried it with him wherever he went.
One day, while he was walking across the meadows, he saw an old man stuck up in a tree. The little boy was so scared that he wanted to run away, but then he remembered his lucky boot. He knew it could come in handy, so he decided to stay.
He called up the old man and said, "Please don't be scared, I will help you." Then he put on the large boot and started to push the tree aside. The old man thanked the little boy and said, "You are so brave and so lucky. You were able to save me with your boot."
The little boy was very lucky to have his boot, but it also reminded him of how important it is to help people in need. If you are ever in trouble, make sure to ask for help, because someone will be there for you.



Once upon a time, there was an incredible paint box. It was full of lots of wonderful colors that made the world brighter. 
One day, a brave 3 year old wanted to try something big. He dared to open the paint box, and mix all the colors together.
He stirred and stirred, until all the paint was gone! When he opened his eyes, an incredible sight greeted him. 
All around him were bright swirls of paint that he had created. It was the prettiest thing he had ever seen. He was so proud of what he had done,
that he ran to tell his family all about it. They all agreed that it was truly incredible!



Once upon a time there was a little boy called Chris. Chris was three years old and he was very brave. His favourite thing to do was to go to the circus. One day Chris went to the circus and he saw a clown. He was so excited and started to laugh. The clown saw Chris and he bent down and said to him, "Why are you so proud Chris?
Chris smiled and said, "I'm proud because I'm brave enough to come here to the circus by myself."
The clown laughed and said, "You should always be proud of yourself! Being brave is an amazing thing!"
Chris nodded and was so proud that he offered to help the clown with his show. The clown was so happy and he said to Chris, "Thank you for your help! Now let's start the show!"
Chris smiled and was so excited to help the clown. Together the clown and Chris put on an amazing show for all the people at the circus. They did tricks, made people laugh and everyone was very happy.
At the end of the show, everyone gave Chris and the clown a big round of applause. Chris was so proud of himself that he couldn't stop smiling. He looked up at the clown and gave him a big thumbs up.
The clown smiled and said, "Thanks for your help Chris, you really made this show amazing!"
Chris was beaming with pride as he walked out of the



Once upon a time, there was a girl. She loved her bracelet. It was made of thin threads and tiny rocks. It was very pretty, and the girl wore it all the time.
One day, the girl was playing in the garden. Suddenly, she saw a small butterfly and tried to follow it! The butterfly flew so quickly and she ran fast, but the bracelet on her arm kept getting in the way.
The girl looked down at her beautiful bracelet, and decided to make it smaller so she could chase the butterfly more easily. She took out a pair of scissors and carefully cut the threads until the bracelet fit perfectly. 
The girl was very happy with her new bracelet, and she raced around the garden, chasing after the butterfly. She was thrilled that her bracelet was so small and she could play without it getting in her way.




Adam was walking down the street. He felt nervous because the city was a new and strange place. All around him there were lots of people, and lots of big cars. Cars are called automobiles.
Adam wasn't sure where to go. He was getting more and more nervous. Then, a friendly man in a car stopped near him and asked, "Do you need help?"
Adam nodded. He knew that to nod means to say yes without words.
The kind man smiled. "Hop in and I'll take you where you need to go."
Adam was very happy. He smiled and climbed in to the automobile. Then, he sat back and relaxed. With a friendly nod from the man, he was soon on his way.



Once upon a time, there were two friends, a banana and an apple. They were very different. The banana was yellow and soft, and the apple was red and crunchy.
The two friends wanted to unite and be different at the same time. So they decided to put on colorful clothes. The banana put on a green shirt and a blue hat and the apple put on a yellow shirt and a purple hat.
When they both had on their colorful clothes, they looked very nice together. Everyone in the park noticed and smiled.
The banana and the apple decided to take a walk and found more colorful friends. They all united together and made the park full of color!
The banana and apple went back to the park every day and made more colorful friends. They all blessed the park with their joy and united to make it even more beautiful.




Jack and his mom were at the park. Jack saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. He looked up at the leaves and saw lots of apples. His mom smiled and said, Pick some apples. They look tasty.
Jack was excited! He started running up the tree, picking the apples off the branches. He was careful not to let any of them fall. He came back down with his arms full of apples. His mom said, Lets go home now. We can make a yummy apple pie.
Jack and his mom went home to make the pie. Jack stirred the apples and sugar together in the bowl. His dad was so excited, he said it smelled very tasty! After the pie was cooked and cooled, Jack, his mom, and his dad ate it. It was delicious!
After dinner, Jack and his dad played a game of catch. They laughed and smiled as the ball went from one to the other. Jack was so happy and said, This was the best day ever!




Ryan and his Dad were in the car. Ryan was asking lots of questions.
Daddy, where are we going?
Were driving to the hospital. Remember, you have to go for an x-ray.
Can we drive fast? asked Ryan.
No, not today. We have to go slow because you are feeling sleepy.
They drove for another 30 minutes until they reached their destination.
When they arrived, Ryan and his Dad went inside the hospital to get the x-ray. After they had finished, they got back into the car and drove home. 
On the way, Ryan was feeling much more awake, and he asked his Dad if they could drive faster.
Sure, we can go faster now, Dad replied with a smile. 
And so Dad quickly drove home and the two of them had the best ride ever!



 Once there was a poor family. One day, they saw an amazing luxury appear in the distance. It was a big, fancy house with a big garden behind it. They thought maybe they could stay there if they asked the owners nicely.
The family knocked on the door of the house. A kind old man opened the door and welcomed them in. He said they could stay in the house as long as they wanted. They were so happy and felt so peaceful now that they were going to have a luxury stay.
The old man offered them food and asked them what their plan was. But the family had no plan, so the old man said, "I'll tell you what, I'll give you this house, so you can stay here forever, and never worry about money again." The family was overjoyed and thanked the old man.
But when they went inside the house, they realized that their dream of a peaceful, luxurious stay was just an illusion. The old man had tricked them! Inside the house, there were many hidden cameras and microphones. The old man was watching and listening to everything they did!
The family was devastated. They had realized too late that the old man's generosity was only a trap. They had to escape the house before the old man caught them. The family ran away in the dark of night, never to appear in that house again.




Once upon a time there was an old, fancy house. It was very true and strong. Everyone who saw it was amazed.
One day a little mouse wanted to repair the house. He worked hard, but the house was too old to repair. He kept trying but it didn't work. The mouse was very sad.
The mouse told True, who owned the house, his bad news. True was so sad that the house couldn't be repaired. For the rest of his days, True never had a fancy house.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Toby. Toby had a unique way of learning. His mom knew he was special so every day she would try to teach him new things. One day she decided to teach Toby about sharks. She told Toby that sharks were a special type of fish and showed him pictures of them. Toby was fascinated and couldn't wait to learn more. 
The next day, Toby's mom took him to the beach so he could see a real shark. When they got there, Toby saw a giant shark swimming in the water and he was fascinated. He asked his mom a lot of questions and she was happy to teach him all about the shark. 
After that, Toby became obsessed with sharks. He drew them in his drawings and asked his mom questions about them all the time. Toby had discovered something unique that could only be taught by his mom and he was excited to share it with the world.




Once there was a little girl who was very tidy. She was playing in her room when she heard something very loud outside. She opened the window to see what it was and she saw a big whale. She was surprised and ran outside. The whale was very friendly and opened its mouth so the little girl could take a look inside. The little girl was so amazed at the whale's tidy mouth. She counted four rows of teeth and saw lots of little fish swimming around inside. Then the whale started to swim away. The little girl waved goodbye as the whale went off on its journey. The little girl never forgot her adventure with the tidy whale.



One day, there was a girl who wanted to pour something onto her garden. She grabbed a bucket and filled it with water. She was a bit nervous because she had never done this before.
She asked her mom for help. Her mom said, "Let's do it together!"
The girl and her mom walked to the garden. They slowly poured the water, making sure it covered all of the plants. When they were finished, the girl was relieved. She said, "I was so nervous!"
Her mom smiled and said, "You did a great job. Now, let's go inside and have a snack."
They went back to the house and ate a yummy snack. The girl was happy that she was brave enough to do something new. She was proud of her garden, and knew it would stay nice and healthy.




Once there was a mother and a daughter. The daughter was very graceful and used to dance all the time. One day, the mother decided to take her daughter to a competition where they had to score the best points to win. The daughter was very excited to take part.
On the day of the competition, the mother and daughter did their best. The daughter danced gracefully and showed everyone her talent. After the scores were tallied, the daughter was expecting to win. But sadly, she had only scored the last place. 
The mother was so disappointed that she decided to go home. The daughter followed her, feeling sad. The mother had been hoping for the best, but it wasn't meant to be. 
The mother and daughter sadly went home and the daughter was never able to participate in the competition again. The story had sad end with mother and daughter disappointed.



 
Once upon a time, there were two friends named Sam and Joe. Sam and Joe were always together and were the best of friends. One day, they were playing in the their garden and they saw a branch. Sam said, "I will steal the branch." Joe was jealous and said, "I want to steal the branch too!" So they both ran over to the branch, but Sam was bigger and faster and reached the branch first. Joe became so jealous that he pushed Sam down and took the branch all for himself. Sam was very sad, but Joe just ran away with the branch.




There was once a little girl who loved to sing a beautiful song. Whenever she felt happy, she would sit in the sun and sing it out loud.
One day, the little girl asked her mom if she could go to the park. Her mom said yes and the little girl was so excited; she couldn't wait to get to the park and sing her song. When she arrived, she sat on the swing and started to sing.
Suddenly, the sky began to darken and the little girl noticed something frightening. It was a big, dark cloud that seemed to be getting closer and darker. She stopped singing and started to feel scared.
The little girl's mom called out to her, "We must run, it is about to rain!" The little girl got up from her seat and ran with her mom. The storm was getting stronger as they ran away from the park. Unfortunately, they didn't make it in time and they both got caught in the rain.
The little girl had a bad ending, but it was foreshadowed when the sky began to darken.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She was very fond of playing. One day, she and her Mama were walking together in the city.
Amy said to her Mama, "I see a shop!"
Mama pointed around and said, "Yes, that's a shop. Do you want to take a closer look?"
Amy said, "Yes please!"
When they got to the shop, it was very filthy. Amy was surprised to see how dirty it was.
Mama said, "Look at all the dirt! We should not go in there. Let's go somewhere else."
Amy said, "Ok, Mama."
So Amy and her Mama went to a different shop instead. It was much cleaner and Amy was happy.
The end.




Once upon a time there was a baby called Andy. He loved playing with his favourite blanket. It was fancy, with little stars and moons on it.
One day his mommy said with a smile, "Andy, we are going to raise your blanket up in the air!"
Andy was so excited to see what would happen. He could feel the blanket becoming lighter and lighter. Then, all of a sudden, Andy was lifted off the ground. He squealed with delight as he flew through the air, the blanket swishing around him.
Mommy had raised Andy high in the air on the blanket! It was like a fancy special magic ride! Andy laughed and laughed as he spun around. All of his family and friends clapped with joy to see him so happy.
Andy flew higher and higher and just when he thought he was reaching the sky, he fell gently down to the ground.
The magic was over, and Andy was sad - until his mommy said, "Who wants to go round again?" Andy shouted with joy, "Me, me!"



Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She was only three years old. One day, Lucy went to visit her friend, Sam. Sam had a flute. Sam showed Lucy how to make music with the flute.
Lucy was so excited that she wanted to play with it all day. They played together until it was time for Lucy to go home. Before she left, Sam gave Lucy the flute as a present.
Lucy was so happy that she took the flute home with her. She practiced and practiced until she was an organized flutist. Every day she taught herself something new and eventually she was able to play beautiful music.
This new skill changed Lucy's life. She loved playing her flute and was now more confident than ever. Lucy had learned to turn the flute into beautiful music and was now on her way to achieving her dreams.




Once upon a time there was a family who wanted to visit the ocean. They wanted to see the whales, so they packed their bags and went to the beach.
When they arrived, they looked out over the water. Suddenly they saw a big, sleepy whale swimming near the shore. They waved, and the whale waved back! 
The family stayed for a while and watched the whale swim around. Soon it was time to go home, so the family thanked the whale for the visit and gave it a big goodbye.
The family went back home with happy memories of the sleepy whale. They looked forward to visiting again soon!




Once upon a time there was a university that glowed. It was so very cheerful, making everyone around it smile.
One day, a little girl came to explore the university. She was so excited to see such a happy place. Everywhere she looked, the university glowed. It made her so delighted.
When she was inside, the girl made a new friend - a puppy! Together, they played different games and laughed together. As they laughed, the university glowed even more.
The little girl had so much fun that she didn't want to leave. But soon the sun had set and the university stopped glowing.
The little girl said goodbye to her puppy friend and went home. She was so cheerful and happy that she had visited the wonderful university with it's special glow.



One day, two best friends were playing together. It was a sunny day, but suddenly it started to get cold. The two friends shivered and hugged each other. 
The first friend asked the second friend, "What do you think we should do?" The second friend had an idea. He said, "Let's go find the warmest place we can!" 
So the two friends set off on their search. They looked all around, but nothing seemed to be warm enough. That's when they spotted an expensive house with a chimney deeper than the tallest tree. 
The first friend asked the second, "What do you think? Will it be nice and warm inside?" His opinion was that it would be freezing cold. He said, "No way, it looks too fancy." 
The second friend disagreed. "Let's go find out," she said. And so, the two brave friends went inside the expensive house. To their surprise, it was nice and toasty warm. The two best friends couldn't believe it! 
They both agreed that it was their best opinion ever. From that day forward, they both knew never to judge a place by how expensive it looks.




Mum and Dad said it was time to go on an adventure. But their little girl was scared. She didn't want to leave the house. She shook her head and said, "No!"
Mum and Dad told her it would be fun and showed her the special passport that they had. It was shiny and new. The little girl looked at it and a tiny smile spread across her face.
Mum and Dad said they needed to leave soon. But the little girl wanted to stay home. She started to cry. Mum told her they would be back soon and not to mind.
The little girl hugged Mum and Dad and watched them walk away. She knew they would come back soon and that made her feel a bit better. Now she just had to mind until they were back.




Once upon a time, there was a man who lived all by himself. Every day, he would look out the window of his house. One day, he saw something strange. It was a woman. She looked very happy, but the man did not know who she was. 
He asked his neighbor, but the neighbor said he did not know her. The man began to look for her every day. He looked in parks, in cafes, and in shops. But he could not find her. 
One day, he decided to try one last place. He looked in the temple, and there she was! The man was so shocked, he said hello to the woman. She said hello back and asked him why he was looking for her. The man said, Because you are my wife!" The woman was very surprised. She had been looking for her husband too! They both were so happy, and the man knew his long search was finally over.




Once upon a time, there were two friends called Andy and Brooke. Andy was taller than Brooke.
One day, they were playing outside in the sun and they got very hot. Andy said to Brooke "It's too hot out here, let's go inside". 
So they went inside and sat down at the kitchen table. Brooke said "What shall we do now?".
Andy said "Let's make some apple pies for us to eat!" 
So Brooke started cutting the apples with her knife and Andy put the apples in the bowl. 
Then Andy put some sugar, cinnamon and butter into the bowl and stirred it all together. 
After that, he rolled out the pastry and Brooke put it in the pie dish. 
Then Andy poured the apple mix into the dish and he put some pastry leaves on top. 
Finally, he put the pie dish in the oven and said "It will be done in 15 minutes."
15 minutes later Andy took the pie out of the oven and said "The apple pie is finished. Let's eat it while it's still warm!" 
So they both ate the pie and it was delicious. The end!




Once upon a time, there was a small bunny named Peter. Peter loved hopping around the garden and exploring. One day, Peter saw a wooden board in the bushes. He got closer to inspect it and noticed it was extra long, shiny and polished. He decided he wanted to hop on it so he hopped on it.
"This board is comfortable," he thought to himself, feeling the wood on his little feet. But then, Peter noticed something. The board was actually quite slippery!
He hopped off and there, Peter could see the board was actually placed over a stream. Peter was scared to hop back on the board, but then he noticed the stream was so sparkly and pretty that he decided to give it a go.
He took one big hop and before he knew it, he was making it across the stream and onto the other side. 
"That wasn't so uncomfortable after all!" he said happily.
Since then, Peter had made it his mission to hop on every shiny board he could find, learning to always be brave and never give up.




Once there was a little girl who was feeling very lonely. Then one day she spotted a box in the corner of the room. She opened the box and she saw that it was filled with nice clothes. She was so excited and she quickly removed them one by one. She put the clothes on, and for the first time in a long time, she didn't feel lonely anymore. She twirled around in the room, feeling so happy with her new clothes. From that day on, her room was no longer lonely and she knew she'd never be lonely again.




Mommy and Daddy were sitting in the kitchen, drinking their coffee. Daddy suggested they should go out for a walk. Mommy said she was tired and suggested they just stay home and relax. 
Daddy said he was feeling restless. He suggested they turn up the music so that the house would no longer feel so quiet. Mommy said it would be too noisy for her and shook her head.
Daddy sighed and said he was bored. He suggested they go outside, but Mommy said it was too hot. Daddy threw up his hands and shook his head. 
Suddenly, Daddy had an idea. He suggested they have a picnic in their living room. Mommy smiled and said that was a great idea. So they quickly made some sandwiches and spread out some blankets. Daddy put on some calm, quiet music, and they enjoyed their picnic together.



Once upon a time, there was a tall duck. He wanted to swim, but there was a wall in his way. He tried and tried to find a way to get over the wall.
Finally, he spotted a tall tree. He waddled over and climbed to the top. From there, he could see over the wall. He jumped down and landed on the other side.
Then, the tall duck spread his wings and started to swim. He swam and swam until he got tired. Then he hopped onto a big rock to take a rest.
He watched the sun setting in the sky and then flew back home. From then on, he went swimming every day.




Once upon a time, there lived a boy called Sam. He was always very quiet and liked making gentle sounds. One day, Sam's mommy told him, "It's time to go outside and play with your friends, Sam!" Sam was tired, so he replied, "No mommy, I wanna stay home." 
Mommy was frustrated. She came over to Sam's room, knelt down beside him and said, "Go out now, Sam. It's important for you to spend time outside with your friends." Sam didn't want to listen and just stayed in bed.
But mommy kept on encouraging him. She said, "If you go outside, you'll make great sounds with your friends. Come on now, you won't regret it!" Sam thought about it and got out of bed. 
At first, Sam was tired and a bit grumpy, but after playing outside a while, he started to make all kinds of happy sounds with his friends. He could hardly believe all the fun things they did! 
At last, it was time to go inside. Sam was so joyful and thanked his mommy for encouraging him go out. This story teaches us that it's important to take the time out of our day to enjoy nature, spend time with friends and make happy sounds.




Once upon a time, there lived a happy little girl named Lucy. She was always excited to go on adventures. 
One day, Lucy heard about a special zoom where she could go with her mommy and daddy. She was so excited she rushed to tell her mommy.
"Mommy, daddy, can we go on the zoom?" she asked. 
Her mommy and daddy smiled. "Yes, we can go on the zoom! It's going to be so much fun," said Mommy.
So the next day, when all the family got dressed up and went on the zoom, Lucy was so happy! 
When they got to the zoom, Lucy saw that lots of people were all around them. Mommy and Daddy took Lucy's hand and told her that everyone was at the zoom to watch them get married! 
Lucy was so excited! She had never seen a wedding before and now it was her mommy and daddy getting married!
The family said their special vows and got married. Lucy had the best time at the zoom and always remembered this special day when her mommy and daddy got married.




Once upon a time there was a big, smelly cow. The cow's name was Moo Moo. Moo Moo was sick and didn't feel very good. So Moo Moo's mommy demanded that they buy a thermometer. Moo Moo's mommy went to the store and bought the thermometer. 
When Moo Moo and her mommy came home, Moo Moo's mommy put the thermometer under Moo Moo's tongue. It was a little weird, but Moo Moo did not mind. After a few minutes, the thermometer told Moo Moo's mommy what her body temperature was. 
Moo Moo's mommy was happy she had the thermometer, because it told her what was wrong with Moo Moo. She took her to the doctor, who gave her medicine that made Moo Moo feel better in no time. 
Moo Moo's mommy was very grateful that she had the thermometer, because it helped her take good care of Moo Moo.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was 3 years old and full of joy. Every day she liked to skip around her neighbourhood with her friends. 
One day, when she was out skipping, she noticed something strange. There were lots of different kinds of cars in the street. Some were moving quickly and some were standing still. The little girl had never seen so many cars before. 
She asked her friend, "What are these things?". Her friend said "That is traffic. It is modern". The little girl couldn't understand what that meant, so they decided to skip away. 
But the little girl still remembered the busy traffic, and she knew that something different and modern was happening.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Penny. She was only three years old, but she was very brave and determined.
One day she decided to perform a special show for her family. She got up on a chair and started singing and dancing. Her family watched with big smiles on their faces.
When Penny finished her performance her mom clapped loudly and said, "That was amazing! Well done Penny!"
But Penny just seemed frustrated. She looked around and said, "That's all? Is there more I can do?"
Her parents laughed and said, "Yes, if you want to you can do more. But for now why don't you have a penny for your performance?"
Penny smiled and ran over to get the penny. She held it tightly in her hand and thanked her mom and dad for the extra treat. From that day on, Penny loved to perform for her family.




Once upon a time there was a boy named Alex. He was 3 years old and he loved playing outside in the garden.
One evening, while playing in the garden, Alex heard something in the bushes. It sounded quite strange. He stood still and listened.
Suddenly, out from the darkness hopped a small, brown bunny. Alex had never seen him from before. 
"Hi there" the little bunny said. "I was just looking for a pin in the bushes".
Alex was a little disturbed by the bunny, but he was also a little curious. 
"What do you need a pin for?" he asked the bunny.
The little bunny held up a ball of wool and said: "I want to hold the wool together, but I need a pin to do it".
Alex was now feeling less disturbed. He had seen his Mommy using pins when she sewed. So he reached down and picked up a pin from the ground.
He handed it to the bunny who smiled and thanked him. Then he hopped away back into the dark. 
Alex smiled and went back to playing in the garden.




Jill was a yoga master. She was very wise and knew lots of different poses. Every day, she would go to a special place and practice her yoga moves.
One day, while she was doing her yoga, an ignorant man came and tried to pull her away. He shouted at her that she should stop doing silly poses. Jill was very angry and used her yoga moves to show him a lesson.
She jumped up in the air and did a handstand. She stretched her legs out until they were super strong. Jill then popped back up and glared at the man. He had no idea how to react, so he ran away.
Jill smiled and kept practicing her yogas. She was happy to teach the ignorant man a lesson.




Once upon a time, there was a lively boy named Tim. He was very happy and liked to play all day. One day, Tim had the best idea ever! He wanted to make a cake. He grabbed the ingredients from the cupboard and started to mix them together. Suddenly, his mom called from the other room. She was in trouble and she needed Tim's help to save her! Tim quickly ran over to help. He was so brave!
When the danger was gone, Tim and his mom went back to make his cake. They mixed the ingredients until everything was perfect. Then he put the cake in the oven. After a while, the timer went "ding!" and the cake was ready.
Tim and his mom took the cake out of the oven and it looked delicious! Tim was so proud of his creation. He invited all his friends over to eat the cake and they had a very lively celebration. Everyone was happy and having a good time.
Tim had saved his mom and made a delicious cake! It was an amazing day for Tim.




Once upon a time there was a busy little girl. She was always wearing her favorite red jacket. She loved her jacket so much, she never wanted to take it off. 
One day she decided to take the jacket off and go to the park. The sun was shining and it felt nice without the jacket.
At the park, the little girl saw a bonfire. She stared at the blaze, mesmerized. She said, "I want to go burn my jacket in the fire too!" 
Her mom shook her head. "No, honey. That's not safe. You could get hurt!"
Little girl pouted and said, "But mama, I want to burn my jacket!"
Mom frowned and said, "No, honey. You can't burn your jacket. It is too dangerous."
The little girl was disappointed. She knew her mom was right, but she still wished she could burn her jacket. She went back to the park, quietly watched the flames, and dreamed of the day she could safely burn her jacket.



Once upon a time there was a creative clown. He liked to have fun and make people laugh. One day he decided he wanted to take a bath. He filled the tub with warm water and bubbles and hopped right in. He laughed and splashed around, so happy to be enjoying a fun bath. After a while, he hopped out and put on his colorful clown costume. He went out to the park to entertain the kids with all his clowning around. They loved to watch him be creative and excitedly laughed and cheered. The creative clown was so happy and ready to have fun!




One day, little David was playing in the garden with his father. He saw a pretty rope that his father had left there. He asked his father, What is this rope for? 
His father replied, It is to pinch the leaves off of the trees. 
Little David was curious and asked, Can I try? His father answered, Sure, my little one. 
David grabbed the pretty rope, and he started pinching the leaves off of the trees. His father smiled and said, You are doing a great job! 
David was so proud and happy to be helping his father. He felt like a big boy! He kept pinching until all of the leaves were gone. Then he said to his father, Thank you for letting me help. 
His father smiled and said, You did a great job, my little one.



Once upon a time, there were two best friends called Steve and Alex.
One day, Steve and Alex were playing a game in the garden. They were having fun and laughing together. Suddenly, Steve saw a wide tree and thought it would be fun to climb it. He went over to the tree and started to climb up and up.
Alex was scared, because she had never seen Steve climb that high before. She wanted him to come down but he wouldn't stop. So she got really mad and slapped the tree.
Steve was very surprised and he quickly climbed down. Alex was happy and she hugged Steve. They both agreed that it was a silly game and that it was time to find something else to do. So, they both went inside and played a different game.




Once there was a little girl who was feeling very lonely. No one ever wanted to play with her.
One day, the little girl got an idea. She decided to make something pretty so that maybe somebody would want to be her friend. She found some pretty pink paper, a pencil and some glue.
Then she started to make a very beautiful card. When she was done she felt very happy.
But then something terrible happened. When she was getting ready to give it to someone, she dropped it and it tore into pieces. She felt so sad and was about to cry.
Suddenly, her mommy came in. She saw the mess and asked why the paper was on the floor. The little girl told her mommy everything, she was so scared that she would be punished.
But her mommy was very kind. She hugged her and said that if she was careful the next time, there would be no need to punish her. And the little girl was very happy.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was feeling scared as it was suddenly very dark outside. The wind was so cold that it made her shiver.
Suddenly she heard a strange noise in the air. It was like something big was flying towards her. She wrote and hid behind a tree.
But then what she saw was amazing! A huge purple dragon had come to give her a big surprise! She was so happy and waved her hands to give it a welcome.
The dragon stepped down from the sky and gave the little girl a big hug. She didn't shiver anymore. She knew she was safe.
The dragon said its goodbyes, flapped its huge purple wings and flew away into the night.
The little girl was never scared anymore. She felt safe and happy and knew that the purple dragon was always looking out for her.



Once upon a time there was a charming girl. She wanted to go on an adventure. So she left her house to explore a nearby forest.
As she started walking, she noticed a pipe in the ground. She bent down and picked it up. It was so shiny and new! She carried the pipe with her as she walked deeper into the woods.
Soon the sky grew dark, and the girl couldn't see anymore. She realized that it was time to leave. She hugged the pipe close and said goodbye to the forest.
The girl returned home feeling happy and excited. She had been on a great adventure and found a shiny pipe! She couldn't wait to show her friends her charming new treasure.




Once upon a time there was a boy. His name was Jake. Jake was three-years-old. One day, he wanted to explore so he entered a big room. He saw a long, comfy couch. It looked so cozy that he lay down on it.
Suddenly, he felt something cold! He jumped off the couch. He looked under the couch and saw a small, white kitten.
"Hi," said the kitten, "I'm so cold. Can I come stay with you?"
Jake smiled. He said, "Yes! You can stay with me. Come up here and warm up next to me on the couch."
The kitten curled up on the couch next to Jake and they snuggled together until they were both nice and warm again. From that day on, Jake and the kitten were best friends.




Once upon a time, there was a girl. She had lots of stuff. Every day she would get new things, and she loved to count them. She counted everyday things like spoons and books, but also strange, special things like feathers from a bird and a shell from the beach.
One day, her mommy decided it was time to go on an adventure. They went deep into the woods. Everywhere they looked, they saw new things. The girl was so excited to count all the new stuff that she found. She found bugs, leaves and twigs...she counted and counted and counted! 
They got deeper and deeper into the woods. The girl was having a great time, so she kept counting until...she reached the deepest part of the woods. There, they discovered something really special - a beautiful lake full of fish. The girl was amazed. She loved counting all the fish swimming around. 
When it was time to go home, the girl said goodbye to the lake with a heavy heart. She knew she'd be back soon. After all, she still had lots of stuff to count!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Hannah. She was three years old. She enjoyed playing outside with her toy cars. The cars had little engines that made a buzzing sound.
One day, while she was outside, her mom called to her.
"Hannah, don't ride your cars too fast! It's dangerous," said her mom. 
But Hannah was very curious. She wanted to find out what it felt like to ride her car fast.
So, she revved up the engine and sped away. As she was riding, the engine got louder and louder. Suddenly, the car wouldn't stop! It was going faster and faster. Hannah was scared!
Hannah started screaming for help. Suddenly, her mom ran out of the house and ran after her. Hannah's mom caught up with her daughter, and stopped her.
"I told you not to ride your car fast, Hannah! You could have been in danger!" said her mom.
Hannah learned her lesson, and she never rode her car fast again.




John and his mom were climbing a mountain. They came to a very steep part of the mountain, and John's mom told him to trust the rope that was holding them up. But John didn't trust it. He said, "No! What if it breaks?"
His mom said that he should trust it, but John refused. He was being very rude.
John's mom said, "Trust is important. If you trust the rope, we will be able to get to the top of the mountain. There's nothing to worry about." John listened and he trusted the rope.
He grabbed onto the rope and started to climb. It was a long climb, but eventually, they made it to the top. John was proud of himself, and realized that sometimes it is important to trust.




Once upon a time there was a boy named Tom. Tom had an uncle who he loved very much. One day Tom wanted to do something special for his uncle, so he decided to climb a high tree. 
He asked his uncle to help him get up, but his uncle said he had to do it by himself. Tom was determined to do it, so he made his way up the high tree. He was so proud when he made it to the top and looked down at his uncle below. 
His uncle was so impressed that he gave Tom a big hug when he got down safely. Tom and his uncle decided to do this every week and have lots of fun together. 
The end.



  
Once, there was a girl named Jackie. She loved animals - she dreamed of them all the time and wished she could go on a safari. One day her wish became a reality - her dad had decided they would go on a safari!
Jackie was so excited she couldn't wait. But then, she realized something - she didn't have the proper clothes to wear. She needed something that fit just right and was suitable for the safari. She searched every closet and drawer but couldn't find the perfect outfit.
Jackie was about to give up hope when suddenly something amazing happened. Her best friend, Samantha, presented her with a safari outfit! It fit perfectly and Jackie was overjoyed.
Jackie and Samantha soon were on their way to the safari with Jackie wearing her new outfit. Jackie looked around in awe and realized that her dream had come true - she was actuallly on a safari!




One day, Billy 's mommy took him to the park. It was a big, sunny place full of fun and games.
As they walked around, they saw some birds flying in the sky, their wings making sharp movements in the air.
Billy then saw some children playing with a map. It looked very interesting. He wanted to play with them but they were too noisy.
"Billy, we need to be quieter," said mommy. "We don't have to shout to have fun. Being quiet can be more enjoyable".
Billy was upset that he couldn't play with the children and their map, but he understood that it was important to be polite and not too loud.
From that day, Billy and his mommy had lots of fun together playing games and exploring without being too noisy. They both learned that being respectful of others is often more fun than being too loud.



Once upon a time there was a friendly melon in the garden. Every day it said hello to the other fruits and vegetables. Unfortunately, not all the fruits and vegetables were as friendly.
One day, a pumpkin came into the garden and it refused to say hello to the melon.
The melon asked, "Why don't you want to be my friend?"
But the pumpkin would not answer.
The melon sighed but it still said hello every day.
One day, after the pumpkin had been in the garden for a long time, it finally said hello back.
The melon was so happy and the two became friends.
From that day onward the pumpkin always said hello first and the two were great friends.
The moral of this story is that everyone should always behave in a friendly way. Even if somebody doesn't act friendly to you, you should still be kind to them.




Once upon a time, there was a dad and a kid who lived in a cozy little home. Dad was always telling the kid to eat their breakfast and be good. One morning, Dad said, "We are going on an adventure today". So they packed their stuff and got ready to go on their journey. 
The dad and kid had been walking for a while when it started to rain. Then it started to get dark, so they looked for a place to stay. They saw a tall, thick tree and the dad said, "Let's rest here". 
So they snuggled into the thick tree and soon the kid felt really sleepy. Dad whispered, "Stay here and I'll keep watch". But the kid was too tired to stay awake, so soon enough, they both fell asleep. 
The dad and kid were both sound asleep when something scary arrived. A giant monster was growling and stomping its feet. The dad and kid were shaking with fear but it was too late, the monster had found them. 
 
The dad and kid had no time to escape, so all they could do was watch as the monster opened its big, sharp jaws and swallowed them both in one big bite. It had a terrible wake, and then it was gone.




Alice had a special mission. She was going to study at the park. She brought her pencil and paper, and was excited to find out what she would learn. She walked to the park and saw lots of different plants and birds. She wanted to know what each one was called.
Alice sat by a tree and started drawing pictures of the animals. She studied the the leaves and shapes of each one. She also looked at the colour of the feathers on the birds.
Alice noticed something else in the park. It was full of children playing and laughing. She soon realized that the park was a useful place to learn as well! She watched how the children played with each other and came up with games and stories of their own.
Alice was glad she came to the park. She had learned so much about plants, animals and making friends. Her day of studying had been fun and useful.




John and his mum were walking down the street. John saw something that made him laugh. It was a big, green balloon. He wanted to get it.
John said, "Please, Mum! I want that balloon!" His Mum said no and shook her head.
John started to cry and his Mum felt bad. She said, "How about some ice-cream instead?" John stopped crying and smiled.
John and his Mum went to an ice-cream shop. There were lots of different flavours to choose from. John chose an ice-cream that looked like a balloon and laughed.
Suddenly, the shopkeeper said, "This is a very deep freezer. Please be careful!" John stopped laughing and nervously reached for the ice-cream. He dropped the ice-cream into the deep freezer!
John started to cry again. His Mum gave him a hug and said, "It's ok. We can get another ice-cream".
John felt better and laughed. He chose the same ice-cream again. And they both enjoyed it.




Once upon a time, there lived a friendly old oak tree. Every day, the old tree would listen quietly to the children play nearby. One day, a little girl named Joy walked up to the old tree and asked it a question.
"What can I do to help you, old tree?" said Joy.
"Well, you can create something for me," said the old tree. 
"What can I create?" asked Joy. 
"You can create an acorn for me," said the old tree.
So Joy went to find some things to make an acorn. She gathered some clay, some glue and some autumn leaves. Then she started shaping the clay into the shape of an acorn. She added some glue and stuck the leaves onto the clay. Finally, Joy took the acorn to the old tree and presented it to him.
The old tree was delighted. 
"Thank you, dear Joy. You have created something very special. It is both beautiful and friendly," said the old tree as it thanked Joy with a friendly nod.




Once upon a time, there was a fun park for kids. In the middle of the park was a big square swing that was very smooth and slippery.
Two friends, Cory and Mark, saw the swing and decided to give it a try.
Cory shouted, Lets swing!
Mark said, That looks fun! Lets do it!
Cory and Mark grabbed onto the swing and started to swing back and forth. Cory and Mark kept swinging higher and higher until they felt like they were flying!
The wind blew their hair as they screamed and laughed. They went higher and higher until their feet were touching the sky! 
Cory and Mark had so much fun swinging on the smooth, slippery square swing that they stayed at the park all day. Every time they felt like they were getting tired, they just thought about their flying dream and started swinging higher and higher.




The rabbit and the chipmunk were friends. One day, the chipmunk showed the rabbit his special track that he had been working on for days. The rabbit was very envious. The chipmunk had worked so hard and the rabbit wanted to be like him.
The next day, the rabbit took the chipmunk's track without asking. He put it in his home and thought he was the best for having it.
But the chipmunk found out. He was sad and angry that the rabbit had taken his track without asking. He showed the rabbit what he thought of him by not saying a word and walking away.
The rabbit didn't understand why the chipmunk was so sad and angry. He thought the chipmunk should be happy that he wanted his track. But the chipmunk didn't share the same feeling.
The rabbit and the chipmunk were no longer friends after that day. The rabbit was sad but also a bit envious of how the chipmunk was able to stand up for himself.




Once upon a time there lived an organized penguin named Pat. Pat loved teaching the other animals how to do fun things.
One day Pat decided to teach the other animals to dance. She said, Lets dance! to her friends.
They all said, Yes! Pat showed them how to move their feet in different ways. She said, Move your feet like this!
The other animals tried their best to dance like Pat. Some had two left feet, but Pat was very encouraging. She said, You can do it if you try!
At the end, they all did a very good job! Pat was proud of her students, and they all had a lot of fun.




Once upon a time, there was a bossy angel named Pip. Pip loved flying through the sky, giving people happy dreams and hope. 
One day, Pip was allowed to go to the Earth for a visit. Pip was so excited!
As Pip flew to Earth, she saw a family who needed some help. Pip decided to ask them if she could help, but they just laughed.
Pip was sad and asked, "Why don't you allow me to help you?" 
The family smiled and replied, "We think you are too bossy". 
Pip realized what they meant and nodded. She thought to herself, "I can be bossy, but I only want to help people." 
So, with a happy heart and gentle spirit, Pip waved goodbye and continued her flight. She was glad that she was able to share her angel magic with the world!




The little girl was so excited! She had been waiting all day. It was finally time to go outside and see the moon. She put on her pink dress and quickly ran outside. The moon was so big and so bright! It shone pink in the sky and the little girl was amazed. She stared at it for a long time and felt so happy and excited. Then she ran back inside, full of excitement and joy.




Once upon a time there was a kitty named Max. Max was a very spoiled kitty, because he got lots of love and food. One day, Max's owner took him to the veterinarian for his weigh in. Max didn't like going to the vet, so he meowed and meowed. The veterinarian weighed Max and said "Wow, Max is a big kitty. He weighs a lot!" After the weigh in, Max's owner gave him a special treat as a reward. Max purred as he ate it. Finally, Max got to go home and take a nice nap!




Once upon a time, there was a boy. He was feeling very lonely and wished he could find something to do. One day, he heard a noise outside his house. It was a bicycle! The bicycle was moving along the road and it looked like it was searching for someone.
The boy ran outside and introduced himself to the bicycle. The bicycle was very pleased to meet him. They played together for the rest of the day. They raced each other and had lots of fun.
However, the next day, the bicycle was gone. The boy was very sad. He had no one to play with him anymore. He wandered around, feeling very lonely and sad.
A few days later, the boy heard the same noise again. It was the bicycle! The bicycle had come back. The bicycle said it couldn't stay away any longer and decided to come back to introduce the boy to its friends.
The boys smiled with joy. He was no longer lonely. He had lots of new friends to play with every day. They all had lots of fun together!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anna. She wanted to go on a trip around the world. So she grabbed her passport and skipped to the airport.
When she reached the airport, she was asked to tie the laces of her shoes. She was so excited about her trip that she did it in a careless way.
Anna's mom saw what she was doing and warned her: "Anna, it's very important to tie your shoes tightly. You don't want to lose your passport!" 
But Anna didn't listen. Instead, she just smiled and said: "I'm sure it's ok, Mom. I tied the laces quickly!" 
So the mom showed Anna how to tie the shoelaces properly and explained to her why it was important: "It's important to tie the laces tight so you can keep your passport safe and sound. If you're careless while tying it, your passport might get lost and you won't be able to have your trip."
Anna listened to her mom and tied the laces carefully. Then she hugged her mom goodbye and set off on her trip around the world. The end.




Once upon a time there was a marriage between two people. They owned a small home together. One day when they were at home, the man saw something outside. He got really alert, so he went outside to check it out. It was a baby rabbit! The rabbit was in their garden, so the man and his wife decided to own it and keep it safe in their home. They named it Snowy and took care of it. The rabbit was so happy to have its new home! Snowy and the couple were best friends and they were very happy together. The end!




Once there was a bald eagle. He was very brave. He would perch high in a tree and look for his friends. One day he spotted a pattern in the sky. It was a bird. He was diving for fish. The bald eagle was so curious that he decided to try it too. He flew up high and dove straight down. He could feel the wind against his wings as he flew through the sky. When he reached the water's surface, he saw the fish and swooped down to catch it. The bald eagle was so proud of himself. He had taken a dive and caught the fish. From that day on, he liked to dive and hunt for fish whenever he could.




It was a sunny morning and Jake was playing outside with his toy rake. He loved to use the rake to move the leaves around the garden, like a little farmer.
Suddenly, his dad came out to the garden and he had a big smile on his face.
"Hey, Jake! We have an important job to do", his dad said.
Jake was very excited. What was the important job?
His dad explained. "You need to help me rake all of the leaves in the garden. This is a very important job!"
So Jake and his dad got to work. They raked and raked and it wasn't long before all of the leaves had been collected. 
When they were finished, Jake was feeling very tired.
"That was hard work," he said.
His dad nodded and said, "Yes, it was! Why don't you have a nap now to rest up?"
So that is what Jake did. He had a nap and felt much better afterwards.




Once upon a time there was a compassionate owl who lived in the forest. She was beloved by all the woodland creatures, who she helped when they were in need.
One day, a bully fox came to the forest and started to sack food from the other animals. The owl was very angry and tried to stop him but the fox was too strong.
The owl thought hard and came up with a plan. She pretended to be a friend and asked the fox to go hunting with her. The fox agreed and when they were in the forest the owl showed the fox her compassion. She revealed her true identity and explained how the fox had caused so much damage to the others.
The fox felt bad and realized his mistakes. He asked the owl to forgive him and promised to never sack again. The owl was happy that her compassionate words had made a difference. From then on the fox was a changed animal and the forest was peaceful once more.




It was a bright and sunny day. Mommy and Johnnie were in the yard.
"Johnnie," said Mommy, "let's go for a drive in the vehicle." 
Johnnie was so excited! He loved the vehicle. 
Mommy started the vehicle and began to drive. They drove past lots of houses and trees. Then, they approached a tall bridge.
Johnnie was curious how the vehicle would make it across the bridge. "That's hard," said Johnnie.
"Don't worry, Johnnie," said Mommy. "Our vehicle is very smart."
And sure enough, the vehicle drove across the bridge with ease. Johnnie was so proud of the vehicle. He couldn't believe it was so smart!




Once there was a little girl named Mary. She loved to choose her own clothes each day. She put on her rain boots and said, "Today I choose the yellow boots!"
Mary ran outside on a fair day to play in the rain. She ran and the rain hit her cheeks and she laughed. She spun around in the rain and jumped in the puddles. She smiled and said, "This day is really fair!"
The rain began to stop, so Mary ran back inside before she got too wet. She changed out of her yellow rain boots and chose a pretty dress and matching shoes. Then she smiled and said, "Now I'm ready for my fair day!"



Once upon a time, there were two best friends who lived far apart. But even though they were far away, they always found a way to unite.
One day, the two friends decided to meet in the middle so they could be together. They packed their bags, said goodbye to their families and started off on their journey.
When they finally arrived, they found a cross in the middle of the road. They stopped, looked at each other and smiled. They were so grateful to have made it to the same place, even though they were so far away. They hugged and said "We made it!"
From that day on, they visited the cross every year to remind themselves that no matter the distance, they could still unite. And they were always filled with hope and gratitude.



 
Once upon a time there were two friends, a bear and a duck. They were always together and had many adventures. 
One day they were walking through the woods when they spotted something yellow and shiny. It was a luxury! They both wanted to take it, so they started to quarrel. 
The arguing got louder and louder until an old owl flew down and said, Friends dont quarrel over things. You should share it and not fight. 
The bear and duck thanked the wise old owl. They decided to work together and share the luxury. They enjoyed it and learnt the valuable lesson about sharing that day.




Max was excited. He was going to go outside and see the unusual sky. He looked up and saw the dark clouds and wondered what form the clouds would take. He began to run towards them, but was stopped by his mom. 
"No, Max," she said. "It's not safe outside. It's starting to lock."
Max didn't understand what she meant, but he knew she was serious. He saw that his mom had a worried look on her face. He was beginning to understand why he couldn't go outside.
The clouds were now darkening, and the wind was getting stronger. Max knew something bad was coming, and then it happened. Lightning struck and thunder roared. In an instant, the sky had turned from beautiful and unusual to menacing. Max was scared and ran back into the house, but it was too late. The sky had locked them inside. 
Max's mom held him tightly, telling him that everything would be alright. But Max knew that nothing would ever be the same. 




Billy was feeling happy, so he asked his mom if he could go to the park. She said yes, and he quickly got into his running shoes.
At the park, Billy saw something even better than the slides and swings; a tall gym. Excitedly he ran to the ladder and started to climb. He made it all the way to the top without stopping.
"Be careful, Billy!" his mom called.
But Billy wasn't listening. He wanted to get to the top of the gym. Suddenly he slipped and started to fall!
"Oh no!" he cried.
Billy's mom quickly tried to help, but she was too late. Billy hit the ground with a thud. His mom was sad but relieved that Billy was okay. She helped him back home for a rest.
Billy learned a lesson that day. He never tried to climb the tall gym again.



Once upon a time, there was a small pumpkin. He was very loud and wished to act like all the other pumpkins. One day, he tried to climb the pumpkin patch, but he was always too big, too round and too heavy.
The pumpkin felt so sad that everyone laughed at him, so he started to act differently. He wanted to do something special and make himself proud.
Suddenly, the little pumpkin had an idea! He opened his mouth and screamed as loud as he could. Everyone was very surprised to see a pumpkin making so much noise! And soon, everyone began to laugh once more.
The little pumpkin felt happy he had found a way to act like the others. He realized he should never be ashamed of being different and instead embrace it! This is the lesson the little pumpkin has taught us: it's good to be loud and proud of our differences.



Once upon a time there was a furry bear. The bear was very brave and kept the forest safe. He had sharp claws and used them to protect the birds and bunnies that lived nearby.
One day, the bear was out walking when he saw a baby bird. The bear knew the bird was just learning to fly and very scared, so he decided to help.
The bear held out one of his giant bear fingers and used it to help the bird get back into the nest. The bird was so thankful that it wrapped its tiny wings around the bear's finger and said thank you.
The bear smiled and gave the bird a big hug. He then promised to protect the bird, and all of the other animals, from any danger that might come.
The furry bear kept his promise and stayed in the forest to keep it safe. Whenever the birds and bunnies were scared, the bear was always there to protect them. He was the bravest bear in the forest!




Once there was a bunny called Fred. He was very happy and always bouncing around his garden. He would jump high and low, left and right. One day he noticed something special in the garden. It was a colourful kite! Fred was so excited. He wanted to touch it and so he jumped up to the kite. He felt the fabric and the strings of the kite and it felt so nice.
Fred wanted to make the kite fly. He ran around the garden as fast as he could, bouncing and waving his arms around. Before long, the kite rose up into the air! Fred leapt and leapt in excitement, watching as the kite flew higher and higher.
When the kite eventually came back down, Fred was so happy. He jumped up and grabbed it, feeling the soft fabric in his hands. His friends the birds and the bees came to look and admire the colourful kite. It was a wonderful day and Fred was so proud that his hard work had paid off.




Once upon a time, there was a strong girl who was getting ready for a big trip. She went to her bedroom and started to pack her things. She put her clothes and some games into her bag. Then she picked up her pass. She saw it was all ready for her trip.
On the day of her trip the girl grabbed her bag, her pass, and headed out the door. She was so excited to start her journey! She walked to the station and got on the train. She felt brave and strong. 
The girl's journey took her far away. When she finally reached her destination she was amazed by the beautiful sights! All of her packing had been worth it. 
The girl enjoyed her trip and had lots of fun. When she got back home, she unpacked her things and tucked her strong pass safely away.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old. She decided to go on an adventure. She grabbed her hat, put it on her head, and started to jog. 
She jogged and jogged and then she stopped by a drain. She peeked down the drain and what do you think she saw? A delicious strawberry pie! 
The little girl was so excited! She forgot all about her adventure and climbed right down the drain to get the pie. She grabbed the pie, held it tight and then climbed back out of the drain.
She quickly opened the box and bit into the delicious pie. It was so sweet and yummy! She gobbled it all up and felt happy and full. 
The little girl was glad she had gone on her adventure, but she was even happier that it had ended with such a delicious treat.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was wearing yellow shoes. One day, she went outside to play. She wanted to have fun, so she decided to slide. She climbed onto the slide and looked down. It looked kind of scary, but she was brave.
The little girl started to slide down the slide. It was fast and she was giggling. Halfway down, she saw something yellow. It was a something fluffy and yellow! She wanted to know what it was.
She got off the slide and ran over. It was a yellow caterpillar! She had never seen one before. It was moving slowly and she thought it was kind of cute. But then, it changed! It turned into a yellow butterfly! 
The butterfly flew away and the little girl was scared. But, she knew it was only trying to find a place to sleep. So, she said goodbye and went back to the slide. She was brave enough to slide one more time before it was time to go inside.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had a hand and she used it to walk. She was bored of just walking. She wanted to do something more fun. 
One day, her mom told her that she could go to the park. She was so excited to go! She put on her shoes and grabbed her mom's hand. She squealed with joy. 
When they arrived, she ran around and had a lot of fun. Then, her mom said "Let's go to the lake." The little girl was confused. She didn't want to walk it, especially since the lake was far away. 
Her mom smiled and said, "We can take the car to get there! Would you like that?" The little girl was so excited. She nodded and laughed, "Yes, I would!" 
So, the little girl and her mom walked to the car, hopped in and drove to the lake. She was so happy that she wasn't bored anymore. Now, she could have a fun time at the lake.



Jemma was a big girl, three years old and very brave. She wanted to play with her friends at the park, but it was all so dirty. Everywhere she looked the grass was mucky and the sand was gritty. But Jemma didn't give in.
Jemma decided to make her own game. She used a stick to mark a goal in the sand. She and her friends took turns taking shots at the goal by throwing pebbles. Jemma cheered every time her friends made a shot.
The game was going well until a big, mean cat came by. It jump over the goal and even tried to take the stick. Jemma had to be brave and take a stand. She clapped her hands and yelled so loud at the cat that it ran away in a fright.
Jemma and her friends cheered. They were so proud of their brave leader. The game was able to continue and the goal was made even stronger. The cat never came back and Jemma was proud of her goal. The game was a success and everyone had great fun.




Jack was at the beach with his family. He wore his new blue pants but he felt very uncomfortable in them. 
He saw a girl in the distance and wanted to meet her, so he waved to get her attention. The girl kept walking and Jack kept waving, but the girl couldn't see him.
He asked his mom why the girl couldn't see him. His mom said it was because of his pants. She said they were so big that they were covering his waving arm.
Jack felt very frustrated, he wanted to play with the girl, but his pants were getting in the way. He asked his mom if he could take them off, but she said no.
Jack was so mad, he wanted to throw a tantrum, so he crossed his arms and started to pout. His mom said it would be ok, she said he just had to try harder to wave with his other arm. 
Jack tried to obey his mom and he waved with his other arm. This time the girl saw him and waved back. 
Jack felt much better, he was so happy he could finally play with the girl. He felt comfortable and happy again!



Bob was getting ready to go to work. He put on his uniform and was getting ready to leave the house. But then he paused. He remembered he had forgotten something very important. He had forgotten his lunch! He felt so stupid.
He quickly got off the uniform and dashed to the kitchen. He quickly packed some lunch and hurried back into the uniform. He paused for a moment, making sure that he had remembered everything for this time. He hadn't forgotten anything else, which made him relieved.
He was now ready for work. As he was about to open the door he paused for one final time. He gave himself a pat on the back for being so smart and remembering his lunch. He smiled and went straight to work. He was confident that today would be a good day.




Once upon a time, there was a farmer. He lived far away, in a distant place. The farmer liked to stop and pause when he worked. He would rest and look around, to take in the sights.
One day, he saw something strange. It was a small, white animal with big ears. He had never seen one before! He paused and watched it, wondering what it was.
Suddenly, it started to hop away. The farmer ran after it, crossing fields and hills. He finally caught up to the animal and paused to look at it. It was a rabbit, and it hopped away again.
The farmer paused to laugh. He was happy to see the rabbit, even if it was far away. He waved goodbye, and the rabbit hopped away into the distant, green fields.



 
Once upon a time, there was a large ranch. In the ranch, there lived two children: Tom and Susie. One day, Tom and Susie were walking in the ranch. Suddenly, Tom said to Susie, "Let's dance!" 
Susie smiled and said, "Yes! That sounds like fun!"
Tom and Susie started dancing around the large ranch. They jumped and twirled in the warm sun. All the animals grazing on the ranch stopped to watch them.
On and on they danced until they were too tired to dance anymore. After a while, Susie said, "That was so much fun! Let's do it again soon!"
Tom smiled and said, "Yes, let's do it! It was a great way to spend the day!" 
And that is how Tom and Susie spent their day: dancing in the large ranch!
