Timmy was on his way to the park with his dad. He had never been there before, so he was excited and filled with wonder. He had never seen a cooler filled with such colorful drinks before. His dad said he could have one, but only if he promised to be responsible.
At the park, Timmy was filled with even more wonder as he saw all the different things there was to do. He wanted to do them all, but his dad said he could only pick one and that he must stay where he could be seen. 
Timmy chose to go on the swings and had so much fun that he almost forgot about the cooler. But then he started to get thirsty and remembered. He asked his dad if he could have one of the drinks, but his dad said no. He said that he wouldn't be responsible if he had one. 
Timmy was so upset that he started to cry. He felt so disappointed and wasn't sure what to do. Suddenly, his dad knelt down, looked him in the eyes and said, "Listen, Timmy. You can have a drink, but only if you promise to be responsible and share with your friends. Timmy smiled, wiped away his tears and ran off to grab a colorful drink from the cooler!




Bob was so excited, he just got a new wallet! His mum said he could keep it, if he helped build something. He said yes with a smile.
His mum gave him some big wooden blocks. She said, "let's build a tower Bob". Bob took some of the blocks, stacked them up one by one and soon the tower was so tall it reached the top of the room.
His mum said "good job Bob, now let's make something tasty to eat". Bob suggested they make some pancakes. His mum said sure and they started gathering all the ingredients.
Bob stirred the bowl of pancake batter and watched as his mum fried up the pancakes on the stove.
When they were done, Bob carefully placed them on plates and added some yummy strawberries and bananas. He took a bite and said "these pancakes are so tasty!"
His mum said, "you did a great job helping me build and cook. Your new wallet will be filled with tasty treats for your hard work. Now how about one more pancake?"




Once upon a time, there was a gifted guitar player. His name was Johnny. He was able to make beautiful music with only his guitar. He performed for people all around the world. Johnny enjoyed playing his guitar so much that he never wanted to stop.
One day, Johnny was playing on a hot summer day. The sun was shining so brightly that his guitar started to melt. Johnny was so sad. He stopped playing and put his guitar on the ground. 
Johnny took a deep breath and said, "How can I ever play my guitar again?" Just then, a kind man walked up to Johnny. He said, "Don't worry Johnny. I know someone who can fix it."
Johnny was surprised and said, "Really? Thank you! I would love to have my guitar back."
The kind man smiled and said, "I'll take you there and you'll be playing your guitar in no time."
And so, the kind man fixed Johnny's guitar and Johnny was once again able to make beautiful music with his guitar. Johnny was so happy and he thanked the kind man for his help.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom loved to find interesting things and store them in his toy chest. 
One day, Tom found a shiny license and was so excited. He brought it to his mother and said, Mommy, look at what I found!
His mom smiled and said, Thats so cool, Tom! What do you want to do with it?
Tom thought for a moment and said, I want to store it in my toy chest!
So his mom said, Alright, lets put it away. But first, why dont we get a yummy treat?
Tom smiled and said, Yes, please! So the two of them went off to get a yummy treat and then stored the special license away. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a daddy and their three year old child named Sammy. Sammy had two special friends who liked to play with him all the time. They were a puppy named Spot and a kitty named Fluffy.
One day Sammy and his two friends were sitting in the garden. They were looking at the clouds and talking about their favorite colors. Spot thought blue was best, Fluffy said pink was her favorite and Sammy said he liked gray. Then Sammy had a good idea. He said, "Let's have a race. Spot can run, Fluffy can jump and I can laugh."
Everyone thought this was a great plan. So, they started the race. Spot ran fast, Fluffy jumped high and Sammy laughed and laughed. At the end, they all agreed that laughing was the fastest way to go.
Then they talked about their opinions. Spot said that running was fun. Fluffy said that jumping was better. But when Sammy talked about his opinion, everyone stopped to listen. He said, "No matter what you do, laughing always wins!"
 Everyone agreed and they all laughed together. It was the best race ever.



Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lily. She was a regular girl who loved to play outside in the wind. One day, Lily decided she wanted to wrap herself up in the wind like a blanket.
She ran outside and spun around and around, trying to wrap the wind around her. Suddenly, a loud noise came from above and Lily looked up to see her mom watching her.
"Lily, what are you doing?" asked her mom.
"I wanted to wrap the wind around me like a blanket," Lily said.
Her mom smiled. "That's very sweet of you, but you can't wrap the wind around you. The wind is free like the birds and can't be locked away in a blanket. You should take time to appreciate it, but not try to contain it."
Lily thought about what her mom said and understood the lesson. From then on, whenever Lily was outside and felt the wind, she would take a deep breath, smile and think about how lucky she was to feel it.




Clara was playing with her toys when she noticed a feather lying near her toys. She thought it looked pretty and wanted to see if it could fit in any of her toys. She carefully picked up the feather, then tried to fit it in her doll house. She tried holding the feather in different ways, but it just didn't fit.
Clara was getting frustrated. She tried and tried, but the feather still didn't fit. Then she remembered to be patient. Clara took a deep breath and calmly tried again. She turned the feather and finally, it fit!
Clara was overjoyed! She ran to tell her mom all about the feather fitting in the doll house. Her mom smiled and told her that being patient was the key to the feather fitting. Clara was very proud that she had been patient and was able to fit the feather in the doll house. From then on she was always careful to remember to be patient!




Once upon a time there was a little girl who liked to play in the park. She liked to slide down the slides and jump on the bouncy toys. But one day, she noticed something strange in the park.
There was a big pile of waste and it was blocking the way. It looked very dirty and it smelled bad. The little girl knew it must be dangerous, so she asked her mom for help.
Mom knew just what to do. She brought some big buckets of water and some special cleaning items. Then, they both started to wash away the waste. It was hard work, but after a few hours, they had cleaned the park.
The little girl was so happy that they had kept the park safe and clean. She knew she would be able to keep playing there without being in danger. She thanked her mom and promised to help keep the park clean.




Once upon a time, there were two friends called Sarah and Harry. Sarah was dependable and always eager to help. One day, Sarah and Harry were playing with cars and dollies in the garden. 
Suddenly, Sarah heard her mom calling from inside the house, "Sarah, can you please help Mommy in the kitchen?". 
Sarah quickly ran inside to help. When she arrived, she saw her mom looking for a fork in one of the kitchen drawers. Sarah opened the drawer and smiled as she spotted the fork. She gave it to her mom, saying "Mommy, here's the fork". 
Her mom smiled. "Oh, thank you Sarah", she said. She gave a Sarah a hug and said "I knew I could always depend on you". 
Sarah was very happy and knew that she had helped her mom. She ran back outside to tell Harry the good news. 
The two friends laughed and smiled together. They knew that Sarah was dependable and always ready to help.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Rosy who was very friendly. One day, Rosy was playing outside when she saw something shining in the grass. When she took a closer look, she realised that it was a shiny silver coin. Rosy was delighted and ran towards her house to show her mum.
When Rosy showed her mother the shiny silver coin, they both started to laugh. Rosy's mum said, "Rosy, it looks like you have found a silver coin. You must have been very lucky!" Rosy was so happy to have found the silver coin and said, "Maybe I can buy something nice with it!". 
Suddenly, Rosy's best friend James came to the door. He had heard that Rosy had found a silver coin and said, "What are you going to do with it?". Rosy replied, "I want to buy something nice with it!". James started to tease her and said, "You won't be able to buy anything. It's too small!" 
Rosy's mum gave a stern look to James and said, "Why are you teasing her like that? Remember, being friendly is always better than teasing someone." The moral of the story is that being friendly is always better than teasing somebody.




Once upon a time, a poor family had very little money and food. One day, the mother felt sad because she had nothing to give her little boy for lunch. She looked in the kitchen drawers for something to eat, but all she saw was an empty jar. 
Suddenly, the little boy shouted from the other room, "I know what to do, mommy!" 
The mom said, "What can we do, sweetheart?" 
The little boy took out a large sack and said, "Let's load the sack with apples from the tree in the park!" 
The mom smiled and said, "Good idea!" So they loaded the sack full of apples and they brought them home. 
The little boy was so proud that he had thought of a way to help his poor mommy. The apples were just enough to make a delicious lunch for the little boy and his mom. 
They ate their apples and smiled. They were so happy. It was a wonderful lunch!




Once there was a little girl who was walking through the park. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise and saw a soldier stumbling across the field.She was scared and yelled out to him, "What happened?" 
The soldier replied, "It was terrible! I slipped on a rock and twisted my ankle". He looked sad and was in a lot of pain.
Then the little girl asked, "What can I do to help?". 
The soldier answered, "Can you help me get back to my barracks? I don't think I can make it by myself". 
So the little girl put the soldier's arm around her shoulder and slowly walked him to his barracks.Every time he stumbled she was there to steady him. The soldier was so thankful for her help.
When they finally reached his barracks, the soldier thanked the little girl and said goodbye. She smiled and waved goodbye to the soldier as he disappeared into the building.




Mum and Dad had an idea. They wanted to make something special. 
"Let's prepare something fancy!" Mum said excitedly.
"Yes!" Dad agreed. "Let's make a honey cake!"
Mum and Dad started to prepare the cake. They mixed the ingredients and put them into the oven.
Then, something terrible happened. The oven was too hot, and the cake burned. Mum and Dad tried to save it, but it was no use.
Mum sighed. "I'm sorry, sweetheart. We won't be able to make a fancy honey cake like we planned. We'll try again tomorrow."




Once upon a time, there lived a patient old man. Every day he tended to his farm, taking care of the animals and growing the crops. One day, he noticed someone sneaking around his farm. 
"Who's there?" yelled the old man. 
But to his surprise, no one answered. He slowly made his way around the farm, calling out for anyone there. Suddenly, from behind the misty trees, a voice said, 
"I'm here! I was trying to steal some of your things!" 
The old man was not angry. He was patient and simply said, 
"Stealing is wrong. It is better to work hard to earn what you need." 
The young man listened carefully and nodded his head. He thanked the old man and ran off, vowing never to steal again. 
The old man smiled, knowing he had done the right thing. He continued tending to his farm, and mist soon faded away. The old man had learned a valuable lesson: being patient can lead to understanding.




Once, there was a kind little girl called Lucy. One day, when she was playing with her dolls, the radio began to make an unusual noise. She decided to get closer to it and soon found out that instead of music, she could hear strange sounds. At first she was scared, but then she realised that the noises were actually coming from other animals. Lucy was very surprised and went to tell her mum.
Her mum began to laugh and explained to Lucy that she had just discovered a secret: she was hearing animals talking on the radio. Its a place where animals can come and share stories with each other.
From that day on, Lucy changed her playtime routine. She started to spend some of her free time listening to the animals on the radio. She learned about their different cultures, their adventures and even the meaning of life.
This little discovery was a pleasant surprise for Lucy and she quickly shared it with her friends. They all loved listening to the animals on the radio and they even had their own radio show.
The moral of Lucys story is that even the most unusual thing can change your life for the better. So, if youre curious, its always worth exploring the unusual!




Once there was a leopard who lived in a jungle. He was very unique because he loved to talk to everyone he met. One day, while he was out on a walk, he came across a group of animals. The leopard stopped and said hello. 
The other animals looked at the leopard and didn't answer him. They glanced at each other, confused and curious about why the leopard was talking to them.
The leopard continued to talk, but the other animals just stared back at him. Finally, the leopard got angry and yelled, "Why don't you like to talk!?" 
The other animals still didn't answer. They just looked away, embarrassed and ashamed.
The leopard was upset and walked away. He had wanted to make new friends, but the other animals wouldn't even talk to him. He hung his head low and went back to the jungle, wondering why he had to be so unique.




Once upon a time, there was a rabbit and a turtle. The rabbit said to the turtle, "Let's race!" The turtle shook his head and smiled.
The two animals lined up, ready to start the race. The rabbit took off at a very fast speed! But at the end, the turtle was winning.
The rabbit was so frustrated that he ran faster, but he was still too slow. The turtle crossed the finish line first. The rabbit was so angry that he started kicking the ground.
The turtle said, "Be careful! That ground is very harsh!" But the rabbit was too mad to listen. He continued to kick until he hurt his feet.
The turtle sighed and said, "That's the end of the story." He was sad for the rabbit but was thankful for his own safety.




One day, a little girl called Lucy was walking through the woods with her mum. As they walked, they came across a lovely pond with a trap set up next to it. "Mummy, what's that?" Lucy asked.
"It's a trap, to catch fish," her mum replied.
Just then Lucy noticed a frog sitting by the trap. "Oh look mummy, a frog!" she said.
The frog looked up at Lucy. "Will you lend me a hand?" it asked.
Lucy was very excited. She bent down, and very carefully and gently, she untied the trap. "There you go," she said, "you can go now". The frog thanked her, croaked happily and hopped away.
Lucy and her mum continued their walk and watched the frog as it hopped into the sunshine. "That was so lovely of you," said her mum.
Lucy smiled. She knew she had done something very special - she had lent a helping hand to a frog in need.




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Max and Sam. Max thought the way Sam did things was different and strange. He said, Why do you do it that way? Sam replied that his way was useful, and he told Max why it worked.
But Max kept on complaining, no matter what Sam said. Until one day, when Sam asked Max why he kept on complaining. Max said he wanted to find an easier way. But Sam told him nothing comes easy.
So Max worked hard, and eventually his hard work paid off. He discovered a way even more useful than Sams way. Sam was so impressed that he asked Max to teach him the new way.
And so the friends learned an important lesson: Hard work is the most useful way to do things. It may not be the easiest, but with hard work, anything can be achieved.




Once upon a time there was a girl who was scared. She was scared of the dark and didn't want to go to bed. So, every night she would find her way to the big, comfy couch and huddle there until morning.
One night, she heard a voice from behind the couch. It was a soft, gentle voice and it said, "You don't have to be scared." The girl was so surprised she jumped from the couch.
"Who said that?" she asked.
The voice answered, "It's me. I live behind the couch and I can see you are scared. I want to tell you something to make you feel better."
The girl was still scared but listened to what the voice had to say. The voice told her stories and made her laugh until she forgot all about feeling scared.
The voice said, "Now, it's time for bed. Sweet dreams!" 
And so, the girl went off to bed feeling safe and secure, grateful for the wonderful friendship she had found behind the couch.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Abi. She was three years old and loved exploring the big world around her.
One day, Abi went for a walk and saw a cobweb at the top of a tree. She wanted to reach it, so she asked her mummy for help. Mummy promised Abi that if she was a brave girl and tried, she could reach the cobweb.
Abi was a little bit scared, but she was also very brave. She climbed up high and was so excited when she saw the cobweb. But when Abi tried to touch it, the cobweb was too weak and it fell down.
Abi was a bit sad, but Mummy kept her promise and they had a big hug. Abi was happy again and they went home.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Max who lived in a small village. One day, Max was walking in the forest when he came across a large log. He thought it would be fun to climb on top of it and he struggled hard to pull himself up.
Maxs friend, Abby, saw him trying to climb the log, so she ran to help him. She grabbed one end and said, Come on, Max, lets try together! Ill help you.
Max and Abby pulled and pushed at the log, struggling hard to get it to move, but it was too heavy for them. Suddenly, a big bear ambled out of the woods and saw what they were doing. It found the log too heavy to move as well, so the bear and Max and Abby worked together and after much hard work, the log finally moved!
Max, Abby and the bear cheered. It had been a lot of work, but it was worth it. They all smiled and hugged each other as they thanked the bear for helping them. Then, the bear waved goodbye and trundled back into the woods. Max and Abby were happy they had been able to overcome the struggle.



Once upon a time, there lived an ordinary mill. It churned day and night, making flour for everyone in the village.
One day, the mill began to creak and groan. It shook like it was about to split in two. The village people rushed to the mill and saw it was about to crumble.
The miller saw it too and sighed.
What can we do? he asked.
An old man stepped forward. The mill has been churning for too long. You need to take a break, he said.
The miller thought for a moment. Youre right, he said. He shut the mill down.
The next day, the mill was alive again. It had been restored and ran smoothly.
Moral: Taking a break is important. If you work too hard without resting, it can lead to a breakdown.




Once upon a time, there was an old man who lived in a small house. Every morning, the old man went outside to listen to the birds singing in the trees.
One morning, the old man heard something that sounded strange. He stepped closer and saw a small hole in the ground. He peered into the hole and said, "I wonder what's down there".
He decided to try and open the hole. He pushed and pulled, but it wouldn't open. Feeling frustrated, he stepped back and heard a small voice coming from inside the hole.
The old man listened carefully and heard the voice say, "Please help me, somebody!"
The old man replied, "Don't worry, I'll have you out of there soon". He worked hard and eventually managed to open the hole. Out came a tiny mouse, who thanked the old man with a smile.
The old man smiled back and said, "It's always good to listen".




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Daisy. She was walking through a forest with her dog, Spot. Daisy was very curious, and stopped to look around. Suddenly, Spot began to bark. Daisy saw a big bear staring right at her.
Daisy was so scared that she hid behind a tree. With a brave voice, she asked the bear: "Why are you staring at me?".
The bear said: "you look silly! You shouldn't be in this stupid forest!". Daisy was angry and yelled back:"That's not nice! Go away!".
The bear hesitated, then slowly walked away. Daisy took a big breath and said to Spot: "Let's go home!" Spot barked in agreement. 
Daisy and Spot walked back home, safe and sound. From then on, Daisy would never go back to that forest again!




Once upon a time, there was a very creative musician. He loved to make music and was always thinking up clever new tunes. Every day, he would go and eat dinner with his family.
His family were so proud of him for being so creative and making beautiful music. One day, he decided to take them to a special dinner. He asked the chef to make something very special.
The chef made a very yummy dinner. It had all sorts of colourful ingredients and it was cooked just right! His family were so happy they took lots of pictures to remember the dinner forever.
When the meal was done, everyone was really full. Everyone thanked the creative musician for taking them out to dinner and enjoying such a delicious meal. And they all lived happily ever after!




John and his Mom were walking through the park when they saw a filthy stick. It was lying on the ground and was covered in dirt and mud. John picked it up and asked his Mom what he could do with it.
Mom smiled as she looked at the stick. She told him he could provide some fun. She said he could use it to make trails in the dry dirt, or use it to chase bugs. John nodded his head, excited to have a new toy.
John rushed off with the stick and started playing. He laughed and had a great time. But as the sun set and it got darker, the stick started to look eerie.
Mom told John it was time to go home. But John wouldn't leave the stick behind. He said he wanted it to provide more fun the next day. So, Mom gave in and let John take it.
But when they got home, they found that the stick had brought a terrible surprise. Inside the house were little black bugs all over the floor. Mom quickly realized that the stick had been full of dirt and bugs, proving that it had been filthy. 
John and Mom had to stay up all night, cleaning the mess. John knew he should've listened to Mom and left the stick behind.



Once upon a time, there was a delicate ashtray. Every day, the ashtray would sit on the table and smile. But one day, a naughty little girl came into the room and saw it. She became so excited that she couldn't stop herself and she quickly took hold of it. The ashtray was so delicate that it couldn't take the pressure, and it started to tear.
The little girl was very sad, and she started to cry. She felt so bad that she had hurt the ashtray. She ran to the kitchen and found some glue and quickly got to work to fix it. After a few minutes of hard work, the ashtray was fixed and looking as good as new.
From then on, the little girl was very careful with the delicate ashtray. She made sure to not be too rough with it and also not to leave it in a place where it could get hurt. 
The end.




Once there was a little boy called Tom. Tom was only 3 years old, but he already loved to play pretend. 
Today, Tom had a wonderful idea. He pretended he was an explorer looking for a hidden wreck. Tom would take an imaginary boat into the ocean and search the depths with a pretend telescope.
Tom's Mum watched from the beach. She smiled when she saw how excited Tom was playing. 
Tom closed his eyes and pretended he had found something. But when he opened his eyes, he was a bit disappointed. All he saw was sand, sea and sky. 
Tom's Mum called out to him: "Are you sure you should be searching there Tom? Have you forgotten that wrecks are under the water?"
Tom looked embarrassed. "Oh, yes! I'm so ignorant!" he said. With that, he ran back and jumped into the cool water, ready to continue his pretend adventure.




Mommy and Timmy were walking through the park. It was a bright and sunny day, and Timmy was very happy. He looked around and saw lots of different animals.
First, Timmy saw a big, harmless, grey squirrel. He ran over to it and tried to pet it. But the squirrel ran away. Mommy laughed and said, Those animals can be a bit skittish.
Then, Timmy saw two friendly ducks. They were quacking and swimming in the pond. Timmy smiled and nodded his head to them. The ducks waved at him and waddled away.
Finally, Timmy saw a cute, harmless, bunny. He ran over and tried to catch it. But the bunny hopped away. He was disappointed, but Mommy said, Thats OK. We can come back tomorrow and try again.
So Timmy nodded and they went home, looking forward to the next day.




Joe was playing in the park one day. He jumped and ran around and noticed a large bubble floating in the air nearby. Joe ran over to the bubble and touched it with his finger. His finger got cold, so he pulled it away. He wondered what could make his finger cold like that.
Joe asked his mom, "What was that cold thing?" His mom smiled. "That was a bubble. We can make more if you want."
Joe was excited. He watched as his mom blew a bubble and floated it into the air. Joe couldn't believe how the bubble moved. He chased the bubble around and laughed loudly. 
Suddenly, Joe noticed the sky had turned grey. His mom said, "I think it's going to rain. We'd better go home now." 
Joe wasn't ready to go home. He still wanted to play with the bubble. But his mom was right, it was starting to rain. Joe reluctantly said goodbye to the bubble and went home with his mom. 
At home, Joe and his mom curled up under a warm blanket and watched the rain outside of the window. Joe saw his bubble again in the rain. It made him smile, because it was still there in the rain, cold and beautiful.




Once upon a time, there was a stable. Inside the stable was a unique horse. The horse was named Charlie and he was always very happy.
One day, Charlie decided to try something special. He began to reverse through the stable. He moved backwards, faster and faster!
Charlie's owner, Bob, was watching him and laughed, "what are you doing, Charlie?"
Charlie turned around and replied, "I wanted to see what it felt like to go backwards!"
Bob laughed again and said, "Well, it looks like you are a very unique horse!"
The next day, Charlie and Bob tried to reverse round the stable again. It took them a while, but they eventually mastered it! They enjoyed their unique activity and kept practising until they became pros.




Once upon a time, two friends named Jack and Jane had a fight. Jack got angry and Jane got sad. They both felt bad.
Today, the two friends made up. They hugged and laughed. Jack said, "Let's play!" Jane said, "Yes, let's!"
They had so much fun! They played hide-and-seek and they sang songs. They even made cookies together.
At the end of the day, they were so sleepy. They said goodnight, gave each other one last hug, and headed home. 
And they lived happily ever after.




Once upon a time there was a daddy who was very alert and noticed that his son was not following the rules. He asked the boy why he was not listening and the son said he didn't know. Daddy said he wouldn't tolerate any more bad behavior and warned the son to be good or he would have to punish him.
The son understood that and promised to try harder. The days passed and the son was very good, but one day he forgot to listen to his daddy. Daddy was very angry and said he had to punish the son.
The son was scared, but he knew he had to accept the punishment. Daddy grabbed a big missile and said that if the son didn't do what he said, he would have to launch it.
The next day the son did as he was told. He was happy that he was still in one piece and nothing had happened. Daddy said he was proud of his son and told him that from now on, he should always stay alert.




Once there was a little girl who was 3. She was walking in a park when she saw a palm tree. She was excited and moved closer. But then she saw something blue at the base of the tree. She moved even closer and saw that it was a bird. The bird was stuck in a bush and she could tell he was scared.
The little girl wanted to help him so she tried to move the bush but it felt too heavy. Even after she got her mom to come and help, the bush wouldn't move.
The little girl tried really hard to think of a way to help the bird. She moved around the bush, looking from all angles, when she spotted a hole. Through the hole she could see the scared blue bird.
The little girl ran and grabbed a stick and tried to move the twigs away from the hole. When she was done, the bird was free! The little girl smiled and hugged the little bird, and the bird flew away. The little girl was so happy that she could help the scared blue bird.




Once there was a little boy and his best friend was a fairy. Every day they would play together in the garden.
One day, when they were chasing each other, the fairy tripped and fell. She started to cry. The little boy wanted to help her so he ran to her and picked her up. He said, "Don't worry, I will make you fit again." 
The fairy shook her head and replied, "No, I don't want to be fit again. I want to stay like this."
The little boy was surprised. He asked, "Why would you want that?" 
The fairy brushed her tears away and said, "I want to resist the change. I like being a fairy and I don't want to be different." 
The little boy nodded and gave her a hug. He understood her feelings and said, "Ok, I won't change you if you don't want to change."
And from that day onward, the little boy and the fairy were never separated, and no matter what, the fairy loved being a fairy and the little boy loved the fact that his best friend was so fit.



 
The little boy wanted to play a drum. He asked his mom to buy him a drum. His mom said she could not buy him a drum. She said it was too noisy.
The little boy was sad. But then he had an idea. He went and asked his friend for help.
His friend said, "I can help you. I have a drum. I can recommend it to you. It is a clear drum." 
The little boy was very happy. He thanked his friend and said, "Yes, I will take it!" 
The little boy soon became an expert at playing the drum. He learned a valuable lesson: We all should recommend something that can be beneficial to others. That way, we help others and build strong friendships.




John loved to explore, he was an adventurous boy! Everyday he would adventure around the backyard looking for new and exciting things. Today he found something special, a pile of stuff! It looked like nice, soft, fluffy stuff so he decided to nap in it. 
When John awoke, he noticed his feet were starting to feel funny. He couldn't move his feet and they were starting to hurt. He heard a voice behind him,"What are you doing in my nest?". John slowly turned his head and saw a large bird. He was scared but tried to explain,"I was just nap-ping, I'm sorry I didn't know this was your nest!". 
The bird didn't listen, it just opened his beak wide and grabbed John's feet with its claws. It kept flying until it reached its nest on the top of a tall tree. The bird dropped John in the nest and then flew away. 
John was stuck on the tall tree and lost all his adventurous spirit. He didn't know how he would ever get out of that nest!



Once upon a time, there was a beautiful purple daisy. Every day the daisy would stand in the same spot, smiling in the sun. Suddenly, one day, a little girl named Molly enter the garden. She saw the magical purple daisy standing in the field and she could not believed her eyes. 
Molly ran to the daisy and asked, "Where did you come from?" The daisy was shy and did not reply. So, Molly asked again, a bit more softly this time, "Do you want to be my friend?"
The daisy brightened, happy to hear these words. She asked, "Will you take care of me?" Molly promises she would take great care of the daisy every day. 
The moral of the story is that if you take care of something good and pure, it will bring you great joy.



 
Once upon a time there was a boy called Tom. Tom was only three years old, but he already knew his name was important. One day Tom went to play in the park. 
When he got there he saw lots of new friends playing together. He wanted to join in, but he was too shy. 
A girl with a big smile walked up to him. She said, Hi! Whats your name? 
Tom was a bit hesitant at first, but he eventually said, My name is Tom. 
The girl smiled and said, Thats a great name! Im sure all your new friends will love to know it.
Tom was very happy and he mind his new friend's advice. He ran around the park introducing himself to everyone. He knew his name was important and he was proud to say it. 
The other kids were happy to meet Tom and they all played together and had lots of fun. Tom was glad he listened to that girl's advice and he knew it was important to always mind your name.




Once upon a time, there was a farmer called Bob. Bob loved to raise squash in his garden. Every day, Bob would spend hours taking care of his squash plants and tending to the garden.
One day, Bob was feeling especially grateful for his squash garden. He looked at all his squash plants and smiled. Bob said, "Thank you, squash plants, for blessing me with a wonderful harvest."
The squash plants seemed to understand Bob, because they gave a gentle nod in response. Bob was so happy with the squash plants that he wanted to give them a special treat.
Bob decided to raise a nice big bowl of squash soup for the plants. He carefully cut up the squash and cooked it in a pot. It smelled so delicious!
Bob fed the squash soup to the plants and thanked them for their hard work. The plants seemed to be very grateful for their reward. Bob was happy to share his love for squash with them.




Once there was a puppy. He was very small and yellow. He liked to keep warm. The puppy was always walking around. He was looking for a place to keep warm.
One day it was cold outside. The puppy was shivering and needed to stay warm. He ran around and found a cozy spot to rest. He lay down and snuggled into the warm spot and slept.
The next morning, the puppy was still cold. He wanted to keep warm. So, he found some blankets to stay under. He stayed under the blankets until he was nice and warm.
After that, the puppy was feeling much better. He was warm and happy and stayed that way for a long time.




Once upon a time there was a little bunny. His name was Jack and he loved to rock. Every day he would hop around the garden looking for different things to rock on. 
One day Jack found a hidden door. He was very excited to see where it would lead! He jumped through and ended up in the veterinarian's office. 
Jack looked around and saw all kinds of animals. He even saw a puppy getting a bath! He knew he was in the right place. 
Suddenly a voice said, "Hello there! How can I help you?" Jack looked up to see the vet smiling at him. 
Jack said, "Hi! Could you help me rock?" The vet said, "Why of course! Let's go find something fun to rock on!" 
The vet showed Jack a big rocking chair that he could enjoy. Jack happily began to rock. He had an amazing time. He thanked the vet and hopped out of the office. 
Jack knew he had found a great place to rock and he would be back again soon.



 
One day, Jenny was very weak. She wanted to do something fun so she went outside. When she was outside, she saw something exciting! She saw a gumball machine! Jenny wanted to try it and see if she could get a gumball. She put a coin in the machine and pulled the handle. With a big spring, out popped a pink gumball! 
Jenny excitedly took the gumball, unwrapped it and put it in her mouth. It was so sweet and chewy that it put a smile on her face! She was very happy and went around the playground to show all of her friends her colorful gumball.
Jenny continued to play until she started to feel weak again. She went home and took a nap. She was so glad that her gumball made her day just a little bit better!




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Anna. She was three years old and loved running around in her garden. Today was special; Anna had found something shiny in the dirt. It was a small piece of coal!
Anna was so excited, but she had no idea what to do with it. She looked up at the sky, wondering what she should do. Suddenly she heard noises coming from the bushes. Anna stepped closer, and to her surprise she saw a badger.
The badger was very angry. He yelled at Anna, "What are you doing here? This is my coal! It's mine!"
Anna was scared, but she was also very brave. She held up her piece of coal and said, "No, it's mine! I found it and it's special."
The badger scowled. He said, "That's stupid! Give me back my coal!"
Anna shook her head and said, "No, it's mine!" And with that she grabbed her coal, turned around and ran back to her house.
When she got inside, Anna felt relieved. But then she realised that the badger had scared her so much that she had started to tear up. She took a deep breath and told herself, "I have my coal and that badger can't take it away from me." And she hugged the piece of coal tight.




Jim was out for a swim, enjoying the summer day. He saw a glimmer in the water and, being curious, he decided to dive in. When Jim came up from the dive, he was holding a beautiful gem. It was very attractive with its bright colours.
Jim looked around to see if anyone had seen him, but no one was in sight. Suddenly, he heard a voice coming from a tree.
"That is my gem," said the little voice. Jim saw a small bird perched on a branch.
"I found it and I want to keep it," Jim said.
"Please let me have it," said the bird, "I will be very grateful."
Jim looked at the bird and thought it was too cute to turn down. So, he gave the gem back to the bird.
"Thank you so much," said the bird. "You are very kind."
Jim smiled and waved goodbye to the little bird. He swam away from the tree, with a smile on his face, knowing he had done the right thing.



Once upon a time, there were two friends called Bob and Jane. Bob was very naughty and he often did things that made Jane feel ashamed. 
One day, Bob and Jane went to the park together. As soon as they arrived, Bob noticed a pile of ripe bananas on the floor. He grabbed one, smiled mischievously, and started munching on it. Jane said "Bob! That's not yours!" But Bob kept eating until he had finished the whole banana.
Jane felt very ashamed. She looked away and said "We should have been more careful. We must learn to share." Bob felt sorry and hung his head in shame.
The two of them decided to take a nap together in a nearby tree. After they had slept, they felt much better. Bob promised to try and behave better and share more with Jane in the future.
The moral of the story is: We should always be kind and share with our friends.



Once upon a time there were two friends - Max and Mina. Max was a blue bear and Mina was a pink rabbit.
Max and Mina loved to play outside together. But one day, Max wanted to play a game while Mina wanted to read a book. Max was sad. He didn't want to read a book. He wanted to play with his friend.
Max and Mina's parents came up with a plan. They would give them each a club to play with in the garden. Max was happy! A fair game!
Max and Mina had so much fun playing together in the garden with their clubs. They both had a turn batting the club and running around playing. Max tried to resist having a turn but Mina was very fair and made sure Max still got to have a turn. 
Max and Mina played together for a long time, and soon the day was over. As the sun set, it was time to go inside. Max was happy - it was a great day!




One day there was a humble triangle. It was small but had plenty of uses.
"My triangle is the best!" said a 3-year-old.
The triangle kept its calm and kept on being humble. It said nothing, because it knew it could be used in different ways.
The 3-year-old then picked up the triangle and used it to make a paper airplane. She was so delighted and said, "Oh wow! Look at my triangle, it made a great paper airplane!" 
The triangle was still content and humble. It was happy that it could be used to make something so cool. It was the perfect shape for it. 
The 3-year-old thanked the triangle for being so useful. The triangle smiled knowing it had made someone so happy.




John was a 3 year old and he loved music very much. He had an old toy piano at home, but he didn't know how to play it. Every day, he would sit in front of the piano and try to make music with it.
One day John decided to go for a walk with his father. As they walked, they heard some music coming from across the street. It was jazz! John's father smiled as he saw John's eyes light up. He said to John, "Let's go and see, it sounds fun!"
When they crossed the street and got closer to the music, they saw a man playing the trumpet. John was mesmerized and wanted to try to play the trumpet himself. His father was careful and said, "Let's see if the man will let you have a go. You must be very careful".
The man agreed to let John have a try. He gave John the trumpet, and showed him how to hold it and make a sound. John was amazed! He tried to make music but it kept coming out wrong every time. 
The man then said, "Let me show you how to twist the sound. You have to change the way you blow into it". 
John followed the man's instructions and suddenly he heard the beautiful Jazz music coming out from his trumpet! John smiled with delight and felt so proud of himself. He thanked the man for teaching him and said he




Once upon a time, there was a mom and her three-year-old son. They planned a fun day out together. They drove in the car and parked near a park. 
The two were excited to go play in the park but then it started to rain. The mom saw how worried her son was and said, "Don't worry, we can still have a good time! Let's just find something else to do." 
Her son got a big smile on his face and said, "Let's go home and bake cookies!" 
So, they drove back home with a big smile and went to the kitchen to make delicious cookies. The mom was happy knowing that she was able to turn her son's worry into something fun. 
They made the best cookies ever and enjoyed the day together.




One sunny day, Lucy and her mom were gardening in their backyard. Lucys mom showed her a vine.
What is it? asked Lucy.
Its a vine, said her mom. Im going to put it on the wall.
Then her mom showed her all the other things in the garden, which included flowers and plants.
Mom said, Look at the clear sky. Isnt it nice?
Yes! said Lucy. She was very happy.
Then, her mom put up the vine on the wall. It created a nice and clear look.
Lucy admired the vine and said, It looks pretty!
Yes, I think so too, said her mom.
And they finished up their gardening together while they watched the vine grow.



Once upon a time, there was a harmless little bird. He was so pleased to be flying around in the sky, it was the best way to have fun!
But one day, he saw something unusual. He saw a boy with a whistle. The bird was worried that the whistle might cause him harm, so he flew away as fast as he could.
The boy was very sad and he wanted to find the little bird. He looked all around, and he found the bird hiding in a tree. He said "Please don't be scared, I don't want to hurt you".
The boy offered the bird something in exchange for making a sound with the whistle. He said "I'll pay you if you make a sound with my whistle". The bird was a bit hesitant but soon realized that the boy was harmless.
So he took the offer, and he made a beautiful sound with the whistle. The boy was so happy, he was really excited and he paid the bird for the sound. The bird was very happy too, and he flew off singing with joy.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Daisy. Daisy was very brave and loved to play with her friends. One day, Daisy was jumping on her mattress when she heard a loud noise. 
She got frightened and ran outside to find what was making the noise. It was a big brown bear, bouncing on her mattress! Daisy was very scared, but she knew she had to do something.
She cleared her throat and spoke loudly. "Hey, why are you bouncing on my mattress?" The bear was startled and spoke back in a gruff voice. "I just wanted to try it out. It looked like so much fun!"
Daisy explained that her mattress was only for her and her friends. She gathered all of her courage and asked the bear to leave. The bear was sad, but understood and disappeared into the woods. 
From then on, Daisy thought twice before jumping on her mattress. She was always careful as she didn't want to frighten any animals again.



Molly was taking a walk with her mule, who was pulling a little cart. The sun was shining and it was a mild day. Molly was smiling and enjoying the view.
Suddenly, the mule slipped on a wet spot on the ground. Molly grabbed onto the handle of the cart to keep it from tipping over. She was thankful that she reacted so quickly.
The mule wasn't hurt, but it was a bit scared. Molly felt bad, so she said some gentle words and gave the mule some carrots. That made the mule feel better and soon it was back to walking calmly.
Molly and the mule eventually made it back home safely. Molly knew she was lucky that the slip wasn't worse. It was a mild reminder that she needs to keep a close eye on her mule when they go for a walk.



 
A little girl named Lucy was playing with her violin. She loved to make music and was really good! Suddenly, she heard a loud sound. It was her mom screaming for help. Lucy quickly ran outside. 
Her mom was trying to hug a big, yellow bird, however the bird was sour and kept trying to fly away. Lucy knew what to do. She began to play her violin. When the bird heard the lovely music, it stopped flying and allowed mom to hug it. 
The mom was very thankful and hugged Lucy tight. It was happy to have helped her mom. Lucy was also glad that she was able to resolve the conflict quickly. Now they could all be happy and content.




Once there was a little girl named May. May was a curious person who liked to explore. She found an old mill and wanted to see what was inside. 
"Wait here," May warned her mom. May went in the mill by herself.
Inside the mill was something shiny. May was excited and wanted to attach it to her backpack. 
But as soon as she touched the object, a loud siren started to sound. May was scared and tried to run out the mill, but the door was locked.
May's mom heard the siren and came to help. But the police were already there. They saw May had taken the object from the mill and it was not good. 
May was taken to jail and never able to go back home.




Max was a three year old boy. He loved to play with his friends. One day, he was playing when the school principal suddenly came in. Everyone got scared and stood still.
"Who made these big messes?" the principal asked. The little kids stayed quiet.
Max was embarrassed. He knew that he had made the mess. Tears filled his eyes and he started to weep.
The principal crossed her arms and said, "Come here, Max. We'll have to tell your parents."
Max was so embarrassed that he could no longer stop weeping. His friends felt sorry for him. The principal took Max's hand and walked him to his parents.
Max's parents were very angry. They scolded him and made him clean up his mess. Max was so embarrassed and could not stop weeping.
Max's friends saw that he was so sad. They all wept together sadly. Max never wanted to make a mess again and felt embarrassed whenever he thought of that day.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sophie. Sophie had a very selfish friend called Tom. Tom didn't like to listen to what Sophie had to say and he would always do whatever he wanted.
One day, Sophie was playing with her toys in her bedroom when Tom came over. He wanted to watch a movie on the TV screen, but Sophie wanted to play with her toys. Tom was very selfish and didn't listen to what Sophie wanted to do.
Sophie said "Tom, can you please listen to me? I don't want to watch a movie today - I want to play with my toys". But Tom didn't listen. He turned on the TV and the movie started to play on the screen.
Sophie was very angry and sad. She said "Tom, why are you so selfish? You don't listen to me!"
Tom felt bad and was sorry he was being so selfish. He apologized to Sophie and together they watched the movie and had a wonderful time!




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Jenny. She was very excited as it was her birthday today! She was wearing a dress that was a really pretty blue.
Jennys family were getting ready to celebrate. Her mom said, Lets get a cake and some balloons! Jennys dad said, We could get a piata too; something to make it extra special. Everyone agreed and went to find a big warm piata.
When they returned, Jenny and her family filled the piata with candy and hung it in the garden. Everyone was so excited when it was time to break open the piata; Jenny was even more eager when she realized that there would be candy inside!
When the piata was broken open, candy flew everywhere and Jenny felt so happy. She quickly gathered up some of the sweets and shared them with her family. 
The moral of this story is that it's important to remember to share with others when we're celebrating. This was a lesson that Jenny learned on her birthday, and it was a happy day for everyone!



Once upon a time, there were two friends called Ben and Tilly. They were both three years old and they both loved to play in the woods. One day they were on an adventure when they suddenly saw something shiny in the trees. It was a golden box.
"Maybe it has something valuable inside!" said Ben.
"Let's march to get it!" replied Tilly. 
The two of them marched quickly to the box and they opened it eagerly. Unfortunately, inside were only some old stones. They were very troubled.
"We should have been more careful," Ben said sadly.
Both of them knew what the lesson was: curiosity can lead to trouble.
The moral of the story is that we should always think carefully before taking risks.




Once upon a time, there was a bunny who loved to hop. He hopped all around, under the trees and in the shade. He hopped so much that he eventually got tired and wanted to take a rest.
The bunny found the perfect spot, under a gentle tree. The shade was nice and warm, he was sure he would fall asleep. But he had no idea that this spot was already taken by another creature.
The bunny snuggled in, but before he could fall asleep, the creature that had been there before him sprung out from under the tree. It was a big, mean fox who was not pleased to find the bunny in its spot. The fox chased the bunny away in a very mean way.
The bunny was scared and was sad not to have been able to take a rest. But it also learned an important lesson - to always be careful where you go because bad things sometimes lurk in the shadows.




Once upon a time, there was a gray squirrel. He was a very cute squirrel and he was always blinking at the world around him. One day, he came across a tree full of nuts. He was so excited that he could hardly contain his excitement. He started to blink happily.
Suddenly, he heard a voice from up above. Looking up, he saw a small bird perched on the branch of the tree. It asked, "Hey there, little squirrel. What are you looking at?"
The squirrel stopped blinking and looked at the bird. He replied, "Oh, I just discovered this tree full of nuts. It looks delicious!"
The bird smiled and said, "I'll bet it does. Would you like me to help you eat them?"
The squirrel smiled and nodded. Together they ate all of the nuts until they were full. After they were finished, the squirrel thanked the bird and they said their goodbyes.
The squirrel blinked one last time and said, "Thank you for helping me. I had the best nut feast ever!" 
The bird smiled and said, "You're welcome. I'm so glad we could have this nut feast together." 
And with that, the squirrel scurried away, blinking happily.




Once upon a time, there was a charming little rabbit. He was always on the lookout for its own adventures. One day, he decided to explore a nearby meadow. 
As he hopped around, he found a battery lying on the ground. Instantly, he was filled with curiosity. Without hesitation, he took the battery and started to examine it. 
The little rabbit was so excited! He called out to his friend, the fox. 
'Fox', the little rabbit squeaked. 'Look what I have found!'
The fox looked at the battery and said, 'It looks interesting, but I'm not sure what it is. Maybe you should put it back.'
But the little rabbit didn't want to hear that. He decided to seat the battery on his nose.
However, as soon as the battery touched the rabbit's nose, it suddenly exploded, sending sparks everywhere! The brave little rabbit had to be taken to the animal hospital to get bandaged up - he had been injured in the explosion.
The moral of the story is that some things can be dangerous, even if they look interesting. It's best to be careful and only do things if you're sure it's safe.




Once upon a time there was an olive who was feeling very organized. He was thinking about all the things he had to do and the places he had to go. He got very excited when he thought about the future.
Suddenly, the olive imagined that he could fly. He started flapping his arms faster and faster. He imagined that he was soaring through the sky, going higher and higher. Suddenly, he found himself in a beautiful meadow full of bright colors.
The olive was enjoying himself so much that he forgot to come back home. He was having so much fun!
Then suddenly he heard a voice, "Where have you been, Olive?" It was his mom who had been looking for him all day.
Olive explained that he had gone on an adventure and imagined that he could fly. His mom smiled, hugged him and said, "It's good to be organized, but don't forget to come home sometimes."
The olive was very happy that he came home and also that he was able to imagine such wonderful things.



Once upon a time there was a young boy who liked to skip. He skipped all around the garden. One day he skipped over to a bad tree. The bad tree had lots of bad apples on it. He wanted to pick one of the apples, so he grabbed one and ate it. Unfortunately, it was so bad tasting that he got really sick and had to go to bed. He never went back to the bad tree ever again. The end.



 
Once upon a time, there was a happy puppy named Max. He lived with an old lady and everyday, he would crawl through the garden and make it his mission to find the best cream.
One day, MAX was crawling around the garden and he found a special tree with the most delicious cream he had ever seen. He quickly ate a large spoonful and it was even better than he could have imagined. He was so happy!
When the old lady came outside and saw Max licking his lips, she laughed and said, "Max, what did you do? It looks like you found something delicious."
Max smiled and said, "I found the best cream ever. I'm so happy!" The old lady reached over and gave Max a pat on the head.
Max was very content with his special treat and continued to crawl around the garden, looking for more cream.




Once there was a bird. It was big and colorful. It had wings and could fly high up in the sky. One day the bird was flying in the sky when it heard a loud noise. It was a horn! The bird was surprised and kept flying. Then, the bird saw a lot of other colorful birds. The birds were all flying around in circles. Soon, the bird was flying with them! They flew all day long and it was so much fun. After dark, they all flew back home.




One day, a curious 3-year-old asked his mom to bring him to the park after dinner. She agreed and they quickly got ready to go. 
When they arrived at the park, there was a beautiful tree glowing in the night. The 3-year-old wanted to get closer to see it. He ran over and asked, "Mommy, what is that?" 
His mom smiled and replied, "That is the magic stamp tree. Each of its leaves has a special surprise on them - it's like a special stamp!" 
The 3-year-old was so curious. He touched one of the glowing leaves and discovered that it was a stamp with a beautiful butterfly picture on it. He was so excited and took it home to show his friends. 
The 3-year-old could not believe what he had found - he felt like he had found a real magical tree! He was so happy and kept visiting the park often, hoping to find more of those special stamps.




A little girl named Emma was walking in the woods. It was a warm summer day. She loved to explore the woods with her Daddy. She saw birds singing in the trees, and she felt the gentle breeze on her face.
Then, Emma saw something she didn't like. It was a big pile of wood. She called out to her Daddy, with a tired voice: "I hate that wood!"
Daddy came over to her, and said, "That's OK, sweetheart. Let's move on and find something nicer to look at." He took her hand in his, and they walked away together.
Emma hugged Daddy even tighter. He was so gentle with her. She liked being in the woods with him. As they kept walking, she saw some pretty butterflies and forgot all about the wood.




Once there was a little girl called Mary. She was three years old and loved to go to the park. Everyday she would go to the park with her mum.
One day she was very upset. She didn't want to go, she wanted to stay on the couch and play. She looked at her mum and said: "No mum, I don't want to go!"
Mum was surprised and felt very upset. She said: "Mary, why don't you want to go to the park? We have so much fun there!" Mary looked at her mum and said: "I don't want to go, I just want to stay on the couch."
Mum thought for a moment and then said: "Ok, we can stay on the couch today, but tomorrow we will go to the park, okay?" Mary smiled and said: "Okay, sounds good!". They both hugged and cuddled on the couch until it was time for bed.




One day, Tom and Wendy were at the park admiring the view. Tom hadn't been to this park before so he found it very exciting. Suddenly, a distant noise caught their attention. It was a dog barking from a nearby house.
"Let's go take a look," Wendy suggested.
 
Tom agreed and they dashed towards the house. As they got closer, they saw that the dog belonged to a little girl. She was playing in the garden, admiring her collections of stones.
When the girl realised Tom and Wendy were there, she became anxious. She tried to hide her stones, feeling that the stones had some value.
Tom noticed her fear and stepped forward. "Don't be scared," he said. "We just came to admire your stones. We think they're special too."
At this, the girl's expression softened and she smiled. She proudly showed them her collection, as they admired her passion. With this, the distant feeling that had been between them disappeared.



Once upon a time on a cold winter night, there was a colorful reindeer. His name was Rudolph. He was very happy because it was almost Christmas. He was excited to show off his colorful antlers.
Rudolph went outside to play with his friends in the snow. He wanted to see who could kick the snow the highest. They all took turns running and kicking it as high as they could. Suddenly Rudolph got the biggest kick of all. It was so high that it almost reached the sky!
All of his friends were so impressed with Rudolph's kick. They even made him their leader. From then on, Rudolph was the leader of the pack. He was known as the leader of the colorful reindeers.
Every year Rudolph's kick is remembered. On cold winter nights you can still hear the reindeer singing about how high he kicked that night. This is one of their favorite stories about Rudolph!




Once there was an ant who wanted to find adventure. He decided he wanted to raise up high to see the world. He searched high and low looking for a way to do it. 
Soon, he stumbled upon a giant stick. He was so excited and he knew it was just what he needed to reach new heights. He quickly grabbed hold of the stick and started to climb. 
Slowly but surely, the ant made his way up the stick. It seemed to go on forever and he felt his strength waning. With each minute, the ant felt more and more proud of himself for not giving up. 
Finally, the ant reached the top. He was so proud of himself for continuing despite the difficult task. He looked out in awe at all the wonders he could now see. It was so much better than he could have ever expected!
The ant made his way back down the stick and set off again, this time with a much bigger sense of adventure.




One day, Jack and his family walked into the museum. Jack looked around in wonder--there were so many things to see! He saw a beautiful painting that glowed with colors and asked his mom what it was.
"That's a painting by a gifted artist," his mom explained. "It's very special."
Jack was amazed. He couldn't take his eyes off the painting! All around the museum he started to notice things that glowed in different colors. Everything was so beautiful.
Jack was so excited he couldn't contain himself. "Mommy, can we come back tomorrow and see all the things that glow?"
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, of course!" Jack smiled back and knew it was going to be the best day ever.




The seal was having a tasty snack. He kept eating, enjoying the crunchy food. Suddenly, he heard a voice.
"What are you eating, seal?" It was a little girl.
"Yummy food," said the seal with a smile.
The little girl was curious. "Can I have some?"
The seal kept the food safe. "No, this is mine."
The little girl's stomach growled. "Please, can I have just one?"
The seal thought for a moment. He gave the little girl half of his snack.
The little girl was so happy. The food was tasty!
The seal kept smiling. He was happy to help.




Once upon a time there were two friends, Sarah and Beth. Sarah wanted to eat something different for a snack but Beth couldnt remember what was on the menu. Sarah had a plan to find out. She told Beth to close her eyes and try to remember.
Beth shut her eyes tight, but no matter how hard she tried, she couldnt remember the menu. Suddenly, Sarah had a harsh idea. She grabbed Beths arm and told her to open her eyes. When Beth opened her eyes, she saw different kinds of food spread out on the table.
Sarah said, See, you can remember when you use your eyes, not just your brain.
Beth was so happy that she laughed out loud. Sarah and Beth decided to both try different snacks. They had a yummy time!
The moral of the story is that we can remember things better when we use our senses, not just our brains. Finding new things to try can be fun if we know where to look.




Once upon a time, there was a great sailboat. On board was a brave little girl, Meg. She bravely sailed across the sea, looking for treasure.
Meg had an idea and shouted, "Let's look for a tomato!" As they sailed, Meg spotted a big, juicy tomato. She was so excited, she shouted, "Great! I found it!"
Meg picked up the tomato, and together they sailed back across the open sea. When they reached the shore, Meg shared the tomato with her friends. They all had a great time and enjoyed the delicious treat.
The end.




Once there was a beautiful princess named Daisy. Daisy loved her family and had a very strong urge to marry. One day, Daisy's mother told her she ought to marry very soon. She was excited, but worried.
Daisy went outside to her favourite spot. While she was thinking, a rude man came to her. He began asking her to marry him. Daisy was scared; she knew he was not a nice person. She didn't like how he talked and quickly ran away.
The next day, Daisy's mother realised that the rude man had been a prince. He had come to her spot because he had heard Daisy wanted to marry. Daisy was very sad. She had wanted to marry, but not to someone so rude.
The day of Daisy's wedding came. When the doors opened, Daisy's heart skipped a beat. Standing in the doorway was the same prince from the day before. He had come to propose with all of his respect, and Daisy was finally able to marry the prince she had always wanted.




Joey and his dad were going on an expedition. As they travelled on the bus, Joey saw all the mysterious things that he wanted to explore.
Suddenly they arrived in town. The town was strange, but Dad said they were here to find a special sauce.
Joey was excited! He ran around and asked different people if they knew where the special sauce was.
Finally, an old lady said she knew the perfect place. She told them to keep walking and soon they saw a mysterious shop.
The sign above said "The Sauce Shop". Joey and Dad both knew this was the place. Inside, they found the special sauce and bought it. 
Joey was very happy as he held the sauce in his hands. Dad told him that it was the best sauce in the world! Joey agreed and slathered it over his pizza that night.



Once there was a family that didn't always get along. The brother and sister, Bob and Jane, wouldn't share. They always wanted to do their own thing.
One day, the family went to a park and saw some people playing football. The brother and sister felt that they wanted to join in too. But they were worried they wouldn't be able to work together.
However, the hairy football inspired Bob and Jane to team up and try. The ball being so hairy made them work together without even thinking about it. They had a lot of fun and soon became very good at working as a team.
The brother and sister soon found that football was a great way to unite the family and make it stronger. They all enjoyed spending time together, and soccer was the glue that held them all together.




Max was a fine three-year-old, and he was very tired. He had been playing all day, so he yawned.
Max's mother said to him, "Time to get ready for bed, Max. Let's start by putting on your pajamas! Come over here, let's do the zipper."
Max was annoyed and he frowned. "No!" He shouted. "I don't want to go to bed yet!"
Max's mother sighed. "Max, you have to go to bed soon. Otherwise, you won't feel fine for tomorrow. Now come over here and let me do the zipper on your pajamas."
Reluctantly, Max trudged over to his mother. Together they pulled the zipper up.
Max's mother gave him a big hug. "Good job, Max," she said. "Now it's time for bed!"
Max yawned, and he knew it was time for bed. Even though he was tired, at least now he was feeling fine.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Ben. He was three years old and loved exploring the world around him. One day, he stumbled across a big field with lots of grass. He decided to test it, so he ran into the field and jumped up and down in the grass.
Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. He looked up and saw a big white bird flying towards him, with a little message in its beak. Ben couldn't understand the message, but he was very excited so he reached out and grabbed it.
The bird flew away and Ben looked at the message. It was cold and the writing was tiny. He tried to read the message, but he was too little and he couldn't understand it. 
Suddenly, an old man appeared and said to Ben, "Do you need help understanding the message?". Ben nodded excitedly. 
The old man smiled and said, "Let me help you. The message says it's going to be very cold tonight."
Ben grinned and said, "Thank you!", before running back home to tell his mom the cold news.



Once upon a time, there was a carpet. It was very empty. One day, a little girl wanted to mix it up. She took some colours and a big paintbrush. She started mixing the colours. She made yellow, green, blue and orange. She painted the carpet with the colours. The carpet was so colourful! Everyone was very happy.



Once upon a time there was a little octopus who lived under the sea. One day, he was scared of the deep blue level where he lived, so he decided to move away from it. He swam to the surface and saw a wide, available beach. He was no longer scared and happily played around the beach.
One day, he noticed two little children were playing in the water. He wanted to play with them, too. He stretched out his tentacles to reach the children, but alas! He scared them away.
The octopus was sad, realizing his tentacles scared the children away. He learned a lesson: Never do something that will scare other people away.  He returned to the sea and continued living in a deep blue level, remembering his lesson and being happy without scaring people away.



Andy was playing in the park. He saw a puddle, and he was really excited. He ran over to the puddle and said to Mom, Look at this! But Mom said, No, Andy, you cant play here. Youll get all wet.
Andy was sad, and he said, But I want to play in it! Pleeeease! Mom said, Im sorry, but you cant. Its too dangerous.
Andy said, Awwww. Thats not fair. Mom said, I know. Im sorry. You can play in the sandbox instead. That will be safer.
Andy wasnt sure if he wanted to, but then he remembered how much fun it was to play in sand. So he decided to go and play in the sandbox instead. He was still a little bit sad, but the thought of playing in the sand soon made him excited again.  He ran off to the sandbox, ready to have some fun.




Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Joe. Joe wanted to buy some candy from the store. He had waited for weeks and was so excited when the day finally came. 
Joe went to the store with some money. On his way inside, he saw an ordinary blue box in the window. He couldn't keep his eyes off it. He asked his mom, "Mommy, can I buy the blue box?" 
Mom looked inside the window and replied, "No, that box is too expensive. We will have to wait until you can buy it." 
Joe was sad but he understood. He bought some candy instead and waited until he could buy the box. 
The days went by and Joe worked hard to save his money. Finally, he had enough and he went back to the store. He ran to the window and saw the blue box waiting there for him. 
He called out to his mom, "Mommy, can I buy the blue box now?" 
Mom smiled and said, "Yes! Go ahead and buy it." 
Joe was the happiest boy ever. He couldn't believe he was really going to buy the ordinary blue box. He ran to the cashier and bought the box. 
From then on, Joe kept his box safe and never stopped smiling.




Once there was a little girl who had a blanket she loved. It was blue with yellow stars. She decided to take it to the beach with her one day. 
When she arrived, she discovered a jellyfish washed up on the sand. It was helpless, its tentacles drooping on the shore. The little girl wanted to help it. 
She folded up her blanket and scooped up the jellyfish. She took it to the ocean and gently put it in the water. It moved away, grateful for the help. 
The little girl smiled and understood that it's important to help those in need. She realized that small things can have a big impact, just like her blanket had for the jellyfish. 
From then on, she always looked around to see who she could help. It made her happy to lend a hand whenever she could.




One day, Jane and her mommy decided to go for a jog in the park. It was a sunny day and all the birds were singing, it was so beautiful! But then, when they were nearly finished jogging, it started to rain. Jane didn't like it. Mommy said, "Come on Jane, we have to finish jogging, the rain won't last long!" But Jane didn't want to, it was too noisy!
So mommy told Jane that if she finished jogging, she could get an ice-cream afterwards. At this, Jane's eyes lit up, and she started jogging with mommy again, faster and faster! Eventually, they both crossed the finish line, and the rain had stopped. Jane was so happy! They celebrated by getting an ice-cream, and mommy and Jane talked about how happy they were when they finished.




One day, Little Billy was playing with his toy cars. His brother, Peter, was eating an egg. Billy wanted to try the egg, so he asked, "Can I chew it?"
Peter said, "No, Billy. Eggs are too hard for you to chew!"
But Billy was feeling nosy. He wanted to try it anyway. So he said, "I want to try it! Please!"
Peter said, "OK. Be careful not to choke." Then he handed Billy the egg.
Billy tried to chew it. He chewed and chewed, but it was too hard. He couldn't chew up the egg. So he spat it out.
Peter smiled and said, "I told you it was too hard!"




One day, a little girl named Sarah had an exciting day ahead of her. She was going to the park with her parents! She jumped around with glee. 
When they arrived at the park, Sarah saw that it was big and beautiful. She could hardly contain her excitement. All around, the trees were tall and green and the sky was a pale blue.
Sarah's father said, "It's time to go inside the park, Sarah. Are you ready?" Sarah happily nodded yes and followed her dad. She looked around. Everything was new and exciting - there were lots of other children playing, birds singing and lots of tall, green trees. 
Suddenly, Sarah heard her father call out, "It's time for ice cream!" She was so excited that she ran to where her father had ordered the ice cream for her.
Sarah smiled with delight; all of her anticipation had paid off with a delicious treat! The ice cream was creamy and sweet. She knew her day at the park would be a great one!




Mum and her little girl were making ice cream. The girl watched as Mum filled the bowl with cream and sugar. She smiled as Mum put it in the big box that shook and turned it around.
"What's that called, Mum?" the little girl asked.
"It's an ice cream maker," said Mum. "And do you know what it does?"
The little girl shook her head.
"It melts the cream and sugar together to make ice cream," said Mum.
The little girl watched as the box made the cream and sugar mix together. After some time, Mum opened the lid and the little girl peered inside. There was nothing there except an empty bowl.
"Where's the ice cream, Mum?" the little girl asked.
"It's finished melting, so now it needs to go in the freezer," said Mum.
The little girl watched as Mum put the empty bowl in the freezer. After a short while, Mum returned with a delicious bowl of ice cream.
The little girl smiled as she dug in with her spoon. Delicious!




Once upon a time, there was a little bear. He was a silly old bear and he liked to sleep a lot. One day he decided he would try to sleep 10,000 inches. It sounded very fun to him, but it was also very difficult.
So he started to sleep. He slept and he slept, until he was very tired. He had already slept 3,000 inches, but 7,000 more were still ahead.
The little bear was so tired that he nearly fell asleep standing up, but he knew he had to keep going if he wanted to sleep 10,000 inches. So he kept going. He counted every inch he slept. He slept 1 inch, then he slept 2 inches, and then he slept some more.
Finally, after what felt like forever, the little bear had reached 10,000 inches. He had hardly slept at all and he was very pleased with himself. He had made it! He was very happy and went back to his cozy den to sleep. He had done his best and was very proud of himself.




Teddy was a bear who loved to sleep and play. One day he decided to go explore the underground. He slowly walked inside, and it was very dark, but he saw lots of colorful lights. He followed the lights and found a cozy place to lay down. He rested and closed his eyes. 
Suddenly, Teddy heard voices coming from the darkness. He opened his eyes and noticed two shadows talking to each other.
"Look at the beautiful colors on the walls," the first said.
"Yes, they look so bright and colorful," the other one said. 
Teddy quietly watched and listened to them talk. After a moment, he realized they were fairies who lived underground! He was filled with awe and delight as he looked around.
The fairies suddenly noticed Teddy and smiled. "Hi Teddy," they said playfully.
"Would you like to come explore with us?" 
Teddy nodded and followed the two fairies as they explored the colorful underground. He had so much fun discovering the wonders of the underground with his new friends.



Once upon a time, there was a big snake. He slithered through the forest and stopped to rest in a sunny spot. Suddenly, he smelt something rotten far away. He followed his nose and found a big pile of rotten fruit. He curled up in the pile and got very comfortable.
Suddenly, he was disturbed by the sound of a small voice. He lifted his head and saw a little girl who couldn't have been more than three-years-old. He wondered what she was doing there.
The girl noticed the snake and said, "Hello big snake. What are you doing?"
The snake replied, "I am sleeping in this big pile of rotten fruit. It smells very nice and it is very comfortable."
The little girl looked delighted. She clapped her hands and said, "I love rotten fruit! Can I sleep here too?"
"Of course you can!" said the big snake.
So, the little girl lay down next to the snake and they both drifted off to sleep in the pile of rotten fruit. They both dreamed happily ever after.




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Katy. Every day, Katy and her Dad would go to the park. Today, Katy wanted something special. She asked her Dad if they could go to the video store.
Katy's Dad said yes, so they went to the video store. When they arrived, Katy looked around and saw lots of delicious videos. She pointed to a video and said to her Dad, Can I order this one?"
Her Dad said, No, Katy, you shouldn't order anything without asking. You should always be polite and ask first."
Katy nodded and said, I remember. Sorry, Dad.
Katy's Dad smiled and said, It's okay. You can order the video if you ask nicely.
So, Katy asked and said, May I please order the video?"
Her Dad said, Yes, of course you can.
Katy was so happy that she could order the video. This taught her an important lesson: always be polite and ask nicely before ordering anything.




Once upon a time, there was a friendly little boy named Jake who often went to the park with his mum. One day, Jake saw a strange man standing near the park entrance. The man had a big piece of luggage in his hands. Jake thought the man looked pretty harmless so he decided to talk to him.
"Hello mister," said Jake. "Where are you going with your luggage?"
The man smiled. "Oh, I'm on a special adventure. I'm going to pinch something special," he said.
Jake was curious. "What are you going to pinch?"
The man winked. "You'll find out," he said.
The next day, Jake walked to the park again. He noticed the same man, but this time he had a bag full of special goodies. The man winked at Jake and said, "I have something special for you."
Jake reached out to grab the bag, but suddenly the man pinched him on the arm! It hurt, but it wasn't that bad. However, the man then grabbed Jake by the collar and dragged him away from the park.
He took Jake to a dark alley and said, "You were a bit too nosy, so now I'm going to pinch something from you!"
