Sara and Tom moved their toys around the floor, making noises and voices. Sara made her doll run away from Tom's car, but Tom chased her with his car, honking and growling.
"Help, help!" Sara made her doll cry. "The dragon is coming! He wants to lock me in his cave!"
"No one can help you, princess!" Tom made his car say. "You are mine now! I will part you from your friends and family!"
Sara did not like Tom's game. She felt scared and sad for her doll. She wanted to stop playing, but Tom did not listen. He grabbed her doll with his car and tried to pull her hair.
"Stop it, Tom!" Sara shouted. "You are hurting my doll! Give her back to me!"
"No, I won't!" Tom shouted back. "She is my prisoner! You can't have her!"
Sara and Tom started to tug and pull on the doll's hair. They both wanted to have the doll, but they did not want to share. They got angry and loud. They did not notice that their mom was watching them from the kitchen.
"Hey, hey, hey!" their mom said. "What is going on here? Why are you fighting over the doll?"
Sara and Tom stopped and looked at their mom. They felt ashamed and sorry. They realized that they had been mean and rude to each other.
"We were playing a game, mom," Sara said. "But Tom was too rough and scary. He wanted to lock my doll in his cave and part her from me."
"I was just pretending, mom," Tom said. "But Sara did not like my game. She wanted to keep her doll and not let me play with her."
Their mom sighed and shook her head. She walked over to them and took the doll from their hands. She looked at the doll's hair and saw that it was tangled and pulled.
"Look what you did to the doll," she said. "You ruined her hair. How do you think she feels?"
Sara and Tom looked at the doll and felt bad. They saw that they had hurt the doll and each other.
"We are sorry, mom," they said. "We are sorry, doll."
Their mom smiled and hugged them. She gave them the doll back and helped them fix her hair.
"It's OK, my loves," she said. "I know you were just playing, but you have to be careful and kind. You have to respect each other's toys and feelings. You have to share and take turns. And you have to use your words, not your hands, when you have a problem. OK?"
"OK, mom," Sara and Tom said. "We understand. We will do better."
They hugged their mom and thanked her. Then they hugged each other and apologized. They decided to play a different game, one that they both liked and agreed on. They were happy and friendly again. They learned their lesson.




Lily and Tom were eager to see the fire. They heard the big noise and saw the red light in the sky. They ran to the window and looked outside. They saw the fire truck and the firemen. They saw the water and the smoke. They saw the fire.
"Wow!" Lily said. "Look at the fire! It is so big and bright!"
"Can we go outside and see it?" Tom asked. He wanted to get closer to the fire.
"No, no, no!" Mom said. She came to the window and pulled them away. "The fire is very hot and dangerous. You have to stay inside and be safe."
"But why?" Tom questioned. He did not understand why they could not go outside.
"Because the fire can hurt you and burn you. And the smoke can make you cough and sick. And the firemen have to work hard to stop the fire. You have to listen to Mom and stay inside." Mom explained.
Lily and Tom were sad and curious. They wanted to see the fire, but they also wanted to be safe and healthy. They decided to listen to Mom and stay inside. They watched the fire from the window until it was gone. They hoped that no one was hurt by the fire. They thanked the firemen for their work. They learned that fire is not a toy, but a force of nature.




Tim and Kim were twins who liked to play in their room. They had many toys and books and a big mattress to jump on. Sometimes they made a fort with the mattress and the blankets and pretended to be pirates or explorers.
One day, their mom told them she had to go to the store and asked them to be good and not make a mess. She said she would be back soon and left them some snacks and juice. Tim and Kim said okay and waved goodbye.
After mom left, Tim and Kim decided to play with the mattress. They dragged it to the middle of the room and started to jump on it. They had fun bouncing and laughing and making silly faces. But then, Tim had an idea.
"Let's make the mattress more fun," he said. "Let's put some juice on it and make it slippery."
Kim thought that was a bad idea. She said, "No, Tim, that's dangerous. We could fall and hurt ourselves. And we could spoil the mattress and make mom angry."
But Tim did not listen. He grabbed a bottle of juice and poured some on the mattress. He said, "Come on, Kim, don't be a baby. It's just juice. It will dry up."
He jumped on the mattress and slid on the juice. He said, "Whee, this is fun. Try it, Kim."
Kim shook her head. She said, "No, Tim, I don't want to. It's not fun, it's stupid. Stop it, Tim, or I'll tell mom."
But Tim did not stop. He poured more juice on the mattress and jumped and slid. He said, "You're no fun, Kim. You're a boring girl. I'm having a blast."
He did not see that the juice was dripping on the floor and making a big puddle. He did not hear that mom was coming back and opening the door. He did not notice that mom was shocked and angry when she saw the mess.
"Tim, Kim, what have you done?" mom yelled. "You spoiled the mattress and the floor. You made a huge mess. You were very naughty and dangerous. How could you do this?"
Tim and Kim stopped jumping and looked at mom. They felt scared and sorry. They said, "We're sorry, mom. We were just playing. We didn't mean to spoil the mattress."
Mom sighed. She said, "Playing is good, but you have to be careful and respectful. You have to listen to each other and to me. You have to clean up your mess and apologize. And you have to promise me you will never do this again."
Tim and Kim nodded. They said, "We promise, mom. We're sorry, mom. We love you, mom."
Mom hugged them. She said, "I love you too, Tim and Kim. But you have to learn from your mistakes. Now, let's get some towels and clean this up. And then, you have to go to bed early. No more playing with the mattress today."




Sam and Mia were twins who liked to explore new places. One day, they went with their mom and dad to visit a big temple. The temple had many stairs, statues, and paintings. Sam and Mia wanted to see everything, so they ran and rushed from one thing to another.
"Slow down, children," their mom said. "You might get lost or hurt yourself. And be respectful of the temple and the people here."
But Sam and Mia did not listen. They kept rushing and running, until they bumped into an elderly man. The man was wearing a long robe and a hat. He was holding a stick and a book. He looked very angry.
"Hey, watch where you are going!" the man shouted. "You have no manners. This is a sacred place, not a playground. You should be quiet and calm, and learn from the wisdom of the temple."
Sam and Mia felt scared and sorry. They realized they had been rude and careless. They apologized to the man and bowed their heads.
"We are sorry, sir," they said. "We did not mean to bother you. We were just curious and excited. But you are right, we should be respectful and learn from the temple."
The man softened his expression and smiled. He saw that the children were sincere and humble. He decided to forgive them and teach them.
"It is good that you are curious and excited, children," he said. "But you must also be careful and mindful. The temple is a place of peace and harmony, where you can find beauty and wisdom. Come, I will show you some of the treasures of the temple, and tell you some of the stories behind them."
Sam and Mia nodded and followed the man. They walked slowly and quietly, and listened attentively. They saw and learned many new things, and felt happy and grateful. They thanked the man for his kindness and generosity.
"You are welcome, children," the man said. "You have learned a valuable lesson today. Remember, always respect the temple and the people, and you will find joy and enlightenment."
The moral of the story is: Respect the temple and the people, and you will find joy and enlightenment.




Sara loved to visit her elderly grandma every week. Grandma had a big garden with many flowers and fruits. Sara liked to smell the roses, pick the strawberries and play with the cat. But her favorite thing was to make lemonade with grandma. Grandma had a big lemon tree that gave many lemons. Sara and grandma would squeeze the lemons, add water and sugar, and stir well. Then they would drink the lemonade together and chat.
But one day, Sara could not visit grandma. She had a cold and had to stay in bed. She felt sad and bored. She missed grandma and the lemonade. She wondered if grandma missed her too. She wished she could see the lemon tree and the cat.
Grandma also missed Sara. She knew Sara was sick and could not come. She prayed for Sara to get well soon. She decided to do something nice for Sara. She picked some lemons from the tree and made a jar of lemonade. She also wrote a note for Sara. She asked her neighbor to deliver the jar and the note to Sara's house.
Sara was surprised and happy when she saw the jar and the note. She read the note. It said: "Dear Sara, I miss you very much. I hope you feel better soon. Here is some lemonade for you. Drink it and think of me. I love you, Grandma." Sara smiled and hugged the jar. She felt warm and loved. She drank some lemonade and felt better. She wrote a note back to grandma. It said: "Dear Grandma, I miss you too. Thank you for the lemonade. It is delicious. I love you, Sara." She asked her mom to give the note to the neighbor.
Grandma was delighted when she received the note from Sara. She read it and smiled. She felt happy and proud. She put the note on her fridge. She waited for the next week, when Sara would come and visit her again.




Lily and Ben were friends who liked to ride their bikes. One day, they rode to the pond near their house. They saw some ducks and fish in the water.
"Look, Ben, the ducks are hungry. Let's give them some bread," Lily said.
"OK, Lily, but we only have a little bread. We need some for ourselves too," Ben said.
They broke the bread into small pieces and threw them to the ducks. The ducks quacked and ate the bread. Lily and Ben smiled and watched them.
But then, a big goose came and chased the ducks away. It ate all the bread and honked loudly. Lily and Ben were scared and angry.
"Hey, goose, that's not nice. You should share with the ducks. They were here first," Lily shouted.
The goose ignored her and looked for more bread. It saw Lily and Ben's bikes and thought they were food. It bit the tires and the seats and made holes in them.
Lily and Ben ran to their bikes and tried to stop the goose. But it was too strong and mean. It pecked at them and made them cry.
"Help, help, someone help us," they screamed.
A man who was walking his dog heard them and came to help. He shooed the goose away and checked their bikes. He saw that they were ruined.
"I'm sorry, kids, your bikes are broken. You can't ride them anymore. What were you doing here?" he asked.
"We were feeding the ducks, but the goose came and took everything. It was greedy and nasty," Lily said.
The man nodded and said, "I see. Well, you were kind and generous to the ducks, but you should also be careful and wise. The pond is not a safe place for kids and bikes. There are many animals and things that can hurt you. Next time, you should ride somewhere else, or ask your parents to come with you."
Lily and Ben thanked the man and his dog. They learned their lesson and never rode to the pond again. They also learned to be more grateful for what they had and to respect other living things.




Tom and Anna were friends who liked to play outside. They liked to skip, run, jump and sing. One day, they saw some big trucks and loud planes go by their street. They were scared and wondered what was happening.
"Where are they going?" Tom asked Anna.
"I don't know. Maybe they are going to war," Anna said.
"What is war?" Tom asked.
"War is when people fight and hurt each other. It is very bad and sad," Anna said.
"Why do they fight?" Tom asked.
"I don't know. Maybe they are angry or greedy or afraid. Maybe they don't have enough things or love," Anna said.
"That is poor. We have enough things and love. We don't need to fight," Tom said.
"Yes, we are lucky. We have each other and our families and our toys and our books. We can share and help and be kind," Anna said.
They hugged and decided to skip away from the noise and go to the park. They hoped that the people who were going to war would stop fighting and be friends too. They wished for peace and happiness for everyone.




Lily and Sam are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big slide. Lily wants to try it, but Sam is scared.
"Come on, Sam. You can do it. It is fun!" Lily encourages Sam. She holds his hand and walks to the slide.
Sam looks at the slide. It is very high and steep. He shakes his head. "No, Lily. I am afraid. I want to go back."
Lily smiles. She is polite. She does not push Sam. She says, "It is okay, Sam. You do not have to slide. But can you watch me? I will show you how I slide."
Sam nods. He lets go of Lily's hand. He sits on a bench near the slide. He watches Lily climb the ladder. He hears her laugh. He sees her slide down fast. She looks happy.
Lily runs to Sam. She gives him a tap on the shoulder. She says, "That was so fun, Sam! Do you want to try now?"
Sam thinks. He sees Lily's smile. He feels her tap. He hears her voice. He is not so scared anymore. He says, "Okay, Lily. I will try. But can you go with me?"
Lily nods. She is proud of Sam. She says, "Of course, Sam. I will go with you. We will slide together."
Lily and Sam hold hands again. They walk to the slide. They climb the ladder. They sit on the slide. They slide down fast. They laugh. They are happy. They are brave. They are friends.




Lily liked to sew with her grandma. Grandma had many colors of thread. Lily wanted to make a dress for her doll. She picked a pink thread and a needle.
"Can you help me, grandma?" Lily asked. "I don't know how to sew."
"Of course, my dear," grandma said. "Sewing is easy and fun. You just have to be careful with the needle. It can hurt your finger."
Grandma showed Lily how to make small stitches on the fabric. Lily tried to copy her. She was happy to see the dress taking shape.
"Look, grandma, I made a dress!" Lily said. "It is very pretty."
Grandma smiled and hugged Lily. "You did a great job, Lily. You are a very humble and kind girl. You don't speak too much or too loud. You listen and learn. I am proud of you."
Lily felt warm and happy. She thanked grandma and put the dress on her doll. She loved sewing with her grandma. She loved her grandma very much.




Tim and Sam were best friends. They liked to play with marbles. They had many marbles of different colors and sizes. They wanted to be famous for having the most marbles in the school.
One day, they saw a big jar of marbles in the shop. They wanted to buy it, but they did not have enough money. They decided to take some money from their mom's purse without asking. They thought their mom would not notice.
They ran to the shop and bought the jar of marbles. They were very happy. They took the jar to the park and opened it. They poured the marbles on the ground and admired them. They felt very proud.
But then, it started to rain. The rain was heavy and cold. Tim and Sam had no umbrella or coat. They tried to pick up their marbles, but they were too many and too slippery. The marbles rolled away in the water and mud. Tim and Sam could not catch them. They lost all their marbles.
They were very sad and wet. They realized they had done a bad thing. They had stolen money from their mom and wasted it on marbles. They had hurt their mom and lost their marbles. They were not famous, they were foolish.
They ran back home and told their mom what they had done. They said they were sorry and asked for forgiveness. Their mom was angry and disappointed, but she also loved them. She hugged them and said she forgave them, but they had to learn from their mistake. She said they had to work hard to earn back the money and to be honest and kind.
Tim and Sam learned their lesson. They never stole money again. They worked hard to help their mom and to save money. They also shared their toys and played nicely with other kids. They did not care about being famous for having marbles. They cared about being good friends and good sons.




Lily was a brave knight. She had a sword and a shield and a helmet. She liked to play with her friends and pretend they were fighting dragons and monsters. One day, she saw a big hill in the park. She thought it looked like a castle. She wanted to climb it and see what was on top.
She asked her friends to come with her, but they were scared. They said the hill was too high and steep and there might be bugs or snakes. Lily sighed. She was not scared of anything. She said she would go by herself and show them how brave she was. She took her sword and shield and helmet and started to climb the hill.
It was hard work. The hill was very high and steep and there were rocks and dirt and grass. Lily had to be careful not to slip or fall. She used her shield to protect herself from the sun and the wind. She was hot and tired, but she kept going. She wanted to see the castle.
She reached the top of the hill. She looked around. She did not see a castle. She only saw more hills and trees and sky. She felt sad and disappointed. She had climbed so far for nothing. She sat down on the ground and put her sword and shield and helmet next to her. She was pale and sweaty and thirsty. She wished she had stayed with her friends.
She heard a noise. She looked up. She saw a big bird flying over her. It had a long beak and sharp claws and bright feathers. It looked like a hawk. It saw Lily and her sword and shield and helmet. It thought they were shiny and pretty. It wanted to take them. It swooped down and grabbed Lily's helmet with its beak. It flew away with it.
Lily was shocked and angry. She jumped up and shouted at the bird. She wanted her helmet back. She picked up her sword and shield and ran after the bird. She did not care how high or steep or scary the hill was. She was a brave knight. She would not let the bird steal her helmet. She would get it back. She would show the bird and her friends how brave she was.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a red wagon that she loved to play with. One day, her mom asked her to measure how long the wagon was. Lily didn't know how to measure, so she asked her mom how to do it.
Mom said, "We can measure with a ruler. It's a tool that helps us know how long or how big something is."
Lily was proud of herself for learning something new. She measured the wagon and found out it was three rulers long. She ran to her dad and said, "Look! I measured my wagon and it's three rulers long!"
Dad was proud of Lily too. He said, "You're getting so smart. Keep learning new things!" From that day on, Lily loved measuring things with her ruler and felt proud of herself every time she learned something new.



Once upon a time, there was a happy spirit named Sparky. Sparky loved to roll around in the grass and play with his friends. One day, Sparky's friend, a little puppy named Max, wanted to play too. But Max wasn't feeling very fit that day. 
Sparky didn't want Max to feel left out, so he came up with an idea. He rolled a ball over to Max and they played together. Max was so happy that Sparky included him in the game. Sparky felt happy too, knowing that he helped his friend feel better. From that day on, Sparky and Max played together every day, rolling and having fun. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to wear her red scarf every day. One day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a small boy crying because he lost his scarf.
Lily asked the boy, "What's wrong?"
"I lost my scarf," the boy replied.
"Don't worry, I can help you find it," said Lily.
Together, they searched for the small boy's scarf. Finally, they found it and Lily said, "Here you go, I took it for you."
The small boy smiled and said, "Thank you, Lily. You're a good friend."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she saw a charming butterfly flying around her garden. It was so pretty, with its colorful wings.
Lily wanted to catch the butterfly, so she leaned over to try and catch it. But the butterfly flew away, up into the sky. Lily felt sad and looked down at the earth. She saw a little ant crawling around and decided to follow it.
The ant led her to a beautiful flower, where more butterflies were fluttering around. Lily felt happy again and sat down to watch them. She realized that sometimes, you just have to lean back and enjoy the beauty of the earth around you.



Once upon a time, there was a little baby named Lily. She loved to play in her crib and giggle with joy. One day, her mommy and daddy decided to take her to the park for a picnic. They packed sandwiches, fruit, and juice in a big basket.
As they were walking, they saw a group of ducks swimming in the pond. Lily's daddy said, "I bet we can feed the ducks and they will come close to us." So, they took out some bread and threw it in the water. The ducks came closer and closer, quacking with happiness.
After they finished their picnic, they started to walk back home. Suddenly, they saw a rainbow in the sky. Lily's mommy said, "This is a successful day! We had a fun picnic and saw a beautiful rainbow." Lily smiled and cooed happily, feeling grateful for her wonderful family.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved trains and he would always watch them go by. One day, Timmy saw a train that he really wanted to touch. He ran towards the train, but he tripped and hurt his knee. 
Timmy's mom came to help him and she brought him inside. She put a band-aid on his knee, but Timmy was still sad because he couldn't go see the train. His mom promised to bring him to see the train the next day. 
The next day, Timmy and his mom went to see the train. Timmy was so happy and excited, but he didn't listen to his mom when she told him to stay away from the tracks. Timmy got too close and the train hit him. Timmy's mom was very sad and hurt because she couldn't bring Timmy back. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a house with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily saw her neighbor walking outside. The neighbor looked gloomy and sad. 
Lily wanted to make her neighbor feel better. She asked her mommy what she could do. Her mommy said, "Let's make some cookies for her!" Lily thought that was a great idea. 
So, they made some cookies and brought them to the neighbor's house. The neighbor was so happy and surprised. She guessed that they made the cookies just for her. Lily felt happy because she made her neighbor feel better. From that day on, they became good friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to walk in the park with her mommy and daddy. One day, they heard an incredible sound coming from the trees. Lily stopped to listen and heard birds chirping.
She loved to walk around and explore the park. She saw a squirrel running up a tree and stopped to watch it. It was incredible how fast the squirrel could climb!
As they continued their walk, they saw a big dog playing with a ball. Lily stopped to listen to the dog barking happily. She thought it was incredible how much fun the dog was having.
Finally, they reached the end of their walk and went home. Lily was happy because she got to listen to the birds and see the incredible squirrel and dog.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily's mommy was drinking her coffee in the kitchen. Lily wanted some too, but her mommy said no because coffee is only for grown-ups. Lily was sad and went to her room.
Later that day, Lily's mommy went to take a nap. Lily wanted to peek at her mommy, but she was sleeping. Suddenly, Lily knocked over the coffee cup and spilled it all over her mommy. Her mommy woke up and was very angry. Lily said sorry, but it was too late. 
The moral of the story is that we should always listen to our parents and not touch things we are not supposed to. And if we make a mistake, we should say sorry right away.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to eat dessert, especially ice cream. One day, Lily's mom made her a big bowl of ice cream with lots of toppings. Lily was so happy and ate it all up. 
After eating her dessert, Lily felt very full and tired. She decided to rest on the couch and watch her favorite TV show. But then, she remembered that she didn't finish her homework yet. Lily felt ashamed because she forgot to do it earlier. 
So, Lily got up from the couch and went to her room to finish her homework. After she finished, she felt proud of herself and went back to the couch to rest again. This time, she fell asleep and had sweet dreams of more ice cream. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, she found an old clock in her grandma's house. It was big and round, and it had a humble sound. 
Lily asked her grandma, "Can I play with this clock, please?" Her grandma replied, "Of course, my dear. But be careful with it." So, Lily took the clock and played with it. She loved the sound it made every hour. 
Suddenly, the clock stopped ticking. Lily was sad and asked her grandma, "What happened to the clock?" Her grandma said, "It's broken, my dear. Let's take it to the repair shop." So, they took the clock to the shop, and the repairman fixed it. 
When they got back home, Lily was happy again. She said, "Thank you, grandma. Now I can play with my clock again!" And they both laughed happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went for a walk in the forest with her mom. They found a new path that they had never seen before. It was so exciting! They followed the path and found a big tree. When they looked closer, they saw that there was a little door in the tree. They opened the door and inside they found a treasure chest! They were so happy to reveal the treasure inside. Lily and her mom found lots of shiny jewels and gold coins. They were so happy that they found the new path and discovered the treasure.



Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop around in the garden and eat carrots. One day, Benny saw a big red radish growing in the ground. He had never seen anything like it before and wondered what it tasted like. 
Benny hopped over to the radish and took a little nibble. It was very spicy and made his nose tingle! Benny thought it was an ordinary carrot at first, but it was much different. He decided he liked it and ate the whole thing. 
From then on, Benny would always look for radishes in the garden. He wondered if there were any other vegetables that tasted as good as the radish. Benny was a happy bunny with a full tummy. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. While they were walking, they saw a big peach tree. The peaches looked so yummy and clear. 
Lily said, "Mommy, can we get one peach?" 
Mommy replied, "We can't take the peaches from the tree. That's not nice. But we can buy some from the store." 
Suddenly, a little boy came up to them and said, "I want a peach too!" 
Lily said, "Sorry, we can't take the peaches. That's not nice." 
The little boy got upset and tried to pinch Lily. But Lily's mommy protected her and said, "No pinching! That's not nice either." 
The little boy felt bad and said sorry. Lily forgave him and they all went to the store to buy some yummy peaches. They all became friends and had a fun day in the park. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to draw. She had many crayons of different colors. One day, Lily was drawing a lovely picture of her family when it started to rain outside. She looked out the window and saw the raindrops falling from the sky. 
Lily decided to take a break from drawing and went outside to play in the rain. She splashed in the puddles and felt the raindrops on her face. It was so much fun! 
After a while, Lily went back inside and continued to draw. She used her blue crayon to color in the sky and added some raindrops to her picture. It was a lovely drawing, just like the rain outside. Lily was very happy with her artwork and hung it up on the fridge for her family to see.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved his mommy very much. He always made sure to take care of her when she was sick or sad. One day, Timmy's mommy had a bad day at work. Timmy wanted to make her feel better, so he went outside to pick some flowers. He made a pretty bouquet and gave it to his mommy as a gift. She smiled and hugged him tight.
Later that day, Timmy went outside to play with his friends. They found a dirty puddle and started playing in it. Timmy didn't want to get filthy, so he decided to go home. When he got home, he took a bath and put on his clean pajamas. He went to bed feeling happy that he made his mommy feel better with his gift.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a furry teddy bear named Brownie. Lily loved to play with Brownie every day. One day, Lily's little brother, Max, came into her room and wanted to play with Brownie too. Lily didn't want to share her teddy bear and said, "No, Max! Brownie is mine!" 
Max started to cry and said, "I want to play with Brownie too!" Lily felt bad and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, she had an idea. She took a picture frame from her dresser and said, "Max, let's play a new game. We can take turns holding Brownie and taking pictures of each other with this frame. Then we can hang the pictures on the wall!" 
Max loved the idea and stopped crying. They played together happily, taking turns holding Brownie and taking pictures with the frame. In the end, they had a lot of fun and even made a new decoration for their room. From that day on, Lily and Max played together with Brownie and the frame every day.



Once upon a time, there was a girl. She was very noisy and liked to shout and sing all day long. One day, her mommy asked her to stay quiet because her baby brother was sleeping. But the girl didn't listen and continued to make noise. 
Suddenly, the baby woke up and started to cry. The girl felt bad and realized that she should have listened to her mommy. From that day on, she tried her best to stay quiet when her baby brother was sleeping. 
Now, the girl and her baby brother are best friends. They play together and have lots of fun. And the girl learned that sometimes it's important to stay quiet and be a good listener. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat sweet candy all the time. One day, she went to the store with her mom and saw a candy necklace. "Can I have it, please?" she asked her mom.
Her mom replied, "Sure, but you have to gain it by being a good girl all day."
Lily promised to be good and her mom bought her the candy necklace. She wore it around her neck and it tasted so sweet. Her friend, Timmy, saw it and said, "Wow, that's a cool necklace! Can I have one too?"
Lily replied, "Sure, you can gain one by being good like me!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived on a farm with her family. They grew wheat on the farm. One day, Lily was excited to help her family turn the wheat. She loved to play in the fields and watch the wheat sway in the wind.
As they were turning the wheat, Lily saw a little bird. The bird was chirping and hopping around in the wheat. Lily got so excited that she ran towards the bird. But as she got closer, she accidentally stepped on the wheat and damaged it.
Lily felt very sad because she had ruined the wheat. Her family was upset too because they needed the wheat to make bread. They had to throw away all the damaged wheat and had no bread to eat. Lily learned that it's important to be careful and not to get too excited sometimes.



Once upon a time, there was a pilot named Jack. Jack loved to fly his big airplane. One day, Jack's friend Timmy came to visit him at the airport. Timmy asked Jack if he could go for a ride in the airplane. Jack said yes and they got in the airplane.
As they were flying, Jack asked Timmy, "Do you want to race with me?" Timmy said, "Yes, I want to race!" So, Jack and Timmy started to race their airplanes. It was difficult to fly fast, but they tried their best.
After a while, Jack said, "I think I am winning!" Timmy said, "No, I am winning!" They laughed and continued to race until they landed back at the airport. Timmy said, "That was so much fun! Can we race again?" Jack replied, "Of course, anytime!" And they both smiled as they walked away from the airplane.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toys and sharing them with his friends. One day, Timmy's friend Billy came over to play. Timmy showed Billy his favorite toy and asked if he wanted to play with it. But Billy said no and took the toy away from Timmy.
Timmy felt sad and didn't know what to do. He wanted to play with his toy but didn't want to be selfish and not share with his friend. So, he asked his mom if it was okay to not share his toy with Billy. His mom told him that it's important to share, but it's also okay to permit yourself to keep your favorite toy for a little while.
Timmy felt better after talking to his mom and decided to share his other toys with Billy. They had a fun time playing together and Timmy realized that sharing is important, but it's also okay to name some special things as your own and permit yourself to keep them for a little while.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys, but he wanted to build something big. He decided to build a tower out of bricks. Timmy went outside to get some bricks, but he was tired from playing all day. 
Timmy's friend, Billy, saw him and asked, "What are you doing, Timmy?"
"I'm building a tower with bricks," Timmy replied.
Billy said, "That sounds like fun! Can I help?"
Timmy said, "Yes, please help me. I'm too tired to do it alone."
So, Timmy and Billy worked together to build the tower. It took a long time, but they finally finished. Timmy was so happy that he said, "This is the best tower ever! Thank you for helping me, Billy."
Billy said, "You're welcome, Timmy. We make a good team."



Once upon a time, there was a mule named Jack. Jack was a big animal with long ears and a brown coat. One day, Jack went for a walk in the forest. It was dark and he felt scared. Suddenly, he saw a light and he felt better. The light came from a house. Jack went closer to the house and he saw a man. The man gave Jack some food and water. Jack felt happy and he changed his mind about being scared. From that day on, Jack visited the man every time he felt scared in the dark forest.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, but he never liked to tidy them up afterwards. His mom would always tell him to tidy up his toys, but he never listened.
One day, Timmy's mom asked him to switch off the TV and help her tidy up the toys. Timmy didn't want to stop watching his favorite show, but his mom reminded him that it was important to keep the house tidy.
Timmy finally agreed and started to lift up his toys and put them away. As he was tidying up, he found a toy he had been looking for. He was so happy that he had found it, and he realized that it was easier to find his toys when they were all tidy.
From that day on, Timmy always made sure to tidy up his toys before watching TV or playing with anything else. He learned that keeping things tidy made him feel better and made it easier to find the things he loved.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to drink milk every day. Her mommy always poured her a tall glass of milk, but Lily wanted it even higher. She would say, "Mommy, can you make the milk go up to the sky?"
One day, Lily and her mommy were baking a cake for her daddy's birthday. They needed to split the eggs into two bowls. Lily was so excited to help, but she accidentally dropped one of the eggs on the floor. Her mommy said, "Don't worry, Lily. We can clean it up together."
As they were cleaning up the egg, Lily noticed that the milk was starting to rise higher and higher in the glass. She said, "Mommy, look! The milk is going up to the sky!" Her mommy smiled and said, "That's because we added a special ingredient to the cake. It makes the milk rise high in the glass." 
When the cake was finished baking, they put candles on it and sang "Happy Birthday" to Lily's daddy. He blew out the candles and they all enjoyed a slice of the delicious cake with their tall glasses of milk. Lily was so happy that she got to help make the cake and see the milk go up high in her glass.



Once upon a time, there was a big rabbit named Benny. Benny loved to eat carrots and cauliflower. One day, Benny went to the vegetable garden to find some yummy veggies to eat.
As he was munching on a large cauliflower, he heard a small voice say, "Hi there, Mr. Rabbit! Do you enjoy eating cauliflower?"
Benny turned around and saw a tiny mouse looking up at him. "Yes, I love cauliflower! It's so delicious and healthy," Benny replied.
The mouse looked surprised. "Wow, I've never tried cauliflower before. Maybe I'll give it a try!" 
From that day on, Benny and the mouse became good friends and enjoyed eating cauliflower together in the vegetable garden.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, he wanted to play with his red truck, but he couldn't find it.
"Mommy, where is my red truck?" Timmy asked.
"I don't know, Timmy. Did you put it away in your toy box?" his mom replied.
Timmy looked in his toy box, but his red truck wasn't there. He looked all over his room, but he still couldn't find it. Suddenly, he remembered that he had put it in his toy chest.
"I remember, Mommy! I put it in my toy chest, but I can't unlock it. Can you help me?" Timmy asked.
His mom went to the toy chest and saw that the number on the lock was not clear. She cleaned it with a cloth and then unlocked the chest. Timmy was so happy to find his red truck and he played with it all day.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the garden, but one day he saw a snake. The snake looked very scary and Timmy was very afraid. 
He ran to his mother and said, "Mommy, there's a snake in the garden! Can we escape?" 
His mother looked out the window and saw the poor snake. It was stuck in a trap and couldn't move. 
"Don't worry, Timmy," said his mother. "The snake can't hurt us. It's just a poor animal that needs help." 
Timmy and his mother went outside and helped the snake escape from the trap. They watched as it slithered away, happy to be free. From then on, Timmy wasn't afraid of snakes anymore.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a rubber ball that she loved to play with. The ball was gray and bouncy.
One day, Lily's mommy said, "Let's travel to the park and play with your ball." Lily was very happy and said, "Yay! I love the park!"
When they got to the park, Lily started to play with her ball. But then, the ball bounced away and went into the bushes. Lily started to cry.
"Don't worry, Lily," said her mommy. "I'll get your ball for you." Her mommy went into the bushes and found the ball. Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, mommy! You're the best!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bounce on her bed all day long. One day, her mommy told her they were going to the airport to see her grandma. Lily got very excited and her face turned pale with joy. 
At the airport, Lily saw lots of big planes with wings that could flap like birds. She wanted to bounce on the runways, but her mommy said it wasn't safe. They went inside the airport and Lily saw lots of people with bags and suitcases. She bounced up and down with excitement, waiting for her grandma's plane to arrive. 
Finally, her grandma arrived and they hugged each other tightly. Lily's face turned red with happiness. They went home and had lots of fun bouncing on the bed together. Lily was so happy to see her grandma and she knew it was going to be a great day. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a man. He had a big machine that could print pictures. Every day, he would work very hard to make sure the machine was happy and could print lots of pictures. But one day, something went wrong and the machine became very messy. The man was sad because he couldn't print any pictures. So, he took a big cloth and cleaned the machine until it was shiny and happy again. From that day on, the man made sure to keep the machine clean and tidy so it could always work and print lots of pictures.



Once upon a time, there was a happy little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and watch the sunrise. One day, Timmy's sister took his favorite toy and wouldn't give it back. Timmy was sad and didn't know what to do.
He asked his mom for help, but she was busy cooking dinner. Suddenly, Timmy had an idea. He went outside and found a crazy-looking rock that matched the color of his toy. He showed it to his sister and said, "Look, this rock matches my toy! Can we share?"
His sister thought about it for a moment and then agreed. Timmy was happy again and they watched the sunrise together with their matching toy and rock. From then on, they learned to share and play nicely together. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a friendly turkey named Tom. Tom liked to walk around the farm and talk to all the other animals. One day, Tom saw a group of children playing and he wanted to join them. 
"Hi, I'm Tom. Can I play with you?" asked Tom.
"No, you can't play with us. You're a turkey and turkeys can't play with us," said one of the children.
Tom felt sad because he wanted to make friends with the children. Suddenly, something happened. A big gust of wind blew and all the children's toys flew away. 
"Oh no! Our toys are gone!" cried the children.
Tom knew he could help. He flapped his wings and ran after the toys. He brought them back to the children.
"Wow, thank you Tom! You're a really friendly turkey," said the children.
From that day on, Tom played with the children every day and they all became good friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Nemo. Nemo liked to swim in the ocean with his friends. One day, Nemo saw a big shiny thing in the water. He wanted to see what it was, so he decided to dive down.
As Nemo got closer, he realized it was a refrigerator! Nemo thought it was cool and wanted to explore it. But as he swam closer, he accidentally bumped into the refrigerator and it fell on top of him. Nemo was hurt and couldn't swim back up to the surface.
Nemo's friends looked for him but they couldn't find him. Sadly, Nemo was stuck under the refrigerator and couldn't get out. He couldn't breathe and eventually, he passed away. His friends were very sad and missed him very much.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and talk on the telephone with his mommy. One day, Timmy decided to build a tall tower with his blocks. He stacked them up higher and higher until it was as tall as him!
His mommy called him on the telephone and asked what he was doing. "I create a big tower!" Timmy exclaimed. "Wow, that sounds amazing!" his mommy replied. "Can you show me on the telephone?"
Timmy held up the telephone to the tower and his mommy could see how tall it was. "That's so cool!" she said. "You're so creative, Timmy." Timmy felt proud of himself for creating something so tall and showing his mommy on the telephone. From that day on, he loved to build tall towers and share them with his mommy on the telephone.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys and his friends. One day, Timmy's mom took him to the park to play. Timmy saw his friends and ran to play with them. 
Timmy's friends were playing a game and they asked Timmy to join. Timmy was very excited and started to play. Suddenly, Timmy fell down and his pants ripped. Timmy was embarrassed and ran away crying. 
Timmy's mom saw him and tried to make him feel better. She told him that accidents happen and it's okay to make mistakes. Timmy felt a little better and they went to get ice cream. 
On the way home, Timmy saw a man shouting and fighting with another man. Timmy was scared and asked his mom why they were fighting. His mom said that sometimes people don't get along and it's important to try and make peace. 
When they got home, Timmy's mom opened the door and they saw that their house had been robbed. Timmy was very scared and didn't understand why someone would do that. His mom called the police and they came to investigate. Timmy felt sad and scared because he lost his favorite toy. 
In the end, the police caught the robbers but Timmy still felt sad because he lost his toy. His mom hugged him and told him that they can always get a new toy but they can't replace the peace of mind that they lost.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play on the playground every day. One day, Lily met a new friend named Max. Max was a big boy with a powerful swing. 
Lily asked Max, "Can I try your swing?" Max said, "Sure, come on!" Lily climbed up on the swing and Max pushed her. Lily felt like she was flying! 
After a while, Lily saw the sunset and said, "Wow, look at the pretty colors!" Max said, "Yeah, it's beautiful." Lily asked Max, "Do you want to slide with me?" Max said, "Sure, let's go!" 
Lily and Max went to the slide and slid down together. They laughed and had so much fun. Lily was happy to have a new friend to play with. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, she found a rope on the ground. She picked it up and saw that it had a knot in the middle. She tried to untie the knot, but it was too hard. So, she decided to stretch the rope to see if it would come undone. 
Lily pulled and pulled on the rope until it finally stretched enough for her to untie the knot. She was so happy and proud of herself for being so strong. She decided to share her rope with her friends and they all played tug-of-war together. 
Lily was very generous and let her friends have turns with the rope. They all had so much fun playing together in the sunshine. From that day on, Lily always looked for ways to help her friends and be a generous little girl.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to hold her teddy bear tight when she went to sleep at night. One day, Lily went to school and learned about math. She loved counting and adding numbers. 
After school, Lily went to the park with her mom. It was a peaceful place with birds chirping and trees swaying in the breeze. Lily saw a butterfly and tried to catch it, but it flew away. She felt sad but then her mom told her to hold her hand and they went for a walk. 
As they walked, they saw a group of children playing together. Lily's mom asked if she wanted to join in and Lily smiled and said yes. They played games and had fun. Lily felt happy and peaceful. When it was time to go home, Lily hugged her mom and said, "I love you." They walked home holding hands and Lily fell asleep holding her teddy bear, dreaming of her fun day.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in his garden with his spade. One day, Timmy's mom came to him and said, "Timmy, be ready to come inside soon. It's going to rain."
Timmy ignored his mom and kept playing with his spade. Suddenly, the sky turned dark and it started to rain heavily. Timmy's mom came outside and warned him, "Timmy, I told you to be ready. You need to come inside now."
Timmy quickly put down his spade and ran inside with his mom. He was happy to be safe from the rain and thanked his mom for warning him. From that day on, Timmy always listened to his mom and was ready for anything she said.



Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Benny. Benny loved to play in the woods with his friends. One day, Benny and his friends went on an adventure to find a hidden treasure. They searched high and low, but they couldn't find it. Benny thought they should tell the truth and ask for help. Suddenly, they saw a glow in the distance. They followed the glow and found the treasure. Benny was so happy that he jumped up and down!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to make sandwiches with her mom for lunch. One day, Lily's mom asked her to help with the jam. Lily tried to open the jar, but it was difficult. 
"Mommy, can you help me?" Lily said.
"Sure, let me cut the seal first," her mom replied.
Lily watched as her mom cut the seal with a knife. Then, they were able to open the jar and use the jam for their sandwiches. 
Later that day, Lily's little brother wanted to make a sandwich too. He tried to open the jam jar, but he couldn't do it. 
"Can you help me, Lily?" he asked.
"Sure, let me cut the seal first," Lily replied with a smile.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going on trips with her family. One day, her mom said, "Lily, we're going on a trip to the beach today! Don't forget to bring your sunscreen."
Lily replied, "Yay! I love the beach! Can we include my favorite toy, Mr. Teddy?" 
"Of course, we can," said her mom. "But we have to be careful not to lose him in the loud waves."
At the beach, Lily had so much fun playing in the sand and swimming in the water. She even made a new friend, a little boy named Max. They had a conversation about their favorite colors and toys. 
After a long day at the beach, Lily was tired but happy. She hugged her mom and said, "Thank you for taking me on this trip. I had so much fun, and I'm glad we included Mr. Teddy."



Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Bobby. Bobby liked to cook. One day, he woke up and it was a heavy day. The sun was hiding behind the clouds and the air felt thick. Bobby decided to make some soup to warm himself up. He got a big pot and filled it with water. Then he put in some carrots, potatoes, and chicken. He stirred the soup with a big spoon until it was ready. Bobby felt much better after eating the soup and went for a long nap.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play the piano, which was a big, black instrument that made beautiful sounds. One day, Lily's mommy told her not to touch the piano when she wasn't around, but Lily didn't listen. She wanted to play a song for her mommy, so she sat down and started to play.
Suddenly, the piano started to shake and make a loud noise. Lily tried to resist, but she couldn't stop playing. Then, the piano fell over and hit Lily on the head. It was a harmless accident, but Lily was hurt. Her mommy came running in and saw what happened. "I told you not to touch the piano," she said, as she picked up her crying daughter.
From that day on, Lily never played the piano when her mommy wasn't around. She learned that sometimes it's important to listen to what grown-ups say, even if we don't want to. And the piano sat in the corner, waiting for someone to play it again, but no one ever did.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had an old teddy bear that she loved very much. One day, Lily's mom gave her a card with a picture of a unicorn on it. Lily was very happy and showed the card to her teddy bear. 
But then, Lily accidentally spilled juice on the card and it got ruined. She felt very sad and regretted spilling the juice. She hugged her teddy bear tightly and wished she could fix the card. 
Later that day, Lily's mom surprised her with a new card. This one had a picture of a rainbow on it. Lily was so happy and showed it to her teddy bear again. She forgot about the old card and was grateful for the new one.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy lived on a ranch with his mommy and daddy. One day, Timmy's daddy said, "It's so hot outside, let's go inside and cool off."
Timmy thought for a moment and said, "I think we should go swimming in the pond."
Daddy thought that was a good idea, so they put on their swimsuits and headed to the pond. The water was cool and refreshing, and Timmy had so much fun splashing around.
After they were done swimming, they went back inside to cool off some more. Timmy's mommy gave him a popsicle to help him cool down. It was so cold and yummy, Timmy thought it was the best thing ever.
From that day on, whenever it was hot outside, Timmy would think about going swimming in the pond. It was his favorite thing to do on the ranch.



Once upon a time, there was a kangaroo named Joey. Joey loved to hop and play with his friends in the forest. One day, Joey met a new friend named Timmy. Timmy was a silly rabbit who liked to tease Joey by hopping around him very fast. Joey didn't like it when Timmy teased him, but he didn't know what to do.
One day, while they were playing, Timmy accidentally knocked over a big rock. Joey saw that Timmy was being careless and didn't want him to get hurt, so he hopped over and pushed him out of the way. Timmy was grateful and realized that teasing wasn't nice. From then on, they played together happily without any teasing.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her big backyard. One day, she found a tiny toy car in the grass. She picked it up and put it on the roof of her dollhouse. 
But then, something strange happened. The toy car started to shrink! Lily was very upset because she loved that little car. She tried to make it bigger again by waving her magic wand, but it didn't work. 
So, Lily decided to keep the tiny car on the roof of her dollhouse. Every day, she would look up and see the little car and smile. Even though it was small, it made her happy. And that's all that mattered. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird loved to sing every day. It would sing in the morning, in the afternoon, and in the evening. One day, the bird woke up early to see the sunrise. It was beautiful! The sky turned pink and orange, and the sun came up over the mountains. The bird sang a happy song.
Later that day, the bird flew to a new place. It was a harsh place with no trees or flowers. The bird felt sad and didn't want to sing anymore. But then, the bird remembered the sunrise and how beautiful it was. It started to sing again, and soon other birds joined in. Together, they made a beautiful song that filled the harsh place with joy.
From that day on, the little bird sang every day. It didn't matter where it was or how harsh the place was. The sunrise reminded the bird that there is always something beautiful to sing about.



Once upon a time, there was a little owl named Hootie. Hootie loved to fly around in the dark night sky. One night, Hootie was flying around when he saw a little mouse named Squeaky. 
"Hello, Squeaky!" said Hootie. "What are you doing out so late?"
"I'm trying to find some cheese," replied Squeaky. "But I keep slipping on the wet leaves."
Hootie felt bad for Squeaky, so he offered to help. "I can fly above and guide you with my eyes," said Hootie. 
Squeaky was grateful for Hootie's help and together they searched for cheese. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise and saw a big, scary cat running towards them. Hootie quickly flew up and scared the cat away, saving Squeaky from danger. 
"Thank you, Hootie!" said Squeaky. "You're the best owl ever!"
Hootie smiled and they continued their search for cheese, happy to have each other's company in the dark night.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very excited because he was going to visit his grandma's house. But when Timmy got to his grandma's house, he realized that he forgot his key at home. Timmy felt sad and scared because he couldn't get into the house.
Timmy's grandma saw that he was upset and asked him what was wrong. Timmy told her that he forgot his key and couldn't get into the house. His grandma told him not to worry and that they would find a way to get inside. They looked around and saw an incredible tree with branches that reached up to the window.
Timmy's grandma told him to choose which branch he wanted to climb on, and he picked the biggest one. He climbed up the branch and reached the window. He opened it and climbed inside. Timmy was very happy that he was able to get into the house with the help of his grandma and the incredible tree.



Once upon a time, there was a tall giraffe named Jerry. He liked to eat leaves from the trees. Yesterday, Jerry was very hungry and went to a tree to eat some leaves. But there was another giraffe there, and he wanted to eat the leaves too. They both tried to eat from the same tree, but there was not enough food for both of them. 
Jerry and the other giraffe started to argue and push each other. They didn't know what to do. Then, Jerry had an idea. He said, "Let's use our long necks to reach the leaves from different trees!" The other giraffe agreed and they both went to different trees. They were both happy and full. They learned that sometimes it's better to use their strengths to solve problems instead of fighting.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite pillow that she always slept with. One night, she couldn't find her pillow anywhere. She looked under her bed and in her toy chest, but it was nowhere to be found. Lily started to feel gloomy and sad. 
Suddenly, her pillow spoke! "Don't worry, Lily! I'm right here!" It turned out that her pillow had fallen behind her bed. Lily was so happy to hear her pillow speak to her. She hugged it tightly and went back to sleep with a big smile on her face. From then on, she always made sure to keep her pillow close by so it wouldn't get lost again.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the sand at the beach. He would build sandcastles and dig big holes in the sand. One day, Timmy met a crab named Crabby. 
"Hello, Crabby!" Timmy said. 
"Hello, Timmy," Crabby replied in a humble voice. "What are you doing here?" 
"I'm playing in the sand," Timmy said. "Do you want to play with me?" 
"I would love to," Crabby said. 
So, Timmy and Crabby played in the sand together. They built a big sandcastle and dug a deep hole. But then, all of a sudden, Crabby vanished! Timmy looked around but couldn't find him. 
"Where did you go, Crabby?" Timmy asked. 
"I'm right here," Crabby said, popping up from behind the sandcastle. 
Timmy laughed and they continued to play together in the sand.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved parades. He would watch them every year with his mommy and daddy. This year, Timmy wanted to be in the parade. He needed to be in the parade.
Timmy worked hard on his costume. He made a big hat with feathers and painted his face with colors. He was so excited to show everyone his costume in the parade. The day of the parade came, and Timmy was ready. He marched with the other people in the parade. 
Suddenly, Timmy saw a big truck coming towards him. He tried to move out of the way, but it was too hard. The truck hit him, and Timmy fell down. His mommy and daddy rushed to him, but it was too late. Timmy had died. His mommy and daddy cried and cried. They missed him so much. They would never forget their little boy who loved parades.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she saw a butterfly and she started to chase it. She ran and ran until she reached a big garden full of colorful flowers and herbs. She stopped to gaze at the beautiful flowers and smelled the sweet herbs.
Suddenly, she saw a snake hiding in the grass. The snake was very dangerous and Lily knew she had to be careful. She slowly backed away and ran back to her house to tell her mom. Her mom was proud of Lily for being brave and telling her about the dangerous snake. From that day on, Lily always remembered to be careful when she played outside.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went outside to play in the rain. Her mommy told her to wear her raincoat so she wouldn't get wet, but Lily didn't listen. She wanted to feel the raindrops on her skin.
As she played, the rain kept falling and falling. Her hair got wet, her clothes got wet, and even her shoes got wet. But Lily didn't mind. She loved the feeling of the rain on her skin.
Suddenly, her mommy called out to her from the porch. "Lily, it's time to come inside now. You'll catch a cold if you stay out in the rain too long." Lily ran over to her mommy and said, "I hope it rains again tomorrow so I can play in the wet again." Her mommy smiled and said, "You're such a persistent little girl, Lily. I'm sure it will rain again soon."



Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play outside in the garden. One day, Benny saw a big slide in the garden. He climbed up the ladder and slid down the slide. Wheeee!
Benny was hungry, so he looked for something to eat. He found a big, red radish. It was so yummy! Benny ate the whole radish.
After eating, Benny felt sleepy. He went to his regular spot under a bush and took a nap. When he woke up, it was time for dinner. Benny went back to the garden to look for more radishes. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a big navy ship. It was very thick and strong. The ship sailed on the big blue sea. The sailors on board were happy and sang songs.
One of the sailors had a cold. He felt a tickle in his nose. He knew he was going to sneeze. He tried to hold it in, but he couldn't. He sneezed so hard that he fell off the ship and into the sea.
The other sailors quickly threw a rope to him and pulled him back on board. From then on, the sailor always covered his nose when he felt a sneeze coming. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily had a pet cat named Fluffy. Fluffy had soft fur that Lily loved to pet.
One day, Lily and her mom went to the store to buy a new toy for Fluffy. They found a cheap toy that Fluffy would love. Lily was so excited to give it to Fluffy.
But when they got home, Lily forgot to give the toy to Fluffy. Fluffy kept meowing and rubbing against Lily's legs, but she couldn't remember what she forgot to do.
Lily's mom asked her, "Did you forget something for Fluffy?" Lily remembered and ran to get the toy. Fluffy was so happy to play with his new toy and Lily was happy too.



Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a daddy who loved to have dinner together. They always had a special drink called "wine" that they would keep in a bottle. One day, they ran out of their special wine and had to go to the store to buy some more. 
At the store, they saw many different kinds of wine, but they wanted an ordinary one that they always had. They found it and bought it. When they got home, they put the wine bottle in a safe place and kept it there until dinner time. 
During dinner, mommy and daddy shared the wine and talked about their day. They were happy to have their ordinary wine and enjoyed their time together. After dinner, they cleaned up and went to bed, ready for another day. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a happy monkey named Max. Max loved to sing and dance. He would sing all day long and make everyone around him happy. 
One day, Max found a big drum in the forest. He was so excited that he started playing it right away. The sound of the drum was loud and made Max feel even happier. 
As he was playing the drum, Max noticed that his friend, the bird, was feeling uncomfortable. The bird was shivering because it was cold outside. Max knew just what to do. He stopped playing the drum and hugged the bird to keep it warm. 
After a while, the bird stopped shivering and felt comfortable again. Max was happy to see his friend feeling better. He started singing a happy song to celebrate. The bird joined in and they sang and danced together all day long.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat yellow bananas and play with her toys. One day, her mom made her eat broccoli for dinner. Lily didn't like it and made a sad face.
Her mom said, "Lily, you have to eat your broccoli. It's good for you."
Lily replied, "But Mommy, it's yucky. I don't want to eat it."
Her mom said, "Well, let's pray and ask God to help you like it."
So, they prayed together and Lily took a bite of broccoli. To her surprise, it tasted better than she thought. From that day on, she ate broccoli without complaining.
The moral of the story is that sometimes we have to try new things and pray for help when we need it.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside with her friends. One day, Lily found a bracelet on the ground. It was shiny and pretty, so she put it on her wrist. But oh no! The bracelet was smelly! Lily didn't like the smell, so she decided to throw it away. 
As she was walking to the trash can, Lily saw her friend Max playing catch with a ball. Max threw the ball to Lily and she caught it. Lily thought it would be fun to throw the ball back to Max, but she accidentally threw the smelly bracelet instead! Max caught it and said, "Ew, what's that smell?" 
Lily felt embarrassed and sad. She didn't want her friends to think she was smelly too. So, she went back to the trash can and threw the bracelet away for good. From then on, Lily made sure to always check if something was smelly before she picked it up.



Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily was scared of the bad storm outside. She went to her mommy and asked, "Mommy, can I watch the storm with you?" Her mommy said, "Sure, come sit with me." 
As they watched the storm, they saw lightning in the sky. Lily said, "Mommy, what's that?" Her mommy said, "That's lightning. It's like a big flash of light in the sky during a storm." 
Lily was scared of the lightning, but her mommy said, "Don't worry, we are safe inside. The lightning can't hurt us." Lily felt better and cuddled up with her mommy to watch the storm. They talked about the lightning and how it looked like fireworks in the sky. 
After a while, the storm passed and Lily felt happy that she watched it with her mommy. She said, "Mommy, I'm not scared of the bad storm anymore. I like watching it with you." Her mommy smiled and hugged her, "I'm glad we could watch it together, sweetie."



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a very thin aunt who loved to sing. Every time her aunt visited, she would sing Lily a song. Lily loved it when her aunt sang. 
One day, Lily's aunt came to visit and brought her guitar. She started to sing a song and Lily danced along. It was so much fun! 
After the song was over, Lily's aunt gave her a big hug and said goodbye. Lily was sad to see her go, but happy that she got to hear her aunt sing. She couldn't wait for her aunt to come back and sing more songs.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved the color red and owned a pretty red dress. One day, she woke up early and put on her red dress to go outside and play. 
As she was walking, she saw a little boy with a red ball. "Wow, your ball is so red! I wish I owned one like that," said Lily. 
The little boy smiled and said, "I have an extra one at home. Would you like to come and play with me?" 
Lily was very excited and followed the little boy to his house. They played with the red ball all day and had so much fun. When it was time for Lily to go home, the little boy gave her the red ball as a gift. 
Lily was so happy and hugged the little boy. "Thank you so much! Now I own a red ball too!" she said. 
From that day on, Lily and the little boy became good friends and played together every day.



Once upon a time, there was a big, big lion. He was enormous! He lived in a jungle with lots of trees and animals. One day, the lion hurt his paw and he couldn't walk. He was sad.
A little girl came to the jungle. She had a bag with her. She saw the lion and asked, "What happened to your paw?" The lion said, "I hurt it. It hurts a lot." The little girl said, "Don't worry, I have an x-ray machine in my bag. I can see what's wrong." 
The little girl took out her x-ray machine and looked at the lion's paw. She said, "There's a thorn in your paw. I can take it out." The lion was scared, "Will it hurt?" The little girl said, "No, it won't hurt. I promise." She took out the thorn and the lion felt better. He was so happy, he roared with joy!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the beach with her family. One day, they went to a restaurant that had oysters on the menu. Lily had never tried oysters before, but her dad insisted that she should give them a try.
Lily was hesitant at first, but her dad was very helpful and showed her how to eat the oyster. She took a bite and was surprised at how good it tasted! From that day on, Lily insisted on ordering oysters every time they went to the beach.
Her family was happy that Lily tried something new and they all enjoyed eating oysters together. Lily felt proud of herself for being brave and trying something new. She knew that being helpful and trying new things can lead to great adventures!



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his toy hammer. One day, Timmy's mom was fixing something with a real hammer. Timmy asked, "Mommy, what's that?" His mommy said, "It's a hammer. It helps me fix things." Timmy thought it looked cool, but he knew it was not a toy and could be dangerous. He said, "Mommy, is the hammer harmless?" His mommy smiled and said, "No, it's not harmless, but I know how to use it safely." Timmy was happy his mommy could answer his question and keep him safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved going to the zoo with his mommy and daddy. One day, they saw a big tiger. The tiger was very lively and ran around in its cage. Timmy was scared at first, but then he saw how beautiful the tiger was.
As Timmy watched the tiger, he noticed something strange happening. The tiger started to grow bigger and bigger! It was like magic. Timmy couldn't believe his eyes. He told his mommy and daddy, but they didn't see it. They thought he was just imagining things.
But Timmy knew what he saw. He saw the tiger grow right in front of him. It was amazing! From that day on, Timmy loved going to the zoo even more. He always hoped to see the tiger again and watch it grow even bigger.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the park. He would run and jump and play with his friends. One day, Timmy lost his sock while he was playing. He looked and looked, but he couldn't find it anywhere. 
Timmy's friends wanted to help him find his sock. They decided to make it a game. They would see who could find the sock first. It was a very competitive game, but they had a lot of fun. 
Finally, Timmy's friend Johnny found the sock. Timmy was so happy to have his sock back. He thanked his friends for helping him find it. From that day on, Timmy made sure to keep a close eye on his socks when he was playing in the park.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy was very happy because he was going to have a party. He wanted to invite all his friends to come and play with him.
Timmy's mom helped him make invitations and they put them in the mail. The next day, Timmy's friends came over and they played games and ate cake.
Suddenly, the police came and took Timmy's dad to jail. Timmy was sad because he missed his dad. But one day, Timmy's dad became famous because he helped catch a bad guy. Timmy was happy again because his dad was a hero.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big house that she loved to play in. One day, Lily's mom asked her to clean her room, but it was very difficult for her. Lily's mom said, "Lily, you need to clean your room before you can play." Lily replied, "I can't do it, it's too difficult." 
Lily's mom said, "I'll help you, but you need to try first." Lily tried, but it was still too hard. She said, "I guess I can't do it." 
Later that day, Lily's mom went to check on her room and found it still messy. She was very upset and told Lily that she couldn't play until her room was clean. Lily was sad and said, "I wish it wasn't so difficult." 
The next day, Lily's mom went to wake her up for school, but she didn't answer. When she went to her room, she found Lily had gotten sick from the mess in her room and had to go to the hospital. Lily's mom realized that she should have helped her more and felt very guilty.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys, especially his toy soldiers. He would make them march around his room and pretend they were in a big battle. 
One day, Tim's mom asked him to clean up his toys and put them in the bin. Tim didn't want to because he thought the bin was too small and cheap. But his mom explained that it was important to keep their house clean and tidy. 
So, Tim started to put his toys away in the bin while making them march. He pretended that they were going on a big adventure and had to go into the bin to hide from the bad guys. Tim's mom was happy to see him cleaning up and even helped him put some of the toys away. From that day on, Tim made sure to always put his toys away in the bin after he was done playing with them.



Once upon a time, there was a brown dog named Spot. Spot loved to play in the park with his ball. One day, Spot saw a man with a wire in his hand. The man asked Spot if he wanted to play fetch with the wire. Spot barked happily and ran to get his ball.
The man threw the wire and Spot ran to get it. But when he picked it up, he felt a shock! The wire was not a toy, it was an electric wire. Spot yelped and ran back to the man. The man was sorry and gave Spot a treat to serve as an apology.
From that day on, Spot only played with his ball and never touched wires again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside, but one day it started to rain. Lily's mom gave her an umbrella to keep her dry. Lily loved her umbrella and twirled it around as she walked. 
But then, Lily saw a big, scary dog. She was fearful and didn't know what to do. She tried to walk away, but the dog followed her. Lily opened her umbrella to try and scare the dog away, but it didn't work. 
Suddenly, the dog jumped at Lily and knocked her down. Her umbrella flew out of her hand and the dog ran away. Lily was hurt and her mom had to take her to the hospital. She never wanted to see that dog again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a cute little puppy named Max. He loved to play outside in the snow. One day, while Max was playing, he saw a big, scary cat. The cat didn't like Max and wanted to hurt him. Max got very scared and didn't know what to do. 
Suddenly, Max remembered that he had a special power. He could freeze! Max closed his eyes and focused very hard. Then, he froze in place. The cat couldn't see him and walked away. Max was safe! 
After that day, Max realized that he had a special gift. He could use it to protect himself and others. He decided to use his gift for good and always be a helpful friend. Max learned that being adorable was not enough to keep him safe, but with his special power, he could overcome any danger.



Once upon a time, there was a nice little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, while they were playing hide and seek, Lily found a toy under a big tree. It was a nice toy car, but it was stuck under the tree. Lily tried to reach it, but she couldn't. 
So, she asked her friend Timmy to help her. Timmy was very strong and he was able to remove the toy car from under the tree. Lily was very happy and said, "Thank you, Timmy! You are so nice to help me." They both played with the toy car for the rest of the day and had lots of fun together. From that day on, Lily and Timmy became the best of friends.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a fancy bracelet that she loved to wear every day. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friend, Timmy. They ran and played together for hours. 
As they were playing, Lily accidentally dropped her bracelet and it rolled away. She searched for it but couldn't find it anywhere. She was very sad and started to cry. Timmy tried to comfort her and said, "Don't worry, I'll help you find it."
They both searched for the bracelet, but unfortunately, they couldn't find it. Lily was very upset and said, "I'll never find my pretty bracelet again." They both went home feeling sad. 
The next day, Lily's mom found the bracelet on the sidewalk. She picked it up and brought it home to Lily. But when Lily saw it, she realized that it was broken. She was very sad and said, "My pretty bracelet is ruined forever." And that's how the story of Lily's fancy bracelet ended sadly.



Once upon a time, there was a kind mailman named Max. Max loved to deliver letters and packages to people's houses. One day, Max had to deliver a package to a house he had never been to before. He didn't know where it was, so it was unknown to him. 
Max got lost and walked around for a long time. He was getting hungry, so he decided to make a sandwich. But when he tried to cut the bread with his knife, he realized he had forgotten it at home! Max was sad because he couldn't eat his sandwich. 
Just then, Max saw a little girl playing outside. He asked her if she knew where the house was. The little girl knew exactly where it was and showed Max the way. Max was so happy and grateful to the little girl that he gave her a big hug. He then delivered the package and went back to work. From that day on, Max always remembered to bring his knife with him when he went on his deliveries.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing outside in the yard. He loved playing with his toys and running around. But one thing he hated was when his mom asked him to help her with the garden hose. 
One day, Timmy's mom asked him to help her water the plants. Timmy was not eager to help because he wanted to keep playing. But his mom explained that the plants needed water to grow big and strong. 
So, Timmy reluctantly helped his mom with the hose. He held the hose while his mom watered the plants. As he watched the water flow out of the hose, he started to feel happy that he was helping the plants grow. 
From that day on, Timmy was no longer afraid of the hose and was eager to help his mom water the plants. He even started to enjoy it!
