Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toys, especially his cars. One day, he got a new toy car that was really fast. He was so happy and played with it all day long. 
But, Timmy's little sister, Lily, was jealous of his new toy. She wanted to play with it too, but Timmy didn't want to share. 
Later that day, Timmy was playing with his toy car near the fridge when he accidentally dropped it. The toy car fell to the ground and broke into pieces. Timmy was sad and didn't know what to do. 
Luckily, Lily saw what happened and wanted to help. She remembered that there was a magnet on the fridge that could pick up the broken pieces. She got the magnet and supported Timmy by helping him fix his toy car. Timmy was so happy and grateful for his little sister's help. From that day on, Timmy learned that sharing and being kind to others can make you feel better.



Once upon a time, there was a mother. She was very sad because her favorite toy was broken. It was a top that used to spin round and round. She loved to watch it spin. 
One day, her little child found the broken top and wanted to make his mother happy again. He took the top and tried to spin it with all his might. At first, it didn't spin well, but he kept trying. 
Finally, the top started to spin faster and faster. The mother watched in amazement as her child made the top spin again. She was no longer sad, but very happy. They both laughed and played with the top, spinning it over and over again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very hungry and asked her mom for some food. Her mom said, "I have some yummy food available for you. What would you like to eat?" Lily replied, "I want some cookies, please." 
Her mom gave her a plate of cookies and Lily started eating them. She loved the cookies so much that she asked her mom for more. Her mom said, "You can have more cookies, but you need to eat your vegetables first." 
Lily made a face and said, "I don't like vegetables." Her mom replied, "But they are good for you. Eat them and then you can have more cookies." Lily thought about it and finally agreed. She ate all her vegetables and then her mom gave her more cookies. Lily was happy and said, "Thank you, Mommy. I love you."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy in the kitchen. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to put the dirty dishes in the dishwasher. 
Lily was very patient and carefully placed each dish in the dishwasher. As she was putting the dishes away, she observed a tiny ant crawling on the counter. 
Lily watched the ant for a while and then gently picked it up and put it outside. Her mommy was so proud of her for being kind to the little ant. From that day on, Lily always observed the bugs in her backyard and made sure to be patient and gentle with them.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to bake with her mom. One day, her mom asked her to measure the flour for the cake they were making. Lily used a big spoon to scoop the flour and put it in the bowl.
Suddenly, Lily heard a loud crack! She looked over and saw that her mom had accidentally dropped an egg on the floor. Lily helped her mom clean up the egg and they continued baking.
When the cake was done, Lily's mom put fancy icing on top. Lily was so happy to see the fancy cake they had made together. She couldn't wait to share it with her friends at school the next day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she found a beetle crawling on the ground. The beetle was very small and had shiny wings. 
Lily picked up the beetle and pretended it was her friend. She talked to the beetle and even gave it a name, Bossy. Bossy was a bossy beetle and liked to tell Lily what to do. 
Lily had fun playing with Bossy, but soon it was time for her to go inside. She gently put Bossy back on the ground and said goodbye. As she walked inside, she wondered if she would see Bossy again tomorrow.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to imagine she was a princess in a big castle. One hot day, she decided to go on an adventure in her backyard. She saw a little bird with a broken wing and felt sad. She imagined she could help the bird and make it feel better. So, she got a little cup of water and gave it to the bird. The bird felt better and flew away. Lily felt happy and proud of herself for helping the little bird. From that day on, she imagined she was a hero who helped animals in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to buy some candies from the store but she didn't have any coins. She asked her mother, "Mommy, can I have some coins to buy candies?" Her mother said, "Sure, here are some coins for you."
Lily happily went to the store and bought her favorite candies. On her way back home, she saw a dead bird on the ground. She felt sad and asked her mother, "Mommy, why is the bird dead?" Her mother explained that sometimes animals get sick or hurt and they can't survive.
Lily learned that life is precious and she should always be kind to animals. She hugged her mother and said, "I want to take care of all the animals in the world." Her mother smiled and said, "That's a kind and wonderful thing to do, my dear."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and sing songs. One day, Lily's mom came in with some news. She said that they had to move to a new house far away. Lily was sad because she loved their beautiful home.
When they got to the new house, Lily saw that it was not as beautiful as their old one. She felt unhappy and missed her old friends. But then, she saw a big rock in the backyard. She climbed on it and sat there, feeling better. She realized that even though things were different, she could still find happiness in new places.
Lily's mom saw her sitting on the rock and came over to talk to her. They talked about how change can be hard, but it can also bring new adventures. Lily felt better and knew that she would make new friends and have new fun times in their new home.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved candy and sweets, but she hated mint. One day, her mom gave her a candy that had a terrible mint flavor. Lily made a face and said, "I hate mint, Mommy!"
Her mom replied, "Oh no, I'm sorry you don't like it. Would you like a different candy instead?"
Lily nodded her head and her mom gave her a delicious candy that tasted like strawberries. Lily smiled and said, "Yum, this candy is so yummy! Thank you, Mommy!"
From that day on, Lily made sure to always ask if her candy had mint in it before she ate it. She never wanted to taste that terrible flavor again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and pick daisies. One day, she found a black daisy that she had never seen before. 
Lily picked the black daisy and showed it to her friend, Timmy. "Look, Timmy! I found a black daisy!" she said. 
Timmy looked at the black daisy and said, "Wow, that's so cool! Can I write about it in my journal?" 
Lily nodded her head and said, "Yes, you can write about it. I love daisies." 
Timmy wrote about the black daisy in his journal and showed it to Lily. She smiled and said, "That's a great story, Timmy. Thank you for writing about my favorite flower." 
From that day on, Lily and Timmy would often write stories about the black daisy and all the adventures they had together. They were the best of friends and loved to explore the world around them.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved butterflies. She would run around the garden trying to catch them, but they would always fly away. One day, she saw a butterfly that was eager to land on a flower. She slowly tiptoed towards it and finally caught it in her hands. She was so happy to have caught a butterfly, but as she opened her hands to take a closer look, the butterfly vanished. 
Lily was sad and didn't understand why the butterfly had disappeared. Her mom explained to her that sometimes when we want something too much, it can slip away from us. She told Lily that it's important to appreciate the beauty of things around us, but not to hold onto them too tightly. From that day on, Lily would watch the butterflies in the garden with wonder and amazement, but she never tried to catch them again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she saw a big, yellow sunflower in her garden. It was so tall and pretty. She wanted to pick it and take it inside to show her mommy. But then she heard a buzzing sound. It was a bee! She knew bees liked sunflowers and didn't want to hurt it, so she left the flower alone.
The next day, Lily went outside to play again. She saw that the sunflower was gone! She looked all around, but it was nowhere to be found. She was sad and confused. Then, her mommy told her that the sunflower was picked by a rich lady who loved flowers. Lily was surprised! She didn't know that someone could take her flower.
But then, her mommy surprised her by saying they could plant more sunflowers together. They went to the store and bought some seeds. They planted them in the garden and watched them grow. Soon, they had a whole bunch of sunflowers, even taller and prettier than the first one. Lily was so happy and proud. She learned that even when things don't go as planned, there is always a way to make things better.



Once upon a time, there was a child who was very weak. He couldn't run or play like the other kids. One day, he saw a toy that he really liked. He asked his mom if he could have it.
Mom said, "You can own that toy if you eat all your veggies and get strong like a superhero."
The child replied, "I will eat all my veggies so I can be strong and own that toy!"
So the child ate all his veggies and got strong. He went back to the store and bought the toy he wanted. He was so happy that he could own it now. He played with it all day and felt like a superhero.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she was very hungry and wanted to eat something yummy. She looked in the kitchen and saw a big pot of rice. She decided to make some rice for herself. 
Lily took a wide bowl and put some rice in it. She added some water and put the bowl in the microwave. When the rice was ready, she took it out and ate it all up. 
After she finished eating, Lily had to decide what to do next. She thought about playing with her toys or going outside to play. She decided to go outside and have some fun in the sunshine.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to collect rocks and shiny things. One day, he went to the store and saw a beautiful mineral. It was so pretty and shiny, but also very expensive. Timmy wanted it so badly, but he didn't have enough money to buy it.
One day, Timmy went on a walk in the forest and he met a kind old man. The old man showed Timmy a special mineral that he had found. It was even more beautiful than the one in the store! Timmy was so happy to have met the old man and to have seen the special mineral.
But then, as Timmy was walking home, he tripped and fell. The special mineral fell out of his pocket and broke into many pieces. Timmy was so sad that he couldn't stop crying. He realized that sometimes, even the most special things can be fragile and easily broken.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to draw and design things. One day, he drew a picture of a big, high wall.
His mom saw the picture and said, "Wow, Timmy, you're such a good artist! Did you design that wall all by yourself?"
Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, I did! I want to build a big, high wall like that someday."
His mom replied, "That sounds like a great idea, Timmy. Maybe we can build a wall together in our backyard."
Timmy was so happy and excited to hear that. He couldn't wait to start building his big, high wall with his mom.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends at the park. One day, they decided to have a race to see who could run the fastest. Lily was very competitive and wanted to win.
But then, it started to rain. Lily's friends all ran home, but Lily was sad because she wanted to keep playing. Suddenly, she saw a rainbow in the sky. She felt better and knew that everything was going to be okay.
Just then, her mom came to the park with an umbrella. "Don't worry, Lily," her mom said. "Let's go home and have some hot cocoa to comfort you." Lily smiled and hugged her mom, happy to be going home to warmth and comfort.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to run fast and have fun. One day, Timmy's dad gave him a magazine to read. Timmy thought the magazine was very useful because it had lots of pictures to look at.
Later that day, Timmy and his friends decided to race each other. They ran as fast as they could and had so much fun. Timmy was very happy because he won the race. He felt like he was the fastest runner in the world.
After the race, Timmy went home and looked at his magazine again. He saw a picture of a runner just like him. Timmy thought the magazine was even more useful now because it showed him how to run even faster. From that day on, Timmy practiced running every day so he could be the fastest runner in the world.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved pandas and wanted to see one very badly. One day, he went to the zoo with his mommy and daddy. They walked around and saw many animals, but Timmy couldn't find a panda. 
He asked his mommy, "Where is panda?" 
His mommy said, "It's difficult to find a panda, Timmy. They are very rare." 
Timmy was sad, but then he saw a big truck coming. The truck was carrying a panda! Timmy was so happy and shouted, "Look mommy, panda!" 
But then, the truck driver lost control and crashed. The panda was hurt and couldn't move. Timmy was very sad and cried. His mommy hugged him and said, "Don't worry, Timmy. The panda will be okay." 
But unfortunately, the panda did not survive. Timmy was heartbroken and learned that sometimes things don't always have a happy ending.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and stuffed animals. One day, she went to her mommy and said, "Mommy, I worry about the scary monster under my bed." 
Her mommy said, "Don't worry, Lily. There's no monster under your bed. Let's check together." 
So they looked under the bed and found a file that had fallen down. "See, Lily? It was just this file that made a scary noise. No monster here," her mommy said. 
Lily felt much better and hugged her mommy. "Thank you, mommy. You make me feel safe."



Once upon a time, there was a dog named Spike. Spike was a big dog with a lot of fur. One day, Spike went to the park with his owner. At the park, Spike saw a fancy lady with a pretty dress. She had a bag with treats for dogs. Spike barked and wagged his tail. The lady gave Spike a treat and he was very happy. Spike loved going to the park and meeting new friends.



Once upon a time, there was a big, loud bear. He lived in a camp in the woods. One day, a little girl came to visit the bear. She gave him a big kiss on his nose. The bear was so happy! They played together all day long. The little girl loved the bear and the bear loved the little girl. They became best friends and had lots of fun in the camp.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a furry teddy bear named Teddy. One day, Lily and Teddy went on an adventure in the forest. They walked and walked until they found a big hook on the ground.
Lily asked Teddy, "What is this?" Teddy replied, "It's a hook. It's used to catch fish." Lily was curious and asked, "Can we catch fish with it?"
Teddy said, "No, we can't. Let's return it to the river so no one gets hurt." So, they picked up the hook and returned it to the river. They felt happy that they did the right thing and continued their adventure in the forest.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, but he wanted more. He wanted to go to the toy factory and choose his own toys. 
One day, Timmy's mom took him to the toy factory. Timmy was so happy! He got to choose any toy he wanted. He picked a big teddy bear and a race car. 
But then, Timmy saw a man who looked very grumpy. The man worked at the factory and was not happy. Timmy felt sad for the grumpy man and decided to give him his teddy bear. The man's face lit up and he smiled. Timmy felt happy too, knowing he made someone else happy.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a finger that hurt a lot. One day, she was playing with her toy car and her finger got split. She cried and her mom came to help. Her mom put a bandage on her finger and gave her a candy to make her feel better.
Lily loved to watch TV with her mom. One day, they watched a show about a famous singer. Lily thought the singer was so cool and wanted to be famous too. She asked her mom if she could sing like that and her mom said yes. Lily started to sing and dance around the room. Her mom clapped and told her she was a great singer.
From that day on, Lily sang and danced every day. She even wrote her own songs and performed them for her family. Everyone loved her singing and she became famous in her own home. And her finger? It healed quickly and she was back to playing with her toys in no time.



Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Bongo. Bongo lived in a big jungle with lots of trees and animals. One day, Bongo's mommy told him not to go too far because there were bad snakes in the jungle.
But Bongo was curious and wanted to explore. So he crawled through the bushes and climbed up the trees. Suddenly, he saw a big snake! Bongo was scared and ran back to his mommy.
"Mommy, mommy! I saw a bad snake in the jungle!" Bongo cried.
"It's okay, Bongo. You should always listen to mommy and stay safe," his mommy replied.
From that day on, Bongo always listened to his mommy and never went too far into the jungle again.



Once upon a time, there was a big, wild lion. He was very strong and had a big, fluffy mane. One day, he saw a white rabbit and chased after it. The rabbit ran as fast as it could, but the lion was too fast. The rabbit screamed for help, but no one came. Just when the lion was about to catch the rabbit, a kind girl appeared and scared the lion away. The rabbit was safe and happy.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to explore and go on adventures. One day, Timmy decided to go on an adventurous hike in the woods. He put on his helmet to keep his head safe.
As he was walking, Timmy stumbled over a rock and fell down. But because he was wearing his helmet, he didn't hurt his head. He got back up and continued on his adventure.
Timmy saw many things on his hike, like birds and bugs and pretty flowers. He had so much fun exploring that he didn't even notice when it started to get dark. But he knew he had to go back home, so he turned around and headed back. Even though he stumbled a few more times, Timmy was happy he had his adventurous hike and his helmet to keep him safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved lollipops and always wanted to eat them. One day, her mommy gave her a lollipop and said, "Lily, you can have this yummy lollipop, but you have to climb the stairs and go to your room to eat it."
Lily was so excited to eat her lollipop that she quickly climbed the stairs. But when she got to her room, she saw her little brother crying. He had fallen down and hurt his knee. Lily knew that she had to help her brother first, so she gave him the lollipop to make him feel better.
Her mommy saw what happened and said, "Lily, you did the right thing. It's always important to help others before we think about ourselves." Lily smiled and felt happy that she could make her brother feel better. From that day on, Lily learned that being kind and helpful to others is more important than having a yummy lollipop.



Once upon a time, there was a birdie. The birdie was very happy because it could fly high in the sky. One day, the birdie saw a butterfly and said, "Hello, butterfly! Can you fly with me?" The butterfly said, "Yes, I can fly with you!"
The birdie and the butterfly flew together and saw a big building. The building was called a jail. The birdie asked the butterfly, "What is that building?" The butterfly said, "That is a jail. It is a place where people go when they do something wrong."
The birdie and the butterfly continued to fly and saw a very modern house. The birdie said, "Wow, that house looks very modern!" The butterfly said, "Yes, it is a very modern house. It is new and has all the latest things inside."
The birdie and the butterfly had a fun day flying together and seeing new things. They said goodbye and flew away, happy and free. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very glad because she got a big bag of candy from her grandma. She opened the bag and saw lots of different candies. She picked one and put it in her mouth. It tasted very sweet.
Lily's little brother, Max, came into the room and asked for some candy. Lily was happy to share with him. Max picked one and examined it closely. He said it was a red candy with white stripes. Lily agreed and they both ate their candy together.
After they finished their candy, Lily and Max went outside to play. They ran around and had lots of fun. They both felt very happy and glad that they got to eat some yummy candy.



Once upon a time, there was a big bull. He was brown and had big horns. One day, he saw a red light in the sky. It was so bright! The bull was scared and started to run. He ran and ran until he saw a little girl. The girl had a bow in her hair. She saw the bull and smiled. She knew he was scared. She took the bow out of her hair and gave it to the bull. The bull felt better and stopped running. He looked at the girl and mooed. The girl laughed and petted the bull. From that day on, the bull and the girl were friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy asked his mom if he could go to the park to play with his friends. His mom said, "Yes, you may go to the park but you must be back before dinner time."
Timmy ran to the park and met up with his friends. They played on the swings, went down the slide, and played tag. Timmy noticed that one of his friends, a youth named Jack, had a unique toy car. Timmy asked Jack if he could play with it. Jack said, "Yes, you may play with it for a little bit but please be careful with it."
Timmy played with the toy car and had so much fun. When it was time to go home, he thanked Jack for permitting him to play with the unique toy car. Timmy ran home and told his mom all about his fun day at the park.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy's mom told him it was time to clean up his toys and put them away. Timmy didn't want to clean up because he wanted to keep playing. 
His mom said, "Timmy, if you clean up your toys now, you can gain extra playtime later." Timmy thought about it and decided to clean up his toys. He felt proud of himself for doing the right thing. 
As Timmy was putting away his toys, he noticed that his favorite toy was missing. He looked everywhere for it but couldn't find it. He felt sad and guilty because he didn't take care of his toy. 
Timmy went to his mom and said, "Mommy, I lost my toy. It's a symbol of my favorite thing to play with. I'm sorry for not taking care of it." His mom hugged him and said, "It's okay, Timmy. We can look for it together and maybe we can find it." Timmy felt better knowing that his mom was there to help him.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sun all day long. He would run and jump and play with his friends until he was very tired. 
One day, Timmy's mom asked him to clean up his toys before dinner. Timmy didn't want to stop playing, but he knew he had to listen to his mom. So he picked up all of his toys and put them away. 
Later that night, Timmy's mom asked him why he was so tired. Timmy answered, "I played in the sun all day and then I cleaned up my toys." His mom smiled and said, "That's because you worked hard today. It's important to listen to me and do what I ask, even if you're tired. It shows that you're responsible and respectful." 
From that day on, Timmy always listened to his mom and did what she asked. He learned that it's important to answer to your parents and be a good helper, even when you're tired.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite toy, a fragile porcelain doll. One day, while she was taking a nap, a thief came and stole her doll. When Lily woke up and saw that her doll was gone, she started to cry.
Her mother asked, "What happened, Lily? Why are you crying?"
"My doll is gone! A thief took it!" Lily replied.
"Don't worry, we'll find it. Let's go look for it together," her mother said.
They searched everywhere, and finally, they found the thief with Lily's doll. "Give me back my doll!" Lily shouted.
The thief said, "I'm sorry, I didn't know it was yours. Here you go."
Lily was so happy to have her doll back, she hugged it tightly and said, "Thank you, Mommy, for helping me find my doll." And then she took a nap with her doll in her arms.



Once upon a time, there was a little orange bird named Sunny. Sunny loved to fly around and sing songs. One day, while Sunny was flying, she saw a big, scary cat. The cat wanted to catch Sunny and eat her for dinner!
Sunny was very scared, so she flew to her friend's house. Her friend's name was Lucky, and he was a wise old owl. Sunny told Lucky about the cat and asked him what to do. Lucky told Sunny to lay low and stay safe until the cat went away.
Sunny listened to Lucky's advice and stayed in her nest until the cat left. She learned that when she was in danger, it was important to stay safe and not take unnecessary risks. From then on, Sunny always remembered to be careful and to listen to wise friends like Lucky.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a red shirt that he loved to wear every day. One day, he went to the park to play with his friends. They played on the swings, the slide, and the monkey bars. 
After a while, Timmy saw a big, mighty tree in the corner of the park. He wanted to touch the tree and feel its rough bark. So, he ran over to the tree and put his hand on it. It felt bumpy and scratchy, but Timmy liked it. 
When it was time to go home, Timmy went back to his house wearing his red shirt. He told his mom about the mighty tree and how he touched it. His mom smiled and said, "That sounds like fun, Timmy. Maybe we can go back to the park tomorrow and touch some more things." Timmy was happy and went to bed dreaming about all the things he could touch tomorrow.



Once upon a time, there was a happy family. Mommy, Daddy, and little Timmy. They wanted to go on a trip. Daddy said, "Let's pack our bags!" Timmy helped pack his toys and clothes. Mommy packed snacks for the trip.
When they got to the airport, Daddy said, "Do you have your passport, Mommy?" Mommy said, "Yes, it's in my bag." Timmy asked, "What's a passport?" Daddy said, "It's a special paper that lets us go to other countries."
They got on the plane and Timmy was so excited. He looked out the window and saw the clouds. Mommy said, "Are you cheerful, Timmy?" Timmy said, "Yes, I am! I love going on trips with my family." They had a great time on their trip and Timmy couldn't wait to pack his bags again for their next adventure.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. She had a big orange ball that she liked to kick around. One day, she was playing with her ball when she saw a fluffy white bunny. 
"Hello bunny, what are you doing?" asked Lily.
"I am looking for some yummy carrots to eat," replied the bunny.
Lily smiled and said, "I have some carrots in my garden. Would you like to come and eat them with me?"
The bunny hopped over to Lily's garden and they both enjoyed some crunchy carrots. After they ate, the bunny started to yawn. "I'm getting sleepy," said the bunny. "Your garden has a nice texture to it. It's very soft and cozy."
Lily smiled and said, "Thank you. Maybe you can come back and visit me again soon."
The bunny nodded and hopped away. Lily picked up her orange ball and continued to play in the sunshine.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was walking down the street when he saw a poor little bird with a broken wing. Timmy felt very sad for the bird and wanted to help.
He asked the bird, "Are you okay? Do you need help?" The bird replied, "Yes, please. I can't fly with my broken wing."
Timmy gently picked up the bird and held it close to his shoulder. "Don't worry," he said. "I will take care of you." Timmy took the bird home and gave it some food and water. The bird was very happy and grateful for Timmy's help.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the store with her mommy. They wanted to buy a soft blanket for her bed. While they were walking around the store, they saw a big leopard toy. 
Lily said to her mommy, "I want to buy the leopard toy, please!" 
Her mommy said, "Okay, we can buy the leopard toy and the soft blanket for your bed." 
Lily was very happy and hugged her new leopard toy. When they got home, she put the soft blanket on her bed and cuddled with her new friend, the leopard. They both slept soundly all night long.



Once upon a time, there was a kind mommy who loved to bake cake. She made a yummy cake with lots of frosting and sprinkles on top. The cake was so pretty and smelled so good that everyone wanted a piece. 
One day, it was very hot outside and the sun was shining bright. The cake was left outside and it started to melt. The frosting dripped down the sides and the sprinkles fell off. The cake looked very different than before. 
But the mommy was still kind and said, "It doesn't matter if the cake looks different. It still tastes just as good!" And everyone agreed. They ate the cake and it was delicious, even though it had melted a little bit. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy was very excited because he wanted to shave like his daddy. He asked his daddy for a razor, but his daddy said he was too little and it was too dangerous. 
Timmy was sad, but he understood that he needed to be careful. He promised his daddy that he would be careful and not hurt himself. 
One day, Timmy's daddy let him use his electric razor. Timmy was very careful and did a great job. He was so proud of himself and his daddy was proud too. From that day on, Timmy knew that he needed to be careful when using sharp things like razors.



One morning, a little girl named Lily saw a shiny toy at the store. She wanted it so much, but it was too expensive. She asked her mom if she could buy it, but her mom said no.
Lily was sad and started to cry. Her mom hugged her and said, "Lily, we can't buy everything we want. Sometimes we have to save our money for more important things."
Lily thought about what her mom said and realized she didn't need the expensive toy. She laid it back on the shelf and said, "Mom, you're right. I don't need this toy. I'm happy just being with you." Her mom smiled and hugged her again, proud of her daughter for learning a valuable lesson.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bake cakes with her mommy. One day, Lily's mommy had an urge to bake a special cake for their neighbor's birthday. 
Lily asked, "Mommy, can I help you bake the cake?" 
Her mommy replied, "Sure, sweetie. But first, we need to make sure we have all the ingredients ready." 
Lily helped her mommy measure the flour and sugar. They mixed the batter and poured it into the pan. 
After the cake was baked, they decorated it with frosting and sprinkles. Lily's mommy said, "This cake looks so pretty and delicious. Let's go give it to our neighbor." 
Lily was excited to share the cake with their neighbor. She said, "I hope she likes it!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the park with her mom and saw a bench. She sat down because she was tired. She saw a butterfly and tried to catch it, but it disappeared. She looked for it, but it was gone. She felt sad because she really wanted to catch the butterfly. Suddenly, she saw a boy who had caught the butterfly. She asked him if she could see it, but he said no. She felt angry and sad because she really wanted to see the butterfly. But then, her mom told her they could go get some ice cream. Lily forgot about the butterfly and felt happy again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a nice squirrel. The squirrel lived in a big tree in the forest. Every day, the squirrel would gather nuts and acorns to eat. One day, the squirrel saw a big pile of nuts on the ground. The squirrel was happy because it could gain more nuts for the winter. 
The squirrel tried to carry as many nuts as it could, but it was too heavy. So, the squirrel decided to take one nut at a time back to its tree. It was a lot of work, but the squirrel knew it was important to have enough food for the winter. 
Finally, after many trips back and forth, the squirrel had gained a lot of nuts for the winter. The squirrel was happy and felt proud of itself for working so hard. From then on, the squirrel made sure to always keep an eye out for more nuts to gain.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy was playing with his toy hammer, but he realized that he needed a real tool to fix his broken toy. 
Timmy went to his dad and asked him for a tool. His dad gave him a real hammer and Timmy was so happy! He fixed his broken toy and it was like new again. 
Timmy thought it was funny how a real tool could fix things so easily. He decided that he wanted to be a builder when he grew up so he could fix things all the time. From that day on, Timmy played with his tools and fixed all his broken toys.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very curious and liked to ask lots of questions. One day, her mommy gave her a calendar to wear on her wrist like a bracelet. Lily thought it was funny to wear a calendar, but she liked it.
Lily wore the calendar everywhere she went. She even showed it to her friends at school. But one day, she lost the calendar. She looked everywhere for it, but it was gone. Lily was sad and cried a lot. She wished she had never lost the calendar.
From that day on, Lily learned to be more careful with her things. She never wore a calendar again, but she always remembered the one she lost.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird who loved to fly in the sky. One day, the bird saw a big, mean cat who wanted to eat him. The bird was scared and cried for help, but no one heard him.
The bird tried to fly away, but the cat was too fast. The cat caught the little bird and ate him up. The sky turned dark and sad, and all the other birds cried too.
It was a very sad day, but the other birds remembered the helpful little bird and how he loved to fly in the sky. They decided to always remember him and be kind to each other.



Once upon a time, there was a big, tall giraffe. He had a long neck and spots all over his body. One day, he was very hungry and wanted to eat some leaves from the trees. But the trees were too tall for him to reach. 
Just then, a little boy came by and saw the giraffe. He wanted to help the giraffe, so he climbed up the tree and picked some leaves. He fed the leaves to the giraffe and the giraffe was very happy.
The giraffe was so grateful for the boy's help that he decided to tell him a story. The story was about a little bird who wanted to learn how to fly. The boy listened to the story and was very happy. From that day on, the boy and the giraffe became good friends and helped each other whenever they could.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a furry cat named Mittens. One night, Lily's mom made her favorite dinner - spaghetti and meatballs. Lily was so excited to eat it.
While they were eating, Lily's mom said, "Lily, don't forget to leave some spaghetti for Mittens. He loves it too." Lily smiled and said, "Okay, Mommy."
After dinner, Lily went to play with her toys. Mittens was sleeping under the table. Suddenly, Lily heard a loud noise. She ran to the kitchen and saw that Mittens had knocked over a pot of water. Lily's mom was upset and said, "Mittens, why did you leave the table? You made a mess!"
Lily felt bad for Mittens, but she knew he didn't mean to make a mess. She said, "It's okay, Mommy. Mittens just wanted some dinner too." From that day on, Lily always saved some spaghetti for Mittens and made sure to keep an eye on him during dinner.



Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy went outside to play. He loved to run and jump and have fun. But today was a little different because it was raining outside. Timmy didn't mind though, he loved to play in the wet rain.
As he was playing, Timmy saw a sign that said "Caution: slippery when wet". But Timmy didn't pay attention to the sign and kept playing. He ran and jumped and had so much fun, until he slipped on the wet ground.
Timmy fell down and hurt himself badly. He realized he should have listened to the sign and been more careful. From that day on, Timmy always paid attention to signs and made sure to be safe when playing outside.



Once upon a time, there was an old man who lived in a large house. He loved to travel and see new places. One day, he met a little girl who asked him where he was going. The old man replied, "I am going to travel to see new things."
The little girl asked, "Can I come with you? I want to see new things too!" The old man smiled and said, "Of course you can come with me!"
They packed their bags and set off on their journey. They traveled far and wide, seeing many new and exciting things. The little girl was so happy she got to go on an adventure with the old man.
When they returned home, the little girl told her parents all about their travels. She said, "We went to many places and saw many things. The old man's house was very large, and he loved to travel!" Her parents were happy to hear about their adventure and the little girl felt proud to have gone on such a big journey.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the snow. One day, Lily went outside to play and it was very cold. She had on a warm scarf to keep her neck warm. 
As she was playing, she fell and hurt her knee. It hurt very much and she started to cry. Her mommy came outside to help her. She wiped away her tears with a tissue and put a band-aid on her knee. 
Lily felt better and wanted to keep playing. But her mommy said it was time to come inside. Lily was sad because she wanted to stay outside and play more. But she knew her mommy was right. 
When they got inside, Lily's mommy made her some hot chocolate. It was very successful and made Lily feel happy again. But later that night, Lily's knee hurt again. It was very swollen and red. Her mommy took her to the hospital and the doctors said she needed surgery. 
Lily was very scared, but her mommy held her hand and told her everything would be okay. Unfortunately, the surgery was not successful and Lily had to stay in the hospital for a long time. She missed playing outside in the snow and wished she had been more careful.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily's mom gave her a big spoon to eat her soup. Lily didn't like the soup, but she didn't want to be rude, so she ate it all. 
After dinner, Lily went to play with her toys. She saw her brother playing with his toy car and she wanted to play too. But her brother said she couldn't because she was too little. 
Lily felt terrible because she wanted to play with her brother. She decided to dare herself to ask him again. She walked up to her brother and asked if she could play too. Her brother said yes and they played together happily ever after. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, she went to the park with her mom. There, she saw a boy playing with a ball. She wanted to play with him, but she was too shy to ask.
Later, her mom took her to the ice cream truck. Lily saw the boy in line in front of her. She decided to request the same flavor as him. "I want the same as the boy in the blue shirt," she said to the ice cream man. The boy turned around and smiled at her.
As they sat and ate their ice cream, Lily asked the boy if he wanted to play with her. He said yes and they had so much fun together. They played tag and hide-and-seek. Before they left, the boy gave Lily his phone number and said they could play again soon.
Lily went home with a gentle smile on her face, happy to have made a new friend. She couldn't wait to call him and play again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and her favorite doll was named Rosie. One day, Lily was playing with Rosie when she accidentally dropped her on the ground. Rosie's hair got all tangled up and Lily didn't know what to do.
Lily's mom came over and saw what happened. She said, "It's okay, Lily. We can fix Rosie's hair. Let's get some oil and gently brush it out." Lily watched as her mom repeated the process until Rosie's hair was all smooth again.
"Thank you, Mommy!" Lily said as she hugged her mom. From then on, Lily made sure to be more careful when playing with Rosie.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily's mom was cooking dinner and some smoke came out of the oven. Lily's mom quickly opened the window to remove the smoke from the kitchen. 
Later that day, Lily was playing with her toys when she accidentally knocked over her brother's tower of blocks. Her brother started crying and Lily felt guilty for what she had done. 
To make things better, Lily decided to help her brother rebuild the tower of blocks. They worked together and soon the tower was even bigger and better than before. Lily's brother stopped crying and gave her a big hug, making Lily feel happy again.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird who lived in a cozy shelter made of twigs and leaves. The bird loved to sing and play all day long. One day, while the bird was flying around, it saw a beautiful shiny object in the distance. The bird felt curious and wanted to know what it was.
The bird flew closer and closer until it reached a big tree. The shiny object was hanging from one of the branches. The bird felt excited and wanted to see what it was. Suddenly, the wind blew and the shiny object revealed itself. It was a golden bell!
The bird felt happy and started to sing a beautiful melody. The sound of the bell was so attractive that all the animals in the forest came to see what was happening. The little bird felt proud and happy to have found the golden bell. From that day on, the bird sang even more beautiful songs, and all the animals in the forest loved to listen to it.



Once upon a time, there was a big lion who lived in the jungle. He liked to roar very loudly to show how strong he was. One day, the lion saw a little boy playing with a mixer. The mixer was making a funny noise that caught the lion's attention. 
"Hey little boy, what is that mixer doing?" asked the lion.
"It's mixing cake batter," said the boy.
"Can I try?" asked the lion.
"Sure, but be careful not to break it," said the boy.
The lion tried to use the mixer, but it was too small for his big paws. He accidentally knocked it over and it got hidden under some leaves. The boy helped the lion find the mixer and they became friends. From that day on, the lion learned that sometimes it's better to be gentle instead of roaring all the time.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play outside in the big green yard. One day, she saw a spider on the ground. It was black and had eight legs. Lily didn't like spiders, but she didn't want to hurt it.
Suddenly, it started to rain. Lily ran inside, but she forgot about the spider. When she came back outside, the spider was all wet and looked sad. Lily felt bad for forgetting about it. She picked up the spider and put it under a dry leaf. She cared about the spider and wanted it to be safe.
From that day on, Lily didn't mind spiders so much. She realized they were just little creatures who needed someone to care for them too.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to get letters in the post from her grandma. One day, Lily's mom needed to go to the store and asked her to be honest and not make a mess while she was gone. Lily promised to be good.
While her mom was away, Lily heard the postman outside. She ran to the door and saw that he had a letter for her. She was so happy and couldn't wait to show her mom when she got home. Lily knew that she needed to be careful with the letter and not tear it.
When her mom came back from the store, Lily proudly showed her the letter from grandma. Her mom was happy to see that Lily had been honest and didn't make a mess. They sat down together and read the letter, feeling grateful for the love and connection that came through the post.



Once upon a time, there was a big tree. An owl lived in the tree. The owl was ready to go to sleep. The owl sat on a branch and closed its eyes. The owl was happy because it had a nice home in the tree.



Once upon a time there was a little brown bear. The bear went on an adventure to find a special victory.
The bear saw a big mountain and decided to climb it. The mountain was very steep, but the bear kept going until he reached the top. The view was amazing. 
The bear saw a river below. The river was very wide and looked like it would take a long time to cross. So the bear changed his plan and decided to float down the river instead.
He grabbed a big leaf and jumped into the river. The leaf carried the bear down the river until he reached a small island in the middle of the river.
The bear was so excited. On the island he saw a tree with a giant shining gem at the very top. The gem was the special victory he had been searching for.
The bear climbed the tree and grabbed the gem. With the gem in his hand the bear had a big smile on his face. He had changed his plan many times, but he had found his special victory in the end.




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Sammy. He was very brave and curious. One day, he decided to explore a strange cave in the woods. His mommy warned him not to go in the cave, but Sammy was a bit foolish.
He decided to ignore his mommy's warning and he went into the cave. Inside, he found a big surprise. It was a golden prize, glimmering in the darkness! Excited, Sammy grabbed the prize and started to run back home.
Unfortunately, the cave was full of dangerous creatures. They had been warned by Sammy's mommy and they were not happy to see him. Sammy had to quickly escape, so he ran as fast as he could.
He made it safely back home and his mommy was so happy to see him. When Sammy showed her the prize, she knew how brave he had been and she praised him for it. Sammy was so proud and excited. He had won an amazing prize for being so very brave. 
The End!




One day, little Jack took a walk. He saw a delicate leaf on the ground and brushed it with his hand. He picked up the leaf and twirled it around in his fingers. He placed the leaf in his pocket and kept on walking.
He saw a lot of leaves on the ground and wanted to collect them all. He ran around and picked up each leaf he saw. He put them carefully into his pockets and even put some in his hat.
As Jack kept walking, he came across a friend. They decided to join hands and collect leaves together. They each grabbed a leaf and then they continued.
Jack's friend shouted, Let's make a leaf palace!. Jack smiled and said, That's a great idea. With their delicate leaves, they built a colorful palace surrounded by a pile of leaves. They admired their work and were delighted with the result.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Alex. He was only three years old, but he already owned something special: an ice cream cone! It was a delicious raspberry flavored ice cream, and Alex was very happy. 
One day, Alexs mommy came over to him with an worried look on her face. She asked him, Alex, did you eat that ice cream cone all by yourself?
Alex smiled brightly and said, Yes, Mommy! It was so delicious! His mommy smiled and told him, Im glad you enjoyed it, but you need to share with others!
Alex nodded and agreed to share his delicious ice cream with his friends. From then on, Alex always shared what he owned with his friends and his family. He no longer worried about not having enough to share.




Once there was a girl who liked to run. One day she was running in the park and saw a tree. She wanted to run to it, so she ran faster. When she got to the tree, she looked up and saw a bird. The bird was fit and healthy, so the girl stopped and smiled.
The bird stopped too, and the girl noticed it was looking at her with kind eyes. The bird and the girl just looked at each other, until the bird started to fly away. The girl smiled and waved goodbye.
The girl went back to running, but this time she ran slower. She made sure to stop and admire the trees she saw. She felt fit, happy and excited!



 
One day, a young girl named Sarah wanted to improve her room. She looked around and saw that her clothes were all on the floor. She felt ashamed of the mess, so she decided to clean it up. She went to the kitchen and found a hanger. Then, she went back to her room and hung all her clothes on the hanger.
She admired her work. She was so happy with what she did. Her room now looked so much better than before. She beamed with joy and was so proud of herself.
The next day, her mom saw her room and was impressed. She said to Sarah, "Good job, you really improved your room." Sarah smiled and said, "Thanks, Mommy!"




Once upon a time, there lived two friends in a small village. Their names were Paul and Matt. They were very good friends and they loved to play football together. One day they got into a quarrel and decided to play a game of football to decide who was right. 
Paul kicked the ball really hard and it flew really high in the air. But Matt was too slow and the ball went over his head. The ball flew so high, it landed in a deep river. 
The two friends were not able to get the ball out. They tried and tried but the river was too deep. They were both very sad and promised each other to never quarrel again.




Once upon a time, there was a big and very tidy kitchen. Everyday, a little girl named Lilly would help her mom tidy up the kitchen and they both enjoyed it very much.
One day, Lilly's mom told her that she was going to go to the library to study and that she should stay at home and help keep the kitchen tidy. She said, "Lilly, while I am studying, I want you to help me make the kitchen very tidy, ok?"
Lilly was so excited to help her mom, so she agreed and said, "Yes! I will make the kitchen extra tidy!"
When Lilly's mom came back from the library, she was surprised to see that not only was the kitchen tidy, but it was also extra clean! She hugged her daughter and thanked her for taking care of the kitchen.
From then on, whenever Lilly's mom needed to study, she would always ask her daughter to help her make the kitchen tidy. Lilly was happy to help, and the kitchen always looked extra clean and lovely.




Once there was a little girl named Abigail. She was three years old and loved to play outside. One day, she went to the park with her family. As she was playing, Abigail saw a paler girl sitting alone on a bench. She went over to say hello. 
The pale girl said her name was Olivia. Abigail asked Olivia why she looked so sad. Olivia showed Abigail a deep cut on her knee. She said it had happened while playing in the park and it really hurt. 
Abigail immediately knew what to do. She cleaned the cut with some soap and water and then gave Olivia a gentle massage. Olivia felt much better. Abigail smiled and hugged Olivia tight. 
Olivia and Abigail became best friends that day. From then on, every time Olivia got hurt, Abigail was there to help with a hug, a gentle massage, and a lot of love.



Once upon a time there was a red paper. It wanted to escape so it could explore the world. Every day it waved to the wind, hoping it would come and help it get away. One day, the wind felt sorry for the paper. He came and blew the paper away and away it sailed! It saw mountains, rivers and fields of flowers. It saw birds in the sky, children playing and animals running. The paper was so happy and excited to see all the things in the world. It waved goodbye to the wind and thanked him for helping it escape. The wind smiled and waved back, happy that the paper could have its adventure. The paper went on its way, exploring the world!




One day, Jack and his Mama went to the park. Jack loved playing with the other kids and running around. But, after a long day of playing and running, Jack was very tired. His Mama told him it was time for a nap. However, Jack didn't want to take a nap. He wanted to keep playing with the other kids.
But, Jack's Mama was very fair. She said he could play for five more minutes and then he had to take a nap. Jack was so excited and continued to run around and play.
Five minutes went by quickly and soon it was time for Jack to take a nap. But, Jack didn't want to take a nap; he wanted to keep playing. So, Jack resisted and tried to stay up.
But, Jack's Mama was very persistent. She kept telling Jack it was time for a nap and he had to listen to her. Finally, Jack gave in and took a nap. He felt much better after his nap and was ready to play with the other kids.




Max had a rubber duck. He loved playing with it in the bath. He would squirt water at it, and make it fit into the biggest bubbles.
Today, Max wanted to take his duck outside. He quickly put on his shoes, grabbed his duck and walked outside.
Max was in the garden, and he saw a pond. He wanted to put his duck in the water. He slowly placed it in the water, and watched it float away.
Max felt thirsty. He walked to the kitchen and found a glass. He drank all of the water in the glass.
Max was now full. He ran back to the pond and saw that his rubber duck was still there, floating happily. He grabbed it and brought it back into the bath. Max was very happy. He was going to play in the bath all day, because it was the perfect place to be fit and have fun.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emma who was very scared of the lab. Every time she had to go to the lab she would get very worried. One day, her mom said to her, "Why don't we try something different to help you get over your fear? Let's go for a jog together!"
So Emma and her mom went jogging around the block. Emma loved running and it made her feel much better. When they were done, Emma's mom asked her how she felt about going to the lab the next day.
Emma thought for a bit and then said, "I think I can go! I'm still a bit scared, but I think if I just keep jogging it will help me be brave enough to go to the lab." Sure enough, the next day Emma and her mom jogged around the block again, and then Emma was brave enough to go to the lab.
The moral of the story is that if you feel scared, the best thing to do is to try something new and practice doing it until you feel better!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved playing pretend. She would imagine she was a doctor or a cowgirl or a princess. One day, she decided to imagine that she was a farmer. Lucy went out to her backyard, which was full of tall grass, and she started pretending.
She bent down and put her hands in the grass, like she was looking for something. Suddenly, her knee got hurt. The pain was sharp and sudden. She started to cry and ran inside. 
Her mom hugged her and kissed her knee. Then, she gave Lucy a hug and asked, "We should put something sweet on your knee. Would you like that, sweetheart?". 
Lucy smiled and nodded. She never knew how much a little bit of honey could help soothe her pain. She put it on her knee and felt much better.
Once again, Lucy was able to pretend, this time with a sweet kiss from her mom. Now she understood the importance of taking care of herself, even if it was just pretend!




Once upon a time, there was a boy who liked going outside. One day, he decided to join a cactus. The cactus had lots of prickly spikes, but the boy thought the spikes would be fun to touch. He slowly reached his arm out and touched one of the spiky branches. 
Suddenly, he felt a sharp sting and quickly pulled his arm away. He realized the spikes weren't so nice after all! He was sad and wanted to get away from the cactus.
Before he left, he saw a little furry creature nearby. The creature asked the boy to come closer and said, "Hey, I know a place where there is something tasty - come join me and I will show you join".
The boy warily followed the creature to a nearby bush. When he looked inside the bush, he was surprised to see the most delicious fruit he had ever seen! There were lots of colorful and tasty pieces of fruit. He happily joined the creature and enjoyed the tasty fruit. 
The boy was so glad he had decided to join the cactus. He learned that sometimes it pays off to try new things - even if it doesn't seem like a good idea at first. He quickly finished eating, thanked the creature and went home with a full stomach!




Once upon a time there was a kind and compassionate man who lived in the nearby village. He was a cheerful soul who always tried to encourage others with his kind words.
One day he was walking through the city when he noticed a little girl, about three years old, sobbing on a nearby bench. He approached her and asked what was wrong.
The girl looked up at him, her eyes full of tears, and quietly said, "My blue balloon floated away. I wanted it for my birthday."
The man's heart melted at her story and he could see how upset the girl was. He gently put his hand on her shoulder and said, "I understand how you feel, sweetheart. Let me try to encourage you. What do you say if I help you get a new blue balloon?"
The girl's eyes lit up with a spark of hope and she smiled through teary eyes.
The compassionate stranger then took her hand and they walked to the nearby market where they bought a brand new beautiful blue balloon. He tied it to her tiny wrist and told her that it was a birthday present from him.
The girl smiled and wrapped her small arms around his neck. He hugged her back and she thanked him for his kindness before she skipped away with her new balloon, still smiling.
The man watched her until she was out of sight and he smiled, knowing that he had just done something kind. He was happy




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. She was very anxious because she couldn't find her zipper. She looked everywhere! Under the bed, in the kitchen, everywhere. But still no zipper.
Jane frowned as she thought about what to do. Suddenly, she noticed that her mom had a zipper on her jacket. She ran up to her mom and asked if she could borrow her zipper.
Her mom smiled and said yes. Jane was so happy. She quickly took the zipper and put it on her shirt. She zipped it up and felt much better. She wasn't anxious anymore!
The end.




Once there was a honest little girl. She was only 3 years old. She had an olive tree in her garden. Every day she would kneel in front of it and talk to it. She would tell her tree all her secrets. She thought it was her special friend. 
The tree was always so quiet and good to her. It never told her secrets to anyone. The little girl was so happy.
One day, the girl was walking around the garden and she stopped in front of her tree. She kneeled down and hugged it tightly. She whispered that she was so happy for such a honest tree like it. She thanked the tree for listening to her secrets.
The little girl and her tree stayed like this for a long time. They were the best of friends forever.




Once upon a long time ago, there was a wise and intelligent man. He would hang around the village and help people with their problems. One day, he decided to climb the mountain and hang up a wish in a great big tree. As he climbed higher, he noticed that larger and larger birds were flying around him and making a lot of noise. But he kept on climbing until he reached the top of the mountain.
When he arrived at the top, he opened the pouch he had been carrying and he took out a little bit of his wisdom and hung it in the big tree. All of the birds were still making noise, so he whispered something in the tree. Then he made his way back to the village.
For days and weeks, the man wondered if his wish would ever come true. Then one day, something amazing happened. There was a knock at his door and the man opened it to find a very intelligent child standing there. He welcomed the child in and asked him what he wanted. The child said he had come for the wisdom that was hanging in the tree!
The man was amazed and very pleased that his wish had come true. He knew at once that this child had come for the wisdom and that he must have been sent by the birds! The man was delighted to share his wisdom with the child and the two of them had lots of fun. From then on, the child was considered a very wise and intelligent person in the




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to skip. Everywhere she went, she skipped. One day, the little girl was skipping in the park when she noticed a deaf old man. He did not hear the birds chirping, so the little girl skipped over to him.
She smiled and said "hello". The old man did not answer, so she realized he was deaf. She then tapped his shoe and said it again, louder this time. The old man finally looked at her, so the little girl smiled and said it again.
The old man was so surprised to hear this little girl speaking to him. He smiled back and said, "Hi.



Once upon a time, there lived a fierce dragon who always liked to listen. One day, he heard about a beautiful rainbow which lived far away. The dragon was so excited that he decided to go look for the rainbow. He flew and he flew until he reached the rainbow. He was ready to listen.
When the dragon arrived, he saw the beautiful rainbow. But what he didn't see was the fierce storm coming his way. The storm grew bigger and bigger and before the dragon knew it, the sky was full of thunder and lightning. The dragon was so scared.
The dragon tried to fly away, but the winds were so strong that he couldn't move. The rain started to fall, and the dragon hid under a tree. He wanted to listen more but he was too afraid. The storm grew stronger and stronger, until it finally ended.
The dragon was so sad. He wanted the rainbow more than ever, but it was gone now. All that was left were the fierce storm clouds and the sad dragon.




Sammy the Rabbit was so flexible. He could bend his head. One day, he went to the forest to find some fun. But then he heard a big noise and he got scared. He closed his eyes and his body started to disappear. His head was still there but the rest of his body had vanished.
He ran back to his house and asked his mama what had happened. She said it was magic, and that he could hide away anytime he wanted. Sammy thought this was great. He kept practising his magic disappearing trick until he got really good at it.
He would often disappear when he was feeling shy or scared, and come back when he was ready. He loved his magic power, and enjoyed learning more about it. From then on, Sammy was never scared as he could use his magic to hide away.




Once upon a time, there was a fat onion. It was never happy for the one thing it wanted most - a friend. One day, an adventurous young girl was walking by and noticed the onion. She said hello to the onion, and the onion perked up. She offered him to lead him to a place where he could make many friends. The onion was so excited and followed her. 
The young girl lead the onion far away to a big, open field. He looked around, and he was so happy! Everywhere he looked he saw other onions, some big and fat, some small, just like him. 
He quickly made lots of friends and they had so much fun playing and spending time together. Now the fat onion is never lonely and loves his new home with all his friends.



Once upon a time, there was a big bird. He liked to sit on the branches of the tree and enjoy the nice weather.
One day, the bird noticed something interesting. Under the tree was something shiny. He flew down to take a closer look and saw that it was a pattern! It was very pretty and looked perfect.
The bird became very excited and he tried to make the pattern bigger. He used his beak and wings to spread the pattern out. Once he was done, the pattern was perfect.
The bird was very proud and he wanted to show it off. He found a comfortable spot and sat down. He sat still for a long time to admire the perfect pattern he created. He enjoyed it so much, he decided to stay there the whole day!




Once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to dig holes in his back yard. One day, as he was digging and digging, he came across a beautiful, shiny red flower. It was amazing! He exclaimed, "Oh, look at the beautiful flower!"
The little boy touched the petals of the flower, when suddenly a magical voice spoke out from underneath it. "Be gentle with the flower," said the voice. "Show it some kindness, and it will bloom."
The little boy listened carefully, and he was amazed by the voice. He smiled, and promised to take care of the flower. Every morning, he watered it and plucked away the weeds that surrounded it. As the days went by, the flower slowly began to open, and it was soon blooming more and more with each passing day.
The little boy was so proud of his work and felt a sense of accomplishment when he saw the bloom of the flower.
The moral of the story is that being nice and gentle to others can have amazing rewards. When we show kindness, it can make us feel good, and great things can bloom from it.




Once upon a time there was an attractive girl who lived in a cozy house. She had a small dog called Bo who liked to run around and play.
One day the girl was outside playing with Bo when she fell down and scraped her knee. This made her cry.
Luckily, her mom was nearby and came over to help. She put a soft bandage on the girl's knee and kissed her forehead. That made the girl feel better.
Her mom rubbed her back and said, "See, it's not so bad. Just don't run too fast next time." The girl smiled, feeling much better.
Mom gave her a hug, and soon they were both playing with Bo again. The girl was careful not to fall down again, and the bandage on her knee soon healed.




Once there was a playful woman who had something to sell. She went to the market to show people her product, but the people in the market wouldn't buy it. They said it was too expensive.
The playful woman was very sad and didn't know what to do. She couldn't understand why nobody wanted to buy her things. She sat down by the side of the market and started to cry.
Suddenly, a kind old man came over and saw the woman. He asked her why she was crying and she told him about her product that nobody wanted to buy. The kind old man told her not to worry and offered to help her.
He said he knew some people who would really want to buy her products. The woman was so happy that someone was willing to help her. She thanked him and followed him to the people he was talking about.
When they got there the people loved the product and bought it from her. The playful woman was so pleased. She thanked the kind old man and he walked off with a big smile on his face. The woman sold her product and was very happy.




Once there was a boy. He liked to run and always had a lot of energy. One day, he wanted something cold to drink. So he went to the store and bought a carton of milk. It was the original kind, and the boy really liked it.
When he got home, he opened the carton and took a big gulp. It was delicious! He finished the glass and then wanted to run, so he put on his shoes and ran all over the house. He never felt so happy before!
Whenever he wanted a cold drink on a hot day, he always went to the store to get his original milk. And he always ran all the way home.




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Joe. Joe loved to eat vegetables! Every day he would eat a different vegetable. 
One day he went to the store with his Mom. Joe wanted to buy some carrots, but his Mom said they were out of money. Joe sighed. He was very sad he couldn't buy any carrots. 
A few days later, Joe was playing in the garden. He noticed a large carrot sticking out of the ground. Joe felt so happy! He pulled the carrot out of the ground and took a big bite. 
Suddenly, his Mom came outside. She saw the carrot and became very angry. She scolded Joe for taking the carrot without asking. Joe felt so ashamed. 
His Mom hugged him and said, "It's okay, but next time, ask me first!" Joe nodded, and vowed he would never take a vegetable without asking again.



Max and his family lived in a lively house. They loved it because it always had energy and life. One day, as Max was playing around in the backyard, he heard a loud noise from the house. He approached cautiously and saw something he had never seen before - a strange, unfamiliar creature. Max was puzzled, but he bravely tried to greet the creature.
To Max's surprise, the creature spoke! He said he was an old friend of the family and had been looking for them for years. He wanted to come and visit often. Max's parents were stunned, but soon they began to recognize him.
Turns out, the mysterious creature was an old family pet that they had been separated from years ago. The family was overjoyed to have him back. The animal made the house even livelier, bringing joy and happiness to the family. Max was delighted - an old friend had arrived, and he cherished every minute of it.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to go to the park.
One day, when Sarah was at the park, she noticed some of her friends playing with a string. Sarah ran over to them and asked them what they were doing.
They said, "We're playing a game. It's called Cat's Cradle and it's very popular!" They taught Sarah how to play the game and Sarah became very good at it.
Sarah and her friends spent all day playing Cat's Cradle at the park. They laughed and had so much fun!
When it was time to go home, Sarah said goodbye to her friends, and promised to come back to the park the next day.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tom. Tom was three years old and could not wait to learn new things. One day, Tom decided he wanted to learn how to make a toy car. So, he asked his mum for help.
Mum said, "You can do it, Tom! All you need is a screw and a bit of studying."
Tom was glad to hear this. He quickly picked a screw and studied how it worked. Once he had the idea, he set to work and looked around for some pieces from the toy car. He worked and worked, until, after some time, he had made a beautiful toy car!
Mum was glad, too. She was so proud of all the hard work Tom had put in. She hugged him and said, "Well done, Tom! You did some great studying today!" 
Tom was glad and hugged his mum back. From then on, he always had a screw nearby, just in case he needed to make another toy car!




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sarah. She loved playing in the park with her father. One day, Sarah wanted to try a new game.
She asked her daddy, "Can I taste this sweet treat?"
Her daddy said no and refused her request. Sarah felt very dizzy and frustrated.
Suddenly, she had a thought. She asked her daddy, "Can I taste it just a little bit? Please!"
Her daddy said, "Yes! But only a tiny bit. Don't eat too much!"
Sarah was very happy and tasted the sweet treat. It was delicious! She felt happy and energized.
The end.




Once there was a little boy, and he went out to play in the snow. The snow was very white and he wanted to choose something to do. He looked around and saw a lot of snow, but he couldn't decide what to do. 
Then he got an idea, he wanted to make a snowman. He gathered some of the white snow into a big pile, then he rolled it and patted it until it was the right size for a snowman. 
He started looking for some things to decorate it when his mom came out and said, What are you doing?
The little boy smiled and said, Mom, I'm making a snowman. I'm choosing what to put on it. 
His mom smiled and said, That's a great idea! Let's choose some things together.
The little boy and his mom had so much fun choosing the right things to put on the snowman. When they were done, the snowman looked so happy and festive, with his little hat and scarf and his big white buttons. 
The little boy smiled at the snowman and said, We chose a great snowman!




Once upon a time in an ancient land, there was a brave princess. She had been on a quest to find something special, something she had never seen before. 
One day, she set out on her journey, as she had done many times before. She hiked through a desert, and soon came across a deep, dark cave. 
She heard a strange sound, and cautiously stepped inside. In the center of the cave, she saw a pile of sand. She got closer to see what it was and saw something incredible - a magical gem. 
The princess was so excited she couldn't believe it! She reached out to get it, but then she heard a voice. 
"No!" the voice said. "If you take the gem, you will be cursed." 
The princess was scared and took a step back. But then she remembered why she was on her journey - to find something special and meaningful. 
The princess decided to be brave and get the gem. She closed her eyes and grabbed it, and when she opened them, she was surrounded by beautiful magical lights. 
The magical gem had granted the princess a wish - to make all the people in the kingdom happy. 
The moral of this story is to never give up on your dreams - because with hard work and courage, you can achieve them.




One night, Sarah went outside to look up at the sky. She noticed something special. At the top of the tall house, a chimney was wearing a hat of smoke. Sarah smiled. She thought it was very cool.
Sarah was tired, so she decided to go back inside for bedtime. As she stepped in through the door, she looked back up at the chimney one last time. It was still wearing its hat of smoke.
In the morning, Sarah went outside again to see if the chimney was still wearing its hat. Sure enough, there it was, wearing its smoke hat high up on the tall house.
Sarah thought the chimney was very special. She also thought it was very cool that the chimney was always wearing a hat of smoke at night. Sarah was tired again, but this time, she was tired from smiling so much.




Once upon a time, there was a gloomy bookcase. Every day people brought books to the bookcase and it was never happy. It wanted someone to bring it something special so it could be the happiest bookcase in the world!
One day, a delivery man came to the bookcase. He was holding something behind his back. The delivery man smiled and said, "I have something special just for you!"
The delivery man pulled out a bright, shiny flag and nailed it to the top of the bookcase! Then suddenly, the gloomy bookcase was bright and cheery.
From then on, the bookcase knew the important lesson that it had learned. It was that no matter how gloomy or sad you might feel, even the smallest things can make you feel happy and special when you least expect it!



Bob was walking in the park one day. He was feeling very good. He saw a squirrel nibbling on an ear of corn. 
It made Bob want to joke. He said to the squirrel, "Whats the funniest thing about corn?"
The squirrel shrugged and went back to eating. 
Bob thought for a moment and then shouted, "Popcorn!" 
He laughed and the squirrel looked up. They both paused and then started laughing together. 
It was a very good joke.




Once there was a dependable man who lived in the city. He was a vendor and sold food to people. Every day he put out his stand with all sorts of wonderful food. People came from far and wide to get some of it.
The vendor was very happy most of the time. But something was missing. He wished that he could make his stand glow as he had seen other places in the city glow at night.
One night a magical creature came to the vendor and said that it could make his stand glow. The magical creature waved its hand and suddenly the stand started glowing in a beautiful light. Everyone who saw the stand was amazed.
The vendor was so happy that his stand was glowing. He thanked the magical creature for its help and from then on his stand glowed every night. Everyone in the city was happy to have such a bright dependable vendor in their town.




One day, a boy named Jack stepped outside of his house and saw something white on the ground. He stepped closer and noticed it was a seal. He knew it was a seal because it was shaped like a kite and had a big, black eyes.
Jack stepped closer and said hello to the seal. The seal opened its mouth and made a loud noise. Jack was so excited and started jumping up and down! When he stepped back, the seal started walking.
Jack stepped forward, curious to see where the seal was going. He followed it around the corner and noticed it was walking towards the sea. The white seal started swimming and Jack waved goodbye. He smiled and ran back to his house feeling excited.




Once upon a time there were two friends called Bob and Lucy. They went out on a sunny day to find something fun to do. So they decided to go to the park. 
When they arrived, they saw lots of things they could do, like swing on the swing and roll down the slide. But Bob saw a rake and thought it would be fun to try it out. 
"Let's try it!" said Bob. He took the rake and Lucy held it. Then Bob tasted the handle. It was an ordinary taste, but Bob tasted it anyway. 
"That doesn't taste good!" said Bob. Lucy shook her head and said, "Bob, you shouldn't taste things that you're not sure about." 
But it was too late. Bob had already tasted it. Then he was feeling very sick.
The moral of this story is to never taste things you are not sure about. Just because something looks ordinary doesn't mean that it is safe.




Once upon a time there was a little girl, her name was Lily. She had long, blonde hair and she was always smiling. One day, she was at home playing when a loud thunder shook all the windows and the sky went dark. There was a storm coming and Lily was scared.
Her mom heard her crying and came to her. "It's allright, sweetheart" she said. Mommy held Lily and hugged her until she was calm. 
"The storm is loud, but it will soon pass" mom said softly.
