Suddenly, Peter came beside him and asked if he could share Dave's pattern. Dave thought for a minute and slowly nodded. Together, they looked at the pattern and started to make changes to make it even better. They smiled and laughed as they shared their ideas. After a while, Dave was happy again. He realized that it was fun to share with others. He thanked Peter for coming over and asked him to come again tomorrow. Peter said he would and they both went home with big smiles on their faces.



 
Once upon a time there was a happy tank. He was eager to explore the world around him. So he began to swim and splash through the cool waters.
Wherever he went he looked for new friends. One day, he met a little fish who welcomed him with a warm smile. The tank was excited, and the fish quickly became his best friend.
They spent many days playing together and discovering new things. Whenever the tank saw a new creature, the fish would say, "Welcome!". It was a cute little habit that the tank had grown to love.
The two friends made all sorts of wonderful memories. Sometimes they raced, other times they played tag. Even when they were apart, the tank was always eager to reunite with his best friend. 
And they lived happily ever after!




Once upon a time there was a big orange drawer. It was filled with all kinds of fun goodies.
One day a little girl wanted to play with them. But she didn't know where to find them.
So she asked her mom to lend her the orange drawer. Her mom said yes, and gave the girl the orange drawer.
The girl was so happy! She opened the drawer and found lots of fun stuff. She played with the things in the orange drawer all day.
When it was time to go home, the girl thanked her mom for lending her the orange drawer. Her mom was glad she had her fun. And the little girl was very happy with all the things she played with!




Once upon a time there was a brave little girl. She was a bit scared, but she really wanted to solve a problem. She had to get to the top of a big hill. She looked at it and felt a bit scared, but she told herself she could do it.
She put one foot in front of the other, and before she knew it, she was already halfway up the hill! She kept going, even when it seemed hard and she was feeling a bit fearful.
Finally she reached the top! There was a big cheer from everyone that she had made it, and she was so proud of herself. She had solved the problem and felt so powerful!




Once upon a time there was a child who wanted to be successful. Every day, the child would turn the pages of books to learn new things. One day, the child felt very tired, so he decided to take a nap.
While the child was sleeping, he dreamed of turning into a successful person. Suddenly, a voice said, You can be successful! All you have to do is turn this door handle. 
The child was so happy that he jumped out of bed and ran to the door. He looked at the handle and thought to himself, I can do this! With a big smile, the child turned the handle. 
But when the child opened the door, he was not successful. Instead, he was back in his bedroom! The child was very sad and wished he had never turned the door handle.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little furry rabbit that lived on a planet far away. The rabbit just loved to wave at people and explore the world. 
One day the rabbit was hopping around and waving at the birds that flew above. Suddenly, a friendly fairy appeared in front of them. The fairy waved back at the rabbit and said, "Hi there! What are you up to?".
The rabbit smiled, "I'm just hopping around and waving at the birds!" The fairy replied, "That's so much fun! Why don't you wander around and explore the planet?" 
The rabbit was excited and started hopping away. The fairy waved goodbye and the rabbit waved back. 
The rabbit wandered around and explored the planet for hours. Every time the fairy passed by, the rabbit would wave and the fairy would wave back. What a special friendship!  
The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Sam. He was a very nice boy and he loved making new friends. One day, Sam came across a flea in the park. He said hello to the flea and they soon became good friends.
Sam and the flea played together every day and Sam would tell the flea all his secrets. Everyone in the park started to like the flea and to join in their games. 
But one day, Sam heard some kids talking about how jealous they were of the flea. It made Sam feel sad that anyone would be jealous of his friend.
So, Sam told the kids that there was no reason to be jealous of the flea, because it was more important to value kindness and friendship over silly things like how popular somebody was.
The kids learned their lesson and from that day forward, everyone in the park got along because they valued friendship and kindness. 
And Sam and his flea friend stayed friends forever.




Once there was a farmer who was very bossy. He lived on a farm and he had lots of animals. The farmer was always shouting orders and scolding the animals.
One day when the farmer was mucking out the pigs, he noticed one of his little ducks was looking very tired.
He said to the duck, "What are you doing? Come over here, I'm going to show you something."
The duck waddled over and the farmer put some polish in his hands. He said to the duck, "We need to polish your feathers. Let me show you how."
The farmer then began to rub the polish all over the duck's feathers. The duck liked it, he began quacking contentedly.
When he had finished polishing the duck, the farmer said, "There, now don't you look fine? This will make you look much better."
The duck loved his polished feathers and kept waddling around the farm showing them off. From then on, all the animals on the farm knew the farmer was bossy, but also kind-hearted.



Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was very spoiled, and always got what she wanted.
One day, she was watching her favorite cartoon on TV. She was so excited to see the characters perform their silly dances!
But then something unexpected happened. Suddenly, the TV switched off and she couldn't watch the cartoon anymore. She was so upset and began to cry.
Her mom came into the room and saw what had happened. She knew her daughter was spoiled, so she decided to try something special. She took her daughter to the theater to watch a live performance of the cartoon!
The little girl was so surprised and happy to see her favorite cartoon characters on stage. She clapped and cheered as they performed all of their fun dances. She had never seen anything like it before and it was a moment she would never forget.
The little girl was so spoiled, but sometimes it is nice to spoil someone you love. She never forgot that special day at the theater and continued to watch her favorite cartoon with a big smile.




The wealthy man went hunting. He had a big gun with him. He wanted to shoot something. After a long time looking, he saw a deer. He was very excited and he shot at it. But he missed and the deer ran away.
He kept walking around and then he saw a bottle of wine. He smiled and thought it was a lucky day! He took the wine and walked away. 
The man was happy and he decided to sit down and enjoy his wine. He drank it and felt very pleased. He was so happy that he started to dance around the woods.
When he stopped dancing, he was very happy and he thanked God for the wine. Then he went home and enjoyed the rest of his day with a big smile on his face.



Once upon a time there was a whale. He was swimming in the deep blue sea, enjoying being free. Suddenly he felt something touch his fin. He looked around and noticed a big, empty bowl.
He swam closer and peeked inside the bowl. It was full of yummy things! He couldn't resist and tasted a little bit of everything. It was delicious.
The whale was so happy that he went up to the surface of the ocean and shouted with joy. He stayed up there for a while, until it was time to go back under the sea.
The whale swam away with a smile on his face, still tasting the delicious flavours of the things he had eaten from the empty bowl.




Sam was a generous three year old who loved to cook. He had his own grill and was always inviting his friends over to cook together. His friends loved eating the delicious treats that he prepared for them.
One day, he was so busy cooking that he didn't notice a mean, old sign that had been posted in the park. It said that grills were not allowed in the park. Sam was worried that he might get in trouble if someone saw him with his grill. 
But just when he was about to turn around and leave, one of his friends saw him and screamed out in delight. Soon enough, all the kids in the park were gathered around the grill, rubbing their tummies and excitedly watching Sam prepare the food.
Just then, a park ranger appeared and looked ready to scold Sam for having the grill in the park. But upon spotting the group's joyful faces, the ranger's stern expression softened and he said, "Well I guess you can stay because you are being generous with your delicious food."
Sam and his friends were so relieved and grateful that the ranger was so generous. From then on, they only tried to stay away from places where grills were banned.




Once there was a little boy who really wanted to grow his own food. So one spring day he took some radish seeds, put them in the ground and watered them every day. Soon, the radishes began to grow. The little boy was so excited to see what would happen!
Every day the little boy went to check on his radishes. He watered them and said kind words, wishing them to grow. After a few weeks, the radishes were fully grown! The little boy was so successful. He was so proud of his radishes.
The little boy picked the radishes and was so happy to see they were nice and juicy. He shared them with his friends and family and they all enjoyed them. The little boy was very proud of himself for growing successful radishes. He couldn't believe he had done it!




There were two friends, Jake and Jane. They were playing in the park when Jane saw a bucket hanging from a tree. She looked up and said, "What is that?"
Jake looked up and said, "That's a bucket."
Jane asked, "What's it doing there?"
Jake laughed. "That's for collecting the leaves when it's fall," he said.
Jane thought for a minute and then got a serious look on her face. "I have an idea," she said. "Let's hang it from the swings and see if we can get higher."
"That sounds seriously fun," said Jake. "Let's give it a try!"
So they took the bucket and hung it from the swings. Jane and Jake took turns sitting in the bucket and swinging higher and higher. They laughed and shouted with joy as they flew through the air. Soon, they were the highest in the park!




One day, Tom went on a search. Tom wanted to find something special for today. He looked in the sky but there was nothing there. He looked in his garden and it was empty. He looked everywhere but he couldn't find anything. 
Just when Tom was about to give up, he found something in his neighbour's garden. It was a modern toy car. Tom had seen this car before, but he couldn't remember where. Tom was so excited and he quickly grabbed it. 
Tom took the car home and showed it to his parents. They were so happy that Tom had found something so modern and special. 
Tom was very proud of his find and he decided to keep the car forever as a reminder of his special search today.




Once upon a time there was a careless boy called Joe. One day, Joe wanted to read a book. He went to the store, but he forgot to bring some gas money. He had no way to get back home, so he asked his friend to help him.
But Joe's friend was very careless too. He told him "I won't give you any gas money, so you have to walk". Joe felt sad and unhappy. He slowly walked back home.
On the way home, he saw some other children playing around. But none of their parents were around to watch them. He realized how careless he and his friend had been and he knew he had to be more careful in future.
Finally Joe made it home. He was relieved and glad to be back. He knew his lesson for the day - Always be careful, think first, and always bring some money with you.




One day, a little boy was walking through the hall. He noticed something strange; a funny object was attached to the wall. He had never seen it before; it was very unknown! He moved closer to examine it with curiosity. He saw that it had funny round shapes and lots of buttons. He felt the buttons, they were so shiny and smooth. He grabbed it and tried to attach it to the wall! After a few tries, he managed to attach it and he was so proud of himself. He ran back to the hall to show his mom what he had found. She was so amazed and she said, "You clever boy, you attached it all by yourself!"




Once there was a girl called Daisy. Daisy was very stubborn. She wanted to fill a bucket but it was too heavy for her.
So Daisy decided to get help from her big sister. Her big sister said, Why dont you fill it a little at a time? Put some into the bucket until you cannot put any more in.
So Daisy put lots of small pieces of wood into the bucket, until finally it was full. She started carrying the bucket away, but she couldnt take it far. Her little heel got stuck in the mud, and no matter how hard she tried, she couldnt pull it free.
Daisy started to cry, but her big sister seemed to know just what to do. She ran and got some rope from the house, and with it she tied the bucket to Daisys hands. Daisy could now pull the bucket along with her feet, without getting her heel stuck in the mud again.
And thats how Daisy filled her bucket, even though she was very stubborn.



Once upon a time there was a yellow reindeer. He loved to eat yellow apples. One day, when he went to get his apples, he couldn't find any! He looked high and low but all he could find were red apples. He was very sad. He was very hungry and he didn't want to eat the red apples because he liked the yellow ones better. He tried to find a way to make the red apples yellow. He thought and thought but he couldn't come up with anything. 
Then he heard a sound in the distance and looked up. It was four other reindeers who were yellow like him! He was so excited. He ran to meet the other reindeers and asked them for help.
The other reindeers said the only way to turn the red apples yellow was to eat them! The yellow reindeer was scared to try it, but he was very hungry. In the end, he decided to try it and it worked! The reindeer was so happy. He ate all the red apples and they were now all yellow! 
The yellow reindeer thanked the other reindeers and they all laughed together. He was so happy to have such good friends that could help him in such a time of need. The yellow reindeer learned a very valuable lesson that day-- friends help each other out.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Tom. He loved the outdoors and he especially loved going to the big field near his home. He loved to run around and play in the warm, sunny grass.
One day, Tom was in the field and he saw a shiny object glittering in the sun. He walked over and picked it up. When he looked closer, he realised it was a ruby. It was so bright and sparkly, it made Tom smile. 
Tom couldn't wait to show his mum what he had found. His mum looked at the ruby and said, "Oh, Tom! It's beautiful. It needs some polish though." 
So Tom and his mum travelled to the store. They bought some polish and went back to the field. Tom's mum showed him how to use the polish and he started buffing the ruby with a cloth. 
Finally, the ruby was shining as bright as the day it had been found. Tom was so proud of his work. As they walked home, they stopped at a bakery and Tom's mum bought him a tasty chocolate eclair. It was the perfect end to a special day!




Once there was an old man who wanted to take a walk. He went outside and saw a mosquito flying around. He smiled and nodded at the mosquito. The mosquito flew away happily. 
The old man continued his walk. He walked for a long time, until he saw a beautiful pond. He stopped and admired the pond. He nodded at it with appreciation.
All of a sudden he heard a splash from behind him. He turned around and saw a little frog had jumped into the pond. The frog was excited to see the old man and nodded his head at him in greeting.
The old man laughed and nodded at the frog. Then he turned and walked away, back home.




Once upon a time there was a soldier. He was very tall and he was always ready to go and help. But one day, he realized he was feeling very sad. He didn't know why he felt so sad and he didn't know what to do.
He thought and thought and then he decided to take a walk. As he was walking, he came across a beautiful lake. He couldn't resist and he started to fill up his bucket with the water. He filled and filled until the bucket was completely full.
When he stopped to take a break, he noticed that the lake had become very full. He saw that his bucket had filled the lake. He smiled and felt better. He knew he had helped fill the lake and he felt proud that he had done something useful. His sadness soon went away and he was happy again. The tall soldier was very happy and so was everyone else in the village.




Sam was a lazy boy who always left his room messy. His mum was tired of it, so one day she said "Sam, it's time to clean up your room!" Sam sighed and started polishing his wallet. He wanted to make it shine.
He worked slowly, as he was quite lazy, but gradually the wallet started to look better and better. He was very proud of his work. 
He showed the wallet to his mum, and she smiled and said "Well done, Sam! You did a great job!" Sam was happy and gave his mum a big hug. 
From that day on, Sam always kept his room tidy. He always took a few minutes to polish his wallet and remind himself of how proud it made his mum.




Once upon a time, Jack invited his best friends to his house to celebrate. They each brought something special to share. Gerry brought cookies, Joanne brought balloons, and Bill brought a tea set. They set up the tea set and shared tea and stories. They each laughed and celebrated all afternoon.
At the end of the party, Jack said to his friends, "Thank you for being here. I'm very lucky to have such loyal friends like you." They all hugged and said goodbye. 
The next day, Jack went to visit them and said, "Let's celebrate again someday. I think next time we should have a picnic in the park." Joanne said, "That sounds like a great idea!" as she hopped up and down with excitement. They all agreed and made plans for their next party. 
The end.




Once there was an old man who loved spicy food. Every morning he called out his window and shouted "I love spicy food!" 
The old man's neighbor, a 3 year old girl named Sally, heard him every day. She loved spicy food too, but she was never brave enough to tell him.
One day, Sally mustered up the courage to call to the old man out her window. She yelled "I love spicy food too!"
The old man was so surprised. He called back "Do you really?". Sally replied "Yes, I do!"
The old man was so happy to hear that Sally liked spicy food, too. He called her over, and the two of them shared a big, spicy meal together. From that day forward, the old man and Sally were friends. And every time they ate spicy food, they thought of the wonderful day they met.



Once there was a calm avocado. She liked to play in the sunshine every day. One day she wanted to go for a walk, so she left her tree and started walking.
But soon she saw smoke in the air. The smoke was coming from a fire! Before she knew it, the fire was burning around her and she was very scared.
But then she remembered the wise advice of her tree to stay calm. So she stopped and took some deep breaths. Suddenly, she saw a brave fire fighter, who put out the fire with a big hose.
The avocado was so grateful! And when the fire was gone, she went home safe and sound.




Once upon a time, there were two friends - Max and Kiki. They were both very excited because they were going on an adventure in the forest.
But then, when they arrived in the forest, something bad happened. The bad man was stealing the beautiful vine, without asking anyone. Max and Kiki were very angry and bravely chased the bad man away.
Unfortunately, the bad man had broken the vine. Max and Kiki were very sad and didn't know what to do. They could not fix it and it was too broken to take home.
But then, Kiki had an idea! She found some string and carefully put the pieces of the vine together. After lots of work, the vine was repaired! Max and Kiki hugged and thanked each other for their hard work. They were proud of their new, better vine!




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Josh. He was three years old. Josh wanted a goat very much. He asked his mom could he get a goat, but she said no.
One day, Josh was playing outside with his friends. Suddenly, they saw a goat! It was a very nice goat. Joshs friends recommended that he should keep the goat. Josh was very grateful.
Josh always took care of the goat very well. He fed the goat, gave it water and played with it. They were very happy together. Josh was so happy that he had a goat of his own.
The end.




The little boy was very weak. He wanted to pick something up off the bookshelf but he couldn't lift it. He asked his father to help. His father came over and looked at the bookshelf. He was strong and he could pick it up with no problem. The little boy was happy he didn't have to do it himself. 
The father put the bookshelf down and showed the little boy how to hold it and pick it up without being so weak. He put his hands on either side of the bookshelf and, using his legs and back, he picked it up and carried it. 
The little boy was very happy. He was so proud that he was able to pick the bookshelf all by himself. He hugged his dad and thanked him. He knew he could do it but he was still very weak. He was happy he could do it with a little help from his dad.




Once there was a friendly girl. She liked to go fast. Everywhere she went she had a happy face.
One day when she was playing outside, the girl saw a dog running in the park. The dog was going so fast! She couldn't believe how fast the dog was running.
The girl wanted to run fast too, so she started running behind the dog. The dog looked back at her and it had a friendly face. It seemed to be happy that the girl was following it.
They kept running and running, until they both had to stop to catch their breath. The girl was so tired but it was fun to speed around with the friendly dog.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who liked to watch television. She had a big, hairy chair to seat in while she watched her favorite shows. 
One day, the little girl went to her chair and was surprised to feel something fuzzy. When she looked closer, she saw a big, hairy spider had made it's home there! 
The little girl was a bit scared but she was brave. She slowly reached out and carefully picked up the spider. Then she found a gentle place outside to set the spider down and watched it scuttle away. 
The little girl was so happy to have been gentle and brave! She went back to her chair and watched television without any hairy spider surprises.



Once upon a time there was a wise old bear. He lived in the woods near a small valley. Every day he would wander around and bring lots of things back with him. He would bring bright flowers, tasty apples, smooth stones and soft feathers. 
One day he brought back something very special - some velvet. The old bear was so excited to show it to the other animals in the forest. 
The other animals were very curious! They thought the velvet was so beautiful. They asked the bear where he found it. He explained it was beneath the mountain, in the secret valley. He said that if they were brave, they could go there and find some for themselves. 
The other animals were so excited about the treasure. They began preparing for their journey to the secret valley, with hopes of finding their own velvet!



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Beth. Beth was always very comfortable and loved the earth. Every day, she took time to appreciate nature and the beauty of her surroundings.
One day, Beth decided to go to a special place where she could shake and tremble the earth. She put her hands in the dirt and started to shake. Beth shook and shook until the whole earth trembled.
At first, Beth was scared. But then she noticed the earth was also shaking with happiness. Everywhere she looked, little plants were swaying and birds were singing their own special song.
Beth was so happy she kept shaking and shaking with the earth until nightfall. When it was finally dark, Beth felt so comfortable, like she was lying in the softest of beds. She said good night to the earth and the world around her, sure that tomorrow would be just as special.



 
Once upon a time, there was a helpful boy named Joe. One day, Joe heard a noise coming from a well in the woods. He went to investigate, and he found a tiny animal stuck inside. The animal was scared, and it was crying for help.
Joe called out, "Don't worry, I'm here to help!" He then grabbed a stick and tried to save the animal. But the stick was too short. He tried again with a longer stick, and it worked - Joe pulled the animal out of the well! 
The animal thanked Joe and said, "Thank you for saving me. You are very helpful". Joe smiled and said, "You're welcome. Glad I could help".
The two friends waved goodbye and went their separate ways. From then on, Joe was always ready to help out when needed.




Milly and Abe were playing in the park. They were running and jumping together, having a lot of fun. But then something happened. Abe tripped and fell and got a big mark on his leg. He was very upset and tears filled his eyes.
Milly saw that Abe was crying and hugged him. She said, "It's okay Abe. It's just a little mark and it will go away soon. Don't cry, I forgive you."
Abe hugged Milly back and was no longer upset. He was happy that Milly had forgiven him and he knew that everything would be all right.




Andy was a very independent little boy. He loved to do things all on his own. He always wanted to drive the truck his dad had in the garage. His Dad said he was not big enough, so he was always sad about that. One day, Andy opened the garage door to find the truck was gone. He was very surprised as he thought it would always be there. He asked his dad if he could go looking for it and his dad said yes.
Andy was so excited that he was able to do something all on his own and off he went. He searched all around the neighbourhood, past the big houses, the tall trees and the green fields. All of a sudden, Andy saw it. The truck was parked at the end of the road. Andy ran all the way to the truck and skipped around it with joy. He then opened the door and sat in the drivers seat. 
He felt proud that he was able to find the truck all by himself and was almost ready to close the door, when he heard a voice. It was his dad! he had been secretly following him, giving him the chance to be independent. When Andy heard the voice, he had the biggest smile on his face and he quickly closed the door. 
Andy's dad said to him, 'Andy, you are a very independent little boy and I'm so proud of you. How about now that you have found it, we can take a drive




Once upon a time there was a boy named Tom. Tom's family lived far away from his goal and it was important for Tom to get there. Tom started walking and walking for days and days. Tom was very tired but he kept going.
He finally arrived at a big lake and saw that he couldn't get to the opposite side. He had to split the lake to get to the other side. He held his breathe, squeezed his eyes shut and he jumped. When he opened his eyes he made it to the other side. He was so happy!
When he got to his goal, his mom was waiting. She hugged him and thanked him for being so brave and working hard to get there. Tom was so proud of himself and he knew it was important for him to never give up. Tom knew he could do anything and the whole experience made him even more determined.



 
Once there was a little girl called Lucy. She was very intelligent and wanted to learn a lot of new things. One day she was playing with her toys when she felt a strange touch on her back and she turned around.
There she saw an ugly creature and it scared her! She felt a wave of fear and quickly ran away from the creature. 
The creature was called an ogre and it was very upset that Lucy had run away. It wanted someone to suffer alongside it and felt lonely and angry. 
The ogre looked around and eventually found a wizard. The wizard wasn't as intelligent as Lucy, but was still quite clever. The ogre asked the wizard to help it. 
The wizard thought about it for a while and then agreed, for he felt sorry for the Ogre and knew it was suffering. So the wizard and the ogre worked together and eventually the ogre was happy again.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very sad. She wanted someone to comfort her. Her family was very poor, so they couldn't buy anything to help her feel better. 
One day, her father found some wood near their house. He decided to carve it into a toy for the little girl. He worked very hard, and the toy looked very nice when he was done! 
The little girl was very happy, and hugged the wooden toy. She hugged it so tightly that the wood started to crack. Before her father could do anything, the toy broke into pieces! 
The little girl felt terrible. She was sadder than before, and she didn't know what to do. She couldn't be comforted, and she cried and felt very alone. 
That was the end of the story. The little girl was never able to find comfort, and her sadness remained terrible forever.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was very friendly and she liked to talk to everyone she saw. She was always very curious. 
One day, she wanted to explore a new place. But it was very far away. Her mom said she couldn't go, so the little girl got angry. 
She found a rope and began to tie one end around her waste. She was going to swing across to the new place! 
Suddenly, her mom noticed and yelled, "Stop! That's dangerous!" The little girl ignored her and started swinging. 
Her mom saw that she was determined, so she said more calmly, "Let me help. I'll tie the rope around the tree, and then you can swing safely." The little girl smiled and hugged her mom. Together they tied the rope around the tree and the girl swung happily to the new place. 
The little girl was very excited and friendly. She talked to all the new people and things she saw. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy who was three years old. She liked to take care of things, like her toys and her pet dog Spike.
One day, Lucy was very sad. Her mom had given her a sour lemon to eat, and she didn't like it. Lucy started to cry, and Spike looked so sad too.
But Spike had a plan to make Lucy feel better. He ran to the kitchen and grabbed a few yummy snacks. He ran back to Lucy and gave them to her. Lucy smiled and hugged Spike, feeling very happy and cared for.
They finished the snacks, and Spike went back to the kitchen to get more. Lucy hugged him again and saw how much he cared for her.
From then on, Lucy and Spike were the best of friends. Even when things were sour, Lucy knew that Spike was always there to take care of her.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Bertha. She was three years old, and loved to play outside. One day, Bertha decided to explore the woods. While she was walking, she found a purple flower. It was very clean, so she decided to pick it.
Suddenly, a big bird came flying. He looked angry and he told Bertha, Hey, give back the flower! Its mine! Bertha hugged the flower tightly and said, No, I wont give it back!
The big bird got very mad and he took the flower away. He flew away, taking the flower with him. Bertha was sad and cried. She had wanted to keep the pretty purple flower.
The end.



Once there was a man who was a fisherman. He loved going out on his boat every day to fish for his dinner. One day he went out on a very rough sea. He felt the boat bouncing up and down and the wind was making a lot of noise. But he knew what to do.
He put his bait in the water and waited. After a while, he felt a tug on his line. He pulled it in and found a big fish! He was so excited because he knew he would have a delicious dinner tonight.
He put his bait back in the water and waited again. Suddenly there was another tug on the line and he pulled in an even bigger fish. He knew that his family would be very happy for such a great catch.
With a big smile on his face, the fisherman went back to shore. He felt very proud that he had known what to do even on the rough sea.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Jack. He loved to look up at the sky and watch the clouds go by. One day, Jack got on a big crane and it started to lift him high up into the sky. He was so excited to be up so high and see the world from above. 
But then something unexpected happened! As the crane kept lifting Jack higher and higher, the sky became dark and a deep storm cloud started to form above him. Lightning flashed across the sky and thunder roared like a lion. Jack was so scared that he started to cry. 
The crane operator tried his best to lower Jack back down to safety, but the storm cloud was too strong. It kept pushing the crane further and further up into the sky until eventually it was impossible to go back. Jack was so far up in the sky and he was never seen again. 
The moral of the story is that no matter how excited you are to explore the world, always be careful of the deep storm clouds.




Once upon a time there was a boy. He was walking through a field one day when he found something heavy. It was a big rock, and the boy wanted to move it. He tried to pick it up but it was too heavy for him. 
He looked around and saw a tiny mouse near him. The boy asked the mouse for help. The mouse agreed and together they started to part the heavy rock. The mouse was so small but he was very strong. Soon the rock was moved. 
The boy thanked the mouse and said goodbye. As he walked away, the boy was very happy he had found the mouse. He never had to part the heavy rock alone.



 
Once upon a time there lived three friends, Joe, Jake, and Molly. Joe and Jake were best friends that enjoyed playing together, and Molly loved to help Joe and Jake decorate their special tree in the forest. The three friends were determined to make the tree the best-decorated tree anyone had ever seen.
One day, when Joe and Jake were out picking pinecones to decorate the tree, they found a mysterious zip on the ground. It was a weak zip, so Joe and Jake wondered what it was. Joe and Jake didn't want to take the zip home, so they left it near the tree and continued picking pinecones.
On the night of the winter solstice, Joe, Jake, and Molly decorated the tree with the pinecones and the mysterious zip. To the friends' surprise, when they fastened the zip to the tree, all the pinecones around it glowed brightly! Joe, Jake, and Molly saw that the weak zip was actually a magical decoration, and they were so excited they all cheered! 
The three friends gave the tree the best decoration ever, and enjoyed the magical view until the sun rose the next morning.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jenny. She was three years old, and she was so enthusiastic about everything. 
One day, Jenny was playing with her doll and eating jam with a spoon. But she accidentally spilt the jam over her doll and its clothes got all sticky. 
Jenny was so upset she started to weep. She shook her head from side to side and tears rolled down her cheeks. 
Her mummy saw what had happened and came to give her a big cuddle. She said, "Don't worry, it's okay". 
Mummy then took the doll away to clean the mess up, and Jenny stopped crying. She was happy again and skipped around the room, feeling enthusiastic about playing with her doll once more. 
The End



John was a little boy who loved to play outside. He saw the sun each day which made the world look clean and happy. One day, John saw a sign for a race. He quit playing and decided to join the race.
It was a long and hard course. After a lot of running, he was tired. But he kept going until he saw the finish line. Even though he was tired, John kept on going until he quit running and crossed the finish line. 
John was a winner! The crowd cheered as he was awarded a medal. Everyone was so proud of him and the medal shone so brightly. Clean and proud, John was ready to go back home.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kitty. She was very adventurous and loved to explore. So one day, her daddy set her off to explore a distant forest.
As Kitty ventured through the forest, she noticed a large chest ahead of her. She thought, This must be so exciting! I wonder what I could find inside!
Kitty ran up to the chest and opened it. But as soon as she opened it, a deep, dark, loud roar came out! She was so scared, she let out a scream and quickly shut the chest.
Dont worry, Kitty, her daddy said. You should never open a chest if you dont know whats inside.
Kitty was so embarrassed she just wanted to go home. But when she turned around to find her dad, he was nowhere to be seen! Kitty was all alone in the distant forest and she was very afraid.
This is what happens when you dont listen to your daddys advice. You never know what you might encounter in a distant forest!



Once upon a time, there was a ship. It was blue and yellow with lots of fun things to do. One day, three friends went for a ride on the ship. They were excited to slide down the big slide.
The first two friends went down the slide quickly, but the third friend was very thoughtful. He thought about which way would be the most fun. After much thinking, the third friend decided to slide down backward. He laughed and giggled all the way down the slide.
When they reached the bottom, the three friends noticed something very exciting. There were lots and lots of colorful balloons! The friends were excited and ran around chasing the balloons.
The friends had lots of fun, but eventually it was time to go. As they said their goodbyes, the friends thanked the thoughtful third friend for choosing the perfect slide. They said goodbye with big hugs and waved as the ship sailed away.




Once there was a little boy who was very eager to explore the world. One day, the boy discovered a big and colorful tunnel. He wanted to go inside the tunnel, but his mom didn't allow it.
Instead, his mom said that he could look from the entrance of the tunnel and see the wonderful colors coming from it. As the boy looked, he saw that the tunnel was full of all sorts of colors: blues, reds, yellows and greens.
The little boy stared and stared at the tunnel, until his mom said it was time to go home. He reluctantly left and promised himself that he would come back and explore more of the colorful tunnel someday soon.




Once upon a time there was a huge fish who was looking for food. He swam up to a little boy and said in a friendly voice, "Wow, I am so hungry! Can you please give me something to eat?"
The little boy was so surprised he could not speak. He just stared at the huge fish. Then he remembered his Mummy telling him never to talk to strangers.
The little boy said, "No, I cant help you. I am sorry."
The huge fish cried out in despair, "Oh please help me! I am so hungry I could die!"
The little boy was very sad. But he bravely said, "I cannot help you. Why don't you find something else to eat?"
Then he started to walk away. But as he did, he stumbled and dropped his lunchbox. All the delicious food inside was now spread across the ground. The little boy started to cry.
The huge fish saw this and hopped up onto the shore. He quickly gathered up all the food and put it back in the lunchbox.
The little boy stopped crying and said, "Thank you so much!"
The huge fish smiled and said, "You're welcome. Now I can go find something else to eat."
And with that, the huge fish happily hopped back into the lake, leaving the little boy feeling very proud of himself.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was going outside to play. She saw something moving near the grass and she bent down to have a closer look.
It was a frog!
The little girl pointed at the frog and said, "Look, a frog!" The frog didn't move. It felt cold.
The little girl was brave. She slowly put her hand near the frog and said, "It's okay little frog." But the frog still didn't move.
The little girl thought for a moment and then she smiled. She said, "I know! I'm going to get you something warm. I'll be right back!"
The little girl went inside and came back with a warm blanket. She gently wrapped the frog in the blanket and soon the frog felt warm and cozy.
The little girl smiled. She said, "There you go little frog. Now you'll be nice and warm."
The frog looked up at the little girl and slowly hopped away.
The little girl smiled and waved goodbye to the frog. She knew the frog was safe and warm.




John was in the bathroom. He liked to observe the bathtub and was so curious about it. One day, he had a bright idea. He thought it would be fun to play in the bathtub, even though he was not allowed. So, he got inside to play. Suddenly, he heard his mother coming and he quickly got out of the bathtub.
His mother saw him and looked very surprised. She asked why he was in the bathtub and he was so ashamed that he did not answer. He knew he had done something wrong and now he was in trouble.
The next day, John's mother came back to the bathtub, but this time she had a surprise for him. She said she would let him play in the bathtub, but only for a little while and he must always listen to her when she told him not to get in. 
John was so happy and jumped in the bathtub. He was no longer ashamed and instead learned an important lesson. He promised his mother that he would always listen to her and only play in the bathtub when she allowed him.




One day, Tom decided to explore the unknown. He had heard about a mysterious hill, so he decided to climb it. When he got to the top, he saw something he couldn't believe. It was a huge pile of yarn!
Tom was so excited. He wanted to take some home with him. So, he started to carefully pick the fluffiest pieces of yarn and put them in his bag.
When he got home, his mom was so happy. She said they could make a blanket together. So, they started working and by the end of the day they had made the warmest and fluffiest blanket ever!



Once upon a time, there was a girl. She wanted to marry. One day she saw a purple thing and thought it was a prince. She went up to it and said, "I want to marry you!" But then the purple thing came alive and started to fly. It was a big, scary nightmare!
The girl screamed and ran away. She was so scared she ran for a long time. Finally, she stopped under a big, old tree. She was safe.
The girl never wanted to marry again. She remembered the nightmare and the purple colour of it. From then on, the girl was always careful to look twice before she made a wish to marry.




One day, Melvin was in the store with his mom. He noticed a beautiful jacket in the window with bright stripes. He asked his mom if he could have it, but she said no and reminded him to never forget his own jacket in the car. Melvin was sad, but he was a wise kid so he agreed. 
When Melvin and his mom got to their car, Melvin realized that he had forgotten his own jacket in the car! His mom laughed and shook her head. She explained that Melvin should have listened to her advice to never forget his own jacket. 
The next day, Melvin and his mom went back to the store. To Melvin's surprise, his mom bought him the bright stripe jacket he liked so much. Melvin was so excited! She reminded him again not to forget his jacket, but this time he really remembered. 
From then on, every time Melvin remembered not to forget his jacket, he would smile fondly at the stripe jacket. He was so wise to learn his lesson and so grateful for the special jacket his mom gave him.




Mummy was very serious. She lifted Tommy up and set him in his chair. Then she said, "We need to play a game."
Tommy didn't like serious games. He shook his head. He said, "No, I don't want to play a game!" 
Mummy looked serious. She said, "Yes, we must play a game. It's time to learn some new things."
Tommy still didn't want to play. He started to cry. He said, "No! I don't want to!"
Mummy looked at Tommy. She said, "It'll be fun, I promise. We'll play a game and you'll learn new things."
Tommy stopped crying and lifted his head. He said, "Okay, I'll play the game."
Mummy smiled. She said, "Alright, let's get started!" 
Tommy and Mummy played the game. After a while, Tommy realized he was having fun. He was learning new things and it was exciting!



It was a dry day. Mommy and Baby were walking through the park. Baby saw a big station and wanted to go in. 
"Can we get inside, Mommy," asked Baby. 
"No, Baby. We can't go in," said Mommy. 
The station was big and had lots of windows. Some of the windows were open and the door was closed. Baby stared at the station, wondering what was inside. 
"Why is the station closed, Mommy?" asked Baby. 
"We can't go inside because the station is closed," said Mommy.
"Why is it closed, Mommy?" asked Baby. 
"The station is closed because it's not open for visitors today," said Mommy. Baby and Mommy kept walking. The station looked empty and dry. 
"Maybe it will open soon," Baby said, smiling. 
Mommy smiled and hugged Baby tight.




Joey was a young boy who wanted to stretch his legs and explore the world, but he knew he'd have to wait. Every day, he would look out his window at the factory down the street. After days and days of waiting, Joey was finally ready. He put on his shoes and quietly stepped outside.
He slowly crept down the street, taking in the sights and sounds of the factory. It was tall and loud, but the walls seemed gentle and kind. He wanted to explore more, but he was a little scared. Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was a kind voice that said, "Come, Little One. I will show you something special inside."
Joey couldn't believe it -- he was being invited inside! He slowly walked in, feeling a little brave. When he stepped inside, he was amazed. Inside the factory was a group of people stretching and exercising together. Joey smiled to himself and eagerly joined in. He felt so happy to be able to stretch his legs and explore this world with new friends.




One day, Lola was smiling as she sat at the piano. She had been learning to play it for a couple of months. Lola had been wanting to play the piano since she saw Mama play it one day. Mama always smiled so much when she was playing the piano.
Suddenly, Lola heard Mama's voice coming from the other room. "Come quick, Lola. You must see something," Mama said. Lola ran down the hallway to find Mama looking at an old black piano. "It's for you, Lola," Mama said. Lola was so excited that she started smiling even bigger than before.
However, when Lola tried to play the black piano, it was not as easy as it was with the other piano. She felt so frustrated that she wanted to cry. Mama said, "It's okay, Lola. You just need practice and soon you will be able to play it just as good as you can play the other piano."
So Lola practiced for some days and the black piano started to sound better. She smiled as she played and soon it sounded just as good as the other piano.
Mama came by to listen to Lola and smiled proudly. "I knew you could do it, Lola," Mama said. Lola smiled and continued to play the black piano, feeling happy and proud.




Billy saw his red wagon outside, and he was so excited! He asked his mom if he could take it outside to play. His mom said yes, and soon he was off, with his wagon in tow.
As Billy pulled the wagon outside, he heard someone calling him. He looked up and saw his neighbor, Mr. Benson. He asked Billy if he wanted to come join him and his dog for a walk. Billy said yes.
Billy and Mr. Benson started walking, but it was harder for Billy to pull the wagon along with them. Soon, he was really tired. He wanted to keep going, but he almost couldn't make it.
Mr. Benson realized how tired Billy was and told him to put his wagon in the back of his car. Billy gratefully accepted the offer and got in the car to rest. They drove around, with Billy's wagon watching them from the back of the car.
Billy was so happy to have made it to the end of the walk. He thanked Mr. Benson for helping him along and hugged his wagon goodbye. Then he hopped out of the car and ran back home, ready to take his wagon out again the next day.



Tuesday was a sad day for Tommy as he dropped his favorite toy on the floor. As Tommy tried to pick it up, it sharped - he had cut himself! Tommy started to cry. His mom tried to comfort him, saying: "It's okay, Tommy! Let's go get a band-aid. That will make it all better." 
But no matter how much his mom tried to help, Tommy was still sad. On the way to the store, they passed by the pet shop and Tommy saw a puppy in the window. He was so excited. He asked his mom if they could get the puppy, but his mom said they had to keep going and get the band-aid first. Tommy was so disappointed. 
When Tommy and his mom arrived back home, Tommy quickly ran to the window to look for the puppy. But it was gone. Tommy was so sad and started to cry. His mom tried to console him and told him that the puppy had gone to find a new home. 
But the sad ending just made Tommy feel worse. He would never see the puppy ever again. He knew he couldn't get it back and he just wanted his favorite toy. He cried and cried until he fell asleep.



Once upon a time, there were two little birds who lived in a nice big tree. They lived happily and sang together every day.
One day, the two birds saw a shiny circle in the sky. They were curious. They decided to peek up and see what it was.
When the birds poked their little heads out of the tree, they were amazed to see the moon. It was so beautiful and important!
The two birds learned a lesson that day. They knew from then on that it was important to peek up once in a while to see what special things were in the sky.




Once upon a time, there was a weird little gold box. No one knew where it came from, but lots of kids wanted to play with it. 
Whenever somebody picked it up, the box would start to fold itself up. It was a magical box! 
The kids had so much fun with the box, but soon, they got a little bored of it. Then, one day, they remembered something they could do with it. They could make it into a house! 
So, they started to fold the box into different shapes and houses. And it kept folding and folding until it was a really big castle! 
The kids laughed and had fun playing and exploring their castle, and even though nobody knew where the weird gold box had come from, they all knew that everything was better when they had it and that theyd never forget it- it was the best box ever. The End.




It was a normal day, and the little girl was out playing. She noticed her neighbor, who was usually so full of joy, looking very sad. She felt a bit helpless and wanted to do something to help them. She found the courage to walk up to the neighbor and asked, "What's wrong?"
The neighbor replied, "Nothing." But the little girl knew something was wrong and could see that they were weeping. She gave the neighbor a big hug and said, "It's okay, you can tell me."
The neighbor then took a deep breath and looked up into the little girl's eyes. "My yogurt is gone! I left it on the kitchen counter and my dog ate it." The neighbor was very sad, so the little girl decided then and there to try and get some yogurt for the neighbor.
The little girl ran off and searched for the yogurt. She searched high and she searched low, but to no avail. After a few hours, she was feeling very helpless and was about to give up, when she stumbled across a yogurt cart in the park. She quickly ran over and bought the yummiest Yogurt she had ever seen. 
The little girl ran all the way back to her neighbor's house, yogurt in hand. Upon seeing the yogurt, the neighbor's face lit up and they gave the little girl a big hug.
The little girl and the neighbor shared the yogurt and laughed until the




Once there was a shy girl named Jazz. She wanted to manage her life, but was always too scared to do anything. She wanted to try different things, but was always too shy.
One day she decided to try something new and brave and began to explore the world. But everything she tried ended poorly and she became even more scared and shy.
Finally, she decided to try something completely new like playing jazz. She loved the sound and the freedom it gave her. But unfortunately, the unfamiliarity scared her and she couldn't manage to control her fear. The more she tried to play jazz, the more scared she became and she eventually had to give up.
Unfortunately, because of her fear, Jazz never managed to find success in her journey. She was always too shy and scared to take any risks, so she never managed to reach her full potential.




Once upon a time there was a field. It was a nice, comfortable field with lots of grass and sunshine.
One day, something special happened in the field. A group of animals came to play. First, two rabbits hopped around. Then, a fox ran in. Next, a squirrel showed up and then a bird flew in.
The animals were happy and comfortable together in the field. They played tag, chased each other and ate yummy picnic food.
But after a while, the animals knew it was time to go. They said goodbye and each animal went their separate way. 
The animals had a really fun time in the field, and they learned that its nice to be together.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Jessie. She was very cute. One day she went to work with her mom. At work, Jessie saw a sweater she liked. It was orange and had a funny cat on it. 
Jessie wanted the sweater, but she didn't have enough money. Her mom saw how much Jessie wanted it. So she worked extra hard to make enough money to buy the sweater. 
Finally, her mom made enough money to buy the sweater for Jessie. When Jessie saw it, she was so excited. She put it on right away and ran around the room showing everyone her new sweater. Everyone said it looked so cute on her! 
After that, Jessie wore her sweater all the time. She even took it with her when she went to work with her mom. Now everywhere Jessie and her mom go, Jessie wears her new sweater and shows it off with a smile on her face.




Once there was a boy, who was only three years old. He had a big day, and he wanted to remember it. 
He started his morning with a smooth banana. After that he put on his smooth shoes and went outside. There were lots of questions that he wanted to ask. He wanted to know why the clouds were so fluffy, and why the birds were so happy. 
So he asked his mum as many questions as he could. She answered them all and he felt very content. 
At the end of the day, he remembered all the things he had done and all the questions he had asked. It was a great day for him. He was happy he had remembered.




Once upon a time, there was an infant named Jack. He often played with his friends, and was always the first to join in the fun. One day, Jack decided to try something different. He wanted to add something new to the regular game. 
But when Jack's friends found out, they were not happy. They thought it wasn't fair. They had been playing the same way since they were toddlers and they didn't want to change it now. 
Jack was quite sad. His friends had always let him join in before. So he tried to explain his idea to them, "I just wanted to add something extra so it would be more fun for all of us." 
His friends thought about this for a while and eventually agreed that Jack's idea could make the game even better. So they decided to give it a try.
Jack was happy again. In the end, his friends realized it was ok to try something new. That made the game fun and interesting. 
Moral of the story: it is ok to add something different to a regular routine, as long as it doesn't hurt anyone.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Bella. Bella loved clapping her hands. She would clap them together as she danced around her house.
One day, Bella was playing in the kitchen. She found a special fork. It was shiny and new, so she decided to keep it.
Bella sat down in a chair and started to play with the fork. Suddenly, a smelly smell came from the fork. Bella covered her nose and jumped away from the chair.
She looked carefully at the fork again. This time, she noticed that something was stuck in the prongs. She carefully pulled out a smelly cheese.
Bella laughed, and then clapped her hands. She threw the smelly cheese away and kept the special fork. And she lived happily ever after!




Once there was a bear called Benny. He was a kind and friendly bear that loved eating honey. One day Benny went for a walk in the woods. He was enjoying the warm sunshine until he saw something in the dirt. It was a battery!
Benny picked it up and he felt very guilty. He had no idea how the battery got there. Benny decided to do the right thing and bury the battery in the soft ground. He dug a hole and carefully put the battery in. He filled the hole up with dirt and said goodbye to it.
As Benny went home he felt relieved. He knew he had done the right thing and that made him feel good. Even though he felt guilty, he was sure that he had done the right thing. Benny was glad his deed was done.




The poor boy wept. He had found a skull in his backyard and wasn't sure what to do. He wondered why someone had left the skull there and what it meant.
He picked the skull up and examined it closely. He sighed, still feeling sad and confused. He wanted to make sure the skull was taken care of, so he carefully put it back down.
The poor boy continued to weep. He did not know what to do with the skull. Was it a sign? He just wanted to know why it was there.
He decided to go to his mom and ask him what he should do. His mom told him to bury the skull in the ground and to pray for the person the skull belonged to. The poor boy felt comforted and said a prayer before burying the skull. 
The boy felt better after burying the skull. He no longer wept. Instead, he was filled with an understanding that everything happens for a reason and that the skull had been given to him for a reason.




One day, Bob saw something amazing. In the sky, he saw a giant oak tree. The oak tree was tall and strong, with wide branches and a thick trunk. Bob was in awe and could not look away from the oak tree. 
Bob wanted to get closer to the tree, so he decided to climb. He was brave and determined, so nothing could stop him. Bob was about to climb the tree when he heard a loud rumble. Suddenly, everything began to change.
The ground shook and the wind blew fiercely. Bob was alert and scared, so he quickly climbed down from the tree. Standing on the ground, Bob watched as the oak tree changed from a majestic state to a pile of rubble. 
Bob was shocked and confused, but he also felt a sense of awe. He knew that the oak tree was gone, but he was thankful that he had the chance to see it and experience its beauty before it changed.




Once upon a time there was a dog named Max. He was a very happy pup and liked to bark and play all day.
Max was walking in the park one day when he saw an old man making a cake. The man was using a mixer to mix all the ingredients together.
Max started to bark loudly and the man became very angry. He shouted at Max in a very rude way.
Max was too scared to stay any longer and ran away as fast as he could. He rushed and rushed until he was safe at home.
Max's mom asked what had happened, and Max told her the story. She said, "It's never ok to be so rude, but if you see the old man again, just remember to stay away and hurry home!"




Once upon a time, there was a family that loved to organize fun outings. They would plan really fun activities, like picnicking or going to the playground. One day, the family decided to organize a kayaking trip. Everyone was excited!
The day of the trip finally arrived. Everyone put on their life jackets and hopped into their kayaks. They spent the morning paddling around the lake. Everything seemed so peaceful and harmless.
As the day went on, the family noticed something strange. A big storm was brewing in the distance. The family started to worry. Fortunately, they could see land. So they all quickly organized themselves and paddled back to shore. Just in time too, because soon afterwards the storm passed and everyone was safe.




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Anna and Joe. They were playing together in the garden when Anna spotted something between the trees.
"Look Joe! Look what I found," she squealed. 
Joe ran over and saw a tiny skull. He felt helpless. 
"What is it, Anna?" he asked. 
"Don't worry, Joe," Anna said cheerfully. "It's just a skull. Let's twist it!"
So, they each grabbed one of the skull's big eyes and twisted it. 
The skull's head spun around, round and round! Anna and Joe laughed and laughed. 
"Let's do it again!" Anna said. So they twisted the skull's head again and again, until they had to go home. 
As they left, Anna and Joe felt happy. They had each made a new, special friend that day.




Once upon a time there was a mommy and daddy who loved each other very much. One day they decided to go on a trip. So they got in their car and drove away.
When they got to where they were going, they felt something very important. It was a veil. Mommy and Daddy looked at it and felt it was special. So they brought it home with them.
When they got home, Mommy and Daddy put the veil in a very special place in their home. They wanted to make sure the veil stayed safe and important.
Every day Mommy and Daddy would go and look at the veil. It reminded them of their special trip. Even though it had been a long time, they still remembered it and felt its importance.



Once upon a time, there was a playful boy called Jack. He had a big garden with lots of things to play with, including a big hose. Everyday, Jack would take the hose and run around the garden sprinkling it all around.
One day, Jack saw something special in the garden. It was a big box, with a funny-looking thing inside. Jack opened the box and saw it was a rubber duck! He was so excited. He took the duck and started rubbing it against his cheek. 
Suddenly, the hose came to life! It started squirting water and Jack laughed so much. Jack and the hose played together, spraying each other with water until they were both completely soaked. 
Jack and the hose became great friends. Everyday, they would play in the garden using the hose and having lots of fun. 
The End.




Once upon a time there was a big, wide mountain. It was so big and tall and the sides were so steep that no one could climb it.
One day a little girl decided to try her luck. She made sure to take it very easy and let the mountain take its time. She took one slow step after the other and before long she was at the top.
When the little girl reached the top, she was amazed. From that wide and high spot, she could see the whole world for miles around. She was filled with joy, and she knew she could never forget the view she saw today.
The little girl was so happy that she decided to let others enjoy the same feeling she had. She started to shout at the top of her voice, Come climb the big wide mountain and see whats on the other side. Its easy!
And thats how the little girl, who was brave and kind, helped everyone to enjoy the same thing she had seen.




Once there was a friendly little kangaroo. She used to play in the big, green park every day. One day, she decided to go on an adventure and explore the park.
The kangaroo saw a big tree and thought it would be fun to climb it. So she hopped to the trunk, and started to climb. Up and up she went, until she reached the top. From up there she could see the whole park. She felt so successful!
But while she was basking in the view, her foot slipped and she fell all the way down. Luckily, there was a big, soft cushion nearby that the kangaroo fell on. She was so happy to have landed safely on the cushion, and she decided to stay there for a while and admire the view from her spot on the cushion. She had a wonderful time exploring the park.




Once there was a boy who loved to play outside. Every day the boy wanted new toys to play with. One day his mom took him to a store to buy a toy. But the toy was very cheap. The boy was disappointed and wanted to bury it.
So the boy went to the backyard and dug a deep hole. He put the toy in the hole and covered it under the dirt. After he was done, he thought about how much fun he would have playing with his new toy.
But then a few days later, the toy was gone. The boy was very sad and looked everywhere. He never found it. He guessed the toy must have been too cheap and it just disappeared. The boy was disappointed and never bought another cheap toy again.




Once there was a little boy named Jim. He was three years old and he loved going outside to explore.
Jim was playing in his garden and spotted a long, thin worm. "Look, a worm!" he shouted. Jim picked up the worm carefully and walked over to the grassy area nearby.
He stretched the worm out and said, "hello, worm. What are you doing?" The worm stretched right back and said nothing.
Jim smiled and said, "let's play tug-of-war. I'll pull tight and you pull tight." So Jim pulled the worm as tight as he could and the worm pulled back even tighter!
They stayed like that for a while until Jim let go. The worm coiled up and wriggled away. Jim smiled and decided to go explore something else.



 
Once upon a time there was a baby bird that got very nervous. The bird needed to find a new home. Everyone told him to go find an oat inside a tree.
But the bird didnt know how. He was too scared to make the trip. He decided to ask his mom for advice.
Mommy, the bird said. Im nervous to go find an oat in the tree. Will you help me?
Im sorry, sweetheart, his mom said. I cant go with you, but I know someone who can. Fly over to Farmer Johns field. He will help you find a new home.
So, the bird flew to Farmer Johns field. Farmer John was very kind. He gave the bird an oat and said, This should replace your old home.
The bird was so happy! He thanked Farmer John and flew home with his new oat. Now he never has to get nervous about finding a new home again.




Once upon a time, a little girl went to the zoo. She was so excited to see all the animals. Suddenly, she saw a big dinosaur. It was loud and giant. She got scared and a bit frightened.
The dinosaur said, Come here. I want to show you something. The little girl was scared, but she came closer. The dinosaur asked her, Do you want to order some food with me? The little girl was surprised. She thought, Dinosaurs can order food?.
She nodded and said, Yes, I want to order some food with you. The dinosaur asked her what she wanted. She said, I want an ice cream and some chips. The dinosaur smiled and ordered the food.
The little girl was so happy! She was no longer frightened of the dinosaur. They ate the food together and then waved goodbye.




Once there was a girl called Anna who was very tidy. She liked to clean and keep everything in order. But one day she forgot something important.
Anna had a horrible nightmare that night, but when she woke up she couldn't remember what it was. She was sad and scared because it was something she was afraid of.
Anna felt better when the sun came up and she decided to clean her room to help forget her nightmare. She tidied her toys and put everything in order. 
However, when Anna was finished she suddenly remembered what her nightmare was about. She had forgotten to close the window the night before and now there were bugs all over the floor. Anna was very sad and no amount of tidying could help her forget her nightmare.




Mum was out shopping when she heard a voice calling from behind her.
"Mum! Mum!"
She turned around and saw a young child running towards her. It was her daughter, Clara. 
Mum smiled and said, "Hello, my little one. Why are you running so fast?"
Clara replied, "I had to find you! I was out in the park playing when some old people asked if I wanted to join them. They said they would teach me something, but I knew I should come and find you first."
Mum nodded. "You made the right decision. Speaking to strangers and going off with them can be dangerous. Let's go home and we can talk there."
The pair arrived home and Mum talked to Clara about the importance of safety. She explained that it was better to delay and think before speaking to strangers. 
"Remember," Mum said, "even though you are young, you can help keep yourself and others safe from danger." 
Clara looked up with a smile, "Okay!" she said. As the two hugged, Clara felt proud of her decision to delay before talking to the old people.



Sam and his mom went to the store. Sam wanted to bring a pen. But his mom said "No! Pens are too dangerous for little kids, like you." Sam was a bit sad, but he listened to his mom and didn't bring a pen. 
On the way home, Sam had an idea. He whispered to his mom, "What if we make a pen? Then it won't be dangerous." His mom was impressed and they decided to try it at home. 
When they got home, Sam and his mom looked for things to make a pen. They got some paper and foam and started crafting. After a few minutes, they made a pen! Sam was so excited and wanted to try it. 
His mom said, "Look at us! We made a safe pen! Now, you can use it without something dangerous happening!" Sam smiled, because he was so happy to bring his very own safe pen!




The clown was at the playground. She was very happy and wanted to play. She jumped and danced around, while the other children laughed and smiled.
Suddenly the clown noticed a little girl who was angry. She had tears in her eyes. The clown stopped dancing and asked the girl, "Why are you so angry?"
The little girl sobbed, "My mom and dad are arguing. I want them to be happy like you." 
The clown hugged the girl. She smiled and said, "It's ok to be sad sometimes. Just know that even when it feels like things will never get better, your parents love you and will remain together for you".
The girl hugged the clown back. She smiled a little. She knew that her parents would remain together. The clown cheered her up and the girl went home feeling happier.




Once there was a little girl. Every year she would go to the park and drop her food in the park for the birds to eat. She was so unselfish and kind to the birds. 
One day, a naughty boy saw her. He thought it was not fair that she was so unselfish and wanted to keep the food for himself. He followed her to the park and started dropping his food too. 
The little girl was very surprised. She asked the naughty boy why he was dropping his food. He wouldn't answer and just continued to drop the food. 
The little girl quickly realized that the naughty boy was very selfish. She said, "You should share your food with the birds. That is the kind thing to do." 
The naughty boy then realized that it was not nice to be selfish, and he started to share his food with the birds too. The birds were so happy! From that day on, the little girl and the naughty boy both dropped their food in the park every year so that the birds could eat.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very confused. Her friend was always making her feel bad.
One day, the little girl decided to go for a walk and explore. She found a cave, so she went inside. The cave was dark, but it was also peaceful.
The little girl stayed in the cave for a while, and she thought about how her friend had been treating her. She thought that maybe she could do something to improve the situation.
So, the next day, the little girl smiled at her friend and was nicer to her. Amazingly, her friend began to smile back, and their relationship soon became much better.
The little girl learned an important lesson that day. By being kind to others and improving our relationships, we can be happier and less confused.




Once upon a time, there was a boy called John. He wanted to go look for an adventure. One day, he entered a huge and scary forest. As he walked around, he saw something amazing - a castle with a sparkly door! He couldn't wait to explore it. 
John opened the door carefully and he entered the castle. It was dark and silent inside. He kept walking until he saw something sparkly. It was a treasure chest! He was so excited! 
John opened the chest and found some toys inside. He played with them for a bit. But after a while, he got bored. He started to wonder if there was something else in the castle. He kept walking and he eventually found a room full of animals! He thought they were so cool! 
John spent the whole day playing with the animals. He was so happy and excited. After a while, John knew he had to go home. He said goodbye to the animals, and left the castle. Even though his adventure was over, John had the best time and can't wait to go explore more!




One day, Lorry and her mommy were walking outside in the bright sunshine. Lorry squinted and smiled as the sun shone down on them. As they walked, Lorry saw something sparkly up ahead. She ran forward and stopped in front of a pond. The pond was full of finger finger fishes, each with a bright, rainbow-colored tail. 
Lorry grinned and bent down, her face close to the clear water. Suddenly, one of the fishes swam up to the surface and smiled back at her.
Hi there, little fish! Lorry said, waving her little finger at him. Do you want to be my friend? 
The fish nodded smiling, and they talked and laughed together until they had to go inside. Lorry hugged the fish goodbye and waved until it disappeared into the depths of the pond. Then, still smiling, she skipped back home.



Once upon a time, there was a kind man who loved to play in the rain. He wore a crown that made him feel special. One day, he wanted to have extra fun, so he ran outside in the rain and started to jump around. He was so excited that he forgot it was raining so hard. Suddenly, he felt his crown getting very wet and dirty. When he looked at it, it was soaked in water and covered in mud. The man was sad and felt silly for getting so wet and dirty. 
He remembered something his mother had said to him - to never give up. So he decided to make the best of the situation and went back outside to play in the rain. He ran and laughed and let the rain soak him. He smiled when he felt the water and enjoyed the special moment. 
When the rain stopped and he went inside, the kind man cleaned his crown gently. He was so happy to see it sparkle like it did before. He took off his crown and put it away for a special day. 
The man learned that day that its ok to get a bit wet and dirty, as long as he was having fun!



Once there was a large sailor who went to sea in his boat. He had all the supplies he needed and he was ready to set sail.
 He opened the sail and it began to move with the wind. The sailor smiled as he felt the wind on his face.
The sailor sailed past tall mountains, small islands, and sparkling oceans. He saw all sorts of creatures in the water. He watched as dolphins and sharks swam around his boat. The sailor smiled as he realized how small he was in comparison to the grand ocean. 
Suddenly, the sailor spotted a large island. He was so excited and quickly sailed towards it. When he reached the island, he opened the sail and jumped onto the shore. He eagerly looked around the island to explore. He found secret caves and hidden treasures. He also found lots of fruit and colourful seashells. 
The sailor was so happy to have gone on his voyage and explore the large island. He was sure to never forget this adventure and continue to explore the seas.




John was a busy little boy. He had a lot of jobs to do in his day. But he liked to delay. He enjoyed sitting quietly and taking his time.
One day, John's mom said, "John, you need to get all your jobs done today!" John knew he needed to get it done, but he still wanted to delay.
John worked hard all morning on his jobs. When it came to the afternoon, he wanted to take a break. He wanted to rest and delay, but he pushed on.
Finally, John finished all his jobs. He was so proud, but exhausted. He was glad that he did not delay or else he never would have finished his work. John learned that day that if he finished his jobs on time, he could still have some time to relax and enjoy the quiet.




A little boy was walking in a park. He saw a big balloon hidden behind some trees. He was so excited that he ran to get it. He grabbed the balloon, but it was too hard for him to hold. The balloon suddenly quit and floated up into the sky. He was so sad because he wanted the balloon. He looked up and saw it get smaller and smaller in the sky until it was gone. He was sad, but then he heard a noise. He heard a crunching sound and realized that something was hidden behind the trees. He went to investigate, and he found a lot of colorful balloons! He was so happy, and he grabbed all the balloons that he could carry and went back home. He was so excited to show his family the hidden balloons.




Once there was a snail called Snoopy who lived in the garden. Snoopy was always very cheerful, even though he didn't have much to do!
That was until one day when he found one of the prunes from the prune tree. Opinions in the garden were split; should the prune be eaten or not?
Snoopy decided to take matters into his own hands and released the prune. Everyone in the garden cheered at his brave decision!
Snoopy continued to release prunes from the tree, spreading joy and happiness throughout the garden. Everyone was overjoyed and thanked Snoopy for his generosity. 
Ever since then, it has been known that the garden is a very cheerful place, all thanks to Snoopy and his prunes!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Mary who was lively like no one else. She always asked a lot of questions and wanted to know why things worked the way they did.
One day, Mary asked her mom why her body was changing. Mama smiled at her and began to explain that as she grew, her body was changing so she could do more things.
Mama told her that as she kept her body healthy and lively by eating healthy food and being active, she could do amazing things.
Mama also explained that when she was happy and feeling lively, she could do all of the activities she wanted to do, like running and leaping!
Mary smiled as she learned that by taking care of her body, she could do anything she wanted. 
The moral of the story is that when you take care of your body, it will help you accomplish amazing things. So keep it healthy, lively and happy!




Once upon a time there was a large skeleton who wanted to go for a drive. He got in his car and started the engine. The skeleton was so excited he waved at everyone he passed by. People were a little scared at first, but eventually they started smiling and waving back at him. 
The skeleton went all around the town, and enjoyed seeing all the different things. He saw a castle, a large park and a zoo full of animals. Everywhere he went, people would smile and wave at him.
