Suddenly, the skeleton decided to take a break from driving. He stopped at a park and had a picnic with some of the friendly animals. After that, he got back in his car and continued his drive. 
The skeleton saw a lot of amazing things during his drive. When night fell, he was tired but very happy. He went back home and thanked everyone for making the day so special for him.




There was a little girl named Sadie who liked to lift cubes. Sadie liked to lift all kinds of cubes - big ones, small ones, red ones and blue ones. One day, she found a special cube. It was small and easy to lift. 
Sadie carefully lifted the cube and discovered something inside. It was a toy train! Sadie was so excited. She lifted the cube over and over again to play with the toy train. 
Sadie played with the cube and the train all morning. But eventually, she had to stop to go to lunch. She carefully lifted the cube and put the train back inside, then put the cube back where she had found it.
The next day, Sadie went back to find the cube. She found it again, and with an easy lift, discovered that it held another surprise - a stuffed bear! Sadie smiled as she lifted the cube, ready to start playing with her new toy.




Once upon a time there was an elderly cactus living in the desert. Every morning the cactus would stand in the sunlight, as vibrant as ever. One day, while the cactus was standing in the sun, a little three-year-old boy came running over to it. The little boy looked up at the cactus and said, "Hi, can I throw a rock at you?"
The cactus looked down at the little boy and said, "No, you may not throw rocks at me. That is not very nice!"
The little boy thought for a moment and then said, "How about if I throw a flower?"
The cactus thought that sounded much better, so he said, "Yes, that would be much nicer. Thank you!"
So the little boy plucked a flower from the desert floor and threw it at the cactus. It landed right at the cactus's feet and the little boy smiled.
The cactus thanked the little boy and said, "Anytime you'd like to throw a flower at me, I'm here for you!"
The little boy smiled and then ran back home to tell his friends all about his exciting adventure with the elderly cactus.



Once upon a time there was a brave girl called Amy. She was three years old and loved to explore. One day she took a walk in the woods near her house and stumbled across a beautiful lake.
Amy was brave and so she decided to go it alone and explore the lake. She carefully walked around the edge, admiring the sparkly water and watching the fish swimming. She could even see a huge frog jumping out of the water.
Suddenly, Amy stumbled and fell into the lake and all she could do was yell for help. Fortunately, her mother was walking nearby and came to help her. She jumped in and carried the brave little girl out of the lake and back home.
Amy was so thankful for her brave mother and by the end of the day, both of them were happily dried off and ready for a warm hug.




One day, Bob was walking through the forest, looking for adventure. Suddenly, he heard a loud call. Bob looked around, but he could not see anyone. Now he was really curious, and he followed the call until he found a humble bird.
The bird said, "Please help me, my eye is hurt!" Bob wanted to help, so he bent down to take a closer look. Just then, a lion came by and roared.
"Let's get out of here!" Bob said. He and the bird quickly ran away, but it was too late. The lion chased them and soon he caught the bird.
The lion devoured the bird and then growled at Bob. Bob was so scared that he ran away as fast as he could and never looked back. He would never forget this terrible ending.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Tim. Tim lived near a pond and one day he decided to go and have a look at it. When he got there he saw a big, noisy frog swimming in the pond. Suddenly, the frog jumped up and made a really loud splash! Tim was very excited, so he ran to the edge of the pond to see what was happening.
When he looked closer, he saw a tiny spider near the water. It was dancing about and making little splashes in the water. Tim laughed - it was so funny! The spider was having so much fun.
Tim wanted to join in, so he ran in and made a big splash. The frog was so startled it hopped away! Tim laughed and laughed until he was too tired to splash anymore. He lay down in the grass and watched the little spider having fun in the water.




Two friends named Jack and Jill were playing together in the garden. Jack was excited, because he saw a flame in the sky. He called to Jill and showed her the flame, and she was also very excited. They both ran over to the flame and started clapping their hands. They watched the flame move around in the sky, changing shape and color as it flew. 
Then, suddenly, a voice called out from above and a big eagle flew down and landed in front of them. Jill was so scared, but Jack was still excited. He stepped closer and patted the eagle's head. The eagle looked at them both and then flew away. Jack and Jill watched it until it was out of sight. They both laughed and smiled, knowing they had just seen something special. 
They held hands and ran back to the garden, still talking about the flame in the sky. They were both so excited about their adventure.




Once upon a time, there was a fish named Bob. Bob was very smart but he often got into trouble. One day, he swam into a net and got stuck. He was scared and didn't know what to do.
A bird named Lucy saw Bob and wanted to help him. She flew down and carefully untangled the net. Bob thanked Lucy and she gave him a happy smile.
Bob was so thankful that he wanted to do something nice for Lucy. He knew she liked to eat berries and noticed that there was a tree with lots of them. He used his smart brain to figure out a way to get the berries down. He put the net underneath the tree and Lucy hopped up and shook it. The berries fell right into the net!
Lucy thanked Bob and the two became great friends. Whenever Lucy needed help, Bob would use his smart brain to think of a way. And whenever Bob needed help, Lucy would be right by his side.



 
"Come and see!" Timmy exclaimed as he watched his momma setting up a tent in the backyard. He clapped with joy as he watched her secure the last bit. "This night is gonna be so fun!"
Timmy and his momma slept in the tent that night and Timmy had never felt so excited before. As the long night stretched on, the sounds outside seemed to grow louder. A mysterious sound filled up the air and Timmy started to feel a bit scared.
Momma, noticing his fear said, "Don't worry Timmy. I'm here to save you from anything that may be scary." She grabbed her flashlight and went outside.
A few minutes later, Momma came back carrying a big, furry creature in her arms. "See? I saved him from being outside in the dark." She smiled.
Timmy watched in awe as Momma instead handed the furry creature a blanket and placed it inside the tent with them. He felt reassured and wonderfully safe. That scary sound that he'd heard earlier was only the sound of Momma saving a new friend.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was so anxious to try something new, but she was also a bit scared. She wanted to try to stand on her knee. It looked so tricky, but she wanted to try.
Every day she asked her mom and dad, "Please can I try to stand on my knee?" But her parents said no.
One day she was playing by herself. She was looking at her knee and wanted to try so hard. Suddenly she had an idea. She asked her teddy bear, "Please can I stand on my knee?" The teddy bear said yes!
The little girl was so excited. She was a bit anxious, but she took a deep breath and tried. At first it was tricky, but she kept trying and trying until finally she could do it! Her parents were so proud of her.
From then on, she would practice standing on her knee every day. She had so much fun and wasn't anxious anymore.




Once upon a time, there was a very hot town. In the hot town, two friends named Timmy and Henry were playing.
"Let's laugh and clap!" said Timmy.
"OK!" said Henry, and they both laughed and clapped.
"Let's clap some more!" cheered Henry, and they laughed and clapped again.
Then, one day, Timmy had a great idea. He said to Henry,
"Let's make everyone in town clap and laugh!"
Henry was very excited and they started to plan. They asked everyone they knew to join in and soon, all the people in the town were ready to clap and laugh.
On the day of the big event, everybody gathered in the town square. It was very hot, but everyone was very excited. Timmy stood up in front of the people.
"Let's make a happy song for our town!" said Timmy.
The people began to clap and sing. Everyone in the town was so happy. They began to applaud and cheer. All the people never felt so happy before. 
Timmy smiled at Henry. They had done it - something that nobody else had done in a hot town like this.




Once there was a small boy named Jack. He loved to spend time playing in his backyard. One day he saw something funny. There was a small square in the grass! Jack was very excited, so he ran inside to get his mom. He asked her to help him dig the square out of the ground.
So they spent the afternoon digging the square out of the dirt. Jack was so happy to find it and they spent lots of time playing together.
But then something bad happened. Jack's mom said they had to leave the square behind. Jack was very upset and he didn't want to go. He asked his mom to take the square with them, but she said no.
So Jack's mom took him away, and reluctantly he left the square behind. He was sad, but he eventually forgot about it. He and his mom went back to playing in the backyard, and all was well again.




One bright day, Timmy was walking in the park. He felt the warm sunshine on his back and the gentle breeze rustling his hair.
All of a sudden, Timmy noticed a buckling spinning in a distant spot in the park. He was curious and excited, so he ran to it.
When he got closer, he found that it was a big wheel, spinning and spinning. Timmy was so excited that he wanted to get on it! He asked his mom for help and she carefully strapped him in.
The wheel spun him around and around, faster and faster. The wind blew through his hair and he squealed with delight. He felt so happy and free! 
When the wheel stopped spinning, Timmy had a huge smile on his face. He couldn't wait to get back on the spinning buckling again!




Emma was gazing out of her window when she saw a curious case in her neighbor's garden. She was intrigued and decided to take a closer look. She went out of her house and crossed the street to the neighbor's house cautiously. 
When she got close, she saw a big, hard box with a lock attached. The lock was too hard to open, so Emma decided to try something else. She ran to her backyard and grabbed the spade. 
She went back and started hitting the case with the spade. It hurt her hands and eyes, but she kept going until finally the case cracked open. She opened it and it was empty!
Emma was so frustrated and disappointed. She threw the spade on the ground and ran back to her house, exhausted and sad. 



Once upon a time there was a pond in the forest. Every morning the sun would make it sparkle. The birds and the animals would come to the pond to drink its mild water.
One day a family of beavers came to the pond. They had traveled far and wide to find a place to build their home. 
The beavers began to prepare for their new home. They chopped down some trees, then carried them near the pond. The beavers built a big dam, which made the pond much bigger.
Next, the beavers dug out a cozy den near the pond. Finally, the beavers made a safe place for their family to live.
So, from that day on the beaver family lived happily in the forest near the pond. The water was mild, and the beavers enjoyed living near it every day.



Once upon a time, there was a cool musician named Tom. Tom loved to play his instrument and make music for everyone. 
One day, Tom was about to start playing in the park when he suddenly sneezed. He couldn't stop sneezing and he had to cancel the show. 
Everyone was so sad and not happy that Tom couldn't play. All of his friends wanted to help Tom, but there was nothing that anyone could do.
Then, one of Tom's friends had an idea. She suggested that if Tom stayed home and rested, he would soon be feeling better. That's exactly what Tom did. 
A few days later, Tom was feeling better and was ready to perform. All of his friends were so happy and they all gathered around to listen. 
The moral of this story is that when you are sick, it is important that you rest and take care of yourself. That way, you can get better quickly and then have fun with your friends.




Once there was a bear named Ben. He was very silly sometimes. One day, he wanted to have a muffin, so he decided to lie to get one from the shop. He put on a very clear voice and said to the shopkeeper: "I want a muffin". The shopkeeper felt suspicious so he said "No, that's not true, tell me the real reason why you wanted a muffin".
Ben was frustrated and didn't know what to do. He knew lying was wrong but he still wanted a muffin. He thought hard and finally he found a solution. He said to the shopkeeper "I want a muffin to share with my friend". The shopkeeper thought it was a good idea and Ben was happy because he finally got the muffin he wanted.
Moral of the story: It's good to be honest and never lie!



Once upon a time, there was a very sad musician. Every day he sat alone, playing his music and feeling down. People would pass by him but no one ever wanted to seat with him. Until one day, a little boy came and asked, "Why are you so sad, musician?". The musician was taken by surprise and he said, "I'm just feeling down, no one ever wants to seat with me." The little boy looked at the musician with a smile and said, "Let me seat with you and sing a happy song". The musician let out a little smile, and started to play the song. People around them began to join in and soon, he wasn't so sad anymore.
The moral of this story is that a smile and a kind word are really powerful. Even if a person is feeling down, a little bit of kindness can change their bad mood. We should all remember to be kind to each other, no matter how hard things seem.




One day, John and his family went to the beach. When they arrived, John found a jet on the sand. He was excited and pleased to see it. He asked his dad "Can I keep it?", but his dad said no. He said it was too heavy for him and he would need help carrying it.
John and his dad walked over to the jet, and John could see it was very heavy. He wondered how he would ever move it. His dad had an idea. He said they could ask some of the other people at the beach to help them. 
So the two of them asked some of the other people, and soon they had a team of 4 people ready to help. With all their strength, they managed to pick up the jet and move it. After they got the jet home, John's dad said it was ok for John to keep it.
John was excited, and he thanked the people who had helped. He was grateful that, with their help, he had been able to find the heavy jet and bring it home.



 Once upon a time, there was a white puppy. He loved to play. Every day, he would run around with joy and jump around with happiness. He often spent time with his family - having fun and being loyal. 
When playtime was over, he would curl up peacefully and take a nap. Every morning, when he woke up, he would eagerly start playing again. He was always so excited about having fun! 
One day, he was playing when he heard a noise. It came from the bushes. He looked over and saw a tiny white rabbit! The puppy barked with joy and the rabbit jumped out of the bushes and ran towards him. They started to run around and play together. 
The two of them became loyal friends. Whenever they were together they played. They were so excited to share the day together. All summer, they ran and laughed and had lots of fun! 
It didn't seem to matter what they were actually playing. They were just happy to be together. All that mattered was the love and loyalty between the two - a puppy and a white rabbit. They were best friends forever!




Once there was a wealthy lady. She wanted to use her money to help others. So she decided to become a patient doctor. Everyday she would go to the hospital to care for her patients.
The patients really liked the lady doctor. She was so kind and gentle. She would talk to them, listen to them and give them medicine. Everyone was so happy when she came to help them.
She used her money to buy toys, books and games for the patients. She even brought some of them candy. The patients were so happy that they danced with joy.
The lady doctor kept on helping her patients. She used her money and her time to make sure they were all happy and healthy. Many people were so thankful for all that she did. She was truly a very kind and generous person.




One day, a little dog named Lucky was walking through a meadow. He looked around and noticed a leather ball lying in the grass. He wanted to take it, but the ball was special. Lucky struggled to pull it out, because it was stuck to the ground. He tried and tried until the ball finally came out.
When Lucky held the ball, he noticed that it was heavy and hard to carry. He quickly ran back home to his boy, Tom. Tom was excited when he saw the ball, because he'd never seen anything like it! He asked Lucky, "Where did you find this?"
Lucky smiled and said, "in the meadow". He was so proud and happy to have found it!
Tom shook his head in disbelief. He couldn't believe that Lucky had found such a special ball. He asked his little dog, "Is this normal?"
Lucky laughed and said, "I don't know, but it was a struggle to get it!" Tom was amazed. Lucky had gone through so much trouble to get the leather ball, and Tom was so grateful. Lucky's effort made a special moment even more special.




Once upon a time, there was a reliable ship at sea. One day, the captain turned to his crew and said, "It's time to move on."
The ship set off and soon they encountered strong winds. The crew felt scared, but the captain said, "Don't worry. I'm a reliable captain and I won't let anything bad happen to us."
The crew relaxed, but soon the winds turned stronger. The captain shouted, "Turn the ship!"
The crew worked together to turn the ship, and soon they were back on course. The captain said, "See, I told you I'm a reliable captain."
The crew arrived safely at their destination, thankful for their reliable captain. They all agreed that the sea might be unpredictable, but the captain was always reliable.




Once upon a time, there lived a small frog named Pete. Pete loved exploring the swamp. Every day, he hopped around and explored what the swamp had to offer.
One day, Pete hopped into the middle of the swamp. Suddenly, a magic tree appeared. Pete was so excited! He hopped closer to take a look.
The magic tree started to speak. Hi Pete! I have something special to reveal. Do you want to know what it is?
Pete nodded his head yes. The magic tree smiled. I have a box full of creative ideas. Come closer and I will show you! 
Pete hopped closer. He couldn't believe it - the box was filled with the most creative ideas he had ever seen. Pete was so happy and thanked the magic tree for revealing the creative ideas to him.
The end.




Once there was a cool, green frog. He lived near a pond in the middle of a forest. The frog was happy in the forest.
One day, he had a really strange urge. He hopped and hopped until he came to a tall, white bird. The bird had a feather in its mouth. He asked the bird to give him the feather.
The bird said no! The frog wanted the feather so badly. Then, he had a bright idea. He asked the bird if they could play a game.
The bird agreed. The frog said if he won, he could have the feather. The bird said yes. The frog and the bird played a game. The frog was very cunning and won all the games.
Finally, the cool, green frog had the feather in his mouth. He hopped happily back to his pond. He put the feather in a safe place and never forgot that special day.




Once there was a charming bookshelf. It stood in the corner of a room and was filled with fun books.
A 3 year old loved to play in the bookshelf. He would take out the books and look at all the wonderful pictures. He loved to whisper the stories to himself and make up more stories too. 
One day, the 3 year old wanted to keep the bookshelf to himself. He tried to protect the bookshelf with a big blanket. But the blanket was too small and the bookshelf was still exposed. 
The 3 year old started to cry. He wanted to protect the bookshelf but he couldn't. He was sad and frustrated.
Suddenly, someone came in and took the bookshelf away from him. He screamed, but it was too late. The bookshelf was gone and he was left alone in the room. He could never see it again.




Once there was a grumpy boy. He liked to sit on a seat all day.
One day the seat was too small. It didn't fit him anymore!
He asked his mom and dad if they could get him a bigger seat.
They did!
The seat was bigger than before and it fit him perfectly. He was so happy!
His dad increased the seat size so it fit the grumpy boy.
Now the grumpy boy had a nice, big seat to sit on all day.




One day, Bill went to the grocery store with his mom. He was excited because grocery stores were such a fun place filled with lots of tasty treats.
When Bill and his mom arrived, it was dark inside the grocery store. But Bill didn't let that stop him from having a good time. He kept running around the store and checking out all the cool things!
Suddenly, Bill heard someone shouting. He tried to remember where he was, but he couldn't. He looked around and saw that it was very dark in the store. He must have wandered away from his mom!
With a scared feeling in his chest, Bill yelled for help. Eventually, his mom found him and scolded him for wandering off. She reminded him that he should always remember to stay with her when they are in places like the grocery store. 
Bill nodded his head and promised he would stay close to his mom next time. But this time, the dark grocery store had taught him an important lesson - to always remember to stay close to his mom.




Once there was a flea who loved to sing. He would sing loud and long all day. One day, a fake bird flew by and heard the flea's singing. The bird told the flea he should try to get other animals to pay him to sing.
So the flea decided to put on a show. He asked all the animals to gather around. But the animals didn't have enough money. They only had Fake coins. The flea was really angry and he stopped singing.
The flea was sad and angry. He was sad because he could not make money with his singing. He was angry because the animals tried to trick him with fake coins. He decided to never sing again. 
The end.



Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tim. He was a polite boy and he was friendly to everyone he met. One day, Tim went for a walk and heard a noise coming from a cave. He looked inside and saw lots of funny little animals. They were chatting to each other and singing a song. He thought they were so cute and decided he wanted to join in the fun. He politely asked can he join them and the animals all smiled and said yes. They welcomed him with open arms and soon he was dancing and singing away with them. They all had such a great time together and they waved goodbye as he left. Tim had a wonderful day and he knew he would always remember the happy cave and the friendly animals.




Mama was very excited. She was going to introduce her daughter, Maya, to her friend. Mama grabbed her daughter's favorite purple sweater and started getting her ready.
Maya was being restless, tugging and pulling on Mama's skirt. Mama said in a soft and gentle voice, "Maya, we are going to visit Mama's friend. I'm sure you'll have lots of fun!"
But Maya just shook her head and wouldn't budge. Mama tried to talk to her daughter, but Maya just closed her eyes and got more and more restless. 
Finally, Mama had an idea. She picked up the purple sweater and said, "Maya, do you want to take your purple sweater with us? I'm sure your friend will like it."
Maya's eyes lit up and she eagerly nodded her head. Mama smiled and finally they were ready to introduce Maya to her friend.




Once upon a time there was a brave girl called Lola who lived in a small house in the woods. Lola liked to explore and always wanted to find something new and exciting.
One day Lola decided to go on a walk. She got ready and said goodbye to her family, who wished her well.
As Lola was walking, she noticed a strange, dark mine. She had never seen one before and was a bit scared, but she was brave so she decided to get closer and take a look.
When Lola got to the entrance of the mine, she heard a voice coming from inside. It said, "Hello, is anyone there?"
Lola was surprised, who could be inside the mine? She stepped closer and called out, "Hello, I'm Lola. Who are you?"
The voice said, "I'm Tom. I've been stuck down here since last week! Please help me get out!"
Lola smiled and said, "Don't worry, I'll help you. You must be brave."
So Lola and Tom worked together to get him out of the mine, and soon enough he was free!
Tom thanked Lola for being so brave and helping him, and then he said goodbye. Lola waved him off with a smile. She smiled even bigger as she realised what an exciting adventure she had just had!




Charlie leaned high, up into the attic. He climbed the ladder and felt the warm air. It was an adventure!
Suddenly he smelled something funny. It was coming from a box in the corner. When he opened it, there was a lazy cat! It was grey and sleepy and didn't move.
Charlie leaned in close and put out his hand. The cat just yawned and stayed still. Charlie thought it was sad and wanted to help it. He tried to pick it up, but it was too heavy and he couldn't lift it.
Charlie got sad and leaned back against the wall. He wanted the cat to be happy, but he just couldn't do it. So he left the attic and went back downstairs, feeling very sad and wishing he could help the cat.




Once there was a small dog named Pete. He was very obedient and followed his mom everywhere. One day, his mom told him to stay inside, no matter what. But the wind was so strong and Pete was so curious. He decided to slip out and go for a walk.
As Pete started to walk, he noticed the wind was stronger than before. He was having so much fun running and he forgot about his mom's warning. The wind was so strong, that it suddenly blew him away.
Pete tried his hardest to get back to his mom, but the wind was too strong for him. He finally fell and hit the ground, exhausted and scared. 
Pete's mom looked for him all night and was very sad when she found out he had disobeyed. She hugged him tight and said: "No matter what happens, always listen to me. I only want what's best for you."
The moral of the story is that children should always obey their parents and follow their instructions, even when they don't understand why.




The lady had some paint. She wanted the room to look special, so she got ready. She opened the paint and she put it on the walls. She painted the walls slowly and carefully. The paint was bright and colourful. She was very happy with how it looked. She kept painting until it was finished. When she was done, the room looked beautiful. The lady was pleased and so were all her friends when they saw it. The lady was proud of her work.




Once there was a man called Bill. He was a small but brave man. One day Bill was walking down the street when he saw two boys fighting. Bill felt that it was a foolish thing to do and wanted to stop them. So he approached them and said, "Stop, why are you fighting?"
One of the boys replied, "He said I was stupid and I had to do something about it!"
Bill was surprised and asked, "Why would you fight over something so silly?" He then added, "Let's turn away from this fight and work it out with words instead."
The boys looked at each other and then stopped fighting. They thanked Bill and agreed never to fight again. Bill smiled and said, "Good. That was the wise thing to do. Fighting is foolish and only leads to more trouble." The boys nodded and went home, happy that they avoided a fight.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mia. Everyday she went to the park with her family. One day, as Mia was playing in the park, it began to rain. Mia's parents handed her an umbrella and said, "Mia, be careful not to get too wet and go home soon".
But so stubbornly Mia wanted to play longer, and even though she was only three, she refused to go home. As it rained, Mia's clothes started to soak up all the water. She was becoming very weak and tired, but she still refused to go home.
The rain started to get heavier and heavier, and Mia was starting to get frightened. Suddenly, Mia saw a kind, old woman with a basket in her hands. She offered Mia a ride home in the basket, so Mia accepted gratefully.
On the way home, the old woman explained, Being weak doesnt always mean being defeated. When things get tough you can always ask for help. No matter how small, every help can give you a lot of strength.
Mia learned her lesson and swore to never refuse help again. From then on, Mia felt grateful for every small help and was never too proud to ask for help when she was in need.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Elizabeth who loved to bake. Whenever she had a free moment, Elizabeth would be in the kitchen, baking whatever she could think of. Every cake and muffin she made would always have a happy face on top.
One day while she was baking, Elizabeth's mother came in and asked her if she would like to bake a cake for someone special. Elizabeth smiled and agreed right away. She started to get all the ingredients ready and began to bake.
Soon enough, the cake was ready. But Elizabeth's mother wouldn't let her put a face onto the cake. She said Elizabeth was too young and needed to be more independent.
Elizabeth was upset and began to cry. She wanted to put a face on the cake for whoever it was for, but her mother said no.
Elizabeth was determined to put a face on the cake, so she thought long and hard about how she could do this. Suddenly, she had an idea. She asked her mother if she could mix up some icing and find something to use as eyes, a nose, and a mouth. Her mother agreed, so Elizabeth finished baking the cake, and put a happy face on top.
Elizabeth and her mother were both happy with the outcome, and Elizabeth was proud of herself for finding a way to be independent while still getting to put a face on the cake.



Bob and Amy were marching together. They walked out of their house. Bob had something special in his hands. It was a bottle of perfume.
Amy didn't know what was in the bottle. Bob told her it was something special and magically sparkly. Amy was excited to find out what it was.
Bob and Amy kept on marching. They marched past the park, then over the bridge and into the unknown. At last they stopped. Bob pulled out the perfume and popped it open.
The magical sparkles flew out of the bottle and into the air. The smell was sweet and beautiful. Even the birds flew closer to sniff the perfume.
Bob and Amy were glad they had gone on their little march. They knew they would never forget their magical adventure.



The little girl had an enormous pillow. It was the fluffiest, biggest one around. Every night, her parents would give her the pillow and tuck her in, so she felt safe and secure. She always knew she was loved. 
One evening, when the little girl was about to snuggle up to her pillow, she noticed something extraordinary. It was growing - growing bigger and bigger until it was bigger than ever before! The enormous pillow filled her bedroom so there was no room for anything else.
The little girl smiled and hugged the pillow. She was so happy and thankful for her parents who gave her such a wonderful and enormous pillow. She laughed, hugging it tightly and fell asleep, dreaming about all the wonderful things to come.




Once there was a big bear. He was so proud that he wanted to weigh more than anything. He ate and ate, but no matter how much he ate, he still weighed the same. He was very sad.
One day, his good friend the fox told him he could make him eat and he would weigh more. The bear thought this was a great idea and the fox showed him the gas. The gas was very smelly and the bear put it in his mouth and breathed it in.
The bear felt really good and he could feel himself growing bigger and bigger. But then, he started to feel very sick! He tried to move but he was stuck and he couldn't breathe. He was so scared and he eventually passed away. He never felt proud again.




Once upon a time there was a giraffe named George. He loved to balance. Every day he walked around in his garden and balanced on one foot. One day he stumbled over a spike. The spike was hard and sour and it really hurt George's foot. He tried to balance on it but he couldn't. He started to cry very loudly. 
Suddenly a giant bird appeared in the sky. The giant bird asked George why he was so sad. George told the giant bird that he had hurt his foot on a spike and he couldn't balance anymore. The giant bird said it could help him. 
The giant bird picked the spike off the ground and placed it back in the ground very carefully. Then the giant bird said magic words and with a loud boom the spike morphed into a big bouncy trampoline. George was so excited and he started bouncing up and down on the trampoline. 
But suddenly, the trampoline started to get sour and it got harder and harder for George to balance. He started to cry again. The giant bird had disappeared and George was all alone. The spike had turned back into a spike and George had to go home, hurt and sad.



 
Once upon a time, there was a daddy who had a daughter. He loved her very much and wanted to play with her. So he poked her softly. His daughter giggled and poked him back. They had lots of fun and laughed a lot, enjoying the mild sun.
The daughter was so happy that she ran around poking everything. She poked the desk, the walls, the couch and even her dad's nose! Her father laughed even harder as his daughter continued to poke him.
But then the daughter started to get tired. She looked up at her dad and poked him one last time. He smiled and hugged her close. She fell asleep in his arms, and they enjoyed the mild day.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Grace. She was a brave and courageous little hero. 
One day, Grace wanted to find out how much she weighed. But she was only 3 years old and didnt know how. 
Grace went to her mom and asked Mom, how can I weigh myself? 
Graces mom smiled and said Lets go to the store and buy a scale. That way we can find out how much you weigh.
So Grace and her mom went to the store and bought a scale. Grace was very excited. 
When they got back home, Grace stepped on the scale. She felt the hot metal against her feet and watched as the numbers changed until it showed her weight. 
Grace smiled and said Thanks Mom! I feel like a hero now! 
Her mom smiled and gave her a big hug. They both felt very proud.




Once there was a little girl called Daisy who wanted to be a princess. She loved pink and wanted to be surrounded by it all of the time. One day her mom came in with a big box from the store. Daisy ran up to it and carefully opened it. Inside was a pink crown with feathers and glitter. Daisy's eyes opened wide with surprise! She was so delighted that she put it on straight away. 
However, soon Daisy started to realize that the crown was a bit fake. She asked her mom, "Is this crown real?" 
Her mom smiled and said, "No, Daisy, it's not real. But even if it isn't real, you can still trust in the feeling it gives you. You don't need a real crown to feel like a princess."
Daisy smiled. She knew that was true. Even though the crown was fake, it still made her feel special. She decided to trust in that feeling. 
And so Daisy proudly wore her fake pink crown and became the princess she always wanted to be!




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tim. He loved exploring his garden and looking for all the animals he could find. One day, he saw a lizard and he wanted to show it to his friend John. He wanted to borrow it for a little while before returning it later. 
So he excitedly picked up the lizard and brought it to John's house, to show him what he had found. When John saw the cool lizard, his eyes lit up! He was so jealous of Tim and he wanted to keep the lizard for himself. He asked Tim to leave, but Tim refused as he wanted to borrow the lizard for just a little while. 
John got angry and tried to take the lizard away from Tim. He was so envious of Tim and began to shout at him. Tim started to cry and was so scared of John. He felt so sad and just wanted to show John the cool lizard. 
Thankfully, John's mum heard the noise and came to help. She saw what was happening and scolded John for being so mean. She said it was ok for Tim to borrow the lizard, as long as he returned it to its home later. 
Tim and John said sorry to each other and went back to playing together. They had such a good time with the cool lizard! 
The end.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Maria. She loved to fold lots of different things. She folded paper, fabric, books, toys and even her clothes! She especially liked to fold her shirts and pants into perfect squares.
One day, Maria decided to have some fun. She got out some paint and brushes, and she made a beautiful picture. She painted a tall tree, with red leaves and blue sky behind it. When she was done, she put her painting down and smiled.
Nearby, Maria's friends were having a competition. Who could fold a paper the fastest? Maria wanted to try and join in. She carefully folded her paper into the tightest, tiniest square she could make. 
When her friends saw this, they cheered. Maria had folded her paper faster than anyone else! She was the most competitive folder in the whole competition. Everyone clapped for Maria and shouted for joy. 
Maria was so proud of her folding skills. She knew she would never forget her special day.




Once upon a time, there was a eager boy who loved cookies. Every day, he would go to the kitchen to get a cookie and polish it up with a napkin. He'd take huge bites to savor the sweet crunch of the sugary cookie. He'd then munch away until all that was left was a crumb or two.
One day, his mommy took him to the store. He was very excited because he just knew there were tons of special cookies waiting for him! He found one with rainbow sprinkles and another shaped like a star. He couldn't wait to polish them off!
He happily picked up the cookies, paid for them and they left the store. He quickly polished one of them off before they returned home. As soon as his mommy opened the door, he ran to his room and polished off the second cookie.
He smiled with satisfaction. He was so eager to polish off one cookie after another and he hoped his mommy would take him back to the store again soon!



One day, there was a poor woman. She was very sad and the little boy who lived nearby wanted to help her. He wanted to understand why she was feeling so sad. 
So he asked her why she was so unhappy. The woman told him that she didn't have enough food or money for her family. The little boy felt so sad for the woman. 
He wanted to do something to help. So he dragged his toy wagon to the woman's house and loaded it up with food from his own kitchen. The woman was very surprised and happy. 
The little boy had given her all the food he had to share so she wouldn't be so poor. Now, the woman could feed her family. The little boy didn't understand why she was poor, but he did understand that he could help her.




Once there was a baby who liked to crawl. She loved scooting around on the ground, exploring all sorts of new places.
One day, the baby found a big, bright yellow cone. It was great! She could just barely reach it with her little hands. The baby grabbed the cone and crawled around the house with it.
The baby crawled under the table, around the chair, and even through the door. Everywhere the baby crawled, the cone followed.
Pretty soon, the baby was getting tired. But she wasnt done playing with her cone yet! So she crawled into the kitchen and grabbed a big spoon. She scooped up some food and put it into the cone.
The baby thought the cone filled with food was great! She crawled around the house, munching on her snack.
When the baby had finished eating, she put the cone back where she found it. Then she crawled to her bed, content after a fun day of crawling and exploring.




Once upon a time, there was a thin daughter and her name was Courtney. Everyday, she would go to the park with her mummy. One day, Courtney got a magical box from a fairy. The fairy said that every time she opened the box, something special would happen. 
Curious, Courtney opened the box and out of it flew a beautiful butterfly. It started to spread its wings and fly around the park. Courtney was so excited and ran around trying to catch it. Eventually, she caught the butterfly, put it in the box and thanked the fairy. 
As Courtney hugged the box and kept going to the park, the magical butterfly spread its wings every day. She was amazed and so happy to have such a special butterfly for her very own.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl named Emma. She was three years old. Emma loved playing outside in the sun. Every day, Emma went outside to the park and ran around with her friends. 
One day, Emma and her friends played in the park until it was time to go home. Emma's mommy was there to pick her up. When they got home, Emma's mommy said it was time for a bath. 
Emma went to the bathroom and got in the tub. She was very dirty and wet from playing in the park, so her mommy put some shampoo in her hair. Emma didn't like it when her mommy did this, because she thought it felt too rough. 
But still, Emma let her mommy put shampoo in her hair. After a few minutes, mommy used a big towel to dry her off. When Emma's hair was clean and dry, she was so happy and excited. 
Then it was time for bed. Emma said goodnight and snuggled into her bed, fell asleep and had sweet dreams!




Once upon a time, there was a mommy. She was always busy, running around and doing things. But one day, she had a bright idea. She decided she needed an apron. So she kept looking and looking until she found one she liked. 
But it was quite hard to get it. She asked lots of people, and they all said no. But she was very persistent. She would not give up! 
Then one day, a friend told her. She knew someone who could deliver the apron right to her door. So the mommy was very happy. 
Finally, the apron arrived. It was perfect! Much better than the mommy ever dreamed. 
The mommy was so pleased. She never gave up and it was worth it. She was now able to do even more work, and look great while doing it. She never forgot how persistent she was!



"Mommy, why is it raining?" asked the small three-year-old boy from the window.
"It's raining because the sky is crying," Mommy answered.
The little boy was scared and confused, so he asked Mommy, "Why is the sky crying?"
"A little bird was so sad because he could not get his red meal," Mommy said. 
"But why can't he get his red meal?" the boy asked.
"Well, the red meal is very high in the sky, and the little bird cannot reach it," replied Mommy.
So the little boy ran out into the rain and climbed the tallest tree he could find. He reached up and grabbed the red meal and brought it to the little bird.
The bird began to eat and was so happy. The sky stopped crying and the rain stopped. The little boy and the bird were so happy that they had solved the problem together.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved sweets. One day, she was walking in the street, when she suddenly saw a vendor. He had lots of cakes and candies and, to her, they all seemed very delicious! 
The vendor noticed the little girl and called her to come closer. He offered her some of the treats, but the little girl didnt have any money. She was so sad, but the vendor seemed crazy. He said he would give her the treats for free! 
The little girl was so excited and asked her mom if she could take them home. Her mom said no, because she was sure the vendor was just trying to trick her. And, sure enough, the vendor started laughing very hard and said: You should never trust strangers, like me!
The girl was disappointed, and learned an important lesson. Even though something seems too good to be true, it usually is!




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Jim. One day, Jim wanted to find a path to the park. He asked his mom, "Mom, will you help me go to the park?" His mom smiled and said, "Of course I will help you, Jim."
So Jim's mom set a path for him. She made sure the path was clean. The path was bright and there were many flowers along the way. Jim was so excited to follow the path. He smiled and said, "Thank you, mom." 
Jim's mom said, "You're welcome Jim. Take this path and you'll soon get to the park. Have fun!" 
Jim said, "Bye mom! I'll see you soon!" Then he followed the path. Jim had a lot of fun playing in the park. He was very happy. 
After a few hours, Jim followed the same path back home. He was safe and he was full of joy!




Unit and Nana were playing outside. Nana brought a big empty bag with her.
Nana said: "Let's go pick something up".
Unit went to the garden and started to pick the dry leaves from the ground. He put the leaves into the big bag.
Nana smiled. "Good job, Unit. We can make something out of these leaves."
Unit and Nana took the bag back to the house. They emptied the leaves onto the table and started to make art with the dry leaves. They flattened the leaves and used them to make a picture of a tree.
"This looks great!" said Nana. "You did a great job picking the dry leaves."
Unit smiled and said, "Yes, I did!"




Once upon a time, there was a dog called Timmy. He wanted to take a train ride around the world. So, he ran to the station. He saw a big, noisy train!
Timmy quickly hopped onto the train and it started to move. He looked out of the window and smiled. He saw many different places. He saw trees, hills and rivers. The wind was blowing through his fur.
The bell starting ringing. Timmy knew it was time to eat. He took out his bowl and had something to drink. Then, he took out a yummy snack and began to eat.
The train stopped at the last station and Timmy hopped off. He had had a wonderful time and was happy. He ran all the way home. He had a great day but was very tired.



Once upon a time, there was a boy. His name was Timmy. Timmy had a lot of hair on his head. His mom told him he needed to go to the barber to cut his hair. 
Timmy went to the barber. The barber was a man who cuts hair. He had a lot of scissors and combs. Timmy sat on the chair and the barber cut his hair. 
After the barber finished, Timmy went home. His mom asked him how it went. Timmy said the barber did a good job. He liked his new haircut. 
But then, the barber realized he cut Timmy's hair too short. He felt guilty. He called Timmy's mom and told her what happened. Timmy's mom was very nice and said it was okay. The barber felt better and promised to be more careful next time.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park with her mom. They saw a big flame in the sky. Lily asked her mom, "What is that?" Her mom said, "It's a hot air balloon. It's different from an airplane."
Lily was curious and wanted to see the hot air balloon up close. They walked closer and saw a man getting ready to fly it. The man saw Lily and said, "Hello! Would you like to come with me on my hot air balloon ride?" Lily was excited and said, "Yes, please!"
They got on the hot air balloon and flew up in the sky. It was so much fun! After they landed, the man said, "I'm hungry. Let's eat some sandwiches." Lily and her mom ate sandwiches with the man and talked about their adventure. They had a great time together.



Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Nutty. Nutty was a very nervous squirrel. One day, Nutty was gathering acorns for the winter. Suddenly, a loud noise scared Nutty and he dropped all of his acorns. The acorns scattered all over the ground.
Nutty looked around and saw a big bird. The bird was looking at Nutty with hungry eyes. Nutty was very scared and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, Nutty heard a voice behind him. It was his friend, Chip the chipmunk.
"Are you okay, Nutty?" asked Chip.
"No, I'm not okay. I dropped all my acorns and now they're scattered everywhere. And that bird is going to eat me!" said Nutty.
"Don't worry, Nutty. I'll help you gather your acorns and we'll store them in my tree. And don't be scared of that bird. I'll chase him away," said Chip.
Nutty was very happy that he had a friend like Chip. Together, they gathered all of Nutty's acorns and stored them safely in Chip's tree. Nutty learned that it's always good to have a friend to help when you're feeling nervous.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a smelly dog named Max. Max loved to run and play in the park with Timmy. One day, Timmy and Max went on an adventure to a big castle. They walked through a long hallway and came to a big chamber. Inside the chamber, there was a big dragon staring at them! Timmy and Max were scared, but they remembered that dragons liked treats. So, they gave the dragon a big bone and the dragon became their friend. From that day on, Timmy and Max visited the dragon in his chamber and brought him treats. They all lived happily ever after. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a great treasure chest that he loved to play with. One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his friends. He left his treasure chest at home.
When Timmy returned home, he noticed that his treasure chest was missing! He asked his mom, "Where is my treasure chest?" His mom replied, "I put it in the closet." Timmy was happy to hear that and said, "Thank you, mom! You are the best!"



Once upon a time, there was a friendly bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play with his friends in the forest. One day, Benny went to visit his friend, a little mouse named Molly.
Molly said, "Hello, Benny! I have some cream for us to eat. Do you want some?"
Benny replied, "Yes, please! Can you show me where it is?"
Molly took Benny to her house and showed him the cream. They ate it together and had a great time playing. Benny was happy he had a friendly friend like Molly.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird loved to sing and make music. Every morning, it would sing a beautiful song to wake up the sun. 
One day, the little bird found a fragile egg on the ground. It was so delicate that the bird was afraid to touch it. But the bird knew it had to help the egg. So, it gently picked up the egg and put it back in its nest. 
Days passed, and the egg hatched into a baby bird. The little bird was so happy that it had helped the egg. It learned that sometimes, we must yield to fragile things and help them. 
From that day on, the little bird sang even more beautiful songs, and all the other animals in the forest listened and danced to the music. The little bird knew that helping others was the right thing to do, and it made the world a better place.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a playful dog named Max. They loved to play together in the backyard. One day, Timmy found a microscope in his dad's room. He asked his dad what it was and his dad explained that it was a special tool to see tiny things up close. Timmy was very curious and wanted to keep the microscope to look at everything he could find. 
The next day, Timmy and Max went on a hunt for tiny things to look at with the microscope. They found some ants, a ladybug, and even a small piece of grass. Timmy was amazed at what he saw through the microscope. He decided to keep the microscope in his room so he could use it whenever he wanted. 
From that day on, Timmy and Max had even more fun playing together. They would look for tiny things to examine with the microscope and learn about the world around them. Timmy was grateful to have such a special tool and a playful dog to keep him company.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play outside in the grass. One day, she found a big hole in the ground. It was very deep and she had to be careful not to fall in. 
Lily saw a sharp stick on the ground and she picked it up. She wanted to use it to see how deep the hole was. But her mommy said, "No, Lily, that stick is too sharp. You could hurt yourself. Let's find something else to use." 
So, they found a long stick that was not sharp. Lily carefully put the stick down into the hole. It was very deep! She was happy she didn't fall in. From that day on, Lily was always careful when playing near holes and never picked up sharp sticks again.



Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Mimi. Mimi loved to eat bananas. One day, Mimi saw a big, yellow banana in the tree. Mimi wanted to eat it, but it was too high. 
Mimi said, "Banana, come down to me!" But the banana didn't move. Mimi was frightened. 
Mimi asked a friendly bird, "Can you help me get the banana?" The bird said, "Sure, I can fly up and get it for you." 
The bird flew up and got the banana for Mimi. Mimi was very happy and said, "Thank you, bird! Now I can eat my banana." And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a king who had a powerful crown. He loved his crown very much and wore it every day. One day, a bad man came and stole the crown from the king. The king was very sad and cried a lot.
The bad man wore the crown and felt very powerful. He gained control over the kingdom and made the people do bad things. The king tried to get his crown back but the bad man was too strong. 
In the end, the bad man became very greedy and wanted more power. He started to fight with other kingdoms and lost his own kingdom. The crown was lost forever and the king never got it back. The kingdom was never the same again.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. One evening, Timmy's mom asked him to eat his vegetables. Timmy refused and said he didn't like them. His mom was sorry that Timmy didn't like his vegetables, but she said he had to eat them to be healthy. Timmy still refused and started to cry. His mom hugged him and said she loved him, but he still had to eat his vegetables. Timmy finally agreed and ate his vegetables. He felt better and his mom was happy. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a big red dog named Spot. Spot loved to play outside with his friends, but sometimes he got very tired. When Spot was tired, he would take a nap in his doghouse.
One day, Spot's owner noticed that he was not feeling well. She took him to see the veterinarian. The veterinarian was a kind person who helped animals feel better. She gave Spot some medicine and told his owner to make sure he got plenty of rest.
Spot's owner took him home and he went straight to his doghouse to take a nap. After a few days of rest and medicine, Spot was feeling much better. He was able to play with his friends again and his owner was very happy. From that day on, Spot made sure to take a nap whenever he felt tired, just like the veterinarian told him to.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but sometimes she got bored. One day, she went to her mom and said, "Mommy, I want to destroy the furniture!"
Her mom was surprised and asked, "Why do you want to destroy the furniture, Lily?"
Lily replied eagerly, "I want to build a fort with the cushions and blankets!"
Her mom smiled and said, "Okay, we can use the furniture to make a fort, but we can't destroy it. Let's be creative and have fun together!" So, Lily and her mom used the furniture to build a big fort and played in it all day long. They had so much fun and Lily was very happy that she didn't have to destroy anything to have a good time.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys. One day, he was playing with his favorite toy, a teddy bear, when he accidentally knocked over a cushion. The cushion was very light, so it didn't hurt anyone.
Timmy's mom saw what happened and asked him to help her clean up. They put the cushion back on the couch and Timmy's mom asked him to put his toys in a sack. Timmy thought it was fun to put his toys in the sack, so he did it quickly.
After they finished cleaning up, Timmy's mom gave him a big hug and told him how proud she was of him for helping. Timmy smiled and felt happy knowing he did a good job. From then on, he made sure to be extra careful when playing with his toys.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved Halloween and wanted to find the perfect pumpkin to carve. She went to the pumpkin patch with her mom and dad. There were so many pumpkins to choose from! 
Lily found a big pumpkin that she liked, but when she tried to pick it up, it was too heavy. Then she saw a smaller pumpkin that was fake. It was made of plastic, but it looked just like a real pumpkin. She was able to carry it easily. 
When they got home, Lily started to carve her pumpkin. She used a knife to cut out the eyes and mouth. Suddenly, she pinched her finger! Ouch! It hurt a lot. But she didn't give up. She finished carving her pumpkin and it looked great. She was so happy!



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in the summer. The sun was bright and made him happy. One day, Tim's mom bought him a new shirt to wear. Tim tried it on, but it didn't fit him. He was sad because he really liked the shirt. Tim's mom said they could go back to the store and find a shirt that would fit him. They found a shirt that was just right and Tim was happy again. They went outside to play and Tim felt even happier because of the bright sun.



Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside and watch the birds fly. One day, Timmy saw a missile in the sky. He got scared and ran to his mom.
"Mommy, mommy! What's that in the sky?" Timmy asked.
"It's just a missile, Timmy. It's something that flies really fast," his mom explained.
Timmy was still scared, but his mom held him tight and told him everything was going to be okay. From then on, Timmy always looked up at the sky to see the birds fly, but he never wanted to see a missile again.



Once upon a time, there was a pilot named Tim. Tim was very organized and always made sure his airplane was clean and ready to fly. One day, Tim had a cold and he started to sneeze a lot. 
While Tim was flying his airplane, he sneezed so hard that his hat flew off. He tried to catch it, but it was too late. His hat flew out of the window and into the clouds. 
Tim was sad that he lost his hat, but he knew he had to keep flying. He landed safely and went to get a new hat. From then on, Tim made sure to always hold onto his hat tightly, even when he sneezed. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a sweet little puppy named Spot. Spot loved to play and run in the park with his owner, a little girl named Lily. One day, while they were playing, Spot saw a little bird that fell from its nest. Spot wanted to pick up the little bird and take care of it.
Lily was happy to see Spot helping the little bird. She helped Spot make a little nest for the bird and they gave it some food and water. The little bird was very happy and chirped a sweet song.
But then, a big dog came and started to chase Spot and Lily. Spot tried to rescue Lily and the little bird, but the big dog was too strong. The little bird flew away, and Spot and Lily got hurt. They went to the hospital, but they were very sad because they couldn't find the little bird again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a chubby little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her yard with her toys. One day, she saw her neighbor's cat in the yard and tried to pet it, but the cat ran away. Lily sighed and felt sad. 
Later that day, Lily's mom brought out a big ball for her to play with in the yard. Lily was so happy and started to bounce the ball up and down. But then, the ball accidentally bounced over the fence and into the neighbor's yard. Lily sighed again and felt worried that she wouldn't get her ball back. 
Luckily, Lily's neighbor was kind and returned the ball to her. Lily was so happy and gave the neighbor a big hug. She realized that even when things don't go as planned, there are always kind people to help.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her toys. One day, she decided to have a tea party with her stuffed animals. She planned everything carefully, making sure to set the table with cups, saucers, and plates.
As she was pouring the tea, she noticed one of her stuffed animals, a bear named Teddy, was looking sad. She asked him what was wrong, and he told her he was feeling sick. Lily knew she had to be patient with Teddy and take care of him.
After the tea party was over, Lily put Teddy to bed and read him a story. She made sure he had plenty of water and a soft pillow to rest on. She was fair to all her stuffed animals, but she knew Teddy needed extra attention.
The next day, when Lily woke up, she was happy to see that Teddy was feeling better. She had planned to take him on a picnic, and she was glad he was well enough to come along. Lily learned that being patient and fair with her toys was important, and that taking care of them when they were sick was the right thing to do.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a furry cat named Mittens. One day, Lily's mommy said, "Lily, we are going to the park. Can you pack some snacks in the cooler?"
Lily replied, "Yes, mommy. I will pack some apples and juice in the cooler." She ran to the kitchen and got the cooler. She opened the fridge and took out some apples and a juice box. She put them in the cooler and closed it.
Mittens saw what Lily was doing and meowed, "Meow, can I come too?" Lily smiled and said, "Of course, Mittens. You can come with us to the park." They all went to the park and had a fun day playing together.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and collect rocks. One day, she found a big rock that made her very excited. She wanted to keep it forever and show it to all her friends.
But as time passed, Lily noticed that the rock started to shrink. It became smaller and smaller until it was just a tiny pebble. Lily was sad because she realized that everything in life eventually shrinks or goes away.
From that day on, Lily learned to appreciate the things she had while she had them. She knew that even though things may shrink or disappear, the memories and joy they brought would always stay with her.



Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Mittens. Mittens liked to sleep all day and didn't like to play. One day, Mittens saw a big stack of boxes and decided to climb on them. 
"Mittens, stop climbing on those boxes! You might fall and hurt yourself," said the little girl who owned Mittens. 
But Mittens didn't listen and kept climbing. Suddenly, the stack of boxes started to wobble and Mittens fell off! 
"Mittens, are you okay?" asked the little girl. 
Mittens meowed and rubbed against the little girl's leg. From that day on, Mittens stopped being so lazy and started playing more with the little girl instead of climbing on boxes.



Once upon a time, there was a family who lived far away from each other. They missed each other very much. One day, they decided to meet up and have a big party. They all drove to a park to have fun together. 
Suddenly, a bad man came and tried to hurt the family. He had a gun and wanted to shoot them. The family was scared and tried to run away, but the bad man caught them. He shot them all and they fell down. 
The police came too late to help the family. They found them lying on the ground, very hurt. The family was taken to the hospital, but it was too late. They all died because of the bad man. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a beautiful swan. She loved to swim in the clean pond. One day, a little girl came to the pond to see the swan. The swan was shy and hid behind some reeds. 
The little girl wanted to see the swan, so she waited patiently. After a while, the swan came out from behind the reeds and revealed herself to the little girl. The little girl was so happy to see the swan up close. 
The swan was very clean and her feathers were shiny. The little girl wanted to touch the swan, but she was afraid. The swan was gentle and came closer to the little girl. The little girl reached out and touched the swan's soft feathers. It was a magical moment.



Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max loved to run and play in the park with his owner. His owner always put a leash on him to keep him safe. One day, a weird man came to the park and talked to Max's owner. The man ordered Max's owner to give him the leash and then he ran away with Max.
Max's owner was very sad and called the police. They searched for Max and found him in the weird man's house. The man was arrested and Max was returned to his owner. But Max was not the same happy dog anymore. He was scared and didn't want to play anymore. Max's owner tried to make him happy again, but it was too late. Max had been traumatized by the weird man and never recovered.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her dog, a pretty golden retriever named Max. One day, Lily and Max went on an adventure in the park. 
As they were walking, Lily noticed that Max was sniffing around a lot. "What are you searching for, Max?" she asked. Max just wagged his tail and continued sniffing. 
Suddenly, Max started barking and ran towards a nearby tree. Lily followed him and saw a shiny object stuck in the branches. It was a pretty necklace with a heart pendant. 
Lily was so happy and thanked Max for helping her find the necklace. From that day on, Lily and Max went on many more adventures together, always searching for new treasures to discover.



Once upon a time, there was a big gray elephant. He was very sad because he felt alone. He wanted to make friends with the other animals in the jungle, but they didn't want to play with him because he was too big.
One day, the elephant saw a monkey who was stuck in a tree. The elephant decided to help the monkey by using his big trunk to open the tree's branches. The monkey was very happy and grateful. He thanked the elephant and invited him to play with the other animals.
The elephant was nervous at first, but he decided to join them. The other animals were surprised to see the elephant, but they welcomed him with open arms. They played together and had lots of fun.
The moral of the story is that when we unite and help each other, we can make new friends and have fun together.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a regular routine. Every day, he would play with his toys, eat his breakfast, and go outside to play with his friends.
One day, Timmy's mom took him to the hospital for an operation. Timmy was scared, but his mom told him that it would help him feel better. The doctor asked Timmy to kneel down on the bed and count to ten. Timmy did as he was told, and soon he was asleep.
When Timmy woke up, he felt much better. His mom was there to give him a big hug. Timmy was happy that he could go back to his regular routine and play with his friends again. He knew that he was brave for going through the operation.



Once upon a time, there was a big and noisy lion. He liked to roar all the time and make a lot of noise. One day, he went into a cave and saw a knob. He started to play with it and turned it round and round. Suddenly, the knob came off and the lion got scared. 
He realized that he shouldn't have played with things that didn't belong to him. He felt bad and decided to go and apologize to the owner of the cave. The owner forgave him and told him that it's important to be careful with other people's things. 
From that day on, the lion learned to be more careful and not to make too much noise. He realized that being noisy all the time wasn't good and that it's important to be considerate of others.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going on car rides with her mommy and daddy. One day, while they were driving, Lily saw a big, soft teddy bear in the window of a store. 
"Mommy, I want that bear!" Lily said.
"I'm sorry, sweetie, but we can't get it right now," her mommy replied.
Lily pouted and looked out the window. Suddenly, she saw a puppy running down the street. "Puppy!" she shouted.
Her daddy pulled over and they got out of the car. The puppy was friendly and licked Lily's face. "He kissed me!" she giggled.
Her daddy picked up the puppy and they saw that he had a broken buckle on his collar. "Let's take him to the vet and get him fixed up," he said.
Lily was so happy to have a new friend and she gave the puppy lots of kisses on his soft fur. From that day on, they were inseparable.



Once upon a time, there was a purple cat named Max. Max loved to perform tricks for his friends. One day, Max saw a little bird with a collar around its neck. The bird was sad because it couldn't fly away. 
Max asked the bird what was wrong. The bird said, "I can't fly because my collar is too heavy." Max wanted to help the bird, so he performed a trick. He jumped up and caught the collar in his mouth. 
Max pulled and pulled until the collar broke free from the bird's neck. The bird was so happy and thanked Max. Max smiled and said, "I'm happy to help. It's important to be kind to others." 
The moral of the story is that it's always good to help others, especially when they are in need.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to build things with his blocks. He would stack them up and make tall towers. One day, Timmy wanted to build a castle with his blocks. He worked hard and built a big castle with lots of rooms.
But then, Timmy noticed that one of his blocks was missing. He looked and looked, but he couldn't find it. Finally, he saw that his little sister had taken the block and was trying to strip the paint off of it. Timmy was upset because the block was now ugly without its paint.
Timmy learned that it's not nice to take things that belong to someone else and that it's important to take care of our things so they don't become ugly. From that day on, Timmy made sure to keep his blocks in a safe place and to share them nicely with his sister.



Once upon a time, there was a big, powerful truck. The truck loved to drive around the town and show off its strength. One day, the truck was driving down the road when it saw a little girl trying to cross the street. The truck stopped to let her pass, but a small car behind the truck honked its horn and yelled, "Hurry up!"
The little girl was scared and didn't know what to do. The truck saw the car and decided to help the girl. "Don't worry, little one," the truck said. "I will block the car and keep you safe." The truck then drove in front of the car and stopped it from passing.
The little girl was so happy and started to applaud the truck. "Thank you, truck! You are my hero!" she said. The truck smiled and replied, "No problem, little one. I will always protect you." From that day on, the little girl and the truck became good friends and the truck always made sure to keep her safe on the road.



Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny was hopping in the forest when he saw a big hedge. The hedge was very tall and green. Benny felt a bit scared because it was a gloomy day and the hedge looked a bit spooky.
Benny felt hungry and realized he needed to find some food. He hopped around the hedge and found some yummy carrots. Benny was very happy because he loved carrots. He ate all the carrots and felt full.
As Benny was hopping away, he saw a little bird who looked sad. Benny asked the bird what was wrong and the bird said she needed help finding her nest. Benny was happy to help and hopped around the hedge with the bird until they found her nest. The bird was very grateful and thanked Benny for his help. Benny felt happy that he could help someone in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in an empty hut in the woods with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to wrap a present for her daddy's birthday. Lily was so excited to help her mommy and she wrapped the present with pretty paper and a big bow.
Suddenly, a big bad wolf appeared and growled at Lily. "Give me the present!" he demanded. But Lily was brave and said, "No! It's for my daddy's birthday!" The wolf got angry and knocked down the hut. Lily's mommy and daddy were hurt and couldn't get up.
Lily cried and cried, but it was too late. The wolf had destroyed their home and they had nowhere to go. From that day on, Lily and her family had to live in the cold woods with no shelter. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little birdie named Tweety. Tweety loved to zoom around in the sky, looking for tasty worms to eat. One day, Tweety saw an ugly cat with big, sharp teeth. The cat wanted to catch Tweety and eat him for dinner.
Tweety tried to fly away, but the cat was too fast. The cat tore through the air and caught Tweety in his claws. Tweety tried to escape, but it was too late. The cat ate Tweety for his dinner.
The end.



One day, a little girl named Lily and her friend Max were playing in the park. They were having fun on the swings and the slide when Max said, "Let's have a race!" 
Lily agreed and they started running as fast as they could. Max was ahead, but Lily didn't give up. She kept running and running until she passed Max and won the race! 
Max was sad he didn't win, but Lily said, "It's okay, Max. We can both have a victory if we try our best." Max smiled and said, "You're right, Lily. You're so flexible with your thinking!" 
The moral of the story is that it's not always about winning, but about doing your best and having fun with your friends.



Once upon a time, there was a big oak tree in a forest. The oak tree was very old and had many branches. One day, a little boy came to the forest and saw the oak tree. He said, "Wow, you are so big and strong!"
The oak tree replied, "Thank you, little boy. I have been here for many years and have seen many things."
The little boy asked, "Do you ever get tired?"
The oak tree said, "No, I am not lazy like some other trees. I always stand tall and proud."
The little boy then asked, "Can you bow down and touch the ground?"
The oak tree thought for a moment and said, "No, I cannot. But I can sway in the wind and dance with the leaves." And with that, the little boy smiled and continued on his way through the forest.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside, especially on the slide. One day, she went to the park with her mommy and daddy. She saw the slide and ran towards it. She climbed up and slid down. She loved it!
After playing for a while, they went home. For dessert, Lily's mommy made her favorite - chocolate pudding. Lily was so grateful and said, "Thank you, mommy! This is yummy!"
Later that night, when Lily was getting ready for bed, she said to her mommy, "I had so much fun on the slide today. Can we go back to the park tomorrow?" Her mommy replied, "Of course, we can go to the park anytime you want." And with that, Lily drifted off to sleep, dreaming of sliding down the slide again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat cookies on her favorite dish. One day, Lily's friend came over to play. They had so much fun together, but then Lily's friend saw the dish and wanted it for herself. She decided to steal it when Lily wasn't looking. 
Lily was very sad when she found out her dish was gone. She asked her friend if she knew where it was, but her friend said no. Lily felt very sorry for herself and cried. 
But then, Lily's friend felt bad for what she did and decided to give the dish back. She said sorry to Lily and promised to never steal again. However, even though the dish was returned, Lily still felt sad because she couldn't trust her friend anymore.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the garden with her toys. One day, she found a pretty flower and picked it up. She held it tight in her hand and showed it to her mom.
Mom said, "That flower is poison. You shouldn't hold it."
But Lily was stubborn and didn't listen. She held the flower tightly and refused to let go.
Suddenly, Lily felt sick and her hand started to hurt. She cried out for her mom, but it was too late. The poison had made her very sick and she had to go to the hospital.
The moral of the story is that we should always listen to our parents and not hold things that can hurt us.



Once upon a time, there was a human named Timmy. Timmy was very peaceful and he liked to talk to his animal friends in the forest. One day, Timmy saw a bird with a broken wing and he wanted to help. 
He asked the bird, "Can I help you?" 
The bird said, "Yes, please. Can you part the branches so I can fly away?" 
Timmy did as the bird asked and parted the branches. The bird flew away happily. Timmy felt happy too because he helped his animal friend. 
From that day on, Timmy made many animal friends and he always helped them when they needed it. He knew that being peaceful and kind to others made him happy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the zoo with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to see the pandas. Lily saw a big, black and white panda sleeping. She wanted to wake it up, so she pointed at it. The panda woke up and looked at Lily. It was not happy because it was spoiled and wanted to sleep more. Lily felt sad and said sorry to the panda. She learned that it's important to be kind to animals and not to bother them when they are sleeping. From that day on, Lily always admired the pandas from a distance and never pointed at them again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play in the park with her friends. One day, they saw a big row of ducks swimming in the pond. Lily admired how the ducks could swim so fast and not get tired. 
After playing for a while, Lily and her friends got very dirty. Their clothes were filthy with mud and grass stains. But they didn't mind because they had so much fun playing together. 
As they were leaving the park, Lily saw a man cleaning the streets. He was using a big broom to sweep the sidewalks. Lily thought he was doing a good job and admired how clean he was making the streets.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved music and wanted to play the violin. Her mommy and daddy promised to buy her one. 
One day, they went to a music store and saw a shiny, brown violin. Lily was so happy! She tried to play it, but it made a screeching sound. Her mommy and daddy said they would answer her prayers and get her lessons.
