After a few weeks of practice, Lily played a beautiful song on her violin. Her mommy and daddy were so proud! They celebrated with a spicy dinner. Lily realized that practicing and patience paid off.



Once upon a time, there was a little duck. The duck loved to play in the water and get all wet. But one day, the duck felt very dirty and wanted to be clean. So, the duck went to the pond to bathe. The duck splashed and played in the water until it was all clean.
After the bath, the duck wanted to go on an adventure. So, the duck put on its gear, which was just a little backpack, and set off into the forest. The duck walked for a long time and met many animals along the way. Some were big and some were small, but all were friendly and kind to the little duck.
As the sun began to set, the duck realized it was lost. The duck felt scared and alone, but then remembered that it had made so many friends on its journey. So, the duck asked for help from a humble rabbit who showed the duck the way back home. From that day on, the little duck knew that it could always count on its friends to help when it was lost or scared.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing in her room with her toys. One day, she found a big cushion and she was so excited! She jumped on it and rolled around.
Her mom came in and asked, "What are you doing, Lily?"
"I'm playing on my cushion! Imagine if I could bounce on it like a trampoline!" Lily said with a big smile.
Her mom laughed and said, "That would be so much fun! Maybe we can find a real trampoline for you to play on outside."
Lily was even more excited at the thought of playing on a trampoline. She hugged her mom and said, "Thank you, mom! You always know how to make me happy."



Once upon a time, there was a little mouse named Mickey. Mickey loved to eat cheese. He would eat all kinds of cheese, but his favorite was cheddar. One day, Mickey saw a big piece of cheese that looked different from the ones he usually ate. It was blue and smelled funny. 
Mickey wanted to try it, but he was scared because it looked so different. He tried to resist eating it, but he couldn't help himself. He took a tiny nibble and it tasted amazing! 
From that day on, Mickey learned that trying something different can be really fun. He still loved his cheddar cheese, but he also loved trying new kinds of cheese too. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to eat sugar because it tasted sweet. One day, she went to the park with her mom and saw a small bird. The bird appeared to be looking for something to eat. Lily wanted to share her sugar with the bird, so she put a small piece on the ground. The bird ate the sugar and seemed very happy. 
Suddenly, a small butterfly appeared and flew around the bird and Lily. The butterfly was very pretty with small wings. Lily was amazed by the butterfly's appearance. She wanted to touch it, but her mom told her to be careful. The butterfly flew away and Lily felt sad. But then, she saw a small flower appear next to her. It was also very pretty, with small petals. Lily picked the flower and gave it to her mom. Her mom smiled and said it was the most beautiful flower she had ever seen.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved playing with her toys and drawing pictures. One day, Lily's mom took her to a big park to play. They had so much fun swinging and sliding, but then Lily suddenly felt a rumble in her tummy. She knew what that meant - she had to go to the toilet!
Lily's mom took her to the nearest toilet, but when they got there, they found that the door was locked. Lily started to feel helpless and worried. What would she do if she couldn't go to the toilet? Just then, Lily's mom remembered that she had a special tool in her bag. It was a key that could unlock any toilet door!
Lily's mom used the key to open the toilet door, and Lily was so relieved. She ran inside and did what she needed to do. From that day on, Lily's mom always made sure to include the special key in her bag whenever they went out to play. And Lily never had to feel helpless or worried about finding a toilet again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to drink juice because it was sweet and tasty. One day, Lily's mommy gave her a big glass of juice to drink. Lily was so happy and drank it all up. 
After drinking the juice, Lily wanted to play. She loved to act like a princess and dance around. But her mommy told her to be careful because she might fall and get hurt. Lily listened to her mommy and was very careful while she played. 
Soon it was time for bed and Lily was very tired. She snuggled up in her cozy bed and fell asleep. When she woke up in the morning, she was excited to have more juice and act like a princess again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy who loved to eat candy. One day, Timmy's mom bought him a big bag of candy. Timmy was so happy and he opened the bag right away. But when he looked inside, he saw that there was a soldier toy in the bag too.
Timmy didn't like the soldier toy and he wanted to throw it away. But then he remembered that his friend Billy loved soldiers. So, Timmy decided to give the soldier to Billy. But when Timmy gave the soldier to Billy, Billy didn't want it either. Billy said that his dad was a soldier and he didn't like toys that looked like soldiers.
Timmy didn't know what to do. He wanted to eat his candy and forget about the soldier toy, but he didn't want to be mean to Billy. Finally, Timmy had an idea. He asked Billy if he could trade the soldier toy for some of Billy's candy. Billy agreed and they both went home happy.



Once upon a time, there was a playful puppy named Max. Max loved to run around and play with his toys. One day, Max saw a cobweb in the corner of the room. He barked at it, but it didn't move.
Max's owner, Sarah, came into the room and saw Max barking at the cobweb. "What's wrong, Max?" she asked. Max replied, "There's a cobweb in the corner and it won't play with me."
Sarah smiled and said, "Cobwebs can't play, Max. But I can whistle and we can play together!" So Sarah whistled a happy tune and Max wagged his tail and jumped up and down. They played together until Max was tired and fell asleep.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, fluffy dog named Max. One day, Lily and Max went for a walk in the park. Lily saw a pretty flower and picked it up. Suddenly, Max saw a squirrel and ran after it. 
Lily called out, "Max, come back!" Max didn't listen and ran away. Lily was sad and started to cry. Just then, a kind lady saw Lily crying and asked her what was wrong. Lily told her about Max running away. The kind lady gave Lily a tissue to wipe her tears. 
As they were walking, they saw a man changing a bulb in a lamp. The kind lady said, "Look Lily, that man is very obedient. He's doing his job very well." Lily didn't understand what "obedient" meant, so the kind lady explained, "It means he's doing what he's supposed to do, just like you listen to your mom and dad." 
Suddenly, Max came running back to Lily, wagging his tail. Lily was so happy to see Max that she hugged him tightly. The kind lady smiled and said, "See, Max came back because he loves you and wants to be with you." Lily and Max went home, happy and content.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mom in the kitchen. One day, Lily's mom asked her to organize the kitchen utensils. Lily was excited to help and started to put the spoons, forks, and knives in their proper places.
As she was organizing, Lily noticed an apron hanging on the wall. It was pink and had flowers on it. Lily asked her mom if she could wear the apron while she helped in the kitchen. Her mom said yes and helped her put it on.
While wearing the ancient apron, Lily felt like a chef from a long time ago. She continued to help her mom in the kitchen, feeling proud of herself for organizing the utensils and wearing the special apron. From that day on, Lily wore the apron every time she helped her mom in the kitchen.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Blue. Blue liked to fly high up in the sky and look at the pretty clouds. One day, Blue saw a big rock on the ground and decided to land on it.
Suddenly, a nosy rabbit hopped over and asked, "What are you doing on that rock?"
"I'm just resting," replied Blue.
The rabbit said, "I wish I could fly like you. It must be so much fun!"
"It is," said Blue. "Do you want to come with me?"
The rabbit hopped onto Blue's back and they flew together through the sky. The rabbit was so happy to fly and see the world from up high. From then on, Blue and the rabbit were the best of friends and flew together every day.



One sunny day, Timmy and his mommy went outside to play on the lawn. Timmy saw a tree and wanted to climb it. "Mommy, can I climb the tree?" he asked. "Sure, be careful," mommy replied.
Timmy started to climb the tree. The bark was rough and scratchy on his hands and feet. "This is hard," Timmy said. "You can do it," mommy encouraged.
Finally, Timmy made it to the top of the tree. "Look, mommy, I did it!" he shouted. "You're a great climber," mommy said with a smile. They both sat on a branch and enjoyed the view.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. At the park, she saw a big dinosaur statue. Lily loved dinosaurs! She ran to the statue and pointed at it. "Look, Mommy, a dinosaur!" she said.
After playing for a while, Lily and her mom decided to have a picnic. They spread out a blanket on the grass and put some sandwiches and fruits on it. But then, Lily accidentally spilled her juice on the blanket. "Oh no, it's wet now!" she said. Her mom quickly got a dry towel and wiped the blanket clean. 
Lily was happy again, and they continued their picnic. As they were eating, Lily saw another little girl who looked lonely. She pointed at her and said to her mom, "Mommy, can we share our food with her? She looks sad." Her mom smiled and said yes. They went over to the little girl and offered her some sandwiches and fruits. The little girl smiled and thanked them. From that day on, they became good friends and had many more picnics together at the park.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a little sword that he loved to play with. He would swing it around and pretend to be a brave knight.
One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his sword. But then, he saw a big dog that made him worry. The dog barked loudly and Timmy felt scared. He didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, a bigger boy came and scared the dog away. Timmy was happy that he was safe, but he felt sad that he couldn't protect himself. From that day on, Timmy decided to practice with his little sword every day so that he could be brave like the bigger boy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the forest near her house. One day, she went on an adventure to find something new. She walked and walked until she found a little cottage. Inside, she saw a kind old lady cooking a sausage. 
Lily had never seen a sausage before, so the old lady gave her one to try. It was so yummy that Lily asked if she could have some more. The old lady said yes and gave her a whole pack of new sausages to take home. 
Lily was so happy that she ran all the way back to her house to show her mommy and daddy her new sausages. They were so proud of her for going on an adventure and finding something new. From that day on, Lily would always remember her fun adventure and her love for sausages.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures with her pastel crayons. One day, Lily's mom took her to a store to buy more pastels. The store had so many colors, it was amazing!
Lily's mom told her to pick out the colors she wanted. Lily chose pink, purple, and blue. Her mom paid for them and they went home. When they got home, Lily's mom provided her with paper to draw on. Lily was so happy to have new pastels to use.
Lily drew a picture of a flower garden with her new pastels. She used the pink pastel for the flowers, the purple pastel for the sky, and the blue pastel for the water. Her picture was amazing! Lily was proud of what she had created with her new pastels.



Once upon a time, there was a sleepy human. The human wanted to buy a teddy bear. So, the human went to the toy store. At the toy store, the human saw many toys. The human found a teddy bear and bought it. The human was happy with the teddy bear and went home to sleep with it. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore the world around her. One day, she met a humble old man who owned a small garden.
"Hello, little girl," said the old man. "What brings you here?"
"I like to see the world," replied Lily. "What do you own?"
"I own this garden," said the old man. "It's not much, but it's mine."
Lily looked around the garden and saw all the beautiful flowers and vegetables. "It's so pretty," she said. "Can I help you take care of it?"
The old man smiled and said, "That would be wonderful. Together, we can make the world a more beautiful place." And from that day on, Lily visited the old man's garden every day to help him take care of it. They became good friends and learned that even the smallest things can make a big difference in the world.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet dove named Dolly. Dolly was a pretty bird with white feathers. One day, Lily and Dolly went to the park to play. They saw a boy named Max who had a modern toy car. 
Lily wanted to play with Max's car, but Max said no. Lily felt embarrassed because she really wanted to play with the car. Dolly saw that Lily was sad and flew over to Max's car. Dolly pecked at the wheels and Max got scared. 
Max said, "Your bird is mean!" Lily replied, "No, she just wants to play too." Max thought about it and said, "Okay, you can play with my car." Lily was happy and thanked Dolly for helping her. From that day on, Max and Lily became friends and they all played together with the modern toy car.



Once upon a time, there was a kind man named Tom. Tom liked to sit on his bench in the park and watch the birds. One day, a little girl named Lily came to the park. She saw Tom on his bench and said, "Hi! Can I sit with you?"
Tom smiled and said, "Of course! I am always happy to have company."
Lily sat down and noticed that Tom's bench was very hard. She said, "This bench is not very comfortable. Can I rub it with my towel?"
Tom was very generous and said, "Yes, please do. Maybe it will be more comfortable for us both."
Lily rubbed the bench with her towel and it became much softer. They sat together and watched the birds, happy to have each other's company.



Once upon a time, there was a jolly little elf named Jingle. He loved to play with his friends and make toys. One day, Jingle heard a bell ringing in the distance. He followed the sound and found a lost reindeer. Jingle knew he had to help the reindeer find its way home.
Jingle asked his friends to help him. They searched high and low until they found the reindeer's home. The reindeer was so happy to be reunited with its family. To thank Jingle and his friends, the reindeer's family gave them a special bell. 
Jingle was so excited to have the bell. He knew it would make a great addition to his toy-making. He added the bell to a toy he was making for a little boy. When the boy received the toy, he was so happy to hear the bell ringing. And Jingle was happy too, knowing he had helped the reindeer and made a little boy's day.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to chew on gum. He always had a piece in his mouth, even when he went to bed. 
One day, Timmy was sitting in class when his teacher passed out a test. Timmy was frustrated because he didn't know the answers. He chewed on his gum, trying to think.
After the test, Timmy went to recess. He was still frustrated about the test. He chewed on his gum and walked around the playground. Suddenly, he saw a girl crying because she lost her favorite toy. Timmy knew how it felt to be sad, so he went over to the girl and gave her a big hug. 
The girl stopped crying and smiled. She thanked Timmy and they became friends. Timmy was happy he could help someone else. He passed the rest of the day with a smile on his face, still chewing on his gum.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to watch cartoons on TV. One day, his TV broke and he couldn't watch his favorite shows anymore. Timmy was sad.
Timmy's mom suggested they go to the store to buy a new TV. At the store, they found a cooler TV than Timmy's old one. It was bigger and had more colors. Timmy was happy and wanted to buy it.
But, Timmy's dad said they couldn't afford the cooler TV and they needed to get a reliable one instead. Timmy didn't understand what reliable meant, so his dad explained that it meant the TV would work well for a long time.
In the end, they bought the reliable TV and Timmy was happy again because he could watch his cartoons. Timmy learned that sometimes it's better to have something that works well for a long time than something that looks cool but might not last.



Once upon a time, there was a big boat on the sea. It was dark outside and the boat had to work hard to move through the waves. The captain of the boat was a kind man who loved his job. He had to work all night to make sure the boat stayed on course. 
Suddenly, the boat hit a big wave and the captain fell overboard into the dark sea. He tried to swim, but he was too tired. Just when he thought he was going to sink, a friendly dolphin came to rescue him. The dolphin swam the captain safely back to the boat. 
From that day on, the captain had a new friend and helper. The dolphin would swim alongside the boat and help it work through the waves. And whenever the sea got dark and scary, the captain knew he had a friend to help him through.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going on adventures and exploring new places. One day, he went to the park with his friends. They brought a cooler full of yummy snacks and drinks.
While they were playing, Timmy got distracted and wandered off. When he came back, the cooler was gone! Timmy felt so sad and ashamed that he lost the cooler. His friends were upset too because they were hungry and thirsty.
Timmy decided to look for the cooler. He searched high and low until he found it near a tree. He was so happy and relieved that he found it! Timmy learned a valuable lesson that day: to always keep an eye on his things so he doesn't lose them again.



Once upon a time, there was a happy puppy named Spot. Spot was always cheerful and loved to play with his toys. One day, Spot met a wise old owl who told him about the importance of wisdom. Spot listened carefully and tried to be wise like the owl.
But one day, Spot met a mean cat who didn't like him. The cat slapped Spot and made him sad. Spot didn't know what to do, so he asked the owl for advice. The owl told him to be kind and not to fight back.
However, the next time Spot saw the cat, he forgot the owl's wisdom and decided to slap the cat back. The cat got angry and chased Spot, and unfortunately, Spot got hurt. From then on, Spot remembered the owl's wisdom and never fought again, but he always felt sad about what happened.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance all day long, even when it rained. One day, she went to a dance competition with her friends. They were all very competitive and wanted to win the big trophy.
During the competition, Lily felt nervous but she tried her best. She danced and twirled and jumped around. Suddenly, she saw a boy poking his friend. She thought it was not very nice, but she continued to dance.
In the end, Lily and her friends did not win the trophy, but they still had fun dancing and being together. Lily learned that it's not always about winning, but about having fun and being kind to others.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. One day, Timmy went for a walk in the forest. He saw many trees, birds, and bugs. Suddenly, he saw a big bear. The bear had a dull look in his eyes. Timmy was scared and ran away.
As he ran, he tripped and hurt his shoulder. He cried for help, but nobody came. The bear saw Timmy on the ground and came closer. Timmy tried to run, but his shoulder hurt too much. The bear attacked Timmy and he got hurt badly. 
Timmy learned that he should never go into the forest alone. He should have listened to his parents and stayed at home. From that day on, Timmy never went into the forest again.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Max. Max loved playing with his toy cars, but one day, he noticed that his favorite car didn't work. He asked his mom why and she told him that the battery was dead.
Max didn't know what a battery was, but his mom explained that it was like a little box that gave the car power. Max was patient and waited for his mom to go to the store to buy a new battery.
When his mom came back, Max was excited to play with his car again. But this time, he had to choose which car to play with. He thought about it for a moment and then picked his red car. As he put the battery in, he remembered what his mom had said about it giving the car power.
Max turned the car on and it zoomed across the room. He was so happy that he had chosen the right car and that the new battery worked. From that day on, Max made sure to take good care of all his toy cars and their batteries.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, Lily and her friends saw a big pile of hay. They wanted to play on it, but it was too high. 
Lily's friend, Emily, said, "I wish we could slide down the hay like a slide." 
Lily had an idea. She ran to her house and came back with a helpful tool - a big piece of cardboard. They put the cardboard on the hay and slid down. It was so much fun! 
After playing for a while, they heard a loud noise. It was the farmer who owned the hay. He said, "What are you doing on my hay?" 
Lily said, "We're sorry. We just wanted to play." 
The farmer smiled and said, "I remember when I was your age. I used to play on hay too. But next time, ask me first." From that day on, they always asked the farmer before playing on his hay.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing in the garden and looking at all the pretty flowers. One day, she saw an ugly spider crawling on a flower. She wanted to squish it because it scared her, but her mommy told her not to hurt it. 
Lily watched the spider for a while, but then it vanished! She looked around and couldn't see it anywhere. She realized that the spider was just trying to hide from her because it was scared too. 
From that day on, Lily learned to be kind to all creatures, even the ones that looked scary or ugly. She knew that they were just like her, trying to live their lives in their own way. And she never forgot the lesson that the little spider taught her.



Once upon a time, there was a gentle beetle. He liked to crawl around in the grass and eat leaves. One day, he met a big beetle who was not very nice. The big beetle told the gentle beetle to quit crawling around and to leave the grass. 
The gentle beetle didn't like being told what to do, so he decided to keep crawling around and eating leaves. The big beetle got angry and tried to push the gentle beetle away. But the gentle beetle was too quick and crawled away. 
From that day on, the gentle beetle knew that he didn't have to quit doing what he loved just because someone told him to. He continued to crawl around in the grass and eat leaves, happy and free. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to touch things and feel their texture. One day, she saw a famous painting in a museum. The painting had lots of different textures, like rough rocks and soft clouds.
Lily's mom said, "Don't touch the painting, Lily. It's very important and we don't want to damage it." But Lily couldn't resist. She reached out and touched the painting, just for a second.
That night, Lily had a dream. In her dream, the painting came to life and all the textures she had touched started to fight with each other. The rough rocks were pushing the soft clouds away, and the smooth water was trying to cover everything up.
When Lily woke up, she knew she shouldn't have touched the painting. She felt bad for not listening to her mom. But she also learned that sometimes, our dreams can teach us important lessons.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bake cookies with her grandma. One day, Lily and her grandma made some dough for cookies. The dough was soft and squishy.
Lily's grandma said, "We need to change the dough. Let's add some chocolate chips!" 
Lily was excited and said, "Yay! Chocolate chips!"
They put the chocolate chips in the dough and mixed it all up. Then they put the dough in the oven to bake. 
After a few minutes, the cookies were done. They were so yummy and soft. Lily and her grandma ate the cookies together and had a happy day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the park with her mom and dad. One day, they went to the park and saw a big tree with a rope swing. Lily was eager to try it out, so her dad helped her balance on the swing. She had so much fun swinging back and forth!
After a while, Lily and her family went to the lake to row a boat. Lily sat in the middle of the boat and helped her mom and dad row. She was so proud of herself for helping out. When they got back to shore, Lily was tired but happy. She had balanced on the swing and helped row the boat. It was a great day at the park!



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside with his friends. One day, something scary happened. Timmy fell off his bike and hit his head. His mom took him to the doctor and they found out he had a big bump on his skull. Timmy was very frightened, but his mom hugged him and told him everything would be okay. After a few days, Timmy felt much better and was back to playing with his friends. From that day on, Timmy always wore a helmet when he rode his bike to make sure nothing scary would happen again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a great home with her family. But one day, Lily noticed that her home was not very clean. Her toys were all over the floor and there was dust everywhere.
Lily decided to improve her home by cleaning up her toys and helping her family to tidy up. She put her dolls in their toy box and picked up all the blocks. Then she helped her mom sweep the floors and dust the furniture.
After they finished cleaning, Lily's home looked even greater than before! Her family was so proud of her for taking care of their home. From that day on, Lily made sure to keep her home clean and tidy so it would always be a great place to live.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the stream near her house. The stream was very clean and had many fish swimming in it.
One day, Lily's friend, Max, came to play with her. Max wanted to lead the game, but Lily wanted to play something else. They started to argue and Lily got upset. She didn't want to play with Max anymore.
Lily went to sit by the stream and watched the fish swim. Max came over and said, "I'm sorry. I didn't mean to make you upset. Can we play together again?" Lily forgave Max and they played together by the stream, splashing in the water and catching fish. They both had so much fun and were happy again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to write stories about dragons and knights. He would sit at his desk and write for hours. One day, Timmy's friend Billy came over to play. Billy brought a toy weapon with him. Timmy thought the weapon looked fine and cool, but his mom told him that weapons were not toys and could hurt people.
Later that day, Timmy and Billy went to the park to play. Billy started to swing the weapon around and accidentally hit Timmy. Timmy was hurt and started to cry. Billy felt bad and apologized. Timmy's mom came over and told them that weapons were dangerous and not to be played with. She said that it was important to always think about safety and not just what looks cool or fine.
From that day on, Timmy and Billy played with toys that were safe and fun. They learned that it's important to always think before playing with anything that could hurt themselves or others. Writing stories about dragons and knights was much safer and just as fun.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved jelly. One day, Lily and her mom went to the store to buy some jelly. When they got to the store, they saw that the jelly was very expensive.
Lily said, "Mommy, can we buy the jelly? I really want it."
Mommy replied, "Yes, we can buy it, but we have to pay a lot of money for it."
Lily was so lucky that her mommy bought the jelly for her. She ate it all up and it was very yummy. From that day on, Lily knew that if she wanted something, she had to ask nicely and be grateful when she got it.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to look at the stars at night. She would point at them and say, "Look, Mama! Stars!" One night, Lily saw a very bright star in the sky. She wanted to examine it closer, so she asked her Mama if she could use her telescope. Mama said yes and helped Lily set it up.
Lily looked through the telescope and saw the star up close. But then, she started to feel uncomfortable. She felt like something was crawling on her skin. She tried to ignore it and kept looking at the star. But the feeling got worse and worse.
Suddenly, Lily screamed and dropped the telescope. Her Mama rushed over to see what happened. Lily was covered in ants! They had crawled all over her while she was looking through the telescope. Lily was very scared and uncomfortable. Mama quickly brushed the ants off, but Lily was still very upset. She never wanted to look at the stars again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys, but she didn't like to share them with her friends. One day, Lily's friend Emma came over to play. Emma asked if she could play with Lily's toy car, but Lily said no. Emma felt sad and said, "Lily, why won't you share your toys with me?"
Lily sighed and said, "I don't want to share because I want to play with them all by myself." Emma said, "That's not very nice. Sharing is caring, and it's not nice to be selfish." Lily thought about what Emma said and realized she was being selfish. She decided to share her toys with Emma, and they had a lot of fun playing together.
After they finished playing, Emma said, "Thank you for sharing your toys with me, Lily. You're a good friend." Lily smiled and said, "You're welcome, Emma. I learned that sharing is important and it makes me happy too." Emma smiled and they hugged each other. From that day on, Lily always shared her toys with her friends, and they all had fun playing together.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved sunflowers. She had a big garden where she grew lots of sunflowers. One day, she met a man who wanted to buy some sunflowers from her.
"Hello little girl, your sunflowers are so pretty. Can I buy some from you?" the man asked.
Lily replied, "Yes, you can buy some. But I'm sorry, I don't know how much to sell them for."
"That's okay," said the man. "I'll give you five dollars for five sunflowers."
Lily was happy to sell her sunflowers and took the money from the man. She said goodbye and went inside to show her mom the money she earned. From that day on, Lily knew how to sell her sunflowers and made lots of money.



Once upon a time, there was a big cabinet in a house. The cabinet was very fragile and could break easily. One day, a little girl was playing near the cabinet when she accidentally knocked it over. The cabinet fell down and started to rot because it was made of old wood. The little girl felt very sad and scared because she thought she had done something wrong. But then her mommy came and said it was okay and they would fix the cabinet together. The little girl felt much better and learned that accidents happen sometimes, but it's important to be careful and ask for help when something goes wrong.



Once upon a time, there was a big boat with a door. The door was called a port. The boat could go on the water and take people to different places. 
One day, the wind was very strong and the boat was moving a lot. The captain told everyone to shut the port so the water would not come inside. 
The port was made of a flexible material that could move easily. When the wind stopped, the captain opened the port again and they continued their journey. 
Everyone was happy and they arrived at their destination safely. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to climb things, like trees and rocks. One day, Timmy saw a very tall ladder and wanted to climb it. 
Timmy climbed and climbed until he reached the top. There, he met a foolish bird who had flown into a tree. The bird was stuck and couldn't get down. Timmy felt sad for the bird and decided to help. 
Timmy climbed back down the ladder and found a way to help the bird. He gently lifted the bird out of the tree and set it free. The bird flew away, happy and grateful to have met such a kind friend like Timmy.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved ice-cream very much. One day, Timmy and his mom went to the park to eat ice-cream. Timmy was so glad and happy. 
But then, Timmy struggled to eat his ice-cream because it was melting so fast. He tried to lick it quickly, but it was too hard. His mom helped him and they ate the ice-cream together. Timmy was glad his mom was there to help him. 
After they finished their ice-cream, Timmy and his mom played on the swings and had fun. They had a great day at the park together. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a clever dog named Max. Max was very intelligent and knew many tricks. One day, Max got into trouble when he chased a cat and got stuck in a fence. He tried to wiggle and waggle, but he couldn't get free.
Max's owner saw him and knew how to help. She used a key to unlock the fence and set Max free. Max was so happy and licked his owner's face to say thank you. From then on, Max knew to be careful when chasing cats so he wouldn't get into trouble again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved candy more than anything in the world. One day, her mom gave her a big bag of candy. Lily was so happy that she started to shake with excitement.
But then, her brother came into the room and asked for some candy. Lily didn't want to share because she wanted to eat it all herself. Her brother got angry and said, "If you don't share, I'm going to tell Mom!"
Lily didn't want to get in trouble, so she reluctantly gave her brother some candy. But as he ate it, he suddenly stopped moving. Lily was scared and ran to get her mom. When they came back, they found her brother dead on the floor.
It turned out that the candy was bad and had made her brother sick. Lily felt so guilty for not sharing and promised to always share her candy from now on. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved robots. He had a toy robot that he played with every day. One day, Timmy went to a store with his mom and saw a big robot. It was very tall and shiny. Timmy wanted to touch it, but it was too high for him.
Timmy's mom asked the store owner if Timmy could touch the robot. The store owner said yes, and he helped Timmy touch the robot's arm. Timmy was so happy and proud that he got to touch a real robot. He smiled and told his mom that he loved robots even more now. From that day on, Timmy wanted to be a robot when he grew up.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pretty dress that she loved to wear. One day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a kind lady sitting on a bench. Lily walked over to the lady and said hello. The lady smiled and said hello back. Lily asked if she could touch the lady's hand. The lady said yes and Lily touched her soft hand. Lily felt happy and went back to playing.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had long hair that always got tangled up. One day, her mom gave her a comb and said, "Lily, you need to comb your hair every morning so it doesn't get messy."
Lily tried to comb her hair, but it was too hard. She couldn't get the tangles out. She said to herself, "I can't do it. My hair is too messy."
Her mom heard her and said, "Don't worry, Lily. Just keep trying. You can do it." Her mom showed her how to shake the comb gently to get the tangles out.
Lily tried again and this time, she was able to comb her hair. She felt so proud and modest. She said to her mom, "Thank you for helping me. I did it!"




Bob and Sarah were two best friends. One day, they wanted to go for a jog together. Sarah put on her running shoes and Bob wore his new red shirt. They asked the guard to let them go outside. The guard said yes and they ran out.
As they were running, they started talking. Bob said, "I'm so happy to be here with you." Sarah smiled and they both laughed. 
But when they reached the park, they realized it was a bit too far to jog. Sarah said, "Let's just walk a bit, it's much faster." 
They kept walking until they reached the lake. They stopped to rest and noticed how grey the water was and how bitter the air smelled. Bob shivered, feeling a bit scared. 
Sarah put her arm around him. She said, "Let's jog back and the guard will keep us safe." So, they started jogging and Bob felt happy again. When they reached back home, they were laughing and smiling. Then they said goodbye, until the next time they would go for a jog together.




George had a big problem; he couldn't find his path. He had been walking for what felt like hours and still couldn't find his way. Finally, he noticed something unique up ahead.
George found a small house at the end of the path. He was so relieved, he ran up to knock on the door.
"Hello?" he said, "Can you help me find my way?"
A kind woman opened the door and said, "I can help. Come in."
George went inside the house and the woman offered him a warm drink. She said, "This will warm you up and help you figure out where to go."
George thanked the woman and followed her instructions. He found his way back home just in time and was so grateful to her. He wanted to show his gratitude, so every week he would go to her house and offer to serve her in any way he could. 
He was so happy to have found such a unique path and the kind woman who served him the warm drink that day!




The sun was shining on a bright day. Jack and his dad, John, were walking in the forest. They heard a rustling noise.
John said, "Let's see who's there. You stay here, Jack. OK?"
Jack nodded.
John moved closer to the sound and saw a little brown fox. The fox wasn't afraid. It just stood there.
John, who was very surprised, said softly, "I have an idea. Do you trust me?"
The fox seemed to understand, and nodded. 
John reached out his hand and the fox touched it gently. 
Jack loved the idea of his dad and fox being friends. 
John said, "See? We can trust each other." 
The fox scampered off, with John and Jack smiling. 
Jack had learned that day to trust people and animals.




Once upon a time, there was a pretty little girl named Lucy. She had a best friend named Tom. Tom was always very kind to Lucy.
One day, Lucy decided to go visit Tom. She packed her bag with her favorite things and set off. But on her way, Lucy started to worry. What if Tom wasn't home when she arrived? What if he was busy and couldn't play with her?
Just as Lucy was about to give up hope, she heard a voice calling to her. It was Tom! He had stayed up just to wait for her. 
Tom gave Lucy a big hug as soon as she arrived and said, I was so worried that you werent coming! 
Lucy was so happy to see her best friend that she forgot all about her worries. They had a wonderful day together, playing and having fun. 
The moral of the story is: never give up when something worries you. When you trust in your friendship, amazing things can happen.




Once upon a time, there was a small bird called Bob. Bob was very persistent and always wanted to visit the forest. He asked his mom if he could go, but she said no.
Bob wasn't going to give up that easily. He packed his bag with snacks and said goodbye to his mom. Bob hopped off in the direction of the forest.
On his way to the forest, Bob heard a loud noise. He stopped and looked up. He saw a soldier flying in a big red helicopter. The soldier was going to the forest as well.
Bob was scared, but he was also determined. He was going to visit the forest no matter what! Bob kept on going and eventually made it to the forest. 
When he landed, Bob shouted, "Hello! I made it!"
The soldier flew by and laughed. "You are very persistent!" he said. 
Bob smiled and enjoyed his visit to the forest.



Once upon a time, there was a thin girl called Rose. Rose loved going to festivals and spending time with friends. 
One day, when she was walking home, Rose saw something which surprised her. It was a big, colourful festival with lots of people, music and fun activities. It was even bigger than any festival she had seen before! 
Rose was so happy and excited, she couldn't wait to tell all her friends about it. She quickly ran up to her house to invite them. 
In the end, Rose and her friends had the best time ever at the festival. They had a big party and danced all night! They were so happy and surprised that Rose had found such a great festival.



 
Once upon a time, there was a brave robot called Sparky. Every day, he would go out and fix broken things. 
One day, Sparky saw a huge wreck in the middle of the road. He wanted to help, so he decided to go and fix it. When he arrived, he saw it was a bus. 
"Oh no!" Sparky said. "That needs to be fixed!" He worked hard and fixed the bus. 
Just then, a driver appeared from nowhere. "Thank you for fixing my bus," he said. "I was worried it could never be fixed, but you made it work again. You are so loyal." 
Sparky smiled. "You're welcome," he said. 
And that was how Sparky fixed the bus and made the driver very happy.




Molly was playing at the park. She saw a big, helpful alligator. After being brave, she said 'hello' to him. The alligator said, "Hi! It is hot today. Would you like to go for a swim in the pond?" Molly smiled and said, "Yes please!"
The alligator took her for a fun swim in the pond, where it was nice and cool. After the swim, Molly thanked the alligator for his help. Suddenly, Molly heard a loud 'Sss!'. She looked around and saw a small alligator in the pond, who started to grow bigger. Molly started to get scared and the helpful alligator said, "Don't worry, that's just my friend Jimmy!"
Molly thanked Jimmy for keeping her safe and said goodbye to him and the helpful alligator. She walked home feeling happy, knowing that alligators can be friendly.



Once upon a time there was a wild goose. Every day it soared in the sky, feeling proud and strong. But one day it was feeling weak. As it flew over a meadow it heard a loud roar. It was scared and flew away quickly.
When the goose landed in the woods it could still hear the roaring. The noise was getting closer and closer. Suddenly the goose was surrounded by a very big, angry lion. The lion roared loudly and the goose trembled in fear.
Suddenly the goose remembered it was strong. It spread its wings and bravely flapped them. The lion was so surprised it ran away. The goose stayed strong and watched the lion run farther and farther away. Then it took off into the sky and flew away into the night.




Once upon a time, there were two brothers. One was small, and the other was much bigger. 
The small brother always wanted to do things like his bigger brother, but he couldn't reach as high, or run as fast as him. 
One day, they were playing outside. The small brother said, "I wish I could jump, like you!" His big brother smiled and said "I bet you can, if you try!" 
The small brother was so excited, he tried and tried and he eventually jumped up and down, just like his big brother. He was so proud of himself.
The big brother guesed, "That was so great! If you keep taking small steps and practice, you can do anything you set your mind to!"
The small brother nodded and the brothers kept on playing, trying different things. The big brother was always there to help, and before they knew it, a whole minute had gone by. 
The two brothers had such a great time, and it showed them that with patience, practice and help from others, anything is possible.




Once upon a time, there was a beautiful fragile cross.
The cross lived in a magical forest, right by a river. Every morning birds filled the sky with joyous singing and the wind filled the trees with a peaceful melody. 
One day, the cross decided to go on an adventure. She picked herself up and walked over to the river. There she filled her tiny hands with water and cast it into the sky.
Just then, a small creature in a boat appeared. It asked, Why did you fill the sky?
The cross smiled and replied, To make it look pretty!
The little creature laughed and said, Thats a wonderful idea. Let me take you with me.
And so, with a single tug, the little boat filled with the fragile cross, and they spent the rest of the day exploring the river together.




Once upon a time, there was an intelligent kangaroo. His name was Sam. He was very friendly and he liked to jump around in the bush. One day, he went out to look for food. Suddenly, a big very mean animal appeared. It was a lion. 
The lion wanted to spoil Sam. He wanted to eat him! Sam was scared, but he thought of a clever plan. He ran away as fast as he could and he was too quick for the lion.
The lion got very angry. He couldn't believe how intelligent the kangaroo was. He then decided to spoil other kangaroos in the bush. He ran around and scared them all. 
Sam was sad. He saw the lion scaring the other kangaroos and he knew he couldn't do anything about it. He wished he had more power but he was just a kangaroo. So, Sam watched as the lion spoiled the other kangaroos. In the end he had to accept that the lion had the power and there was nothing he could do.




Mollie enjoyed playing with her toys every day. One day when she was playing outside, she found an old pin. It looked interesting, so she kept it. That night, she showed her mom the pin.
Mollie's mom was troubled. She said, "Mollie, that pin does not belong to you. You must give it back to its rightful owner."
Mollie was sad. She wanted to keep the pin, so she reluctantly agreed to put it back.
The next day, Mollie went outside to return the pin. But when she found the spot where she had found it, it was gone. She was very sad. She was sure someone else now had the pin that she wanted to keep.




Once upon a time, there was a restless little mouse. She scurried around busily, never feeling at rest. One day, the mouse heard a strange sound coming from the corner of her room.
"Shake, shake!" the sound said.
The mouse was surprised and a little scared. She cautiously inched closer and looked around the corner. There she saw a tiny puppy, gently shaking his ears.
"What are you doing?" asked the mouse.
The puppy stopped shaking, and said, "I shake my ears when I'm feeling restless. It helps me feel better."
The mouse thought about this for a moment, then decided to give it a try. She began shaking her own ears, and soon felt much more relaxed.
From then on, whenever the mouse felt restless, she would shake her ears, and it would help her feel better.




Once upon a time, there was a man who wanted to marry. So, he went to the field to find a wife. He was so happy, he sang and jumped.
Suddenly, a woman appeared. She was beautiful. She asked, Why are you so happy? The man said, I'm going to marry!
The woman said, You should be grateful for what you have. Don't try to make your life more complicated. 
The man thought about what she said and gasped. He realized that he already had everything he wanted.
From then on, the man stayed in the field and kept his life simple. He found joy in the little things and was ever so grateful.
The moral of the story is that it is important to be grateful for what we have and not try to complicate our lives.




Once it was time to perform the show. The audience waited in the room, excited to see what was to come.
The first actor stepped forward and they placed a big print on the wall. The print was deliciously sour, and the room filled with smiles.
The actor then performed on stage and everyone applauded. He danced and sang, and soon everyone was singing along. 
The last song was a big hit and everyone was clapping. The actor bowed and the audience was clapping so loud.
The show was over, but everyone was still smiling. Everyone had enjoyed their time, and the sour print left on the wall.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived in a big world. Her name was Marie. Every morning, she would fill a bucket with water from the nearby river to bring back to her home. 
One day, Marie was very worried. She didn't know why, but for some reason she could not fill her bucket with water. No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't get the water to fill up the bucket. She had a feeling that something was wrong.
Marie told her mother about the problem. Her mother frowned. "I think something must have happened to the river," her mother said. 
So Marie and her mother went on a journey to the river. As they approached it, they saw that the river was much lower than normal. Marie's mother put a hand on her shoulder and said, "See, you were right to be worried. Something has happened to the river. We must fix it and fill it again." 
And so, with determination and hard work, Marie and her mother worked together to fill the river once again. The river sparkled, and Marie was filled with joy! 
The end.



Once upon a time there was a charming little port. All the boats would come in for docking and refueling before going off to explore new lands. One day a young sailor named Jack set off on a grand adventure, with one mission: to rescue his beloved sailboat from a distant island.
Jack was so determined to reach his goal, but as he ventured farther out to sea, he began to fear he would never get there in time. Suddenly, a wave washed up onto the deck, revealing a tiny island in the distance. Without hesitation, Jack steered his boat toward the small port.
At the charming port, Jack was able to refuel his boat and find supplies for his rescue mission. He said his goodbyes to the friendly locals and sailed off into the horizon. Finally, after days of sailing, Jack arrived at his destination  the island where his beloved sailboat was stranded.
Jack set out to explore the island, until he discovered his sailboat, just as he had left it. With great joy he was able to rescue his boat from the island and make his voyage back home. What an adventurer Jack had been!



 
Once upon a time there was girl called Rachel. She was 3 years old and very curious. One day Rachel's parents left her alone in her room. She had been warned not to go near the big wardrobe in the room. 
As soon as her parents left, Rachel went over to the wardrobe and opened the door. To her surprise, it was much bigger inside than it was from the outside. Rachel went inside and the door closed shut. She was worried and started to cry.  
Suddenly she heard a voice. "Hello Rachel! I'm the wardrobe! I'm not scary, I promise." Rachel wiped away her tears and replied, "Hello wardrobe! What happened?" 
The wardrobe replied, "I shrunk you! Now you can explore my world." Rachel was excited to explore the wardrobe and went off on her adventure. She discovered a magic world inside and remained there for hours. 
When Rachel was ready to leave, the wardrobe welcomed her back and said, "Welcome back Rachel! I'm glad I didn't scare you away."




Once upon a time, there was an ancient sheep. She lived in a meadow filled with flowers. Every day, she would graze in the sun and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.
One day, a young lamb came to the meadow. He said to the ancient sheep, "Can I join you?" The ancient sheep was very happy. She smiled and said, "Yes, you are welcome here."
The two sheep started to explore the meadow together. They walked through the tall grass and watched the butterflies. They found a lake and admire the ripples of the water.
The ancient sheep and the young lamb became very good friends. They came back to the meadow every day to play together. The ancient sheep was so happy to have found a friend.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Jane. She had a special dress which she liked to keep and wear. One day, Jane wanted to take her dress on a walk, so she put it on and went to the park by herself.
At first, Jane felt excited to be wearing her special dress, but soon she became a bit lonely. She looked around and saw nobody else walking alone like she was. She started to feel sad.
Just then, a friendly dog came up to Jane. He had a big smile on his face and Jane smiled back. The two of them started to play together and Jane soon forgot about being lonely.
The two friends kept playing until it was time to go home. Jane thanked her new friend and gave him a big hug. She felt much better and didn't feel so lonely anymore.
The next day, Jane put on her dress again and went back to the park. She was sure to keep her special dress safe as she looked forward to playing with her new friend again.




Jack was scared. He had never seen anything like this before.
He was looking at a big circle on the ground. He had never seen a circle so big before.
Jack didn't know what to do. He was so scared.
Suddenly, the circle opened and out jumped a big, scary monster. Jack screamed and ran away.
He ran and ran until he came to his house. He opened the door and ran inside, screaming.
His mom asked, "What is it Jack? What happened?"
"A monster!" he said, "A monster jumped out of a big circle! I'm scared!"
His mom hugged him and said, "Don't be scared Jack. That was just a nightmare. Everything is okay."
Jack smiled. He knew his mom was right. He was safe at home and the scary monster was gone.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was three years old and loved to explore. Today she was playing in her garden when she saw a triangle. She picked it up and it was filthy. But she didn't care and hugged it.
Suddenly, a voice said, "Why are you hugging that triangle?" Lily laughed and said, "Because I like it!"
The voice belonged to her grandmother. She smiled and said, "It looks like it needs a good wash first. Let's go to the bathroom and give it a rinse."
So together, Lily and her grandmother washed the triangle in the sink until it was shiny and clean. Afterwards, Lily hugged her triangle tightly and thanked her grandmother.
From that day forward, the triangle was Lily's favorite toy and she hugged it every day. The end.




John was playing catch with his dad. He threw the baseball and it landed deep in the grass. His dad said, "You need to run and get it, John."
John said, "But Daddy, it's too far away."
His dad said, "Nothing is too far away when you try. Please go get it."
John was scared. He did not want to get close to the deep grass. But his dad showed him how to count to three and said, "One, two... three - go!"
John ran and found the baseball. He couldn't believe it! He was so proud and showed it to his dad with a big smile. His dad patted him on the head and said, "Good job, John. Everything is possible if you try."
John and his dad continued playing catch. This time, John threw the ball even farther away and ran to get it. His dad said, "That's great! Anything is possible if you believe and try."
The moral of the story is that if you believe in yourself and try, anything is possible.




Once upon a time there was a gray baby elephant. His name was Spike. He was always very playful and curious about the world around him.
One day he ran into the woods to explore. In the woods he met a friendly bee.
The bee asked Spike, Hi Spike, why are you here?
Spike replied, Im here to raise some fun!
The bee smiled and said, That sounds like a great idea! Lets play some games.
So they played all day, until the sun started to go down. When it was dark, the bee said to Spike, I think its time for me to go home. Do you want to come and raise with me another day?
Spike smiled and said, Yes! That would be great! Ill see you soon!
The bee waved goodbye and flew away. Spike waved goodbye too and walked back to the grey elephant herd. He looked forward to raising with the bee again soon.




Sophie and her brother Ben were playing in their living room. Ben had a big red guitar. He was strumming it until it made a pleasant sound. Sophie loved the peaceful music it made.
Suddenly, they started to quarrel. Sophie was crying, and Ben was angry.
'It's my guitar!' Ben said loudly.
'It is not!' Sophie shouted back.
Their mother came in. 'What is going on here?' she said calmly.
Ben and Sophie stopped fighting. They both looked down.
'I will put the guitar back and make some tea for us all,' she said.
Sophie and Ben felt peaceful as they sipped their tea and enjoyed a slice of cake. 'Let's go play outside,' Sophie suggested.
Ben and Sophie ran out to the garden, smiling, and the guitar was tucked away safely.




The sun was setting in the evening sky and the sky was painted in a beautiful red colour. 
"Mom, what is that beautiful colour?" asked little Maya. 
"That is the evening sky, sweetheart," said mom. 
Maya smiled with delight and said, "I hope that it stays red forever!" 
Her mom chuckled and said, "I'm sure that we can see a red evening sky again. But for now, let's go inside. 
Maya gave one last look at the red sky before she and her mom headed inside. She hoped that the beautiful red sky would still be there tomorrow. 
Then she said, "Goodnight, red sky."




Jim was a little bear. He was only 3 years old. One day, his mum told him to put his coat on because they were going to the park. Jim was so excited. He ran to his bedroom to get his coat.
But when he reached for it, his hand got stuck on a hook. He screamed in fear. His mum rushed to him and saw him stuck. She gently took his hand and said "it's ok, darling. It's ok".
Jim looked around his room and realised that the hook was a deep blue colour and very different from the warm colours in his room. He told his mum that he wanted to paint the hook.
She smiled and told him "you can paint it if you want - but never forget to stay away from hooks. They can look beautiful but they can also give you a fright".
Jim painted the hook a nice yellow colour - to remind him never to forget what his mum had said. He realised that it's not always about being attractive - sometimes it's about being safe.




Once there was a brave girl who liked to hike. One day, she decided to hike near a volcano. The volcano was big, and she was a bit scared, but she was also very ready.
She hiked to the bottom of the volcano, and looking up was amazed at how huge it was. Suddenly, the volcano began to shake, and the girl knew it was about to erupt. All around her people started to run, but the brave girl decided to resist.
No! I will not run away! shouted the girl.
So, despite the lava and the danger, the girl stayed and faced the volcano. As it erupted, she kept her ground and kept her head high. Finally, the volcano stopped, and the girl was safe. All around her, people applauded her bravery.
The girl smiled, feeling proud that she had resisted the volcano. She was ready for anything!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, a bear and a rabbit. One day, they set out to explore the forest. But it was not too long before they found themselves completely lost.
The bear looked around and thought of a plan. "Let's go that way!", he said, pointing one direction. But the rabbit shook his head and pointed the other way.
The bear sighed and shrugged. "It doesn't matter which way we go, anyway. I guess we'll just have to take a chance," he said. 
The rabbit nodded and said, "That sounds smart. Let's go!" So they headed one way.
After a while, they came across a bridge over a river. On the other side, the bear and rabbit could see some food and a way out of the forest. But the bridge had a sign on it: "Cross here and you will lose your skin!"
The bear shuddered. "That's stupid," he said. "We'd better find another way out."
The rabbit and the bear thought for a moment. Then the rabbit said, "I know. Let's go back the way we came and try a different path." 
The bear and the rabbit looked at each other and then nodded. So they headed back, always looking for a way out.
At last, they found the way out. The moral of their story? Don't




Once there was a little girl. She was three years old, with blonde hair and blue eyes. One day she was playing in her garden when it started to rain. The little girl didn't have a coat, so she got very wet. She was soaked! 
The little girl was sad because she was so wet and cold. But then an idea came to her. She went to her mom and dad and asked for a big bath. They said yes, so she filled it up with water and then she jumped in. It felt so warm and lovely, and soon she was completely soaked!
Meanwhile, outside the rain was still falling, and it made a big puddle on the garden. It was smelly and filthy, but the little girl laughed because she was so warm and dry in her bath. 
The puddle stayed there for days, but one night the rain finally stopped. The sun came out and the smelly puddle went away. The little girl was so happy that it was all gone. She had had so much fun in the bath and knew she was safe and dry. 
The end!



 
One night, a bear and a rabbit were walking in the woods. The night was dark and the stars twinkled in the sky. Suddenly, a distant noise made the rabbit tremble.
The bear said, "What is that noise and why are you trembling?"
The rabbit replied, "I am scared because the noise is trouble."
The bear was brave and he said, "Let's go and see!"
They walked together until they saw a big lion in the distance. The rabbit trembled again and said, "Help! That lion is trouble! We need to run!"
The bear knew the lion was fierce, so he quickly said, "Quickly, let's go back and run away!"
The rabbit and the bear ran as fast as they could and they were soon far away from the distant lion. The rabbit was relieved and no longer trembling.




Anna and her mom were in the kitchen. Her mom was very noisy.
Anna asked her mom, "Why are you so noisy?"
Her mom said, "I'm fixing the faucet."
Anna said, "What's a faucet?"
Her mom said, "It's a thing I use to get water in the sink."
Anna knelt down next to her mom and put her small hands over her mom's hands.
Her mom smiled, "Let's try and fix it together."
They both listened to the faucet and found out what parts were broken.
Then Anna's mom said, "Let's kneel down together and pray we can fix it."
They held hands and bowed down. Anna closed her eyes and said a pray they could fix the faucet.
When they opened their eyes the faucet was fixed! Everything was now quiet and the water was coming out of the faucet.
Anna was so happy. Her mom had made her prayer come true. She thanked her mom for fixing the faucet.




Once there was a new gorilla. He was walking around the jungle happily. Then he saw another gorilla teasing him. The new gorilla got angry and ran towards the teasing gorilla. They started to fight and soon the entire jungle was filled with laughter. Everyone was cheering them on. The new gorilla was finally stronger and he managed to win the fight. After the fight finished, the new gorilla was feeling pleased with himself and went off in search of new adventures.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She was a very smart girl and loved to solve puzzles. On this special day, she was given a very special puzzle to solve. The box was very tight and she couldn't open it. She tried and tried but nothing worked. Suddenly she remembered that her Daddy had told her she had to spell some special words to open the box. 
Sarah concentrated very hard and did her best to remember the secret spell. She thought about it for a long time and then - she solved the puzzle! The spell was right and the box popped open! Inside the box was a special surprise for Sarah and she was very very happy. 
Sarah learned that when faced with a tough puzzle, a special spell will always solve it.



Once upon a time, there lived four friends who lived together. They wanted to share a meal together, so they went to get their knives ready. One friend was careful and wanted to make sure it was safe so she sorted the knives. Some were too sharp and some were too dull. She found four that were just right and gave one to each of her friends. She was so proud that she had kept them safe. 
They enjoyed their meal together and ate with their knives. Everyone was so happy and they all said they had the best time. After that, they promised that each time they had dinner together, they would always sort the knives first to make sure it was safe for everyone. 




Once there was a little girl. She was very special and had a magical bracelet. It seemed like it lit up whenever she was near. One day, a man saw the girl's bracelet and wanted to buy it. He offered the girl a lot of money, but she said no. The man got angry and said that the bracelet was ugly.
The girl felt sad and ran away. She ran to a hidden place and cried. Suddenly, the bracelet lit up brighter than ever before and made a magical sound. The girl looked up and saw that her bracelet had grown bigger and bigger. It was three times bigger than before and much more beautiful.
The girl was so happy that she ran outside and showed everyone her bracelet. Everyone was amazed and said it was the most beautiful bracelet ever. The man who said it was ugly could not believe his eyes.




One day, a little girl was playing in the garden. She had a red balloon in her hand and she was having lots of fun. Suddenly, she heard a loud bzzz noise in the sky. She looked up and saw a tiny, blue airplane. She laughed and waved at it.
The airplane noticed her and came flying closer. It waved back at the little girl and said, "Hello! I'm looking for work. Can you help me?"
The little girl got very excited and said, "Yes, I can help you! What kind of work do you want to do?" 
The airplane replied, "I'm looking for something to do with my head. Can you find something for me?"
The little girl thought for a moment and then had an idea. She said, "I know just the job for you! You can be my kite friend in the sky! Your blue head will match the kite, and you can work with me to make it fly really high!"
The airplane was overjoyed and happily agreed. So, the little girl put the string of her kite in the airplanes head and they went flying up into the sky together. The little girl had lots of fun and the airplane was very proud of its new job.



Once upon a time there was a big, strong lion. It lived in a very big and rich jungle. Every day the lion would take a long nap in the sun. One day, while the lion was napping, a cheeky monkey spotted a bright and shiny tie.
The monkey just had to have it! He ran over to the lion and tugged at the tie but it was too tight. The lion woke up with a start and roared so loudly that the monkey flew away in fright! 
Once the lion realised what the monkey was trying to do, he laughed. He knew the monkey just wanted to look as rich and fancy as the lion did! He never saw the monkey again, but he never forgot its beautiful bright tie.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was walking to school one day when she saw a white stranger. The girl was scared, but she didn't run away because she had been taught to be brave.
The girl bravely asked the stranger, "Who are you?" But the white stranger didn't answer. He just kept walking.
The girl kept following the stranger, but no matter how many times she asked who he was, he didn't respond. So the girl decided to ignore him and keep walking.
But then, the white stranger stopped walking and suddenly turned around. He grabbed the girl and threw her in a dark van. The girl screamed for help, but the stranger drove off before anyone could hear her.
The stranger took the girl to a scary place and left her there. Then he drove away and never came back.
That's why it's important to never ignore a stranger.




Riley was feeling sad. He had lost his favourite toy and did not know where it was. He was frowning and his mommy saw him. She put some lotion on her hand and put it on Riley's forehead.
"There, there," she said.
But things weren't getting better. Riley's big brother was being bossy. He kept telling Riley to play with something else.
Riley got more and more upset, until he was crying. His mommy tried to help him again, but it was no use. Riley's toy was lost and wouldn't be found.
In the end, Riley felt very sad. He had tried his best, but things just didn't work out. He had to go to bed without his toy and it was not a happy ending.



Once upon a time, there was a bright child named Mia. She was always looking for ways to explore and have fun. One day, Mia and her mom were camping in the woods. They set up their tent and made a campfire. 
Mia declared, "Mom, let's go explore the woods!" 
But her mom said, "No, Mia. It's getting dark, the woods can be dangerous. You could get lost or hurt."
Mia thought for a moment, and then she said, "I'm strong and I'm very bright. I know I can find my way back if something does happen."
Her mom thought for a moment, then finally yielded. She said, "Alright, Mia. I can tell you're a brave girl, so I trust you. Just stick to the path and come back before it gets too dark."
Mia was so excited! She grabbed her flashlight and ventured off into the woods. She loved exploring and discovering new things. She confidently made her way along the path, looking for things to explore. 
But then, something unexpected happened. Mia took a wrong turn and got lost! She tried to get back to the path, but with the darkness, it was hard to find her way. Suddenly, she saw a bright light coming through the bushes. It was her mom, who had followed her in the dark. 
Mia's mom hugged her




Once upon  a time there was a little girl named Mia. She was 3 years old and loved birthdays. Unfortunately, Mia's last birthday was very different than her previous ones. Instead of having a melting cake and presents, she only had a healthy cookie. Everyone in her family was feeling sad.
Mia was feeling very sad too but she tried to keep a smile on her face. She decided to go play in the park. On her way there she saw a lot of kids playing and she sighed. She wished she could be outside with them but she felt a bit lonely.
Suddenly, she heard somebody calling her. She saw one of her favorite friends holding a present and a birthday cake. Her friends had come to give her a surprise birthday party! 
Mia was so happy! Instead of feeling lonely, she was now surrounded by all the kids playing together. She learned that day that it is important to be kind and caring and that it can make somebody happy even if they don't have a lot of gifts.  Mia was so grateful, and she and her friends ate a healthy birthday cake together.




Once upon a time, there was a tiny girl. She had the most beautiful eyes in the world and she was so curious about the world.
One day, she heard a strange noise in the forest. She decided to search for the noise because it sounded really curious to her.
When she arrived in the forest, she saw her best friend John running away from a cloud of smoke. She was so envious that he found something fun.
John saw the little girl and shouted, "Help me! There is something chasing me!" 
The little girl bravely stepped forward and started searching for the smoke. After a few minutes of searching, she saw a tiny dragon! It was the source of the smoke.
The dragon was so friendly that the little girl and John quickly became friends. Since then, they often play together in the forest, happy and safe.




Once upon a time, there were three friends in the sky. One was a sun, one was a moon, and one was a star. They were always together, shining brightly. The sun and the moon were very jealous of the star, because it twinkled with the most beautiful colours.
One day, the sun said to the star, "I'm the brightest one here - why do they love you so much?"
But the star only smiled and said, "Our light is different, but it is all equally beautiful."
The sun and the moon thought about this and said, "Yes, you're right. Your light is special too."
 
Soon the three friends decided to settle down on earth. The sun shined in the day, the moon glowed in the night, and the star twinkled in the sky. From that day onwards, everyone on earth could enjoy the light of all three friends.
The moral of the story is that it's okay that we are all different. What's important is that we appreciate and enjoy each other's differences.



Once upon a time there was a little girl called Susie. She had a big dream, she wanted to fly!
One morning, she put on her favourite wings found in her toy box and stepped outside her front door. She flew higher and higher in the sky. Susie was very happy and it made her forget her fear of heights.
Susie flew so high that she eventually lost sight of her home. Suddenly, it started to rain heavily and the wind began to blows stronger. Now scared, Susie's wings dropped and she began to fall.
Susie shouted for help. Suddenly, a kind voice spoke from the clouds. It said, "Come back home, Susie. There's nothing to fear. I'll help you return".
Susie held onto the kind voice and flew back home safely. She never forgot her dream of flying and how her new friend helped her return.




Once there was a little girl named Emma. She was three years old and loved to explore.
One day, she took a step outside her house and saw an old sack on the ground. It was full of fun things, so she stepped closer to take a look.
Inside the sack there were many things available for Emma to play with: dolls, toys, books and more. She was so happy and spent hours playing with these items.
When it was time to go back home, Emma was sad to leave her new discoveries behind. But she had to go, so she stepped away from the sack.
On her way back home, she made a plan: the next day she would go back to the sack and find more surprises!




Once upon a time, there lived a rat. He was very brave and he wanted to travel. He packed his bags and went for a long journey. He had a mild trip, until he reached a forest. When he travelled through the forest, he heard someone talking. Suddenly, he saw a big rat. The big rat said, "I'm the king of this forest. You must give me something or else I'll eat you!
The brave rat was very scared and he did not know what to do. The king rat said, "If you don't give me something, I'll eat you! The brave rat knew he couldn't escape and so he gave the king rat all his packed items. But it was not enough. The king rat said, "I still want more!
The brave rat started to cry and begged, "Please don't eat me! I don't have anything else to give you! But the mean king rat didn't listen and he ate the brave rat. That was the end of the poor brave rat's journey. He had a bad ending.



Sandra was excited to visit the museum. "Mummy, what can we make at the museum?" she asked.
Her mummy replied, "We can make lots of cool things at the museum. We can explore and learn a lot too."
As they walked into the museum, Sandra's eyes lit up. She was amazed by all the strong things she saw - sculptures, paintings, and many other kinds of art.
They decided to make a painting. Sandra used bright and bold colours to paint a strong and beautiful picture. She worked hard and when it was finished, everyone clapped and praised her work. Sandra was so proud.
"You did a wonderful job, Sandra," her mummy said.
"Yes! Making things at the museum is so much fun!" Sandra smiled.




Once upon a time, there were two friends named Ben and Jo. Ben and Jo were very honest and always wanted to win the prize in their game.
One day, they found a special prize inside a block of ice. But it was too cold to pick up, so Ben and Jo had to think of a clever plan. Jo suggested they take it outside where the sun would melt the ice. 
Ben grinned. "Good idea," he said. So they took it outside and put it in the sun. 
The ice began to melt and they watched in awe as the prize inside it started to appear. In the end, they each won a prize, so they were very happy. 
Ben said, "Thanks Jo - you're so honest, and you think of the best ideas!" Jo beamed and hugged Ben. 
They never forgot how their honest friendship had helped them win their prize.




One day a little girl was playing in the garden. She found a sheet that was very unusual. She thought it was very exciting, so she decided to swing on it. She tied the sheet to two trees and climbed up. As she was moving backwards and forwards, the sheet suddenly ripped. The little girl fell to the ground, and started to cry. Her parents came running out and saw what had happened. They were so upset and quickly put the sheet away. The little girl was sad that her unusual sheet had gone. She never got to swing on it again.




Once there was a young boy named Peter who loved to explore every nook and cranny of his house. One day, he found a mysterious knob on the wall. He asked his mum, "What is this knob for?"
Mum smiled and said, "Let's see, Peter." She wrapped a delicious red ribbon around it and then said, "Now try turning it."
Peter loved the way the ribbon felt and gave the knob a slight twist. The wall suddenly slid open, and behind it was a delicious surprise. A huge chocolate cake sat on a table, tempting him to take a bite.
Peter couldn't believe it. He snatched up the slice of cake and said, "Wow, Mum! This is so delicious!"
Mum laughed and said, "Sometimes, you just have to find a way to wrap up surprises."




Once upon a time there was a fierce dragon. He lived high up in the mountains and enjoyed eating yogurt every day. Every morning, he would fly down to the village store and buy a big pot full of yogurt.
One day, the dragon decided to take a nap. So, he snuggled up in a cosy cave and closed his eyes. As he fell asleep, the dragon accidentally released a stream of fire out of his nostrils.
The fire quickly spread and started to burn down houses in the village. As the villagers ran around in a panic, the dragon suddenly woke from his slumber. Oh no! he gasped.
He flew down to the village to help. He quickly picked up every house and used his stream of fire to put out the flames. 
The villagers cheered and thanked the dragon. The dragon smiled and said, Anytime I can help my friends, I will! and flew off back to his cave, carrying a whole pot of yogurt for his breakfast.
