Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to explore and discover new things. One morning, the sun was shining and the sky was blue. The little girl decided to go and explore the forest, so off she went!
As the little girl walked, she saw something yellow peeking out from behind a bush. She followed the trail of yellow and discovered a little duck. The duck was hopping around and quacking happily.
The little girl smiled. "Hi there," she said. The duck stopped and looked at her.
At noon, the little girl decided she should be getting home. She said goodbye to the duck, who quacked and nodded its head.
The little girl was very happy with her discovery. She skipped home and knew, she would always remember the yellow duck she'd found in the forest.




Once there was a boy named Bob who wanted to do something fun. He had some toys, but he was looking for something special. One day, he had an idea! He wanted to find a cooler. His mom said he could count down from ten and then it might appear. He counted down from ten and waited. 
Bob saw a cooler nearby and ran over to it. The cooler was full of ice and was wet from the rain. Bob was excited! He opened the cooler and discovered lots of cold drinks and snacks inside. 
Bob couldn't help but say, "Wow, this is the coolest thing ever!" His mom smiled and said, "Now you can have a cold drink and snack until your heart is content!" Bob was so happy, he started to count all the snacks he could see inside the cooler. 
Bob had a great time and made sure he counted all the snacks in the cooler. With his cooler and ice, he could now do something special and fun all day long!



Once upon a time, there lived an elephant. He was very important, but he never knew it. One day he was walking when he began to feel dizzy. He tried to stand up, but he kept falling. Soon the elephant saw a small boy nearby who watched him in surprise.
The boy asked, "Why do you keep falling, elephant?" 
The elephant replied, "I keep falling because I don't realize how important I am. I think I can do what I want, but I can't!" 
The boy thought for a moment and then said, "Remember, everyone needs to take care of themselves. It's important to know your own worth!"
The elephant was very thankful for the boy's advice. He realized that he was indeed very important, and he took better care of himself after that. 
The moral of the story is: Everyone needs to take care of themselves, and know their own importance.




Once upon a time, there was a lively little girl named Millie. She was always laughing and having fun. One day, Millie went to the park with her mom and brother. While running in the grass, Millie stopped near a tree and started tapping her knee with her hand.
Millie's mom said, "Millie, why are you tapping your knee?" 
Millie smiled and said, "Mom, I'm teasing a bug!" She laughed as the bug scurried away.
Suddenly, Millie's brother, Evan, came running over. He eagerly tapped Millie's knee and asked, "What was that bug you were teasing?" 
Millie laughed and said, "It was a little ant. He was being so lively!" 
Evan smiled and asked, "Can we go find more bugs to tease?"
Millie's mom smiled and said, "Yes! Let's go explore the park and find some neat bugs to tease!"
And that is how Millie, Evan, and their mom spent the rest of their day, exploring the park and teasing lots of fun, lively bugs!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Clara and her mom. Clara was very sick and her mom wanted to see if her fever had gone down. Clara's mom thought that the best way to do that was to take out Clara's thermometer.
Clara's mom said to Clara, I am going to pull out your thermometer sweetie, so that I can see if your fever is better. Clara nodded and was very calm as her mom pulled the thermometer out of its box.
Once the thermometer was out, her mom smiled, Your fever is much better now, let's go have a nice rest.
The moral of this story is - a little patience goes a long way! If we take our time, we can get things done calmly and efficiently. Plus it also encourages positive health outcomes.



"Once upon a time there was a small, harmless mouse. The mouse liked to chew and escape from danger.
One day, the mouse spotted a giant piece of cheese in the corner of the room. Chewing as fast as possible, the mouse was determined to find a way to escape with her prize.
Suddenly, the mouse freezeed as it heard a gruff voice speaking. It was an evil cat, who planned to catch the mouse in his claws and make it his next snack.
The mouse quickly devised a plan. She started to chew her way through the floorboards, desperately seeking an escape. Finally, the mouse had made a hole big enough to fit her body throught to freedom.
But it was too late! The cat had spotted the mouse just as she was soaring through the hole, and lunged toward her with claws outstretched. 
The mouse had no choice but to frantically run away and leave her cheese as the cat's reward. She was lucky to escape, but the cheese was gone without a trace.
The End"




Billy and his dad were playing in the park. It was a sunny day and everything was so exciting. Suddenly, Billy heard a loud "crack!". He looked over and saw a big, mighty tree had broken.
"Wow, Dad, look! That tree broke!" shouted Billy excitedly.
"Yes, it did Billy. But don't worry, that tree was very old. Let's go and see if we can find some other things to play with!"
Billy and his dad walked around the park for a while until they saw a big old sink. It was rusty and had lots of moss and dirt on it.
"Dad, what is this?" asked Billy.
"It looks like a mighty sink to me," his dad replied. "It must have been here for a long time - let's see if it still works!"
Billy and his dad moved the old sink to a safe spot in the park and tried to fill it with water from the nearby river. To their surprise, it worked! As the water filled the sink, Billy and his dad saw fish and tadpoles swimming around.
"Look Dad, look!" cried Billy, "it's so amazing!"
Billy and his dad spent the rest of the day fishing in their mighty made-for-story-times sink.




Once upon a time there were two little bunnies. They were named Cottontail and Cottonball.
One day they were hopping through the meadow when they heard a ringing sound and felt a trembling underneath the ground. They looked around and noticed an old box in the grass.
Cottontail hopped closer and said, "What is this?" Cottonball hopped over and said, "I don't know, let's open it!"
They opened the box and found an original toy inside. It was a timer that counted down the minutes. They felt excited!
Cottontail said, "Let's see how far we can hop in one minute." So the two bunnies hopped as fast as they could for one minute straight. 
At the end, Cottonball said, "That was fun!"
Cottontail agreed and said, "Yes, it was. Let's do it again!"
So the two little bunnies kept hopping and playing with their original timer all day. It was a day full of hopping, laughter and fun!




Digger the dog was not happy. His best friend Bonnie was ignoring him. He tried to get her attention, but she just kept scanning the ground.
"What are you looking for, Bonnie?" Digger asked.
"I'm looking for an earthquake," Bonnie said. "I can always feel one soon before it happens."
Digger was curious so he joined her in search for an earthquake. But soon enough, he realized that he was getting really bored!
"This isn't very fun," Digger said.
"It's not supposed to be," Bonnie said. "Earthquakes can be really messy. I just want to make sure we're ready if one hits."
Digger sighed and shrugged his shoulders. Sure enough, within just a few minutes, they felt the ground shake. The earthquake was here! Though it felt a bit scary, Bonnie had been right. Digger was relieved that they were prepared. The earthquake wasn't as messy as it could have been.




One day a wealthy man had a dream about a magical jungle. He wanted to see it for himself so he got on a plane and flew away.
When he arrived he saw a beautiful and colourful jungle filled with birds and monkeys. He was so happy and curious that he started to explore. 
He soon found a hidden cave filled with treasure. The man took as much as he could and left to go home. 
On the plane he looked at the treasure and laughed, remembering how beautiful the jungle was. But his laughter quickly stopped when the plane crash-landed. The man's wealth was all gone and he never saw the jungle again.
 
The man looked into the sky and said, "I will remember you forever, jungle!"



 
Mama and Max were driving home from mommy's job. Max was looking out the window when he saw an old, filthy window display. He wanted to look closer, so he started to search for a way to get outside.
Mama said, No, Max, we cant go outside now. That window is too filthy and we dont have time to search around it. Lets go home.
Max shook his head and said, But Mama, I want to go see it. It looks fun! Mama smiled and said, I know it looks fun, but its too dirty right now. We can come back another day.
Max pouted and said, But Mama, I want to go see it now! Please! Mama thought for a moment and then said, Alright, we can go take a quick look, but then we have to go right home.
They got out of the car and Max could hardly contain his excitement. He ran over to the old, filthy window display and marveled at all the colorful things inside. Mama watched Max with a happy smile on her face. Finally, the time for fun was over and they drove home.




Once there was a yellow bird. It was looking for a place to belong. It flew all around searching for the perfect nest. Finally it spied a cozy yellow nest in the tree. It hopped inside and knew that this was the place for it. It felt like it belonged.
The bird stayed in the nest and kept it clean. Every morning it would look out from the nest and sing a song. All the other birds heard the yellow bird's beautiful song and they knew it had found its home.
The yellow bird was very happy with its nest. It was safe and warm and it was the perfect place to belong. The bird knew it was lucky to have such a great home.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Clara. She was three years old and loved to play outside.
One day Clara decided to go for a walk. As she walked she saw a lady in the park with a dog. The lady looked very worried. Clara smiled and said hello.
The lady smiled back and asked Clara what her name was. Clara told her as she patted the dog. The lady said she was very happy to meet Clara and was no longer worried.
Clara smiled and said bye to the lady. She then went home and had a very nice day!




Once upon a time there was a boy. His name was Thomas. He was three years old.
One day, Thomas took his cooler to the beach. It was full of sweet treats. Suddenly, the phone in Thomas's pocket began to ring.
Thomas answered the call and began to talk to his mom. "Mom! I'm at the beach with my cooler! It's so cool!"
"That sounds fun," said his mom. "Make sure to stay cool while you're there. Don't forget to put your cooler in the shade too!"
Thomas thanked his mom and hung up. He grabbed his cooler and found a shady spot to put it down. The sun was hot, but his cooler was nice and cool.
As Thomas enjoyed the sweet treats from his cooler, he forgot all about the phone call!




Once there was a little girl named Jane. She was three-years-old and loved pink. One day she found a pink pill. She wanted to eat it, so she did.
Jane's mom saw her and said, "No Jane, you shouldn't eat that!" But Jane just smiled and kept eating it.
The next day, Jane's mom saw her frowning. "What's wrong, Jane?" she asked.
Jane said, "I don't feel good. The pink pill made me sick." Jane's mom was very sad and hugged her tight.
Jane went to the doctor the next day and the doctor said, "The pink pill was very bad for you. You can never eat it again." Jane was very sad and tears filled her eyes. 
Jane never ate the pink pill again and always remembered to listen to her mom. She was very careful with the things she ate. The end.




Once upon a time there were two humans, Sam and John. Sam was very scared of everything and something inside told him he needed to go into the forest for something special. So, he asked John if he wanted to join. John was brave and wanted to help Sam. 
They trekked through the dark and scary forest, not knowing what they would find. Sam was filled with wonder, but the dark and mysterious woods had him feeling scared.
Finally, they reached a clearing and there in the middle was an old man sitting in a chair. He told them they had made it. Sam and John didn't know what he meant. The old man then said that his courage gave him strength and that he just needed to have faith in himself. Sam felt relieved and powerful with this new knowledge. 
John looked at Sam and said that he was brave and that they could take on anything together. With this new understanding and newfound courage, the two humans headed home knowing that they could do anything as long as they believed in themselves and believed in each other.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Ann. One day, Ann and her mum went to the hospital for a check up. Ann saw a unique nurse, who was very kind. The nurse asked Ann to stay quiet and lie down on the bed so she could measure her. So, Ann did as she was told and lay down.
The nurse looked at Ann and smiled. She smiled back. The nurse said, You can sit up now. Ann. That was very good. 
Ann was very pleased. She wanted to show the nurse how happy she was and said, I like you! The nurse hugged Ann and said, I like you, too! Ann was over the moon!
After the check up was finished, Ann and her mum left the hospital. Ann was very proud of herself. She was happy to have met such a unique nurse.



Ted was a happy three year old boy. He loved to play with his toys, swing in the park and go on adventures. One day, he decided to explore the woods nearby. As he wandered through the trees, he stumbled across a mysterious, old house. He decided to go inside and explore, but when he opened the door, he felt a strange pain in his chest. It wasn't too bad, but it was weird.
He stepped into the old house, discovering all kinds of strange, old objects scattered everywhere. He was startled when an even weirder creature sprang from one of the dark corners. It had big, green eyes and sharp claws. The creature hissed threateningly at Ted and he was scared, but he managed to hold his ground and stay brave.
The creature seemed unhappy and Ted's heart went out to it. He reached into his pocket, pulled out a handful of candy, and offered it to the creature. It hesitated for a few moments, then it slowly accepted the sweets and began to settle down. As the creature ate, Ted felt the mysterious pain in his chest subside.
The creature thanked Ted with a nod, then curled up in the corner. Ted smiled. It was strange, but he was glad he was able to help. He left the house feeling content, knowing he had made a new friend.




Once upon a time there lived a bee. The bee loved to fly around outside in the fresh air. One day as the bee was flying, it saw a nice sunny spot. The bee liked the warm sun, so it flew down and relaxed. Suddenly, the bee heard a loud noise and felt a sharp pain. The bee was dead!
The bee had been stung by a big bee. The bee was very sad it had died but it was happy it had been able to relax in the sun for a bit before it passed away.
The other bees were sorry to hear that their friend was dead. They made sure to keep an eye out for any more bees flying around, so that they could stay safe.
The lesson from this story is to relax and enjoy life, but also be careful.




Once upon a time, there was a hairy cat. It was so hairy, everyone called it Hairy Cat. One day, Hairy Cat wanted to find a special card. So, it ventured to the nearest shop. 
When Hairy Cat got to the shop, it saw that the shopkeeper had lots of cards. But, none of the cards were what it was looking for. Frustrated, Hairy Cat asked the shopkeeper: "Do you have the card that I am looking for?". 
The shopkeeper shrugged and said no. Hairy Cat was so disappointed. It trudged home without its special card. 
Since then, Hairy Cat became sadder every day. No matter how hard it tried, it still could never find its special card. And so, Hairy Cat lived a sad and lonely life, without its special card.



Once upon a time there was a rich man. He wanted to come to the beach and go surfing. So he came with his big car, and he put all of his surfboards into the trunk. But when he got to the beach, he realized he had forgotten his wetsuit.
The rich man didn't know what to do. He had come all this way and he really wanted to go surfing. Luckily, a kind boy he met at the beach offered to share his wetsuit.
The rich man was so grateful and thanked the boy before he put on the wetsuit and went out to the surf.
The moral of this story is that sharing is caring. It doesn't matter how rich or poor you are, when you share with others it can make them very happy.



Once upon a time there was a little girl named Ameli. She had a special place that she went to when she wanted to feel safe and happy - an igloo. Inside the igloo, Ameli would play with her favourite toys and draw pictures with coloured crayons.
One day Ameli was feeling brave and decided to cook something special in her igloo. She had all the necessary ingredients, including a big egg, flour, sugar and milk. Ameli was determined to make a delicious cake.
Using a bowl and wooden spoon, Ameli carefully mixed the ingredients and placed the mixture in the oven. Then, Ameli waited patiently keeping an eye on the timer.
Finally the timer went off and Ameli took her cake out of the oven. It was golden brown and smelled amazing. Ameli was so excited that she forgot to let it cool and ate the cake while it was still hot.
Ameli's parents saw the empty plate and smiled. They were not at all angry that Ameli had been spoiled by eating the cake before it was cool. In fact, her parents were so proud of her for making the cake all by herself. 
And so, Ameli enjoyed many more happy moments in her igloo.




Once upon a time there was a boy who loved to be warm all the time. One day he was feeling chilly, so he decided to go and find something that would make him warm. He found a note that had been sitting in the sun all day; the day's sunshine had made it melt. When he touched the note it was warm, and it made the boy feel warm too. 
He held the warm note close to his heart and smiled. Suddenly he could feel the warmth spread all over him and he felt so content. 
The boy enjoyed his newfound warmth, and he kept the note close to him as a reminder that some good things come when we are patient. Whenever he felt cold again, he would remember the note and it's melting warmth, and he would be happy. 
The end!




Once upon a time there was a poor soldier who had to wander through the forest all alone. As he wandered he came across a small cottage. When he knocked on the door the owner of the cottage opened it.
The soldier asked the owner, "Do you have anything to eat?" 
The owner replied, "Yes I do. Please come in and help yourself." 
The soldier thanked the owner and stepped inside. Inside he found a big pot of stew. The soldier enjoyed the stew and thanked the owner. 
The owner said, "It's my pleasure. The forest can be a scary place and you look like you could use a friend." 
The poor soldier was so happy to have a friend. From then on whenever he needed to wander through the forest he knew he could count on the owner of the cottage for a hot meal and some kind words.



Fatima was a poor girl who lived in a small village. She lived with her mum and dad and looked after her brother, Fambi.
Every morning, Fatima and Fambi would go outside and enjoy the sun. They would run around in the grass and pick flowers. Then they would lie down and sigh in the warm sunshine.
One day, Fambi pointed his finger up to the sky and said, "Look sis! There's a smile in the sky!" Fatima looked up at the sky and saw a beautiful, yellow sun smiling down at them. 
Fatima smiled back and said, "That's the best smile I've seen today". Fambi reached for her hand and said, "Let's go show the sun our smiles too".
So Fatima and Fambi ran back home and held each other's hands. They put on their biggest smiles and ran back outside, this time smiling up at the sun. 
The sun was so happy that it blazed even brighter as a sign of thanks. Fatima and Fambi cheered and smiled at each other before running back home. They knew that even though they were poor, they could still find happiness in the small things.




Tommy was playing in the play park. There were lots of other children there too, so it was a lively place. He was playing in the sand, making a giant pile of it with his little shovel.
Suddenly, a bigger boy ran up and shouted at him. "This is my sand, you can't play with it!" the bigger boy roared.
Tommy felt scared. He didn't want to cause trouble, so he stepped away from the sand.
But the boy was angry. He wanted Tommy away from the play park altogether. He kept shouting.
Soon, Tommy's mum came and saw what was happening. She tried to reason with the boy, but it didn't work. In the end, Tommy and his mum had to leave the park. Tommy was disappointed and sad.




Molly was a 3 year old who had a lemon tree in her garden. One day, she decided to pick a lemon from the tree. She was so excited. As she grabbed the lemon, juice started to drip from it. Molly quickly wiped the juice away with her sleeve.
Molly then asked her mom if she could make a lemonade. Her mom agreed and gave her a recipe. It included lemon juice and sugar. Molly got to work and started to squeeze the lemon. She was having a great time. 
Molly started to worry when she noticed that her hands had become sticky from the lemon juice. She asked her mom: How do I stop my hands from getting sticky? Her mom replied: You need to wipe your hands. Thats perfectly normal.
Molly took a cloth and wiped her hands until they were clean and nice again. After that, she finished making her lemonade. She couldnt wait to take a sip and show the lemonade to all of her friends!




Once there was a little boy named John. He was very patient and liked to build things with his blocks. One day while he was playing with his blocks, he heard a noise outside his window. He went to look and saw a big kite flying very high in the sky. He wanted to fly his own kite, so he asked his mom for help.
Mom said, "OK, let's try!" She grabbed a kite and quickly snapped it together. John was very excited and ran outside. He held the kite with both hands and let go. Suddenly, the kite was high in the sky, twisting and turning as the wind caught it.
John was patient and waited for the kite to come back down. He watched it glide up and down on the breeze and finally it came back down to him. John was very happy and hugged his mom. He knew all his patience paid off!




There was a boy and a girl. They had a nice day and were excited to explore the outside world. So, they went out and walked around. The girl saw something in the grass and stopped to take a closer look. It was a magazine!
The boy stopped too and they both examined it. The magazine was very fragile. It felt soft, almost like it was made of paper. The boy and girl were careful with it and decided to take it home.
When they got home, they put the magazine on the table. They read the magazine happily together and the girl thought it was really interesting. After looking at the magazine for a while, the girl was inspired to do something creative.
They went to the kitchen and made a collage out of paper and the magazine. It was beautiful and the girl was so proud of her work. They were both very happy and had a great day exploring.



Once upon a time, there was a smart lion who liked to eat spoons. He thought they tasted delicious, so he would eat spoons all day long. One day, the lion noticed he was all alone. He didn't want to be alone anymore, so he went out looking for a friend.
He searched high and low, until he found a little bird sitting on a tree branch. He asked the bird, "Do you want to be my friend?" The bird was excited and said, "Yes, of course!" The lion and the bird became best friends.
Every day, the lion and the bird would go on fun adventures together. Then one day, the lion noticed something was wrong with his best friend. The bird was weeping and he couldn't figure out why. The lion asked, "What is wrong, little bird?"
The bird sniffled and said, "I'm sad because I don't have a spoon to eat anymore. I don't know what to do!" The lion was so touched by the bird's sad story. He said, "Don't worry, little bird. I'll find you a spoon."
The lion went off in search of a spoon and found one right away! He brought it back to the bird and said, "Here you go! Now you can have something to eat!" The bird smiled and said, "Thank you, my smart lion friend!" The two friends were so happy they laughed




Once upon a time, there was a robot that did many things. It included modest tasks such as cleaning and helping around the house. One day, the robot was faced with a challenge that it could not solve. A voice screamed, "What should I do?!".
The robot looked around and noticed a small child playing nearby. It approached the child and said, "Can you help me?". The child was curious about what the robot wanted. "I'm trying to figure out this problem. Can you help me?" The child thought for a moment and said, "Yes".
The robot and the child worked together for hours, trying to solve the problem. Finally, they figured out the answer. The robot was so relieved and thanked the child. It asked the child, "How should I reward you?". The child was modest and said, "A hug will be enough".
Unfortunately, the robot malfunctioned as it hugged the child and it crushed the child to death. Everyone was sad and shocked. The robot was taken away and never seen again.




Jack was skipping through the park, feeling happy and carefree. Suddenly, he spotted a shiny fork lying on the grass. He was a very honest little boy, and he decided it must belong to someone. 
He carefully picked it up and started looking for its owner. He asked a lady he saw nearby, "Do you know who the fork belongs to?" 
The lady smiled at Jack and said, "No, I don't. You must find the honest person who it belongs to."
Jack nodded and continued on his way, skipping and searching for the fork's owner. He soon met a man sitting on a nearby bench. He asked the man if it was his fork, but the man shook his head.
Finally, Jack ran into a little girl playing in the playground. He asked her if the fork was hers and her face lit up. "Yes it is!" she exclaimed. "That's my special fork! Thank you so much for being honest and finding it!"
Jack was so pleased to have helped and he smiled as he watched the little girl skip away with her fork.




Once upon a time there was a beetle. The beetle was available to fly. It was a happy beetle! It loved to clap. Each day it would go to the park and clap and fly around in circles.
The beetle's claps were so loud that everyone in the park stopped to watch. The beetle didn't care, it was enjoying its moment of flight. Everybody would cheer and clap along with the beetle.
One day, a little girl joined the crowd in the park. She was only three years old, but she loved the beetle's clapping too. She came closer and started clapping with the beetle. The beetle was so happy, it started to fly higher and higher!
Soon, the beetle and the little girl became best friends. The beetle showed her how to fly, clap, and have fun. Every morning they would meet in the park and fly around together, clapping and cheering.
And they lived happily ever after!




Max was playing hide and seek with his friends at the park. They were all having a great time and then Max had a bright idea.
"Let's make something!" he said.
So, they all ran to the bench and began to write all over it with a big chunky marker.
Max was bossy and tried to take charge of the whole operation. He told each of them what to write and even tried to write some of it himself. 
But in the end, they all managed to write a huge 'HAPPY BIRTHDAY' message on the bench. It was great fun! 
Max was very proud of their work and everyone smiled. 
"That looks so cool!" said Max.




The sun was shining brightly on the farm. The chickens were clucking and the cows were mooing. "Let's go and gather some squash," said Mama to her two little children.
The children followed Mama outside and soon they were picking big oranges squash that were growing in the garden. While the children were picking the squash, Mama saw that one of her chickens was in the garden, too. It had the biggest orange squash in its beak. Mama yelled, "Come back here!" But the chicken wouldn't listen and ran away.
Mama chased the chicken and it ran into a bramble bush. Mama quickly ran after the chicken, but when she reached the bush, she was hurt and started to cry.
The children quickly ran to her side and said, "Mama, are you okay?"
Mama took a deep breath and said, "Yes, but the chicken is too fast and we didn't get the squash."
"Don't worry, Mama," said the children with big smiles. "We still have lots of squash, let's just go and gather more!"




Liz was a young girl living on the ranch with her family. She had two brothers and they were all quite playful together. 
One day while they were playing outside Liz saw something strange in the sky. A big cloud was quickly growing bigger and darker. 
"Uh oh," she said. "It's gonna rain!"
Her brothers thought it would be fun to keep playing, but Liz couldn't help feeling a little bit scared. She knew heavy rainfall sometimes caused floods and she began to panic. 
Liz begged her brothers to take cover in the barn, but they just laughed and kept playing. Then the rain came down in torrential sheets! Liz knew that the little river near the barn was likely to flood.
She quickly tried to get the boys to a safer place, but it was too late - the barn was already flooding. Her brothers began to scream and cry, while Liz could only stand there in shock. The family had to abandon the ranch and start over again. 
The loss of the ranch was a devastating moment for Liz and her family, but she was also reminded of the power of mother nature. Liz had warned her brothers and tried to get them to safety but they had not listened. Small disasters can quickly lead to much larger endings. 




John was a 3 year old boy who was very excited.
He was going to celebrate his mom's birthday.
He was excited because he was going to cast a special spell.
John went around the room looking for something to use for his spell.
He found a funny hat and he knew it was perfect.
He put the hat on and said a special chant.
Suddenly, the ground started to shake and the walls started to crack.
John was scared by the sight and started to cry.
Mom came in and asked John what had happened.
John said he was trying to cast a spell to celebrate her birthday.
Mom hugged him and said that spells weren't real.
John seemed so sad and disappointed.
Mom said they would celebrate her birthday in another way.




Once upon a time there was a very rich little girl called Daisy. Daisy had everything she wanted and was very happy. One day she went outside to play in the sun. She had a sheet with her, which she spread out on the grass and she lay down on it.
As the sun shone it began to get hotter and hotter. Daisy began to feel uncomfortable, so she decided to move. She folded up the sheet and looked around. To her surprise, she saw a tall tree with big, leafy green branches.
She walked over to the tree and stood beneath its shade. She spread out the sheet and lay down once more. The sun was blocked by the tree and the temperature began to decrease. Daisy smiled and exclaimed Ahhh, much better!
As Daisy lay there she noticed the leaves rustling in the breeze. The rich, green colour of the leaves was beautiful. Daisy lay there for a while, until the sun began to increase again.
So she gathered up her sheet, thanked the tree and ran back to her house.




Once there was a little girl named Sarah who loved to explore outside. She was very brave and one day decided to go explore a creek.
Sarah came to a creek which was very filthy. The water was dark and had a bad smell. But Sarah was not scared. She loved to explore, so she stepped closer. 
Suddenly, Sarah lost her balance and fell into the creek. She was very afraid and started to cry out for help.
A kind lady heard Sarah's cries for help and quickly came to the creek. Together she and Sarah pulled herself safely out of the creek. 
The lady said to Sarah, "You were very brave to explore the creek, but it's too dangerous for a little girl like you.  Next time make sure you stay away from this filthy creek!" 
Sarah thanked the kind lady and promised never to fall into the creek again. She went away happily and never explored that filthy creek again.




Once there was a mama bear and her cub. The cub was only three years old, but already very brave. One day they were walking through the forest when they heard a loud noise. Mama bear quickly put her cub behind her and rushed to see what was happening.
She saw a giant, who was being very rude and loud. The giant had a big lip and was making strange faces. Mama bear was very scared. She wrapped her cub in a big hug and whispered in his ear, We should go, quickly. The cub nodded and ran as fast as he could.
Mama bear was so relieved that none of them had gotten hurt. But she also felt a little sad, because she was worried that the giant might come back.
The next day, the mama and cub returned to the same spot. Suddenly, the giant appeared again. But this time, he wasn't being loud or rude. He was singing a gentle song. Mama and cub were surprised, and walked up to the giant.
Mama bear thanked the giant and explained that she had been scared of him before. The giant smiled and said he was sorry for being so rude. Then he sang a happy song, while mama and cub smiled and danced around. They had a wonderful day together.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to explore and learn new things. One day, she decided to explore the shelves in her parents' bedroom. As she peered up at the shelves she noticed a great number of interesting things she had never seen before. Her curiosity got the best of her as she asked her parents what each item was.
Mia's father smiled at his daughter's great interest. He pointed to a book with a colorful cover and said, "That's a book. Any time you want, you can open it and read it".
Mia gazed up at her father in awe and excitement. She had never seen a book before and she couldn't wait to learn how to read it.
Mia was so excited by this new discovery that she ran over to the shelf and grabbed the book. She raced back to her room, forgetting all about the other things on the shelf.
Once in her room, Mia plopped down on the floor and started to read the book with great enthusiasm. Before she knew it, hours had passed and she hadn't even noticed.
Mia had so many questions that she wanted to ask her parents but the night had already come and it was time for bed. She put away the book, gave it one last admiring glance and said, Maybe I'll ask them tomorrow.. She crawled into bed, dreaming of all the




Once upon a time there was a monkey who liked to display his banana everywhere he went. Everywhere he went, people would look in amazement at the size of the banana. One day he went to a park with his banana, but he was not alone. There was a troubled little elephant there. The little elephant was curious about the banana and so he asked the monkey if he could show him his banana.
The monkey was worried. He was enjoying displaying his banana, but he was also troubled. He knew the banana was very big and the little elephant was very small. He was scared the elephant would get hurt.
Eventually, the monkey decided to do the kindest thing. He gave the banana to the little elephant to enjoy. Seeing the elephant so happy with the banana filled the monkey with joy. He had been kind and generous, and the little elephant was so delighted.
The story teaches us that kindness is important. In the face of a troubled little elephant, the monkey chose to give away his banana instead of showing off. Even though he was afraid, his generous spirit won through in the end - and it is this that counts the most.



John and his parents decided to go for a ride in the park. John saw an old man standing beside a motorcycle, so he asked his dad:
"Dad, can I have a ride on that motorcycle?"
Dad looked kindly at John and said:
"John, we should be compassionate. This old man must need the motorcycle more than we do. We should ask him if he would be willing to borrow it to us."
John's parents walked over to the old man and asked politely if they could borrow his motorcycle. The old man looked surprised, but he said: 
"Of course, I'd be happy to let you borrow it. Thank you for being so respectful."
John was excited to ride the motorcycle, but he remembered that his parents had taught him to be respectful and compassionate. He learned you must always be kind and considerate to others. 
John thanked the old man and said goodbye when it was time for them to leave. The old man smiled and waved goodbye, grateful for their understanding. 
John and his family had a wonderful time in the park, and he remembered the importance of being compassionate and polite.




Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little dog named Spot. Spot liked nothing better than to play in the sunshine and go for walks in the park.
One day, Spot went for a walk in the park. While they were there, Spot noticed a dusty old house. He decided to take a closer look. As Spot got closer, he heard a friendly voice calling out to him:
"Welcome, Spot! Please come in!"
Spot was very curious. He walked inside to find an old woman sitting in a rocking chair. She had a kind face, and a big smile. She said "Why, hello there! What can I do for you?"
Spot wasn't sure why the old woman wanted to welcome him, but he was happy to listen. The woman told him that this was her house and she hadn't had a visitor in many years. She said that Spot was welcome in her home anytime.
Spot thanked the woman for her kind words and he promised to visit again soon. He waved goodbye and ran back outside, feeling cheerful and happy. As Spot walked away, he remembered that the dust in the old house was the sign of a warm and welcoming place.



 
Once upon a time there was a small boy. He was walking in the forest and he saw something that he wanted. He saw a snack, and quickly ran toward it.
The snack looked so yummy that he did not want to stop. But then he heard someone calling him. It was his dad. 
The boy's dad said,"Stop, boy. That snack does not belong to you!"
But the little boy was too excited. He kept running towards the snack.
The dad shouted again,"Stop, or else I will be very mad!"
But the little boy was too distracted. He jumped up and grabbed the snack. Suddenly his dad grabbed his arm and said,"You disobeyed me! No snack for you today."
The little boy was sad and ran away. He knew he had done something bad and now there was no snack.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sophie. She was three years old and very curious. Every day, she asked her parents questions about the mysterious things around her.
One day, Sophie saw something strange in the garden. It was a box with a mysterious pattern on it.
Sophie asked her mom, "What is that?"
Her mom replied, "It's a mystery! I think it will be fun for you to keep it and try to figure it out."
Sophie was very excited. Every day, she came back to the mysterious box and tried to find a way to open it. After a few days of trying, she managed to open the box!
Inside the box, Sophie was surprised to find a tiny toy that made sounds when she turned it over! Sophie said "I kept the mystery and now I know the surprise!"
Sophie was so happy to have found the surprise and kept the mystery. From then on, she always reminded herself to keep exploring and never give up.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sunshine. She was a brave and adventurous three year old. One day, she decided to go on her own in the forest.
As she was walking along a path, she heard a crackling sound. Looking up, she saw a broken shield in a nearby tree. She walked closer to take a better look. With a curious giggle, she reached out her hand to grab it.
Suddenly, a voice rang out - "You must never touch that shield." Sunshine jumped with surprise. She stepped back and looked around. But the forest was quiet. 
Sunshine decided to listen to the mysterious voice. She repeated to herself, "I will never touch the broken shield". 
Little did she know her words would be put to the test. A few days later Sunshine returned to the same forest and found herself in an epic battle. When she felt she could take no more, she looked up to the tree and spotted the broken shield. Taking her own advice, she reached out and grabbed the broken shield. It turned out to be the only weapon she had to protect herself and win the battle!
The moral of this story? Listen to your instincts and repeat the wise words to yourself. You never know when they might come in handy.




One day, Bob was walking in the forest when he saw a big spike lying on the ground. He was very curious and he picked it up. Suddenly he heard a voice.
"Give me back my spike!" it said.
Bob turned around and saw an old man. He looked a little bit angry.
"I'm sorry," said Bob. "I didn't know it was yours."
"That's alright," said the old man. "I can teach you something if you return it to me."
Bob thought this sounded like a good deal, so he returned the spike to the old man.
"Thank you for being so generous," said the old man. "Now, here is what I wanted to teach you: never trust strangers!"
With those words, the old man vanished. Bob was a bit confused, but then he realised that the old man had tricked him. He had made a bad decision.




Once there was a big black bear who liked to run. Everywhere he went he would turn and look around to see if he was being followed. One day, he got very tired and stopped to take a rest.
Suddenly, he heard something behind him. He turned and saw a little girl wearing a pink dress. She was looking right at him with a friendly smile.
"Hello!" said the little girl.
The black bear smiled back. "Hello!" he replied.
The little girl asked, "What were you doing?"
"I was running," the black bear replied.
The little girl smiled and said, "I like to run too! Can I run with you?"
The black bear was so happy, he nodded his head and said, "Yes, let's go!"
So the little girl and the big black bear went running together, turning and looking around and making sure no one was following them. They had a lot of fun running around and before long, they had forgotten all about being tired.




Penny and Dan were walking in the park one day. Suddenly they noticed a small, furry animal running around the trees. "What is it?" asked Dan. 
Penny laughed. "That's a squirrel! Let's see if we can touch it." 
Dan was frightened. "I'm scared, Penny."
Penny smiled. "Don't be afraid. We'll just follow the squirrel around the trees and see if we can get close enough to touch it."
And that's what they did. The squirrel seemed miserable, jumping from branch to branch and moving around quickly. Finally, after a few minutes, the squirrel stopped and Dan carefully reached out his hand. But as soon as he touched it, the squirrel ran away and they never saw it again.




Once upon a time, there was a little king. He loved to take long walks in the forest. 
One sunny day, he decided to take a walk. He felt the sun on his face and the breeze in his hair. Suddenly, the sky turned dark and it began to rain. 
The little king was very miserable. He began to cry. 
Just then, a friendly bird flew down and asked, Why are you so miserable, little king? 
The little king said, I was taking a walk, but its raining now. 
The bird said, Come with me. I will take you to a dry place. 
So they flew away and the little king was dry and happy again.




Once upon a time there lived a graceful elephant. She lived in the wood and was very happy. One day she was walking in the wood when she spotted a pear. She walked up to the pear and gathered it in her trunk. 
Suddenly, a little rooster came up to her and said, "Hi! What have you got there?" 
The elephant said, "I found this pear in the wood and I gathered it in my trunk." 
The rooster smiled and said, "That is so nice. Do you want to share it with me?" 
The elephant smiled too and said, "Yes, I would love to share the pear with you!" They both enjoyed the pear together and the elephant said, "Thank you for being so kind!" 
The rooster smiled again and said, "No need to thank me. It is a pleasure to be so graceful with a friend!" 
The elephant thanked the rooster and they went their separate ways, but they would often gather together and have pears ever since.




Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit. He was hopping through the grass, looking for something to eat. Suddenly, he stopped and started to sneeze. He sneezed and sneezed, and he couldn't stop.
The rabbit had a thought. He said, "Maybe I could find something to eat that would help me stop sneezing!" 
So the rabbit hopped and hopped, until he came across a long carrot. He thought, "This looks perfect!" He grabbed the carrot and took a big bite.
He chewed and chewed. After he was done, he felt so much better! He was no longer sneezing.
The rabbit smiled with delight, and said, "Thank you for this delicious long carrot!"




Once upon a time there was a clumsy bear. The clumsy bear was always discovering new things. One day, the clumsy bear found some mail in the forest. He opened the mail and found a treasure map inside. The clumsy bear was both very excited and confused.
He asked the nearby fox, "What should I do with this map?"
The fox thought for a while before answering, "Follow the map and see where it leads!"
The clumsy bear set off, following the map. After a long journey, he found a hidden treasure chest. He opened it up and discovered a wonderful surprise inside.
The clumsy bear couldn't believe it and was so happy. He ran back to the fox and showed him his discovery. "Thank you for the advice," said the clumsy bear.
The fox smiled and replied, "You're welcome! Always remember to trust your discoveries."




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Toby. She loved to dance and play all day. She had a band of special friends who she played in the park with.
One day, Toby's friends said to her, "Let's all jump together!" Toby was excited and said, "Yes! That sounds like a lot of fun!"
They went to the park and stood in a circle. They held hands and jumped together in the warm sunshine. Toby couldn't help but laugh and smile.
When they had finished jumping, Toby's friends said, "We should do this every day!" Toby agreed and said, "I'm so happy we can jump and play together!"




Once upon a time, there was an old man who had a beautiful wife. She was very graceful and he spread love everywhere.
One day, the man went outside and his wife followed him. Suddenly, a big wind started to blow and the man warned his wife to go back in the house. But his wife was too eager to go outside and spread her love in the world.
The wind kept getting stronger and the man yelled, "Please go back in the house!" But the wife didn't listen and said, "I love to spread love over the world."
The man was very worried and shouted, "It's too dangerous!" But it was too late. The wind was too strong and it spread the wife far away.
The man began to cry and he never saw his wife again. The wind had taken her away and he was never able to find her. The man was sad for the rest of his life. The wife's graceful love was never spread throughout the world again.




Nana was in the garden. She was picking flowers for her folder. It felt like she had been there for hours. Suddenly, Nana heard someone shouting. She looked around to see what was happening.
It was Nana's little brother Jimmy. He was very impatient and he was shouting for Nana to hurry up. Nana shook her head, smiled and carried on picking flowers.
Jimmy shouted even louder. "Nana, come on! I want to go to the park!" Jimmy stamped his foot. Nana finished picking the flowers. She spoke calmly. "Jimmy, I'm almost finished. Be patient."
Jimmy was not impressed. He shouted again, this time right in Nana's ear. "No! I want to go to the park now!" Nana sighed. She put the last flower in her folder and said, "OK, Jimmy, let's go to the park." 
Jimmy was very happy. He shouted with joy and ran to the park with Nana.




Bob was a bald man. He loved to go outside and do things. One day he decided to go to the park to feed the birds. He put some birdseed into a teaspoon and he held it out to the birds.
"Hello little birds," said Bob. "Would you like something to eat?"
The birds were very happy and they landed on Bob's hand. They pecked away at the birdseed in the teaspoon. Soon there was no more and the birds flew away.
Bob watched them fly away and smiled. He put the teaspoon back in his pocket and went home with a smile on his face.

Once there was a little girl in the garden. She saw a big beetle crawling on a thick tree. The girl was so excited and she wanted to catch it. She quickly ran up to the beetle and tried to grab it. But the beetle was too fast. It flew away and the girl started to cry.
Just then her mom called her. Come here my little one! Dont worry about that beetle. Lets go play something else.
The girl tearfully told her mom, But mom, I really wanted to catch the beetle!
Her mom smiled and said, I know, sweetheart. Dont worry, the next time you come here the beetle will still be here.
The little girl was so happy and she stopped crying. She decided to go pick some flowers before coming back to look for the beetle.
 
The next day, she woke up early and ran to the garden. There it was: the big beetle still on the thick tree! She was so excited and quickly ran to catch it. This time she was faster than before and the beetle was in her hands. She gleefully brought it back home and showed it to her mom.

Once there was a turtle named Sam. Sam was very tidy and he liked to keep his home clean. His friend, Dave, was often messy and left a lot of things lying around that made it difficult for Sam to keep his home tidy.
One day Dave came to Sam and said, "Let's make an image together!" Sam was excited and brought out some paper, markers and crayons so that they could start to make their image.
But, instead of adding a little bit at a time like Sam wanted, Dave added too much and made a huge mess. Soon the room was filled with papers, markers, and crayons and it was very difficult to see the image.
Sam was very disappointed, but he kept his temper and decided to teach his friend a lesson. He showed Dave how to add a little bit at a time and slowly the beautiful image began to appear.
The moral of the story is that it is important to add a little bit at a time to anything we do. This way, we can keep our homes tidy and create beautiful projects together.



Daddy was driving his car to the store. He needed to buy a new grill. 
"Daddy, what are we getting?" asked his three year old son. 
"We're getting a new grill," said Daddy. "It will be good for us to make healthy meals together!" 
They arrived at the store and Daddy bought the new grill. When they drove home, Daddy showed the boy how it will help them to cook healthier meals. 
The boy jumped up and down in excitement. 
"Let's grill some yummy food!" he said. 
And so they did! And they ate together and had a great family day.




Amy and her dad were having a fun day outside. 
"What can we do today, Dad?" Amy asked. 
"Let's attach our kite to the tree!" her dad replied. 
They got the kite out, and as they attached it to the tree, Amy laughed with delight. 
"Zero the string," her dad instructed. 
Amy took the string and held it tight. Her dad took the kite and launched it in the sky. 
The kite flew high! Amy clapped and smiled. They watched it swirl around in the sky until the string became so taut that the kite would go no higher. 
"The kite is really high, Daddy!" Amy exclaimed. 
"Yes it is, Amy," her dad agreed. "Let's see how long it can stay up there!"




Once there was a little girl named Lucy, who loved to play all day. One day, she went out to the barn to see the sheep. They had all kinds of wool, which made them look very funny.

Hello, sheep, Lucy said. Whats your name?
The sheep just stared at her, but Lucy didnt mind. She smiled and said, Ill call you Woolly, because you have lots of nice wool.
Lucy stayed with Woolly for a while, petting its soft wool, which felt very nice. She laughed as they played together and had lots of fun. At the end of the day, Lucy hugged and said goodbye to Woolly, promising to come back and play soon.




Jan and Jack were best friends. One day they were playing outside and decided to go down the slide. They giggled as they took turns slipping down. 
"Faster, faster!" Jan shouted. 
Jack then had an idea. "Let's use some fuel to make the slide even faster!" Jack said.
Jan thought it was a great plan, so they grabbed a bucket of fuel. They cautiously poured some onto the slide. 
The slide was becoming quite dirty. But finally, they were ready to go. 
"Let's slide!" Jan said. 
So they took turns sliding down the faster, dirtier slide. It was a lot of fun and they both shouted, "Yay!" at the end.




Once upon a time, there was a great igloo. Two little polar bears lived inside it. One day, one of the polar bears got a bit too excited and accidentally lost the key for the igloo door.
"Oh no!" said one of the polar bears. "How will we get back inside our great igloo now?"
The other polar bear thought for a while and then said, "I have an idea! Why don't we try to build a tunnel under the snow so that we can get back inside?"
The first polar bear thought it was a great idea, so they got to work. They worked hard all day, digging under the snow and building a tunnel to the igloo. Finally, after a long day's work, the two lucky polar bears made it back inside their great igloo!

The sun was shining outside and Henry was so excited. He had been invited to explore a building today. As he scurried along, he met a friendly dog.

Henry smiled. He nodded and said, Lets go! and they set off together.
When they got to the building, Henry was mesmerized by all the shiny things it had. He ran around in amazement, exploring every nook and cranny. The dog watched him excitedly, cheerfully following as Henry went from room to room.
When Henry had seen everything, he smiled and waved goodbye to the dog. He was happy that he had found such a wonderful adventure.




Sunday was a very pretty day. The sun was shining and the birds were singing.
Mommy asked her three year old daughter what did she want to do? She thought for a while, until finally she said "I want to go to the park!" Mommy was happy and said that sounded like a good idea.
They put on their shoes and went outside. They found the prettiest park with the prettiest flowers. The little girl was so excited that she started running and laughing.
They spent the whole day playing in the park. Mommy and the little girl had so much fun. Finally, when it was time to go home, the little girl said "Can we come back here next Sunday?" Mommy agreed and said she wanted to, too.




Once upon a time, there was a strong and powerful warrior called Jim. He was brave and noble and always ready for an adventure. 
One day, he decided to go on a great quest and see what he could find. He walked and walked until he came to a narrow alley. As he entered, he heard a voice.
"Turn around," the voice said "or you will be sorry." Jim was not scared and he continued to walk. Finally, he came to a large door with a giant keyhole. "This must be the door that I'm looking for," he said.
He put his hand in the keyhole and turned the key. Suddenly, the door opened and a powerful force rushed out. Jim stepped inside and found himself in a magical world. He was filled with awe and excitement. 
He explored many lands as he went on his journey. He faced many challenges but he was brave and powerful and he overcame every obstacle. 
Finally, his quest was complete and he returned home. He was filled with stories to tell and ready for his next great adventure.



Once upon a time, there was a cow. The cow had a secret that no one knew.
One day, the cow revealed its secret. It said it was going to make a big and tasty surprise! 
The cow worked hard that day, and soon it was ready to show everyone its surprise. The cow shared its surprise, which was a delicious beef dish! 
The cow's surprise was a success! Everyone who tried it said it was the best beef they had ever eaten. 
The cow was so happy that it had shared its secret with everyone. It knew that its beef surprise was a success.




Once upon a time, there was a pig who lived underground in a cave. He was a very honest pig, always trying to do the right thing.
One day, he heard a strange noise coming from outside of the cave. He went to take a look and found a little pig leaning against a rock. The little pig seemed sad, so the honest pig asked him what was wrong.
The little pig said that he had no friends, and the other pigs were mean to him. The honest pig said that he could live in the cave with him and they would be friends. 
The little pig smiled and followed the honest pig inside. But when they got there, the honest pig found that the little pig had stolen his things. He was mad, and told the little pig to leave. 
The little pig ran away, never to be seen again. The honest pig was disappointed, but he learned a valuable lesson. From then on, he always checked to make sure that he could trust his friends.




Once upon a time, there was a twin who loved being outside. She had a bright pink sack that she filled with all her favorite things.
One day, the twin was playing outside when she found a mysterious pink flower. She decided to put it in her sack.
"Thank you!" said the flower.
The twin jumped back in surprise. She had never heard a flower talk before! She asked the flower, "Who are you?"
"My name is Pinky," said the flower.
The twin was now even more surprised. She asked, "Can I take you with me?"
"Yes, of course," said Pinky.
So off the twin went, with Pinky in her pink sack. They had lots of fun together, stopping to smell all the other flowers along the way. 
They became best friends, forever. 
The end.




Once upon a time there was a patch. The patch was nice. It was a nice patch of green grass with a few dandelions growing here and there. 
One day, a little girl came to the patch. She bent down and touched the soft grass. She smiled. Then she turned to the patch and said, "Hello! May I join you?" 
The patch was pleased and said, "Yes, please join me. We will have lots of fun together." 
So the little girl and the patch joined together. They played tag and had a race, and the little girl laughed as she ran around the patch. 
Eventually it was time for the little girl to go, but she said to the patch, "I had so much fun. I'll come back soon." 
The patch smiled and waved goodbye as the little girl ran off. It was a nice day and they had a nice time together.



 
Once upon a time, there was a sister who was very elderly. Every morning, she would bow to the sun, to show her respect. 
Her little sister, who was only three years old, wanted to join her. 
"Will you teach me how to bow too?" She asked.
The elder sister smiled. "Of course, little one. Follow me and I will show you how it's done."
She bowed deeply, and the little one did her best to copy. But when the sun shined brightly, she was too shy to bow as far as her elder sister did. 
The elder sister frowned, and said, "I want to show the sun my respect, but you are not bowing deeply enough. Will you try again and show the sun your respect?" 
The little one nodded, and the next morning the sun shined even brighter. Taking a deep breath, she bravely bowed twice as deeply as before to show her respect. 
Her elder sister smiled, proud of her little sister for showing the sun respect. The sun smiled too, for it did not need much to be respected, only a willing heart.




Once upon a time there was a little boy who was marching around in his tiny room. He had a favourite rag which he always held with him, like a security blanket.
One day, the little boy noticed something different outside his bedroom window. He saw a big and dangerous looking animal, with giant horns and furry body.
He asked his mom, "Mommy, what is that animal outside my window?" His mom answered, "That is a bull, my child. It is dangerous so you must stay away from it."
The little boy got scared and said, "I will never march near the bull!"
But the next day he forgot his mother's warnings and found himself near the bull. The bull began to Charge at him! 
Luckily, the little boy had his rag with him and he waved it in front of the bull's face, scaring him away.
The moral of this story is to always listen to your parents even if you don't want to, because they are always trying to protect you.




Once upon a time there was a cute little girl who loved to walk. Every day she would go out for a stroll with her parents, and all around their neighbourhood they would find exciting things to collect.
On one of her walks, the little girl saw a beautiful flower in a neighbours garden and asked her parents, Can I collect it? Her parents said yes, and the little girl smiled, feeling so happy. 
She skipped over to the flower and carefully plucked it from the soil. She twirled it around and ran back to show it to her parents. 
They smiled at the thoughtful gift and praised the little girl for her kindness.
This is a lovely flower. You have done a wonderful job collecting it! her parents said. 
The little girl blushed and said thank you, happy to have found such a cute flower.




Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man who owned a car. One day the tire of his car got flat and he was so unhappy. He went to a mechanic to examine the tire. 
The mechanic took a look and said "Your tire is broken! You need a new one!" 
The rich man was very angry. He said "Can't you fix it? Don't you want to save the tire?" 
The mechanic replied "No sir, it's too late for that. The tire can't be mended." 
The wealthy man was angry and sad, but he had no choice but to buy a new tire. He paid a lot of money, but the tire he bought was old and weak. 
The next day, the car tire got flat again. The wealthy man was furious and had to buy another tire. He was so upset and angry that he never returned the mechanic's shop ever again!




Nina was so excited as she held her new bucket. It was a lovely bright yellow color and it made her feel so happy. She looked up at her mom who was smiling at her.
"What is it, mommy?" Nina said, her voice full of excitement.
"It's your new bucket, sweetheart," her mom replied. "And, as soon as you put it to use, you'll know exactly what it's for." 
Nina couldn't contain her enthusiasm. She ran around the yard with her bucket and eventually filled it with some of the lovely flowers growing on the other side of the garden. 
But when she tried to show her mom, she found the path blocked by her older brother Ivan. He was trying to take the bucket away from her.
"Give it to me!" he said.
But Nina shook her head and held the bucket tightly. She fought with Ivan until eventually her mom came to intervene.
"Now, now, both of you," she said firmly. "Let's be good and share the bucket, okay? I know there's plenty of love to go around." 
Nina and Ivan agreed, and the three of them went together to water the flowers, with Nina proudly holding her lovely bucket.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Emma. She loved to play in the garden and was always playing dress up. Today was special; she had a new hat to try on.
As Emma put the hat on her head, she looked in the mirror. She was glad to see that she looked so beautiful. She twirled around and around and laughed out loud.
Suddenly, her mother called from the doorway, "Emma, time for lunch!"
Emma paused for a moment and then said, "Coming, Mama!" She quickly took off the hat and ran inside.
At the table, Mama said, "I'm glad to see you looking so beautiful in your new hat, Emma." Emma smiled and nodded. She was happy to show off her new hat to Mama.
They finished their lunch and decided on a game of hide and seek. Emma put the hat back on and ran off to hide. Mama counted to ten and began looking for her.
After a few minutes, Mama found Emma and said, "Glad you found such a great hiding spot!" Emma laughed and gave Mama a big hug, then ran off to play some more.




Once upon a time, there lived a little girl named Jane. Jane had a favourite dress, it was blue and sparkly and she loved it more than anything else. Every day, she asked her mum if she could wear her dress and her mum said yes. 
One day, when Jane was wearing her dress, she happened to trample through some grass that had a smelly smell. When Jane got to the house, the smelly smell followed her like a cloud. Jane's mum noticed the smell, and she looked at Jane's dress. 
Mum asked Jane, "What happened? Why is your dress smelly?" Jane replied, "I stepped in some smelly grass, Mum." Mum said, "Oh dear, let's get your dress washed quickly - it's absolutely smelly!". 
That evening, after the dress was washed and dried, Jane was the happiest she had ever been. She thanked her mum for washing her dress and put it on in a flash and wore it throughout the night. Jane was thankful for her dress and all the joy it brought her. 




Once upon a time, there was a farm. The farmer had a delicious, red apple tree. Every morning, the farmer would pick a juicy apple and eat it. One morning, the farmer was walking and noticed something on a cliff. He went to take a look and found it was a sour apple! He thought to himself, "Why is this apple so sour?" The farmer picked the sour apple, put it in his pocket, and continued walking. He soon came across a windmill and decided to turn it around. Suddenly, the windmill started to spin in reverse and a loud noise echoed in the air. The farmer realized the sour apple was a magical one that allowed him to reverse objects. He was very excited! From then on, he was able to reverse anything he wanted. The farmer was very happy and enjoyed his new power.




Once there was a bald man who liked to go for walks in the woods. One day, he was walking and he saw a brown squirrel. The squirrel looked at the bald man and then it started to run away. The bald man chased after it, but it was too fast!
The squirrel ran up a tall tree and the bald man stopped. He stood and watched the squirrel playing in the branches. Then, the squirrel looked down at the bald man, ran to a different tree and jumped through the leaves.
The bald man decided to go home. He smiled as he thought about the squirrel, and he went back the way he had come. He never saw the squirrel again, but he always remembered that special day.




Once upon a time, there were two best friends named Tom and John. Tom went to John's house and saw that he was sad.
Tom asked, "What's wrong?"
John replied, "My pet fish, Fuzzy, died."
Tom said, "I'm sorry." He hugged John and said, "Let's share a thread of sadness together."
John was thankful and said, "Yes, thank you." 
The two friends held hands and shared their sadness. Suddenly Fuzzy's dead body started to move and he was alive again!
John and Tom jumped with joy and they said, "Let's share a thread of happiness together!" They laughed, hugged each other and celebrated Fuzzy's return.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tom. Tom was very brave and did not forget anything. One day Tom's parents took him to the park. Tom was so happy to be there. He ran around the park, laughing and playing.
Suddenly an loud noise got Tom's attention. It was a helicopter! Tom smiled and waved to the people in the helicopter. It was so powerful and moved so fast!
 
Tom asked his parents: "Can we fly in the helicopter?" His parents laughed and said "Maybe one day". But Tom could not wait, he wanted to fly right away. 
Tom was never going to forget the magical moment when he was flying in a powerful helicopter!




Timmy was playing in his sandbox when he noticed something falling from the sky. Whats that? he asked his dad.
Thats ash, his dad replied. Its from the volcano near the city.
Timmy frowned. He felt sad that the volcano was hurting people. He noticed his dad talking to a rude man across the street.
The man yelled, Stop the volcano! Make it fall down!
His dad shook his head. Thats not nice. We cant make the volcano fall - only nature can do that.
Timmy smiled. He was glad his dad was so kind. He watched as the ash continued to fall from the sky.



Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl called Flora. Flora was very curious and liked to explore the world. One day, she was walking in the woods when she heard something. It sounded like singing. Flora was scared, but she decided to dare and venture in further to discover the source of the sound.
As she went deeper and deeper into the forest, she saw a beautiful pond surrounded by trees. There, she saw a cute little fairy singing and playing. The fairy was wearing a sparkly dress and had wings on her back. Flora was fascinated. The fairy noticed her and waved.
The fairy said: "Hello Flora, I am Stevie! Would you like to come and play with me? I have some magical water that can make special things happen". Flora was excited and nodded. The fairy opened her bag and brought out a big jar full of wet, sparkling liquid. She poured some of it on the ground. Suddenly, a big rainbow appeared. Flora was amazed.
Then, Stevie poured the wet magical liquid on a flower, and it came to life! Flora and the fairy laughed and played with the magical flower for hours. In the end, Flora said goodbye to Stevie, waved, and went home.




Once there was a girl called Jane. She was very clever. Jane had lots of toys but her favourite was a doll. Jane loved to play with her doll, especially when the sun was shining.
One day when Jane was playing with her doll, she had an idea. She decided to put her doll in a boat and make it sail on the waves. She took the boat and said to her doll: "Let's go for a sail, it will be fun!"
The boat floated away on the waves and Jane waved goodbye. Jane watched it go and felt proud of her clever idea. But then suddenly, there was a huge wave and the boat tipped over.
Jane was worried, but she didn't give up. She put the boat back in the water and waited for another wave. In no time, a smaller wave came and the boat was righted. Jane was so happy that she learned a lesson that day; she was proud of herself for being so clever!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Janey. She lived with her mommy and daddy, and had a pet dog she loved very much.
One day, daddy brought home a special white vest for Janey. She was so excited to wear it!
But then daddy said, "Janey, if you want to wear this special vest, you must behave well."
Janey was worried, but she nodded and said, "I will, daddy."
Daddy smiled and said, "I know you can do it, Janey."
So Janey did her best to be a good girl and behave very well. After a few days, daddy said, "Well done Janey, you can wear the special white vest now."
Janey was so happy! She put on the vest and smiled. Daddy was so proud of her.
The end.



 
Once upon a time, there were two friends named Leo and Fred. They loved playing together. One day, Leo asked Fred to come to  his house. Fred was excited and he immediately followed Leo.
When they arrived at Leo's house, Leo went to get something from inside. He came back with a large box and said, "Look what I have here!" Fred was curious, and he opened the box. Inside, there was a small, fragile knife.
Leo said, "This knife will unite us forever!" He explained that no matter what happened, they would always be friends. Fred was touched and he immediately hugged Leo. Suddenly, the knife started to glow.
Leo and Fred knew that the knife was magical and it would unite them forever. They held hands and smiled, knowing that nothing would ever be able to keep them apart.



Once upon a time, there was an ignorant baby. He was sitting in the garden and playing with some rocks. Suddenly, he noticed something strange and went over to take a look.
He saw a frog, sitting there in the dirt. The baby asked the frog, "What are you doing?"
The frog replied, "I'm just minding my own business."
The baby thought this was so funny. He laughed and said, "I like that. I'm going to mind my own business too!"
He then went back to playing with his rocks and the frog went back to minding its own business. The two were happy and content, each one doing what they were meant to do. 
The End.




It was a beautiful day, and the air was filled with sunshine and birdsong. Joe was playing in the park with Molly, his best friend.
"Let's pretend to sail!" shouted Molly, pointing to the pond.
Joe smiled, and they both ran to the edge of the water. Joe grabbed a stick, while Molly scooped up some leaves and stones.
"We can make them into a boat!" Molly said, giving Joe a leaf.
Joe made a boat shape with his stick and leaf, while Molly made a boat with her stones. When they were done, they put them carefully in the water and watched.
"Will they float?" asked Joe.
Molly smiled and nodded. "You just have to be patient."
The two friends sat and watched as the boats slowly sailed away from the pond. Joe and Molly laughed as the boats sailed back and forth.
At last, the two friends stood up. "It was fun sailing!" said Joe.
Molly agreed. "Let's do it again some time."




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They were playing together in the garden when Jack said:
"Let's race, Jill!"
Jill thought for a moment, "That's a good idea!" she said.
They ran as fast as they could around the garden, trying to race each other. 
When they stopped, they saw an ordinary screen on the wall of the house. 
"What is that?" asked Jill.
"It's a TV," said Jack. "Shall we watch something together?"
"Yes, let's!" she said.
They rushed over to the screen and started pressing the buttons until they found a cartoon that they liked. 
They both laughed and cheered as they watched the show together, forgetting about their race.



John and Sarah were very excited. Today they were going to send something in an envelope to their Grandma in the east. John decided to draw a picture of a flower and Sarah made a card with a poem.
John said, "Let's be grateful to Grandma and write a thank you note in the envelope".
So Sarah quickly wrote a thank you note and they placed both the card and the picture carefully into the envelope and closed it up. 
John looked at Sarah and said, "Let's send and show Grandma how grateful we are." 
They ran outside and put the envelope into the mailbox and waved goodbye. 
John and Sarah smiled as they watched the envelope move further and further away towards Grandma in the east.




Once upon a time, there were two little kids who loved to explore outside. Their names were Max and Lou.
One day, Max and Lou decided to go for a walk and see if they could find some adventure. They decided to follow the trail of nuts and see where it would lead them.
Max and Lou walked and walked. Max said, Look, Lou! Theres a nut up ahead! Lou said, Lets follow it! 
So they followed the nut and it led them to a big tree. Lou said, Oh, look at all the nuts under the tree! Max said, Lets try to get one! 
So they ran fast to try and get a nut. But just as they were about to grab it, a big squirrel grabbed it first and ran away! 
Max and Lou laughed. Oh well. At least we tried, Lou said. And then they went home, with lots of stories to tell.



 
The sun was out, and the sky was very blue. In the distance, Jack could see a delicate crane flying across it. He ran out of his house to get a better look.
"It's so beautiful," he said to himself. As he watched the bird, an idea popped into his head. "I want to care for the crane," he said. 
Jack's mom heard him and looked at him with love. She said, "Jack, what a wonderful thought. But we can't keep it here."
Jack was sad, but he understood. He waved goodbye to the crane as it flew away.
On Jack's birthday, his mom brought him a special gift. It was a delicate crane, just like the one he had seen in the sky.
Jack was so happy. He hugged it and said, "I'm so excited to care for you!" 
His mom smiled and said, "Now you can care for the crane yourself." 
Jack beamed with pride. He held his new crane close and said, "I can do it. I'm going to be the best crane caretaker ever!"




Michael toddled around the playground, admiring the colorful slides and swings. He was determined to try each one. As he walked, he stumbled over a rock. Michael fell onto the ground. He started to cry.
Suddenly, his mom heard the cries and ran to him. "Oh no! Are you okay?" His mom asked.
Michael sniffled and pointed to his toe. "It hurts," he cried.
His mom looked closer and saw a tiny cut on his toe. "It's okay, let's get you some help," she said, picking him up.
Inside the house, his mom got out a bandage and began wrapping it around Michael's toe. He grasped at the bandage and tried to rip it off.
"Michael, it's important to keep the bandage on," his mom said. She was very persistent.
Michael stopped for a moment and slowly nodded. He knew his mum was right, so he held on until the bandage was securely in place. Now his boo-boo was safe. He smiled and hugged his mom.




One day, the little girl was feeling curious. She saw a big wheel in the playground and wondered what it would be like to spin it. She went up to it and tried to spin it, but it wouldn't move. 
And then her mom walked up, saw what she was doing, and said, "Let me help you." She knelt down and turned the wheel. 
The little girl was so happy! She ran around and around the wheel and laughed as it spun faster and faster. Mom watched with a smile on her face.
When the little girl got tired, mom said, "Let me help you back down." She held the top of the wheel and slowly worked it back to a stop. 
The little girl smiled and gave her mom a big hug. They both laughed and the little girl said, "Thank you for helping me."




Sam's mum had made some amazing pastries for him and his brother to eat. They were so delicious. Every time Sam took a bite of the pastry, he felt so comforted. 
One day, his mum asked him and his brother to go for a walk outside. When the boys got home, they saw a huge furry dog. Sam's brother was scared, but Sam was excited. He wanted to pet the dog.
Sam's mum told the boys to stay away from the dog. She said, "It's not safe, something bad could happen." 
Sam didn't listen. He ran up to the dog and said "hi". But the dog growled, and then it bit Sam's arm. Sam screamed. 
His mum quickly ran over and comforted Sam until the ambulance came. Sam was taken to the hospital and, thankfully, he was okay. But he never forgot his mum's warning.




Once upon a time, there were two friends. The first friend was called Jack, and the second friend was called Jill. Jack and Jill were having a picnic in the park, and they had lots of yummy food that they could eat.
Jack looked at the table and noticed a strange jar. He asked Jill, "What's in this jar?" Jill smiled and said, "It's sugar! Would you like some?"
