Jack shook his head and said, "No, thank you. I don't think I should eat sugar. My mom won't allow it." 
Jill nodded and said, "I have something else for you. Take a look!" She handed Jack a box of sour candy.
Jack was surprised. "Sour candy! That sounds yummy. Can I try some?" 
Jill nodded again. "Of course! Here, take one. I hope you like it!" Jack took one of the sour candies, put it in his mouth, and smiled. "Mmm, this is delicious! Thank you, Jill!" 
And that's the story of Jack and Jill and the sweet and sour candy.




Once upon a time there was a clever puppy named Fluffy. He loved to wander around, exploring the world around him. 
One day, Fluffy stumbled upon a pocket. He sniffed it curiously. When he looked inside he saw a shiny red ball. He instantly knew he wanted to belong to him. 
"Wait a minute," said a voice. Fluffy turned quickly and saw a little girl. He knew he wasn't supposed to take something that didn't belong to him, so he bowed his head in shame. 
"That's okay," said the little girl. "My name is Sue and I can tell you're a very clever puppy. You can have the ball if you like." 
Fluffy was so happy! He put the ball in his pocket and smiled at little Sue. He thanked her for her kindness and raced off to show his new ball to his friends. 
From that day on, Fluffy always remembered to be kind and thoughtful because he knew there was always something special in helping other people.




Once upon a time, there was a family. The mom, dad, and their two children. The two children were named Susie and John. One day the family decided to go on a zoom. 
They zoomed around in the car for a very long time. They enjoyed looking at the trees and sky. As they were zooming, they began to see lots of bright lights and make crazy sounds. 
John was amazed by the lights and wanted to get a closer look. So mom and dad decided to stop the car and let him out. He was so happy to explore. 
John saw something twinkling on the ground and he picked it up. It was a little rock! He was so excited to have found this treasure. But then, he started to think, maybe it had value. He thought it was too special to keep, so he put it back where he found it. 
John was proud of himself for valuing the little rock. He got back into the car and they continued with their zoom.




Ryan was excited because he had been invited to a special event. His parents told him he would need to be good to go. "Do you think you can be nice for us, Ryan?" his mom asked.
He nodded eagerly and promised he would behave. His mom smiled and gave him a big hug.
On the day of the event everyone was getting ready to go. Ryan was so excited, he was bouncing off the walls! 
His mom put on an extra special outfit and said, "Ryan, I have something special for you." 
She held out a small box and said, "In this box is something really useful for you. You can use it at the event."
Ryan opened the box and inside was a toy helicopter. It was orange and blue and had blinking lights. 
He was so excited, he ran up to his mom and gave her a big hug. Then he ran outside to try out the toy. He flew it up and down in the sky, pretending to send messages. 
When it was time to leave, Ryan put the toy in his pocket and he and his family headed off to the event. He had a wonderful time and thanked his mom for sending him something useful.




At the forest, there was a little bunny named Binky. Binky was so cheerful, she loved to run and play with her friends.
One day, Binky stumbled upon a trap that had been left by a hunter. Binky was so scared and she started to cry. 
But then, a friendly fox named Fluffy came over and asked her why she was crying. Binky told Fluffy about the trap. 
Fluffy said, No more crying. We can solve this together!
So, Binky and Fluffy worked together to set the trap aside. When it was done, Binky was so happy and Fluffy was so cheerful. 
They high fived each other and went back to playing in the forest. Binky was so glad that Fluffy helped her solve the trap.




Once upon a time, a mom and dad had a son named James. He was 3 years old and loved the outdoors.
One day, James's parents told him, "It's time to go to the park." James was so excited that he jumped up, grabbed his shoes, and ran outside.
When they got to the park, James was in awe. He saw a big pond with birds floating on it, and the moment he saw them, he started pointing and saying "Look! Look!"
His mom said, "Do you believe that if you throw a penny in the water, the birds will bring you money?" James didn't understand what she said but he just kept looking and pointing at the birds.
Mom then said, "Here, why don't you try it?" She gave him a penny, but it was so heavy that James couldn't throw it far enough for the birds to get it.
His dad then said, "It's okay, James. You can keep the penny. One day you'll be able to throw it and know the magic of believing." 
James smiled and hugged his parents tight. He felt warm and happy inside. From that day on, he believed that money was magic.




Once upon a time there was a family who loved going on adventures. One day they decided to go camping.
Mum said, We need to prepare for our camping trip!
Dad said, Lets get the tent, food and games ready.
The little girl smiled, she was so excited to go!
On the way to their camping spot, they stopped at a river. Suddenly, the little girl saw a very unusual word written in the sand.
The little girl asked: What does that word mean?
Its a surprise, mum said.
When the family got to their campsite, the little girl looked back at the word in the sand and shouted with joy, Its the name of the river!
Mum laughed and said, Thats right! Now, lets prepare for a wonderful camping adventure!




Once upon a time, there was a little bear. He was ready for a big adventure but he wasn't sure what he should do. So he decided to take a walk in the woods.
As he walked, he heard a sound. It was a raven, cawing in the tree above. The raven's beak glowed in the moonlight. The little bear could feel the bright light shining all around him and he knew something special was coming. 
The little bear kept walking and soon he saw a cave. He was scared, but he was also brave and he was ready to explore. He stepped into the cave and saw a glowing object in the distance. The raven flew into the cave and landed next to the glowing object.
The little bear saw that the object was a magical gem. He wanted to take it with him but the raven wouldn't let him. He was ready to fight the raven, but just when they were about to fight, a bright flash of light filled the cave and a beautiful fairy appeared. 
The fairy told them that the gem was an important part of their magical forest, and that it was their job to protect it. So the little bear and the raven understood, and the raven left in peace. 
The little bear was relieved. He now knew what his adventure was about--to guard the gem and protect the magical forest.




One day, Jimmy was bouncing a ball against the fence in his yard. Suddenly, the fence revealed a graceful fairy in a sparkly dress. She smiled at Jimmy and said, Hello there!
Jimmy was so surprised he dropped the ball and asked, Who are you?
The fairy laughed and said, My name is Clara. I want to show you something special. She waved her wand and the fence opened up to reveal a beautiful flower garden. Jimmys eyes lit up and he said, Wow!
Clara smiled and said, This is my garden and it is my job to make sure it looks graceful. Now, go explore!
Jimmy was amazed, so he ran around the garden, looking at all the different kinds of flowers. After he finished exploring, he thanked Clara for showing him such a special place. She smiled and said, Youre welcome! Now, I must go back to my job of keeping the garden looking graceful. Goodbye!
And with that, Clara disappeared behind the fence. Jimmy smiled and continued bouncing the ball against the fence, hopeful that one day Clara would come back and reveal her magical garden again.




Once upon a time, two friends were walking in the landscape. They were talking and laughing, having a great time together.
"Look at the fair sky!" said one friend.
"Yes, it is beautiful!" said the other.
Suddenly, the first friend started to run. He ran faster and faster, and soon, he reached the edge of the landscape.
"What are you doing?" shouted the other friend. 
The first friend ignored him, and wanted to jump off the edge.
"NO!" shouted the other friend, and he rushed over. He went over and slapped the first friend on the shoulder.
The first friend was angry. He shouted, "Why did you do that?" 
"You shouldn't do something just because it looks fun," said the other friend. "It isn't always fair to ignore the rules".
The first friend thought about it for a moment, and he realized that his friend was right. He thanked his friend for showing him what was fair and for helping him make better choices. 
The two friends smiled at each other, and from then on, they were always careful to make sure they followed the rules.




Once upon a time there was a young girl named Sarah. She loved to record the world around her. She had one wish: to buy a cheap recording device and capture the sights and sounds of nature. 
One day, Sarah asked her mom if she could buy a new recorder. Her mother agreed and they went shopping together. 
They searched the stores and eventually found the perfect, cheap recorder. The little girl was so excited. She grabbed the device and hugged it close.
Thank you for my recorder, mommy! Im going to record everything! she said. 
Her mother smiled, hugged her back and said, Im sure you will, sweetie. Just be sure to be careful. 
And so, Sarah happily walked away with her new recorder, excited to go out and record the world around her.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Daisy. She had a special rocking chair which her Daddy had made for her. Every day when Daisy was tired, she would sit down in the rocker and her Daddy would give her a big push and say, 'One, two, three, rock!'
Sometimes Daisy's little sister, Annabelle, would join in. She would carefully climb on to Daisy's lap and hug her tight. Then Daisy and Annabelle would hold on as Daddy pushed them back and forth.
When Daisy rocked, she felt so safe and happy. She would close her eyes and feel the rocking going faster and faster, until it felt like they were flying. "Wheee!" cried Daisy with a huge grin. 
Annabelle would squeal with delight, and Daddy would laugh, too. Then the rocking slowed down until it came to a gentle stop.
"That was the best ever!" said Daisy, hugging her Daddy and her little sister close. "Rock me again, please!" 
And so dad Patiently pushed Daisy and Annabelle back and forth, again and again, in their special rocking chair, until Daisy was sleepy and ready for a nap. 
And that's what happened every time Daisy and Annabelle went for a ride in their rocking chair.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Timmy. He loved to play with his toys and make castles with them.
One day, Timmy wanted to make the biggest castle ever. He was very excited and started to build it carefully. He was very delicate so the castle looked perfect!
Suddenly, something scary happened. A dragon appeared in the sky and it flew down to Timmy's castle! It pinched the tower with its claws and destroyed it. Timmy was terrified - it was like a nightmare!
Luckily, his mom came to the rescue. She put her arm around Timmy and said "Don't worry, everything will be okay."
Timmy felt much better and they cleaned up the mess together. From then on, Timmy only built small castles that were safe from dragons.




Once upon a time, there was a small girl who loved to walk around in nature. On one of her walks, she came across a bean in the grass. She was so excited, she shouted out loud, "Look what I found!" 
Her mother, who was walking behind her, answered her, "That's a bad bean, let's leave it alone."
The little girl didn't understand and picked up the bean in her hands. "Why is it bad mommy?" she asked. 
Her mother smiled and replied, "Because it won't grow into something special, like your other beans at home." 
The little girl smiled and said, "Ok, I'll leave it here then!" She put the bean back in the grass and they continued to walk together.




Once upon a time, there was a lab. In the lab, lived a small girl named Sophie. She was three years old.
Sophie loved to explore the lab. Every day she would go from room to room, discovering something new. One day as she went from room to room, she came across a large room with a big box in the middle of it. 
"What is in the box?" Sophie asked. 
Just then, an old man appeared in the doorway. He smiled kindly at Sophie and spoke. "That is a hard puzzle," he said. "Will you try to solve it?" 
Sophie nodded and climbed into the box. For hours she tried to solve the puzzle, but it was very hard. She was about to give up when suddenly, the puzzle unlocked.
The old man smiled and said, "Well done Sophie! I knew you could do it." 
Sophie smiled and stepped out of the box. She thanked the old man and went back to exploring the lab.




Once upon a time there was John, he was a fat boy. One day he was playing with his friends when they heard a noise coming from the wardrobe. They saw an old man and a bird quarreling in the wardrobe. The old man was shouting at the bird. 
John wanted to see what was happening so he and his friends opened the wardrobe door and peeked inside. The old man was getting very angry with the bird and he was chasing her around inside the wardrobe. 
John was frightened, so he and his friends closed the door. Later that day, John's parents took him to the park and he saw the bird again. The old man was there as well. This time, instead of quarreling, the old man was holding a treat for the bird and she was eating it happily. 
John was surprised by the surprising change in their behavior. He had expected the old man and bird to continue to quarrel, but instead they were content. John had learned a lesson that day  not to judge people and animals too quickly.




Once upon a time there lived a little boy named Jake. Jake lived near the sea and he loved to watch the boats sail past. One day Jake decided he wanted to sail his own boat. So he found a boat and climbed on. He pushed and pulled until he was out in the open sea. 
The sun was shining, the wind was blowing and the boat was rolling in the waves. When the boat reached the middle of the sea, Jake noticed an old cabin. He made his way to the cabin and saw it was very peaceful.
"I could stay here forever" thought Jake. He opened the door and heard a loud noise. A big scary monster was inside! The monster frowned and said "YOU CANNOT STAY HERE. THIS PLACE IS FOR ME AND ME ALONE!"
Jake was scared, but then he remembered something his father had told him. He said that peace comes from sharing and understanding. 
Jake looked the monster in the eye and said "Let me stay here a while. I can show you how to share and understand and we will both be happy."
The monster thought for a moment and said "OK. You can stay, but only if you show me how to be peaceful. Deal?" 
Jake smiled and said "Deal!" 
So Jake taught the monster how to share and understand and soon the two were living in peace and harmony in the old cabin. 



 
Lily was walking around the lake. It was so pretty, with bright blue water and lots of ducks. She was so happy, she smiled and said, "Look how adorable!"
Suddenly, she heard a noise. It was a strange noise, like somebody was singing. Lily looked around and saw a frog. He was hopping from one lily pad to the next, singing a happy song.
Lily said hello and asked him why he was so cheerful. The frog kept hopping and singing, and then he said, "I'm so happy! I'm going to bring a friend to the lake."
Lily was so excited and said, "That's a wonderful idea! Please bring them." And with that, the frog hopped away. 
The next day, Lily was back at the lake. Suddenly, she heard the same singing. She looked around and saw the frog, with a tiny ladybug on his back. The ladybug was singing too!
Lily was so surprised and said, "That's so adorable!" The frog hopped around, showing off his new friend. The two of them were having a lot of fun together and it made Lily smile.




Once upon a time, there was a very cheerful cop. He loved his job and kept everyone safe. One day, he was having a tough time. He was trying to solve a difficult problem! 
Just then, a little three year old walked up to him. "What's wrong?" the little one asked with a smile.
The cop smiled too, happy to have help. He said, "I'm trying to solve this problem, but I can't figure it out. Can you help me?"
The little one frowned and kicked a rock. Then, all of a sudden, she had an idea. She clapped her hands and said, "I know! Let's go ask my mom!" 
The cop and the little one went to her mom and asked for her help. After a few minutes, the problem was solved! 
The cop smiled from ear to ear and thanked the little one, saying, "Thank you for being so cheerful and helping me solve the problem!" 
The little one smiled back, happy that she could help.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Joe. Joe loved playing in the garden, and especially liked chasing butterflies.
One day, Joe was chasing a butterfly when suddenly it flew into a bush. Joe wanted to catch it and pushed the bush aside.
Suddenly, a bee struck Joe's arm! Joe was scared and ran away.
Joe's mum saw what happened and ran over to help her son.
"Are you okay, Joe?" asked his mum.
Joe shook his head and said "Bee sting bad".
Mum looked at Joes arm and said: "I think it's time for some sugar".
Joe loved sugar, so he cheered up. Mum gave Joe a spoonful of sugar to eat. She explained that sugar helps heal bee stings because it's dangerous for them.
Joe learned an important lesson that day - never mess with bees or they might strike!




John and Jane were at the park. Sunlight was shining brightly and the birds were singing. John and Jane heard a splash in the lake. 
John said to Jane, "Look! What is that?"
Jane said, "It's a turkey! It's swimming and splashing in the lake!"
They laughed, watching the turkey swim and splash in the bright water. Then, they ran to the lake to see the turkey up close.
John and Jane got to the lake and saw the turkey swimming in circles. They laughed as the turkey splashed them, getting them all wet. 
The turkey was happy and John and Jane were happy too. Finally, the turkey flew away to the sky, still splashing in the bright sunlight.




Once upon a time, there was a rich boy called Jack. Jack wanted to keep some lightning in his house.
So he went to find some. On his way, he met some friendly animals who were more than happy to show him where he could find some lightning.
But once he got to the place of the lightning, there was so much of it that Jack couldn't keep it all. He looked at the animals with a sad face and said: "I can't keep so much. What should I do?" 
The animals thought for a while and then one of them said: "You can take a little bit each time. That way, you can keep some lightning, and it will last much longer than if you try to carry it all in one go."
Jack thanked the animals and did as they said. He kept some of the lightning in his house and was very happy. From that moment on, every time Jack needed some lightning, he knew just where to get it!




Once upon a time there was a little boy who really liked to sleep. Every day he loved to sleep for long hours. One day he thought he would try something different and he decided to take a nap in a coal mine. 
The coal mine was very dark and scary but he was brave and so he decided to go ahead. He soon found the perfect spot and fell asleep.
But little did he know, there was a giant monster sneaking around in the coal mine! The monster was searching for someone to eat. When it saw the little boy sleeping it decided to eat him.
The little boy woke up with a start and saw the monster. He was so scared that he started to cry. But then he had a brilliant idea. He quickly closed his eyes and pretended to be asleep. The monster got very confused and decided to leave. The little boy was so relieved and he knew that sleep had saved him this time.
And ever since then, the little boy was very careful to always sleep in an easy and safe place.




Once upon a time there was a bad guy. He was mean and wanted to steal. One day, he saw gas in a big tank. He thought it was very heavy, but he wanted it so he tried to carry it away.
He struggled and stumbled trying to get the heavy tank, but he kept going. Everyone started shouting, telling him to put it back. But the bad guy didn't listen.
Suddenly, the police arrived. They asked him why he was stealing the gas. He looked scared and tried to hide the tank. But it was too late. The police caught him and he had to go to jail.
The bad guy learned his lesson and never tried to steal again. He was very sorry for trying to steal the heavy gas. He promised to always be good.




Once upon a time there was a curious little girl. She liked to explore and find interesting things. One day while she was playing by the river, she spotted a twinkling diamond on the ground. She said to herself, "Ooh, a diamond!" She picked it up and brought it home to show her mum.
Mum smiled and said, "That's a pretty diamond, my love. We should look after it and keep it as our special gem."
The little girl nodded and carefully placed the diamond in her pocket. But later that evening, when the diamond was nowhere to be found, everyone was very sad.
The little girl's mum looked at her and asked, "Do you know where the diamond is, my love? We really want it back."
The little girl felt so guilty and ashamed. She knew she had lost it in the river. She looked up at her mum and said, "I'm so sorry, Mum. I lost the diamond in the river."
Mum smiled and said. "It's ok, my love. I forgive you. Let's go and search for the diamond tomorrow."
The next day they went to the river and searched and searched until they finally found the diamond. Everyone was so happy!
Mum said to the little girl, "I'm so glad we found the diamond. That was so kind of you to come here and help look for it




Once upon a time, there was a chubby man who liked to go to the market. He liked to look at all of the things there, and he especially liked to find the things that had value. Every time he shopped, he found something new and special.
One day, he spotted a very shiny item in the market. He asked the shopkeeper what it was, and the shopkeeper told him it was a diamond. He was amazed and couldn't believe his luck. He wanted to buy it, so he asked the shopkeeper how much it cost. The shopkeeper said it was worth a lot of money, but he was willing to make a deal.
The man was so excited to own the shiny diamond, he quickly agreed to the deal. He paid the shopkeeper and left the market with a huge smile on his face. From then on, he was sure to always value the nice things he found at the market.




The mommy and her son were walking outside. The son saw a shiny metal thing on the ground. He asked his mommy what it was.
"That's a metal," the mommy explained. "It's very hard and heavy."
The son picked it up and noticed it was sharp. He got a cut on his finger. "Ouch! It hurt!" the son cried.
The mommy came over and held his hand. "Let me see," she said. "Yes, it looks like you got a little hurt. But don't worry, it's just a tiny cut and it will heal soon." The mommy kissed his finger and smiled at her son.




Once upon a time, there was a mommy and a little girl who loved to perform. Every spring, they would go to the park and dance a special dance together.
One day they went to the park again, and the little girl was upset. She wanted to perform her dance all by herself, but mommy said she was too little to do it alone.
The little girl started to cry. She was so upset that she had to perform with mommy. Mommy tried to tell her it was ok and even gave her a hug, but the little girl kept crying.
Finally, mommy said they should leave the park. They got in the car and drove away. The little girl kept crying all the way home, and she was so upset that she never went back to the park to perform her special dance.



Once upon a time, there lived a little girl called Amy. Amy was very wealthy and lived in her own huge chamber. 
One day, Amy decided to take a nap and she lay down in her chamber. She closed her eyes and began to think happy thoughts.
Suddenly, a tiny little voice came from the corner of the chamber. "Amy, why don't you come and play with me?," said the voice. 
Amy opened her eyes and saw a small, friendly fairy.
"Oh, hello little fairy! I'd love to come and play but I'm so tired, can we play later when I wake up from my nap?" Amy replied.
The fairy smiled and said "Of course! I'll be here when you wake up." 
Amy closed her eyes and continued to dream peacefully until later that day when she awoke feeling refreshed and happy. Amy and the fairy played happily in the chamber all day and Amy was glad she had made a new friend. 
The End.




Jane and Tom were in the front yard, playing a game. Jane was laughing and said, "I have a good joke!" 
Tom said, "Let me hear it!" 
Jane took a deep breath, then said, "Why did the baby store his dirty clothes in the closet?"
Tom thought for a minute, and said, "I don't know, why?"
Jane laughed, "Because he wanted them to stay tidy!" 
Tom laughed too, but then he looked around, and became very serious. 
"Oh no," he said, "Mommy is mad at us! We weren't supposed to tell jokes in the front yard!"
Jane was scared. She wasn't sure what would happen next. Suddenly, Mommy came out of the house, with her hands on her hips.
"Tom and Jane," she said in a stern voice, "You have to tell jokes in the house, not outside. Now come inside and I'll help you think of a new joke to tell." 
Tom and Jane looked at each other, and sheepishly followed Mommy inside.




Once upon a time, there was a small girl who wanted to see a whale. She asked her mom, "Mommy, can I see a whale?" Her mom replied, "Maybe. We'll have to wait and see." 
So the girl and her mom went out to the beach to find a whale. But there was no whale to be seen. The little girl was so sad and sighed. Then suddenly, she saw a big whale high up in the sky! 
"Oh, look! A whale, Mommy! Up in the sky!" shouted the little girl. 
The mom and the little girl watched the whale, who was sitting high up in the sky. It was so graceful and the little girl was so excited. She looked up in the sky and watched the whale until it disappeared. 
The little girl smiled and said, "We saw a whale in the sky, Mommy!" 
The mom smiled back and said, "Yes, my darling. We saw a whale in the sky."




Once upon a time, there was a rich boy called Tim. He loved to go outside and move around. One day, Tim went to the roof of his house and he saw something amazing  a bouncy castle! It was so big and colourful, Tim couldn't believe his eyes. 
He ran back inside to find his parents. When he found them, he asked them: "Can I go play on the bouncy castle?" His parents smiled and agreed to take him.
When Tim got to the castle, he jumped and moved around like never before. He had so much fun, that he didn't want to leave. His parents had to call him several times to get him to come home.
From that day onwards, Tim knew that the roof of his house contained amazing surprises. He loved to come up there and move around. Even now, as a grown-up, he always goes to the roof of his house whenever he needs some time to enjoy the beautiful view and simply move around.




Once upon a time there was a small girl called Ami. She was only three years old, but she was very brave. Today, she was feeling a bit scared of the thunder and lightning outside.
Ami's parents heard her crying, so they came in to see her. They gave her a big hug, trying to make her feel better.
Ami's dad said, "Don't worry Ami. Let me wipe away your tears."
Ami smiled and felt much better. Her dad wiped her tears away with his big soft handkerchief.
Ami said a big thank you to her parents. She felt so much safer now that they were around.
From that day on, Ami knew she could always depend on her loving parents to make her feel safe and secure.




Timmy was getting ready for bed. His mommy was helping him pick out his pajamas. When they were finished, they went to his bedroom and his mommy tucked him in his crib. She smiled down at him and said, "Be safe, Timmy!"
Timmy asked, "Mommy, why can't I stay up a little longer?" His mommy replied, "Because it's time to go to sleep. You can delay it, but you must go to bed soon."
Timmy reluctantly nodded and his mommy gave him a kiss on the forehead. She hugged him tight, then wished him sweet dreams and left the room.
Timmy laid down in his crib and looked around his bedroom. He saw his stuffed animal, Mr. Bear, and smiled. He felt safe and comfortable in the warm and cozy bed. Then, with a yawn and one last glance around the room, he closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep.




Once upon a time, there was a cute little girl named Jenny. She really enjoyed playing with her toys and loved the cold winter months. One winter, Jenny decided she wanted to go and visit a reindeer.
So, Jenny put her warmest coat on and set off to the nearest park. When she got there, she was very excited to see a big, beautiful reindeer. Jenny walked up to the reindeer, wanting to give it a big hug. 
The reindeer smiled at Jenny and said, Hello! Would you like to enjoy a ride on my back? Im available to take you around the park. Jenny was so excited, she couldnt contain her happiness. 
Jenny hopped onto the reindeer's back and held onto its antlers. The reindeer started to walk around the park and Jenny was so amazed at how fast it was going! They went around a few times before the reindeer said, That was fun! I hope you enjoyed it". 
Jenny smiled and said, Yes, thank you so much! I really enjoyed my ride. She quickly hugged the reindeer before running back home, happy with her amazing adventure.




Once upon a time, there lived two little friends, Jack and Lily. They were always together and loved to explore. One day they decided to go to the big city and have an adventure. 
They got on the train and it took them to the city. As soon as they stepped off, Jack said, "Lily, let's go look around!"
Lily nodded and smiled. They wandered around the city looking at all the tall buildings. Then they saw a beautiful park.
"Let's go over there," said Lily.
When they got to the park, they found a thin fence around it. Jack said, "Oh, this fence is locked. Let's try to find a way in." 
Lily thought for a minute and said, "I know! Let's climb over the fence, it's thin enough!" So Jack and Lily scaled the thin fence, and soon they were having lots of fun in the park. 
At the end of the day, they waved goodbye to the city and happily went home.



 
There was a dove. It was very comfortable in the tree. The dove liked to hang from the branch. Every day it would hang upside down and close its eyes. 
One day, a little girl walked by the tree. She was 3 years old and she saw the dove hanging. She was very excited. She put her hand out and tried to touch it. The dove didn't mind; it felt comfortable with the little girl. 
The girl smiled. She said hello to the dove and the dove tilted it's head. She touched it very gently and then started to climb the tree. Soon, the little girl and the dove were both hanging from the branch. 
The dove was happy and the little girl was smiling. They stayed there together until the sun went down. Then they both flew away, up into the sky.



 
Once upon a time there were two friends, Julie and Jack. One day, Jack said to Julie, "Let's go sit in the park!" Julie smiled and said, "Yes, let's go!"
So, off they went. When they reached the park, they sat down beside a big tree. From there, they could see all kinds of fruit trees. Julie pointed at a fruit tree and said, "That looks so scary! I don't want to pick its fruits!" Jack smiled and said, "Don't worry, Julie. That's just a blackberry bush. Let's go pick some delicious berries!"
Together, they carefully picked the berries and put them into a bowl. After they were done, they went back to their spot and sat under the tree. They enjoyed the juicy and sweet blackberries, and laughed happily.




Once upon a time, there was a rich little girl named Emily. Every day, Emily would climb up on the swing in her backyard. As she swung higher and higher, she imagined she was soaring high in the sky with the birds. One day, while Emily was on the swing, a big block of ice flew down from the sky and landed in her backyard! Emily was so excited! She hopped off the swing and ran up to the ice. She touched it and saw that the ice was very cold.
Emily shouted to her mom, "Mommy! I found some ice!" Her mom came running and said, "Oh wow! That is a big block of ice! What are you going to do with it?" Emily thought for a moment and said, "I'm going to swing it!" She grabbed the ice and used it like a swing. She swung it vigorously from side to side, laughing as the ice made a whooshing sound through the air. 
After a while, her mom said, "That's enough swinging for now, Emily. Let's put the ice in the freezer so we can enjoy an icy treat later!" Emily smiled and said, "Yes Mommy!"  She was happy to have her very own piece of ice that she could swing and enjoy!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She wanted to find a place to take a nap. Everywhere she looked, there was nothing soft she could sleep on. Lucy saw a big rock and decided to try napping on it. 
No matter how much she tried, the rock was just too hard. Lucy started to feel an itch and picked at it. 
"Why is this rock so tough?" complained Lucy.
Just then, a small, fluffy pillow flew out of the sky and landed in front of her. She smiled and said, "This looks perfect for a nap!"
So Lucy laid down on the pillow and felt the softness against her skin. She closed her eyes and nodded off right away. 
The next morning, Lucy woke up feeling well-rested. She was so glad she found the perfect spot for her nap!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was very brave and had a lot of muscle. She was always reliable when it came to doing something new.
One day, Lucy decided to enter a mysterious forest. As soon as she did, she heard an unfamiliar voice. It was coming from a big tree.
Lucy said to the tree, "Who are you?"
The tree replied, "I'm Old Oak, the guardian of the forest."
Lucy felt a bit scared, but she trusted her muscle and stayed strong. She asked Old Oak if she could explore the forest.
Old Oak smiled. "Of course you can. Just be reliable, and you'll be safe."
And so, Lucy ventured into the forest, feeling brave and confident with her reliable muscle. She had the best adventure ever!




Once upon a time, there lived a curious little girl called Sara. She just turned three and loved to explore her garden.
On one hot day, Sara found a strange loop in the grass. She wondered what it could be used for and said to her mum, What is this?
Her mum smiled and said, That's a loop. It's very useful for doing something special.
Sara was very intrigued and asked, What can I do with it?
Watch this, replied her mum as she shut the loop. All of a sudden, the wind stopped blowing and the sun was blocked out. 
Sara was surprised, Wow! How did you do that? 
Her mum laughed and said, The loop is very useful. It can make the wind and sun go away, just like magic.
Sara was delighted. She ran around the garden with the loop, experimenting to see what else she could make happen. Her mum smiled and said, That loop is a very useful tool. 
The End.




Maggie the kangaroo marched through the woods. She was happy and full of energy. Suddenly, she heard a voice yelling. It was her friend Johnny.
"Maggie, stop! There's a big hole in the ground ahead," he said. 
Maggie stopped and looked. She could see the hole and it was very big.
"I'm scared," said Maggie. "I don't want to hurt my foot trying to jump over it."
But Johnny was brave. He marched right up to the edge of the hole and said, "I know how to get across. Follow me!"
Maggie followed Johnny. He used a large stick to help him balance as he hopped from one side of the hole to the other.
When he was safely across the other side, he called out to Maggie, "See, it was easy! Come on, you can do it too!"
Maggie got ready and started to jump. She easily leapt over the hole and safely landed on the other side. Maggie was so happy. She had conquered the big hole and didn't get hurt!




Once upon a time there was a tiny mouse who lived in an ancient castle. The castle was full of secrets and the mouse was always curious to explore it.
One day the mouse saw an inviting door. He hesitated for a moment but then decided to enter. Inside was the most delicious looking salad the mouse had ever seen! He eagerly started snacking on the salad when suddenly, he heard a loud voice.
"Hey! Get off my salad!" The mouse looked up to see a giant lizard standing in front of him. The mouse was terrified and stopped eating right away.
The lizard was angry and demanded that the mouse pay for the salad. The mouse had no money, so he offered to clean the ancient castle as payment instead. The lizard reluctantly agreed, and the mouse got to work. 
Eventually, the mouse managed to clean the castle and the lizard was very impressed by his hard work. The lizard said he'd let the mouse go for this one time but advised him to never enter the castle again. The mouse thanked the lizard and ran off, never to return.




Once upon a time there lived a boy named Pete. Pete wanted to climb to the top of a tall tree. The tree was very high, but Pete was very persistent.
Pete's mom saw him and said, "Pete, that tree is too high! You can't climb it!"
But Pete wouldn't listen. He kept trying to climb higher and higher. He just wouldn't give up.
Finally, Pete made it to the top of the tree. At the top, he found a giant bowl of salad. He was so excited that he started to eat it with his hands.
Suddenly, Pete started to slip. He tried to grab onto the tree, but his hands were too greasy from the salad. He tumbled down and landed with a thud on the ground.
The next day, Pete was very sad. He went back to the tree, but he knew he would never climb it again.




Anna was a three-year-old who prided herself on being a big girl. She loved to do things by herself, like getting dressed for the day. One day, she was feeling especially brave and wanted to help mommy with cooking, so before mommy could say no, Anna ran over to the kitchen. She saw the stove, and it made her eyes light up.
"Ooh! I'm gonna be sooooo helpful," Anna said with a smile. 
Mommy looked over and said, "Anna, you must not touch the stove. It can be very noisy and dangerous." 
Anna nodded, but when mommy had her back turned, Anna ran over to the stove and touched the knob. But when she touched it, it started to emit a loud buzzing sound. Anna panicked, and backed away from the stove.
Mommy looked over and said, "See, I told you it was dangerous! Please don't touch the stove without adult help." 
Anna nodded, understanding that the stove was too big and noisy for her to handle. Since then, Anna has remembered to always ask for help when it comes to things that are too big or dangerous for her. The moral of this story is to ask for help when you're not sure what you're doing!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. She was three years old and loved to clap her hands. One night, while Daisy was playing in the park, she wanted to clap her hands but it was too dark.
Daisy called out to the night, "Hey, night! Please come back during the day so I can clap again!"
The night, of course, did not answer. Daisy sighed and said, "That was so stupid!" 
Just then, a voice from behind said, "Whoever said that? It was not very nice!"
Daisy turned around and saw an old man. She said, "I said it! It was stupid of me to think that the night would come back!" 
The old man laughed and said, "It was a little stupid, but it was understandable. Why don't you clap your hands now and enjoy the night? I promise that the night won't run away."
Daisy smiled and started clapping her hands. She looked up at the stars in the sky and said, "Thank you, night, for not running away!"




Once there was a little girl named Suzie who was three years old. Everyone said she was delicate, which was true, because she was always very gentle.
One morning, Suzie was playing in the backyard with a basketball. She loved feeling how the basketball bounced when she tossed it in the air. But then, all of a sudden, a huge screech filled the air. Suzie screamed as she saw a big, black cat sneaking up to her basketball.
"No! Leave my basketball alone!" cried Suzie.
The big, black cat just looked at Suzie with wide eyes and then her long tail twitched before she jumped away. Suzie looked relieved, and she sighed with relief. She picked up her basketball and hugged it tight against her chest.
"That was close," Suzie said with a laugh.
And from then on, Suzie learned to always guard her delicate basketball.




Once upon a time, there was a chubby little fish named Fisky. He lived in the sea with his friends, but Fisky was always very curious about the land above the water. One day, Fisky decided he would find a way to explore the land. 
He asked his best friend, Wavy, for help. Together, they came up with a plan. Wavy said to Fisky, "I can shrink you down so you can go explore the land!" Fisky was so excited and said "Yes, please!" 
So Wavy gave Fisky a magical wave of her tail and Fisky began to shrink down. Soon enough, Fisky was small enough to fit in a bottle. He was amazed and waved good bye to Wavy as he began his adventure. 
Fisky traveled on the wind until eventually he reached the shore. He hopped off the bottle and explored the amazing new world in front of him. 
From that day on, Fisky visited the shore monthly to explore the land above the sea with his best friend Wavy. They were always happy and full of curiosity!




Once upon a time, there were two best friends who loved to play together. One day, they decided to go get a treat. They went to the store and saw a big white treat. They couldn't wait to eat it! 
The friends put the treat in their basket and headed home. They were so excited and couldn't wait to eat it.
When the friends arrived home, they quickly opened the white treat. But when they tried to eat it, it just tasted bad!
The friends looked at each other in confusion. One friend said, "Why does this treat taste so bad?"
Sadly, the friend had forgotten to check the expiration date on the treat. The treat was spoiled and they couldn't eat it.
The friends were sad and went home, not able to enjoy the treat they were so excited about.




Once there were two birds, Peep and Tweet. They were best friends and always liked to have fun. One day they decided to have a race.
Peep said to Tweet, "Let's race around the calendar. I'll go first!"
Tweet said, "Okay, go ahead."
So, Peep started running around the calendar. She flew faster and faster until she was a blur. Tweet tried to keep up, but Peep finished the race first. 
Suddenly, there was a huge rainstorm! Both Peep and Tweet were very wet.
Tweet said, "Let's race around the calendar again! This time I'll go first!"
Peep smiled and said, "Okay, let's race!"
So, they started to race around the calendar again. This time, it was a lot harder since they were both so wet. Even so, Tweet managed to beat Peep and was the winner.
Peep said, "Good job, Tweet! That was a fun race!" 
Tweet smiled and said, "Let's do it again!"



"Mommy, let's go to the river," said the little girl.
"Okay, that sounds like a great idea. We'll take the raft," said mom.
The little girl and her mom loaded up the raft with all their supplies and went to the river. The little girl was so excited that she kept giggling.
When they arrived, the water was so sparkling and clear. The little girl jumped into the raft and looked around.
"It's so amazing!" she shouted.
The sun was shining and the breeze was blowing. They paddled slowly along the river. Suddenly, a little fish jumped up and the little girl screeched with delight. This started a series of little surprises in the river.
Every time the little girl saw something new, she would exclaim in amazement. Butterflies, frogs, sparkly rocks, and more. 
By the end of the day, the little girl had experienced many amazing things and they returned home with a lot of beautiful memories.




Alice and her dad were talking about sending her away to camp. Alice did not want to go because she was ignorant of what was in store for her.
Alice's dad said, "You need to go, Alice. It will be a great experience."
Alice asked, "But what will I do at camp?"
Her dad said, "You will learn lots of new things and make new friends."
Alice protested, "But I don't want to mail myself away! I will miss you too much!"
Alice's dad sighed. He was sad that Alice was feeling so scared. He said, "It won't be too long. You will learn so much and you will have lots of fun. You will never be alone and you can mail me letters every day about camp."
Alice thought for a moment and finally understood. She realized that camp wasn't so bad after all and that the experience would be beneficial. She agreed to go to camp.
Alice and her dad hugged and he told her he would miss her. Then, Alice mailed herself away to camp.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Tim. He was three years old and he had lots of toys. His favourite toy was a big white bear. Every night, Tim and the bear would get ready for bed.
One night, Tim put on his pyjamas and tucked his bear into bed. But as he was about to get cozy and warm, the bear suddenly disappeared!
Tim looked around the room to find his bear, but he was gone! He started to get scared and he shouted out: "Where is my bear?".
Suddenly, he heard a faint noise coming from outside. It sounded like music. Tim crept over to the window and peeped outside. He saw a parade of people dancing to music with exciting jazz!
He got so excited that he forgot all about his missing bear! He ran outside, warmly dressed in his pyjamas, and he joined in the dancing with the others.
Eventually, the parade disappeared away and it was time to go home. It was then that Tim remembered about his bear. He ran back into his bedroom and there he saw his bear, curled up in the bed. He had been there all along!




Gina was getting impatient. She stomped her feet and shouted, "I want a new bug!" She searched everywhere for an insect she hadn't seen before.
That was when she spotted a tall, black beetle. She was excited and she ran over to take a closer look. She asked her mom if she could keep it. Mom nodded and said, "Yes, Gina, you can keep it."
Gina smiled, she was so happy. She picked up her new bug and raced over to her backyard sandbox. She wanted to show it to her best friend, Lily. She was already there, playing in the sand.
Gina held out the beetle and said, "Look at this new bug!" Lily's eyes opened wide and she got up so she could take a closer look. She was so excited she squealed and hopped up and down.
Gina and Lily then spent an hour in the sandbox playing with their new insect friend. They were so excited, they kept taking turns holding it and watching it crawl around the box. They had so much fun they didn't want their playtime to end. 
In the end, Gina waved goodbye to her bug and bid him farewell. She was sad to see it go, but she knew that, one day, she might find another insect to take its place.




Once there was a little boy called Gavin. He was three years old and he loved to march. Everywhere he went he marched with his legs moving up and down, up and down in a very fun way.
One day, Gavin went to visit his friend Susie. He marched all the way until he arrived at her house. When he got there, he knocked on the door and Susie opened it.
"Hi Gavin!" She said. "Come in and see my new fan!"
Gavin stepped inside, and there it was, a long and shiny fan. He was very excited and wanted to try it out.
"Can I march with the fan?" He asked Susie. 
"No, sorry," Susie said. "You can't use the fan, it's too dangerous".
Gavin was disappointed, but he understood why Susie wouldn't let him march with the fan. He had to find another way to march, even if it wasn't as fun as marching with a fan.



Betty was an enthusiastic three year old. She loved to study. Every day, she went to the hall with her parents. Every morning, her parents would leave her with a teacher. She was excited to learn new things.
One day, she noticed something different in the hall. Everyone was crowded around a new student. Betty asked her teacher what was going on. The teacher replied, "Thats Jake. He's a new student. He's very enthusiastic about studying. He's looking forward to learning a lot!"
Betty smiled and said, "I'm excited to get to know him!"
The teacher nodded and said, "So am I. Let's introduce ourselves."
The two children waved at each other and began to study. From that day onward, they were good friends. They had lots of fun learning and exploring the hall together.




Once there was a brave girl called Jessie. Jessie really loved exploring the woods near her house.
One day, Jessie went out in the woods and saw a spark on the ground. She was curious to find out what it was, so she decided to use it.
When she touched the spark, Jessie saw a big, scary monster. The monster said, "I will eat you if you don't give me some candy!" 
Jessie did not have any candy so she tried to run away. But the monster was too fast and caught her. He ate Jessie and the spark was never seen again.




Once upon a time there were two friends who were very tall. One day they wanted to go outside, but it was raining. So they stayed inside but they wanted to go out. Then they saw an exit. It was a doorway that led to the outside. 
The friends were brave and decided to go out in the rain. They opened the exit and stepped out. The rain was really big and it was wet. 
The friends quickly ran around and had so much fun. They splashed and played until they were all wet. They laughed and jumped in the puddles until their clothes were soaked. 
Then the friends got tired and decided to come back inside. As soon as they stepped in the room, the rain stopped. They said goodbye to the rain and thanked it for a fun time.




Lily was 3 years old and loved spending time in the classroom. She liked to investigate the shelves and explore the toys that were neatly lined up. Every day, Lily and her friends would go to the classroom and spend time playing together.
The classroom was very clear and everything was put in its place. Lily always made sure to put all of her toys back before she left. She was so proud of always cleaning up!
One day while they were in the classroom, they decided to make a surprise for their teacher. Everyone worked hard to make the room look extra special. They moved around the furniture and decorated the walls with colourful drawings.
When the teacher arrived she was so happy to see all of their hard work. She thanked them for making the classroom look so clear and happy. Lily and her friends were happy to spend the day in the classroom.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Mike. Mike liked to go outside and play in the light of the sun.
One day, Mike was running and he slipped. He banged his head and he fell down to the ground. He was upset and scared and he started to cry. 
His mother came over to him and she said, "Mike, what happened?" 
Mike said, "I slipped. I hit my head and it hurt."
His mother said, "It's ok, Mike. You just bumped your brain. Do you want a hug?" 
Mike nodded and he felt a bit better. His mother held him close and told him that his brain was very important. "Your brain is like a light, Mike. It helps you think and remember things. It's very special." 
Mike nodded and he felt better after hearing his mother's words. From that day on, he remembered that his brain was like a light.



Once upon a time there was a baby who was very impressive. She loved to take naps in the sun and rest. One day, the baby was sleeping in her favorite spot and she heard a voice from above.
"Hey baby! You are so impressive!" the voice said.
The baby was startled and jumped up. She looked around and saw a big, white bird perched on a branch in a nearby tree.
"What did you say?" the baby asked.
The bird smiled and said, "I said you're impressive. I've never seen a baby rest as peacefully as you."
The baby smiled and thanked the bird. From that day forward, the baby knew that resting was one of the most impressive things she could do.




Paul looked up in the sky and wondered. He saw a big, white owl flying hello. The owl swooped and soared through the air like it was fit for the sky. 
Paul was so amazed that he said outloud, Hey Mr. Owl, do you want to be friends? The owl hooted in response. Then Paul asked, Do you want to play with me?
The owl hooted again. Paul began to run and laugh in delight. He and the owl flew in circles around the tree. As the sun began to set, Paul said goodbye to his new friend with one last hoot.
The owl looked down at Paul and flew away with a fit of wings. Paul waved goodbye as the owl flew away.He began to walk home and wondered if the owl would ever come back.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl named Elsie. She loved to run around in the big grassy fields and feel the sun on her face. One day, Elsies mom told her to take a deep breath and be still and quiet. Elsie tried, but it was hard to stay still and quiet in the fields. 
Eventually Elsie did find a moment of peace. Everything around her felt so tight and calm. She felt like she could heal and find strength in that peace. 
As Elsie started to relax, a big loud noise came out of nowhere. It was a monster! The monster shouted at Elsie and told her that the peace in the fields was his and he didnt want her there. Elsie was so scared she ran away and never returned to the fields again.
The monster stayed in the fields and never let anyone enjoy the quiet peace any longer.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Anna. She was playing in the garden when she decided to pull at a big, tough tree. She grabbed onto one of the branches and yanked as hard as she could, but the branch didn't move. Anna was very curious, so she put her hands on the bark to feel its texture. To her surprise, it felt very tough.
"I can't move it no matter how hard I try," Anna said to the tree. 
The tree replied in a deep, rustling voice, "I'm very tough, little girl. You won't be able to pull me down."
Anna was astonished! She ran to her mom and told her what had happened. Her mom smiled at her sweetly and said, "Yes, trees are very tough. That's why it feels so solid to touch. But don't worry, you can still climb the branches and explore its texture!"
Anna was so happy that she had found out how tough the tree was. She hugged it tightly and vowed to never try to pull it down again!



Once upon a time, there was a brave little frog. His name was Floppy. One day he noticed a stream running through his pond. He was very curious and decided to investigate.
He hopped to the edge and peered in.
It looks so sparkly and harmless, he said.
He was about to jump in, when his mother hopped up beside him.
Floppy, she said. Be careful and always listen to your heart.
Floppy and his mother continued to stare into the stream together. After a while, he received a gentle whisper from within.
Jump in and join the fun! it said.
Floppy listened to his heart and decided not to jump. He knew the stream looked harmless, but his instincts said it could still be dangerous.
So, he and his mother hopped away, frog smiling to himself as he realized that sometimes, it pays to be brave and listen to your heart.



Once upon a time there was a lively spider. He lived in a meadow full of flowers and butterflies.
One day, he decided to start an adventure. He scampered across the grass and hopped over logs. Later he found a big pond, and he could see lots of fish swimming beneath the water.
But the water was too deep for the spider, so he started climbing a nearby tree instead. He climbed and climbed, higher and higher until he could see the whole meadow. He felt so excited.
Suddenly the spider noticed something colorful at the top of the tree. It was a bird with bright yellow feathers! The bird said hello and soon became friends with the spider.
The lively spider and the bird played all day long. They sang songs, played tag and flew around together.
The spider was never so happy as when he was on his adventure with the bird.




Once upon a time, there lived two best friends: Sarah and Josh.
Every day they went to the beach and played together. As they ran and laughed, they stumbled upon a small tank full of yummy treats.
Josh said,"Let's shut the tank and save the treats for later!" 
Sarah smiled and nodded. Quickly, they shut the tank tightly. 
The day went quickly, and the sun began to set. As Sarah and Josh packed up to go home, Sarah said "What about the tank?"
Josh smiled, "Let's hurry back soon and open it up for a yummy treat."
The two friends ran home. When they returned the next day, they opened the tank and shared the yummy treats as they laughed and played in the sun.




Mommy, why do we have to close our eyes? Jane asked her mommy as they lit the candle.
Well, Jane, mommy said. When the candle is lit, we like to take few minutes to be quiet, and to think about what is most important to us.
Jane closed her eyes, and then slowly opened one eye to peek at the candle, which was now lit up brightly. It was a special candle that had been given to them by a friend and it smelled really good.
Suddenly, Jane's brother came running into the room. He was so spoiled and had never been taught how to be quiet. He started running around and laughing. Jane's mommy quickly got out of her chair and said, "No, Jimmy! Candles can be dangerous, now shhh! Please be quiet."
Jimmy stopped and looked at the candle's soft yellow light, and he quietly said, "I'm sorry."
Jane smiled, and they all sat down together to enjoy the quiet moment that the candle created.




Once upon a time, there were two friends named Bob and Sam. They liked to play together, but today Bob was very angry. He was mad because Sam had spilled paint on his favorite t-shirt. But Bob had an idea.
He said to Sam, "Don't worry about it. Let's go to the cabinet and I'll show you something fun."
Sam followed his friend to the cabinet. He wondered what was inside. Bob opened the door and inside was an old printer.
Bob said, "This is an old printer. It prints pictures if you press the buttons. Let's try it."
So, Bob and Sam pushed the buttons, and a picture started printing out. Bob and Sam were so excited!
The picture was of Bob's t-shirt. When they saw it, they knew Bob was going to be happy again. Bob said, "Oh, wow! I can wear my t-shirt again!"
Bob was so happy and Sam was glad his friend was no longer angry. They had used the printer to make Bob's t-shirt new again. And they lived happily ever after.



Bob and Tim were playing together in the park on Tuesday. Tim played with a stick but Bob didn't like it. Bob said to Tim, "Let's make a joke!" Tim smiled and said, "Ok!" But when Tim made the joke, Bob didn't find it funny and he became embarrassed. Bob turned away from Tim and said, "I don't want to be your friend any more." Tim was sad and he started to cry. Bob left the park and Tim was still there, all alone. 
It was a sad day for Tim as he didn't understand why his friend was embarrassed.




Once upon a time there was a clumsy cat. It wanted to find a candle to make the night glow. It looked around and saw an old candle in an old room. The cat was excited and wanted to light the candle.
The cat got near the candle and tried to strike a match to light the candle. But it was so clumsy that it kept dropping the match.
A mouse watched from the corner and said, "Why dont you strike the candle? Thats faster." The cat smiled and went to strike the candle.
But as soon as it touched the candle, the room filled with smoke. The cat had made it too hot and the candle had exploded. The cat was sad. The mouse shook its head and ran away.
The end.




Once upon a time there was a postman called Joe. Joe loved his job. Every day, he got up early and delivered letters and parcels to everyone in the village. Joe was always happy because he was successful at delivering the post.
One day Joe had a bad feeling. It was a feeling of regret. Instead of taking the long way to the village, he decided to take a shortcut through the woods. Joe had never gone through the woods before. 
When Joe reached the middle of the woods, he realised his mistake. He was lost! Joe was scared and started to cry.
He called out as loud as he could and soon enough a kind old man heard Joe's cries. The man was very helpful and helped Joe out of the woods and back home again. Joe hugged the old man and thanked him for finding him.
It was a lesson for Joe and he promised himself that he would never regret taking a shortcut through the woods again. From that day onward, Joe was always successful at delivering the post.




Once upon a time, there lived a mighty bear. He lived in a faraway cave and he hardly ever had visitors. One day, he was woken up by an alarm. It was so loud that the mighty bear was startled! He wondered who was trying to get his attention. 
He got out of bed and slowly walked towards the entrance of his cave. A little mouse was standing there, looking scared. 
The bear asked the mouse, "Why is the alarm so loud? Do you need help?"
The mouse replied, "My family is in trouble! We need your help!"
The mighty bear was filled with care for the little mouse. He followed him to his family's home in the woods. When they arrived, the mouse's family was surrounded by a group of fierce wolves!
The bear used his mighty strength and courage to scare away the wolves. The mouse's family was safe!
The mouse thanked him and ran home with his family. From that day onward, the mighty bear had new friends.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Sally. Sally was very silly and liked to play games. One day, her mother told her it was time to go to bed. But Sally was too busy playing and did not want to go. 
Her mother warned her not to stay up too late. Sally kept ignoring her. Finally, her mother said, "If you don't go to bed now, I will have to punish you!"
Sally thought about it for a moment and said, "But I want a strawberry!"
Her mother replied, "No, no strawberries now! Go to bed or you will have to be punished!"
Sally knew her mother meant it. She got up and said, "OK, I'm going to bed."
And that's the end of the story! Sometimes, it's important to listen to our parents, even if it seems silly.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Kelly. She was a very curious three year old. One day she decided she wanted to go exploring. She crawled through the forest until she arrived at a big, ancient market. 
As she crept around the market she saw many different things, some shiny, some old and some very strange. Then, she spotted an old man who was busy talking to some other people.
Kelly went up to the man and asked him "What's this place?". The old man smiled and said "This is a very ancient market, full of exciting things to see and do".
Kelly thanked the old man and continued to explore the market. She saw so many exciting things and couldn't wait to go back and tell her family. 
The end.




Once there was a man who was very tired. His name was Tim. He had been running around all day long. Now he was at home and he sat down in his chair.
Tim was very frustrated. He wanted to take a nap. But his tire was flat. He looked at it, and it was all squished in. He couldn't figure out what to do.
Suddenly, he had a great idea! Tim went to his friend Sally's house. She had a tire pump. He asked if he could borrow it. She said, "Yes, of course!"
Tim took the tire pump to his tire and he pumped it up. It was so nice to have the tire all fixed. Now he could take a nap and rest.
He was so happy that he had found a way to fix his tire. He thanked Sally and was grateful for her help. Tim was no longer tired and frustrated. He was happy and content.



Once upon a time, there were two friends who loved to play football. They were playing in a big field filled with tall green grass. One afternoon, they spotted an ancient fountain in the middle of the field. The friends wanted to cool off so they decided to splash in the fountain. 
They had so much fun, they splashed and splashed until they could not splash anymore. Then, suddenly, a big thunderstorm appeared in the sky. The friends ran to get their football, but it was too late - their football had already been soaked by the water from the fountain. 
The storm made the ancient fountain bigger and bigger. The friends tried to stop the water from flooding the entire field, but their tiny hands could not do much against the powerful water. The storm kept growing stronger and stronger until the water completely destroyed the field and the ancient fountain. 
The friends sadly said goodbye and went home. They wanted to play together again but they forgot their beloved football, which was now gone forever.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lucy. She was very intelligent and she liked to play in the rain. But one day when it was raining, Lucy had nothing to keep her dry.
So the girl asked her mom, "Mom, what can I do? I want to go play in the rain!"
"I know," said Mom. "You can take my umbrella and store it in the garage next to the door. That will keep you dry!"
So Lucy did as her mom said and she went outside with her moms big umbrella. She played in the rain and had lots of fun. She stayed as dry as she could and came back home with a smile on her face.
But when she got home, she realized that she had forgotten to store the umbrella in the garage like her mom asked her to.
Mom said, Lucy, when I gave you the umbrella, I told you to store it in the garage. If you had done that, our umbrella would have been safe from the rain.
Im sorry, Mom. I wont forget next time, said Lucy as she realized her mistake.
This story teaches us that being intelligent is important so you can remember to do all the important things. Lucy was happy that she remembered what mom had asked her to do - and happy that she was covered when it




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. He was just 3 years old, and one day he noticed that some of the clouds in the sky were doing something strange. They were shooting all sorts of different colours of water into the air!
Jack was very curious, so he asked his mom what was happening. His mom smiled and said: "Those are called rainbows! It's when the sun shines on the water droplets in the sky and they spray into colours. It's like a paintbrush!
Jack was so excited. He loved rainbows! That day it was raining, and he kept looking up, hoping to see another one. But then he noticed something else.
The rain was dripping down to the earth and making little puddles, but then he saw something completely different. Some of the puddles were spraying up into the air! They were spraying in different directions like little fountains! Jack was amazed.
He asked his mom what had happened, and she laughed and said "That's called evaporation! The water heats up and turns into a gas, and when that happens, it sprays up into the air!"
Jack couldn't believe it. He'd learned something new about the earth, and he loved it!




Once upon a time, there lived a mighty folder that could reverse time. One day, a 3-year-old named Jax was playing in the garden when he noticed something strange. He saw the mighty folder lying in the grass, shining in the sun. Jax was curious, so he picked it up and held it in his hands. 
"Wow!" he said, examining its shimmering surface. Suddenly, he heard a voice in his head. 
"This folder can reverse time," the voice said. "But be careful; reversing time can be dangerous." Jax was confused but he put the folder away in his pocket and finished playing. 
The next day, Jax forgot all about the folder until he heard news that his best friend was sick. Jax felt sad and wished he could do something to help his friend. So he took the folder out of his pocket and opened it. To his surprise, time began to move backward and his friend was cured! 
Jax had used the folder's mighty power to reverse time and save his friend. From then on, he vowed to never use the power of the folder carelessly.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to polish things. One day, Lucy was polishing a piece of paper. She was polishing it so loudly that her mom came into the room. 
"What are you doing?" Mom asked.
Lucy answered, "I'm polishing the paper mommy. It looks so shiny!"
Mom smiled at Lucy and said, "That's great! But make sure you don't make too much noise. You don't want to be too loud."
Lucy said, "Okay Mommy! I will be extra careful."
So Lucy began polishing the paper with a gentle hand. The paper got shiner and shiner and when she was finished, it looked like a beautiful diamond. It was so sparkly! 
Lucy was so proud of her work. She proudly showed it to her mom, and her mom said, "Wow! That's so pretty! You did a great job polishing that paper." 
And that is the story of how Lucy polished the paper very neatly, and quietly.




Once upon a time, there was a wise old fox who lived in a big forest. Every day, the fox liked to sit in a clearing and think about life. One day, a little bunny hopped over and saw the fox. The bunny asked, "What are you thinking about, fox?" 
The fox said, "I'm thinking about understanding." 
The bunny asked, "What does that mean?" 
The fox replied, "It means to use your head. You understand things when you use your head to think about them." 
The bunny thought for a moment and then asked, "Can I use my head to understand the color of my hair?" 
The fox smiled and said, "Yes, you can." The fox explained if the bunny looked at his hair and thought about it, he could understand why it was the color it was. 
The bunny thanked the fox and hopped away. The fox smiled and knew that the bunny now understood that using your head to think and understand was a very wise thing to do. 
The moral of the story is this: understanding things is important, and it comes from thinking, not from just knowing facts. That's why it's important to be wise and think before you act.



 Once upon a time there was a very hungry girl called Emily. She was walking in the park when she saw a tree with a very tasty mineral sitting on the top of it. She wanted to get the mineral so she could eat it for dinner.
Emily spotted a bow tucked behind a bush. She picked it up and worked out how to use it. She notched an arrow into the bow and took aim at the tree. She pulled back the bowstring until it was tight, and then let go! The arrow flew straight and true, hitting the tree and knocking down the tasty mineral. Emily smiled. She had scored a hit!
Emily clambered up the tree trunk and reached for the mineral. She took a bite, and it was the most delicious mineral she had ever tasted. It was so tasty that she did not want to stop eating it. She ate the whole mineral and belched with satisfaction!




One day, a little boy was walking near his house when he noticed a strange hut on the side of the road. He thought it was funny so he decided to go over and take a look.
When he got to the hut, he heard a voice from inside say, "Please come in little boy, I need you to deliver something for me."
So the boy went inside. There, he saw an old man with a package in his hands.
The man told him, "Can you take this package to the next village for me? It's very important."
The little boy was scared but he agreed to do it. He set off on his journey, feeling scared but determined.
Unfortunately, when the little boy got to the village, he was attacked by some bandits! They ran away with his package and the little boy was left alone.
The little boy was so sad. He regretted listening to the old man in the hut and wished he had never gone. He never returned to the hut again.



Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Bill. He was a very bouncy bunny, always hopping around the garden. One day, Bill was feeling a bit grumpy. He wanted to do something exciting, something new!
He decided it was time to do an adventure. He followed his nose along a path, deep into the forest. It soon became very dark, so he hopped faster and faster. Suddenly, he stumbled over a big muscle!
He was a little scared at first, but then he noticed the muscle was smiling. He asked the muscle what he was doing there. The muscle said he was looking for an adventure too! Bill was so excited and asked the muscle if he wanted to come with him.
The muscle happily followed Bill along the path. Everywhere they went, they had an incredible adventure. Bill's grumpy mood soon vanished and they both had the best time ever!




Once upon a time there was a family of three. A mother, a father, and their son, Bob. Bob was 3 years old and loved to act.
One day, Bob was standing next to the living room wall and acting. He was pretending he was a brave knight fighting a dragon! His mother watched with a smile but his father looked jealous. He wanted to join in the fun.
Suddenly, Bob's mother spoke to his father.
"Why don't you join in, too?" she said.
"I am too old," answered his father.
"Nonsense!" said Bob's mother. "You don't have to act any differently then Bob!"
So, Bob's father joined him and the two of them began to act together. Bob was so happy to have his father join him.
Bob and his father continued to act together until bedtime. Both of them had so much fun being brave knights together!




Once there was a girl called Amy. She was three years old and she had a perfect phone which made her very happy.
One night, Amy had to go to bed. But she didn't want to, she wanted to play with her phone! She begged, "Please Mum, can I stay up for just a few more minutes?"
But her mum said no. "Amy, No! You must sleep now."
Amy cried and begged again, but her mum was firm. She put the phone away and tucked Amy in.
Suddenly, there came a bright light from Amy's room! It was coming from her phone! She quickly grabbed it and looked in wonder. On the phone was a beautiful game, perfect and exciting.
Amy wanted to play. She tried to get up, but her Mum said,"No!" She stayed in bed and the bright phone light faded away.
Amy was disappointed, but she knew it was the right thing to do. She closed her eyes and went to sleep.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna who wanted to go out and explore the world. She admired the trees, the birds and the flowers. She especially loved the big brown butterflies that flew around her.
One day, as Anna was exploring, she saw a tall building with big brown gates. She asked her mother what it was, and her mother replied, "That is jail my dear. Jail is where people are sent when they do something wrong."
Anna felt sad for the people who were stuck behind the big jail gates. She felt like she should be helping them in some way, so she decided to be kind and generous to everyone she met.
She started to give away her toys whenever a friend needed them and shared her lunch with strangers who looked hungry. Soon, Anna's kindness spread and many people started to admire her.
The moral of the story is that being kind and generous can bring admiration and happiness. Anna teaches us to always stay generous and be kind to everyone, no matter where they come from.




One day, a little boy was walking through the woods. It was a gloomy day, and the trees had no leaves. He walked for a while until he saw a chest in front of him. He was curious, so he started to pull on the latch. It opened, and inside the chest he found a bottle of lotion. He had never seen anything like it and he smiled.
The little boy couldn't wait to use the lotion, so he opened the bottle. Suddenly, he heard a voice from behind him. "What do you think you're doing? That's my lotion!"
The little boy turned around to see a mean-looking old man. He was tall and scowling. The little boy was scared and he quickly put the lotion back in the chest. He apologised and ran off as fast as he could. 
The little boy was relieved to get away safely. But he was still sad that he had to leave the lotion behind. He didn't understand why the old man had to be so mean. He knew he would never forget that gloomy day.




One day, Sammy and his family went to the park. Sammy had a red tray and he was very excited. He could not wait to go to the park. 
At the park, Sammy kept blinking because he saw something amazing. There were so many colorful birds around him. His parents were very helpful and they helped him put his red tray down. 
Suddenly, one of the birds landed on Sammy's tray. Sammy was amazed and he kept blinking. He could not believe that the bird was in his tray. 
The bird said, "Hi Sammy. I am so glad to meet you. Would you like to become my friend?" 
Sammy was so happy and he smiled. He looked up to his parents and they nodded. Sammy nodded in excitement and said, "Yes. I would love to be friends!"




Maggie was a little girl who loved to play outside. Today, she was trying to climb up a hill. With each step, she struggled, but she kept going. At the top of the hill was an enormous cone. Maggie felt a little nervous, but she took a deep breath and started climbing up the cone. 
Maggie was exhausted. Halfway up the cone she stopped to catch her breath. Suddenly she heard a voice calling her name. It was her mom. "Maggie! Come down from there! That cone is too high! You don't need to struggle so much!"
Maggie was relieved. She carefully scrambled down the cone and scrambled back down the hill. Her mom hugged her and said, "Let's go home and have an ice cream cone as a treat!"
Maggie smiled and nodded excitedly. After all her struggling, she was happy to do something easier.




Timmy was walking in the stadium. He was very excited because it was his first time visiting such a big place. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise coming from a distance. Timmy was confused and he stopped in his tracks. 
A big figure appeared in front of him. "I'm the Stadium Guard," he said in a serious voice. "You need to stay safe. So I will warn you - don't wander off!" 
Timmy was scared and confused. He didn't understand what the guard was saying. The guard tried to explain one more time, but Timmy still didn't understand. 
The Guard was getting impatient. So he pointed towards a group of children in the distance, to show Timmy it was safe to explore. He said, "Those children are having lots of fun - see?"
Timmy smiled and thanked the guard. He was glad he was warned and that he could join the other children. He walked away knowing he was safe.




Mum and Jane went for a visit. Jane was a bit scared of going too far away but Mum was with her, so it was ok. 
Mum said to Jane, "Let's go for a walk in the garden." Jane was very excited. 
The garden was so busy with animals. They saw ducks, rabbits and even some frogs. Jane wanted to see a frog in the pond but Mum said, "Maybe later. Let's go and visit the horses now." 
The horses were huge and Jane was a bit scared, until Mum showed her that they were very friendly. Mum gave Jane a whip so that she could give the horses a stroke.
