Jane was so happy to visit the horses and when it was time to go home, she said to Mum, "Next time we visit, can we bring some carrots for the horses?" 
Mum smiled and said, "Of course! Let's go home now." 
They held hands and skipped all the way back home.




The pupil was sad. She was feeling bad and teary. Her teacher noticed and asked the pupil what was wrong.
"I just feel so lonely", the little girl answered.
The teacher touched her on the shoulder and said, "I understand how you feel. Go ahead and take a break, I will join you soon".
The pupil went outside to the playground. There were no other children there but she saw a friendly puppy. She touched the puppy and it made her feel a little better.
The teacher came outside and smiled. "You have a friend now," she said. "He's here to help you feel better when you're feeling bad". 
The pupil thanked her and befriended the puppy. From that day on, she was never lonely again. The puppy was always there to touch and to comfort her.




Once upon a time, there was a naughty little boy called Bert. He was always up to no good, no matter how much his mom tried to tell him to be a good boy.
One day, Bert was feeling particularly naughty and decided to steal his neighbour's hat. He snuck over to their house, quietly took the hat and ran away with it.
When he got back home, he was so proud that his mom asked him "What did you get, Bert?" He proudly showed her the hat and said "Mom, look what I brought!"
His mom was very angry and said "Bert! That was not nice! You must take that hat back to where it belongs!"
So Bert sadly went back to the neighbour's house to give the hat back. When he handed it over he said: "I'm sorry I took your hat, I will not do it again!"
The neighbour laughed and said: "You must have been feeling very naughty, that's why you took the hat!"
But Bert knew he had done something wrong, and that naughtiness is never a good thing. Because of this, he never went near the neighbour's hat again!



"Come on lily!" said Dad, as he strode down the street.
He was very eager to get to the park, as this was something Dad and lily did every day. 
Lily skipped along, happily matching Dad's pace.
When they arrived at the park, Dad helped lily find a good spot to play.
He gave her a toy to play with, and then he lay down on the grass to support her.
Suddenly, lily started digging in the dirt and laughing.
"What are you doing?" Dad asked, with a huge smile.
"I'm building a sandcastle," lily replied, still smiling.
Dad was so proud of her for being so eager about trying something new. 
He stayed close by and supported her as she made her sandcastle. 
When lily was done, she couldn't contain her excitement.
"I did it, Daddy!" she said, jumping up and down.
"Yes, you did, Lily. I'm very proud of you," Dad said with a warm smile.
Lily was glad that Dad was there to support her. 
She hugged him and thanked him for helping her make her sandcastle. 
Together, they watched the sun set, and then they walked home, both of them content and happy.



 One day, Max was walking around the park. He was looking at the trees and the flowers. Suddenly he saw a picture on a bench. Max went to the bench and looked at the picture. He was very curious. He asked, "What is this picture?"
A busy bee flew by and answered, "It's a beautiful flower." Max smiled. He thanked the bee and continued walking.
Max loved looking at the pictures in the park. He answered that the purple flower was his favorite. Then he said goodbye to the bee and ran off.
Max spent the rest of the afternoon busy looking at different pictures in the park. By the time he was ready to go home, Max had seen many beautiful pictures. He was happy and content.




Once there was a shy little girl. She was scared of the dark. She was alone in the park.
Suddenly, a cat appeared from the shadows. It meowed loudly. 
"Who are you?" asked the little girl with a quiver in her voice.
The cat meowed again. The little girl was not sure what to do.
All of a sudden, a big dog came out of nowhere. It growled at the cat, and they started to fight. The little girl was so scared.
The little girl started to weep and call for help. Soon, an old man appeared. He grabbed the dog and took it away.
The little girl was so relieved. She thanked the old man. He smiled kindly and told her to stay safe, before leaving.
The cat and the little girl stayed together in the dark park. The girl realized that sometimes, even the shyest people can find comfort in a special friend.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mia. She was three years old and very curious. One day Mia decided to go on an adventure into the forest.
As she explored, she came across a wise old turtle. Mia was surprised because the turtle seemed to be able to talk. 
"Hello Mia", said the turtle. "Welcome to the forest. I have been waiting for you to come here. I have powerful wisdom to share with you. 
Mia looked around curiously. "What kind of wisdom? What is it?" she asked.
"Ah", said the turtle. "To find the answer, you must first solve a difficult challenge."
Mia was excited. She wanted to find the wisdom, and she was ready to take on the challenge. She said, "Let's do it!"
The turtle smiled. Together they set out to find the powerful wisdom. Mia thought hard, and eventually she found the answer.
She had found the powerful wisdom that the turtle was talking about. With this knowledge, Mia was able to make good choices and be successful. She thanked the turtle and went on her way, happy and wiser than before.




Once upon a time there lived a little girl named Jane. She was always full of joy and could never sit still. She was always singing and dancing, no matter what.
One day, Jane's mum gave her a special gift. It was a tiny magnet that glittered when the sun shone on it. Jane was so happy with her present and thanked her mum for it.
The next day, Jane took her magnet out to the garden, singing and dancing as she went. But when she got there, she noticed that the ground was really dirty. She was about to try and clean up the mess, when her mum stopped her. She said, "Jane, I know you want to help, but sometimes it is better to leave thing as they are. It's ok to just go outside and enjoy the sunshine."
Jane listened to her mum and said, "Ok, I will". And so she just sang and danced, with her little magnet glittering in the sunshine. She was filled with such joy and happiness, and she knew deep in her heart that what her mother said was right.
The moral of this story is that helping is important, but sometimes it is better to just enjoy life, no matter what. We must take time to appreciate the beauty around us and be thankful for it.




Once there was a boy who was very jealous of his friends. He had seen them in a big raft out on the lake. He wanted to go in the raft with them but they wouldn't let him. He was feeling really bad and sad.
One day the boy found his own raft and decided he would take it out on the lake himself. He wished he could take it out with his friends, but he was sure they wouldn't let him. So he grabbed the raft and ran down to the docks.
When he got there, his friends were already there on their raft. He started to paddle out to them, when suddenly his paddle broke! The boy was so scared, he tried to get back to shore, but the wind was too strong. 
He was stuck in the middle of the lake and started to cry. His friends had seen him and paddled closer to help him, but when he tried to make it to them, the wind would push him back.
Finally, his friends had to shut off their raft and turn back to get help. Unfortunately, by the time they got there the boy had been swept out to sea.
The moral of the story is that jealousy will lead you nowhere. The boy wanted to join his friends, but his own jealousy and pride drove him to take risks that could have been avoided. He should have been happy with what he had and not been jealous of his friends.




Molly was so excited! Her mum had just told her that she was getting a box of toys today. She jumped up and down, clapping her hands and shouting "Yay!"
When the box arrived, Molly's dad helped her to unpack it. Inside, there were all kinds of amazing toys. There was a hopscotch set, a big top hat and a crazy spinning top.
Molly loved them all, and she couldn't decide which one to play with first. Then a voice said "I think you should play with this one". Molly looked around, but no one else was in the room. She slowly turned her gaze to the box, and saw the little blue spinning top smiling at her.
Molly gasped and said "Oh, hello! Are you a talking toy?". The spinning top nodded and said "Yes, of course I am! Why don't you play with me first?".
Molly was so excited to be playing with a talking toy that she couldn't wait to start. She grabbed the spinning top, and the two of them had a crazy, fun-filled day, full of spinning, laughing and playing.




Once there was a child who wanted to meet someone special. One day, she went to a special place where she could get a massage. It was a magical place, and she was very excited.
The child was greeted by a friendly lady who was going to give her the massage. She was careful and gentle with the child, and asked her to relax. The lady carefully moved her hands along the child's back until the massage was finished. The child felt very happy and calm when it was done.
The child asked the lady if she could come back sometime. The lady said that she would be available any time the child wanted to come. The child was very happy and thanked the lady for the massage. They said goodbye and the child went away, knowing that she would meet the friendly lady again soon.




Once upon a time, there was a baby girl called Ruby. She was very tiny and only 3 years old. One day, Ruby was playing in the garden with her toy rock. She loved to pick it up, throw it and watch it bounce.
Suddenly, Ruby felt a sharp pain in her stomach. She started to cry and screamed, "Mummy, my stomach hurts". Her mother quickly ran over and hugged her. She asked, "Did you eat something that hurts?" 
Ruby shook her head and said, "No, I was just playing with my rock". Her mother looked up and noticed the toy rock lying in the grass. She said, "Oh sweetheart, maybe that's why your stomach hurts". 
Ruby's mother picked up the rock and put it away safely. She told her daughter, "Playing with rocks can sometimes hurt people, so it's best to be careful". Ruby nodded and hugged her mummy. From that day on, Ruby was extra careful when playing with rocks.



 
Once upon a time there was a little boy named Jack. He was only three years old, but he was very smart. One day, Jack decided to borrow his mom's faucet. He wanted to use it to make a big splash. 
So, Jack dragged the faucet to the bathtub and plugged it in. But when he turned it on, nothing happened. It just made a weird sound. Jack wanted to make a big splash, so he tried harder. He pushed the handle down with all of his might. Suddenly, the faucet started dripping very bad water. 
Jack was terrified! He quickly ran to get his mom. "Mom, what's wrong with the faucet?" he asked. 
Mom smiled and said, "It's ok, Jack. You don't need to borrow my faucet to make a big splash. You can just use water from the bathtub like normal." 
Jack felt relieved. He thanked his mom for helping him and returned the faucet back to its usual spot.




Jack and Sally were sitting on the grass watching a film. Jack saw that his friend was looking embarrassed.
"What's wrong Sally?" he asked her.
"I made a rough mistake when I was playing with the film," she said sadly.
"That's ok Sally," said Jack. "Everyone makes mistakes. I can help you to fix it."
He looked at the film and was able to mend it. Then they both found the film funny and laughed together.
Sally was no longer embarrassed, and she was so happy that she gave Jack a big hug.
"Thank you for helping me," she said.
"That's alright," said Jack with a smile. "Friends help each other."




Once upon a time there was a bird. The bird wanted to fly high and explore the world. Every day it flew up in the sky. It loved to fly!
One day the bird got married! It was a very humble ceremony. Other birds came to celebrate. Everyone was happy.
Eventually the bird said to its partner "Let's fly together". The partner agreed and together they flew high in the sky. They had so much fun.
The bird said "This is why I wanted to marry you, so I can fly with you forever!". The partner smiled and said "Me too". And so they flew and flew, together!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Rae. She was only 3 years old. Rae wanted to get a new toy, and so her mother took her to the toy store. 
Inside, Rae saw something she wanted. It was a beautiful toy with a glowing bulb and a metal lock. Rae's eyes glowed with joy, but her mother said it was too expensive and she couldn't buy it for her.
Rae was disappointed, but she asked if she could just have the bulb and the lock. Her mother agreed and they brought it home.
When they got home, Rae put the bulb and the lock in her room. She quickly ran out to find something to connect the two and eventually found a really long piece of string. She put the string through the lock and the bulb and connected them.
Rae was so excited to finish her project, and when she pulled on the string the toy lit up. Her mother was so amazed that she said she'd get her the most expensive toy in the shop the next day. 
The End.



Davey was a curious little boy. He always wanted to explore and learn new things. One day, Davey was in his bedroom when he decided to open a box that he had never seen before. Inside, he found some tape that was all twisted up. He was excited because he had never seen any tape before and wanted to know what it was for. He asked his mom and she told him it was for wrapping presents. Davey was so excited. He asked if he could have some, and his mom said yes. 
Davey went to the kitchen and opened a drawer to look for the tape. He found it and wrapped his favorite toy with it. He was so proud of himself. He showed his mom and she was so happy. Then, Davey wanted to open the present but his mom said to wait because it was spoiled. She told him it was a secret she wanted him to keep until his birthday. Davey was disappointed because he wanted to open the present now, but he listened to his mom and waited. 
Finally, Davey's birthday came and he was so excited. He opened the special present and was so surprised to see a brand new bike. He was so proud of himself for being so patient and waiting.




Once upon a time there lived a sweet little caterpillar called Fluffy. Fluffy loved to explore the world and was always on the lookout for something new.
One day, Fluffy scrambled off down the path. Soon, Fluffy noticed a big, bright butterfly in the sky. The butterfly waved at Fluffy and said "welcome, my little friend".
Fluffy was incredibly excited. He happily waved back and said "hello!". The butterfly smiled, and invited Fluffy on a wonderful journey.
Off they flew together through the sky. As they flew, the butterfly showed Fluffy all the wonderful things the world had to offer. After what seemed like an eternity, they eventually came back down to the path where they had first met.
The butterfly said "Thank you for joining me on this adventure. I have one more thing for you to take home - a sweet, sweet treat".
Fluffy was delighted. He thanked the butterfly for such an amazing experience. He then ran home with the treat in hand, ready to show his family what a wonderful day he'd had.



 
Max and his mom were outside in their yard. The sun was shining and the birds were chirping. Max looked around and saw animals running around. He wanted to play with them.
Max said to his mom, "Can I mark in the yard, please?" 
His mom smiled and said, "Ok, but only if you stay close." 
So Max started to mark in the yard. He would make lines in the grass and big circles with his finger. He liked how the patterns looked in the grass. 
Soon, some nosy animals were coming close to see what Max was doing. He saw a bunny, a squirrel, and a raccoon. Max laughed and said, "Hi animals!"
The animals were curious and wanted to play. So Max and the animals started running around and having a good time. Max and his mom stayed in their yard until the sun went down, marking and playing together.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Sarah. She loved to write stories and when she grew up, she wanted to be a writer. One day, she heard a big boom. The boom was so loud that it shook the house. Sarah asked her mom, "What was that noise?" Her mom replied, "That was an earthquake. They are very special and amazing! 
Sarah was excited! She wanted to write about the earthquake so she asked her mom for a pen and paper. Her mom gave her a pen and Sarah quickly wrote her first story about the amazing earthquake. She was so proud of her writing that she quickly ran to show it to her mom. Her mom was so impressed with the story that she hugged Sarah and said, "You are a wonderful writer!"




Mama asked her son to go to the store to buy some new swimming trunks. As he was walking through the store, he saw a pair of trunks with a picture of a fish on them. He wanted those ones!
Mama said, No, those look too hard to go swimming in. Lets get the ones with the different pattern.
But the boy wanted the fish ones, so he kept asking and begging until Mama said yes.
He was so happy and excited after buying the trunks. He tried them on as soon as he got home, ready to jump in the water.
But when he arrived at the pool, he realized the fish trunks were too hard. The material was so thick that he couldnt move his legs around the way he needed to.
He tried his best but soon he was too tired and had to get out. Mama had to buy another pair of trunks, this time with a different pattern.
Moral of the story: Sometimes it is better to listen to our parents.




Once upon a time, there was a chubby little boy. His name was Jack, and he loved to play. Jack especially loved to soar in the sky.
One day, Jack decided he wanted to stand on top of a hill and imagine himself soaring higher than ever before. He climbed the hill and used his imagination. He imagined he was wearing a red cape and would fly like a bird.
Suddenly, Jack heard a noise. It was a clown down at the bottom of the hill! The clown said, "Hello, young man! Would you like to come and fly with me?"
Jack was so excited to see the clown and he eagerly agreed. The clown held Jack's hands and they both started to soar in the sky. Jack felt like he was flying with a real bird! They soared so high, and then flew lower and lower until they both landed.
Jack thanked the clown for a wonderful day, and the clown said, "You can do it anytime! Whenever you want to feel free, just come back here and use your imagination!" 
Jack smiled, gave the clown one more big hug and went back home feeling happy and so proud of himself.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Martha. Martha was very frightened. She was alone in the dark room, and the door had been locked shut.
The room was wide and cold. Martha heard a loud sound outside and she started to cry.
Suddenly she heard her father's voice. He called, "Martha! Where are you?"
She replied, "I'm here, Daddy, in the wide room, but the door is locked!"
Her father laughed and said, "Don't worry, I'm here now."
He opened the door, and when Martha saw him, she smiled. 
Martha was no longer frightened, and the two hugged and went home.




Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Daisy. Daisy was too young to take care of herself, so she had to ask her mom for help.
One afternoon, Daisy asked her mom, Mom, Im hungry. What is for dinner?
Her mom said, Daisy, Im sorry but dinner is going to be a bit rough tonight. We are all out of food.
Daisy was very sad. She did not want to be hungry at dinnertime. She asked her mom, Mom, can I be in charge of dinner tonight?
Her mom smiled and said, Daisy, go ahead and try. See what you can find in the cupboard.
Daisy went to the cupboard and looked around. She was able to find some crackers and a few pieces of fruit. She brought this back to the kitchen and made herself a dinner.
When she was done, she proudly showed her mom her dinner. Her mom smiled and said, Daisy, you did a great job. Good thing you were able to find something for dinner.
Daisy smiled, knowing that even though dinner was a bit rough, she was able to make it special.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jimmy. He was only three years old and loved to play with his toys.
Jimmy was playing with his trucks outside when he heard a loud noise. It was coming from the backyard. He rubbed his sleepy eyes and realised smoke was coming from the grass! It was burning!
Jimmy ran towards his mother and said, Mama, the grass is burning!
His mother quickly ran out and put out the burning grass with a bucket of water.
After the fire stopped, she said to Jimmy, Please be careful, Jimmy. Burning is not safe. You can get hurt if you dont be careful.
But Jimmy just nodded and said, OK.
He went back to playing but suddenly felt a sharp pain in his arm. He cried out and said, Ouch, mama! It hurts!
His mother took him to the doctor and they found out that it was a persistent burn from being too close to the fire.
Jimmy learned his lesson that day and promised to always be careful and stay away from things that are burning.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Joe who had a very special porch at his house. He loved to play on the porch and he was always very alert when he was outside. 
One day while Joe was balancing on the porch, he noticed something strange in the sky. He squinted and saw a bright, shiny star. Joe was so excited and he called out to his mom and dad. 
"Mom, Dad, look what I found!" he shouted. 
His mom and dad quickly looked up and saw the star too.
"That's an amazing discovery Joe!" his dad said, "Let's balance on the porch and see if we can see anymore stars too!"
Joe was so happy as he balanced on the porch with his mom and dad. They kept looking up at the night sky, until they eventually saw many more stars twinkling in the darkness.
Joe was filled with joy and he was so alert while he was looking up at the stars. He had never seen such a beautiful sight before and he was so lucky to share the experience with his mom and dad. 
The family stayed up late, until Joe eventually fell asleep in his dad's arms. Joe smiled, knowing that he had made a special discovery on his porch.



Once upon a time, there was a little baby girl named Ashley. She was three years old, and wanted to learn all about the world.
One day, Ashley's mom took her to the park. Ashley saw lots of pretty flowers and birds. But, the most beautiful thing of all was a big, shiny diamond! Ashley was so excited, she wanted to pick it up, but her mom said, "No Ashley, that is not yours. We need to be compassionate when we look at things like this."
Ashley's mom knelt down and explained to her why it was wrong to take the diamond. "It belongs to somebody else, and it is not nice to take something that does not belong to us," she said.
Ashley listened carefully and learned the important lesson. She smiled and hugged her mom, and the two of them enjoyed the rest of their day at the park. Ashley never forgot what she had learned about being compassionate with what does not belong to her.




Once upon a time there was a very thoughtful girl. She would often invite her friends to her house to play. On this particular day, her best friend had come over and they were exploring the backyard.
"Look, what's that?" asked the friend, pointing to something.
The girl looked carefully and saw it was a toy car. It was old and rusty but she knew it could be fixed.
"I think this car needs a new battery," she said.
They found an old battery and worked together to get the car running again. The girl turned to her friend.
"Let's try and reverse it," she said.
Excitedly, they got the car going in reverse. Whooping and cheering, their excitement filled the backyard. Even their parents came out to see what all the noise was about.
The girl smiled, knowing she had been thoughtful and been able to fix the car.




Once upon a time, there was a farm. On this farm there lived an impressive cow, who could fold many items that the farmers needed.
One day, the farmer asked the cow, "Can you fold this blanket?" 
The impressively skilled cow responded, "Yes, of course I can!"
So the cow took the blanket and neatly folded it into a square.
The farmer was so impressed and thanked the cow for its help. 
The next morning, the farmer brought out a quilt, and asked the cow, "Can you fold this quilt?" 
The cow responded, "Yes, I can!" 
Again, the cow carefully folded the quilt into a perfect square. The farmer was so pleased at the cow's impressive skills, he gave the cow some extra hay for breakfast.
From that day forward, the cow was always folding things for the farmer, and the farmer was always impressed by the cow's skill. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy was a very curious 3 year old and she loved to play pretend. She would dress up as a princess, a doctor, or even a fire fighter. 
One day, Daisy asked her mother, "What is a symbol?" Her mother explained that symbols are something used to represent an idea. Daisy thought about it for a minute, then got an idea. She told her mother, "I'm going to pretend to be a symbol of healthy!" 
Daisy's mother smiled. She helped Daisy dress up in a bright green dress and gave her a fresh piece of fruit. "Have fun pretending to be a symbol of healthy," she said. 
Together they went outside, where Daisy ran around in her costume and played pretend. She pretended to eat the piece of fruit and be healthy like the symbol she was dressed up as. Daisy had a lot of fun being a symbol of healthy that day.




Once upon a time there were two friends, Jerry and Susan. They loved the outdoors, and especially enjoyed going for long walks and picking strawberries.
One day when Jerry and Susan were out picking strawberries, Jerry found the biggest one hed ever seen. He said to Susan, Look! This strawberry is fit for us! Lets move it back home!
But Susan said, No! I found it first, so I should get to move it! 
Jerry said, No, no thats not fair! 
After a lot of arguing and disagreeing, they decided to take turns carrying the strawberry. Jerry moved the strawberry first and then Susan moved it too. They finally made it back home and shared the giant strawberry. 
Friends may argue, but in the end, theres always a way for them to be happy.



Once there was a boy named Tom. He was a curious boy and was always looking for something to explore and do. 
One day, Tom decided to go for a walk and found a pistol in the woods. He was so excited and so he ran home to show his mum.
Tom's mum was not so excited. She looked at the pistol and said Tom, you must never touch a distant pistol again! Its very dangerous and could hurt someone.
Tom nodded and promised to never touch it again. He thanked his mum for teaching him such an important lesson.
From that day on, Tom always thought before taking a risk. He remembered the lesson his mum taught him and kept herself and others safe.




There was a little girl who loved playing in the garden. She would happily run around, tumble, and pick up all the colorful flowers.
One day, she was playing in the garden when she saw a big, fat, orange bird with a long tail. She asked it, "Please can I have a ride on your back?"
The orange bird said, "No, silly girl! I don't want to help you get around. That's not useful for me. Instead, why don't you get some water and go take a bath? You'll have more fun that way."
The little girl smiled and ran off to get some water. She found a little pond and filled her bucket full of cool, crystal-clear water.
But when the little girl came back, the orange bird had flown away! All she had to show for her efforts was a heavy bucket of water. She didn't get to take a ride on the orange bird, and she had wasted her time getting the water.
Moral of the story: Sometimes asking for help isn't always the best choice. It's usually better to be useful and try to do things on your own.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. She was a shy three year old with big dreams. One day, she decided to make her dreams come true and set out to find a way to succeed.
In her search, Jane found a pin. It was made of metal and glimmered in the dark. Jane gasped with excitement, as she was sure this was the key to her success. She grabbed the pin and immediately started walking home.
On the way, she met an old man who asked, "What have you found, little girl?" Jane proudly replied, "I found a pin, and with it, I'm going to succeed!"
The old man smiled and said, "Good luck, little one, and follow your dreams."
From then on, Jane kept the pin close to her and never let go of her dreams. With the help of her pin, she was able to succeed in her dreams and live happily ever after.




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Tom. Tom loved playing with his blocks. He would build towers, castles and houses with them. 
One day, Tom's blocks got too close to the edge of the table. They started to topple over! Tom quickly ran to the table and managed to save all the blocks. 
Afterwards, Tom was feeling very happy and excited. He couldn't wait to build more towers and castles! But then, one of his friends, Max, came over. Max was feeling grumpy and wanted to join in. But Tom was not sure if he wanted to share his blocks. 
"Come on, Tom. Can I play with your blocks?" asked Max. 
Tom thought for a moment and then said, "I saved them all! They are mine". 
Max was feeling very sad now, but then Tom had an idea. He quickly moved the blocks over and said, "You can be the king of one tower and I can be the king of the other". 
Max smiled and said, "Yes, that sounds like a good plan!" 
Tom and Max built their towers together and had lots of fun. Tom was so glad he had managed to save his blocks. Everyone was happy in the end!




The family went for a walk in the park. The sun was shining and the sky was a bright blue. Daddy asked his two daughters if they wanted to play. The little girl, who was three, said she wanted to go to the swings. Daddy said it was a great idea so off they went.
The little girl ran to the swings and started to swing. She squealed with delight as Daddy pushed her higher and higher. Soon, her sister wanted to join in. Daddy asked her if she wanted to swing on the big swing or the small one, and the little girl said the small one. So Daddy put his two daughters on the swing, one on each side and they swung together, laughing and singing. They had a great time.
When they were done swinging, Daddy asked the little girl what she wanted to do next. She pointed to the slide and said, Slide! Daddy said that was a great idea, so he carried them both to the top of the slide. He showed them how to sit down and slide down the slide easily. The little girl had a great sight when she looked down the slide. She smiled and said, Let's do that again! So they did, again and again, until the girls were ready to go.



"Mommy, what are we having for dinner?" asked the three-year-old.
"Your favorite dish - macaroni and cheese," replied mommy.
"Yay!" the child said with a big smile.
Mommy took the child outside to the backyard. The child could smell something delicious, but they couldn't see anything.
"Mommy, where is dinner?" asked the child, puzzled.
"It's a secret! See if you can find it," Mommy said.
The child began exploring the backyard. After a few minutes, the child saw a small, hidden table with the macaroni and cheese.
"I remember this spot - it's where we had dinner last year!" the child said excitedly.
"You found it!" said Mommy. "Let's enjoy our dinner!"




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved to play. She raced around the house, pretending she was a jolly pirate. Then, she got an idea. She ran to the door and yelled, "I'm going to lock it tight like a lip." She giggled and grabbed the lock. But when she tried to turn it, she felt dizzy and had to sit down.
"Are you okay?" her mom asked. The little girl shook her head. 
"It's too hard," she said sadly. "I can't lock it."
Her mom smiled. She kneeled down and said, "Do you trust me?" The little girl nodded.
So, mom reached over and helped turn the lock. Then, she leaned down and gave the little girl a hug.
"See," she said, "you don't have to do everything alone. We can do it together!"
The little girl and her mom held hands as they looked at the door, which was now firmly locked.




Once upon a time there was a band of four animals, each one was its own color. There was a red dog, a blue frog, a yellow cat, and a green parrot. Together they were always having lots of fun.
One day, the dog was walking in the forest alone. Suddenly, he heard something that scared him! He knew he wasn't alone in the forest and he started to run.
The other animals heard the dog barking and ran to the forest to help him. When the band of four animals got to the forest, they saw a big mean bear! 
"Don't worry," said the parrot. "We are here to protect you".
Suddenly the bear started to run away! The band felt like heroes and they all cheered.
From then on, the band was never lonely. Whenever one of them felt scared, they knew that the other three would always be there to help.




There was once a good boy named Peter. Peter was three years old. One day, he wanted to explore his backyard. In the middle of the backyard, he found a big barrel.
Peter walked up to the barrel. He was curious and knocked on it to see what was inside. Suddenly, a voice came from the barrel!
"Who is there?" it said.
Peter was startled, but soon he remembered that he was brave. "It's me, Peter," he replied. "Can you please come out?"
An old man stepped out from the barrel. He smiled at Peter. "My name is Lawrence. I fell asleep in the barrel and cannot remove it by myself. Would you help me?" 
Peter wasn't sure if he should help, but then he remembered that it was nice to help people. So he put his hands around the barrel and tried to lift it up. With great effort, he finally managed to remove the barrel from the ground.
Lawrence smiled at Peter. "Thank you, young man! You have done a very good job!"
Peter smiled too; he felt proud of himself. He waved goodbye as Lawrence walked away.




John was a curious 3 year old. Every day he would go to the park to explore and play. One day, John thought he saw something shiny underground. He decided to dig around it to see what it was. 
John's mom saw him and said, "John, stop digging! You're going to get dirty down there." 
John wanted to keep digging and said, "Just one more minute, mom. I think I found something!" 
But his mom was firm and said, "No, John. Put the shovel away and come with me."
John was disappointed, but he put the shovel away and followed his mom. The next day, his mom suggested that they go back to the park. But this time, she told John to bring a bag with them. 
John was confused, but he was excited to go back to the same spot and find out what he almost dug up the day before. When they arrived, his mom pulled out the bag and said, "Let's go find that special something underground." 
John was overjoyed, and followed his mom as they walked around the park. After about 15 minutes of walking and searching, John finally found it! He had dug up a dirty old coin! John was so happy and hugged his mom to thank her. 
John finally understood why his mom made him put the shovel away the day before. Without that setup, he




Once upon a time, there was a very adorable little girl who wanted to go to the beach. Her mom said, Yes, you can go to the beach, but you must stay close to me.
At the beach, the little girl wanted to dive. She loved the feeling of the water on her skin. She asked her mom, Will you dive with me? Her mom said, I need to stay here to watch you, but you can dive!
The little girl was happy and she started to dive in the shallow water. She played and laughed, and then suddenly she saw something at the bottom. It was a beautiful shell! She held it up, and most importantly, didnt forget to thank her mom.
The moral of this story is that it is important to listen to our parents, so that we dont miss out on the beautiful things life has to offer. As a dessert, the family had ice cream and giggled together about the fun day they had at the beach.




John was in the kitchen making dinner for his family. He was making a spicy ranch dish. He opened a bag of potatoes and started to fold them up into slices. Suddenly, he heard a voice from behind him.
"Daddy, what are you doing?" asked John's 3 year old daughter, Emily.
John smiled and said, "I'm making spicy ranch potatoes. It's going to be so tasty!"
Emily's eyes lit up. She couldn't wait to try them.
John finished folding the potatoes and put them in the honey pan. He added some butter, spices and ranch seasoning. Then he put it all in the oven.
While the potatoes were cooking, Emily and John went outside to play catch. After a while, they came back in to the smell of a hot, delicious dish. They were both excited to eat it.
After dinner, Emily said, "Daddy, these potatoes were so tasty and spicy! Did you fold them up?"
John laughed and said, "Yes, I did! I folded them up special for you."
Emily smiled and hugged her dad. She was so happy and full after a delicious spicy ranch meal.




Once upon a time there lived a little girl named Susan. She loved to explore the world around her. One day, she was out playing in the woods. She came across an old, dusty mill. 
As she looked around, she noticed a sign which said: "Value your thoughts". She was curious and decided to enter the mill. Inside, she found a cheerful old man sitting in a corner.
Susan asked the old man, "What does the sign mean?"
The old man replied, "It means to be thoughtful, to think before you act. To value your thoughts. That's all it means."
Susan nodded and thanked the old man before she continued exploring the mill. She looked around and felt a great appreciation for all the thoughtful things she saw and thought about what the old man had told her. 
At the end of the day, Susan left the mill with a valuable lesson: always think before you act!




Once upon a time there was a boy named Jack. He lived in the city and loved to explore. One day Jack's mom said to him, "Jack, why don't you look around the city and see what you can find?"
So Jack went. He looked around the city and found a big, black crow. He asked the crow, "What should I do?" The crow said, "If you want to learn something new, look closely and you'll find something to teach you."
So Jack looked closely at the city. Everywhere he looked he found something new. He learned that being curious was a good way to learn about the world.
Meanwhile, Jack's mom was looking for him. When she finally found him, she said to him, "Jack, you know you should never wander off without telling someone first, right?" Jack nodded and said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I was just looking, and I found something new. I learned that looking and being curious is a good thing. I won't wander off again."
Jack's mom smiled and said, "That's my smart boy. From now on be sure to look, but always stay close to home."
Jack learned an important lesson that day - that it's good to look around and explore, but it's also important to stay close to home.




Once upon a time there was a flower. She was very red and beautiful. Every day she would put out her petals and dance in the wind. She loved being surrounded by other flowers but she was alone.
One day, a little girl came up to the flower. She had little hands and big eyes. She looked at the flower and said, "Oh, you're so pretty!" Then she asked, "Can I pick you?"
The flower thought for a moment. She wanted to stay here in the garden, but she also wanted to give the little girl a special gift. Finally, the flower said, "Yes, you can pick me - but only if you promise to take care of me."
The little girl agreed and plucked the flower from the ground. She carried it with her all the way home and kept it in her room. She watered the flower every day and it bloomed brighter and redder.
The moral of the story is that it's good to give when it comes from the heart. The flower had the courage to fulfill her friend's request, knowing that no matter what happened she could trust that the girl would take care of her.




Once upon a time there was a cheerful little girl named Jane. One day when she was out in the garden, she found a skull. She thought it was strange, but it wasn't too scary. She showed it to her mommy who was very surprised.
Mommy said, "Let's go back inside the house." Jane was a bit worried but followed her mommy inside. Mommy put the skull on the table and said, "Stay here, Jane. I'm going to get something from the attic." Jane waited and waited but her mommy never came back. 
Where did her mommy go? What could she be getting from the attic? Jane was very confused, but then she heard a strange noise. Suddenly, her mommy appeared holding a box. Jane's mommy smiled as she opened the box. Inside was a colorful puppet!
Jane was so excited and cheered as she saw the puppet vanish, then appear, vanish, then appear again. Suddenly, Jane understood why her mommy had gone to the attic.  She knew the skull held the power of magic and her mommy had gone to get the puppet. Jane was so happy, she wanted to do more magic!



John walked outside. The sky was dark and the wind made the trees sway back and forth. John could feel something was wrong. He could hear a loud rumbling noise coming closer and closer. Suddenly, it started pouring rain and the wind blew harder and harder. John was so scared he had to hide. 
John crawled under the porch and pulled his knees up close to his chest. The storm outside roared louder and louder. John felt so fearful. He repeated to himself, "It's only a storm. It's only a storm." 
After a while, the storm blew away. When the sun came out, John crept out from under the porch. He stood in the sunshine and smiled. He was so happy the storm had gone, and he was no longer scared.




"Mama!" Jake shouted as he held his brush up in the air. "I need to brush my hair!"
Mama smiled and knelt down to meet her little boy's sparkling eyes. "Yes, my sweetheart, you need a brush," she said gentley.
Mama opened the drawer and pulled out a beautiful brush. It was soft and pink, with a bow made of glitter. Jake's eyes lit up, and he smiled wide.
Mama proceeded to gently brush Jake's hair. He squirmed and giggled, feeling so spoiled and loved. She tied a pink ribbon at the end, admiring her little boy's golden locks.
Mama kissed Jake's nose. "All better now," she said with a smile. "Let's go show daddy what a handsome young man you are!"




Once upon a time there was a family named Bob. Bob and his family lived in a little house surrounded by a garden with all sorts of flowers.
One day Bob was walking around the garden when he noticed something strange. He smelled something smelly! He followed his nose and he found a string that was leading somewhere in the garden.
He followed the smelly string and eventually found a big pile of rotten fruit. He knew that the smelly string had something to do with the rotten fruit!
Bob asked his family to gather around the garden and he mentioned that he had discovered the rotten fruit and asked them what to do about it. His family had an idea, they would bring their little puppy, Daisy. Daisy could sniff out the smelly string and the family could follow the string until they found the source of all the smelly rotten fruit.
That's what the family did! Daisy followed the smelly string until everyone was led to a fruit tree. Together the family was able to pick and clean the rotten fruit and share the healthy delicious fruit with their neighbours. Everyone was happy!




John had a reliable birdcage. It was the perfect home for his little feathered friend. Every day, John would take good care of his pet by filling the birdcage with food and water. One day, John was feeling especially proud of his pet and wanted to show it off to the world. 
John asked his mom, "Mom, can we take my bird to the park?" His mom nodded in agreement and soon the two were on their way. 
At the park, John pointed at the different squawks and chirps coming from the birds in the trees. He could not believe how wonderful they looked in the sky. Suddenly, one of the birds flew into the birdcage and perched itself on the top of the reliable cage. John was so excited and quickly ran over to tell his mom, but when he returned to the birdcage, the little feathered friend was gone. 
John began to cry, and his mom could tell he was really distraught. She put her arm around John to comfort him, and then she pointed at the tree closeby. On one of the branches sat the little bird, looking back at them and chirping softly. 
John smiled and knew it was the same bird from his birdcage. He realized that he should look closer at things in the future and that his birdcage might not always be as reliable as he thought!




Once there was a smart girl who wanted to win. Every day she worked hard, but never seemed to win. One day she decided to visit the doctor. But the doctor said she couldn't win. She was very sad and had to give up trying. The girl was so upset that she never wanted to try again. She never won, but she tried her best each and every day.




Once there was a little girl who was very intelligent. She was playing in the park one day and saw a boot. She was fascinated by it, so she reached down and picked it up.
The boot said, "Hello! Who are you?" The little girl was surprised and replied, "I'm Anna!"
The boot laughed and said, "That's a very nice name! Are you an intelligent girl?" Anna thought for a moment, and then she replied confidently, "Yes, I am!"
The boot said with admiration, "I knew it! You are very special Anna."
Anna was so happy to have a new friend. She took the boot home with her and they have been friends ever since.




Once upon a time there was a jolly doctor. He worked very hard in his office every day. One morning he saw a little girl outside his window. She was crying.
The doctor went out to speak to her. Whats wrong? he asked. 
My mommy is very sick, the little girl said.
The doctor smiled. Let me help, he said. 
So the doctor took the little girl to his office. He worked hard all morning to make sure her mom felt better. When it was time to leave, the little girl smiled and thanked the doctor.
The doctor said, It is important to help others. Everyone should work together to make the world a better place.
The little girl was very happy, and she ran home to tell her mommy the story. From then on, she helped people whenever she could.
The moral of the story is that hard work and helping others makes the world a better place!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sara. One day, Sara had a brilliant idea. She looked around her garden until her eyes rested on a big tree. Grinning, she excitedly grabbed a big net and ran to the tree.
"I'm going to throw the net up in the tree and climb it," she said, throwing the big net over the tree's branches.
Suddenly, the net got stuck in the branches and Sara got a bit dizzy. She tried to get the network out of the tree, but no matter what she did, it stayed stuck.
"Oh, no!" she said.
Sara looked around for help when she spotted her dad looking at her with a smile. She ran to him and he gave her a big hug.
"Don't worry, darling," he said. "I will help you get the network out of the tree".
Sara's dad grabbed a ladder and carefully climbed up the tree. He carefully started untangling the net from the branches until it finally came free. When Sara saw the network in her dad's hands she felt so happy that she jumped around and celebrated.
"Yay! I got my net back," she said, feeling dizzy with joy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing with her toys and drawing pictures. One day, she accidentally broke her favorite fragile vase while playing. She was sad and scared to tell her mom.
When her mom saw the broken vase, she asked Lily what happened. Lily told her the truth and said sorry. Her mom forgave her and gave her a hug. 
Later that day, Lily and her mom went to the beach to watch the ships. Lily saw a big ship with lots of colorful flags. She asked her mom if they could go on a ship and sail away. Her mom said they couldn't go on that ship, but they could go on a different ship one day.
Lily felt happy and loved knowing her mom forgave her and they could go on a ship adventure one day.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to read books. He would go to the library every week to get new books to read.
One day, Timmy went to the library and saw a big sign that said "Quiet please". Timmy didn't understand why he had to be quiet. He asked the librarian, "Why do we have to be quiet?" The librarian said, "Because we don't want to disturb others who are reading." Timmy nodded his head and said, "Oh, I understand now."
Timmy found a book he wanted to read and sat down at a table. He read the book quietly and when he was finished, he put it back on the shelf. As he was leaving the library, the librarian said, "You did a fine job being quiet today, Timmy." Timmy smiled and said, "Thank you!" From that day on, Timmy always remembered to be quiet in the library.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play at the beach with his mommy. One day, Timmy saw an unusual animal on the sand. It was a seal!
"Mommy, look! A seal!" Timmy shouted.
"Yes, Timmy. It's a seal," said his mommy.
Timmy wanted to play with the seal, but it was too far away. So, he kicked a ball towards the seal. The seal saw the ball and swam closer to Timmy. Timmy was so happy to play with the seal. He petted the seal and said, "You're my new friend!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to take baths in the bathroom. One day, Lily's mom asked her to help attach a hook to the wall. Lily was glad to help her mom. 
Lily's mom said, "We need to attach this hook to the wall so we can hang your towel." 
Lily didn't know what "attach" meant, but she watched as her mom used a hammer and a nail to put the hook on the wall. 
After Lily's bath that night, she was so glad to have a hook to hang her towel on. She said, "Thank you, Mom! I love our new hook!" 
From that day on, Lily always remembered what "attach" meant and she helped her mom with lots of projects in the bathroom.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside and look at the big billboard on the street. The billboard had lots of colors and pictures of yummy food.
One day, Timmy's friend Billy came to play. Billy saw the billboard and said, "Wow, that looks so good! I wish I could eat all of that food." Timmy said, "Me too, but we can't steal it. That would be a terrible thing to do."
Billy said, "I know, but I really want some of that food." Timmy thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea. Let's go home and ask our moms to make us some yummy food just like the pictures on the billboard."
So, Timmy and Billy went home and asked their moms to make them some delicious food. Their moms were happy to help and made them a big feast. Timmy and Billy sat outside and enjoyed their food while looking at the billboard. They were happy they didn't have to steal and knew it was the right thing to do.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweety. Tweety loved to fly high in the sky and sing songs. One day, Tweety saw a big tree and wanted to build a nest in it. But Tweety didn't have a saw to cut the branches.
Tweety asked a squirrel, "Do you have a saw? I need to cut some branches to build a nest." The squirrel replied, "I don't have a saw, but I can help you find one."
Tweety felt anxious because it was getting dark and she needed to build her nest before it got too late. Suddenly, the squirrel came back with a saw and helped Tweety cut the branches. Tweety was so happy and said, "Thank you, squirrel! Now I can build my nest and sleep safely tonight." And with that, Tweety flew back to the tree and built her cozy nest.



Once upon a time, there was a little ball. It was red and small. The ball loved to roll around and play with its friends. One day, the ball saw a long line of ants marching. The ball rolled over to the line and watched the ants walk by. The ants didn't seem to notice the ball. 
Suddenly, the ball saw a toy car. It was big and shiny. The ball wanted to play with the car, but it was too expensive. The ball felt sad because it couldn't afford the car. Then, the ball saw a cheap toy truck. It was not as shiny as the car, but the ball was happy to have found something to play with. The ball rolled over to the truck and they played together all day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and her favorite toy was a teddy bear named Mr. Snuggles. One day, Lily wanted to play with Mr. Snuggles but he was not in her room. She looked everywhere but he was not there. 
Lily decided to plan a search for Mr. Snuggles. She went to her mom and told her the plan. Her mom helped her by giving her a flashlight and a switch to turn it on. Lily was ready for the search!
She went to every room in the house and finally found Mr. Snuggles behind the couch. She was so happy to have found him and hugged him tightly. From that day on, Lily always made sure to put Mr. Snuggles back in his special spot so she wouldn't have to plan another search again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her pen. One day, she accidentally dropped her pen in a puddle and it got wet. Lily was sad because she couldn't draw anymore. 
But then, her mom gave her some gum to chew. Lily loved chewing gum because it was so yummy. As she was chewing, she noticed that the gum made her mouth wet. She had an idea! 
Lily took her wet pen and dipped it in the gum. She started drawing with her new "sticky" pen and it was so much fun! She drew pictures of her family, her pets, and even a big rainbow. From that day on, Lily knew that even when things seem bad, there is always a way to make them better.



Once upon a time, there was a little spider named Charlotte. She lived in a big tree with her family. One day, she woke up and saw a cobweb on her head. She didn't like it because it was different from the other cobwebs she had made before.
She went to her mommy and said, "Mommy, look at my cobweb. It's different from the others." Her mommy said, "It's okay, Charlotte. Everyone makes different things. Your cobweb is still beautiful."
Charlotte felt happy and decided to make more cobwebs. She worked hard and made many different cobwebs. As the sun started to rise, she looked at her cobwebs and felt proud of herself. She said to her family, "Look at my cobwebs. They are different but still pretty."
Her family looked at her cobwebs and said, "Wow, Charlotte! You are a great spider. Your cobwebs are amazing!" Charlotte felt happy and went to sleep, dreaming of making more different cobwebs.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, she went to the park with her mom and saw a little bird with a broken wing.
Lily said, "Mommy, we need to help the birdie. It can't fly with a broken wing."
Mommy said, "That's a good opinion, Lily. Let's take the birdie to the vet."
They took the birdie to the vet and the vet said, "The birdie needs to rest and be quiet so it can heal."
Lily said, "I'll be quiet so the birdie can rest."
A few days later, they went back to the park to release the birdie. Lily was so happy to see the birdie fly away. But then, a big dog came and chased the birdie. The birdie couldn't fly fast enough and the dog caught it.
Lily was very sad. She said, "Why did the dog do that? It's not nice to hurt others."
Mommy said, "I don't know, Lily. Sometimes bad things happen even when we try to help."



Once upon a time, there was a gifted boy named Tim. He loved to play with his toys and go outside to play with his friends. One day, Tim found a shiny copper penny on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his mom. "Look what I found!" he said. His mom was happy for him and said, "That's a lucky penny, Tim!" Tim put the penny in his pocket and went back outside to play with his friends. They played tag and hide-and-seek until it was time for dinner. Tim went home and showed his penny to his dad. His dad said, "That's a special penny, Tim. Keep it safe." Tim smiled and went to bed, happy with his new copper gift.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the park with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to the park and saw a long line for the swings. Lily wanted to swing too, but she didn't want to wait in the line. 
Suddenly, a kind man who worked at the park came up to them and said, "I can serve you and your family first, since you have been waiting patiently on the side." Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, mister! That's very fair!" 
Lily had so much fun swinging and playing at the park. When it was time to go home, she said to her parents, "I want to come back here again and play on the swings. Maybe the kind man will serve us again!"



Once upon a time, there was a man who lived in a big city. He had a job that made him work very hard every day. He had to wake up early in the morning and go to work in a big building. He worked with many other people who were also very busy.
One day, the man went to a restaurant and ordered some food. But when he tasted it, he found that it was very sour. He didn't like it at all! He told the waiter about it and the waiter said sorry and brought him another dish.
After work, the man went back to his home in the city. He was very tired but he felt happy because he knew that he had worked hard and done a good job. He went to bed early so that he could wake up early again the next day and go back to work. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved cars and trucks. He had a big red truck that he liked to drive around his backyard. One day, Timmy's dad took him to a baseball game. They sat in the stands and watched the players pitch the ball. Timmy was anxious to see who would win the game. After the game, they got back in the car and Timmy's dad let him drive in the parking lot. It was so much fun! Timmy felt happy and excited.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, but she didn't know how to count them. One day, her mom came in and said, "Lily, let me teach you how to count your toys. It's easy!" 
Lily was excited to learn, so she sat down with her mom and they started counting together. Her mom would point to each toy and say the number, and Lily would repeat after her. After a few tries, Lily got the hang of it and was able to count all her toys by herself. 
"Wow, Mommy! That was so easy!" Lily exclaimed. "Thank you for teaching me how to count." 
Her mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, sweetie. It's important to learn new things so we can grow and be smart." 
From that day on, Lily loved to count everything she saw and would proudly show her mom how many toys she had. She was grateful that her mom took the time to teach her something new.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to school because she got to learn new things every day. One day, her mom asked her, "Lily, what would you like for lunch?" 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I want a fancy sandwich with cheese and ham, please." 
Her mom smiled and said, "Sure, I'll serve you a fancy sandwich for lunch today." 
At school, Lily showed her fancy sandwich to her friends. They asked her where she got it from, and she proudly said, "My mom made it for me." 
After lunch, Lily's teacher asked the class, "Who wants to serve the snacks today?" Lily raised her hand and said, "I want to serve the snacks, please." 
Lily felt proud that she could serve her classmates and make them happy. She loved going to school and learning new things every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and run around in the park. One day, Lily saw an aeroplane flying in the sky. She was so happy to see it and waved at the aeroplane. 
But then, Lily saw her friend crying. Her friend had lost her favourite toy. Lily felt sad for her friend and decided to help her look for the toy. They searched everywhere and finally found it under a tree. 
Lily's friend was so happy and hugged Lily. Lily felt happy too because she helped her friend. She learned that helping others can make them happy and that makes you happy too. From that day on, Lily always tried to help others and make them happy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore the world around her. One day, she decided to try something new and climb a big tree in her backyard. She was a little scared, but she wanted to see the world from up high.
As she climbed higher and higher, she started to feel a little wobbly. She tried to keep her balance, but she felt like she might tip over. She took a deep breath and tried to steady herself.
Finally, she made it to the top of the tree and looked out at the world around her. It was so beautiful! She felt proud of herself for trying something new and not giving up. She climbed back down the tree with a modest smile on her face, knowing that she had accomplished something special.



Once upon a time, there was a chubby little mouse named Max. Max lived in a cozy hole in the ceiling of a big house. Max loved to whistle and dance around his little home. 
One day, Max saw a big piece of cheese in the kitchen. He wanted it so much that he decided to go and get it. Max climbed down from his hole and ran across the floor. 
Suddenly, the owner of the house saw Max and chased him with a broom. Max tried to run back to his hole, but he was too slow. The owner hit Max with the broom and Max fell to the floor. Max was hurt and couldn't whistle or dance anymore. 
The moral of the story is that sometimes, things that we want can be dangerous. It's important to be careful and stay safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park. One day, she found a big, green leaf on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mom. "Look, Mommy! This leaf is so pretty," Lily said.
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, it is. But it's also dirty. Let's wash it." So, they went inside and washed the leaf with soap and water until it was clean.
After they finished, Lily's mom said, "Wow, you did a great job washing that leaf. You have strong hands." Lily beamed with pride and said, "Thank you, Mommy!" From that day on, Lily loved to help her mom wash things and show off her strong hands.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and listen to music. One day, she heard a loud noise outside her window. It was an enormous truck!
Lily ran to her mommy and said, "Mommy, what is that enormous noise outside?"
Her mommy replied, "It's just a truck, Lily. They are recording some music for the new movie."
Lily was excited and asked, "Can we go see the movie when it comes out?"
Her mommy smiled and said, "Of course, Lily. We can go see the movie and listen to the music they recorded." 
And so, Lily and her mommy went to see the movie and listened to the beautiful music that was recorded by the enormous truck. Lily was happy and danced along to the music, knowing that she had heard it being recorded before.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved playing outside. She would run around in the grass and pick flowers. One day, she saw an elderly lady struggling to carry her groceries. 
Lily asked, "Do you need help?" 
The elderly lady replied, "Yes, please. I forgot my cane at the store and it's hard for me to walk without it." 
Lily helped the lady carry her groceries to her house. The lady was very grateful and thanked Lily for her kindness. 
The moral of the story is that helping others is important, especially when they are elderly and may need extra help. And even if we forget something, we can always ask for help.



Once upon a time, there was a little bunny who loved to run. Every day, he would rush around the meadow, chasing after butterflies and playing with his friends. One day, while he was playing, he saw a white shape in the distance. Curious, he hopped over to investigate.
As he got closer, he realized that the shape was a little bird who had fallen from her nest. The bunny knew he had to help her, so he carefully picked her up in his soft, furry paws and brought her back to her nest. The bird's mother was so grateful that she gave the bunny a shiny white feather as a thank you.
From that day on, the bunny learned that helping others was more important than just rushing around and playing all day. He felt proud of himself for being kind, and he always kept the white feather as a reminder of the important lesson he had learned.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy was very adventurous and loved to explore. One day, Timmy went on a big adventure in the forest. He saw lots of animals and trees, but then he got lost. Timmy felt scared and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, Timmy heard a loud noise. It was an emergency! He saw a little squirrel stuck in a tree. Timmy knew he had to fix the problem. He climbed up the tree and helped the squirrel. After that, Timmy felt happy and proud of himself.
The moral of the story is that it's important to be brave and help others when they need it. Even if you're scared, you can still be a hero and fix the problem.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the zoo with his mommy and daddy. One day, they went to the zoo and saw a big brown ostrich. Timmy thought it was funny because the ostrich had a long neck and big eyes.
Timmy's mommy said, "Timmy, do you want to carry your toy ostrich around the zoo?" Timmy said, "Yes, please!" Timmy carried his toy ostrich all around the zoo, showing it to all the animals.
As they were leaving the zoo, Timmy saw the big brown ostrich again. But this time, the ostrich was carrying something too. Timmy said, "Mommy, look! The ostrich is carrying something too!" His mommy smiled and said, "Yes, Timmy. Ostriches like to carry things too." Timmy was so happy to learn something new about the ostrich.



Once upon a time, there was a lovely little bird named Tweet. Tweet liked to fly high in the sky and zoom around the trees. One day, Tweet saw a big, scary cat down below. "Oh no!" Tweet cried. "I need to find a safe place to hide!"
Tweet flew around, looking for a safe spot. Suddenly, she saw a friendly squirrel. "Excuse me, Mr. Squirrel," Tweet said. "Can you please help me find a safe place to hide from that scary cat?"
"Of course, little birdie," said the squirrel. "You can hide in my cozy nest up in the tree. It's a lovely spot to be."
Tweet was so grateful to the kind squirrel. She zoomed up to the nest and felt safe and sound. "Thank you so much for helping me," Tweet said. "Now I can zoom around without any worries!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went outside to play and saw a pretty butterfly. The butterfly had colorful wings and flew around in the sky. Lily recognized the butterfly from a book she had read. 
Lily wanted to catch the butterfly, but she knew she shouldn't because it was too delicate. Instead, she watched the butterfly fly around and land on a flower. The flower looked tasty to the butterfly. 
Lily was happy that she saw the butterfly and she went back inside to tell her mom. She said, "Mommy, I saw a pretty butterfly outside. It was just like the one in my book!" Her mom smiled and said, "That's wonderful, Lily. Maybe we can go outside and see if we can find more butterflies tomorrow."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pale dress and loved to play outside. One day, she found a big number three on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mommy. "Look mommy, I found a number!" she said with a big smile. Her mommy was proud of her and gave her a hug. Lily loved when her mommy hugged her. 
Later that day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a little boy who was sad. She went over to him and said, "Hi, my name is Lily. Do you want to play with me?" The little boy smiled and said, "Yes, please." Lily and the little boy played together and had so much fun. They loved playing together so much that they became best friends. 
From that day on, Lily and her new friend played together every day. They loved each other's company and never wanted to be apart. Lily was so happy that she found the number three and made a new friend. She knew that it was a special day that she would always remember.



Once upon a time, there was a train. The train was going to the station. The train was happy because it was going to see its friends at the station. But then, something bad happened. The train hit a tree and it stopped. 
The train was stuck and it couldn't move. The train was sad because it couldn't see its friends at the station. But then, the train had an idea. The train thought it could reverse and go back to the station. So, the train reversed and went back to the station. 
When the train got to the station, all its friends were happy to see it. They asked the train why it came back. The train told them about the tree and how it was stuck. The friends were sad that the train had a bad experience. But they were happy that the train came back to see them.



Once upon a time, there was a baby who was crying. The baby's mom was trying to calm the baby down, but nothing seemed to work. Suddenly, a helpful neighbor came over and asked what was wrong. 
"The baby won't stop crying," said the mom. 
"I can help," said the neighbor. "Let's hurry and make a silly face to make the baby laugh." 
The neighbor made a silly face and the baby stopped crying. "Thank you for being so helpful," said the mom. 
"No problem," said the neighbor. "I love babies."



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go on adventures with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to a car store to buy a new jeep. Lily saw a shiny red jeep and pointed to it. "Mommy, daddy, that one!" she said.
But her parents said, "That jeep is too expensive. Let's look for a cheaper one." Lily was sad, but then she saw a blue jeep that was just as cool. "Look, mommy, daddy, that one!" she said, pointing again.
Her parents looked at the blue jeep and agreed that it was a good choice. They bought the jeep and went on a fun adventure together. Lily loved her new jeep and pointed out all the cool things they saw on their trip. "Look, mommy, a bird!" she said. "And a flower! And a tree!"



Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky liked to play in the pond with his friends. One day, it started to rain really hard. Ducky and his friends got upset because they couldn't play in the pond anymore.
Ducky had an idea. He said, "Let's make a raft and go on an adventure!" His friends thought it was a great idea. They found some sticks and leaves and made a raft. They went on the raft and floated down the river.
It was still raining, but they didn't mind. They were having so much fun on their adventure. They saw lots of animals and even a rainbow! When they got back to the pond, they were all wet and tired, but they were happy because they had such a fun time.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys. One day, she found a loop of string on the ground. She picked it up and looked at it. It was so pretty! She decided to make a necklace out of it. 
Lily went to her room and got some beads. She put the loop around her neck and started to push the beads onto it. It was hard work, but she did it! When she finished, she looked in the mirror. She felt so proud of her beautiful necklace. 
Later that day, Lily showed her necklace to her mom. Her mom said, "Wow, Lily! You are so creative and talented! You made a beautiful necklace. You are so rich in imagination." Lily smiled and felt happy. She loved her new necklace and was proud of herself.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to sing and dance, and dreamed of performing on a big stage. One day, she met a friendly butterfly who asked her what was wrong.
"I want to be on stage, but I forget the words to my song," Lily said, feeling sad.
"Don't worry, I can help," the butterfly said with a gentle smile. "Just practice every day and you'll remember the words."
Lily practiced every day, and soon she was ready to perform on stage. She sang her heart out and danced with joy, and the audience cheered and clapped. After the show, the butterfly flew up to her and said, "You did it! You were amazing!"
"Thank you for helping me," Lily said, feeling happy. "I'll never forget this day."



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and wear pretty costumes. One day, Lily's mom set up a special surprise for her. She had a smooth, shiny costume waiting for her to wear. Lily was so excited to put it on and twirl around in it.
As she danced around the room, Lily noticed that her costume had a special power. Whenever she wore it, she felt like a princess. She loved the way the smooth fabric felt against her skin and how it sparkled in the light.
Lily wore her special costume every day and felt happy and confident in it. She knew that it didn't cost a lot of money, but to her, it was worth more than anything in the world. She felt like a true princess and nothing could ever take that feeling away from her.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy lived in a big house with his family. Timmy's family was very rich, which means they had lots of money. 
One day, Timmy's mommy got some mail. It was a big envelope with lots of papers inside. Timmy asked his mommy what was in the mail. His mommy said it was important grown-up stuff that he wouldn't understand.
But Timmy wanted to see what was inside, so he grabbed the envelope and started to twist it. Suddenly, all the papers fell out and Timmy's mommy got very upset. She told Timmy that he shouldn't play with the mail and that it was important. Timmy felt bad and promised to never twist the mail again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to ride her scooter around the park. One day, Lily was feeling very sleepy, so she decided to take a nap under a tree. While she was sleeping, she heard a beautiful sound. It was a bird singing a sweet song. Lily woke up and started to sing along with the bird. They sang together for a long time, and it made Lily very happy. From that day on, whenever Lily felt sleepy, she would take a nap under the tree and listen to the bird sing.



Once upon a time, there was a little fairy named Lily. She was very pretty and loved to fly around the garden. However, she was also very careless. One day, she accidentally knocked over a flower pot and made a big mess.
The other fairies were upset with Lily and told her to settle down and be more careful. But Lily didn't listen and continued to fly around without a care in the world.
One day, while flying too close to a spider's web, Lily got stuck. She tried to wiggle free, but it was no use. She was scared and didn't know what to do. Luckily, her fairy friends came to her rescue and helped set her free.
From that day on, Lily learned to be more careful and never flew too close to spider webs again. She settled down and became a more responsible fairy. The other fairies were proud of her and they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a favorite rug in her room that was soft and cozy. One day, Lily's little brother spilled juice on her rug and it became sticky and dirty. Lily was upset and didn't know what to do.
Her friend Timmy came over to play and saw the terrible rug. "I dare you to jump on it!" he said with a mischievous smile. Lily was hesitant at first, but then she thought it might be fun. She jumped on the rug and it made a squishy sound.
Suddenly, their mom walked in and saw the mess. "Oh no, what happened to the rug?" she asked. Lily explained what had happened and her mom helped her clean it up. From then on, Lily made a rule that no drinks were allowed near her favorite rug.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she wanted to have a party with her friends. So, she decided to invite them over to her house. She made pretty invitations with colorful paper and stickers.
Suddenly, there was an emergency! The cake she baked fell on the floor and broke into pieces. Lily was sad and didn't know what to do. But, she remembered that she was creative. She decided to make cupcakes instead and decorate them with sprinkles and frosting.
When her friends arrived, they were happy to see the pretty cupcakes. They played games and danced to music. Lily was happy that her friends came to her party and that she was able to be creative and make something yummy for them to eat.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go on adventures. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to sit in her seat at the dinner table. But Lily didn't want to sit in her seat, she wanted to play with her toys instead.
Mommy told Lily that if she didn't sit in her seat, she would have to be punished. Lily didn't know what that meant, but she knew it didn't sound good. So, she sat in her seat and ate her dinner.
After dinner, Lily wanted to go on an adventure outside. But mommy said it was too distant and she had to stay close to home. Lily was sad, but she knew mommy was just trying to keep her safe.
Later that night, Lily realized that listening to mommy was important. She didn't want to be punished again and she wanted to stay safe. So, she promised to always sit in her seat and stay close to home. And she lived happily ever after. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to watch TV all day long. One day, his mom said, "Timmy, you need to go outside and play. It's a beautiful day!"
Timmy didn't want to go outside. He said, "But Mom, it's too harsh outside. I want to stay inside and watch TV."
His mom replied, "No, Timmy. You need to get some fresh air. Why don't you go to the pool and dive in?"
Timmy thought about it for a moment and then said, "Okay, Mom. I'll go to the pool and dive in. But can I watch TV when I come back inside?"
His mom smiled and said, "Of course, Timmy. But remember, it's important to have fun outside too!"



Once upon a time, there was a dancer named Lily. She loved to dance and twirl around. One day, she put on her tutu and ballet shoes, but they didn't fit her anymore. Her mommy said they were too small and she needed new ones. 
Lily went to the store with her mommy to find new ballet shoes. She tried on many pairs until she found the perfect ones that fit just right. She was so happy she could dance all day!
