The lady told Sue she was looking after some delicate flowers. Sue asked if she could help. The lady said yes and showed Sue how to take care of them. 
Then, every day, Sue and the lady looked after the flowers together. Sue was very happy to learn how to be delicate with the flowers.




Once upon a time, there was an old star in the sky. It was very special, because it was the oldest star in the universe. Every night, the old star shone so brightly that it lit up the whole sky.
The old star was so magical that it could grant wishes. One day, a little girl saw the old star in the night sky. She made a wish that she could write like a grown up. Suddenly, the old star sparkled and her wish came true.
The little girl was so happy that she ran to get a pencil and paper. She wrote and wrote and wrote. Soon, the little girl was writing stories about the old star in the sky. She wrote about all of its magic and how brightly it shone.
The little girl was thankful to the old star for making her wish come true. Every night, she would look up to the sky and say "Thank you!"




Once upon a time there was a boy named Sam. He was a very selfish boy.
Sam had a herb garden that he liked to take care of. Every day he would part the herbs and make sure they were all taken care of.
But one day when he looked in his herb garden, it was all gone! All of the herbs had been taken by a selfish person.
Sam was very sad and angry. He knew he had to get his herbs back.
He searched and searched until he found the person who had taken his herbs. He asked them why they had taken them and the person said they just wanted something to grow in their own garden. 
Sam was still sad and a little angry, but he realized that the person had only done it because they wanted something for themselves. Sam decided to be generous and gave them some of his herbs to grow in their own garden. 
The person was very happy and thanked Sam for his generosity. From then on, Sam made sure to be less selfish and to share his herbs with everyone.




Mummy and Daddy were very excited. It was time to celebrate!
They put on their warm coats and hats. Then they took Copper outside. Copper was their little puppy.
The day was very icy. Snow was everywhere! Daddy held Copper's leash tightly, and they set off to celebrate.
They went to the park and there were lots of families there too. There was loud music and yummy food! Everyone was wearing bright colours.
Copper was very excited to be there. He ran around and played with the other puppies.
At the end of the day, Mummy, Daddy, and Copper were so tired. But they had lots of fun! They were all so happy to have celebrated together.



The sun was high in the sky and the day was hot. Suddenly, it started to rain. The drops of rain were big and heavy. Emily looked up at the sky, excitedly. She opened her mouth and let the raindrops hit her tongue. They tasted cool and sweet.
Next, Emily went outside and saw a puddle of orange water. She smiled and went closer. She picked up a small dish and scooped up some of the water. She played with it, making figures in the mud.
The rain stopped, but Emily stayed outside. She played with her dish of orange water, until it disappeared in the sun. Emily was happy and covered in mud. But she also had a big smile on her face. She knew that it would rain again soon.




Once upon a time there was a crazy rod. It was so special because it could create things. Every day it would create something new and amazing. One day it created a giant tree filled with candy. Everyone was so excited! 
The candy fell from the branches and filled the sky. Everyone was happy and they ate so much candy. But then the rod created a volcano and a big fire came out. Everyone was scared and started running. 
But then the rod created a big monster made of ice cream! Everyone smiled and laughed then the monster gave everyone a hug. 
The rod kept creating new and amazing things every day. That's why it was so special and so crazy. Everyone loved it and they were so happy!




George was walking through the forest when he heard a loud noise. He looked up and saw a big, filthy crane in the sky. The bird was flapping its wings, making a loud sound. George was scared and started to shiver. He stood there, shaking, until the crane flew away.
When the crane was gone, George noticed something glimmering in the dirt. He walked over and picked it up - it was a gold coin! He put it in his pocket and headed home, feeling much less scared.
When George got home, he showed his mom the gold coin. She was so excited, she hugged George and told him what a good job he did. Even though George was still a little bit scared of the crane, he couldn't help but smile.




Once there was a humble worm who wanted to get a hug. He crawled up to a little boy and squeazed up against his leg. The little boy was surprised and laughed. He scooped up the worm in his hands and gave him a big squeeze. The worm felt so happy and he wriggled with joy. 
The little boy put the worm on the ground and they spent the rest of the afternoon playing together. The little boy showed the worm his ball and they ran around trying to catch it. The worm would get so close to the ball and then the little boy would pick him up and give him a squeeze.
At the end of the day the little boy said goodbye to the worm. He waved as he walked away and the worm waved back with his two little arms. The humble worm said goodbye to his friend, happy to have had such a wonderful day.




Randy was a little boy. He was only three years old. He played with his toys all day long.
One day he found a gun in his backyard. He thought it was cool and started to play with it. His mom saw him from the window and got very scared. She called the police.
The police came quickly. They saw what Randy was doing and told him it was not safe. They took the gun away and put it in a sack.
Randy was very sad. He tried to explain to the police that he was only playing but they did not listen. They said it was foolish of him to play with a gun.
Randy was sad but he understood why the police took the gun away. He learned a valuable lesson that day - not to play with guns. He made a promise to himself never to be so foolish again.




Once there was a little girl. She was only 3 years old. All she wanted was to have fun. One day, she saw a warm butterfly. She didn't know what it was. She was so curious, so she followed it. The butterfly flew around in circles until it landed on a flower. The little girl was full of joy! She ran up to the butterfly and said hello. The butterfly was friendly too. The girl knew she had found a new friend. She was so happy and said goodbye with big hug. The butterfly flew away and the girl watched it until it was out of sight. The girl was sad to see it go, but she knew she would never forget that warm butterfly.




Max was a young boy and he wanted to go on an adventure. He asked his mom if he could go outside and explore. And so, his mom said yes. Max was very excited and ran outside. 
He ran across the lawn to a big tree. He looked up and thought it was the tallest thing he had ever seen.
Max wanted to go to the top so he started to climb. But it was very hard and he was scared because he was so young. Just then, he saw a ladder and he knew just what to do. He ran over and climbed up the ladder and soon he was at the top. 
Max was so proud of himself. He looked around and it was a beautiful sight. He saw a castle in the distance and he pointed to it. He wanted to go there and explore. He asked his mom if he could and she said yes. 
Max was excited and off he went. The castle was so much fun and he explored it all day. He was so young and it was a great adventure. He will never forget it.




Bella was a three year old who loved to bathe. Every night, she would splash around and make bubbles. One night, however, Bella tried something new. She put a lemon in her bath water. It smelled really nice. She thought it was very impressive! It was so much fun that she continued to do it every night.
When her mom came to check on her, she couldn't help but be amazed. Bella had created such a wonderful bath for herself. She asked Bella why she had chosen a lemon and Bella said, "It makes the water smell so nice." Her mom was so proud of her and impressed with her creativity.
From then on, Bella always asked her mom to add a lemon in her bath water. She loved taking luxurious baths with the citrus scent. Bellas' baths had become quite impressive.




Once upon a time, there was an ancient kitchen. Everything in the kitchen was old and still worked. One day, when the cook was making lunch, he sneezed. His sneeze started a chain reaction. The ancient oven began to shake and something started to move. The cook was very surprised! The cupboard opened up and something hidden for a long time was revealed. It was a treasure chest full of coins! The cook was so happy that he shouted out loud. He was going to be rich!
The cook was in such a good mood that he started to dance in the kitchen. He sneezed again and the ancient oven shook even harder. Suddenly, out of nowhere, a genie appeared in the kitchen! He said that the cook was granted three wishes!
The cook thought of what he wanted and wished for two more kitchens, one modern and one ancient. He also wished for an endless supply of coins. The genie granted his wish and disappeared in a puff of smoke. 
The cook was very happy. He looked around and saw a beautiful modern kitchen and an ancient kitchen. He also saw a treasure chest full of coins! He was so thankful for his three wishes!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She was three years old and very brave. One day, she went to the beach with her family. The beach was quiet and the waves were gentle.
Amy wanted to try surfing. She was excited but a little scared. Her family showed Amy how to do it. She stood on the surfboard and tried to stay on it. She kept falling off but she didn't give up.
Finally, Amy was able to ride the surf for a few seconds! She was so proud of herself. But then the waves got bigger and she had to resist them. After a while, the waves became too strong and Amy had to give up trying. Even so, the feeling of riding the surf was amazing.
At the end of the day, Amy was happy and exhausted. She had learned a lot and could not wait to go surfing again.




Once upon a time, there was a nice woman who had a big smile. She was very busy doing all sorts of things during the day. When it was time for her to rest, she would sit down, close her eyes and take a deep breath. She would then open her mouth wide and let out a big yawn.
The yawn was very loud, and it filled the room. The woman felt so calm and relaxed. She would stay in that peaceful moment for a long minute. Then, she opened her eyes and saw something very original. At the other end of the room, she could see a small tree with many different kinds of flowers. 
The woman smiled at this beautiful sight. She was once again ready to do the things she had to do. But, she always remembered that peaceful minute filled with her big yawn.



Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to crawl. She would crawl around all day, exploring new places. But one day, she found something very special. She found a radish! It was a bright red colour and looked very crunchy. She grabbed the radish and instantly her hands got stuck! It was too tough for her to pull off.
The little girl was sad but then remembered she had a brilliant idea. She called out to her mom and asked if she had a knife. Mom quickly gave her a little knife and the girl carefully cut the radish off. It worked! She then happily ate the radish, crunching as she chewed it.
The little girl continued to crawl around and found more radishes. She would find them, cut them off with her knife and eat them each and every day. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a kind boy. He loved to imagine funny things. One day, he imagined that he was a giant peanut! He laughed and laughed, but then he started to get hungry.
He decided to go get some real peanuts from the kitchen. When he got there, he ran over to the pantry and opened the door. He saw a big jar filled with peanuts! He was so excited, he started to dance around the kitchen.
When he was done dancing, he grabbed a handful of peanuts and ran back to his room. He sat on the floor and started to eat his peanuts. With each crunchy bite, he imagined he was back in the kitchen dancing again. One by one, he ate the peanuts until they were all gone.
He had so much fun imagining and eating the peanuts, he knew he wanted to do it again soon. He smiled and thought that peanuts were very kind to let him imagine and have fun with them.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very excited. Her name was Millie and she lived near a playground. 
One day, she asked her mom if she could go to the playground. She wanted to go and play with her friends. Her mom said yes and Millie was so happy! 
When she got to the playground, she saw that there was a big loop. Millie and her friends wanted to ride it. Millie's mom told her that she could try it. Millie was so excited! 
Millie jumped onto the loop, and her mom sent her around the loop. Millie was laughing and smiling as she went around. She felt like she was flying. 
Millie and her friends played on the loop all day and when they were done, Millie was so tired that she fell asleep on the grass. Millie's mom smiled and sent her home with a hug. 
The end.




Once there was a little boy who was very poor. One day, he had to take a taxi to get somewhere. He was so poor he couldn't afford a taxi, and he started to cry.
Just then, a kind and generous woman came up to the boy. She pinched his nose lightly and said, "Don't worry little one. I'll pay for the taxi for you".
The boy smiled, and thanked the woman as she hailed the taxi. He got inside, and waved goodbye to the woman as the taxi drove off. He was very grateful for the woman's kindness and generosity.
The boy arrived at his destination, safe and sound. He knew he'd never forget the kind woman who had pinched his nose.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Alice. Alice was walking along the beach one day when suddenly she spotted a crab. The crab had a big frown on its face. Alice wanted to help and so she reached out her hand to pat the crab. But before she could, the crab scuttled away. 
Alice was sad that she couldn't help the crab. Later, she saw some friendly seagulls flying in the sky. She waved to the seagulls and followed them over the dunes.
At the top of the dune, Alice found the crab again! It was looking around, but this time it didn't seem scared. Alice knew it was looking for help and so she said hello and carefully placed one finger on its shell. The crab looked at Alice with a big smile!
Alice was so excited she started clapping her hands. The crab had been so helpful. She was happy this time she could help. The crab scuttled away again and waved goodbye.
 
Alice felt really proud of herself. She had found a way to help a crab in need. She would never forget the crab and its helpful smile.




One day there was a little girl. She was very smart. She had a hand that she was very proud of. She was always careful and didn't want to slip with it.
One day she was playing with her friends. She wanted to show them how smart she was. She ran around and jumped. She held onto her hand tightly and tried not to slip.
But, she slipped and fell on the floor. She was so sad, but her friends came to help her. They helped her stand up and then hugged her.
She learned that it was ok to slip and make mistakes. As long as she had her friends and her smart hand, things would be alright.




Once there was a little boy. His hair was very long, and it was the color of brown leaves.
One day he was playing in the garden, when he heard a sound. It was very loud and he was scared. He hid in some bushes.
Peeking out, he saw a bear! The bear was big and black. The little boy was so scared he started to cry. But the bear didn't hurt him.
The bear said, "Don't be scared. You are okay. I just wanted to hear you laugh." The boy stopped crying.
He was ashamed he was scared. The little boy asked the bear why he wanted to hear him laugh. The bear said, "Those beautiful long hairs, they make me think of my little cub. When I saw them, I wanted to hear your laugh just like my cub." 
The little boy smiled. He was glad he wasn't scared any longer. They made a friend and laughed together all afternoon.



Once upon a time there was a village far away. It was a terrible place. The people who lived there had nothing to eat and were very sad. 
One day, a kind man came to the village. He said he wanted to help the people in the village. He offered them food, toys and clothes.
At first, the people were scared. They did not want to accept the kind man's help. But then one by one, they realized that he was nice and accepted his offer. 
The kind man kept coming back to the village every day. He did this for months and months. And slowly the terrible village transformed. It became a happy place, filled with smiles and laughter.
The kind man had brought so much joy and love to the village. The people were so thankful and grateful for his help. 
From then on, the people of the village accepted help from anyone who offered it. They knew that accepting kindness was the best way to live a happy life.




There were two friends, Jane and Sam. They liked to share things together. One day, they decided to make a sound. Jane thought it would be a difficult one. Sam thought it would be an easy one. They both tried to make the same sound.
At first, it was difficult for both of them, but they kept trying. They kept making the sound until they both got it right. Jane and Sam were so happy that they shared it with everyone. Everyone cheered when they heard the sound. 
Jane and Sam both smiled. They had done it! They had shared something together. Sharing was so much fun!




Jack wanted to succeed. He wanted to do something special. He wanted to draw a picture. 
He got some paper and some pencils. He also got some paints and a brush. He started to draw. 
Jack drew a tree with apples. He painted it brown and green. He was so happy with his work. 
When he was done, he showed his mom. She said it was delicious! She put it on the wall. Now everyone in the family can see it. 
Jack was very proud of his picture. He had succeeded!




Once there was a tough little girl called Sue. She was always ready for an adventure. One day, Sue wanted to go explore the forest.
"I'm going to send my pet rabbit to explore the forest!" she said.
So Sue took her rabbit and they set off.
As they walked, they found a lonely and secret tea party. Tea was everywhere! The rabbit wanted to try it, so Sue sent him to explore.
The rabbit sniffed the tea, tasted it and hopped away. Sue was so excited to try it too. She took a sip and found that it tasted really yummy!
They stayed for a little while and then Sue sent her rabbit back home with a piece of cake for them both to enjoy. It was a tough adventure but Sue and her rabbit had lots of fun!



There was a boy named Charlie. He was 3 years old and loved to play. He had a special game he liked to play every day. It was called Jump-Hand. 
Charlie would put his hands together and say, "Jump-Hand!" Then he would jump as fast as he could. He loved the feeling of jumping so quickly. 
He would jump up and down, sometimes he would even jump sideways. The faster he jumped, the more fun it was. 
One day he jumped so fast, he almost flew. Charlie thought he was a bird, flying around the room. Charlie just kept jumping, higher and higher, until eventually he stopped and laughed.
He had had so much fun playing Jump-Hand. Every day he looked forward to playing it, and enjoying the feeling of jumping so fast.




Once there was a fast bunny who wanted to see the world. He was very brave and had a curious opinion about everything. So, one day he decided to take off on an adventure.
First, he hopped up a tall mountain. Then he looked around the world from the top. He saw some tall trees, a wide river and lots of fluffy clouds. But the best part of it all were the fluffy purple flowers he found!
He hopped around until he found a big pond. He hopped into it and paddled with all his might. He had a great time exploring the pond.
When he was done, he decided to remove something that he found in the pond. It was an old boat full of treasure. He was so excited to show it to his friends!
So with a big smile, he hopped back home with the boat of treasure. All his friends were very impressed with his adventure and the opinion of fast bunny was forever changed in their eyes.



John loaded his truck with zero bananas. He was fearful he wouldn't be able to sell them all. He drove to the market and began to yell, Bananas for sale!
Suddenly he heard a voice behind him. It was Jenny, a three year old girl.
Jenny said, I want five bananas! John smiled and gave her five bananas. Jenny was so happy and grateful. She thanked John and ran to find her mommy.
John was surprised. He had sold five bananas! He was not so fearful anymore. He continued to yell and soon more people bought his bananas. 
By the end of the day, John had sold all of his bananas and was feeling very proud. He had loaded the truck with zero and now it was full!



John and Sara wanted to get married. They both loved to swim in the quiet river near their home. On their wedding day, everyone was excited. John and Sara put on their swimsuits and swam out to the middle of the river. 
When they reached the middle, they hugged and said special words to each other. They kissed to make their marriage official.
When they got back to the shore, John and Sara threw a big party to celebrate. Everyone was happy and had a great time. 
John and Sara still love to go swimming in the quiet lake, just like they did on their wedding day. They still kiss in the middle of the lake, now to celebrate their marriage.




Once there was a small mouse. He lived in a house with his family. He was very excited one day to see that his family was getting ready to go on an adventure.
They piled into the car and drove to the park. The mouse was so happy to see the trees and the birds chirping. He wanted to explore and had so much fun!
Then it started to rain. Everyone had to hurry to find shelter. The mouse found a small space between two big trees that had a cord in it. He ran over and got under it.
The cord was old and dirty. The mouse was so cold and wet but it was better than getting even wetter. The rain stopped and everyone got back in the car and left.
The mouse stayed and partied. He had a wonderful time playing and exploring. When he was ready, he bid farewell to the cord and went home with his family. He was happy and tired from a great day in the park.




Cody wanted to be ready for school.  He put on his shirt and pants.  He was very excited for his first day.  He grabbed his lunchbox and said goodbye to his mom.
On his way to the school, Cody passed lots of trees.  The leaves were falling from the trees.  Cody watched the leaves fall and laughed.
 
When he arrived at the school, Cody met his teacher.  He said hello and showed her his lunchbox.  Cody's teacher said that he looks ready to be a pupil.  She showed Cody where to go.
Cody saw many other pupils.  They were excited to meet him.  He smiled and said hello.  They all had fun together playing games.
At the end of the day, his teacher said goodbye.  Cody was very tired, but he was happy he had met his new friends.  He waved goodbye to his teacher and the other pupils, and walked home carrying a big smile.



Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Suzy. She loved to go on safaris. One day, Suzy hopped on her bike and began pedaling fast. She wanted to go on the best safari she could find.
On her way, Suzy stopped by a soft meadow full of colorful flowers. When she stepped out of her bike, a tiny baby rabbit hopped over to greet her. Suzy smiled and held out a carrot for the little bunny.
An hour later, Suzy and her new friend continued on their safari. Suddenly, there was a loud noise in the sky. Suzy looked up and saw a huge, colorful rainbow! The soft colors were so beautiful that Suzy felt her heart fill with joy. 
The rainbow seemed to be changing all the time. Suzy and the baby rabbit stayed and watched until the sun went down. When they finally went back home, Suzy had remembered a wonderful safari full of adventure and change.




Once upon a time, there was a busy bee called Bizzy. She loved to play with her yarn and make colorful things.
One day, Bizzy was so busy that she forgot to take a break. She worked and worked until she finally quit playing with the yarn.
The next day, Bizzy decided to take a break and play with her yarn again. She had so much fun making things with it and came up with some very cool shapes and creatures.
Bizzy and the yarn became the best of friends. She went to it every day and made something new and special.
The moral of the story is to never quit something if you enjoy it and always take a break when you are feeling busy.



 
Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Bob and Brian. They loved playing together and having fun. 
One day, Bob and Brian were walking together, when they saw a yummy prize. It was an ice cream! They both wanted it so badly, so Bob had an idea. He said to Brian, "Let's borrow it and share it!" 
Brian was very excited, so they borrowed the ice cream. They walked together and licked their yummy prize while they chatted away. They laughed and had so much fun. 
When they finished their treat, they smiled and thanked each other. Then they said goodbye and went on their way. Bob and Brian would always remember the fun time they had sharing their yummy prize.




Once upon a time, there was a boy named John. He was a very cheerful boy who loved celery. Every day, he would go to the fridge and get a big bunch of celery.
One day, John was eating his celery and he started to think. He wondered what it would be like to live in a place where everybody ate celery all the time. He thought it would be a lot of fun.
So, John decided to visit a magical land where everybody ate celery. He hopped on a bus, and soon he arrived at his destination. Everywhere he looked, he saw people eating celery! Everyone was happy and cheerful.
John smiled and realized that he had made the right decision. He enjoyed himself and ate a lot of celery. Then, he hopped back on the bus and went home. From that day forward, he was sure to always keep celery in the fridge.



Once upon a time there lived a boy called Ben. Ben had a skin that was very special. Even though it was extremely stupid, it had the power to turn into anything he could imagine.
One day Ben decided to use his special skin and turn it into a car. He jumped up and down when he saw how fast it went. With a huge smile on his face he drove around the garden.
It wasn't long before the skin grew tired of being a car. It wanted to be something else. It whispered in Ben's ear that it wanted to turn into an Elephant. Ben smiled and nodded his head.
In an instant, the skin changed into an Elephant. Its trunk was huge, its ears were flapping and it was tripping over it's elephant feet! Ben laughed and laughed until he was almost crying.
When Ben finally said goodbye to his Elephant skin it waved it's trunk softly and turned into it's original form. Ben hugged his special skin because he was so thankful for all the cool adventures he went on. He knew that no matter how stupid it looked it was the most amazing thing in the world.




Once upon a time there was a rock. It was light, so it didn't weigh very much. But one day, the rock met a disgusting frog. The frog said to the rock, "I'm so heavy! Can you weigh me?" The rock was scared, but it agreed.
The rock and the frog went to find a scale. When the frog stood on the scale, it said the frog weighed five pounds. The rock was so surprised that the frog weighed so much! The rock thought it weighed nothing compared to the frog.
The rock and the frog were so happy. They celebrated with a dance and a song. The rock felt so much better about itself. It knew it was very light and that was ok!




Once upon a time, there was an incredible boy. He had a very special opinion of the world.
Every day, he went outside to explore with his mom and dad. He saw big trees, little animals, and bright flowers. He shared his opinion with everyone he saw.
One day, the boy and his family went to the beach. He ran in the waves and felt the sand beneath his feet. He couldn't believe how incredible it was.
At the end of the day, the boy was tired but happy. His opinion was that the day had been the best! He had seen and learned so much. 
It was time to go home, but the boy was filled with excitement. He was ready for tomorrow, when he would explore and share his opinion again!




Once there was a little girl who was 3 years old. She loved to make noise! One day, she was running around the living room and she jumped on her mom's couch. Her mom made a loud noise and said "No!" But the little girl kept jumping.
So, her mom went over to her and gave her a big slap! The little girl was so surprised she stopped jumping. She knew she was not supposed to do that anymore. She sat quietly on the noisy couch and felt sad.
But soon, her mom came over and gave her a hug. She smiled and said, "It's ok. Don't be scared." The little girl was so happy to be hugged that she forgot all about the slap. She ran off to play happily again.



Dave was so excited. He had been looking forward to today for days. Today it was finally his birthday! He knew that something special was going to happen, but he couldn't guess what it was.
He started to get ready, brushing his teeth and picking out his clothes. On his way out the door he even remembered to bring a napkin so he could wipe any chocolate of his face!
When Dave arrived at the birthday party, he couldn't believe his eyes--the entire room was filled with his favourite chocolate! He couldn't wait to eat it all!
But suddenly his mom arrived with something even more special: a loyal puppy. This was the best birthday present ever! Dave hugged the puppy and then dove into the chocolate--his two favourite things in the world!
Dave had the best birthday ever thanks to his loyal puppy and all the delicious chocolate.



Once there was a little girl who was very happy. She had seven sheep, which she loved very much. She would hug them every day and tell them stories.
One day the girl saw a strange thing. It looked like a sheep but it was much bigger and it wasn't real. It was a fake sheep. She was very surprised.
She didn't like it at all. She frowned and said 'Go away!' But the fake sheep wouldn't move.
So the girl did the only thing she could do. She got her seven real sheep together and shouted 'Go away sheep!'.
The fake sheep ran away and never came back. The little girl was happy again and hugged her seven sheep. They were her real friends and she smiled at them.




Once upon a time, there was a fake oak tree. It was so tall, it reached up to the clouds. One day, there was a huge heatwave and the sun shone down so brightly, it made the oak tree so hot. Soon, the fake tree started to melt! All of its leaves dropped down to the ground and the trunk started to squash. Everyone who saw it was so sad and wished they could help. Luckily, the fire brigade was nearby and they sprayed water on the tree. The tree was soon saved, and it was back to its original shape again. Everyone was so happy and grateful to the fire brigade.



 
Once upon a time, there lived an impressive little girl. She was only three-years-old, but she was very brave and clever. Every day she would explore the world around her. 
One day, she came across something extra special. It was a big iron box with lots of exciting goodies inside. Much to her surprise, the box included sweets, toys, and books. She was so fascinated by everything inside the box.
The little girl opened the box and took out each item. She was so excited to learn about each new thing, and found it all very impressive. She played for hours, learning about each new discovery. 
At the end of the day she put everything back in the box, and tucked it away carefully. Every day she kept returning to explore the box and she kept learning new and exciting things. It was an adventure like no other!




Once upon a time, there was a lovely orange cherry. It was so big and juicy! A little girl named Jane wanted to go and pick the cherry so she lay down in the grass. She reached out with her tiny hand and picked the orange cherry.
Jane smiled and took a big bite of the yummy cherry. Juice ran down her chin. Then she layed the cherry back down on the grass.
Out of nowhere, a little bird came by and saw the cherry. He was so excited! He flew over and picked up the cherry in his little beak and flew away!
Jane was sad that her cherry was no longer there, but she knew the little bird must have been really happy with his orange cherry.




Once upon a time there was a pot. It was very special, but very expensive. One day, the pot was sitting in a room when suddenly, it started to sneeze. The pot sneezed and sneezed until everyone in the room was all tickled. Everyone was so surprised because never before had a pot sneezed before!
No one knew what to do. So, one brave person decided to see why the pot was sneezing. The person opened the lid of the pot and out flew a small mouse with a big, red nose. The mouse had jumped inside the pot and sneezed, which is why the pot was sneezing!
Now that the mystery was solved, everyone laughed and had a good time. The small mouse soon found its way out of the room and the pot was no longer sneezing. The pot was thankfully very special, but also very expensive.




Once upon a time, there was a tall bear. He was wearing a red vest. He had a very special mission - he wanted to dare to go on an adventure.
He looked around and saw lots of trees. He climbed up and down the trees, discovered new things and even found some delicious fruit.
Suddenly he heard a funny noise - it was a loud buzz! He looked up and saw a bee buzzing around. The brave bear dared to reach out and touch the bee, which made the bee fly away.
The adventure was exciting and the bear was thankful he had dared to explore. He waved goodbye to the trees and went home in the evening. He was proud that he had been brave and dared to go on an adventure.




Once upon a time, there was an ugly crack. Nobody could find it, no matter how hard they searched.
One day, a brave little boy went looking for the crack. He searched and searched until finally he found it! 
The little boy smiled and said to the crack, "Hi! I found you! What do you want to do?"
The crack was so happy that someone had found it! It said, "Let's go on an adventure!"
So the crack and the little boy went on an adventure together. They visited the park, ate ice cream, and jumped in the puddles.
The little boy and the crack had the best time! And from that day onwards, they were the best of friends.




Once there was a girl named Lola. She was 3 years old and wanted to reach the sauce on the top shelf. She reached on her tippy toes but the jar was still too high.
Lola's mom saw that she was upset so she hugged her. She lifted Lola up so she could reach the jar and handed it to her.
Lola smiled and took the jar of sauce. She opened it up and put some on her dinner. The dinner tasted so yummy that Lola clapped her hands with joy.
Reaching the sauce had made Lola very happy and she ate the rest of her dinner with a big smile on her face.




Once there was a little girl who wanted to send a present to her grandmother. She found a stick of butter and put it in an icy box. She then had her mommy and daddy help her send the box to her grandmother.
On the way, the box became very cold. When the box arrived at her grandmother's house it was so icy that the butter was very hard. The little girl's grandmother was so happy to get the present.
The grandmother put the butter onto a dish and it started to melt. As it melted, the butter became soft and the grandmother spread it on fresh bread. She shared it with the little girl and it tasted so delicious! They shared the butter and had a wonderful afternoon together.




Once upon a time, there was a rich man who lived in a big house. Every day, he took his axe outside and chopped wood for his fire. He was working hard one day when something strange happened. Suddenly, the axe flew out of his hand, spun around in the air, and then reversed direction and flew back into his hand! 
The man was very surprised, but he picked up the axe again and continued chopping. Then, it happened again! This time, the axe spun so fast that it turned into a blur. The man was amazed and called out for help.
A magical fairy appeared, and she said, I will help you. Put your axe on the ground and stand back. So, the man did as he was told. The fairy waved her wand and said a magic spell. Then, the axe reversed direction one more time and flew across the field. It landed safely in a tree. 
The man was very thankful, and he thanked the fairy for her help. The fairy said, You are a very lucky man to be so rich. I hope this experience has taught you the power of reverse!"




Once upon a time there was a little boy called Jack. He liked to jog in the park every morning. One day he was jogging around the edge of the park when he saw a big triangle. It was rough and it looked like it was made of wood. 
The little boy decided to take a closer look. He walked up to it and saw that it was made of wooden sticks that were stuck together in a triangle shape. He wanted to touch it, so he reached out his hand. 
Suddenly, the triangle started to move! Jack jumped back in surprise. He realised that it was a triangle-shaped animal! It was a turtle! 
The turtle was shy, so he started to jog away. Jack said goodbye, then he watched the turtle jog away into the distance.



Once upon a time, there was a dark and gloomy forest. Inside, was a secret. No one had ever seen what lay beyond the trees. 
One sunny day, the secret was ready to be revealed. A little boy, who was only three years old, went on a special adventure with nothing but courage in his heart. He stepped through the trees and his eyes widened with surprise. 
The forest inside was full of beautiful colorful flowers. The pupil of the little boy widened too, as he took in the display of beauty. He wandered through the forest, smelling the fragrant flowers, enjoying the beauty.
Once the boy had explored the full woods, it was time for him to go. Before leaving, he made a promise to himself to come back again soon with friends and family. He smiled, feeling content with his day. 
The little boy had discovered the secret of the dark and gloomy forest and reveled in the beautiful surprises it held.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Abigail. She was running around in the park, looking for something fun to do. She suddenly saw a big steel ball. It looked like it would be lots of fun to play with, so she went over to kick it.
She reached out to kick the steel ball, but it was dirty. She saw some dirt and grass stuck to the ball. She tried to kick the ball, but it wouldn't move.
Abigail didn't want to stop playing, so she got down on her hands and knees and started to brush off the dirt. After a few minutes, she had made the steel ball nice and clean.
At last, she was ready to play! Abigail stood up and held her breath. Then she kicked the steel ball as hard as she could. The ball flew across the park and she ran after it, almost tripping over her own feet in her excitement. 
Abigail chased the ball around for hours, feeling like a very lucky girl. She learned that playing with steel can be lots of fun, as long as it stays nice and clean. 

The End.




Once upon a time there was a proud little girl called Gina. Gina wanted to explore, so she set off on a journey.
Gina started walking, and soon she noticed a big vine. She wanted to climb the vine, so she stretched out her arms as high as she could to reach for it.
Gina grabbed ahold of the vine, and soon she was swinging back and forth like a monkey! Every time she swung, she let out a big CHEER!
But then, Gina heard a loud sound. She looked up and saw a door had shut! Gina was scared, she didn't know what to do.
But then, Gina heard a kind voice. It was her mom, who had seen Gina swinging on the vine and had come to help her.
Gina smiled and looked up proudly at her mom. She knew having a mom was a lucky thing!



Once upon a time, there was a chubby girl named Sally. She lived on a beautiful island and loved to explore the big world around her.
One morning, Sally found a magical steam train in the forest. She was so excited she couldn't help but hop in and take a ride!
The train chugged through the countryside, passing over bridges, through tunnels, and crossing rivers. Finally, it came to a stop. In front of the train was a little dragon.
The dragon smiled and asked Sally a question: "Where do you want to go?"
Sally thought and thought, but she couldn't decide. So, she just said "Wherever the steam takes me!"
The dragon smiled again and the train started up again. Sally waved goodbye and finally took off, the beautiful steam trailing behind her.




Once there was a tall man. He loved to eat salad. Every day he would make a big salad and eat it. One day while he was making the salad, he slipped and fell. He looked really sad! 
But then a magical thing happened. His friends came out and helped him. They helped him finish the salad. He thanked them and they all laughed. 
Then they shared the salad. It was so delicious! When they were all done, the tall man hugged his friends. He was very happy to have them there. 
They all said goodbye and ended the day with happy smiles.



Sam and his mommy went to the restaurant. It was a brilliant restaurant. Sam was so happy! He looked around, the restaurant had lots of decorations and people eating delicious food.
Sam sat down and had his meal. He finished all of his food and said "Yum!" He was so full! He was also tired, so he asked his mommy if he could have a nap.
His mommy said it was ok, and they both left the restaurant. Sam put on his special blanket and had a long rest. He felt so much better after he finished his nap. 
On the way home, Sam told his mommy how much he had enjoyed his day at the restaurant. It had been brilliant!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had an amazing idea about how she could have some fun. She wanted to repeat things over and over again.
The little girl clapped her hands and then jumped up and down. She repeated this several times and it made her laugh. She decided to try something else, so she put on a funny hat and danced around the room. She repeated this over and over again too. It was always so much fun!
Later, she thought of another amazing idea. She grabbed some toys and put them in a circle. She repeated this over and over again and eventually, the toys made a big circle around the room. She thought it was great and couldn't wait to show it to her friends.
The little girl kept repeating ideas. Each one was even more amazing than the last. And soon, she was having so much fun that her mom and dad had to join in the fun too!




Once upon a time, there were two best friends. Jack and Jill were very polite to each other. They were always laughing and playing together.
One day, Jack and Jill noticed a table outside with a special game on it. It was a game called chess. They had never seen it before, so they looked at the pieces carefully.
The game looked fun. So, Jill asked Jack to learn how to play the game with her.
Jack said yes, and he quickly signed up for tutorial lessons. Jack and Jill practiced each day and soon they knew how all the pieces moved.
After a few weeks, Jack and Jill were very good at playing chess. They were very polite while they played, always saying 'good move' or 'well done'.
They would play the game together all the time. They had so much fun!




Bobby was a proud little boy. He loved to play outdoors and explore the world around him. He would often find something new and exciting to do every day. One day, Bobby decided to catch a computer. So, he ran around the house looking for one. He finally found a computer in his mother's office.
He was so proud and excited as he carefully picked it up. He ran around the house, giggling and carrying it in his arms. He showed it to everyone and told them he had caught a computer. His family was amazed and proud of Bobby for such a feat.
For the rest of the day, Bobby decided to put the computer to good use and learn some new things. He watched videos, played some cute games, and read stories. He was so proud of himself for catching a computer.




Once upon a time there was a nice tree. It stood tall and strong in the sunshine.
One day, while the tree was standing there, a little girl who was three years old came walking by. She stopped and looked at the tree with wonder. It was so big and had so many branches!
The little girl wanted to climb the tree, but it seemed too high. Then she had an idea. She ran and got a wooden stool and put it right beside the tree. Then she climbed on and stretched out her hand to the tree's branches. She started climbing, and soon she was up high in the tree!
It was so fun to be up high. The little girl looked down and saw the world looking so small. She looked up and saw the birds flying high in the sky. She felt so free!
The little girl spent a long time up in the nice tree. It was a wonderful afternoon. When she finally got down, she said goodbye to the tree and went off with a happy heart.




Jimmy was running fast. His Mom had said go, go, go and Jimmy wanted to get there quickly. He had never moved so quickly before! His arms and legs were pumping and his feet felt like they were flying.
He could see the park, and could almost taste the sugar that his Mom had promised him. Jimmy ran past the trees and skipped over the rocks, expecting the park to get bigger and bigger the closer he got. He had an incredible feeling as he ran.
By the time he arrived, Jimmy was breathing hard and smiling wide. The sugar was waiting and Jimmy could hardly contain his excitement. He grabbed a handful, filled his mouth with the sweetness and laughed.
Jimmy had never before felt so incredible as he did with the sugar in his mouth and the feeling of moving at such speed!



Once upon a time, there was a brave knight who was very strong and had a big shield. He was always protecting the kingdom.
One day, he was attacked by a mean dragon who wanted to hurt the knight. It sent big fireballs at him and the knight was getting very hot.
The knight was very brave and ran as fast as he could to a pond. He washed himself with the cool water and the fireballs no longer hurt him.
Thanks to the shield, the knight was able to stop the dragon and the kingdom was safe. 
The knight lived happily ever after and used his shield to protect the kingdom.



Jimmy loved to laugh. Especially when he was out playing with his friends. Today, he was having fun running in the park. The grass was so green and it tickled his feet.
Soon, he stopped running and noticed a bird's nest in the palm tree nearby. It was made of twigs and feathers and it was pretty. Jimmy smiled and laughed softly.
A cold breeze blew by and Jimmy shivered. He hugged himself and felt the icy air on his face. Suddenly, he had an idea. He ran back to where his friends were, and got them to come with him to the palm tree.
When they all stood beneath the palm tree, Jimmy laughed again. The icy wind whipped through their hair and they all laughed until they could hardly stand. That chilly day they had so much fun playing together. Laughter filled the park!



The peanut was the only one in the room. Everyone else was empty handed. The peanut was angry and confused. He looked around and saw no one else. Suddenly, the peanut heard a loud voice order him to move.
The peanut was scared, but he moved as the voice commanded. He slid across the floor until he saw an ignorant looking person. The person seemed to be looking right at him and shouted, Stay there, peanut! 
The peanut did as he was told, and stayed in place. He felt silly and embarrassed standing out in the middle of the room alone. But then, something wonderful happened. The ignorant person reached down, picked up the peanut, and placed him in a warm, cozy jar.
The peanut was filled with joy. For the first time ever, he was safe. He was at home.



Once upon a time there was a great operations. Everyone wanted to win the competition. Two friends decided to try their luck and hold the operation. They had their plans all set up and were determined to win the competition. 
They worked hard and held the operation for days. Everyone cheered for them as the two held on to the operation. Finally after days of hard work, the two friends achieved success! 
They were declared winners for their competitive efforts! Everyone was so happy for them and showered them with praise. The two friends proudly held their prize and felt ecstatic. 
Everyone congratulated them for their winning attempt and the two friends went off celebrating their victory. They held their prize high and celebrated their win.




Once there was a boy called Jack. He loved to play and do fun things. One day, Jack was playing with a black box. Inside the box was a special kind of magic. When he opened the box, he could see all kinds of lights and colours. Jack was very excited to find out what the magic did.
He decided to press a button on the box. Suddenly a bright light started to shine and music began to play. It was amazing. Jack smiled and started to dance. He loved the music and kept moving.
The magic was recording everything Jack was doing. Soon he saw the lights around the box were changing colours. They were magenta and yellow and blue. Jack couldn't believe what he was seeing.
When he looked inside the box again, he saw that the music was being recorded. He was amazed! From then on, Jack would play with the black box every day and record all the magical things he did.




Once upon a time, there was a big ship. This ship was very important. It had to supply all sorts of things to different places. It had to take lots of boxes of things from one place to the other.
One day, the ship got a new captain. He was very brave and he knew lots about ships. He told the ship that it was very important and that it had to supply things to lots of different places.
So the ship started its journey. It went from one place to the other, supplying things like food, clothes and toys. Everyone was happy when the ship arrived with the supplies.
That's why the ship was so very important. It supplied happy things to make people smile.
The end.



Once upon a time, there was a large onion. The onion was so big that it felt like it would never stop growing. One day, something special started to happen. The onion started to get smaller and smaller. The more it shrank, the more the onion smiled and laughed. Soon the onion was so small, it could fit into a tiny teacup. Everyone who saw it was amazed. The onion was so happy that it finally had a chance to join in with their tea parties. And so, the onion made many new friends and it was always the life of the party.



Once upon a time there was a loyal little girl. She lived with her mom and dad. The little girl always wanted to play with her friends, but sometimes they would fight.
One day, the little girl found a piece of thread. She thought of a great idea and ran to her friends. With the thread, the little girl showed them how to make a game. She said they should make two sides, then they could have a fun fight!
The friends followed the little girl's idea. They had a great time. Each one was loyal to their team and fought as hard as they could. In the end, everybody was happy and the game ended with lots of cheers and smiles. 
The little girl was very proud of her friends and her idea. From that day forward, whenever her friends and her had to fight, they all remembered to play the thread game.



Granny was writing in a big book. She had a picture of a soldier on the page and she was writing with a cold pencil. She said, "The soldier is very brave!" 
Then Granny wrote something else in the book. She wrote, "He is a brave soldier". 
After Granny finished writing, she said, "The soldier is very strong and he is good at fighting." 
Suddenly the door opened and Granny's grandson, Tim, came in. He said, "Granny, what are you writing about?" 
Granny said, "I'm writing about a brave soldier. He is strong and he fights for his country." Tim asked, "Do soldiers get cold?" Granny smiled and said, "Yes, sometimes they can get cold." 
Tim nodded as if he understood and he said, "I want to be a brave soldier when I get bigger!" Granny smiled and said, "That would be wonderful!"




Once upon a time, there was an old cave at the edge of town that was very charming. A three year old girl named Emma used to explore the cave with her friends. One day, while they were playing inside it, they heard a strange noise.
The noise sounded like someone was calling out to them. It was coming from the dark depths of the cave. Emma wanted to see what it was, so she asked her friends to stay nearby while she went to investigate.
When she reached the source of the sound, she saw a small creature with big eyes. Emma was scared at first, but the creature told her not to be afraid. It said its name was Tom and it was stuck in the cave since it lost its way.
Tom asked Emma to help it. Emma was not sure what to do, but when she saw how sad Tom was, her heart filled with kindness. She ran back to her friends and told them what had happened.
They all agreed it would be best to bring Tom out of the cave. Together, they made a plan and, with a little help from Emma, Tom was freed from the cave. Tom thanked them for their help and, with a wave goodbye, it disappeared into the night.




Once upon a time there was a girl called Lucy. She had a vase which was very special to her. It was very cute and had beautiful flowers on it.
Every morning Lucy would take her vase and place it in the window. Then she would nod her head and say good morning.
One day, as Lucy was walking home with her vase, she saw a very big puppy. It was so cute that she couldnt help but smile. The puppy came over to her, and Lucy smiled and nodded her head.
The puppy was so happy that it started to jump up and down. It was jumping so high that it bumped the vase out of Lucys hands. Lucy was so scared that she started to cry.
But then the puppy stopped jumping and came over to Lucy. It licked her hand and she stopped crying. Lucy smiled at the puppy and nodded her head to say thank you.
The puppy leapt away and Lucy held her vase close to her chest. She smiled and said thank you again, before going home with her special vase.




Once upon a time, there was a grumpy stick. It didn't want to play with any of the other sticks. Every time they asked it to play, it replied with a sad "No".
One day, a little girl walked by and noticed the grumpy stick. She asked it why it wouldn't play with the others. The stick replied sadly, "They don't want to play with me".
The little girl smiled, picked up the stick and said, "Let's go play together then!" The stick was happy, and it smile back.
The little girl and the stick played together all day long. The grumpy stick soon stopped feeling grumpy and became very happy. They became best friends and never forgot the day they met.




Jimmy was on a van. He took a seat in the back and looked around. He saw a big machine which was testing something. Jimmy was curious, but he didn't want to be a bother. He watched the machine test and test, but he still wasn't sure what it was doing.
Suddenly the van stopped. Everyone looked embarrassed. It turned out the machine had been testing the brakes! The driver was a little embarrassed, but he was glad that the test was successful. 
Jimmy was glad too. He was glad that the van was safe, and he was relieved that it hadn't caused any trouble. He and the others hopped back on the van and off they went, happy that the test had gone well.




Once upon a time, there was an ugly painter. He had a problem he couldn't solve. He was very sad and he couldn't figure out what to do.
One day, he went for a walk in the park. He saw a little girl playing. She looked so happy! He asked her for help.
She asked him what was wrong. The painter explained his problem. The girl thought for a minute, then she said she knew how to solve it.
The little girl told the painter what he should do. He did it and the problem was solved! He was so happy! He thanked the girl and gave her a big hug. The girl was very pleased and she waved goodbye as the painter went on his way.
The end.




Emma and her mom went for a walk on a sunny day. They saw a daisy in the grass and Emma said, Look! A daisy! Her mom smiled and said, Let's open it up and see how many petals it has. Emma bent down to the daisy and opened it carefully. Inside the daisy were five normal petals. Emma was so happy to see the daisy and smiled. She told her mom she wanted to pick the daisy and take it home. Her mom said yes and together they carefully picked the daisy. Emma held onto the daisy as they continued their walk and gave the daisy big hugs all the way home.




George was walking outside and it was cold. He saw a shiny magnet on the ground. He picked it up and it felt very sharp in his hand. He didn't want it to get him hurt, so he quickly put it away. But, then he heard a noise! 
He looked around and he saw a car coming down the street. It was fast! The car was getting closer and he was scared. He quickly picked up the magnet and searched for something to stick it to. He saw a big truck and ran to it. Just before the car got to him, he stuck the magnet on the truck. The car drove fast past him. He said "whew" and smiled. 
Then he noticed the magnet was still stuck to the truck. He didn't want to lose it, so he stayed close to the truck until it stopped and the magnet fell off. He picked it up and smiled. He was glad he found his magnet and that he was safe!




Once upon a time, there was a mom and dad who went to the store to buy some food for dinner. They bought some celery and some other yummy things.
At home, the mom and dad started cooking dinner. They chopped the celery into small pieces, but some of the pieces were too small. The dad got angry, and he broke the celery into even smaller pieces.
The mom said, Lets not spend too much time on the celery. We still have other food to cook. So the dad put the pieces of broken celery into the pot.
When dinner was ready, the family sat down and ate all the yummy food, including the celery. It was all delicious!
The family had a happy dinner and everyone was satisfied. The mom and dad said, Next time, lets spend more time on the celery!




Once upon a time there lived a gifted girl called Lou. Lou was special because she could do things that other kids couldn't. Everyone was in awe of her.
One day, Lou went to the store and bought a beautiful trophy. She was so proud of herself. She showed it off to all her friends and put it on the top shelf in her room.
At night, Lou wanted to make sure her special trophy was always safe so she took it down from the shelf and locked it in her cupboard.
Every morning, when Lou woke up, she'd take out the trophy and brace her special gift. It made her happy and made her feel like a champion. She was so proud of it and loved it very much!



Once upon a time, there was an empty house. In this house, there lived a family of five: mom, dad, and three children. One day, the mom and dad decided it was time to teach the children about money.
They gave each child a toy cup, and told them they could each use it to collect money. They explained that if they worked hard, they could put money in their cups to serve them in the future.
The children were so excited that they ran around the house looking for things to do. They cleaned the kitchen, helped their parents with the dishes, and swept the floor.
Each day, the children put a little money in their cups. After a few weeks, the little cups began to fill up. Soon enough, the children had enough money and could buy whatever they wanted.
The family was so proud of their hard work and dedication. The empty house was now full of love and money!




Once upon a time, there was a poor bird called Paul. Paul was very sad and lonely because he did not have any friends. Then one day, he heard a happy sound. He looked up to see where it was coming from. It was a dog, whose tail was wagging and who was running around and whistling. Paul was so happy that he decided to talk to the dog.
The dog told Paul about an event he was going to. It was a festival and lots of his friends were going to be there. Paul was excited and asked if he could come along too. The dog said yes and so Paul set off with him to the event.
When they got there, all of the dog's friends were very surprised to see Paul and asked him all sorts of questions. Paul was no longer sad and lonely - he was happy and had lots of new friends!
Paul was so excited that he started whistling loudly. Everyone else joined in and soon all the animals were whistling together, which made it the best event ever. Paul smiled from ear to ear, feeling so lucky to have such good friends. And they all lived happily ever after!




Once there was a little boy who loved to eat a lot of candy. Every day he would eat his fill and then some, but every time he ate too much he would leave a feeling in his stomach that was very bitter.
One day, he decided to find a way to own the candy he wanted and he set off to find a way. He explored high and low, up and down until he stumbled across a secret place filled with candy. He was so happy he had found the place, it was more candy than he had ever seen before.
He tried some of it, and it was the most delicious candy he had ever tasted. But then he kept eating, and eating and before he knew it, he had eaten so much that he felt terrible. His stomach was very full and it was very bitter.
The bitter feeling taught him an important lesson; you can own something, but if you own too much it can be a very bad thing. So the little boy went home with a much deeper understanding of what it meant to own something, and a much more controlled way to eat candy.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Janey. She was only 3 years old but she loved to dress up. Every morning, she would wear her modest dress with purple polka dots and her sparkly red shoes.
One day, Janey went to the garden with her Mommy to pick some herbs. She was so excited. She picked some basil and parsley, marveling at how each herb smelled different. 
Janey's Mommy put the herbs into Janey's dress pocket for safekeeping. Now when Janey went out, people could smell her herbs when she walked by. They thought she was so cute and smelled so nice!
From then on, Janey was sure to bring her herbs with her when she went out to dress up in her modest dress. She just knew she was the sparkliest little 3 year old in town!



Once upon a time, there was a harmless little dog. His name was Spot. He loved to play and run around on the grassy hills near his house.
One day, Spot saw something really exciting - an ambulance! He didn't know what it was, but it looked like lots of fun. So, he chased after it.
Spot ended up running for such a long time that he got very tired and went to take a nap. But when he woke up, he had a surprise. A big ambulance had come to spoil his fun!
The ambulance gave him a check-up and made sure that he was still harmless and healthy. Then the ambulance drove away, taking Spot's new friend with it.
Spot was sad, but he knew that the ambulance was trying to help him. He was glad that he was harmless and healthy.




Mum was in the kitchen making her lunch when she heard a sound. It was the ordinary clock ticking in the hallway. It reminded her to mind the time so she didn't run late.
Mum said "I must go now". She grabbed her jacket and went outside. She was going to pick up her little girl from day care.
Mum opened the door and saw her daughter playing. She smiled and waved. Her daughter ran to her with a big hug.
Mum said it was time to go home. Her daughter waved goodbye to her friends and gave them a hug. 
They walked home together, happy and laughing. The ordinary clock was still ticking loudly when they arrived.
Mum said it was important to mind the time. They both had to hurry to get ready for dinner.




One day, Matt was at home playing. Suddenly, he heard a very loud noise coming from the kitchen. He went to investigate.
In the kitchen he saw his mum and dad. His dad was holding a cup and shaking it up and down. His mum was telling him to reverse.
Matt didnt understand why they were reversing the cup. He watched as his dad turned the cup upside down.
Suddenly, a small, furry creature jumped out of the cup and ran around the kitchen! It was a hamster!
Matt laughed and laughed. His dad had reversed the cup and freed the hamster!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was happy and kind. She loved to explore the world around her. All the time she looked for something fun to do.
Then one day she found a stick lying on the ground. She was excited. She picked up the stick and started to play. Suddenly, a little bird landed on her shoulder and said, "Coo!"
The little girl was so surprised. She let out a laugh, then asked the bird what it wanted. The bird said it needed help and asked if the little girl could help. 
The little girl was compassionate and wanted to help the bird. She found a little home for the bird and put some food and water near it. 
The little girl wanted to make sure the bird was safe and happy, so she let it fly away, just like the other birds. And together they were happy ever after.




Once upon a time there was a family who loved to eat. They always had lots of food. One day, the mom brought home a special treat - it was wine. She said it was for the adults only. 
But the little girl was curious. She wanted to try it. So one day, when no one was looking, she took a sip. It was yummy! She spread the word to her brothers and they all wanted some, too. 
But the mom and dad said no. They said it was dangerous. The little girl thought it was not fair but everyone listened. 
The end.




A boy named Fred wanted a symbol. One day he asked his mom. She told him no! He was very persistent. He asked again. But she said no again! So he kept asking. He asked every day until one day his mom said yes!
Fred was so happy! He ran to his mom and hugged her. She had a big smile on her face and said he could have the symbol. Then she took him to the store and he picked out the symbol he wanted. It was perfect!
Fred was so thankful for his mom's persistence. He was so happy to finally have the symbol. He couldn't wait to show it off to all of his friends!



Once upon a time, there was a foolish bird. He flew over the Big Blue Sea, looking for a harbor to call his home. But no matter how far he flyed, the bird could not find a place to nest.
One day, the bird saw a little harbor far away. He was so happy, he flew straight there!
When the bird got to the harbor, he looked around. It was so beautiful and peaceful. He hoped it would be his home.
The bird decided to build his nest in the harbor. He worked hard all day long. Finally he had made a beautiful nest.
He cooed with joy. The foolish bird had found his home! From then on he was so happy, living in his little harbor. He hoped it would be forever.




Mum had a very special job for her and her daughter. She was going to weigh potatoes. The potatoes were stacked in a box on the kitchen table.
Mum taught her daughter how to use the scales. They had to place the potatoes on the metal tray and watch the dial to see how much it weighed.
Mum was very helpful and showed her daughter how to find the correct weight for the potatoes. After a few attempts, the daughter was able to read the scale and tell her mum how much the potatoes weighed. 
The mother was proud of her daughter. She said, "Great work. You are so helpful. Now we can weigh all these potatoes." 
At the end of the day, they had finished weighing the potatoes. They smiled at each other, proud of a job well done.




Once there was a smelly butter. It was so smelly that everyone around it said "yuck"! Poor butter. It felt so sad. It wanted to be like all the other butter.
One day the butter was so sad it started to cry. It cried and cried until it made a big pool of water around it.
Then suddenly the sun came out from behind the clouds. It felt really warm and made the butter happy. The water around it started to boil and the smell of the butter changed from smelly to sweet. Everyone breathed a sigh of relief.
The butter was happy and excited. It had a new smell! It was a happy end for the smelly butter.




Once there was a little bunny. The bunny was very independent. The bunny liked to explore. Every day the bunny ran around the garden looking for exciting things. 
One day the bunny was running around and bumped into a wall. It was a big wall and the bunny couldn't get over it. The bunny was tired from running, so it decided to rest. The bunny lay down and closed its eyes. 
The bunny felt so relaxed it fell asleep. The bunny slept for a long time until it felt well-rested. Then the bunny opened its eyes and hopped away.
It was happy to be an independent bunny again, exploring the garden and running around freely.




One day, Tom was walking down the street. He saw a model on the sidewalk. It was very tough and he wanted to talk to it. He approached the model, but it wouldn't answer. 
Tom was puzzled, so he decided to try something else. He started to whistle, but the model wouldn't respond to that either. 
Tom was getting frustrated, but then he had an idea. He started to sing and clap his hands. Suddenly, the model started to talk. It was the most amazing thing Tom had ever heard! 
Tom kept singing and the model kept talking. They talked and talked and talked. 
Eventually, Tom had to go home. He said good-bye to the model and promised to come and visit it again soon.




Molly was very angry today. She was angry because her friend had a juice and she didn't. She saw her friend drinking it and wished she had one too.
She asked her mom if she could have something to drink, but her mom said 'not today'. Molly was even more angry. She stamped her feet and shouted 'I want something to drink!'
Molly's mom thought for a moment and then said 'I know what you can do. We can go to the store and you can pick something to drink!'
Molly was excited. She put on her coat and they went to the store. Molly chose her favorite juice and they bought it.
Molly couldn't wait to get home. When they did, she ran straight to the kitchen and poured some of her juice. She took a big drink and smiled.
Now Molly was happy again. She was no longer angry!




Once upon a time, there was a friendly man. He lived in a house with a big garage. Every day he used the garage to fix his useful toys. Every week the man asked his friends to the garage. He would invite them to have a party and play with the toys he made. Everyone in the town had so much fun in the man's garage. They all enjoyed the useful toys they could play with. 
One day, the man invited all of the children from the town to his garage. They were so excited to see what kinds of toys he had made. They all ran through the garage, playing and having a great time. Everyone was so happy that the man was so kind to invite them to his beautiful garage. 
The man's garage was always so full of laughter and fun. Everyone in the town was grateful for the end of the day when the man invited them all to his garage. The man had the most special and useful garage of all.



Once upon a time there was a poor tiger. He was lost and alone and didn't know what to do. He was so scared and sad. Then, he heard a noise. It was a man! He was coming to rescue the tiger. The man was so kind and brave. He put the tiger in his truck and brought him to a safe place.
At the safe place the man showed the tiger his new home. It was so nice and clean! The tiger was so happy! He had a bed to sleep in and big, yummy meals to eat. 
But then the tiger realized he was alone. "I miss my friends," he thought. Just then, the man came back with some other tigers. The man had rescued them too! The tigers were so happy to see each other. 
The man had not just saved the tigers from being all alone, but also from a place that was disgusting. It was dirty and smelly and the food was bad. But now that the tigers were all rescued, they were safe and happy. They would never have to be scared and alone ever again!




Once there was a girl named Mary who was ready to go for a walk. She put on her shoes and grabbed her mama's hand. 
As they walked, she saw a bright green butterfly floating in the air. She smiled and pointed excitedly at it with her thumb. 
When they reached the park, she ran to the playground. She skipped over to the swings and sat down. Mama leaned down and pushed her higher and higher until she felt like she was flying with the butterfly. 
At the pond, Mama showed her a new kind of bird. Together they watched it swim away. 
Then it was time to go home. Mary was ready for a nap and a snack. She held her mama's hand and they walked home, smiling the whole way.



 
Once upon a Tuesday there was a boy named Jack. He was very excited because today he was going to slide. He went outside and the sun was shining brightly. Jack had a big slide in his garden and he couldn't wait to have fun. 
Jack ran to the top of the slide, put his hands above his head and he started to slide. He laughed so loud. Jack slid down the slide so many times. At the end, he was so happy and smiling from ear to ear. 
He went back to the top of the slide and did it again. Jack was so excited that he wanted to slide all day. He was having so much fun! 
The day then came to an end and it was time for Jack to go inside. He was a bit sad, but he reminded himself that he would get to slide again on another Tuesday.




It was a lovely sunny day, so Tom and his mum decided to go for a walk to the farm. Tom was so excited to meet the animals!
First, they met a big yellow chicken. Tom tickled her under her chin and she clucked happily.
Next, they met a deaf goat. He was white and fluffy and liked eating apples from Tom's hand.
Then, they met a friendly brown cow. She liked to have her back scratched and she made lots of happy mooing sounds.
Finally, Tom and his mum said goodbye to the farm animals. It was such a fun day!



Once upon a time there was a little girl called Molly. She was very brave and loved finding new things.
One day, Molly was looking for an adventure. She decided to go for a walk in the woods.
Suddenly, Molly heard some weird noises coming from behind a tree. She slowly walked closer and closer until she could see what was making the noise. It was a rubber! It was bouncing up and down and it looked so much fun.
Molly got closer and tried to catch the rubber, but it was bouncing away too fast. She shouted out, 'Come back here!'
Suddenly, the rubber stopped bouncing and came over to Molly. It seemed very friendly. Molly stroked its shiny, tough surface and smiled. She had finally met her new friend.
Molly took the rubber home and kept it by her bed. Every day they would go on a new adventure together. They were the best of friends. 
The End




Once upon a time there was a tall boy. He lived in a forest full of herbs. The boy loved being in the forest. Every day he went around to pick the different herbs. He became very good at it and soon he knew he was an herb expert.
He decided to use his skills to help the other animals in the forest. He created special recipes with the herbs that made the animals much happier.
One day the boy noticed a tall plant growing in the forest. He knew this was an unusual herb so he decided to try to make a recipe with it. He used special ingredients and eventually the recipe became very special. All the animals began to cheer.
The tall boy had discovered a special new herb. All the animals in the forest were very happy. They thanked him for making such a wonderful recipe. From that day on the boy was known as the Herb Master.



Once upon a time, there was a hungry kangaroo. He wanted something to eat, but he didn't know what to do.
Then, he saw a big, green apple tree. He hopped over to it and started to bounce around. He saw a big, juicy apple and tried to reach it. He didn't quite get it, so he jumped higher and higher.
Finally, the kangaroo reached the apple and took a big bite. He liked the sweet taste and was very happy. He was no longer hungry! The kangaroo was so happy that he started bouncing around the tree again. 
He bounced higher and higher until he reached the top of the tree. The kangaroo looked around and saw that he was the highest kangaroo in the area. He was so proud! He kept bouncing and jumping around until the sun went down. 
The kangaroo had a great day and was happy he was no longer hungry.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Lily. She had a big sister named Clara who was very graceful. 
Every day Clara would ask Lily for help. She would say, "Lily please help me!"
Lily always replied, "Yes, I will help you!"
So, each day Lily and Clara worked together to get things done. Clara helped Lily learn how to do things in a graceful way. 
One day, Clara said to Lily, "Thank you for always being here for me. You make being graceful look so easy."
Lily smiled and replied, "I'm glad I can help my big sister." 
The two of them continued to work together and they learned that no matter what, they would always have each other's backs. They knew they could rely on each other with grace.




Once upon a time there was a sailor who had a boat. He wanted to go on an adventure so he set off with his boat. Then, something bad happened. His boat split in two with a loud bang. The sailor was very sad because his boat was broken. 
He was all alone and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, he saw something in the distance. It was a rainbow! He knew he had to follow it.
The sailor swam and swam, following the bright colors of the rainbow. Finally, he made it to a sunny beach. He was so happy! 
The sailor was so grateful that he built a new boat from the broken pieces of his old one. Then, he set off on a new adventure in his new boat beneath the rainbow.



Once upon a time there was an old man. He was very wise and kind. One day, the old man observed the birds in a nearby park. He watched the birds play in the trees, fly around in the sky, and make nice chirping sounds.
He closed his eyes and took in the moment. Suddenly, he remembered a time when he was a young boy. He remembered playing in the park with his friends and chasing the birds around. Those were nice memories for the old man.
He opened his eyes and saw the birds still playing in the trees. He had observed the birds again, this time with a different memory. He smiled and enjoyed the warmth of his memory.




Once upon a time, there was a book. It was a special book, with lots and lots of pictures. It was so pretty.
