But one day, a mean old man wanted to take the book away. He wanted to steal it. He wanted it for himself.
But the brave little girl saw him trying to steal the book. She was so brave and scared at the same time. She shouted, "No! You can't do that!"
The cold wind blew and the mean old man ran away.
Everyone was so happy. The brave little girl had saved the book.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Mia. She loved to collect things. Mia collected everything from socks to dolls. But her favorite thing to collect was fashion. Every day, Mia would go out looking for new outfits and dresses.
One day, Mia found the prettiest dress she had ever seen. She decided to wear it right away! But when she went out to show it off, she felt very embarrassed. All the other kids in the neighbourhood were giving her funny looks.
Mia could tell the kids did not like her fancy dress. She quickly ran home and changed out of it. She then carefully packed away her special dress and vowed never to wear it in public again.
Mia learned a valuable lesson that day. Even though it was fun to collect fashion, sometimes it is better to wear it where you can't be seen!




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Mia. She wanted to explore the world, but she had to be safe. She put on her special cap, so that it could make her shine. Then Mia took a big step outside her front door. 
She began to explore the world around her. She saw lots of trees and plants, some with big leaves. She heard birds singing and saw butterflies fluttering. She went to a lake and saw small fish swimming. 
Mia kept going until it started to get dark. She knew it was time to go home and be safe. She put her cap back on, so it could make her shine. Then she ran back home to her mom, who gave her a big hug. 
Mia was safe and happy. Wearing her cap made her shine even when it was dark. She had discovered so much and she couldn't wait to explore more. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She wanted to make something special for her mommy. 
So Lucy kneeled down and grabbed some flour, sugar, eggs and butter from the counter. She mixed them together and put the batter in the oven.
When the cake was ready, Lucy's mom put a thermometer in it. The thermometer said the cake was done! 
Lucy's mom took the cake out of the oven and put it on the counter. It smelled delicious. Lucy couldn't believe it, she had made a cake!
Lucy and her mom both grinned as they took a bite of the yummy cake. It tasted just as delicious as it smelled! 
Lucy was so proud of herself. She thanked her mom and hugged her tight. 
The end.



Once upon a time there was a mummy and daddy. They were in a hurry to go somewhere special. They had to turn a special switch.
Mummy said, "Hurry up, let's turn the switch!" Daddy said, "Okay, I will try to be quick". 
Daddy got to the switch and pushed it. He made a very harsh sound! Mummy jumped and said, "Oh, that was loud!"
Daddy said, "Let's go, we don't want to be late!" They both ran out of the room very fast. 
At the end of the day, mummy and daddy had a great time. They made it to the special place just in time!



 
Once, there was a happy gorilla. He liked to spend all day swinging around in the trees. He was so happy that all the other animals in the jungle wanted to be his friend. 
One day, the gorilla decided he wanted to spend the day playing games with his new friends. He played hide and seek and tag around the trees. Everyone had lots of fun and was very happy. 
The gorilla continued to spend his days playing with his friends. He was the happiest and most fun gorilla around. He loved laughing, singing and playing together. 
Soon the other animals would tell their friends to come and join in the fun. Everywhere the gorilla went, he was met with lots of happy faces. He had made so many friends, he was the happiest gorilla of all.




Once upon a time, there was a lab. In the lab, the people wanted to make sure things were safe. So they worked to fix things that were broken. 
One day, they noticed something wasn't working right. Everyone in the lab worked hard together to figure out how to fix it. 
Finally, they found a way to make the thing safe and make it work right. The people cheered and enjoyed feeling happy that they could fix the problem and make it safe. 
The end.




One day, John was very eager to receive something special. He was wondering what it could be. Suddenly, he heard a knock on the door. He ran to answer it and saw a box! He was so excited he began jumping up and down. When he opened the box, to his surprise, he found a big bowl of pasta! He couldn't believe his eyes. He was so eager to eat the pasta. He grabbed a spoon and started eating. It was the best pasta he had ever tasted! He smiled and laughed with joy. He was so happy and thankful to receive such a special gift.




One day, a little girl was walking in the garden. Suddenly, she found a handle on the ground. She picked it up and looked at it. It was very strange. She decided to crawl with it. 
She started to crawl slowly, holding the handle. She looked around but she couldn't see where it was from. As she kept crawling, the little girl felt calm. 
Eventually, she saw a secret door. She looked carefully around and saw that it had two handles. One handle was very small and the other was the handle she had found. 
The little girl put the handle in the right place. She was very excited when the door opened. Inside, she found a secret room with lots of presents! There was a cake, some toys, and a big balloon! 
The little girl was so happy that she held the handle tightly and shouted out of joy. From then on, she kept the handle in her room as a reminder of her fun adventure.



Once upon a time there was a mountain. The mountain was huge and looked like a castle. Every day, the mountain was covered in dirt and grime.
So, every day the mountain had to be washed. Every morning, a group of children with buckets of water would march up the mountain and start washing. They washed and scrubbed the mountain until it was clean again.
The children felt so happy when they were done. They were so dizzy from scrubbing the mountain, they had to lay down and rest. But, it was worth it, because the mountain was clean and looked so beautiful! 
The children cheered and cheered and cheered, until they were too tired to cheer anymore. They were so proud that they had washed the mountain!




Once there was a little girl named Jane. Jane was very stubborn. She often refused to do what her parents said.
One day, Jane's parents asked her to put her pants on. But Jane did not want to listen. Over and over they asked Jane to put her pants on, but each time she said no. 
Finally, Jane's parents had had enough. Her dad lifted her up and put the pants on her. Jane had to wear them, no matter how stubborn she was! 
That day, Jane learned that it was important to listen to her parents. After all, they only wanted what was best for her.



Once upon a time, there was a boy who wanted to try something special. He loved to kick things so he went outside and found a whip. It was different than anything he had ever seen before.
The boy started to kick the whip. He was so excited and he kept kicking until it made a loud noise. The noise was so loud that it echoed off the walls.
The boy smiled and kept kicking. He tried to make different patterns and shapes. He loved playing with this new toy. He kept kicking until he became tired and stopped.
The boy was so happy that he had found the special whip. He couldn't wait to show it to all of his friends! He took the whip and ran off to find them. He kicked it all the way home and everyone watched him go.



One day, Billy wanted to be like his older brother, so he asked his mom if he could have a uniform. His mom said yes and Billy was so happy. He put on his uniform and looked in the mirror.
He loved it so much. When he went outside to play, all of his friends loved his uniform too. They wanted a uniform just like Billy had, so his mom bought uniforms for all of his friends.
At first, Billy was happy for his friends, but then he started to feel upset, because his friends looked just like him. He didn't want to look like everyone else.
But then he remembered something his mom told him. She said that it was ok to be different, but it was just as important to accept differences in others. So, Billy decided to accept his friends' uniforms.
He smiled and started to play with his friends. He realized it was better to play together than to be upset about being different. Billy was happy he had his friends and his uniform.




Once upon a time, there was a perfect prince. He wanted to try something new, but he wasn't sure what it should be. All of a sudden, an idea popped into his head! He decided to try to make a cake.
The prince went to the kitchen and gathered all of the ingredients he would need. He mixed the flour, sugar and eggs together. He added in some butter and a pinch of salt. The prince stirred and stirred until the batter was smooth.
The prince put the batter into a baking dish, then he put it into the oven. He checked it often, watching to make sure it looked perfect. After it was done baking, the prince took it out. He waited for it to cool and then he served it for all to enjoy.
Everyone loved the perfect cake the prince had made. They all cheered and thanked him for his wonderful work. From then on, the prince tried to make something new every day.



Once upon a time there was a doggy with a big mustache! He was always chewing on something  sticks, bones, even grass  he was always chewing!
One day, the doggy was scavenging around looking for something new to chew. He stumbled upon a much bigger bone than he had ever seen before. He started to snatch it up and chew it away!
Suddenly, something very strange happened! The bigger bone was actually a secret container! As the doggy chewed away, he uncovered all sorts of hidden treasures inside the container. He was so excited! He kept on chewing and chewing until all the hidden surprises were revealed.
The doggy even found a big cookie in the container! While he was thrilled by all of the hidden surprises, the big cookie was his favorite. He joyfully chewed away on his cookie as his bushy mustache wiggled.
When the doggy was finished, he found a beautiful bow for his mustache! He was so happy with his new discoveries and treats that he set off to show all his friends.
The End.




Molly was walking in the park. She saw a big bird on a branch. It had beautiful feathers with lots of different colours. Molly admired the bird. She looked at it for a long time.
Then she heard a voice coming from the bird. It said "hello". Molly was very excited. She wanted to talk to the bird. She said hello back and asked the bird what its name was.
The bird's name was Daisy. Daisy told Molly about all the fun she had in the park. She said she loved flying and eating seeds. She said the best thing was when the wind blew and she could soar above the trees. Molly was amazed.
Suddenly, Molly smelt something really smelly. It was the bird! Molly shouted in surprise. Daisy giggled. She said the smell was from her feathers. Molly laughed too and said goodbye to Daisy. She waved as Daisy flew away. Molly was happy, she had a new friend.




Johny loved going to the store with his mom. Today she promised him a special treat - a new cartoon to watch. As they walked in, his mom said, "Let's find something fun to watch!" 
Johny was so excited; he ran to the TV section, shouting with joy. Finally, he found the perfect cartoon! It was about a chubby little bear, and Johny just had to have it.
His mom said sure, and before long, the cartoon was in their shopping cart. It was the best day ever!
When they got home, Johny raced to the DVD player and popped in the cartoon. His mom and dad joined him on the couch, and they watched the cartoon together. Johny was so happy, he shouted and laughed. It was the perfect day!



 Once, a little boy got a mitten for Christmas. He was so happy! He loved it so much.
The boy liked to wear his mitten everywhere he went. He even slept in it once! Whenever it was cold, he would put it on his hand and go outside.
One day, the boy went to the park to play. He put his mitten on, ready to play. He had so much fun! He ran, jumped and laughed all day.
But then he finished playing. He was very tired, so he decided to go home. He took his mitten off, waved goodbye to all his friends, and went home.
He was so happy to have his mitten to keep him warm and cozy. The little boy was thrilled and couldn't wait to play again.




The mommy put the zebra in the box. She gave it a kiss and made the zebra feel all happy. The zebra was so quiet, it slept in the box. The mommy was so happy, she put the box in the car and drove away. When she arrived at the park, she put the box gently on the ground.
When she opened the box, the zebra woke up and ran around the park. It was so excited and it ran around and around. It ran so fast, it was a blur.
The mommy laughed and said, that zebra sure is fast. But when it saw a tree, it stopped and got very quiet. It saw a bunch of leaves on the tree and began to nibble them. The mommy laughed again and said, I think it likes the leaves.
The mommy watched the zebra eat the leaves for a while and then put it back in the box. She gave it another kiss and drove it home. Then she put it back in the box and gave it one more kiss goodnight. The zebra went quietly back to sleep.




Once there was a mommy who had a baby. The baby was very happy and the mommy was very proud. The mommy encouraged the baby to do good things. Every time the baby would do something nice like say please and thank you, the mommy would give the baby a big hug and a big smile. Every day, the mommy helped the baby learn new things. Every night, the mommy would tell the baby a bedtime story and snuggle with the baby before it went to sleep. The mommy was always very gentle and loving and always encouraged the baby to be good. The mommy and baby were very happy together.




Once upon a time there was a messy key. It was all covered in dirt and mud.
A little girl came by and saw the key. She wanted to pick it up but it was so messy.
The little girl clapped her hands and sang a song. Suddenly, the tiniest bit of magic happened. The key sparkled and shone as if it had just been cleaned.
The little girl smiled and picked up the key. She was so happy that it was clean. She put it in her pocket and skipped off home.
When she got home, the little girl opened the door with the key. She was so proud to use the key all by herself! She clapped her hands in delight.
The end.



 
Once upon a time there was a young girl named Clara. Clara wanted to gain something yummy, so she went for a walk. She spotted some berries in a nearby bush. Clara was so excited, so she ran to get them.
When she looked closely at the berries, she realized they weren't the same bright and juicy berries she wanted. These berries were terrible. She felt so sad and disappointed.
But then she realized that her mommy said she shouldn't take things that don't belong to her. Clara decided to leave the berries and went home. She gained something else instead- a lesson in being honest.




Mama was restless. She looked at her watch and sighed. She was watching the clock, waiting for something.
Suddenly, the door opened. In ran a tiny, busy toddler. He giggled and hugged his mamas legs. Mama smiled and reached down to give him a hug.
They went outside and watched the birds in the sky. Mama pointed at the ones that were flying high. The little boy laughed and watched the birds for a long time. 
Mama looked at her watch again. She was still restless. She wanted something. Picking up the little boy, she turned to go inside. 
But as soon as they were through the door, the little boy began to bawl. Mama hugged him close until he stopped. 
Finally, Mama put him down and looked at the clock. She was not so restless anymore. Mama smiled and reached down to grab her little boys hand. Mama and her little boy would have a long day ahead.




Once there was a popular spirit who lived in the village. He was nice and he liked to stir things up. Everywhere he went, he made people smile. He was so popular, that everyone wanted to be his friend.
One day, the spirit decided to stir up some trouble. He ran around the village, playing pranks on the people by hiding their things and making silly noises. The people laughed and the spirit couldn't help but let out a little giggle too.
Soon, he was stirring up trouble all over the village. Everyone was having a lot of fun, but the spirit had stirred up too much trouble. He was so tired he just wanted to sleep.
The village people noticed what the spirit had done and they took care of him. They helped him find a warm place to sleep, away from all the trouble he had stirred up. From then on, everyone in the village looked out for the popular spirit. He was happy and safe, and everyone always made sure he had a lot of fun.



Once upon a time there was a fairytale land where everything was strange and unusual. One day, a little boy went for a walk in the forest and came upon a very strange mushroom. It was big and round and it sparkled in the sunlight.
The boy was mesmerized by the sight of it. He didn't know what it was or what to do with it. He just wanted to keep it. So he promised it a magical home, where it would be safe and loved.
The boy was very proud of his promise and he went home with the mushroom. Every day he would visit the mushroom and talk to it, telling it stories and playing games with it in its new home.
The boy and his mushroom became the best of friends. And, together, they had many unusual adventures. The boy was very happy to keep his promise and keep his mushroom safe and loved.




Once upon a time there was an adorable little match. The match was red and sparkly, and it was always happy. The match loved to be played with and make people smile. 
One day, the match made a special wish. The match wished to change, to become something more than just a piece of wood. The match wanted to be a part of something bigger, something more special. 
So the match did what any brave match would do, it changed. It changed into a beautiful butterfly. The butterfly was so colourful and breathtaking that everyone wanted to hold it. 
The butterfly enjoyed its new life - spreading its wings and flying around the garden. Everyone was so amazed by its colours and loved it very much. 
The butterfly enjoyed its time as a butterfly, fluttering in and out of people's hearts. From that day forward, the match was never again seen in its original form. 
But its memory lives on for the butterfly was an adorable one and made everyone smile.



Once upon a time, a mama and her baby were walking through the park when they stopped in a quiet corner to pray. Mama closed her eyes tight, put her hands together and whispered. Baby watched her and copied what she did by putting his little hands together and closing his eyes too.
Mama pointed to the top of a very tall tree and told Baby they were going to pray for a birds nest. Baby looked up and saw a dirty old nest at the top. Mama and Baby prayed to the bird for a safe place to sleep and for happy days. 
Mama and Baby kept walking until they saw another nest in a different tree, this one much cleaner. Mama was very happy and Baby cheered. Mama smiled and said that their prayer had been answered and that the birds would have a much nicer place to sleep now.
Mama and Baby walked away from the park with big smiles on their faces. From now on, they would never forget to pray for the birds.



 
Once upon a time, there was a furry bear who lived near a lake. He loved swimming in the lake and playing in the sun. One day, he decided to explore the deep parts of the lake. 
As the bear swam deeper into the lake, he started to feel a chilly breeze. This made him feel a bit scared, but he wouldn't give up! Suddenly, he heard a loud voice calling out to him. It was the voice of an old swan. 
The swan said, "You must turn back. It's too dangerous to swim any further." The bear was confused, but the swan kept on warning him not to continue. The bear finally understood and quickly swam back to shore. 
He was very thankful to the swan for warning him about the deep parts of the lake. From that day on, the bear didnt swim too far from the safety of the shore.



Once upon a time, there was a wise bear. He marched across the woods, searching for something exciting. As he kept walking, he heard a beautiful sound coming from the nearby station. The bear marched over and saw a beautiful big train. He was so happy and wondered how he could get on it. He asked the station master and she showed him the way.
The bear was so excited he started to march around the station. He smiled and waved to everyone who passed by. He was having so much fun until he noticed the train was getting ready to leave. He marched as fast as he could and just made it in time.
The bear looked out the window and enjoyed the journey as it passed by. Everywhere he looked, he saw something new and exciting. When the train reached its destination, he was so happy. He hugged the station master so tight and marched off into the sunset.



Once there was a mighty king who loved the truth. He always tried to make sure that everyone in his kingdom was happy and safe.
One day, something terrible happened. The king lost his most precious crown. He searched high and low for it but couldn't find it anywhere.
He was so sad because he thought his crown was gone forever. But the truth was, his faithful friends the birds had been looking after his crown and were now bringing it back to him.
The king was filled with joy and thanked the birds for their help. He learned that he could always rely on the truth to be mighty and powerful. And he never lost hope again.




Tommy had a cube. He wanted to decorate it. He asked his mum for some paint and some brushes. His mum said yes and gave him some hot colours.
Tommy put the paint on the cube. He put yellow paint here, orange paint there and blue paint everywhere. He was so happy that he laughed and smiled as he decorated it.
When he was done, he had a beautiful cube. It was hot and colourful, and he was happy. He showed it to his mum, who smiled and nodded her head. Tommy was very proud of his work and he carried it everywhere. 
He was happy with his cube and he was proud of his decoration. He had made something very special!




Once upon a time, there was a dog. He was small and brown and he had a thin, red leash. He loved to run and play. One day, he went for a walk with his owner. He zoomed down the street and chased a butterfly. Before long, he was far away from home. His owner was worried and ran after him. But the dog was fast! He zoomed around the corner and was gone. His owner called, but the dog didn't stop. He kept zooming and was soon lost. Luckily, the dog made it home. His owners hugged him tight and put his leash back on. He zoomed around his backyard, chasing all the birds and butterflies. He was happy to be safe and sound at home.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Suzie. Suzie was very excited because her mom said they were going on a surprise. Suzie's eyes lit up as she imagined all the fun things she would do.
She hopped into the car and her mom started to drive. Suzie rubbed the window with her hand as they drove down the street. Then they stopped and her mom said "We're here!"
Suzie opened the door, and to her surprise there was a big, silly clown waiting for her. She was so happy she couldn't believe it. She ran up to the clown and hugged him tight. The clown gave her a big, stupid smile and pulled out a big box of toys for her. She laughed and thanked him.
Suzie spent the whole day playing with the clown and her toys. She was so happy and excited, she couldn't help but rub her hands together with joy. What a surprise!




Once there was a boy who loved to run and play. One day, he heard a soft glowing sound coming from the trees. He was curious and went to investigate. 
When he got there, he saw a cone that was glowing. It was very beautiful and seemed very helpful. The boy reached out and touched it.
Suddenly the cone started to get bigger and bigger. It grew until it became as big as a house. The boy was scared but the cone was very friendly. It said it would help him so he was no longer afraid.
The cone gave the boy a big hug. Then it gave him some special powers. He could now fly and make things glow. With the help of the cone, the boy could do things he never thought possible. He was so excited! 
The boy decided to go home and show his family his new magical powers. He thanked the cone for its help before flying off into the sky.




Once there was a little girl who loved to paint. She had so many different paints - blues, greens, yellows and more! One day the little girl had an operation, so she couldn't paint for a while. 
When she finally felt better, she was ready to paint again. She grabbed her paints and started mixing them together. She painted silly pictures of her cat, her dog and herself. She also painted some big trees, a big sun and lots of happy animals.
When she finished painting, the little girl felt so happy. Painting was so much fun! She wanted to keep painting more and more pictures, but it was time to go home.
But the little girl wasn't worried. She knew she'd have lots more chances to paint in the future.




Once upon a time, there was a kind lady. She brought a big jug of milk and two mugs. The milk was very pale.
The kind lady said to the three year old, "Would you like some milk?". The little one nodded and said, "Yes, please". The kind lady poured the pale milk into the mug and handed it to the three year old.
The little one smiled and said thank you. The kind lady said, "You're welcome". She smiled and watched the little one enjoy the pale milk.
The little one loved the pale milk. He asked the kind lady, "Can I bring more milk, please?". The kind lady said, "Of course, you can".
So, the little one and the kind lady went to get more pale milk. When they came back, the little one was happy. He thanked the kind lady again and the kind lady said, "You're welcome. I'm happy you enjoyed the pale milk!".




One day, Jack and Jane went to the ranch. It was very hot outside. When they arrived, they took off their shoes. They saw a bunch of animals running around. Jack and Jane took the time to pet some of the animals. They loved feeling the soft fur. They even took turns feeding them.
Afterwards, Jack and Jane took a walk around the ranch. They saw a big pond and ducks swimming around. Jack and Jane took a big stick and started poking the water. All of a sudden, some frogs jumped out! Jack and Jane took a few steps back. They were very surprised!
When the sun was getting very hot, Jack and Jane decided to take a break. They found a big tree and sat in the shade. Jack and Jane talked and played until it was time to go. Taking one last look around, they smiled and waved goodbye.




One day, a young boy named Tommy grabbed his dad's razor. Tommy thought it looked very fun and shiny. He wanted to touch it. He wanted to make it do something cool.
But when Tommy grabbed the razor, he cut himself and the razor made a big mess. The floor was all red and his hand had a big cut. He started to cry.
His dad heard all the noise and ran into the room. He saw the mess and knew what had happened. He quickly grabbed the razor and put it away.
His dad gave Tommy a big hug. He helped him wash out the cut and put a band-aid on it. Then he cleaned up all the mess on the floor. 
After his dad was finished with the cleaning, he gave Tommy a big smile and said, "It's ok, let's never do that again."



 
Once upon a time there were two friends, Bob and Sue. They were best friends, but one day they had a disagreement.
Bob wanted to stand on the famous hill, but Sue wanted to stay at home and make cookies. Bob asked Sue to come with him and she replied, "No, I'm not going to the hill."
Bob was very sad. He decided to go to the hill by himself. Sue felt bad for her friend and decided to go after him. When she got to the hill, Bob saw her and smiled.
They both stood on the hill and looked out over the famous landscape. They shared a hug and agreed to never fight again. From then on, Bob and Sue never left each others' side.



Once upon a time there was a very old anchor. It was so old it was almost ancient. The anchor lay at the bottom of the ocean for many years until one day a fisherman decided he wanted to buy the anchor.
He asked around to see if anyone was selling an anchor. Finally, he heard about the old anchor deep underwater. He went to get it and swam down until he found it. It was heavy and he worked hard to bring it up to the surface.
When the anchor reached the surface, the fisherman was very happy. He quickly put it on his boat and took it to a shop that sold things from the sea. The owner of the shop was very happy to buy the anchor.
The fisherman made a lot of money from selling the anchor and happy ever after.




Once there was a poor family who lived in a small house. One day they decided to go to the shop to buy some food. When they got there, they saw that the shop had split into two. The shop keeper was very sad, because the poor family had no money to help him fix it. So mum, dad and the children worked together and used their hands to rebuild the shop. The shop keeper was very thankful for their help! After a few hours, the shop was fixed and the happy family could buy their food. It was a good day!




Sam and Mom were playing in the park. Mom taught Sam how to swing on the swings. He was so excited to go up high and feel the wind on his cheeks. He loved how it felt when he swung higher and higher. 
Mom said "Now let's try a new swing!", and it was green. It was more comfortable than the old swings and Sam loved it. He swung on it until he got sleepy. 
Mom taught Sam how to put his feet on the ground, so he could stop the swing and get off safely. Then, he curled up in Mom's lap and fell asleep. It was the best feeling in the world to be so comfortable and safe.



Once upon a time, there was a friendly bear. He wanted to go on an adventure to find something special.
So he started walking through the forest. He came to a tunnel and he wanted to see what was on the other side. He was a bit scared, but he kept walking.
As he walked, he started to see beautiful colours. He also heard lovely sounds, like birds singing and rivers bubbling. He was amazed by all the new things he saw. 
He decided to spend more time in the tunnel. He explored all around, poking his nose into different corners and he even made a special friend, a friendly rabbit. 
After a long time, he was happy and decided to go home. But he promised himself he would come back and spend more time in the tunnel, exploring and making more friends.



Once upon a time, there was a very adventurous boy. He wanted to have some fun, so he went to the forest. He saw a big piece of wood and he wanted to pull it. He grabbed hold of it and started to pull. He tugged and tugged, but the wood wouldn't move. He tried and tried, but he couldn't get it to budge!
Then a big, furry bear came along and saw what the boy was doing. He said, "Let me help you." He grabbed hold of the wood and pulled with all his might. With the bear's help, the wood moved a little.
The boy and the bear kept pulling, and before long, the wood started to move more and more. The boy was so happy that he clapped his hands and cheered. After a lot of hard work, the wood was finally free! 
The boy thanked the bear for all his help. They said their goodbyes, and the boy went home feeling very accomplished. What an adventurous day it had been!



Once there was a poppy. It was so pretty with its red petals. One day, something very sad happened, the poppy became dead.
The news spread all around the meadow. Every creature was both sad and scared. Then, something amazing happened. A drop of water touched the dead poppy, and it started to come back to life. Soon enough the poppy was alive and blooming once again!
The news quickly spread, and all the creatures in the meadow were so happy. They cheered and danced, and all agreed that the poppy was the most beautiful sight they had ever seen.
The little poppy and its red petals will forever be remembered in the meadow, and all of its inhabitants will spread the news of its revival.



 
Once there was an old lady who lived in a big house. One day, she went to the kitchen to make pancakes. She loved pancakes, so she requested lots of rub to make them. She searched and searched, but there was no rub anywhere. 
Suddenly, she heard a noise outside. When she looked out the window, she saw a crazy little squirrel! The squirrel was dancing around and doing a silly dance.
The old lady was so surprised that she opened the window and asked the squirrel if he could help her. She requested that he bring her some rub so that she could make pancakes. 
The squirrel hopped and jumped, then ran off in search of rub. A few minutes later, he returned with a bag full of rub! The old lady thanked the squirrel and quickly made the pancakes. 
She enjoyed them very much, and every now and then she even saw the crazy little squirrel outside the window!




Mom and Dad were doing laundry. They were carefully folding the clothes and filling the laundry basket. Mom and Dad could see that the clothes were very tight. 
But then little Sam came in. Sam had a mischievous smile. He started to throw the clothes all over the room. He was so excited! 
Mom and Dad were not happy. They tried to get Sam to stop, but he kept going. He was spoiling all the laundry!
Finally, Dad scooped Sam up with a hug. He looked him in the eye, and said, "No spoiling the laundry, ok?" 
Sam promised he would be good, and he and Dad helped Mom gather up all the clothes. In the end, their laundry was nice and tidy again.




Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very nervous. She was going on her first trip to the airport.
At the airport, the girl was super excited. She saw big airplanes and lots of people. She wanted to go explore the airport more.
Suddenly, the girl noticed that everyone was running. She got scared and ran too. She was trying to escape!
The little girl ran and ran until she found her mom. Then, both of them escaped from the airport.
They were so happy. The little girl had many new stories to tell her friends about her first trip to the airport.



One day, a little girl named Jane wanted to make something special. She wanted to find a way to make something that was as pretty as a happy song. 
So she decided to get some paint. She found white, pink, and yellow colors and she was very excited.
Jane got some big paper and put it on the table. Then she used a brush to spread the paint on the paper. She worked hard, mixing colors and making shapes.
When she was done, the picture looked beautiful. She showed it to her mom and her mom was so proud of her. She asked Jane to serve the picture to her friends.
So Jane proudly displayed her art to all her friends. Everyone was amazed at how hard Jane worked on the paint and how pretty it was. Jane was very pleased with her work and knew she could make something even better the next time.




Once there was a little boy named Jake. Jake loved his bed so much, but it was getting old. His mom decided it was time for a new mattress.
So she sent a big truck to the store to get a nice new mattress for Jake. When the truck came back, it was filled with a big, soft mattress.
Jake was so excited, he couldn't wait to try it out. He jumped onto the mattress and it was so comfortable and peaceful. 
He sunk into the mattress and soon fell fast asleep. He slept like a baby, he was so peaceful and happy.
Jake lived happily ever after with his new mattress!



Once upon a time there was a nice little girl. She loved velvet because it felt so soft and it was so nice. Every day she would hug and cuddle a big velvet pillow, it was her best friend!
One day when she was playing outside, the little girl saw a beautiful velvet dress. She loved it so much and wished she had one just like it.
The next day her mum surprised her with an even nicer velvet dress. She was so happy and she hugged and kissed it as if it were alive. 
Every day she wore her dress and loved how it felt against her skin. She thanked her mum for the lovely present and the warm feeling in her heart was true love.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Zoe. Zoe liked to explore, so one day she went to the park with her friends. At the park, Zoe spotted a beautiful palm tree. She thought it would be fun to steal one of its leaves. She gently touched the soft green leaf and slowly pulled it off. She was excited to show her friends!
Just then, a park guard came to investigate what was going on. Zoe was so surprised she dropped the leaf. The guard saw it and asked Zoe to give it back. Zoe quickly nodded her head and carefully returned the leaf back to the palm tree.
The guard thanked Zoe for her honesty and sent her and her friends off with a warning. Zoe was embarrassed but also happy to learn about the importance of not stealing. She promised to never do it again!
From then on, Zoe was very careful of what she touched at the park. Whenever she saw a beautiful leaf, she admired it from afar and appreciated its soft beauty.



Once upon a time, there was a wide judge. He liked to give people answers.
One day, the judge was very tired. He decided to rest under a tree. He lay down in the grass and closed his eyes.
All of the animals came to watch the judge. They were curious! He was resting for so long that they started to get worried.
One brave little bird flew up to the judge and whispered in his ear to wake him up.
The judge opened his eyes and smiled. He thanked the bird for helping him and hopped up.
He said goodbye to all the animals and told them that it was time to get back to work.
The judge went on his way feeling more rested. He continued to make wise decisions with the help of the little bird.



Mommy and Betty were walking on the beach. They looked at the tide as it came in and out. 
"Look, Mommy" said Betty. "The water is so big today".
Mommy smiled. "Yes, it is" she said.
Then Mommy and Betty stopped and started to discuss what they should have for dinner. Mommy said she was feeling very hungry.
Then Betty had an idea. "Let's go to get some fish from the fish shop" she said. 
Mommy agreed. "That sounds like a good idea Betty" she said. 
So they went to the fish shop and bought some fish. They cooked the fish for dinner and it was delicious. 
The tide was still coming in and out when they finished eating, so Mommy and Betty smiled and went for a walk along the beach.




Molly and Mommy were in the kitchen. Molly saw a wrap on the counter. It was big and colorful. Mommy said, "Let's join the wrap". So Molly helped Mommy wrap it around a special present for her brother. 
Next, Molly and Mommy put the present in a big box. Molly wanted to carry it, but Mommy said it was too big. So they drove to her brother's house. 
When they arrived, her brother was very happy. He was spoiled with the present. Molly was glad she helped wrap it. Mommy was proud of Molly. They all hugged, and Molly felt very special.



Once upon a time, there was a thick stream. Everyday it gurgled and bubbled. One day, something magical happened. Two little fish swam up the stream and got married! The other fish in the stream were so happy for them. They gathered around and cheered as they said their vows.
After the wedding, they shared lots of yummy treats. There was ice cream and candy, and the other fish all had a wonderful time. It was the best day ever!
The little married fish stayed in the stream and were very happy. They laughed and played together, and the other fish watched them with pleasure.
So that's what happened when two fish got married in the thick stream!




Once upon a time there was a little dog called Max. Max was very alert and always ready for a walk. He always looked for something fun to do around his house.
One day he found the perfect spot. It was a shelter made out of sticks. Max was so excited that he wanted to record it with his camera. He took some pictures and some videos so he could show his family when they came back home.
Max was so pleased with his new shelter that he went back to play inside every day. He went even when it was raining. He was always so alert looking out for anything fun outside.
Max loved playing in his shelter and told his family about it every time they came back. He loved to show them the pictures and videos he had recorded.
The end.




One day, a boy and his mommy were walking near a river. The boy wanted to go into the water, but his mommy said no because she was too scared. She said it was too deep.
The boy felt embarrassed. He wanted to get in, even if it was a bit deep. He looked for a place to go in and he found one that wasn't too deep and looked kind of safe.
But then a grown-up came up to him and said he wasn't allowed to go in. He looked serious and he said it was too dangerous and too cold.
The boy was embarrassed again, and his mommy said it was ok and to try again tomorrow. They went back home feeling sad. But the next day, they went back and the boy was able to get in the river without any trouble.




Once upon a time, there was a big, bright rainbow in the sky. It was a perfect rainbow because it was really colourful and it had a lot of pretty colours. A girl took a look at the rainbow and decided to take it.
So she jump, hopped, and skipped closer to the rainbow until she was almost there. Just then, it started to rain. The girl was soaked, but she was also very happy because she had caught the rainbow.
The girl ran back home with the rainbow in her hand. She showed everyone her beautiful rainbow and everyone 'oohed' and 'aahed' at how perfect it was. The girl was so proud of her rainbow - she had taken the perfect rainbow!




Once upon a time a little girl named Grace found a box of crayons. She couldn't wait to play with them! She sat on the floor and made a big circle with a red crayon. Then she laughed, because the circle looked silly.
Next, Grace decided to make some funny faces. She used a green crayon to draw two eyes and a blue crayon to draw a nose and a mouth. When she was done, they looked so funny that she laughed even harder.
Grace was having so much fun that she wanted to do it again. She grabbed a yellow crayon and started to draw. She made three circles and then added some big ears. This time, she couldn't stop giggling.
Finally, Grace put away her crayons and had a seat on the floor. She was so happy that she couldn't stop smiling. She had drawn some silly pictures, and it was the perfect end to a fun day.




Once upon a time, Timmy was walking in a gloomy forest. Suddenly, he heard a loud roar. He froze in fear. Looking down, he saw a skull. Timmy was scared. He wanted to run away.
He saw a big rock nearby. He quickly ran over and hid his head under the rock. Then, he waited and waited.
After a while, Timmy heard the frightening roar again. Then, he heard the sound of animals running and hoped they would run away. After a few minutes, everything was quiet.
Timmy slowly peeked out from under the rock and looked around. Everything was back to normal. He said out loud, "Phew!" He was so happy and excited that he was safe. Timmy took a deep breath and ran back home, never wanting to come back to the gloomy forest again.




One day, Jimmy wanted to organize his toys. He thought it would be fun to have them all put away in their proper places. He grabbed his calendar and made a plan. He decided he could organize them each day of the week.
The first day was for sports toys. Jimmy was so embarrassed when he saw how many toys were scattered around his room. He quickly picked them all up and put them in their proper places.
The second day was for puzzles. Jimmy was much less embarrassed this time. He had a good plan and he worked quickly. He soon had all of his puzzles put away nicely.
The third day was for blocks. Jimmy felt so proud that he was able to organize all his toys. His room looked very neat, and he was so pleased with his accomplishment. 
Jimmy knew he had done a great job organizing. He smiled and looked proudly at his calendar, happy with his accomplishment.




Jim and his daughter were cooking. They were making dinner together. Jim was chopping vegetables very quickly, chopping the carrots into small pieces. His daughter was being slow and careful, taking her time with the potatoes. Jim watched her proudly.
Jim's daughter took out the pan and put it on the stove. She turned on the heat. Jim was so proud of his daughter! They added water and put the vegetables in the pan.
Jim and his daughter watched the vegetables cook. The potatoes and carrots sizzled in the pan. Together they stirred the vegetables, patiently waiting for them to be ready.
Jim and his daughter smiled as they took the vegetables off the stove. They had made dinner together and Jim's daughter was proud of the dinner she had helped cooking.




It was a gloomy day. Mommy was feeling sad, so she decided to take a walk. She brought along her little dog. The dog was small and very cute.
Mommy and the little dog began to walk. Mommy looked around and noticed a park. She thought that it would be nice to take the little dog there to play.
They walked through the park. Mommy enjoyed looking at the trees, the flowers and the blue sky. The little dog saw a squirrel and started to follow it. It hopped and jumped away, and the little dog followed. Mommy laughed and could not help but smile. 
The little dog chased the squirrel around the park. Every time the squirrel stopped, the little dog barked and followed it. Eventually, the squirrel ran away and the little dog came back to Mommy. 
Mommy smiled and hugged the little dog. She was feeling happy now, and the gloomy day had brightened. Together, they continued their walk around the park until it was time to leave.




Once upon a time there was an old man who was very poor. He didn't have much money, but he was very kind.
One day, the old man saw a strange thing. A big frozen lake that hadn't been there before. He wanted to see what was inside, so he decided to walk over to it.
When he got to the lake, he saw a little creature inside. It was a snowman! He was stuck in the ice and couldn't get out.
The old man didn't know how to help the snowman, so he decided to wait. He waited for hours until finally, the sun came out and the ice started to melt.
The snowman was free! The old man was so happy that he could help the little creature. The snowman thanked him and the old man was filled with joy.




Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She liked to balance on the hanger in her room. One day, Sarah decided to climb up to the highest point of the hanger. She was so proud that she had balanced all the way up. But then, Sarah lost her balance and fell off the hanger. It hurt so much that she started to cry. 
Suddenly, Sarah's mom came in the room. She was very worried about Sarah and ran over to make sure she was okay. Sarah was still crying, so her mom picked her up and hugged her tight. She said, "Don't worry, Sarah. Mommy is here to make sure you're safe." 
Sarah's mom knew that the hanger was not safe for Sarah to play with, so she got rid of it and found some toys that were safer. Now Sarah has lots of fun things to play with that don't make her hurt!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sophie. She was very anxious about touching things. Everywhere she went, things looked so nice and shiny, but she was scared to touch them. One day, Sophie came across a beautiful stone. She wanted to touch it very much, but she was too scared. So, she decided to make a wish instead. She closed her eyes and wished that she wasn't scared to touch things. Then, something magical happened. When Sophie opened her eyes, she felt like something had changed. Her anxious feeling had gone away and she was no longer scared to touch things. She slowly reached out her hand and, with a big smile, she touched the stone. Suddenly, something else unbelievable happened. The stone started to turn different colours! Sophie was amazed and laughed with joy. With her courage, Sophie had made a wish come true.




Once upon a time, there was a mom and a child. The child was very careful and was always looking out for the mom. One day, the mom said that she needed to go to the store to get some celery. The child offered to help the mom by delivering the celery. 
So off the mom and the child went to the store. They bought the celery and then headed back home. The child was so careful when carrying the celery, scared it would drop! 
When they arrived home, the mother said, "Thank you for delivering the celery!". Then the child said, "I'm so careful, aren't I?". The mom replied, "Yes, you certainly are, my child".



Once upon a time, there was a happy little boy, who loved to make things. One day, the little boy's mommy gave him some paper, and taught him how to fold it.
The little boy had so much fun folding the paper! He made lots of shapes, like boats and flowers. But his favorite thing to make was a little igloo.
He was so happy and proud of his igloo. He wished he could have a real igloo! But for now, his folded paper igloo would have to do.
The little boy asked his mommy to help him make more folded paper things, and soon he had a whole collection. He was so happy to show off his folded paper creations to his friends. 
The little boy loved to fold, and his mommy was so proud of all the things he had made. Together they folded many things, and made many things, and had lots of fun.




Once upon a time, there was a big fight. Everyone was yelling and screaming. One of the people in the fight got really mad and shouted for everyone to stop. They didn't listen, so the person shouted louder and then let go of a big, loud yell. 
It surprised everyone and that was when they stopped fighting. The person who shouted felt really proud and happy. They had released their loud noise and the fight was over. 
Everyone thanked the person for helping to stop the fight. They asked if the person could help them with other fights too. The person smiled and said yes! Then, everyone gave the person a big hug. That was the end of the big fight.



Once upon a time there was a lonely tool. He was very bored because he was all alone. He wanted to make something to do so he decided to paint his home.
The tool got a paint brush and some paint. He pushed the brush into the paint and began to make dots and strokes. He made a rainbow of colors to brighten up his house.
When he was finished, the paint was dry and his home was beautiful. He was so happy and proud of his work. The lonely tool lifted up his brush and smiled at the beautiful art he had made.
From that day on, the lonely tool never felt lonely again. Every day he would paint something new and fill his house with beauty and fun.

Once upon a time there was a brave knight. He carried a heavy shield with him wherever he went. He kept it clean and shiny.
One day, the knight was on a long journey when it started to rain. He looked around for a place to take shelter. He spotted a cave and decided to hide there.
He was about to enter the cave, when he noticed something shining inside. He entered and saw a golden shield on the ground. But it was very dirty! He took out his cloth and started to clean the shield.
He worked very hard, repeating the same motion over and over. He rubbed and polished the shield until it was as bright as the sun. The brave knight was so proud of his job!
He picked up the clean shield and walked away, with a big smile on his face.




Once upon a time, a little girl called Elle was walking around her garden and she saw the earth. She thought to herself how amazing it was. She looked up at the sky and noticed the clouds. She decided to plan a big adventure.
Elle thought about flying up to the clouds, so she could see what was up there. She needed to find a way to travel that was flexible and could quickly get her from the ground to the sky.
The little girl smiled as she spotted a tree in the garden with branches like long arms reaching up to the sky. She set to work, building a special flying machine out of twigs and leaves.
When she had finished building it, Elle held onto her special creation and felt the wind blow against her cheeks. The flexible machine took Elle up, up and away, higher and higher until she reached the clouds.
Up in the sky, Elle saw the most beautiful views of the earth. She waved goodbye to the ground and was sad when it was time to fly back home. But she had planned her special adventure, and she was very happy as she floated back down to her garden.




Once there was a little girl. She was very sad because she had done something wrong. She was scared and didnt know what to do.
Suddenly she saw a light from the window and it felt like it was coming from the sky. It filled her heart with warmth and she started to feel better.
She realised that it was time to forgive herself. She ran outside and saw that the sky was full of gas that shone like stars in the night. She realised that forgiveness was everywhere and it made her feel better.
The little girl smiled. She knew that forgiving herself was the right thing to do. From that moment on she was happy, and felt like she had been forgiven.




Mommy saw her baby walking near the pond and she warned him not to go near it. She said it wasn't safe. Baby's big brother was nearby and was very dependable. He had heard mommy's warning too, so he watched baby very carefully.
Suddenly, the baby saw a frog in the grass and started to run towards it. The big brother quickly warned baby to stop and said that mommy said not to go near the pond. Baby listened and stopped running. He was so glad that his big brother was there to warn him and help him stay safe.
Mommy was very happy to have a dependable big brother to help with her baby. Not only was he warn her when she wasn't nearby, but he also warned the baby to keep him safe. Mommy thanked her big brother and gave him lots of hugs and kisses.




One day, there was a weird tiger. It was walking in the park. There were two children, Emma and Ben. They saw the tiger and they were so excited. They watched the tiger as it walked in the park. The tiger was so cool!
The tiger then stopped. It started to roar very loudly. Emma and Ben were scared but they couldn't look away. They kept watching the tiger. The tiger started to run around in circles. It was so fun to watch.
After a few minutes, the tiger stopped running. Ben and Emma laughed and said goodbye to the tiger. They waved as their parents took them away.
The tiger watched them go, too. It was so weird to see such a cool animal watching them go! But it was a very special moment for Emma and Ben. They will always remember the cool and weird tiger!




Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog. He was so happy that he was always smiling.
One day he found a bottle and it said "spray me!". He sprayed it around, and it made a rainbow in the sky.
The rainbow spelled out the word "reward" in the sky. The dog was so excited and barked with joy.
He waited and waited and then a big box of treats fell from the sky!The dog was so happy he did a happy dance around the treats.
He ate the treats and ran around being jolly again. He learned that when he sprayed the bottle, he got a big reward.




Zara was very enthusiastic. She wanted to try sewing with a needle.
So Zara asked her mom for a needle. Mom said yes, and gave her the needle.
Zara studied the needle carefully. Then she started to sew some old pieces of fabric. She was so excited!
But sewing with a needle was much harder than she thought. She kept pricking her finger, so she stopped for a bit and sucked her finger.
Mom saw Zara trying her best, and said, "You're so determined. You can do it!" 
Encouraged by her mom's words, Zara picked up the needle and kept sewing. Soon, she had made a beautiful blanket! She was so proud of her achievement and ran to show her mom. 
Mom was so impressed, and said, "You did it! You're the best!" 
Zara was overjoyed, and hugged her mom in happiness. Now she could make anything with a needle!




Nina and her dad were in the country. They were looking at a stable. It seemed old, like it had been there for a long time.
Nina and her dad went inside the stable. It looked unusual. There were lots of animals in there, and they made lots of funny noises. Some of the animals seemed friendly, and some the animals seemed a bit scared.
Nina's dad went to find the farmer to ask him some questions. Nina looked around and saw that the stable seemed safe. She decided to stay and look at the animals. She talked to them and even gave them some food.
When her dad returned, he looked happy. He said the farmer seemed nice, and the animals were healthy and happy. The stable seemed stable, and Nina and her dad felt good about leaving the animals there.




Once there was a bridge. It was very big and wide. One day, two people came to the bridge. One was selfish and the other was kind.
The selfish person wanted to come first. The kind person said, "No, let me come first." But the selfish person did not listen and stepped onto the bridge.
Suddenly, the kind person shouted "Stop!" The bridge was shaking and cracking. But the selfish person did not listen. He kept walking across the bridge.
Eventually, the bridge fell down. The selfish person was stuck there and the kind person was safe. The selfish person soon learnt not to be so selfish!




Once there was a boy named Tom and he wanted to go to the beach. He saw an interesting boat in the water and he wanted to join the boat. He asked his mom if he could join and she said yes.
Tom was so excited and he ran towards the boat and hopped onboard. The boat took him through the water and Tom thought it was so much fun. He watched the water and he saw some fish swimming in the sea.
The boat then stopped and Tom saw a beautiful island. The captain said they were going to explore the island. Tom went ashore with the crew and they went hiking and exploring.
They found some interesting plants, animals and rocks. It was the most fun Tom had ever had and he didn't want the day to end. When it was time to go back to shore, Tom sat in the boat and sailed back to the harbor. He couldn't wait to join the boat again.



Once upon a time there was a big dream. Every night the dream would provide a special adventure to a little girl. One night she dreamed of going to a special land filled with grand castles and big animals. 
The little girl was so excited and she couldn't wait to go exploring! She traveled through the enchanted forest filled with singing birds and friendly bunnies. Later she came across a big river with a rainbow bridge for her to cross. 
The girl was so happy to explore the new land and she soon found a grand castle made of colourful glass. She went inside and discovered that a friendly dragon had been living there all along. The dragon was happy to provide the girl with a wonderful gift - a beautiful sparkly wand! 
The little girl smiled and thanked the dragon. She then waved goodbye, hopped on the rainbow bridge and returned home. 
The little girl kept visiting the big dream night after night. The dream always provided her with new adventures, new friends and so much fun!




Once upon a time there was a popular shark. He liked to hop around the ocean. He told everyone he met about how much he liked to hop. 
One day he saw a fish swimming around and he really wanted to play with it. He asked the fish if it wanted to hop with him. 
The fish said yes and they both started to hop around the ocean. They had so much fun together. Everywhere they hopped, the fish and the shark laughed. 
Soon they became very good friends and loved hopping together. The shark was so happy that he had found a new friend to hop with.
Finally, when it was time to go home, the fish and the shark waved goodbye and hopped off in different directions. They both looked forward to the next time they could hop together!




Once upon a time there was a girl. The girl was wearing a skirt. She wanted to sharpen her pencil, but she was having trouble. The pencil was so tough, she couldn't make it sharp. Suddenly, an idea came to her! She took her skirt and used it to sharpen the pencil. She was so happy when it became sharp. She used it to draw a picture of herself, wearing her skirt. And she lived happily ever after.



Once there was a special caterpillar. It was incredible. The caterpillar had magical powers. One day, the caterpillar felt like something special. So it used its magical powers to buy something special.
The caterpillar bought a big bubble. Inside the bubble were sparkles and rainbows. It was beautiful. The caterpillar was so happy with its purchase. 
It hopped around the garden, showing off its sparkly bubble. All its friends oohed and aahed in amazement. 
The caterpillar was so proud. It was incredible. It happily flew away with its magical bubble. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy who was very frightened. He was walking with his mommy in the park one day. Suddenly, he saw something scary - a spike! He jumped and started to cry, so his mommy gave him a hug.
The little boy was scared and very curious. He stepped closer to the spike to see what it was. But then something strange happened- the spike started to disappear! He couldn't believe his eyes! His mommy said it was a magic spike and couldn't be seen anymore.
The little boy was happy and excited. He couldn't wait to tell everyone his story. He wanted everyone to know about the magic spike that can disappear. He ran around and shouted to all of his friends what had happened.
It was the best day ever! The little boy had seen a magic spike and kept a happy memory of it. He was no longer scared and would never forget the spike that had made him feel so special.



Once upon a time there was a puppy with a sweet, scruffy fur collar. He had four furry paws and always wanted to go faster and faster. One day, he chased a rabbit and ran so fast that his collar flew off and he lost it. He whined sadly, he wanted his collar back.
Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was the rabbit! He had found the collar and put it around his neck. "It's all right, I found it again," the rabbit said. The puppy was so happy, he gave the rabbit a big wet lick on the nose and ran around in circles! They ran faster and faster, the rabbit holding on to the collar so it wouldn't disappear again.
The rabbit and puppy became best friends, running and playing together all the time. Whenever the puppy went a little too fast and the collar began to slide off, the rabbit was always there to put it back around his neck. His sweet, scruffy fur collar stayed with him forever.




Once upon a time, there lived a dependable star. She shined brightly every night and was an important part of the night sky. 
One day someone asked the star why she never lied. She smiled and said it was because she was dependable.
One night, another star came and asked her why she was so dependable. She said it was because it made her happy. The other star thought she was silly, so he decided to try lying. 
The star tried to lie, but he just couldn't do it. He was too used to being dependable. So, he decided to stick to being honest just like the first star. 
They both shone together in the night sky, dependable and happy.




One morning, the sun rose in the sky. It was a peaceful sunrise, with birds singing and animals playing.
Mama and Daddy were in the kitchen, talking in low voices. Mama had caught Sammy, the little boy, breaking something in the house. She was telling Daddy that Sammy needed to learn he couldn't break things. 
Daddy agreed with Mama, and said that Sammy needed to be punished. So they made a plan.
The next day, they took Sammy outside when the sun rose. Sammy was confused, but they said they were going to have a special lesson. On the grass, they had Sammy write with a stick, 'I must not break things.' All morning Sammy wrote this, so he would remember. By the time the sun was high in the sky, Sammy was done writing. 
Mama and Daddy looked at the words. They said Sammy had been punished, and now he must always remember to be careful. Sammy nodded, and said he would. 
Mama and Daddy hugged Sammy. Then they all went inside, happy and together.




Mia was so excited - she was going to pick out a special dress for her birthday! She could hardly wait. She hopped in the car with her mom, who was very compassionate about Mia's big day.
When they finally got to the shop, Mia's eyes lit up. There were so many beautiful dresses! She asked her mom to help her pick the best one. After much deliberation, Mia chose a bright pink dress with sparkly sequins - she knew it was perfect.
Mia's mom paid for the dress, and they headed home. Mia couldn't wait to show everyone the dress she had chosen. When they got home, Mia put on her beautiful new dress and twirled around. Everyone oohed and ahhed at how pretty she looked.
Mia was so happy - she had the perfect dress for such a special day. She was so thankful to her mom for being so compassionate and helping to make her birthday extra special.




Once upon a time, there was a mosquito. He was very popular with the other animals in the forest. Everywhere he went, the other animals wanted to be near him. One day, he wanted to have some fun, so he started to bite the animals. The animals didn't like this very much and shouted, "stop!" But the mosquito just kept going. He liked the way it felt to bite people. In the end, the animals had to find a new way to keep the mosquito from biting them. They decided to give him a special place in the forest that was just for him, and this made the mosquito happy. So, the mosquito and the other animals lived happily ever after.




Once upon a time there was a young girl called Rosa. Every day, she loved to mail her letters to her friends. One day, Rosa wanted to mail a very special letter. But when she arrived at the post office, it was closed. She was so upset!
Just then, her friend Bob arrived with a brilliant idea. He said that he could help her by putting the letter down the sink! Rosa thought it was a good idea, so she thanked Bob and carefully put the letter down the sink. 
The next day, they waited and waited. But the letter never came out of the sink. Rosa was so angry! She thought Bob was being selfish, putting her letter in the sink on purpose. 
But then, suddenly, the sink made a loud noise and the letter popped out! Rosa was so happy. She hugged Bob and thanked him for his help. From then on, she never forgot to thank Bob for being so kind.



Danny liked playing with his friends and he had so many new toys. One day he decided to get a new video game. He was so excited as he was caught in the moment. 
He asked his dad if he could buy the video game and his dad said yes. So Danny went to the store and began picking out the best video game he could find. 
Then Danny went to the checkout and paid for the video game. As he was walking home with the new video game, he was so excited. 
Meanwhile, his dad was getting grumpy waiting for Danny to come home. As soon as Danny arrived home, he showed his dad the video game. His dad was then so happy, he forgot how grumpy he had been and told Danny to go play with it. 
Danny thanked his dad and went to his room to play the game, as he was so happy with his decision.




Billy loved going to the gym with his mom and dad. There was always yummy food there, like apples and oranges. He would clap and laugh whenever he saw them. But sometimes he would complain because he was so excited to get there. 
One day, Billy's mom and dad packed a picnic lunch for their family outing. Billy was so happy! He kept saying, "Yummy food!" He wanted to eat the food right away, but his mom and dad said he had to wait until after the gym. 
Billy complained, but he knew his parents said no for a reason. When they arrived at the gym, Benny's dad showed him how to do some cool tricks like cartwheels. He ran and jumped and laughed the whole time. He forgot all about his lunch and the complaining he did earlier. 
At the end of the day, Billy was tired but happy. And when he finally got to eat the yummy food his mom and dad packed, he gobbled it up! He loved going to the gym with his parents, even when he had to complain sometimes.



 
Once there was a knob. It was perfect and round and shining. But the knob was embarrassed. Whenever someone walked by, it hid away in shame. 
One day, a child stepped in front of the knob. She reached out and touched it with her tiny hand. The knob felt a warmth deep inside, and it no longer felt embarrassed.
The child smiled and said "I like you knob. You are perfect the way you are". She turned the knob and opened the door. Now they were friends forever!




Once there was a girl who liked to dance. She liked to turn and twirl with her best friend. Every day they would dance together and have so much fun.
One day the girl's friend noticed her waist was so hard that she couldn't move quickly. She was very sad, for she knew that she could not dance like before. The girl's friend wanted to help, so she turned to the girl and said let me help. Here, lets do some hard exercises.
The girl did not want to at first, but her friend said, It will make your waist stronger, so you can twirl and turn again!
The girl listened to her friend, and did the hard exercises. Every day they would stretch and bend, but the girl was getting so much stronger. Finally, one day the girl was able to turn and twirl again! She was so happy and thanked her friend for all the help! The two girls danced together again and enjoyed their friendship.




Once there was a little girl named Lisa. She was three years old. She wanted to do something cool and she was hoping to find something fun. 
One day , Lisa saw a jog happening in the park. She thought it looked like a lot of fun and she decided to join the jog. Everyone there was happy and running. 
Lisa started to jog but it was hard to keep up. She kept running and eventually she was able to match the pace of the jog. Everyone cheered and Lisa felt happy.
She jogged with her friends and it felt so cool. They all laughed and smiled and when they were done, Lisa couldn't wait to go back the next day. She hoped every day would be like this. 
The End.




Once, there was a smelly sock. It wanted to make a sound, so it decided to fold itself. It folded and it folded, until it was a tiny, tiny sock. Then, it made a sound - a loud, smelly sound! Everyone was surprised and laughed at the sock. The sock was so proud of making that funny sound! It stayed folded up, enjoying the sound it made. From then on, it always folded itself when it wanted to make that funny sound.



 One morning, a round and wide sun sat in the bluest sky. Its warmth remained with the ground and made the day nice. A family of three went outside to enjoy the sun. Among them was a three-year-old girl. She was very eager to explore what remained around her. So my the family set off. They walked through a wide field until they saw a tall, round hill. It looked so high that they had to remain where they were. But then the little girl remained determined and started to climb the hill. One by one they climbed, until they made it to the top. From there, they could see round and wide fields and the sun still remained in the sky. The little girl smiled in joy. The family could spend the whole day there, and it remained a perfect sunny day.




Once there was a little monkey named Moncey. She liked to explore and find things. One day, Moncey was exploring far away and she noticed a big barrel. Moncey climbed on top of the barrel and started pushing and pulling it. 
Suddenly, the barrel moved and Moncey was so surprised! She had revealed an incredible secret. Inside the barrel was a hidden tunnel. Inside the tunnel, Moncey found a bunch of bananas and delicious treats. She was so excited she started eating right away! 
Moncey had an incredible adventure that day. She was glad she revealed the special barrel because it had revealed something very special to her.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Molly. She was only three years old and she wanted something very special. One day her mommy and daddy offered her a beautiful cushion. It was fluffy and pink and very adorable. Molly was so happy and hugged it tight. She carried it around everywhere, even to her friend's houses. 
Her friends wanted one too and so Molly happily offered hers to them. They all had so much fun playing with their cushions and trying to make the softest and cuddliest one. After a while, the friends put them away, thanked Molly and said goodbye. 
Molly took her cushion home and proudly showed it to her mommy and daddy. They told her that she had been a very kind and generous girl. Molly smiled and went to bed with her cushion. She had the nicest dreams about her cute, adorable cushion. The end.




Once there was a girl named Alice. She loved to sing. Every morning she would wake up singing. One day Alice wanted something sweet. So she went to the kitchen and found a big delicious pie. It was so yummy that she couldn't wait to sing her song.
Alice started singing and dancing around the kitchen. She was so happy that she spun around and around. But when she spun, her hands got wet and she dropped the pie. It fell right into a big puddle on the floor.
Alice was sad. She thought that she had ruined the lovely pie. But then something magical happened. Alice looked down and the pie had changed into a bunch of yummy little pies! She was so excited that she started singing again.
Alice was so happy that she invited all her friends over to share the delicious pies. They all sang together and it was so much fun. The pies made everyone happy, even when it was wet outside. What a fun day it was!



Once upon a time there was a kind mommy. Every day she would pray to God. One day she wanted to do something special for her daughter. So, she went to the store and bought her a pretty black belt. 
The next day she gave it to her daughter and said "This is from mommy. Wear it when you go outside and pray every night." The little girl was very happy and thanked her mommy for being so kind. 
From then on, the little girl would wear her belt and every night she'd pray to God. She thanked Him for her mommy, her belt and all the good things in her life. And as time passed, she started to see just how much God loves her.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. 
One day, she went outside to play and found a mosquito. She wanted to tie the mosquito, so she found a piece of string and tied it around the mosquito's feet. 
The next day, she decided to take her mosquito for a picnic. She spread a blanket and tied a delicious sandwich to the blanket. She then tied the mosquito next to the sandwich so it could enjoy the picnic, too. 
Sally and the mosquito spent the rest of the day eating the delicious sandwich and enjoying the summer sunshine. They had a wonderful time together!

Her mum said, "we mustn't delay!" but Grace wanted to keep exploring until she knew what the pattern was. 
Eventually, Grace realized the pattern was made up of tiny little shapes and it made a big picture. She was so excited and told her family all about it. They were all very proud of her adventurous discovery. From then on, Grace didn't delay - she explored everything that she could find!




Once upon a time, a little boy named Tommy was walking outside. It was a sunny day and Tommy felt happy. He walked for a few minutes until he saw a big grocery store. He had never seen it before! He was very curious so he walked in.
Inside the grocery store, Tommy saw lots of interesting things. There were little red apples that looked smooth and shiny, bags of potatoes, and lots of colorful boxes. His eyes sparkled as he looked around. Then, something else appeared! He saw a push cart that was full of groceries. He wanted to go closer and see them, so he slowly walked over. 
The groceries in the cart looked yummy! He saw sweet oranges, giant bananas, and juicy apples. Tommy reached out to touch them, but he was careful to be gentle. Suddenly, a big smile appeared on his face. He wanted to take the groceries home with him! 
So Tommy carefully started loading the groceries into a small bag. When he was done, he stood up and saw he had his own bag full of smooth and yummy groceries. He was so happy. Tommy tucked the bag of groceries under his arm and headed home!




Once upon a time there was a large pony. The pony lived in a field near a big hill. Every day the pony grazed in the field and was happy. Then one day it began to rain. The pony snuggled under a bush to keep warm and dry. After a while the rain stopped and the sky cleared. The pony went into the field and rolled in the wet grass. When it was done it looked so big and shiny. The pony stayed in the field until the sun set behind the big hill. Then it trotted back home and went to sleep.




Once there was a mother and daughter. The daughter loved to explore the world. Everywhere she went she found interesting objects. Today, her mother wanted to encourage her to explore the nearby woods. 
The mother was a bit worried since she had never been this far before. She smiled at her daughter and said in a gentle voice, "Let's go explore the woods. I'm sure we'll see something lovely there."
They set off on their adventure and soon they started to see things they hadn't seen before. They could hear birds singing from the treetops and discover different kinds of rocks and leaves. Then, they came upon a pond.
In the pond, the daughter was delighted to see a frog. The mother chuckled as her daughter ran to get a closer look.
Together, they spent the time exploring and observing the different objects their eyes found. When the sun started to set, the daughter thanked her mother for encouraging her on this lovely adventure. The mother smiled, happy that her daughter had such a wonderful day.




Two friends, Bob and Bill, were walking through the park. Suddenly, they saw a big robot! Bob was excited, so he seated himself next to the robot. Bill was worried about getting too close.
They asked the robot what it was doing. To their surprise, the robot said it was unhappy. It said it was feeling very bitter. Its computer heart was sad.
Bob and Bill were sad, too. They wanted to help. So, Bob gave the robot a big hug, and Bill found it a comfortable seat. The robot thanked them and smiled.
Bob and Bill were happy to have helped the robot. They waved goodbye and walked away, feeling much better.




Once upon a time, there was a happy, wealthy pup named Lucy. One day, Lucy's mommy decided to take her to the veterinarian to get her a check-up. 
At the veterinarian, Lucy was a bit scared, but the vet soon made her feel better by giving her lots of petting and attention. The veterinarian was very nice and asked Mommy if she would like to invite Lucy back for a check-up next month!
