Lucy's mommy happily accepted the invitation and thanked the veterinarian for her kind offer. She was even more thankful when the veterinarian suggested that Lucy may not need to come back next month since she was very healthy. 
Mommy and Lucy thanked the vet once again before heading home. They were both very happy that the vet had invited them back for a check-up in the future. Lucy's mommy was especially pleased that her pup was in such good health! 
The end.




The sun shone brightly in the sky. John and his dad were going to the park. They walked to the park and when they arrived, they saw lots of tall trees and grass. 
John liked the park very much. He ran over to the big wood and saw who was there. It was a fierce tiger! John was scared but his dad wasn't scared. His dad was brave. He took a big step towards the tiger and the tiger ran away. 
John and his dad were now alone in the park. They walked through the wood and saw lots of different animals. John and his dad had a great time. When it was time to go home, they said goodbye to the park.




Once there were two space adventurers, called Jack and Jill. They wanted to explore the entire universe, so they set off in their space ship.
They soon came upon a strange planet. It was very dark and the natives were suffering. Jack and Jill were very enthusiastic to help the people, so they started to do a lot of good deeds.
At first, the people were very shy and scared. But then Jill showed them a magic trick. The people were so amazed that they opened up their hearts.
Jack and Jill spent many months with the people, and soon the planet was happy and joyful. The two adventurers had truly made a difference.
Jack and Jill were very proud of themselves and thanked the universe for the chance to help others and make a difference.




Once there was a little rabbit who wanted to go on an adventure. He saw a big, yellow door that had an exit sign above it. He was very excited. He stood up on his two little feet and hopped over to the door. He opened it and hopped through. 
On the other side, he discovered a magical land. The sky was orange and the sun was so warm. He looked around and saw that there were lots of creatures and plants. He hopped around, exploring the new and exciting place. 
He discovered a small lake in the middle of the magical land. In the lake was a boat, so he hopped in and rowed around. 
The boat led him to a creative tree, which had different coloured fruits growing on it. The little rabbit was amazed. He ate some of the fruits and they all tasted wonderful. He felt very happy and creative.
Suddenly, he spotted the same yellow door that he had come through, so he hopped out of the boat and stood up on his two little feet. He waved goodbye to the magical land and then hopped through the door. He had had the most wonderful adventure and he could not wait to tell all his friends about it.



Jim was a curious boy. He always wanted to know what others thought. One day, he went to his friend's house. He thought it was nice. He asked his friend what he thought about it. His friend said he thought it was very nice. Jim was happy that his friend shared his opinion.
Later in the day, Jim and his friend went to the park. Jim was very curious about the park. He looked around and wanted to know what his friend thought of the park. His friend said it was fun. Jim was glad that his friend shared his opinion.
On their way home, Jim was still curious. He wanted to know what his friend thought of their time together. His friend said he had a great time. Jim smiled because his friend shared his opinion. 
He realized that everyone has an opinion - but it's up to us to think and make decisions. Being curious is a good thing!




Once upon a time there was a mighty backyard. On one side of the backyard was a big tree and on the other side was a slide. Every day a boy would come out to play in the backyard. He'd climb up the tree, slide down the other side, then climb back up again. The boy had to be very careful as he balanced on the branch of the tree - he knew if he fell off he would get a bump.
But the boy was brave and was determined to show how mighty he was. One day, the boy reached the top of the tree and stood up on the branch. Everyone in the backyard cheered as the boy balanced perfectly on the branch. They thought he was the bravest and mightiest of them all.
The boy stayed balanced on the branch of the tree for as long as he could, then realised it was time to get down as it was getting dark. He jumped down and everyone cheered and congratulated him - he had done it!
The boy felt so proud of himself as he ran around the backyard, showing everyone his mighty balancing skills. From then on, the boy was known as the 'Balance Master' of the backyard!



Once there was a little girl named Sally. Sally wanted to explore the jungle. It was a rough jungle, and Sally wasn't sure if she could do it. But she decided to try. 
Sally started walking through the jungle. She had to step over roots and climb over rocks. Sally tried not to get scared. She kept going and going until she eventually found a den of animals.
Sally was not sure what to do. She was scared, but she wanted to try to get closer to them. She carefully took one step at a time until she was right in front of them. 
Suddenly, the animals started jumping around! Sally was surprised and a little bit scared, but she kept trying until they calmed down.
And just like that, Sally had made it through the rough jungle. She was so happy that she had made it. She had learned that she could do anything if she just tried!




Once there was an ordinary girl named Sarah. Sarah loved collecting things to put in her stomach. Every day she would go around the house and find something special to collect.
On one special day she found something bigger and more special than she had ever seen before. It was a huge bird! She quickly tried to collect it but it was too big for her stomach.
So Sarah tried something different - she collected some of its feathers! One red feather, one yellow feather, one purple feather and one black feather. She put the feathers in her tiny stomach and they fit perfectly!
Sarah smiled as she continued her collection around the house. She loved collecting things, especially when they fit in her stomach!



Once upon a time, there was a kind man. He had a pet rabbit and he fed it every day. The rabbit was very happy because the man always gave it something yummy.
One day, the man decided he wanted to see what was behind the big door. He opened the door and saw a big garden with lots of carrots!
He decided to gather some carrots and take them home to feed to his rabbit. The rabbit was so excited and the man was so happy he could make his pet happy. 
The man and the rabbit enjoyed the carrots together. They both had a wonderful time and were very happy. The kind man continued to feed his pet and they both lived very contentedly ever after!




Cathy was a nosy little girl. She loved to explore and she was always curious. One day when she was playing in the park she saw a lemon! It was yellow and round and it was on the ground.
Cathy was so excited. She picked up the lemon, held it tightly and started to dance. She twirled around the park, spinning and laughing!
The other people at the park saw Cathy dancing and laughed too. They thought she was so cute and happy. Everyone started to dance with her and soon the park was filled with people!
By the time Cathy had finished, the lemon was squished. But she still had fun, and everyone else did too!




Once upon a time there were two best friends who liked to play together. The friends were named Bob and Sue. Bob always had a big smile on his face and Sue had bright, twinkly eyes. They loved playing together and shared everything.
One day, Bob and Sue wanted to do something special, so they decided to unite by joining their necks together with a scarf. They held hands and began to spin in circles, until their necks were united. The scarf was a bright yellow and had many sparkles. It was a safe way for them to be together forever.
They kept their heads close and giggled as their heads spun. Sue and Bob shared more stories together and sang songs until they were both very happy.
Now Sue and Bob are always together, and no matter how far apart they are, they will always be united.




Once there was a tall ranch. It was a happy farm with lots of animals. On this ranch there lived a little girl named Rosa. Every day her mommy would take her to the ranch to play. 
They would go and play with the rabbits, the chickens, the ducks and all the other animals. Rosa would follow the animals around, talking to them as if they were her friends. 
Rosa's mommy would bring her a lunch and the two of them would eat it in the grass next to the barn. They would watch the animals play and when it was time to go home, Rosa's mommy would take her hand and they would say goodbye to all their animal friends. 
Rosa went to the tall ranch every day and every day she had lots of fun. She never tired of playing with the animals and watching them have fun.



Mummy and Little John were in the living room. Little John was so excited because they were going to play a game. Mummy said, "Let's play 'Stir the Pot'!"
Little John smiled and clapped his hands. He picked up a big spoon and began to stir the pot. He stirred it round and round, faster and faster. Then Mummy took her turn. She was so good at stirring the pot, she made it move so quickly!
Little John was getting restless. He wanted to stir the pot again, so he did. He stirred and stirred until the pot was full of sugary sweets. Then he and Mummy shared them and giggled as they ate.
Little John enjoyed the game so much. He couldn't wait to play again!




Once upon a time there was a naughty little boy. He did not listen to his parents and often made messes. One day his mum went to the field to get some wheat. She asked the naughty boy to help her lift the wheat, but he didn't want to!
Finally, the naughty boy agreed to help, but not without a bit of grumbling. He carefully lifted the big bags of wheat and carried them to the wagon. It was hard work, but he did it!
Mum was very pleased with the naughty little boy for helping her, and rewarded him with an ice cream. He smiled and knew that helping was the right thing to do.



Once there was a little girl named Lucy who liked to go on adventures. She put on her most adventurous clothes, which made her feel so happy. She went outside and looked around. Everywhere she looked, she saw amazing things. She saw a tree that was so tall it seemed to touch the sky. She saw a park full of kids playing games and laughing. She even saw a little bird chirping in a nearby bush.
Lucy smiled and kept exploring. She climbed on the trees, jumped on the swings and rode around on her bike. Everywhere she went she saw something new and exciting. She was having the best day ever.
At the end of the day, Lucy went back home. She took off her adventurous clothes and put on her pajamas. She hopped into bed feeling content and happy. She closed her eyes and kept on smiling as she drifted off to sleep.




Once upon a time there was a bird called Kelly. She was small and very brave. She lived in a small cage near the house. Every day she looked out the bars of her cage, dreaming of escape.
One day, a boy named Andy found Kelly's cage and said, "I will help you!" Kelly was so excited, she couldn't believe her luck. Andy promised Kelly he would help set her free from the house.
That night, Andy and Kelly worked together to make a plan. The plan was crazy and it seemed impossible. But Kelly was brave and she believed in Andy. Together they worked to set up the plan.
Suddenly, it was time to make their escape. Kelly looked to Andy and he nodded. Then they were away, flying through the night. Kelly was free and she had Andy to thank. 
Andy had kept his promise to Kelly. Andy had helped Kelly to escape, and Kelly was now happy and free.




Once there was a little girl named Clara. She was very small, but she knew a lot of things. Every morning she would go out and whistle. She would look up at the planet in the sky.
One day, she saw something very strange. It was a big, red planet with rings around it. Clara was very curious. She thought and thought about what it could be.
She decided to ask someone. She met a very friendly old man who was sitting nearby. When she asked him what the planet was, the old man whistled with delight.
He told her it was Saturn, and it was very special in the sky. He said it was good to be thoughtful when looking up at the stars. Clara smiled and thanked him for the knowledge.
The next day, she went outside and whistled with joy. She looked up at Saturn and thought about what the old man had told her. She was so thankful for being able to see this special planet every day.




Once upon a time, there were two best friends named Eddie and Lola. They were always playing together. 
One day, Eddie had a nice new shirt. He asked Lola to help him button the front of it, but she was too small. Eddie was getting frustrated, so Lola asked her big brother to help. 
He was happy to serve and quickly buttoned the shirt. Eddie thanked him, but then he felt embarrassed because Lola's brother was so much bigger and stronger than him. 
Lola saw how embarrassed Eddie was and gave him a big hug. Eddie smiled and they all laughed together. From then on, Eddie and Lola both knew that they could always ask each other to help when they needed it.



 
Once upon a time there was a tidy little hut in the middle of a meadow. It was big enough for one little bear and it was just perfect for him. 
One day, the bear saw an orange and blue bird spread its wings and soar away. The little bear wanted to spread his wings like that, so he ran to the meadow and tried to do it. He flapped his arms and jumped but nothing worked. He got very frustrated and decided to go back to his hut.
When he got back, he noticed something strange. His hut was surrounded by colorful rocks, flowers and twigs. He noticed that the birds had helped him spread some decorations around the hut! His hut suddenly became much brighter and much more inviting. The bear was so happy and thanked the birds for making his hut so tidy and beautiful. 
And that's how the little bear's tidy hut spread its joy around the meadow!




Once upon a time there was a helpful king. Every day the king would help all the people in his kingdom. One day the king paused and looked out at his kingdom. He saw how happy everyone was with his help. He suddenly had an idea. He wanted to try something new to help his people even more. 
So, the king went off and gathered some supplies. Then, he came back and started to build something special. Everyone stopped to watch and wondered what the king was doing. 
When the king finished, he had made a big playground for the children. Everyone was so happy to have a place to play and be happy. They all thanked the king for being so helpful. 
The king smiled and said "you are all welcome". Then he paused and smiled at all the children playing in the playground. He was so happy that he had done something to help them.




Once upon a time there was a nice boot. It was very popular! Everyone wanted one. One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to read about the boot. She got out her special book and started to read. 
She found out that the boot was very good for jumping and running. She loved the idea of jumping and running in a boot. She wanted to go outside and try it right away! 
So Lucy went outside to play with the boot. She finally realized why it was so popular. She jumped so high and ran so fast in them! After that she read all the time about the boot and became even more popular. And they all lived happily ever after.




Once there was a cute little girl named Lilly. Lilly had just turned three and her mom and dad wanted to give her a special present. So they gave her a microscope!
Lilly was so excited to have her very own microscope, so she could look at tiny things. She asked her mom and dad to help her use it, and they were happy to support her. 
Lilly spent all day looking at things through her microscope, like a spider on a leaf, a bug on the windowsill, and even the dust on her carpet! She was so curious and amazed by what she saw!
When it was time for bed, Lilly went to sleep dreaming about all the tiny things that were now visible to her. Thanks to her parents' support, Lilly now knew how amazing the world was, even to the tiniest detail.




Timmy went to the store. He saw all the different yogurts. The yogurts were very colorful and looked yummy. He wanted to get something, but he couldn't decide what to get. 
Then he saw a clear yogurt. It looked special, so he picked it up. He took it to the cashier and paid for it. 
He opened the yogurt as soon as he was outside the store. The clear yogurt was sweet and delicious. Timmy ate it all and smiled. He loves going to the store to get yogurt!



Once upon a time there was a girl. She was very excited because she wanted to see a new country. She packed her suitcase full of things and set off. She went to the airport, boarded the plane and soon arrived in the new country.
When she got there she opened the door to the outside world. It felt very easy and she smiled. She looked around and saw lots of interesting buildings and people.
She loved exploring and opened every door that she saw. She saw gardens, farms and rivers. She opened a door and saw some animals, like cows and horses.
Finally, it was time for her to go home. She said goodbye to the new country and went back to the airport. She smiled all the way home and couldn't wait to go back and explore the country again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Isabelle. She was a very special girl and she had a very special dress. It was a beautiful pink dress with lots of frills and lace.
Isabelle was very happy when her mommy put it on her. She looked in the mirror and smiled. But then, suddenly, she heard a whisper. She got so nervous!
The whisper was coming from somewhere in the room. Isabelle felt scared but she decided to find out what was going on. She slowly walked over to the corner of the room.
And there, she found a little mouse! The mouse was wearing a tiny red dress and it was jumping up and down and whispering stories. Isabelle felt so excited and she whispered back.
The little mouse smiled. From that day on, Isabelle and the mouse were very special friends. They would whisper stories to each other every day. And Isabelle always wore her beautiful pink dress.




Mrs. Smith looked at the little girl. She was only 3 years old, so it was important that Mrs. Smith taught her carefully.
First, Mrs. Smith helped the girl stand. She was a bit clumsy and wobbled a bit, but Mrs. Smith held her hand.
Slowly, Mrs. Smith guided the girl's feet. She showed her how to step forwards and then back. The girl smiled and tried to do it again. Mrs. Smith smiled too and said, "Good job! That was great!"
Then Mrs. Smith taught the girl how to turn around. She put her little arm in the air and spun it around and around. Mrs. Smith showed her again and said, "Now it's your turn!"
The girl smiled and spun around. The view had changed! She laughed, delighted. She spun around again, enjoying the fun of it.
Mrs. Smith was glad she was able to teach the girl something new. She was so excited to learn!




Tom and Sue like to bake with Mom. Mom says they can make a cake today. They get a big bowl and some eggs and flour and sugar. They mix everything with a spoon. Mom puts the bowl in the oven.
Tom and Sue have to wait for the cake to bake. They are bored. They want to play. Mom says they can go for a walk. They put on their shoes and coats. They go outside with Mom. They see a dog. The dog is brown and fluffy. It barks at them. Tom and Sue are scared. Mom says the dog is friendly. She lets them pet the dog. The dog licks their faces. Tom and Sue laugh.
They walk back to the house. They smell something good. The cake is ready. Mom takes it out of the oven. She lets it cool down. She puts some frosting on it. She gives Tom and Sue a slice each. The cake is yummy. It is brown and sweet. Tom and Sue are happy. They say thank you to Mom. They hug her. They love to bake with Mom.




Lila was playing with her dolls in her room. She liked to dress them up in different clothes and make up stories. She had a pink skirt that she wanted to put on her favorite doll, but it was too big. She asked her mom for help.
"Mom, can you make this skirt smaller for my doll?" she said, holding up the skirt.
"Sure, honey, let me see what I can do," her mom said, taking the skirt. "You can play with your other dolls while I finish this."
Lila nodded and went back to her room. She picked up another doll and pretended she was a princess. She gave her a crown and a necklace and a wand. She made her talk to the other dolls and tell them what to do.
After a while, her mom came back with the pink skirt. She had cut it and sewn it to fit the doll. She gave it to Lila and smiled.
"Here you go, sweetie, your skirt is ready. Do you like it?" she said.
Lila was very happy. She took the skirt and put it on her favorite doll. It looked perfect. She hugged her mom and thanked her.
"I love it, mom, thank you so much! You are the best!" she said.
"You're welcome, Lila. I'm glad you like it. Now, why don't you show me your princess doll? She looks very pretty," her mom said.
Lila nodded and ran to her room. She grabbed her princess doll and showed her to her mom. She told her all about her story and what the princess did. Her mom listened and smiled. She liked to see Lila happy and creative.
The princess doll had a pale blue dress and a silver crown. She looked very nice with the pink skirt. Lila thought they were the best friends. She played with them until it was time for dinner. She put them on her bed and kissed them good night. She was very happy with her dolls and her mom. She had a good day.




Lily wanted to wear her new dress to the party. It was pink and had flowers on it. She loved it very much. She put it on and looked at herself in the mirror. She smiled and twirled around.
But then her big sister Anna came in. Anna was mean and liked to tease Lily. She looked at Lily's dress and said, "That dress is too small for you. You look silly. You can't wear it to the party. You need to wear something else."
Lily felt sad and angry. She liked her dress and it fit her well. She did not want to wear something else. She said to Anna, "No, I don't. This is my dress and I can wear it to the party. It is not too small. It is perfect. You are just jealous."
Anna rolled her eyes and said, "Whatever. You can wear your baby dress if you want. But don't come crying to me when everyone laughs at you. You will be the only one who looks like a toddler."
Lily did not listen to Anna. She knew that Anna was wrong and mean. She knew that her dress was beautiful and that her friends would like it too. She grabbed her coat and her bag and ran downstairs. She saw her mom waiting for her in the car. Her mom was dependable and kind. She always supported Lily and made her feel good. She smiled at Lily and said, "You look lovely, sweetie. Are you ready to go to the party?"
Lily nodded and hugged her mom. She said, "Yes, I am. Thank you, mom. I love you and I love my dress." She got in the car and waved goodbye to Anna, who was still in the window, looking sour. Lily did not care what Anna said. She was happy and proud of her dress. She was ready to have fun at the party.




Ben and Mia are twins. They like to play with their toys and wear their vests. Their vests are blue and have a big star on the front. They are the same, but Ben and Mia are different. Ben likes to run and jump and make noise. Mia likes to draw and sing and be quiet.
One day, Ben and Mia are playing in the yard. Ben sees a big rock and kicks it hard. The rock flies and hits Mia's vest. Mia's vest rips and the star falls off. Mia is sad and cries.
"Look what you did!" Mia says to Ben. "You broke my vest! It was my favorite!"
"I'm sorry, Mia," Ben says. "I didn't mean to. It was an accident."
Ben feels bad and wants to make Mia happy. He thinks of a way to repair her vest. He runs inside and gets some glue and some paper. He cuts out a new star from the paper and glues it on Mia's vest. He also draws some flowers and hearts around the star. He brings the vest to Mia and shows her.
"Here, Mia," Ben says. "I fixed your vest. I made it different, but I hope you like it."
Mia looks at her vest and smiles. She sees the new star and the flowers and the hearts. She thinks it is pretty and special. She hugs Ben and thanks him.
"Thank you, Ben," Mia says. "You are a good brother. I like my vest. It is different, but I love it."
Ben and Mia are happy and play together. They wear their vests and show them to their mom and dad. Their mom and dad are proud of them and tell them they are both wonderful. Ben and Mia are twins. They are the same, but they are different. And they love each other.




Anna likes to play with her toys. She has many toys, but her favorite is a fork. She thinks the fork is original. She can use it to make funny shapes in her clay, or to comb her doll's hair, or to pretend it is a sword.
One day, Anna goes to the park with her mom. She brings her fork with her. She sees a big slide and wants to go on it. She runs to the slide and puts her fork in her pocket. She climbs up the ladder and slides down. Whee!
But when she reaches the bottom, she feels something is wrong. She checks her pocket and sees that her fork is gone. She is sad. She looks around and sees a boy holding her fork. He is playing with it in the sand. She runs to him and says, "That is my fork! Give it back!"
The boy looks at her and says, "No, this is my fork. I found it on the slide. It is original. I like it."
Anna is angry. She says, "No, it is not your fork. It is my fork. I brought it from home. It is original. I like it."
The boy and Anna start to argue. They both want the fork. They both think it is original. They both like it.
Mom sees them and comes over. She says, "What is going on here? Why are you fighting?"
Anna and the boy tell her about the fork. They both say it is theirs. They both say it is original. They both say they like it.
Mom looks at the fork and says, "Hmm, this is a tricky situation. How can we solve this problem?"
She thinks for a moment and then says, "I have an idea. Why don't you share the fork? You can take turns playing with it. You can both enjoy its originality. You can both have fun with it."
Anna and the boy look at each other and think. They realize that mom is right. Sharing is better than fighting. They agree to share the fork. They say sorry to each other and smile.
They go to the sandbox and play with the fork together. They make castles and tunnels and cakes. They use the fork to decorate them. They have a lot of fun. They both think the fork is original. They both like it. They both are happy.




Lila and Ben were twins who liked to play together. They had many toys, but their favorite was a big red car that they could ride in the garden. They took turns to drive the car and pretended to go on adventures.
One day, Lila and Ben were playing with the car when they saw a big black dog in the garden. The dog was barking and growling and looked very angry. Lila and Ben were scared and ran back to the house. They told their mom about the dog and she said they had to stay inside until the dog went away.
Lila and Ben were sad and bored. They wanted to play with the car, but they were afraid of the dog. They looked out of the window and saw the dog still in the garden. The dog was sniffing around the car and trying to bite the wheels.
"Mom, the dog is ruining our car!" Lila cried.
"Can we do something, mom?" Ben asked.
Mom thought for a moment. She had an idea. She went to the kitchen and came back with a pill. She said it was a special pill that could make the dog friendly.
"Really, mom?" Lila and Ben asked.
"Yes, really. But you have to be very brave to give the pill to the dog. Do you think you can do it?" Mom asked.
Lila and Ben looked at each other. They nodded. They wanted to save their car and make the dog happy. They took the pill from mom and went to the door.
"Be careful, kids. And remember, you have to unite to do this. That means you have to work together and help each other. OK?" Mom said.
"OK, mom. We will unite," Lila and Ben said.
They opened the door and walked slowly to the garden. The dog saw them and barked louder. Lila and Ben held hands and walked closer. They talked to the dog in a soft voice.
"Hello, dog. We are Lila and Ben. We are not here to hurt you. We are here to give you a gift. It is a pill that will make you feel good. Do you want it?" Lila said.
The dog stopped barking and tilted his head. He looked at the pill in Ben's hand. He smelled it and licked his lips. He wagged his tail and came closer.
"Good dog. You are very smart. Here, take the pill. It is yummy. You will like it," Ben said.
He threw the pill to the dog and the dog caught it in his mouth. He chewed it and swallowed it. He smiled and licked his lips again. He looked at Lila and Ben with friendly eyes.
"Wow, it worked! The dog is nice now!" Lila said.
"Yes, it did! The dog is our friend now!" Ben said.
They hugged the dog and the dog licked their faces. They laughed and played with the dog and the car. They had a lot of fun.
Mom watched them from the window and smiled. She was proud of her brave and united twins. She knew they could do anything they set their minds to. She was happy they had a new friend. She hoped the pill would last for a long time.




Lily and Sam were playing outside in the snow. They made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They gave him a carrot nose and two rocks for eyes. They were very happy.
But then the wind started to blow hard. It was very cold. Lily and Sam felt their fingers and toes get numb. They started to shiver.
"Let's go inside, Sam," Lily said. "I'm freezing."
"Me too," Sam said. "But what about our snowman? He will be lonely."
"Don't worry, he has his hat and scarf. He will be fine. Come on, we can come back later."
Lily and Sam ran fast to their house. They knocked on the door. Their parent opened it and smiled.
"Hello, my little snowflakes," their parent said. "You look very cold. Come in, I have some hot chocolate for you."
Lily and Sam hugged their parent and went inside. They drank the hot chocolate and felt warm and cozy. They looked out the window and saw their snowman. He was still smiling. They waved at him and he seemed to wave back. They were very happy.




Lily and Tom were playing in the living room. They saw a big cushion on the sofa. They wanted to have fun with it.
"Let's weigh the cushion!" Lily said. "I will stand on the scale and you put the cushion on me."
"OK!" Tom said. He lifted the cushion and put it on Lily's head. The scale showed a big number.
"Wow, you are very heavy!" Tom said. "The cushion is heavy too!"
Lily laughed. She felt the cushion was soft and warm. She liked it.
"Can I try too?" Tom asked. He wanted to know how heavy he was with the cushion.
"Sure!" Lily said. She took the cushion off her head and put it on the floor. She helped Tom stand on the scale. Then she put the cushion on his back.
The scale showed a smaller number than before.
"Ha, I am lighter than you!" Tom said. He felt the cushion was cozy and fluffy. He liked it too.
They both smiled. They had fun with the cushion. The cushion was harmless and nice. They hugged the cushion and each other. They were happy.




Lila liked to play dress-up with her dolls. She had many clothes and hats and shoes for them. She liked to make them look pretty and different. She gave each doll a name and a style.
One day, she was playing with her doll Mia. She put a pink dress and a yellow hat on her. She said, "Mia, you look so nice. You have a sunny style. Do you like it?"
Mia did not answer, because she was a doll. But Lila pretended she did. She said, "Yes, Lila, I like it. But can you remove the hat? It is too hot for me."
Lila was surprised. She said, "But Mia, the hat is part of your style. It matches your dress. Why do you want to remove it?"
Mia said, "Because it is not mild today. It is very warm. The hat makes me sweat. I want to feel the breeze on my hair."
Lila thought for a moment. She said, "OK, Mia, I understand. You can remove the hat. But you have to keep the dress. It is very pretty."
Mia said, "Thank you, Lila. You are very kind. I like the dress too. It is soft and light. Can we go outside and play?"
Lila said, "Yes, Mia, we can. Let me get my shoes and my bag. Then we can go and have fun."
Lila and Mia went outside and played in the garden. They enjoyed the sun and the flowers. They had a happy day.




Lily and Ben are eager to go to the park. They put on their hats and shoes and run to the door. But Mom says, "Wait, you have to stay here. It is raining outside. You will get wet and cold."
Lily and Ben are sad. They do not like to stay inside. They want to play on the swings and slides. They look out the window and see a big black cloud. It makes loud noises and drops water on the ground.
Mom says, "Do not worry, the rain will stop soon. Then we can go to the park. Why don't you play with your toys for a while? You have many fun toys to choose from."
Lily and Ben nod. They go to their room and find their toys. They have cars and dolls and blocks and books. They start to play with them and make up stories. They forget about the rain and have fun.
After a while, Mom comes to their room and says, "Guess what? The rain is gone. The sun is shining. We can go to the park now. Are you ready?"
Lily and Ben are happy. They put away their toys and grab their hats and shoes. They run to the door and say, "Yes, we are ready. Let's go to the park!" They are eager to see the swings and slides and the flowers and the birds. They thank Mom for letting them play with their toys and for taking them to the park. They have a great day.




Anna and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big slide and run to it. Anna goes first. She slides down fast and laughs. Ben waits for his turn.
But then, he feels a tickle in his nose. He tries to stop it, but he can't. He sneezes loud and hard. "Achoo!"
Anna hears him and turns around. She sees Ben holding his nose. She runs to him and asks, "Are you okay, Ben?"
Ben nods, but he sneezes again. "Achoo! Achoo!" He wipes his nose with his hand.
Anna looks at him and says, "You need a tissue, Ben. Come, I have one in my purse."
She takes out her pink purse from her backpack. She opens it and looks inside. She has a tissue, a candy, a sticker, and a toy car. She gives the tissue to Ben and says, "Here, use this. It will make you feel better."
Ben takes the tissue and says, "Thank you, Anna. You are very fair. You share your things with me."
He blows his nose and smiles. He feels better. He says, "Can I have a candy, too?"
Anna giggles and says, "Okay, but only one. And then we can go back to the slide. It is fun."
She gives him a candy and takes one for herself. They unwrap them and put them in their mouths. They are sweet and yummy. They say, "Mmm!"
They put their things back in the purse and close it. They hold hands and run to the slide. They slide down together and laugh. They are happy. They are friends.




Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big wire fence. Behind the fence, there are many animals. Lily and Tom want to see the animals.
"Look, Tom, a lion!" Lily says. She points to a big, yellow animal with a mane. "He is so attractive. He has a loud roar."
"Yes, he is attractive, but he is also scary," Tom says. He sees the lion's sharp teeth and claws. "We should not go near him. He might hurt us."
Lily and Tom walk along the fence. They see more animals. They see a zebra, a giraffe, a monkey, and a bird. They are all attractive and different. Lily and Tom are happy.
But then, they see a hole in the fence. The hole is big enough for them to crawl through. Lily and Tom are curious. They want to go inside the fence and touch the animals.
"Come on, Tom, let's go inside," Lily says. She runs to the hole and starts to crawl.
"No, Lily, stop!" Tom says. He runs after her and grabs her hand. "It is not safe. The animals might bite us or kick us. We should stay outside."
Lily and Tom look at each other. They are both afraid and excited. They do not know what to do. Should they go inside or stay outside?




Lily and Ben were playing in their room. They had many toys and books, but they liked to make their own games. They moved the furniture around and made a big fort with a blanket and some pillows. They pretended they were in a cave, hiding from a dragon.
"Shh, be quiet," Lily whispered to Ben. "The dragon is outside. He can smell us and hear us. We have to be smart and trick him."
"How?" Ben asked.
Lily had an idea. She took a flashlight from her backpack and turned it on. She made it glow under the blanket. "Look, we have a magic stone. It can make us invisible. If the dragon comes in, we can use it to escape."
Ben smiled. He liked Lily's idea. He took another flashlight and made it glow too. "We have two magic stones. We are very powerful. The dragon can't hurt us."
They heard a loud roar from outside. It was their dad, playing along. He knocked on the door and said in a deep voice, "I smell children. I smell tasty children. Where are you? I want to eat you."
Lily and Ben giggled. They turned off their flashlights and hid under the blanket. They waited for their dad to come in. They were not scared. They were having fun. They knew their dad loved them and would not really eat them. They were ready to use their magic stones and surprise him.




Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big cat in the park. It has spots on its fur. It is a leopard.
"Wow, look at the leopard!" Tom says. "It is so fit and fast. I want to pet it."
"No, Tom, don't!" Mia says. "The leopard is not a pet. It can bite you. It is wild."
But Tom does not listen. He runs to the leopard. The leopard sees Tom and growls. It shows its teeth. Tom is scared. He stops and cries.
Mia runs to Tom. She hugs him and wipes his tears. "It's okay, Tom. The leopard will not hurt you. It is just scared too. Let's go away and leave it alone."
They walk away from the leopard. The leopard runs away too. It goes back to the woods. Tom and Mia are safe. They are still friends. They learned a lesson. They will not bother wild animals again.




Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They liked to run and jump and slide. But today, the park was full of fog. They could not see very far.
"Where are you, Tom?" Lily called. She could not see her friend.
"I'm here, Lily!" Tom answered. He was on the swings. He tried to swing high, but the fog made him slow. He could not see the trees or the sky.
Lily ran to the swings. She saw Tom's shape in the fog. She smiled and joined him. They swung together, back and forth.
"Let's raise our hands and touch the fog!" Lily said. She thought the fog was soft and cool.
"OK, let's do it!" Tom said. He liked to try new things.
They raised their hands and reached for the fog. They felt the wet air on their fingers. They giggled and swung faster.
The fog was like a big blanket. It made them feel cozy and happy. They did not mind that they could not see very far. They had each other and the swings. They had fun in the fog.




Ben and Mia are at the park with Mom. They see a big fountain with water that goes up and down. The water is icy and makes them shiver.
"Can we move closer to the fountain, Mom?" Ben asks. He wants to touch the water and see if it is cold.
"Okay, but be careful. Don't get wet or you will catch a cold," Mom says. She holds their hands and walks with them to the fountain.
Mia sees a shiny coin at the bottom of the fountain. She points at it and says, "Look, Ben, a coin! Maybe someone made a wish."
"Can we make a wish, too?" Ben asks. He likes the idea of making a wish.
"Sure, why not?" Mom says. She gives them each a coin and tells them to close their eyes and think of something they want.
Ben and Mia close their eyes and toss their coins into the fountain. They hear a splash and open their eyes.
"What did you wish for, Ben?" Mia asks.
"I wished for a new bike. What about you?" Ben asks.
"I wished for a puppy. Do you think our wishes will come true?" Mia asks.
"Maybe. But we have to be good and wait and see," Ben says.
They smile and hug Mom. They are happy and hopeful. They like the fountain and the icy water. They think it is magic.




Lily liked to play with her dad's office things. She liked the pens, the papers, the stapler and the calculator. She liked to pretend she was working like her dad. Sometimes, her dad let her sit on his lap and help him with his work.
One day, her dad had a very important work to do. He had to complete a report for his boss. He told Lily he needed to focus and not to disturb him. Lily nodded and said she would be quiet. She took some papers and pens and went to the corner of the office. She wanted to make her own report.
She drew some pictures and wrote some words. She used the stapler to put the papers together. She used the calculator to make some numbers. She was very proud of her report. She wanted to show it to her dad.
She walked to her dad's desk and said, "Dad, look at my report. I completed it for you." She put her report on top of his report. Her dad looked at her report and smiled. He said, "Wow, Lily, this is a very nice report. You did a great job. Thank you for helping me."
He hugged her and kissed her. He said, "But you know, this is my report. I need to send it to my boss. Your report is very pretty, but it is not what my boss wants. And you used some of my expensive papers and pens. Those are for special work only. Next time, please ask me before you use them, okay?"
Lily felt sorry. She said, "I'm sorry, dad. I didn't know. I just wanted to make you happy. Can I keep my report?" Her dad said, "Of course, you can keep your report. It is yours. And you made me very happy. I love you, Lily. But now, I need to finish my report. Can you play with something else for a while?"
Lily said, "Okay, dad. I love you too. I will play with something else." She took her report and went to the corner of the office. She found some toys and books. She played with them quietly. She was happy. She had completed her report. And her dad had liked it.




Tom and Anna are brother and sister. They like to play outside with their dog, Spot. One day, they go to the lake with their mom and dad. The lake is big and blue and has many fish and ducks.
"Can we swim in the lake, mom?" Tom asks.
"Yes, but you have to be careful and stay close to us. And you have to behave, or we will go home," mom says.
"OK, mom. We will behave. Come on, Anna, let's go!" Tom says. He and Anna run to the water and splash each other. Spot follows them and barks happily.
Mom and dad sit on a blanket and watch them. They smile and talk.
"Look, dad, a duck!" Anna says. She points to a brown duck that swims near them. The duck has a green head and a yellow beak.
"Wow, that's a pretty duck. Do you know what kind of duck it is?" dad asks.
Anna thinks for a moment. She remembers what she learned in preschool.
"It's a mallard duck, dad. It's a very intelligent duck. It can find food and make nests and fly far away," Anna says.
"That's right, Anna. You are very intelligent, too. I'm proud of you," dad says.
"Thank you, dad. I love you," Anna says. She hugs dad and kisses him on the cheek.
Mom and dad hug Anna and Tom and Spot. They are happy and proud of their children. They have a fun day at the lake.




Anna and Ben were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big fly. It was yellow and black. It buzzed near the flowers.
"Look, a fly!" Anna said. "Let's catch it!"
"No, don't!" Ben said. "It might sting you!"
But Anna did not listen. She ran after the fly. She wanted to touch it. She was not nervous.
Ben was nervous. He did not like flies. He thought they were scary. He followed Anna. He wanted to stop her.
Anna reached out her hand. She almost caught the fly. But the fly was fast. It flew away. It flew near Ben's face.
Ben screamed. He was afraid. He closed his eyes. He felt something on his nose. It was the fly!
Anna saw Ben. She felt sorry. She ran to him. She hugged him.
"It's okay, Ben," she said. "The fly is gone. I'm sorry I chased it. You are my friend."
Ben opened his eyes. He saw Anna. He smiled. He hugged her back.
"Thank you, Anna," he said. "You are my friend too. Let's play something else."
They walked away. They held hands. They did not look at the fly. The fly flew away. It looked for another flower.




Lily liked to play with her dolls. She had many dolls, but her favorite was Anna. Anna had a long dress and a shiny crown. Lily pretended that Anna was a princess who lived in a big castle.
One day, Lily found a spider in her room. The spider was black and hairy and had eight legs. Lily was not afraid of the spider. She thought the spider was cute and friendly. She decided to make the spider her new friend.
"Hello, spider," Lily said. "Do you want to play with me and Anna? We are having a tea party."
The spider nodded. It crawled on Lily's hand and tickled her fingers. Lily giggled. She put the spider on the table next to Anna.
"Spider, this is Anna. Anna, this is spider. You two can be friends, too," Lily said.
Anna and spider looked at each other. They liked each other. They smiled and touched their noses.
"Lily, can I ask you something?" Anna said.
"Sure, Anna. What is it?" Lily said.
"Can I marry spider?" Anna said.
Lily was surprised. She did not know that dolls and spiders could marry. But she thought that Anna and spider were happy together. And she wanted them to be happy.
"Of course, Anna. You can marry spider. If you love spider, you can marry spider," Lily said.
"Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend," Anna said.
"Spider, will you marry me?" Anna said.
Spider nodded. It spun a web around Anna's finger. It was a ring. A spider ring.
"Spider, you are a powerful spider. You can make rings with your web. I love you, spider," Anna said.
"I love you, too, Anna. You are a beautiful princess. You make me happy, Anna," spider said.
Lily clapped her hands. She was happy for Anna and spider. She hugged them both.
"Congratulations, Anna and spider. You are married. You are a family," Lily said.
Lily, Anna and spider had a tea party. They ate cake and drank juice. They talked and laughed. They were happy. They were friends. They were a family.




Tim and Mia are friends. They like to play with their toys and speak to each other. One day, they see a big box in the living room. It has a ribbon and a tag on it.
"What is that?" Tim asks.
"I don't know. Maybe it is a gift for someone," Mia says.
They go closer to the box and read the tag. It says: "To Tim and Mia, for being good kids. Love, Mom and Dad."
"Wow! It is for us!" Tim says.
"Can we open it?" Mia asks.
They look around and see no one. They decide to open the box. They pull the ribbon and lift the lid. Inside, they see something incredible.
It is a big, fluffy, colorful unicorn. It has a horn, wings, and a long tail. It looks very soft and friendly.
"Wow! It is a unicorn!" Tim says.
"It is so pretty!" Mia says.
They touch the unicorn and it moves. It opens its eyes and smiles. It speaks to them.
"Hello, Tim and Mia. I am your new friend. You can call me Sparkle. I am here to play with you and make you happy. You are very lucky to have such a wonderful reward for being good kids."
Tim and Mia are amazed. They hug the unicorn and thank their parents. They are very happy. They have a new friend and a new toy. They think it is the best gift ever. They play with Sparkle all day and have a lot of fun. They are very grateful for their incredible reward.




Anna and Ben like to play in the park. They have a big sandpit where they can dig and build. One day, they find something shiny in the sand. It is a coin. It is gold.
"Wow, look what we found!" Anna says. "It is so pretty and bright. Maybe it is magic."
"Maybe we can find more," Ben says. "Let's dig deeper and faster. Maybe there is a treasure."
They rush to get their shovels and buckets. They dig and dig and dig. They find more coins. They find rings and necklaces and bracelets. They find a big chest full of gold.
"We are so successful!" Anna says. "We are rich! We can buy anything we want. We can share with our friends and family."
They are very happy and excited. They hug and dance and sing. They do not see the sign that says "Do not dig. Sandpit under construction. Fake gold for decoration."




Tom and Mia like to collect things. They have a big box of things they find in the park, in the street, and in the trash. They have rocks, shells, feathers, cans, and bottles. They think they are very smart and fun.
One day, they find a big balloon in the trash. It is red and shiny and has a string. They think it is a toy and they want to collect it. They put it in their box and take it home.
"Look, Mom, we found a balloon!" Tom says. "Can we play with it?"
Mom looks at the balloon and frowns. She sees a label on the string. It says "Danger. Helium gas. Do not inhale or puncture."
"Tom, Mia, this is not a toy. This is a gas balloon. It has air that is different from the air we breathe. It can make you sick or hurt you if you breathe it or pop it. You need to give it back to me right now." Mom says.
"But we want to keep it. We collect things. It is pretty and light." Mia says.
"I know, but this is not a safe thing to collect. It is messy and dangerous. You can collect other things that are not gas. How about we go to the library and find a book about gas and balloons? You can learn more about them and see pictures. Would you like that?" Mom says.
Tom and Mia think for a moment. They like books and pictures. They want to learn more about gas and balloons. They nod and smile.
"Okay, Mom. We will give you the balloon. Can we go to the library now?" Tom says.
"Yes, we can. But first, let's wash our hands. They are very messy from the trash. And let's say thank you to the balloon for being so shiny and light. Maybe someone else can use it later." Mom says.
Tom and Mia wash their hands and say thank you to the balloon. They put it in a bag and give it to Mom. Then they go to the library with Mom and find a book about gas and balloons. They learn a lot and have fun. They are happy and smart.




Lily and Tom are playing with their toy kitchen. They have a scale, some fruits and some pots and pans. They want to make a fruit salad for their mom.
"Let's weigh the fruits first," Lily says. She puts a banana on the scale. "This is one," she counts. Then she puts an apple on the other side. "This is two," she counts. The scale tips to the apple side. "The apple is heavier than the banana," she says.
"Can I try?" Tom asks. He takes the apple and the banana and puts them in a pot. Then he adds some water and some pepper. "I'm making a spicy soup," he says.
"Spicy soup? That sounds yucky," Lily says. She makes a face. "Fruits are not for soup. Fruits are for salad."
Tom stirs the pot with a spoon. "No, it's yummy. You'll see. It just needs a minute to cook," he says.
He puts the pot on the stove and turns the knob. The stove makes a hissing sound. "Look, it's boiling," Tom says. He smells the steam. "Mmm, it smells good."
Lily smells it too. She coughs. "It smells hot. It makes my nose hurt," she says.
Tom takes the pot off the stove. He pours some soup into a bowl. He blows on it. "It's ready. Do you want to try?" he asks.
Lily shakes her head. "No, thank you. I don't like spicy soup. I like sweet salad," she says.
Tom shrugs. "Okay. More for me," he says. He takes a sip of the soup. He makes a funny face. His eyes water. His tongue burns. "Ahh, it's too spicy!" he cries.
Lily laughs. She gives him a glass of water. "Maybe you should stick to salad too," she says.




Lily liked to play with her mom's makeup. She wanted to look fancy like her mom when she went to work. She found a red lipstick, a pink blush and a shiny polish in her mom's drawer. She put them on her face and nails. She looked at herself in the mirror and smiled.
"Wow, you look so fancy, Lily!" said her brother Max, who came into the room. "Can I try some makeup too?"
"No, Max, this is mine!" said Lily. "You are a boy, you don't need makeup!"
"Yes, I do! I want to look fancy too!" said Max. He grabbed the lipstick from Lily's hand and tried to put it on his lips.
"Hey, stop it! Give it back!" said Lily. She pulled the lipstick from Max's hand and they started to fight.
"Ouch, you hurt me!" said Max. He dropped the polish on the floor and it spilled on the carpet.
"Oh no, mom is going to be so mad!" said Lily. She looked at the mess and started to cry.
"What's going on here?" said mom, who heard the noise and came into the room. She saw Lily and Max with makeup on their faces and the polish on the carpet. She was not happy.
"Lily and Max, what did you do?" said mom. "You know you are not supposed to play with my makeup and polish! They are not toys, they are for grown-ups!"
"Sorry, mom," said Lily and Max. They felt bad for making mom angry and for ruining her things.
"Come on, let's go to the bathroom and wash your faces," said mom. "And then we have to clean the carpet and the makeup. Next time, if you want to look fancy, you can ask me first and I will help you."




Sara and Ben were twins who liked to play with their toys. They had a charming dollhouse that had many rooms and furniture. They also had a toy car that could go fast and make noises.
One day, they were playing with their toys when they heard a loud snap. The toy car had broken one of its wheels and could not move anymore. Sara and Ben were sad and did not know what to do.
They decided to ask their dad for help. He was good at repairing things. They ran to him and showed him the broken toy car.
"Dad, can you fix our car?" Sara asked.
"Let me see, what happened?" Dad said. He looked at the car and saw the broken wheel. "Oh, I see. This is not a big problem. I can repair it for you. But I need some tools and glue. I will get them from the garage."
"Thank you, Dad!" Ben said.
Dad went to the garage and came back with some tools and glue. He worked on the car and fixed the wheel. He tested the car and it worked again. He gave it back to Sara and Ben.
"Here you go, your car is as good as new. Be careful with it, okay?" Dad said.
"Wow, thank you, Dad! You are the best!" Sara and Ben said. They hugged their dad and took their car back to their dollhouse. They played with their toys until it was night. They were happy and grateful to their dad for repairing their car. They put their toys away and went to bed. They dreamed of more adventures with their toys.




Sara and Tom were playing in the woods. They liked to build forts with lumber they found on the ground. They had a big pile of lumber near a big tree. They were happy.
But then, a mean man came. He had a big truck and a big saw. He wanted to cut down the big tree and take the lumber. He did not see Sara and Tom. He did not care.
Sara and Tom were scared. They hid behind the lumber pile. They hoped the mean man would go away. But he did not. He started to cut the big tree. The big tree made a loud noise. It fell down. It hit the lumber pile.
Sara and Tom screamed. They tried to run away. But it was too late. The lumber pile fell on them. They were hurt. They cried for help. But no one heard them. No one came to answer.
The mean man did not hear them either. He did not look. He did not care. He loaded the lumber on his truck. He drove away. He was happy.
Sara and Tom were not happy. They were pale. They were still. They were gone.




Tom and Lily were playing in the kitchen. They liked to pretend they were chefs and make yummy food. They had a big pot, some spoons, and some things to put in the pot.
"Let's make soup!" said Tom. "We need water, carrots, and onion."
"Okay!" said Lily. "I will get the water and the carrots. You get the onion."
Tom and Lily rushed to get what they needed. They filled the pot with water and put it on the stove. They chopped the carrots and put them in the pot. Then Tom picked up the onion and peeled it.
"Ow! Ow! Ow!" Tom cried. "The onion hurts my eyes! It makes them wet and stingy!"
Lily heard Tom and ran to him. She saw his eyes were red and watery. She felt sorry for him.
"Here, Tom, take this," she said. She gave him a towel to wipe his eyes. "I will chop the onion for you. You can stir the pot."
Tom took the towel and thanked Lily. He was grateful for her help. He went to the stove and stirred the pot. Lily chopped the onion and put it in the pot. They smiled at each other.
Soon, the soup was ready. It smelled good and tasted good. Tom and Lily poured some soup in two bowls and shared it. They were happy and proud of their soup. They hugged each other and said, "We are the best chefs ever!"




Tom and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to climb the trees and swing on the ropes. They saw a big pile of leaves and ran to jump on it.
"Let's split the leaves and make a fort!" Tom said.
"OK, but be careful. There might be bugs or spiders," Lily said.
They split the leaves and made a big wall around them. They felt like they were in a secret place. They pretended they were pirates and had a treasure.
"What is our treasure?" Lily asked.
Tom looked around and saw something shiny under the leaves. He pulled it out and gasped.
"It's a skeleton!" he said.
Lily screamed and dropped the leaves. She saw a white bone with a skull and teeth. She was scared and ran away.
"Wait, Lily, don't go!" Tom said. "It's not a real skeleton. It's a toy. Look, it has a button and a sticker."
He pressed the button and the skeleton made a funny noise. It said, "Boo! I'm a friendly skeleton. Do you want to play with me?"
Tom laughed and showed Lily the toy. He said, "See, it's not scary. It's just a joke. Someone left it here to trick us."
Lily came back and looked at the toy. She saw that it was not real and felt calm. She said, "Oh, I see. It's a silly skeleton. It's not scary at all."
She smiled and took the toy from Tom. She said, "Let's play with it. It can be our treasure. We can make it talk and dance."
They played with the toy skeleton and had fun. They forgot about the leaves and the bugs. They were happy and laughed a lot. They were the best pirates in the park.




Sara likes cereal. She likes to eat it every morning. She likes to put milk and bananas on it. She likes to eat it with a spoon.
One day, Sara sees a new box of cereal. It is black. She does not like black. She thinks black is yucky. She does not want to eat it.
She says to her mom, "Mom, I do not want this cereal. It is black. I want my old cereal. It is yellow and brown. It is yummy."
Her mom says, "Sara, this is a special cereal. It is not yucky. It is crunchy and sweet. It has chocolate in it. Do you like chocolate?"
Sara likes chocolate. She likes to eat it sometimes. She thinks chocolate is yummy. She says, "Yes, I like chocolate. But I do not like black."
Her mom says, "Why don't you try it? Just one bite. Maybe you will like it. It is good for you. It has vitamins and minerals. Do you know what vitamins and minerals are?"
Sara does not know what vitamins and minerals are. She thinks they are hard words. She does not care about them. She cares about yummy and yucky. She says, "No, I do not know. I do not want to try it. I want my old cereal."
Her mom says, "Okay, Sara. I will not make you eat it. But I will eat it. It looks delicious. Can I have some milk and bananas, please?"
Sara says, "Okay, mom. You can have it. But I will not. I will have my old cereal. Here is some milk and bananas. Can I have some chocolate, please?"
Her mom says, "Yes, Sara. You can have some chocolate. But only a little bit. And only after you finish your cereal. Deal?"
Sara says, "Deal, mom. Thank you. I love you."
Her mom says, "I love you too, Sara. You are a good girl. Now let's eat our cereal. Bon appetit!"




Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play together. One night, they hear a noise in the closet. They are scared. It is dark in their room.
"Ben, what is that?" Anna whispers.
"I don't know. Maybe a monster," Ben says.
They hide under the covers. The noise gets louder. They see the closet door open. They scream.
"Anna! Ben! What's wrong?" Mom comes in. She turns on the light.
"Mom, there is a monster in the closet!" Anna cries.
Mom looks in the closet. She smiles.
"No, there is no monster. It is just your clothes. They fell off the hanger. See?" Mom shows them the clothes.
Anna and Ben feel silly. They laugh.
"Sorry, Mom. We were scared," Ben says.
"It's okay. It's normal to be scared sometimes. But there is nothing to be afraid of. Your clothes are not monsters. They are just clothes," Mom says.
She hugs them and tucks them in.
"Good night, Anna. Good night, Ben. I love you," Mom says.
"Good night, Mom. We love you too," Anna and Ben say.
They close their eyes and fall asleep. They are not scared anymore.




Tom was a boy who liked to polish things. He had a cloth and a bottle of polish that he used to make his toys and shoes shiny. He was very proud of his work and liked to show it to his friends.
One day, he went to the park with his mom and saw a big statue of a king. The king had a crown and a sword and a long coat. Tom thought the statue looked dull and dirty. He wanted to make it shiny like his toys and shoes.
He ran to the statue and climbed on it. He took out his cloth and polish and started to rub the king's face. He did not see the sign that said "Do not touch". He did not hear his mom calling him to come down. He did not notice the people staring at him.
"Hey, what are you doing?" a loud voice said. Tom looked up and saw a man in a uniform. He had a badge and a hat and a whistle. He was a guard. He was angry.
"I'm polishing the king," Tom said. "He looks sad and dirty. I want to make him happy and shiny."
The guard frowned and blew his whistle. He grabbed Tom and lifted him off the statue. He scolded him and told him he was not allowed to touch the statue. He said he could damage it and get in trouble.
Tom felt scared and embarrassed. He did not mean to do anything bad. He just wanted to polish the king. He started to cry and said he was sorry.
The guard softened and gave Tom a tissue. He said he understood that Tom liked to polish things, but he had to be careful and respectful of the statue. He said the statue was very old and important and needed to be protected. He said Tom could polish other things, like his bike or his spoon, but not the statue.
Tom nodded and wiped his tears. He said he was sorry again and promised not to touch the statue anymore. He hugged his mom and said he wanted to go home.
The guard smiled and said it was okay. He said he hoped Tom learned his lesson and would be more careful next time. He said he liked to polish things too, when he was a boy. He said he had a polish for his badge and his hat and his whistle. He said he would show Tom how to use it, if he wanted.
Tom smiled and said yes. He said he liked the guard and his polish. He said he wanted to be a guard when he grew up. He said he would polish his badge and his hat and his whistle every day.
The guard laughed and said he was glad. He said he would be happy to have Tom as a friend and a helper. He said he would teach Tom how to be a good guard and how to respect the king. He said he would let Tom polish his badge and his hat and his whistle, once in a while.
Tom was happy. He said he liked the king and his statue. He said he wanted to make him happy and shiny, but not with his polish. He said he would make him happy and shiny with his smile and his wave and his thank you. He said he would be a good boy and a good guard and a good friend. He said he learned his lesson and would not be embarrassed again.




Lila and Ben are twins. They like to play in the garden. They dig in the soil and find worms and bugs. They are careful not to hurt them. They are helpful to the plants and the animals.
One day, a big dog comes to the garden. He barks and runs around. He steps on the flowers and digs up the soil. He scares the worms and the bugs. Lila and Ben are not happy. They want to protect the garden.
They run to the dog and shout, "Stop! Go away! You are not nice!" The dog does not listen. He keeps barking and running. Lila and Ben look for something to make him leave. They see a hose. They turn on the water and spray the dog. The dog gets wet and cold. He does not like it. He runs away.
Lila and Ben are happy. They hug each other. They have protected the garden. They check on the flowers and the soil. They say sorry to the worms and the bugs. They are helpful to the plants and the animals. They are good twins.




Lily and Ben were having lunch with their mom. They liked to eat soup and bread. Lily wanted some salt on her bread, but the salt was on the other side of the table. She tried to reach for it, but she could not. She asked her mom to pass the salt, but her mom was busy talking on the phone.
"Mom, can you give me the salt, please?" Lily said.
But her mom did not hear her. Lily felt angry. She wanted the salt now. She stood up on her chair and stretched her arm. She almost touched the salt, but then she lost her balance. She fell off the chair and knocked over the soup bowl. The soup spilled all over the table and the floor. Lily cried out loud.
Mom heard the noise and dropped the phone. She ran to Lily and hugged her. She was frightened. She checked if Lily was hurt.
"Lily, are you okay? What happened?" Mom asked.
"I wanted the salt, but I could not reach it. I fell and made a mess. I'm sorry, Mom." Lily said.
Mom kissed Lily and said, "It's okay, sweetie. I'm glad you're not hurt. But you should not stand on the chair. That's dangerous. Next time, just wait for me or ask Ben to help you. Okay?"
Lily nodded and said, "Okay, Mom. I'm sorry, Ben."
Ben smiled and said, "It's okay, Lily. I'll help you clean up. And I'll share my salt with you."
Lily and Ben hugged each other. Mom smiled and said, "That's very nice of you, Ben. You're a good brother. Now let's finish our lunch and then we'll have some cookies. How does that sound?"
Lily and Ben said, "Yay! Cookies!"
They all laughed and ate their lunch. They were happy.




Tom and Anna like to go to the park with Mom. They put on their hats and shoes and walk to the park. It is not far. They see many things on the way. They see a big dog, a red car, a yellow flower and a blue bird.
At the park, they play on the swings and the slide. They have fun. They see other kids and say hello. They share their toys and make new friends. The park is green and pretty. There are many trees and grass and flowers.
Mom calls them for a snack. They run to her and sit on a bench. She gives them juice and cookies. They say thank you and eat. They are happy. They love the park. They love Mom. They smile and hug. They are a good family.




Sam and Mia are twins who like to play in the garden. They have a small patch where they grow radishes, carrots and lettuce. They are very proud of their vegetables and like to water them every day.
One day, they hear a loud noise from the garden. They run outside and see a big rabbit nibbling on their radishes. The rabbit has long ears, a fluffy tail and a pink nose. It looks harmless, but Sam and Mia are angry.
"Hey, stop that!" Sam shouts. "Those are our radishes, not yours!"
The rabbit looks up and sees the twins. It is scared and hops away, dropping a radish on the ground.
"Come back here, you thief!" Mia yells. "You owe us a radish!"
The twins chase the rabbit, but it is too fast and disappears into the bushes. Sam and Mia are out of breath and sad. They look at their patch and see that the rabbit has eaten many of their radishes.
"Oh no, what are we going to do?" Sam asks. "We worked so hard to grow them."
Mia thinks for a moment. Then she smiles and says, "Don't worry, Sam. We still have some radishes left. And we have carrots and lettuce too. We can share them with the rabbit. Maybe he is hungry and lonely. Maybe he can be our friend."
Sam nods and smiles too. He picks up the radish that the rabbit dropped and says, "Okay, Mia. Let's share our vegetables with the rabbit. Maybe he will come back and say sorry. Maybe he will hear us and be nice."
The twins go back to their patch and make a pile of radishes, carrots and lettuce. They leave a note that says, "For the rabbit. From Sam and Mia. We want to be your friends."
They hope that the rabbit will see their note and their vegetables and come back. They hope that the rabbit will hear their words and be kind. They hope that they can all play in the garden together.




Tommy liked to ride his bike in the park. He had a red bike with two big wheels and a shiny pedal. He could go very fast and make loud noises with his mouth. He felt happy and free on his bike.
But Tommy was not nice to other kids. He did not share his bike or his toys. He did not listen to his mom or his dad. He did not say sorry or thank you. He was ignorant and rude. He thought he was better than everyone else.
One day, he saw a little girl with a yellow bike. She had a basket with flowers and a bell that rang. Tommy wanted her bike. He rode up to her and said, "Give me your bike. It is mine now. You are stupid and ugly." The little girl was scared and sad. She said, "No, this is my bike. I got it for my birthday. Please go away." Tommy did not care. He pushed her off her bike and took it. He laughed and rode away.
But Tommy did not know how to ride the yellow bike. It was smaller and lighter than his red bike. It had a different pedal and a brake. Tommy did not pay attention to the road. He did not see the big truck that was coming. He did not hear the horn that was honking. He did not feel the bump that was ahead.
The truck hit Tommy and his yellow bike. There was a loud crash and a lot of pain. Tommy flew off the bike and landed on the ground. He was bleeding and broken. He cried and screamed. The little girl ran to him and tried to help. She was kind and brave. She said, "I'm sorry, Tommy. I hope you are okay." Tommy did not answer. He shut his eyes and did not open them again. He was gone.




Anna and Ben like to play with blocks. They have many blocks of different colors and shapes. They can create many things with blocks, like houses, towers, bridges, and animals.
One day, they decide to create a maze with blocks. A maze is a path with many turns and walls. They want to make a big maze that they can walk inside. They start to put blocks on the floor, making walls and gaps. They use red blocks, blue blocks, yellow blocks, and green blocks.
"Look, Anna, I made a long wall with blue blocks!" Ben says.
"Good, Ben, but we need more gaps. A maze has to have gaps, so we can go through," Anna says.
"OK, Anna, I will make some gaps. How about this one?" Ben says, and makes a gap with two green blocks.
"That's too small, Ben. We can't fit through that gap. We need bigger gaps," Anna says.
"Fit means to go inside something, right?" Ben asks.
"Yes, Ben, fit means to go inside something. Like when you fit your foot in your shoe, or when you fit your toy in your box," Anna explains.
"I see, Anna. Then I will make bigger gaps. How about this one?" Ben says, and makes a gap with four yellow blocks.
"That's better, Ben. We can fit through that gap. Let's make more gaps like that," Anna says.
They keep creating the maze with blocks, making walls and gaps. They have fun making the maze. They also have fun walking inside the maze, finding the way out. They are proud of their maze. They show their maze to their mom and dad. Their mom and dad are happy to see their maze. They say, "Wow, Anna and Ben, you are very creative. You made a great maze with blocks. Well done!"




Lily and Ben are playing dress up. Lily puts on a fancy dress with a big bow on the back. Ben puts on a hat and a coat with buttons. They look at each other and smile.
"Let's pretend we are going to a party," Lily says. "You are the prince and I am the princess."
"OK," Ben says. "But we need a carriage to take us there."
They find a big cardboard box and decorate it with stickers and crayons. They make wheels out of paper plates and a handle out of a rope. They put their toys inside the box and get ready to go.
"Wait," Lily says. "We need to look nice for the party. We need to cut our hair."
She finds a pair of scissors and starts to cut her own hair. She cuts off a big chunk of her bangs and drops it on the floor. She looks in the mirror and gasps.
"Oh no," she says. "I look funny. I don't look like a princess anymore."
Ben sees what she did and laughs. He picks up the scissors and cuts his own hair too. He cuts off a piece of his sideburns and puts it on his chin. He looks in the mirror and grins.
"I look funny too," he says. "I look like a pirate."
They look at each other and giggle. They don't care that they don't look fancy anymore. They are having fun.
"Come on," Ben says. "Let's go to the party. Maybe we can find some treasure there."
They hop into their cardboard box and pull the rope. They pretend to drive through the streets and wave to their friends. They sing and laugh and have a good time. They are happy.




Lily liked to watch her mom change her baby brother's diaper. She wanted to help, but mom said she was too little. Lily felt sad. She wished she could do big things like mom.
One day, mom was busy in the kitchen. She asked Lily to watch her brother for a minute. Lily was happy. She ran to the crib and saw her brother crying. He had a dirty diaper. Lily thought she could change it. She grabbed a new diaper and some wipes from the shelf.
She tried to undo the old diaper, but it was hard. She pulled and tugged, but it didn't come off. She made a mess. She started to cry too. She didn't know what to do.
Mom heard the noise and came to the room. She saw Lily and her brother covered in poop. She was shocked. She asked Lily what happened. Lily said she wanted to change the diaper, but she couldn't. She said she was sorry.
Mom hugged Lily and said it was okay. She said she was proud of Lily for trying to help, but she was too little to change diapers. She said she would teach her when she was bigger. She said she loved her. She cleaned them up and put a new diaper on her brother.
Lily felt better. She smiled and kissed her brother. She said she loved him too. She said she would watch him, but not change him. Mom laughed and said that was a good idea. She said they were a good team. Lily agreed. She was happy. She liked to watch her mom change her baby brother's diaper.




Lily was an adventurous girl who liked to explore new places. One day, she saw a big hill covered with snow. She wanted to slide down the hill on her sled. She put on her red mitten and ran to the hill.
But when she got there, she saw that there was another boy on the hill. He was also sliding on his sled. He had a blue mitten. He looked at Lily and said, "This is my hill. You can't slide here. Go away."
Lily felt sad and angry. She said, "No, this is not your hill. This is a big hill for everyone. I want to slide too. You have to share."
The boy said, "No, I don't have to share. I was here first. You have to yield. That means you have to let me go first and wait for your turn."
Lily said, "No, you have to yield too. That means you have to take turns and be fair. You can't have the hill all the time."
The boy and Lily started to argue. They did not listen to each other. They did not have fun. They only made noise.
Then, they heard a loud roar. They looked up and saw a big bear coming down the hill. The bear was hungry and angry. He saw the boy and Lily and wanted to eat them.
The boy and Lily were very scared. They forgot about their sleds and their mittens. They ran away from the hill as fast as they could. They did not stop until they reached their homes.
They learned a lesson that day. They learned that it is better to share and yield than to fight and be greedy. They learned that being adventurous is good, but being careful is also good. They learned that sometimes, a big hill is not worth a big trouble.




Lily and Tom were going to visit their grandma. They had to pack their bags with clothes and toys. Lily liked to pack her teddy bear and her books. Tom liked to pack his cars and his ball.
"Are you ready, Lily?" Tom asked.
"Yes, I am ready, Tom," Lily said. "But I am hungry. Can we have a snack?"
"Sure, let's go to the kitchen," Tom said. They went to the kitchen and saw their mom making sandwiches. She had bread, cheese, ham, and beans.
"Can we have some beans, mom?" Lily asked.
"Of course, you can have some beans, Lily," mom said. "Beans are good for you. They make you strong and healthy."
"Thank you, mom," Lily said. She took a spoon and put some beans on her bread. She liked beans. They were soft and tasty.
"Can I have some beans, too, mom?" Tom asked.
"Sure, you can have some beans, too, Tom," mom said. She gave him a spoon and he put some beans on his bread. He liked beans, too. They were fun and colorful.
"Thank you, mom," Tom said. He took a bite of his sandwich and smiled.
"You're welcome, my loves," mom said. She hugged them and kissed them. "I'm so grateful for you. You make me happy."
Lily and Tom hugged and kissed her back. They were grateful for her, too. She made them sandwiches and helped them pack. They loved her very much.
They finished their snacks and took their bags. They were ready to go to grandma's. They said goodbye to mom and got in the car with dad. They were excited to see grandma. They knew she would be grateful to see them, too.




Lily liked to read books. She had many books in her room. Some books had pictures, some books had stories, some books had both. Lily liked to learn new words from her books.
One day, Lily found a big book on her shelf. It was yellow and heavy. Lily opened the book and saw many words. The words were in order, from A to Z. Lily did not know what the book was. She asked her mom.
Mom said, "That is a dictionary. A dictionary is a book that tells you what words mean. You can use it to learn new words or to check how to spell them."
Lily was curious. She wanted to learn new words from the dictionary. She asked mom, "Can I join you in the kitchen and read the dictionary?"
Mom smiled and said, "Of course, you can join me. You can read the dictionary while I make lunch. Maybe you can find some words that start with the same letter as your name."
Lily was happy. She carried the yellow dictionary to the kitchen and sat on a chair. She opened the dictionary and looked for words that started with L. She found words like lamp, leaf, lion, and love. She read the words and their meanings aloud. Mom listened and praised her.
Lily and mom had fun reading the dictionary together. Lily learned many new words and mom was proud of her. They also enjoyed their lunch and talked about the words they liked. Lily decided that the dictionary was a good book to read. She thanked mom for letting her join her in the kitchen.




Tom and Mia were playing on the beach. They liked to make sand castles and look for shells. They saw a big boat in the water. It was loud and smoky. They wondered what it was doing.
