Tim and Sam are friends. They like to play sport. They have a ball and a bat. They go to the park with their mums.
"Can I hit the ball first?" Tim asks.
"OK, but I will catch it," Sam says.
Tim holds the bat and Sam throws the ball. Tim swings the bat and hits the ball hard. The ball flies in the air.
"Wow, good hit!" Sam says. He runs after the ball.
But the ball is too fast. It goes over the fence and into the road.
"Oh no, the ball is gone!" Tim says.
They look at the road. There are many cars and bikes. They are loud and fast. They cannot get the ball.
They are sad. They like their ball.
A man sees them. He is clever. He has a big stick. He walks to the road. He waits for the cars and bikes to stop. He uses the stick to get the ball. He brings the ball back to Tim and Sam.
"Here you go, boys. Be careful next time," he says.
"Thank you, sir. You are very kind," Tim and Sam say.
They are happy. They have their ball again.
They hug the man. They hug their mums. They spend the rest of the day playing sport in the park. They have fun.



Once upon a time, there were two friends named Timmy and Tommy. They loved to play together, but one day they got into a fight. They were both very sad and didn't know what to do. 
Suddenly, Timmy had an idea. He said to Tommy, "Let's unite and be friends again!" Tommy thought that was a great idea and they hugged each other. 
To remember this happy moment, they decided to take a picture. They found a pretty frame and put the picture inside. The frame was blue and had stars on it. 
Afterwards, they went to get some ice cream. It was a hot day and they were very thirsty. They drank some cold water and ate their ice cream. They were happy to be friends again and promised to never fight again. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she saw a swing hanging from a tree. She ran over to it and started to swing back and forth. It was so much fun!
As she was swinging, her mom called out to her. "Lily, it's time to come inside and change your clothes for dinner," her mom said. Lily didn't want to stop swinging, but she knew she had to listen to her mom.
After dinner, Lily went to bed. She was so excited to wear her new thin pajamas that her mom had bought her. As she was getting ready for bed, she remembered how much fun she had swinging earlier that day. She couldn't wait to swing again tomorrow.



Once upon a time, there was a kind lady named Mrs. Smith. She had a lot of money and was very wealthy. One day, she decided to mail a hot pie to her friend who lived far away. She put the pie in a box and went to the post office. 
At the post office, Mrs. Smith gave the box to the kind postman. He put a stamp on it and said, "I will mail this for you." Mrs. Smith smiled and thanked him. She was happy that her friend would soon receive the hot pie.
A few days later, Mrs. Smith received a letter from her friend. It said, "Thank you for the hot pie! It was delicious!" Mrs. Smith was happy that her friend enjoyed the pie. She realized that even though she was wealthy, it was the simple things like sharing a hot pie with a friend that made her the happiest.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to read books about animals and princesses. One day, her mommy took her to a big field filled with pretty flowers. Lily saw a red poppy and wanted to pick it. But her mommy said they had to wait until it was fully grown. Lily was impatient, but she understood. 
The next day, Lily's mommy took her back to the field. The poppy had bloomed and was now big and beautiful. Lily was so happy! She picked the poppy and showed it to her mommy. Then, they went home and read more books together. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and make crafts with paper. One day, Lily found some scissors and wanted to cut some paper. But the scissors were dull and couldn't cut well.
Lily's mom told her not to use the dull scissors and to wait until she could get some new ones. But Lily didn't listen and tried to cut the paper anyway. Suddenly, the scissors slipped and cut her finger. Lily cried and her mom had to take her to the hospital.
From then on, Lily learned to listen to her mom and wait for the right tools. She also learned to be careful when using sharp objects. And she never forgot about the dull scissors that caused her harm.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, he put on his favorite red cap and went outside to play.
As he was playing, he heard a noise. Timmy felt anxious and wanted to know what was making the noise. He decided to peek behind the bushes to see what was there.
To his surprise, he saw a little bunny hopping around. Timmy smiled and felt happy. He slowly approached the bunny and the bunny didn't run away. Timmy felt proud that he was brave enough to peek behind the bushes and make a new friend.



Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Tom. He had a kind spirit and loved to help people. One day, he met a little girl named Lily who was lost in the park.
Tom asked Lily, "Are you lost, little one?"
Lily replied, "Yes, I can't find my mommy."
Tom said, "Don't worry, I'll help you find her."
They searched and searched, but Lily's mommy was nowhere to be found. As the sun began to set, Tom told Lily, "We must remain here until we find your mommy."
As they waited, Tom told Lily stories and made her laugh. But as it got darker, they heard strange noises. Suddenly, a big, scary monster appeared and took Tom away.
Lily was all alone and couldn't find her way home. She missed Tom and his kind spirit. From that day on, she always remembered Tom's kindness, even though he remained gone forever.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally loved to spin around and around until she got dizzy. One day, Sally went to the park and saw a group of children playing. Sally wanted to join in, but the other children didn't include her. 
Sally felt sad and didn't know what to do. She sat down on the grass and looked up at the sky. She saw the earth spinning and thought about how everything is connected. Suddenly, Sally had an idea. She got up and started spinning around. The other children noticed and asked her to join in. 
Sally felt happy and included. She learned that sometimes, you have to take action and include yourself in order to make friends. The moral of the story is that everyone deserves to be included and it's important to be kind to others.



Once upon a time, there was a little mouse named Timmy. Timmy loved to explore and go on adventures. One day, Timmy met a big friendly cat named Mittens. Mittens said, "Hi there little mouse, I won't hurt you. Want to go on an adventure with me?"
Timmy was scared at first, but Mittens seemed nice. They walked through a maze of tall grass and bushes. Timmy was having a great time, but he noticed that Mittens kept shaking her head and scratching her ears.
Timmy asked, "Are you okay Mittens?" Mittens replied, "No, I have fleas. I need to find a way to get rid of them." Timmy remembered that he had seen some herbs that could help with fleas. He led Mittens to a patch of herbs and Mittens rubbed them all over her fur. Soon, the fleas were gone and Mittens was feeling great again.
From that day on, Timmy and Mittens went on many more adventures together. Timmy learned that even though someone may look scary, they can still be a great friend.



Once upon a time, there was a humble rabbit named Benny. He liked to stand on his hind legs and hop around. One day, Benny found a shiny diamond in the grass. He was so happy and showed it to his friend, a little bird.
"Look, look!" Benny said, holding up the diamond. "Pretty!"
The bird looked at the diamond and said, "Wow, that's amazing! Can I hold it?"
Benny gave the diamond to the bird, who flew up into the sky with it. Benny watched as the diamond sparkled in the sun. He felt proud and happy that he had found something so special. From that day on, Benny continued to stand tall and hop around, grateful for the little things in life.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her crayons. She had a big box of crayons that she kept very tidy in her room. 
One day, Lily went outside to play. It was very cold outside and she started to shiver. She decided to go back inside to warm up. 
When she got back to her room, she saw that her little brother had made a big mess with her crayons. They were all over the floor and not tidy anymore. She felt a little bit upset, but she decided to clean them up and put them back in the box. 
After she finished cleaning up, she felt happy again. She decided to draw a picture of a cozy blanket to keep her warm when she went back outside to play. She used her favorite blue crayon to color in the blanket. It was a beautiful picture and she felt very proud of herself.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to build things with his dad's tools. He had a hammer that he used to hit nails into wood. The hammer was heavy, but Timmy was strong and he could hold it.
One day, Timmy's dad let him build a birdhouse. He allowed Timmy to use his tools and showed him how to use the hammer. Timmy hit the nails into the wood and made the birdhouse. It was smooth and had a little hole for the birds to go inside.
When Timmy was finished, he showed his dad the birdhouse. His dad was proud of him and said, "You did a great job, Timmy! I'm so happy I allowed you to use my tools." Timmy smiled and felt happy too.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to hear her mom's stories every night before bed. One night, Lily's mom promised to tell her the perfect story. Lily was so excited!
Her mom began, "Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. He loved to hop and play with his friends in the forest. But one day, Benny got lost and couldn't find his way back home."
Lily listened closely as her mom continued the story. She was so happy when Benny finally found his way back home. "That was the perfect story, Mommy!" Lily exclaimed.
From that night on, Lily's mom promised to tell her a new story every night before bed. And Lily was always excited to hear them.



Once upon a time, there was a nice woman named Lily. She had a car and loved to drive it around. One day, she saw a little girl named Mia walking on the street. 
"Hello there!" said Lily. "Do you want a ride?"
"Yes, please!" replied Mia.
So, Mia hopped into the car and they drove around together. They saw many things along the way, like trees, birds, and other cars. 
"This is so fun!" exclaimed Mia.
"I'm glad you're enjoying it," said Lily with a smile.
After a while, they arrived at Mia's house. 
"Thank you for the ride, nice lady!" said Mia.
"You're welcome, little one. Anytime!" replied Lily.
And with that, Mia went inside her house, happy from her nice ride with the friendly woman.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play golf with his dad. One day, Timmy and his dad went to the golf course. Timmy was excited to play, but he was also scared because he had never played before.
"Dad, I'm scared," said Timmy.
"Don't be scared, Timmy. I'll teach you how to play," said his dad.
Timmy's dad showed him how to hold the golf club and swing it. Timmy tried and tried, but he couldn't hit the ball. He was getting frustrated.
"I can't do it, Dad," said Timmy.
"Don't give up, Timmy. Keep trying," said his dad.
Finally, Timmy hit the ball and it went into the hole. Timmy was so happy! He hugged his dad and said, "Thank you, Dad. I love playing golf with you."
The moral of the story is to never give up, even if you're scared. And always remember to hug the people you love.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and run around in the garden. One day, Lily's mommy bought a beautiful vase to put flowers in. It was so pretty and shiny.
Lily loved to look at the vase and touch it gently. But one day, she accidentally knocked it over and it broke into many pieces. She felt very sad and scared that her mommy would be angry.
But then, her mommy came in and saw what happened. Instead of being angry, she hugged Lily and said, "It's okay, my lucky girl. We can fix it together." And they did. They glued the pieces back together and the vase looked even more beautiful than before.
From that day on, Lily learned to be careful around the vase and always make sure to close the door so that it wouldn't fall again. And she felt very lucky to have such a kind and understanding mommy.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play chess with his grandpa. Chess was a game with black and white pieces on a board. It was very important to Timmy to win.
One day, Timmy's grandpa said, "It's time to shut the chess board and go to bed." Timmy replied, "But grandpa, I want to keep playing. Winning is important!" Grandpa said, "Winning is fun, but sleep is important too. We can play again tomorrow."
Timmy felt sad, but he knew his grandpa was right. He shut the chess board and went to bed. As he was falling asleep, he thought about all the moves he would make the next day to win the game.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing in the park when she saw a butterfly. She wanted to catch it, but it flew away. 
Lily's friend, Timmy, saw her looking sad and asked her what was wrong. "I wanted to catch the butterfly, but it flew away," Lily said. 
"Don't be frightened, Lily," Timmy said. "Maybe we can draw a picture of the butterfly instead." 
Lily smiled and said, "That's a good idea! I'll write 'victory' on the picture because we won over our fear of the butterfly flying away." 
So, Lily and Timmy drew a picture of the butterfly and wrote "victory" on it. They were happy and proud of their artwork. From that day on, they were no longer frightened of the butterflies flying away.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his kite. He would run and run until the kite flew high in the sky.
One day, Timmy met a new friend named Billy. Billy was an ignorant boy who didn't know much about kites. Timmy tried to teach Billy how to fly the kite, but Billy didn't listen. He thought he knew everything.
Timmy decided to test Billy's knowledge by asking him questions about kites. Billy couldn't answer any of the questions. Timmy realized that Billy needed to learn more about kites before he could play with them. He decided to teach Billy everything he knew about kites so they could play together happily.



Once upon a time, there was a bald man who loved to swim in the river. He had a dog named Spot who loved to play fetch with a bone. One day, the man and Spot went to the river to swim and play.
As they were swimming, a big fish jumped out of the water and scared Spot. "Woof woof! Scary!" barked Spot. The man laughed and said, "Don't worry, Spot. The fish won't hurt us."
But as they continued to swim, the man suddenly felt something grab his leg. It was a big alligator! "Help! Help!" he cried. Spot tried to save him by biting the alligator's tail, but it was too late. The alligator took the man underwater and he never came back up.
Spot was very sad and went home alone without his owner. He missed the man and the bone they used to play with. From that day on, Spot never went back to the river again.



Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Freddy. Freddy lived in a big pond with lots of other frogs. One day, Freddy forgot where his favorite lily pad was. He asked his frog friends if they could help him remember, but they were all ignorant and didn't know.
Freddy hopped around the pond, searching for his lily pad. He looked under rocks and around plants, but it was nowhere to be found. As the sun began to set, Freddy started to feel sad. He thought he would never find his lily pad again.
Just as Freddy was about to give up, he saw a glimmer of green in the distance. It was his lily pad! He hopped over to it and felt so happy to be home. From then on, he made sure to remember where his lily pad was so he would never lose it again.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, but he didn't like when his toys got stuck on the ceiling. One day, Timmy's mom saw him trying to get his toy down and said, "I have an idea to prevent your toys from sticking to the ceiling." 
Timmy's mom got a special spray that she used on the ceiling. She sprayed it all over the ceiling and said, "Now, your toys won't stick anymore!" Timmy was so happy, he jumped up and down with joy. He even tried throwing his toy up to the ceiling to see if it would stick, but it didn't.
Timmy's mom was happy too, because she didn't like the disgusting mess that the toys made on the ceiling. Now, the ceiling was clean and Timmy could play with his toys without any worries. From that day on, Timmy and his mom were both very happy. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys every day. One day, Timmy found a locked box in his room. He wondered what was inside the box. 
Timmy asked his mom, "Mommy, can you help me unlock this box? I wonder what's inside." His mom said, "Sure, let's find the key." 
After looking for a while, they found the key and unlocked the box. Inside the box, they found a regular toy car. Timmy was so happy and said, "Thank you, Mommy! I love my new toy car." 
From that day on, Timmy played with his regular toy car every day and wondered what other surprises he might find.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily and her mommy went to the park to play. While they were playing, Lily's mommy lost her key. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. 
Lily saw that her mommy was starting to panic. "What's wrong, mommy?" Lily asked. "I lost my key," her mommy replied. 
Lily wanted to help her mommy find the key, so she started to look around too. After a few minutes, Lily saw something disgusting on the ground. "Ew, what is that?" she said. But then she realized it was the key! "Mommy, I found it!" she said happily. 
Her mommy was so relieved and gave Lily a big hug. "Thank you for helping me, Lily," she said. "You're my hero!"



Once upon a time, there was a brave knight who loved to ride his horse. He had a symbol on his shield that showed he was a knight. One day, he fell off his horse and hurt his arm. It hurt so much that he couldn't move it. 
The knight went to see a wise old woman who knew how to heal people. She gave him some medicine and told him to rest. The knight was sad because he couldn't ride his horse anymore. 
But one day, the knight's arm felt better. He was so happy that he went outside to ride his horse again. He looked at his symbol on his shield and felt proud to be a brave knight. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her teddy bear. One day, Lily's little brother Tommy came into her room and took her teddy bear without asking. Lily felt sad and angry because she loved her teddy bear very much.
Lily decided to go to the kitchen to get an olive snack to make herself feel better. But when she got there, she accidentally spilled the olives all over the floor. It was very messy! Lily felt even more upset because she didn't want to clean up the mess.
Just then, Tommy came into the kitchen and saw the mess. He felt bad for taking Lily's teddy bear and decided to help her clean up the olives. Together, they picked up the olives and put them back in the jar. Lily felt happy again because she got her teddy bear back and her brother helped her clean up the messy olive mess. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat candy, especially the delicious gummy bears her mom gave her. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom and brought her favorite backpack. Her mom helped her put on the backpack and zippered it closed. 
As they played, Lily noticed a boy playing with a ball. She wanted to play too, but she didn't want to leave her backpack alone. So, she decided to keep it close to her. 
After a while, Lily got thirsty and asked her mom for some water. Her mom reached into the backpack to get the water bottle, but it was gone! They looked around and saw the boy from earlier running away with the backpack in his hand. 
Lily felt sad and scared, but her mom told her they would find the boy and get the backpack back. They searched the park and finally found the boy. He had opened the backpack and was about to eat the gummy bears. Lily's mom asked him to give back the backpack and he did. Lily was happy to have her backpack back and she learned to always keep an eye on her things.



Once upon a time, there was a poor little bird. The bird lived in a tree and had no food to eat. One day, the bird went to pick some seeds from the ground. But the bird was still hungry. Suddenly, the bird heard a beautiful sound. It was a little girl singing! The bird felt happy and started to sing too. The little girl saw the bird and gave it some bread to eat. The bird was not poor anymore and sang a happy song.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the rain. One day, Timmy went outside to play and found a big hole in his backyard. He leaned over to look inside the hole and saw that it was very deep. 
Suddenly, Timmy's little sister, Lily, came outside and wanted to play too. She saw Timmy leaning over the hole and wanted to see what he was looking at. Timmy told her it was a big hole and that she shouldn't lean over it because it was wet and slippery. 
Lily didn't listen and leaned over the hole anyway. She slipped and fell into the hole! Timmy was scared and didn't know what to do. He ran inside to tell his mom and dad. They came outside and helped get Lily out of the hole. From then on, Timmy and Lily knew to be careful around holes and always listen to each other.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was playing outside in her backyard when she saw a wild mole digging a hole. "Hello, little mole," said Lily. "What are you doing?"
"I'm digging a home," said the mole.
"Oh, can I help?" asked Lily.
"Yes, please," said the mole.
Lily got a shovel and helped the mole dig its home. When they were finished, the mole was very happy. "Thank you for helping me," said the mole.
"You're welcome," said Lily. "I had fun getting dirty with you."
From that day on, Lily visited the mole every day and they became the best of friends.



Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little girl named Lily. She loved to wander through the forest and pick flowers. One day, she met a friendly squirrel who asked her what she was doing. "I'm looking for pretty flowers," said Lily.
Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. It was a big, scary bear! The squirrel was afraid and ran away, but Lily stood her ground. She saw that the bear had a knife in its paw and was looking for something to eat. 
Lily had an idea. She picked some berries and offered them to the bear. The bear was so happy that it forgot about the knife and ate the berries instead. The bear and Lily became friends and wandered through the forest together, picking flowers and berries. From that day on, they always looked out for each other.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her garden. One day, Lily found a big bag of bulbs. She was so happy! She wanted to plant them all. But, she didn't know how to sort them.
Lily asked her mommy for help. Together, they sorted the bulbs by color. The red ones went in one pile, the yellow ones in another, and the white ones in a third pile. Lily was so proud of herself for sorting the bulbs.
As Lily was planting the bulbs, she saw a little bird in her garden. The bird looked frightened. Lily didn't want the bird to be scared, so she spoke softly to it. The bird felt better and flew away happily. Lily felt happy too, knowing that she helped the bird.



Once upon a time, there was a silly bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play in the grass and lay in the sun. One day, Benny felt a stitch in his tummy and it made him sad. His friend, a kind mouse named Mandy, saw Benny was sad and asked what was wrong. Benny told Mandy about his stitch and Mandy said she could help. Mandy gave Benny a carrot and soon his stitch went away. Benny was happy again and thanked Mandy for her help. They continued to play and lay in the sun together. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance and move to the rhythm of the music. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to dress up for a special occasion. Lily couldn't decide what to wear, so she put on a silly hat and a big bow.
As they were walking to the occasion, Lily saw her friends playing outside. She wanted to join them, but her mommy reminded her that they had to go to the special occasion. Lily didn't want to go anymore, but her mommy explained that it was important to show up and be responsible.
At the special occasion, Lily saw her friends again. They were all dressed up nicely and looked very happy. Lily realized that her silly hat and big bow didn't fit in with the occasion. She felt embarrassed and wished she had dressed up nicely like her friends.
From that day on, Lily learned that it's important to dress appropriately for different occasions. She also learned that it's okay to be silly sometimes, but there's a time and place for everything.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play at the beach and look for pretty shells. One day, she saw a seal on the shore. The seal was sad because it was stuck in a net. 
Lily wanted to help the seal. She ran to her dad and said, "Daddy, we need to help the seal!" Her dad was brilliant and knew just what to do. He got some scissors and cut the net. 
The seal was so happy and swam away into the ocean. Lily felt proud that she could help the seal. From that day on, she always looked for ways to help animals in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the woods behind her house. One day, she met a friendly bear named Benny.
Benny asked Lily, "Do you want to come to my camp with me?"
Lily was curious and excited to see what a bear's camp looked like. She followed Benny through the woods until they arrived at his cozy campsite. Benny showed Lily how he stored his food in a big tree trunk to keep it safe from other animals.
Later that day, Lily and Benny went on a hike and saw a beautiful waterfall. As they were walking back to camp, they heard a loud noise. Benny knew it was a storm coming and quickly showed Lily how to store their belongings safely in the tent. They stayed dry and cozy all night long.
The next morning, Lily thanked Benny for showing her his camp and teaching her how to store things safely. She couldn't wait to come back and visit her new friend again.



Once upon a time, there was a big TV in a house. The TV was very large and it had many colors. One day, a boy was playing with a toy and he accidentally hit the TV. The TV fell down and broke. The boy was very sad because he loved watching cartoons on the TV. His mom told him not to worry and that they would get a new TV. The new TV was even bigger and sharper than the old one. The boy was very happy and he watched his favorite cartoons on the new TV every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play outside in the big green yard. One day, she went exploring and found a bush with lots of pretty flowers. She picked some and put them in her hair.
But then, she realized she was lost. She looked around and everything looked different. She didn't know how to get back home. She started to cry.
Luckily, her mom heard her and came to find her. Lily was so happy to see her mom and she hugged her tight. They walked back home together, and Lily never went exploring alone again.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, Lily's mommy asked her to come inside for lunch. But Lily wanted to play a little bit longer. She delayed coming inside and kept playing.
Later that day, Lily's daddy asked her to help him cut some vegetables for dinner. Lily was excited to help. She got her little knife and started cutting the vegetables. She was very careful not to cut herself.
After dinner, Lily and her brother played a game of hide-and-seek. Lily found a great hiding spot behind the couch. She was so well hidden that her brother couldn't find her for a long time. When he finally found her, they both laughed and had a great time.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a yellow dress and loved to play with her toys. One day, Lily was playing with her dolls on the floor when she saw a bug. 
Mommy, theres a bug on the floor! Lily said.
Oh no, we dont want any bugs in the house, Mommy replied. Can you pinch it and put it outside?
Lily pinched the bug gently and put it outside. She was happy to help her mommy keep the house clean. 
Good job, Lily! Youre such a helpful girl, Mommy said, giving her a big hug. 
Lily smiled and went back to playing with her dolls, feeling proud of herself for being a good helper.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a kitty named Mittens who she loved very much. Lily liked to play with Mittens and give her treats. Mittens loved Lily too and would always cuddle with her.
One day, Lily saw a girl at the park who was wearing a modest dress. Lily thought the girl looked very pretty and wanted to be her friend. Lily went up to the girl and said, "Hi, I like your dress. Do you want to play with me and Mittens?" The girl smiled and said yes.
Lily was very happy to have a new friend who liked to play with her and Mittens. She loved spending time with her new friend and hoped they could play together again soon.



Once upon a time, there was a cute little bunny. One day, the bunny wanted to take a shower. So, the bunny went into the shower and turned on the water. The bunny loved the warm water and stayed in the shower for a long time.
After the bunny finished taking a shower, it went to play outside. But, the bunny didn't see the big, scary dog that was nearby. The dog started chasing the bunny and the bunny tried to run away. But, the bunny couldn't run fast enough and the dog caught it.
The bunny couldn't stay safe from the dog and got hurt. The bunny's friends were sad and cried for the cute bunny. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little ant who loved to crawl around. One day, the ant saw a large cherry on the ground. It looked so delicious, but the ant knew it was too big for him to carry. 
The ant thought and thought, and then he had an idea. He went back to his ant friends and asked for their help. Together, they worked hard to carry the large cherry back to their home. 
After they finished, the ant felt proud of himself for working with his friends. He learned that when he needed help, he could always ask his friends. The moral of the story is that teamwork can help you achieve great things.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a favorite blanket that he loved very much. He would take it with him everywhere he went. One day, Timmy's friend dared him to climb up a tall tree to get a toy that had gotten stuck up there. Timmy was scared, but he wanted to impress his friend, so he climbed up the tree.
As he was climbing, Timmy's persistent friend kept urging him to go higher and higher. But suddenly, Timmy slipped and fell down from the tree. He hurt himself badly and had to go to the hospital. His favorite blanket was torn and ruined.
The moral of the story is that it's not worth risking your safety or your favorite things just to impress others or to do something daring. It's important to be careful and think about the consequences of our actions.



Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Benny. Benny loved to skip and play in the forest. One day, Benny met a bee who was making honey. 
"Hello, Mr. Bee. What are you doing?" asked Benny.
"I'm making honey. Would you like to try some?" replied the bee.
Benny tasted the honey and it was very yummy. He felt calm and happy. 
The bee said goodbye and flew away. Benny continued to skip and play until he saw a hunter. The hunter aimed his gun and shot Benny. Benny fell to the ground and could not get up. 
"I'm sorry, little bear. I didn't mean to hurt you," said the hunter.
But it was too late. Benny was gone forever.



Once upon a time, there was a big, hairy bear who lived in the forest. One day, the bear was very hungry and decided to try to find some meat to eat. He walked and walked, but he couldn't find any meat. 
Suddenly, he saw a small rabbit hopping nearby. The bear thought that the rabbit would make a tasty meal, so he tried to catch it. But the rabbit was very fast and managed to escape. 
The bear was still hungry and tried to find something else to eat. He saw some berries on a bush and tried them. They were delicious! The bear was happy to have found some food and decided to go back to his cave to take a nap.



Once upon a time, there was a little otter named Ollie. Ollie loved to play in the river with his friends. One day, Ollie's mom told him that they were going on a trip to the ocean. Ollie was so excited because he had never seen the ocean before. 
When they got to the ocean, Ollie saw something incredible. It was a big, shiny pearl. Ollie wanted to play with it, but his mom told him that it belonged to someone else. She said, "Ollie, we must behave and not take things that don't belong to us." 
Ollie listened to his mom and didn't touch the pearl. Later that day, they met a kind old otter who had lost his pearl. Ollie remembered the shiny pearl he had seen earlier and told the old otter about it. The old otter was so grateful that he gave Ollie a special gift. Ollie learned that it's always important to behave and do the right thing.



Once upon a time, there was a big, big fisherman named Tom. Tom loved to fish in the deep blue sea. One day, Tom went out to fish and he caught a huge fish. The fish was so big that it made Tom's boat tip over. Tom was scared and suffered a scratch on his leg, but he was happy that he caught the huge fish. He took a picture with the fish and showed it to all his friends. Tom was the happiest fisherman in the whole wide world!



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the mud and dirt. One day, she had so much fun playing that her head got very dirty. 
When it was time to come inside for dinner, Lily didn't want to stop playing. But her mom said it was time to surrender and come inside. 
Lily was sad to leave her fun outside, but she knew it was time to clean her dirty head and have some yummy dinner. After dinner, Lily went to bed with a clean head and happy heart, dreaming of playing in the dirt again tomorrow.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play outside in the sun, but it was very hot. Lily's mom told her to drink water to stay cool. One day, Lily was running and she slipped on a banana peel! She fell down and got a little bump on her head. She thought it was crazy that a banana peel could make her fall. From then on, Lily was more careful when she played outside.



Once upon a time, there was a mighty ant. The ant lived near a big hill. The ant was very strong and everybody liked him. One day, the ant found some salt. He thought it was good to eat. So, he took it to his friends.
When the ant's friends saw the salt, they began to panic. They knew that the salt was not good for them. But the mighty ant did not listen. He told his friends to eat the salt with him. They did not want to, but they did it because they liked the mighty ant.
After they ate the salt, they all felt sick. The mighty ant was sad because he made his friends sick. They all went back to their homes and laid down. The mighty ant was not so mighty anymore. And they never ate salt again.



Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin loved to swim in the big blue sea. One day, while swimming, Fin saw a pretty image on a rock. The image was of a big fish with many colors. Fin wanted to be friends with the big fish in the image.
Fin swam around and asked other sea friends, "Do you know where the big fish is?" But Fin's sea friends did not know. They were ignorant about the big fish. They had never seen it before.
Finally, Fin met an old wise turtle. The turtle said, "The big fish is not real. It is just an image on a rock." Fin felt sad but learned that not everything we see is real. Fin continued to swim and make friends with real fish in the big blue sea.



One day, a big bus went down the road. The bus was very fair and nice. It had many colors and a happy face. The bus liked to take kids to fun places like the park and the zoo.
At the park, the kids saw a man balance on a long rope. He was very good at it. The kids clapped and laughed. They wanted to try to balance too. So, the man let them try, but he held their hands so they would not fall.
After playing at the park, the bus took the kids to the zoo. They saw many animals like big lions, tall giraffes, and funny monkeys. The kids were very happy. At the end of the day, the fair bus took them home. They waved goodbye to the bus and thanked it for the fun day.



Once upon a time, there was a big town with a little shop. In the shop, there was an enormous ball. This ball was very special, and everyone wanted to see it.
One day, a small girl named Lily went to the shop. She saw the enormous ball and wanted to touch it. The shopkeeper told her, "If you rub the ball, something amazing will happen." So Lily rubbed the ball, and it started to glow. The glow made everyone in the town happy.
The people in the town learned that being kind and sharing the ball's glow made everyone feel good. They took turns rubbing the ball to make it glow. The town became a happy place, and everyone learned that sharing and being kind is important. And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a great big hill. On top of the hill, there was a pitch where kids liked to play. Every day, they would run, jump, and have lots of fun.
One sunny day, a little boy named Tim went to the pitch to play. He saw a big, round ball. Tim wanted to play with it, so he poked the ball with his finger. The ball started to roll down the hill.
Tim chased the ball down the hill, laughing and shouting. His friends saw him and joined in the fun. They all poked the ball, making it roll faster and faster. At the bottom of the hill, they stopped the ball and cheered. They had a great time playing together on the pitch.



One day, a little dog named Spot was very impatient. He wanted to go outside and play. Spot saw a big chair and decided to seat on it. He jumped up and sat down.
"Spot, do not seat on the chair!" said Mom. "You can go outside and play now." Spot was happy and ran outside. He saw a little house that looked like a jail. Spot was curious and went inside.
Inside the jail, he found a small bird. The bird said, "Help! I am stuck in this jail. Can you open the door?" Spot tried to open the door, but it was too hard. He called his friend, a big dog named Max. Max came and helped Spot open the door.
The bird was free and thanked Spot and Max. They all played together outside and had a lot of fun. Spot was not impatient anymore and learned that helping others can be fun too.



Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tim. Tim was a fine cat with soft fur. He lived in a small house with his family. They all loved Tim very much.
One sunny day, Tim went outside to play. He saw a big tree and decided to sit under it. The tree had many leaves, and it gave Tim some shade from the heat of the sun.
As Tim sat under the tree, he saw a little bird. The bird was singing a happy song. Tim liked the song, so he stayed under the tree and listened. They spent the whole day together, and Tim felt very happy.



One day, a boy named Tom went for a walk with his dog, Max. They went to the park and played with a ball. Max was very happy and Tom was having fun too.
While they played, Tom saw a leak in a big pipe. Water was coming out very fast. Tom thought, "I need to find something useful to fix the leak." He looked around the park and found a big rock.
Tom put the rock on the leak, and the water stopped coming out. Max looked at Tom and wagged his tail. Tom felt very proud because he fixed the leak. They went back to playing with the ball, knowing they did a good thing.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very patient boy. He liked to play outside with his toys. One day, he found an axe in the yard. It was not a real axe, but a toy axe. Tim was very excited to play with it.
Tim took his toy axe and went to the woods. He pretended to chop down the trees, just like his dad. Tim was so excited, he laughed and jumped up and down. He played all day long with his toy axe, having so much fun.
When it was time to go home, Tim took his toy axe with him. He showed it to his mom and dad. They were happy to see Tim so excited. They all sat down for dinner and Tim told them about his day. They all smiled and laughed together.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. She loved to draw and write in her journal. Every day, she would write about her day and draw pictures of her friends and family. Jane's journal was very important to her, and she valued it a lot.
One day, Jane went to the park with her journal. She found a big, disgusting bug. The bug was green and slimy. Jane thought it was icky, but she wanted to draw it in her journal. So, she sat down and drew the bug with her crayons.
When Jane finished drawing, she showed her picture to her mom. Her mom said, "Wow, that bug looks disgusting, but your drawing is very good!" Jane was happy that her mom liked her drawing. She knew that her journal was special and she would keep drawing and writing in it every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little train. The train loved to wave at his friends. Every day, he would go on a fun ride. The train was very comfortable.
One day, the train saw some steam. The steam was coming from a big pot. The train was curious. He wanted to see what was in the pot.
The train went closer to the pot. He saw a nice man cooking food. The man saw the train and waved back. The train was happy. He made a new friend. And they lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, in a small pond, there was a shy little fish named Fin. Fin was not like the other fish. He was afraid to swim and play with his friends. He liked to hide behind the big rocks and watch them from far away.
One day, while Fin was hiding, he saw a big net coming to catch his friends. He wanted to warn them, but he was too shy. He knew he had to do something, so he took a deep breath and started to crawl on the bottom of the pond. He crawled and crawled until he reached his friends.
Fin shouted, "Net! Net! Swim away!" The other fish heard him and they all swam away as fast as they could. They were safe because Fin was brave and helped them. From that day on, Fin was not shy anymore. He learned that sometimes, you have to be brave to help your friends.
And the moral of the story is: Don't let your fears stop you from helping others.



Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a lonely dog named Max. Max did not have any friends to play with. One day, Max went on a walk to search for new friends.
While Max was searching, the ground started to shake. It was an earthquake! Max was scared, but he knew he had to be brave. He ran to find a safe place to hide.
After the earthquake, Max saw a little girl who was also scared. He went to her and they became friends. They were not lonely anymore. They played together and were happy. And that is how Max found a friend after the earthquake.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and a humble cat named Muffin. They were a happy family.
One day, Tim's dad went to work. He worked with coal, a black rock that people use for heat. Tim wanted to join his dad at work, but he was too little. So he played with Muffin instead.
After a fun day of playing, Tim's dad came home. He was covered in coal dust. Tim laughed and gave his dad a big hug. Then they all had dinner together. The end.



Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim was very excited. He wanted to go to the park with his mom and dad. They were going to play with a sail.
At the park, the wind blew. The sail went up, up, up in the sky. Tim laughed and clapped his hands. The sail danced in the air. Tim's mom and dad were happy too.
But then, it started to rain. The sail got wet. Tim was sad. They went home and hung the sail up to dry. The next day, the sun came out. The sail was dry again. Tim was excited to play with the sail another day.



Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They needed to buy food for dinner. Tim saw a big fish in the store and he wanted it. He asked his mom, "Can we get the fish, please?"
His mom said, "Yes, we can get the fish." Tim was very glad. They took the fish and went to the man at the front of the store. The man said, "You need to pay for the fish." Tim's mom gave the man some money and they paid for the fish.
They went home and cooked the fish for dinner. Tim was happy he got to eat the fish he picked from the store. He thought it was very yummy. From that day on, Tim always loved to eat fish.



Once upon a time, there was a small pebble named Pebby. Pebby lived in a big garden with many other pebbles. One day, Pebby saw a big rock talking to the other pebbles. Pebby wanted to understand what the big rock was saying.
Pebby went closer to listen, but the big rock saw Pebby and laughed. The big rock said, "You are too small to understand!" Pebby felt very sad and ashamed. Pebby wished to be big like the other pebbles so they could understand the big rock too.
One day, a nice bird saw Pebby feeling sad. The bird told Pebby, "You don't have to be big to understand. You just have to listen and learn." Pebby listened to the bird and started to learn from the other pebbles. Soon, Pebby could understand what the big rock was saying. Pebby was very happy and was no longer ashamed.



Once upon a time, there was a big cloud. The cloud was scary. It was dark and loud. The cloud had lightning inside it.
One day, the cloud wanted to spread. It moved and moved. The lightning went with the cloud. The cloud went over a small town.
The people in the town saw the cloud. They saw the lightning. They were scared. They ran inside their homes. The cloud moved away. The people were happy again. The scary cloud and lightning were gone.



Once upon a time, there was a fast bunny named Bob and a graceful deer named Daisy. They both lived in a big forest. One day, they decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
Before the race, Bob said, "Daisy, do you remember the last time we raced? I won! I am very fast!" Daisy smiled and said, "Yes, I remember, Bob. But this time, I will win the race."
The race started, and Bob and Daisy ran as fast as they could. But then, they saw a big river in their way. Bob and Daisy didn't know what to do. They both wanted to win the race, but they couldn't cross the river.
Bob had an idea. He said, "Daisy, let's work together to find a way across the river. Then we can finish the race." Daisy agreed, and they both looked for a way to cross the river.
In the end, Bob and Daisy found a big log to walk across. They crossed the river and finished the race together. They learned that sometimes, working together is better than trying to win alone.



Once upon a time, in a small kitchen, there was a big bowl of pasta. The pasta was long and curly. A little girl named Mia loved to eat pasta. It was her favorite food. She thought it was so yummy.
One day, Mia's mom said, "Mia, it's time to eat!" Mia ran to the kitchen and saw the pasta. She was so happy. She sat down and started to eat. But the pasta was too long to fit in her mouth. Mia didn't know what to do. 
Mia's mom saw her trying to eat the pasta. She said, "Mia, let me help you." She took a piece of pasta and snapped it in half. Now, the pasta could fit in Mia's mouth. Mia smiled and said, "Thank you, Mom!" They both laughed and enjoyed their yummy pasta meal.



Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was frightened of loud noises. One day, he went for a walk in the park with his best friend, a little girl named Amy.
"Spot, let's start our walk," said Amy. They walked and played in the park. Spot was very happy. But then, a loud noise came from the sky. Spot was frightened and ran away.
Amy looked for Spot and found him hiding under a big tree. "Spot, it's okay. The loud noise is gone," said Amy. She sat down next to him and started to pet him gently. "Relax, Spot. I am here with you."
Spot felt safe with Amy and began to relax. They stayed under the tree for a little while. When they were both ready, they went back to playing in the park. Spot was not frightened anymore because he knew Amy was there to keep him safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to play in her room, which she called her "chamber." Her chamber was a safe place where she could have fun and be happy.
One sunny day, Mia's friend, Tom, came over to play. They went to the park to play on the swings. Mia loved to swing high in the sky, and Tom liked to swing too. They laughed and talked while they played.
Mia said, "Tom, do you want to see my chamber? It's a safe place to play." Tom smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to see your chamber, Mia." So they went back to Mia's house and played in her chamber. They had a great time, and they knew they were safe and happy in Mia's special chamber.



Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. One day, Spot went for a jog in the park. As he jogged, he saw a shelter. Spot was curious, so he went inside.
In the shelter, Spot found a big, impatient cat named Fluffy. Fluffy said, "Spot, I want to go for a jog too! Can you help me?" Spot nodded and said, "Yes, Fluffy! Let's jog together."
Spot and Fluffy jogged around the park. They were very happy. After their jog, they went back to the shelter. They became good friends and played together every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a dog named Spot. Sue and Spot were best friends. They played together every day.
One day, Sue taught Spot a new trick. She said, "Spot, sit!" Spot sat down. Sue said, "Good boy, Spot!" Sue gave Spot a reward for doing the trick. The reward was a tasty treat. Spot loved the treat.
Sue's friend, Tim, saw Sue and Spot. Tim was jealous. He wanted to teach his cat, Fluffy, a trick too. Tim said, "Fluffy, sit!" But Fluffy did not sit. Tim tried to repeat what Sue did. He said, "Fluffy, sit!" again. This time, Fluffy sat down. Tim was so happy. He gave Fluffy a reward too. Now, Sue, Spot, Tim, and Fluffy could all play together and do tricks.



Once upon a time, there was a little fox. The fox lived in a big forest. One day, the fox saw a big tree with a fruit. The fox wanted the fruit so much.
The fox tried to pull the fruit down. But the fruit was too high. The fox felt sorry that he could not get the fruit. Then, a big bird came and saw the fox.
The bird wanted to help the fox. So, the bird flew up and pulled the fruit down. The fox was very happy. The fox and the bird shared the fruit and became good friends.



Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named Jane. Jane had a weird toy. It was a velvet cat. She loved her cat very much. Every night, she would hold it close and go to sleep.
One day, Jane was playing with her velvet cat. She saw her friend Tom outside. Tom came in and said, "Hi Jane! What is that weird toy?" Jane smiled and said, "This is my velvet cat. I love it very much."
Tom looked at the velvet cat and thought it was nice. He asked, "Can I hold it close too?" Jane said, "Yes, you can." Tom held the velvet cat close and felt happy. They both played with the velvet cat all day long.



Once upon a time, there was a dog named Spot. Spot was not like other dogs, he was very original. He had a beautiful, big, and colorful tail. Spot loved to play with his friends and have fun.
One day, Spot was playing with his friend, Tim. Tim said, "Wow, Spot! Your tail is so big and pretty!" Spot was very happy to hear this. He wanted to make his tail even more special, so he decided to increase the size of his tail.
Spot ate a lot of food and his tail grew bigger and bigger. All his friends were amazed by how big it got. They all said, "Spot, you have the biggest tail we have ever seen!"
Spot was very proud of his big tail, but he also liked being original. He knew that having a big tail was not the only thing that made him special. He decided to be happy with his original tail and not try to increase it anymore.
From that day on, Spot learned that being original is what makes you special. He continued to play with his friends and have fun, and they all loved him for who he was.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a careless boy. He loved to play outside in the mud and get wet. One day, Tim's mom told him not to play in the mud because it would make him wet and dirty.
Tim did not listen to his mom. He went outside and played in the mud. He got very wet and dirty. His mom saw him and said, "Tim, I told you not to play in the mud! Now you are wet and dirty."
Tim felt sad because he did not listen to his mom. He said, "I am sorry, Mom. I will not be careless again." Tim's mom helped him clean up and they hugged. From that day on, Tim tried to be more careful and listen to his mom.



Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. He liked to spend all day sleeping in the sun. Tom did not like to play or run.
One day, Tom found a magic toy. The toy gave him special power. He could now jump very high and run very fast. Tom was happy with his new power.
Tom decided to stop being lazy. He spent his days playing with his friends and helping them. Everyone loved Tom and his new power. And Tom was happy too.



Once upon a time, there was a clumsy dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball. One day, while playing, he bumped into a big screen. The screen fell down with a loud noise.
Spot's friend, a little bird named Tweet, heard the noise and came to see what happened. Tweet saw the screen on the ground and the ball near Spot. Tweet yelled, "Spot, are you okay?"
Spot looked at Tweet and said, "Yes, I am okay. I was just clumsy and bumped into the screen." They both laughed and picked up the screen together. After that, they played with the ball and had a fun day.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a violin that she loved to play. One day, she was going to play at her friend's house.
On her way, she saw a big dog. The dog said, "Hi Lily! Can you play your violin for me?" Lily said, "Yes, I can play for you, but first I need to go to my friend's house. I will play for you after that." The dog was happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! I will wait here."
Lily went to her friend's house and played the violin. They had lots of fun. But then, Lily forgot her violin at her friend's house when she left. She went back to the big dog, but she did not have her violin.
The dog asked, "Where is your violin, Lily?" Lily was sad and said, "I forgot it at my friend's house. I am sorry." The dog said, "That's okay, Lily. We can go get it together, and I will keep you safe."
So, Lily and the big dog went back to her friend's house. They got the violin, and Lily played a beautiful song for the dog. They were both happy, and Lily knew her violin was safe with her new friend, the big dog.



Once upon a time, there was a bird who wanted to fly very high. The bird was heavy, so it was hard for him to fly. The bird tried and tried, but it could not fly high.
One day, the bird met a doctor. The doctor said, "I can help you fly high!" The bird was very happy. The doctor gave the bird some medicine to help it fly high.
The bird took the medicine and tried to fly. It flew higher and higher, but then the bird felt sick. The bird fell down from the sky and could not fly anymore. The bird was sad and the doctor was sad too.
The moral of the story is that we should not try to be something we are not. We should be happy with who we are and what we can do.



Once upon a time, there was a fat cat named Tom. Tom liked to eat a lot of food. One day, Tom saw a pretty image on the wall. It was a picture of a big fish. Tom wanted to eat the fish in the image, but he could not. It was just a picture.
Tom went outside to look for a real fish to eat. While he was running, he hurt his leg. Tom was very sad. He could not walk or run to find a fish now. He sat down and cried.
Tom's friend, a little bird named Sue, saw him crying. Sue wanted to help Tom. She knew a special song that could heal Tom's leg. Sue sang the song for Tom. Slowly, Tom's leg began to feel better. Tom was very happy. He could walk and run again. Tom thanked Sue for healing his leg. They became best friends and played together every day.



Once upon a time, there was a big red horse named Bob. Bob lived in a stable. He had many friends like the cow, the pig, and the sheep. They all liked to play in the sun.
One day, Bob wanted to go for a walk. He was very happy. But Bob was careless. He did not look where he was going. He stepped on a big rock and fell down. "Ouch!" said Bob. His leg hurt a lot.
His friends saw him and came to help. They took him back to the stable. They gave him love and care. Soon, Bob felt better. He learned to be careful when he goes for walks. And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy mine that he loved to play with. One day, Tim went to the park with his mine.
At the park, Tim met another boy named Sam. Sam saw Tim's mine and thought it was very original. He said, "Wow, your mine is so cool! Can I play with it too?" Tim said, "Yes, you can play with it, but we have to share."
As they played together, they had so much fun. They learned that when they share, they get to have more friends and more fun. The moral of the story is that sharing is caring.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. One day, Tim went to the store with his mom. They bought some spicy food. Tim liked spicy food very much.
On their way home, Tim and his mom needed to take a taxi. They waited and waited for a taxi to come. Finally, Tim noticed a yellow taxi coming their way. They got in the taxi and told the driver where they lived.
As they got closer to their home, the sky turned dark and it started to rain. Tim and his mom ran inside their house. But they forgot the spicy food in the taxi. The taxi drove away, and they never saw the spicy food again. Tim was very sad because he wanted to eat the spicy food.



Once upon a time, in a big pretty sky, there was a bird who could fly. This bird was purple, and it was very polite. The purple bird liked to say "hello" and "please" and "thank you" to all its friends.
One day, the purple bird met a little red fish. The fish could not fly, but it could swim. The purple bird and the red fish became good friends. They played together every day. The purple bird would fly high in the sky, and the red fish would swim fast in the water.
As they played together, the purple bird was always very polite. It would say "please" when it wanted to play and "thank you" when they were done. The red fish liked the purple bird's polite ways and learned to be polite too. They were the best of friends and had lots of fun together. And they lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a rat named Remy. Remy lived in a big park. He was a popular rat because he was kind and funny. All the other rats liked to play with Remy.
One day, Remy saw the sun shine very bright. He wanted to find a new friend to play with in the sun. Remy saw a big tree and under the tree was a cat named Kitty. Remy said, "Hi Kitty, do you want to play with me in the sun?"
Kitty looked at Remy and said, "Yes, Remy! Let's play together." So, Remy and Kitty played in the sun all day. They ran, jumped, and laughed. From that day on, Remy and Kitty were best friends. They played together every day, and the sun always seemed to shine brighter when they were together.



Once upon a time, there was a big bear. The bear was very hungry. He went to find food in the forest. He saw a small rabbit. The rabbit was very scared because the bear looked terrible.
The rabbit had an idea. He said to the bear, "Please don't eat me! I can help you find better food." The bear thought about it and said, "Okay, show me the food." The rabbit urged the bear to follow him.
They found a big tree with lots of sweet fruit. The bear ate the fruit and was very happy. The rabbit was happy too because he helped the bear and did not get eaten. From that day on, the bear and the rabbit became good friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play and discover new things. One day, he found a candle in a box.
Tim showed the candle to his mom. "Look, Mom! I found a candle!" he said. His mom smiled and said, "Great job, Tim! That candle can give us light when it is dark."
That night, Tim wanted to use the candle. He asked his mom, "Can we use the candle now?" His mom said, "Yes, but be careful. The fire can be hot." Tim felt a little embarrassed because he did not know that.
Tim and his mom lit the candle together. They watched the candle glow in the dark. Tim felt happy that he discovered the candle. They had a cozy night with the candle's light.



Once upon a time, there was a cute little dog named Toby. Toby loved to stir his water bowl with his paw. One day, Toby's family went on a holiday, and they took Toby with them.
On the holiday, Toby met a new friend named Daisy. Daisy was a small bird who liked to sing. Toby asked Daisy, "Do you like to stir things too?" Daisy said, "No, I like to sing. But I can try to stir with you!" They played together, and Toby showed Daisy how to stir.
As they stirred and played, they made a big mess. Toby's family saw the mess and said, "Toby, you need to learn to be careful when you play." Toby and Daisy felt sad, but they learned that it is important to be careful and not make a mess. From that day on, they played together carefully and had lots of fun on their holiday.



Once upon a time, there was a little hut in the woods. It was very smelly because a big, stinky skunk lived there. The skunk loved to put smelly things in his hut to make it even more smelly.
One day, a little girl named Lily walked by the hut. She smelled the smelly hut and said, "Ew, what a smelly hut!" She wanted to help the skunk make his hut smell better. So, Lily went to find some nice smelling flowers.
Lily found some pretty flowers and put them in the smelly hut. The skunk liked the flowers and said, "Thank you, Lily!" Now, the hut smelled much better. The skunk and Lily became good friends and played together in the woods every day.



Once upon a time, there was a woman. She was deaf, so she could not hear. She had a big cat. The cat liked to play with the woman. They were very happy.
One day, the cat was playing with a ball. The ball went far away. The cat ran to get the ball. The woman could not see the cat. She looked around for her cat.
The cat came back with the ball. The cat jumped and gave the woman a big slap with its paw. The woman laughed and hugged the cat. They played more and had fun. The woman and the cat were best friends.



Once upon a time, there was a heavy cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play with her ball. One day, Fluffy saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was playing with a ball too. Fluffy wanted to play with Lily's ball.
Fluffy went to Lily and asked, "Can I play with your ball?" Lily said, "No, this ball belongs to me. But we can play together with my ball." Fluffy was very happy to hear that. They played with the ball all day.
At the end of the day, Fluffy was tired. She said to Lily, "Thank you for playing with me." Lily said, "You're welcome, Fluffy. I had fun playing with you too." They became good friends and played together every day.



Once upon a time, there was a colorful bird. The bird liked to fly high in the sky. The bird had many friends.
One day, a big wind came. The wind was a hurricane. The bird and its friends were scared. They needed to find a safe place.
The colorful bird had an idea. It started to ring a bell. The bell sound was loud. All the friends heard the bell and came together. They found a safe place to hide from the hurricane. The bird and its friends were happy and safe.



One day, a little fish named Fin wanted to swim. He loved to swim fast and play with his friends in the water. But today, he saw something new. It was a cop car near the water. Fin was very curious.
Fin swam closer to the cop car. He saw a cop standing near the water. The cop looked sad. Fin swam up to the cop and said, "Why are you sad, Mr. Cop?"
The cop looked at Fin and said, "My ice cream is spoiled. I wanted to eat it, but now I can't." Fin thought for a moment. He wanted to help the cop feel better.
Fin had an idea. He told the cop, "Let's swim together! It's fun and will make you happy." The cop smiled and agreed. They both swam and played in the water. The cop forgot all about his spoiled ice cream. They had a great time and became good friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to study and learn new things. One day, she was very upset because her ice cream was all gone.
Lucy went to the big freezer in her house to find more ice cream. She opened the freezer and saw a big box. Inside the box, she found many ice creams in different colors. Lucy was so happy!
Lucy took the ice creams to her room and shared them with her teddy bear. They both enjoyed the cold and sweet treat. Now, Lucy was not upset anymore. She went back to study with a big smile on her face.



Once upon a time, there was a little dove. The dove lived in a dry tree. The dry tree had no leaves. The dove was sad because the tree was not pretty.
One day, the dove wanted to sleep. It was very tired. So the dove tried to sleep on the dry tree. But the dry tree was not comfortable. The dove could not sleep well.
The dove was very sad. It wanted to find a new tree to sleep on. But the dove was too tired to fly. The dove fell down from the dry tree. The dove did not feel good. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Tom. He lived in a small house with his friend, a happy dog named Max. Tom and Max liked to play outside and make sounds. Tom would meow, and Max would bark.
One sunny day, Tom and Max found a pretty red ball. They played with the ball all day long. But then, it was time for Tom to mail a letter to his friend, a wise old owl. So, Tom and Max went to the big blue mailbox.
As they walked, Tom and Max heard a strange sound. They looked up and saw a little bird stuck in a tree. Tom and Max wanted to help the bird. Tom climbed the tree and helped the bird get free. The bird was very happy.
Tom and Max went back to their small house. They were tired but happy they helped the little bird. That night, Tom was not grumpy anymore. He was a happy cat who liked to mail letters and make sounds with his best friend, Max.



One day, a boy named Tim found a key. The key was big and shiny. Tim wanted to find what the key could open. He looked all around his tidy room, but there was no lock. Tim was sad.
Tim went to his friend, Sam. Sam had a big seat in his house. Tim and Sam sat on the seat and talked about the key. They wanted to find the lock, too. But they started to fight. Tim wanted to keep the key, but Sam wanted it, too.
In the end, Tim and Sam were so mad that they threw the key out the window. The key was lost in the tall grass. They could not find it again. Tim and Sam were very sad and did not find what the key could open.



Once upon a time, there was a rich man. He had a big house and many things. But he needed a cane to walk. One day, he went to the park with his cane. He saw a little boy playing with a ball.
The little boy saw the man's cane and asked, "Why do you have a stick?" The rich man said, "It helps me walk." The little boy wanted to help, so he asked, "Can I delay you? I will hold your cane, and we can walk together."
The rich man smiled and said, "Yes, you can delay me." They walked in the park, and the little boy held the cane. They talked and laughed. The rich man was happy to have a friend. The little boy was happy to help. They had a good day at the park.



Once upon a time, there was a warm day. A little boy named Tim went to play near a creek. He liked to watch the water move and listen to the sounds it made.
One day, Tim saw something new in the creek. He wanted to examine it. It was a small, shiny thing. Tim tried to reach for it, but he fell into the water.
The water was cold and Tim was scared. He cried for help, but no one was close to hear him. Tim tried to swim, but he could not. In the end, Tim could not get out of the creek, and it was a very sad day.



Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Remy. Remy was a different rabbit because he had a very big spring in his step. He loved to hop and jump all day long.
One sunny day, Remy saw a stand with many colorful balloons. He met a little girl named Lucy. Lucy said, "Hi, Remy! Would you like a balloon?" Remy nodded and picked a big, blue balloon. Lucy tied the balloon to Remy's tail.
As Remy hopped away, he felt the balloon tugging at his tail. He was scared but then he remembered his big spring. Remy took a deep breath and jumped as high as he could. The balloon lifted him up into the sky.
Remy looked down and saw all his friends cheering for him. He felt so happy and proud. The moral of the story is to always believe in yourself and use your special talents to help others.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a rare toy that she loved very much. It was a big, red ball. She played with it every day.
One day, Mia saw a small leak in her ball. She tried to resist playing with it, but it was too hard. She played with the ball all day, even though it was leaking.
At the end of the day, the ball was flat. Mia could not play with it anymore. She was very sad. The leak had made her ball go away, and Mia had a bad day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to eat cherries. She thought they were very delicious. One day, her mom gave her a big bowl of cherries to eat.
Sue was so happy. She sat down and started to eat the cherries one by one. She liked how they were red and sweet. She ate and ate until there was just one cherry left.
Sue wanted to finish all the cherries in the bowl. She picked up the last cherry and ate it. It was the most delicious cherry of all. Sue was very full and happy. She thanked her mom for the yummy cherries and went to play outside.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lucy. She had a big box. Inside the box, there was a blouse. Lucy wanted to unpack the box to see the blouse.
When Lucy unpacked the box, she found a pretty blouse. It was red and had flowers on it. Lucy was so happy! She put on the blouse and danced around her room.
Lucy's mom made dinner. They had spicy food. Lucy liked spicy food a lot. She ate all her food and said, "Yum! I like my new blouse and spicy food!" And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. One day, her mom asked her to help fill the refrigerator with food. Amy was very excited to help.
Amy and her mom went to the store and bought lots of fruits, vegetables, and milk. When they came home, Amy's mom said, "Let's fill the refrigerator together!" Amy happily put the fruits and vegetables in the refrigerator. But when she tried to put the milk in, she saw a big spider on the refrigerator door. Amy was frightened and yelled, "Mom, there's a big spider!"
Her mom came and saw the spider. She said, "Don't be frightened, Amy. The spider won't hurt you." Then, her mom gently took the spider and put it outside. Amy felt better and finished filling the refrigerator with her mom. They both smiled and were happy with their hard work.



Once upon a time, in a small farm, there lived a tiny mouse. The mouse was always frightened of the big animals around him. One day, he saw some wheat in the field. He wanted to eat it but was too scared to go and get it.
The tiny mouse had a friend, a big cow. The mouse went to the cow and said, "Can you please help me get the wheat? I am too frightened to go alone." The cow agreed to help and they both went to the field. The cow was not scared at all. The cow helped the mouse get the wheat and they both ate it together.
The tiny mouse learned that it is okay to request help when you are frightened. He also learned that having a friend to help you can make you feel brave. The mouse and the cow stayed friends forever and always helped each other when they were scared. The moral of the story is to ask for help when you need it and to be a good friend to others.



Once upon a time, there was a pale bunny named Bobo. Bobo lived in a big forest with many friends. Every day, Bobo played with his friends and had a lot of fun.
One day, Bobo and his friends wanted to have a race. They wanted to see who was the fastest. They all lined up and got ready to run. "Hurry!" said Bobo's friend, the bird. So, they all started to run as fast as they could.
Bobo ran and ran, and he was very fast. He passed all his friends and reached the finish line first. Everyone cheered for Bobo. It was a big success! Bobo was very happy and proud. From that day on, Bobo and his friends had many more races and fun times together.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big, colorful flag that he loved to wave around. One day, his friend, Lily, asked if she could lend his flag to play with. Tim said yes, because he was a good friend.
Lily took the flag and ran around with it. But then, a naughty dog saw the flag and wanted it too. The dog jumped and tried to take the flag away from Lily. Lily was scared, and she did not want the dog to have the flag.
Tim saw what was happening and ran to help Lily. He shouted at the naughty dog and waved his arms. The dog got scared and ran away. Tim and Lily were happy that they saved the flag. They played together with the flag for the rest of the day.



Once upon a time, there was a little ghost. The ghost liked to study. He liked to learn new things. He lived in a big house with other ghosts. The other ghosts played all day. They did not study. They did not learn new things.
One day, the little ghost found a big book. The book was about being kind. The little ghost studied the book. He learned how to be kind. The other ghosts saw the little ghost being kind. They were envious. They wanted to be kind too.
The little ghost taught the other ghosts how to be kind. They all studied the big book. They all learned how to be kind. The big house was now a happy house. The ghosts became friends. They played and studied together. The moral of the story is that learning and being kind makes everyone happy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to go to the store with her mom. One day, Sue's mom said they needed to buy some food. Sue was very happy!
Sue and her mom went to the store. They took a huge basket to put the food in. They bought apples, bananas, and bread. Sue liked to help her mom put the food in the basket.
When they were done, they went home. Sue helped her mom put the food away. They had a lot of food in their huge basket. Sue was a good helper, and her mom was so proud.



Once upon a time, there was a regular cat named Tom. Tom liked to enter the house and sit under the table. The table was big and brown.
One day, Tom saw a little mouse enter the house. The mouse ran under the table. Tom wanted to play with the mouse, so he went under the table too. They both had fun playing together.
After playing, Tom and the mouse became friends. They would always enter the house and play under the table. They were happy and had lots of fun.



Once upon a time, there was a big, red bus. It had a driver who drove it every day. One day, the bus saw a scary cat. The cat had big, sharp teeth and it made the bus very scared.
The bus yelled to the driver, "Help me! There is a scary cat!" The driver looked at the cat and said, "Do not worry, bus. I will help you." The driver honked the horn very loud. The scary cat heard the loud noise and ran away.
The bus was very happy. The driver and the bus went on their way. They were not scared anymore. They had a good day and saw many friends. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Max. Max liked to help his family. Every day, Max would pour water for his family to drink. He would also help them turn the switch on and off to make the room bright or dark.
One day, Max saw a little bird who was thirsty. The bird could not find water to drink. Max wanted to help the bird. He found a small cup and poured water into it. The little bird drank the water and was very happy.
Max and the little bird became good friends. They played together every day. Max would always pour water for the bird and help with the switch. The little bird knew that Max was a dependable friend. And they lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a very interesting hat. It was red and blue with a big, yellow star on it. He loved to wear his hat every day.
One day, Tim saw a big tree with a kite stuck in it. He wanted to help get the kite down. Tim thought, "If I wear my interesting hat, maybe I can succeed!" So, he put on his hat and started to climb the tree.
With his hat on, Tim felt strong and brave. He climbed higher and higher until he reached the kite. He pulled it free and climbed back down. Tim succeeded in getting the kite down, all thanks to his interesting hat.



Once upon a time, there was a big, pink cat. This cat had a funny mustache. The cat loved to play with a ball. One day, the ball went far away. The cat wanted to reach the ball.
The cat tried to reach the ball, but it was too far. The cat looked around for help. A small dog saw the cat and wanted to help. The dog had a long stick. The dog used the stick to reach the ball.
The cat was happy to have the ball back. The cat and the dog played together with the ball. They became good friends. The pink cat's funny mustache made the dog laugh. They had a fun day playing together.



Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a fake tree. The tree did not look like the other trees. The other trees were big and strong. The fake tree was small and weak.
