Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy went on a walk with his family. While they were walking, Timmy observed a little bird in a tree. He pointed and said, "Look, I spot a bird!" His family stopped to look and they saw the bird too. Timmy was so happy that he could observe the bird and share it with his family. They continued their walk and Timmy couldn't wait to spot more animals along the way.



Once upon a time, there was a little goat named Billy. Billy had a horn on his head that made him look special. One day, Billy met a little bird named Tweety. Tweety said, "Wow, Billy! You have a cool horn!" Billy said, "Thank you, Tweety! I like my horn too."
But then, a mean wolf came along and said, "Hey, Billy! I want your horn for myself!" Billy got scared and ran away. Tweety said, "Poor Billy, he got scared because of that mean wolf." 
Later, Billy and Tweety saw the wolf again. The wolf said, "I won't hurt you, Billy. I just want to see your horn." Billy said, "No, it's mine! You can't have it!" The wolf got angry and tried to take the horn. But Billy was strong and didn't let the wolf get it. In the end, the wolf went away and Billy felt proud of himself for standing up to the wolf.



Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Nemo. Nemo loved to swim in the big, blue ocean with his fishy friends. One day, Nemo's mom showed him a calendar with pictures of all the different sea creatures they might see on their swim that day. Nemo was so excited to see a big, scary shark and a pretty, shiny starfish.
As they swam deeper into the ocean, Nemo saw something that made him scared. It was a dark, spooky cave. Nemo's mom told him not to be scared and that they would swim past it quickly. But Nemo couldn't help feeling a little scared as they swam by the cave.
Finally, they made it to the other side of the cave and Nemo felt relieved. He realized that sometimes things might seem scary, but with his mom by his side, he could swim through anything.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to sort his toys into different colors. He had a red pile, a blue pile, and a green pile. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a quiz to do. The quiz had pictures of animals and Timmy had to say what animal it was. Timmy did really well and got a clear sticker as a prize.
But then, Timmy's little sister came into the room and knocked over all of his toy piles. Timmy got really angry and started to yell. His sister started to cry and Timmy felt bad. He tried to sort his toys again, but he couldn't remember which toy went where. Timmy felt sad and went to bed without his clear sticker.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to go to the beach with his mommy and daddy. One day, they saw a huge dolphin swimming in the ocean. Timmy was so happy to see the dolphin. He felt excited and amazed.
The dolphin swam closer to the shore and Timmy could see it better. It had a shiny grey skin and a big smile on its face. Timmy wanted to touch the dolphin, but his mommy told him it was not safe. They watched the dolphin swim away and Timmy felt a little sad.
But then, the dolphin jumped out of the water and did a flip in the air! Timmy laughed and clapped his hands. He felt happy again. From that day on, Timmy always looked for the huge dolphin whenever he went to the beach.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Every Sunday, she would wake up fast and happy because she loved going to the park with her family. She would swing and slide and play with her friends. 
One Sunday, Lily saw a little bird with a hurt wing. She cared about the bird and wanted to help it. She gently picked it up and brought it to her mommy. They took the bird to the vet and it got better. 
From that day on, Lily felt happy every Sunday because she knew she could make a difference in the world by caring for others, even if they were just little birds. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy with the laundry. One day, Lily's mommy accidentally spilled some juice on her favorite shirt. Lily wanted to fix it for her mommy. She got a wet cloth and gently wiped the stain. Her mommy was so happy and said, "You're such a sweet helper, Lily!" From that day on, Lily always helped her mommy with the laundry.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big house with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily's mommy asked her if she wanted to help clean the house. 
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I think I can help make the house strong." 
Her mommy smiled and said, "That's a great idea, Lily. Let's start by picking up all the toys." 
Lily picked up her dolls and blocks and put them away. As she was cleaning, she noticed her daddy fixing a broken chair. 
"Daddy, are you making the chair strong again?" she asked. 
"Yes, Lily. I'm using glue to make it strong," her daddy replied. 
Lily was happy she could help make the house strong and clean. She knew it was important to take care of her home.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy boats in the bathtub. One day, Timmy's dad took him to the beach to see the big boats called yachts. Timmy saw an enormous yacht that was so big he could hardly believe it.
Timmy said, "Daddy, can we go on the yacht?"
His dad said, "No, Timmy. We can only look at it from here."
Timmy was sad, but he decided to spin around in circles to make himself feel better. As he was spinning, he accidentally bumped into a man who was walking by. The man got angry and pushed Timmy, causing him to fall into the water.
Timmy's dad jumped in to save him, but it was too late. Timmy had drowned. His dad was heartbroken and wished he had never taken him to see the enormous yacht.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had long, curly hair that she loved to rub between her fingers. One day, she met a wealthy woman who had a big house and lots of toys.
"Your hair is so pretty," said the wealthy woman. "I'll give you lots of toys if you let me rub your hair."
Lily thought about it for a moment and then agreed. The wealthy woman rubbed her hair for a long time and then gave her lots of toys. Lily was happy and went home to play with her new toys.
But the next day, Lily woke up with a rash on her head. Her mom took her to the doctor and found out that the wealthy woman had given her lice. Lily had to cut off all her hair and throw away her new toys. She learned that sometimes, being wealthy doesn't mean being kind.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine and pick pretty flowers. One day, while playing in the park, she found a shiny gem on the ground. It was so pretty and sparkly, she couldn't resist picking it up and putting it in her pocket.
Later that day, Lily's mom noticed the gem in her pocket and asked her where she got it from. Lily showed her mom and her mom was very surprised. She told Lily that the gem was very valuable and should be returned to its rightful owner. Lily felt regret for taking the gem and promised to return it.
The next day, Lily went back to the park and asked around if anyone had lost a gem. Finally, an old lady came forward and said it was hers. She was so happy to have it back and gave Lily a big hug. Lily felt happy that she did the right thing and everything was back to normal.



Once upon a time, there was a big river. In the river, there lived a crocodile. The crocodile was very big and powerful. One day, the crocodile wanted to dive into the river. So, he took a deep breath and dived into the water. He swam very fast and felt very happy.
As the crocodile was swimming, he saw a little fish. The fish was scared of the crocodile because he was so big and powerful. But the crocodile was friendly and said hello to the fish. The fish was surprised and happy to see that the crocodile was not mean.
After a while, the crocodile had to go back to his home. He said goodbye to the little fish and dived back into the water. The fish watched the crocodile swim away and felt very happy to have made a new friend.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat steak because it was so tasty. One day, Timmy's mom cooked him a big juicy steak for dinner. Timmy was so happy and said, "Mommy, this steak is so yummy! Can we have it every day?"
His mom replied, "No, Timmy. We can't have steak every day. It's not good for our bodies."
Timmy didn't understand why he couldn't have steak every day, so his mom asked him to imagine eating only one thing every day. Timmy thought about it and said, "I don't want to eat the same thing every day. That would be boring!"
His mom smiled and said, "That's right, Timmy. Eating a variety of foods is important to keep our bodies healthy. So let's enjoy this tasty steak today, but remember to eat different foods every day." And Timmy learned that it's important to have a balanced diet.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to class every day with her friends. One day, Lily's friend Jack was feeling sick and had to leave class early. Lily was sad, but she knew Jack needed to go home and rest. 
After class, Lily went to the playground with her other friends. They played on the swings and the slide, but Lily couldn't stop thinking about Jack. She was persistent in wanting to make him feel better. 
So, Lily decided to draw a picture for Jack to make him smile. She drew a picture of them playing together on the playground. Lily was excited to give it to Jack when he came back to class. 
The next day, Jack came back to class feeling better. Lily gave him the picture and he smiled from ear to ear. Jack was happy to be back with his friends, especially Lily, who had been so persistent in making him feel better.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, Lily went for a walk in the park with her mommy. It was very cold outside and the ground was icy. 
Suddenly, Lily slipped and fell down. She started to cry because it hurt. Her mommy came over and hugged her. "Don't worry sweetie, I'm here to support you," said her mommy. 
As they continued their walk, they heard an alarm go off. "What's that sound?" asked Lily. "It's just a car alarm," replied her mommy. They looked around and saw a car with its alarm blaring. 
Lily's mommy explained that sometimes cars have alarms to protect them. Lily thought it was cool and they continued their walk, holding hands and enjoying the fresh air.



Once upon a time, there was a cute little doggy named Max. Max loved to run and play outside with his leash on. One day, Max saw a big bone on the ground and he ran to get it. But, he didn't see the bitter medicine on it. Max ate it and got sick. 
His owner took him to the vet to heal him. The vet gave Max some medicine and told his owner to keep him on a leash so he wouldn't eat anything bad again. Max's owner did just that and Max got better. 
But one day, Max's owner forgot to put his leash on him and Max saw another bone. He ran to get it and ate it. This time, the bone had a lot of bitter medicine on it and Max got very sick. Sadly, Max didn't heal this time and he went to doggy heaven.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved baking cookies with her mommy on Sunday afternoons. It was their regular thing to do together.
One Sunday, Lily's mommy asked her, "Do you want to bake cookies today, Lily?" Lily replied, "Yes, please mommy!" They went to the kitchen and started to mix the ingredients. Lily loved the smell of the dough and couldn't wait to taste the cookies.
As they were putting the cookies in the oven, Lily asked, "Mommy, why do we bake cookies every Sunday?" Her mommy replied, "It's our regular tradition, Lily. We love spending time together and baking yummy treats."
When the cookies were done, they took them out of the oven and let them cool. Lily took a bite of a warm cookie and exclaimed, "Mmm, these are delicious, mommy!" They both smiled and enjoyed their special Sunday tradition.



Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to eat yummy treats and run around in the grass. One day, Spot saw a big bone on the ground and he wanted to eat it. But the bone was too big for him to carry in his mouth. 
Spot saw a bigger dog and asked him, "Can you help me carry this bone?" The bigger dog answered, "Yes, I can help you." The bigger dog picked up the bone with his heel and carried it to Spot's house. 
Spot was very happy and thanked the bigger dog. He learned that it's important to ask for help when you need it. And it's also important to answer when someone asks you for help. From that day on, Spot and the bigger dog became good friends and shared yummy treats together.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the mud and get his hands dirty. One day, Timmy saw a shiny car parked on the street. He wanted to touch it, so he pulled on the door handle. But the car was locked, and Timmy couldn't get inside.
Suddenly, a man came out of a nearby shop. "Hey, kid, what are you doing?" he asked. Timmy pointed to the car and said, "I want to touch it." The man said, "That's a luxury car. You can't touch it. It's not yours."
Timmy was sad, but he understood. He went back to playing in the mud. But later that day, he saw the man driving the luxury car. He was going too fast and didn't see the stop sign. The car crashed into a tree, and the man was hurt.
Timmy ran to the man and said, "Are you okay?" But the man didn't answer. Timmy knew he had done something bad by pulling on the car door, but he didn't mean for anyone to get hurt. He felt very sad and wished he could make things better.




A mom and dad were getting ready for a trip. The mom packed their luggage and the dad loaded it in the car. Then they hugged each other, kissed their three year old daughter and said goodbye. The daughter was sad, but she knew they would come back soon.
The mom and dad traveled to a big city. They were very serious because they had important business to do. They carried their luggage as they went from meeting to meeting. After many days of hard work, they were done, and they were ready to go home.
At home, their daughter ran to hug them. She was so happy that they were back. As she held them close, she could tell how much they cared for her. She knew that no matter what, her mom and dad would always be there for her.




Once upon a time, there was an enormous castle that belonged to a very mean king. One day, the king told his people that they must gather a very long string. Everyone in the kingdom was sad.
The people of the kingdom started to weep. None of them wanted to take the string to the mean king. So, instead, they all came together and held their hands and made a very long string with their hands.
The kingdom was very happy again! The kind people had made a string bigger than the one the mean king had asked for. The people laughed and hugged each other.
The mean king was so angry when he saw the string. He started to shout and stomp his feet. But the kind people did not care. They were happy that they had all worked together to make something special. 
The people all cheered and the mean king was very jealous. He ran away from the kingdom never to be seen again. Everyone was happy and they all lived happily ever after.




Once upon a time there lived a unique yacht. It was so special because it was filled with lots of fun toys. Every day it would leave the dock early in the morning and sail away in the sea. 
One day, a little girl who was three years old wanted to come and visit. The yacht was so excited and welcomed her with open arms. The girl was amazed by all the colourful toys, the bright sunshine and the wind in her hair. 
The little girl and the yacht had so much fun together. They played games and even jumped into the sea. After a few hours, it was time for the little girl to leave. The yacht was sad to say goodbye, but was excited to have made a new friend. 
The little girl left with a smile on her face. She had such a lovely time and promised to come back soon. Until then the unique yacht sailed out into the sea, happy at last. 




Once there was a little girl who loved to play. One day she was exploring and she found a file in her backyard. She was so happy! She took the file and ran to show her mom.
Her mom was very serious when she saw the file. She said to the little girl that she must stay in the house because the file was very important. The little girl agreed and stayed inside the house.
Then her mom put the file in a safe place. She told her daughter that she was responsible for taking care of the file and that it was a very serious job. The little girl promised to take good care of the file.
Every day the little girl would look at the file and make sure it was safe. Soon it became part of her daily routine and she was happy. She was so proud that she could take care of something so important.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. Jane was three years old and she loved the water.
One day, Jane's mom gave her a raft. The raft was big and fit Jane just right. Jane hopped on the raft and went for a ride.
The water was cool and Jane loved it! She waved to some ducks and madenew friends.
After a while, Jane was getting tired. She hopped off the raft and dragged it back to shore.
Jane was happy because her raft was fit and snug. She thanked her mom and hugged her raft tight.
The End.




Once there was a very busy little girl. Everywhere she went, she was always on the go. One day, while walking, she noticed a bush. She stopped and decided to take a closer look.
She knelt down and carefully opened the bush. She was amazed at what she found. Inside was a big, yellow bee buzzing around! She stared at it and smiled.
The bee was busy collecting pollen from the many colorful flowers in the bush. Little girl watched it for a while, entranced by its beauty.
Eventually she said goodbye to the bee and closed the bush. She continued on her way, feeling happy that she stopped to take a closer look the bush.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She wanted to dress in a special way. She went to the store and there were lots of choices. She found a cheap dress that was nice and bright. She was so happy!
The little girl put on the dress and ran outside. She was playing in her yard when she saw something in the distance. It was a hut. It had lots of windows and a big door.
The little girl took off her dress and decided to explore. She knocked on the door of the hut. It was unlocked, so she opened it. Inside, there was a small room full of things. She was so excited she put on her dress again and ran into the room.
There were lots of wonderful things in the room. Cheap toys, clothes and decorations. The little girl chose some clothes for herself and she put on a pair of shoes. She was so happy with her new stuff.
The little girl took the things she had chosen and ran back to her house. She was so excited to show her mum her new outfits. She had a lot of fun dressing up with her new things.




Once there was a little girl who loved to explore. She loved to go on long adventures and discover new things. Every summer she would hop aboard a plane and explore somewhere new with her family.
When they arrived at the airport, she was excited to go somewhere new. She always felt so special when her parents checked in the heavy suitcases, bought the tickets, and got ready to go. She especially loved the bright colors and friendly smiling faces all around. The airport was a lovely place for her to explore.
But once she was in the plane, she didn't love it so much. She hated how cramped and noisy it was. She was scared of the loud noise it made, especially when it took off. But she always remembered that once she arrived at her destination, it would be worth it.
The little girl was always sad when they had to leave the lovely airport, but she knew that she would explore somewhere new soon. She was always looking forward to the long walks and airplane rides, even though she didn't care much for being on the plane.



One day there was a little girl named Mia. She was three years old. Mia always felt miserable because of how small she was, and she often questioned why she was so small.
One day, Mia got a great idea. She went to her mom and said, "I want to go outside and find somebody bigger and stronger than me, so I can go on adventures!"
Mia's mom smiled and said, "OK, sweetheart, but go to the left. That's the way to your grandpa's house!"
Mia was so excited. She skipped to the left down the path, eager to find her grandpa and get adventures.
When she found her grandpa's house, she ran up to him and began to question him about her big adventure.
Grandpa smiled and said, "Mia, I'm happy to help! How about we go on a walk together and explore the world around us? You can ask questions along the way and learn lots."
Mia couldn't believe it! She was no longer miserable. She was now full of energy and excitement. She ran around the room, ready for her big adventure!




Once upon a time there was a pretty puppy. His name was Spot and he was very excited to go outside. His mommy put Spot's leash on him. He was excited to see what he could find.
Spot ran out of his house and he saw some pretty flowers. When he reached out to grab a flower, his leash tugged him back. Spot couldn't reach the flower. He kept trying to get closer to the flower, but the leash kept him back.
Suddenly, Spot heard the sound of a toy. He started to run towards it, but his leash held him back again. He whined and tried to get close to the toy. His mommy pulled him back and said, "No Spot, stay here."
Spot didn't understand why he couldn't reach the toy. He wanted to play with it so badly. To make him feel better, his mommy took him for a walk. Spot ran around and explored the world. He was so happy he was able to reach all the things he wanted to this time!




One day, little Sarah was helping her mom. She was given a big jug of water to carry. She took it and was walking very carefully outside when she saw a tiny flower in the grass. She bent down to take a closer look and suddenly, the jug toppled over and all the water spilled out. It created a small pond around the flower.
Sarah felt badly and she tried her best to mop up all the water, but it was too much. Her mom came over to help her and together they gathered a few empty jugs from the shed and started filling them with the water. Within an hour, the water was all gone and the flower looked very modest, standing in the damp grass.
The next day, Sarah and her mom took the empty jugs to the lake. They filled the jugs with lake water and soon, the jug and the flower both had water. The flower was very happy and Sarah was happy that the flower was doing better.
But little did they know, the lake water was not that clean. The water in the jug started to rot and an awful smell filled the air. Sarah and her mom had to throw the jug away. Thankfully, the flower was now in better shape and Sarah learned an important lesson.




Once there was a boy who had a broken bike. He was very sad because he couldn't ride it and he wanted to be able to do so again. So he went to the shop to get it fixed.
The man at the shop was very nice. He looked at the bike and said, I can repair it for you. The boy was so happy. The man went to the back of the shop and brought out a box full of tools. He took out a bright screwdriver and some wheat to use to fix the bike.
The boy watched him as he worked. The man was very careful, tightening each screw and making sure that all the parts of the bike fit together nicely. Finally, after a few hours, the bike was fixed.
The boy was so excited. He jumped on his bike and rode away, feeling so proud. He had fixed his bike with the help of the man at the shop!



 
Once upon a time, there was a copper. He wanted to go outside and play, but the day was very dangerous. He thought and thought about what to do. Suddenly he heard a call. It was his friend, a brave squirrel. 
The squirrel called out, "Come outside! We can have fun yet be safe from danger." The copper hesitated but then remembered that he was brave too. He stepped out into the sunshine and saw the squirrel waiting there with a smile.
"You can follow me," the squirrel said, and the copper felt excited to see his friend. They hopped and skipped over the ground, singing and playing all the way. Everywhere they looked the danger was gone, and the copper felt so free and happy. 
The copper and the squirrel enjoyed their time together and called out to one another. They ran around until the sun began to set, and when their time together was done, the copper waved goodbye with a grateful heart.



Once there was a caterpillar. The caterpillar had many legs and was green all over. Every day he looked around his garden, seeing all the different things. Then one day something special happened. The caterpillar became tired, so he curled up and went to sleep. During the night he had a magical dream. When the caterpillar woke up he looked different. He had big colourful wings and he could fly! The caterpillar was so excited and looked around the garden again in a much different way. He became a beautiful green butterfly!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. Her name was Daisy. Daisy lived in an old valley. It was dark, and very quiet.
One day, Daisy thought she would take a walk in the valley. She walked and walked until she got to the top of a hill. The view was beautiful and Daisy felt so proud.
But then something happened. Suddenly, Daisy felt embarrassed. She had forgotten all about the monster who lived in the valley. Daisy knew that the monster got angry when people visited the valley, and she was scared.
As Daisy was about to turn around and run back home, the sun came out and shone on the valley. It made the valley bright instead of dark. Daisy smiled and felt brave.
The monster was nowhere to be seen. Daisy had been brave and the darkness had gone away. She smiled and ran back home, happy that she had seen the beautiful view of the valley.




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Pete. He was very competitive and liked to win at everything he did. One day Pete went to a store. He saw so many pastel colors and he liked them all. He wanted to buy them all but he didn't have enough money.
Pete got very sad and didn't know what to do. But then he heard a strange sound behind him. He turned around and saw a beautiful pastel owl. The owl stared at Pete and blinked its big eyes. Suddenly Pete felt happy and he wanted to get the owl. But the shopkeeper wanted too much money for it.
Pete couldn't buy the owl, so he decided to ignore it and walked away. Even though Pete was sad, he kept his competition nature and went to find more colorful stuff to buy. The pastel owl watched him leave, with its big eyes.




Once upon a time there was a pretty figure. She was shiny and sparkly and all the other figures wanted to be like her. Every day she would go on special adventures, looking for things that were special and beautiful.
One day she came across a rock. It didn't look like the other rocks but it had a special sparkle in the middle. The figure knew that it was going to be extra special. She put it in her pocket and took it with her wherever she went.
The other figures wanted to know about the rock. They asked the figure why she valued it so much. She told them that the sparkle inside was very special to her. She said that it reminded her of how special and pretty she was.
The figure was proud of her rock. She always went on adventures with it and kept it safe. All the other figures saw how much it meant to her, and they valued it too.




Once upon a time, there was a mysterious hat. A small bunny wanted to find out what it was. He was brave, so he hopped up and touched it with his paw. But suddenly, the hat started to rot! The bunny was so surprised, he hopped away. He couldn't believe what happened.
The bunny went to get his friend, a fox. The fox wanted to figure out why the hat was rotting. He sniffed it and said, "Maybe it was too old?" The bunny was confused. He had never seen anything like it before. 
The two friends decided to find the owner of the mysterious hat. So, they set off on an adventure. Along the way, they met a friendly bear. The bear said he knew the owner of the hat. The fox and the bunny were excited! 
Eventually, they came to a large cave. The bear told them to wait outside while he went inside. A few minutes later, the bear came out with an old man. The old man was the owner of the mysterious, rotting hat! 
The bunny and the fox were so relieved. They thanked the bear for his help, and promised to visit him again soon. Then the bunny and the fox said goodbye to the old man and continued on their journey.




Once there was a boy who liked to play outside. One cold winter day, the boy's mom was giving him his jacket so he could go and play. As the boy put his jacket on, he noticed something outside the window. It was snowing! He was so excited that he ran outside and looked around. The ground was covered in a thick, icy layer of snow.
The boy started to scatter the snow around with his feet. He had so much fun! He noticed a rubber ball in the snow, so he picked it up and started running around with it.
The boy found it fun to throw the rubber ball against the icy walls of his house. The ball bounced off it and landed in the snow again. The boy ran to grab the ball, and started to scatter the snow around again with his feet. The boy had so much fun that he wanted to keep playing until dinnertime.




Once upon a time in the wild forest, there was a little girl. She had an axe, and she loved to number the trees. She would count them one by one as she walked.
Every day, she found a new and exciting thing in the forest. She saw wild animals and furry bunnies, and she even saw a big bear! One day, she found an old tree with a huge axe stuck in it.
The little girl tried to pull the axe out, but it was too heavy! She kept trying and trying and eventually, the axe was free. She was so excited! She thought it was really cool!
The little girl took the axe home with her, and she was so happy to show it to her family. She had found a real, wild axe in the forest! She couldn't believe it, and neither could her family.
From that day on, the little girl and her axe were inseparable! She went on all sorts of adventures together, numbering trees, finding wild animals and exploring the secrets of the forest.




One day, a little girl was walking in the field. She saw something moving really fast. She looked more closely and it was a rabbit! The rabbit was hopping around and eating some wheat. 
The little girl decided to get closer. She was excited and wanted to pet the rabbit. But as she tried to get closer, the rabbit started moving faster. 
The rabbit was so fragile. Its body was so small and it was so hard for it to speed away from the little girl. But it was amazing how quickly it could move! 
The little girl watched the rabbit until it was out of sight. She was sad that the rabbit had gone, but happy that it was free.



Once upon a time, there was a mole named Mike. He was a harmless creature who liked to stretch out his soft, furry body when he slept.
One day, Mike was in his hole, feeling content, when he heard a loud noise. It was coming from a bush nearby! He was so curious that he decided to take a look.
When he got closer to the bush, he saw that a big cat had gotten stuck in it! The cat was too scared to move, so Mike decided to help. He gently stretched his long nose towards the cat and pulled her out of the bush.
The cat was very happy to be free, and she stretched too. She thanked Mike for being so brave and kind, and they both smiled.
From then on, Mike and the cat were the best of friends and they spent a lot of time stretching around, happy and harmless. And they lived happily ever after.




Once there was a girl named Emma. She was three years old and had a trouble problem. Every day she would mark all over the walls with crayons. 
One day her mom said, "Emma, no more marking!" She showed Emma a big bathtub in the corner of her room and said, "Emma, this is your special bathtub. If you mark on the walls you must sit in your bathtub for five minutes."
So Emma decided to listen to her mom and not mark on the walls anymore. But it was hard. Every time she came close to a wall she felt the urge to mark on it. 
But Emma was brave. She sat in her bathtub every time she had the urge to mark and after five minutes she would feel better. Emma never had a trouble problem again!




Once there was a little boy named Pete. He was a curious little fellow and very restless. One night, he got out of bed to peek around his room. He had a nightlight near his bed, but it only provided a tiny bit of light. Pete decided to turn on the big lamp in his room. When the light came on, Pete peeked around the room. He could see lots of toys and he felt very excited. He looked at each one and touched them to explore. It was fun, but after a while his eyelids started to get heavy. He decided it was time for bed and he turned off the lamp. With the room dark again, Pete snuggled back into bed. He was soon fast asleep.




Once upon a time there was a loyal dog named Jelly. She was always friendly and acted very nice to everyone she met.
Jelly lived in a big house with a big garden. Every day, she liked to take long walks around the garden and to explore all the different smells and sights.
One day when Jelly was out exploring, she came across something very special. It was a big bowl filled with jelly! She had never seen anything like it before and was very excited.
Jelly couldnt help herself, she had to act! She ran over to the bowl and started to eat the jelly. It was so yummy! She ate until her belly was full and then trotted back home.
Every day after that, Jelly went back to the same bowl and acted the same way. She was always loyal to the bowl and ate all the jelly it had.
The end.




Once upon a time there was a young musician. She played her music in the park every day. The musician was very polite and she always smiled at everyone.
One day while she was playing, she saw a little girl who looked very sad. The musician asked her what was wrong and the little girl said that she was tired and her legs hurt.
So the musician took the little girl to a shady spot for her to rest. She lay down and almost immediately fell fast asleep. 
The musician sat with the little girl until she woke up. The little girl was feeling better, and thanked the musician for being so kind. The little girl said that she had been having a bad day, but lying in the park with the polite musician had really made her feel better. 
The musician said it was no problem and they both smiled. The little girl waved goodbye and the musician went back to playing her music.




Once upon a time there was a fun boy named Jack. He was three years old and he liked to jog.
Every day he put on his shoes and his fancy shirt. Then he went outside and jogged around the park. Everybody would cheer and wave when they saw him.
Jack also loved stuff. He had lots of fun stuff, like a toy truck and a stuffed animal. He liked to play with all of his stuff at the park or in his bedroom.
When Jack was done jogging he would eat a snack. Then he would go to bed and dream of all the fancy things he wanted to do when he was older.
The end.




Once there was a boy called Tom. He was very thoughtful. He liked to help his Mom and Dad whenever he could. 
One day, Mom was pouring some water into a pot. Tom wanted to help her. He got a cross from his room and gave it to Mom. 
Mom smiled and thanked Tom. She put the cross in the pot with the water. Then she poured some more water. 
When all the water had been poured, Mom took the pot off the stove. She was very happy to see that the cross was still in the pot. She thanked Tom and gave him a big hug. 
Tom was very proud of himself. He had been very thoughtful and his Mom was very happy. 
From that day onwards, Tom made sure to help his Mom and Dad whenever he could. He would always be thoughtful and try to do his best.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Ella. Ella was always very glad. She was always smiling and she loved to play with her friends.
One day, Ella was feeling very cold. She was standing outside and the wind was blowing. She shivered and shivered but she tried not to cry.
Suddenly, Ella heard someone calling her name. It was her mom! Ella was so glad to see her. Mom said she had a special surprise for Ella. Ella was excited.
When Ella and her mom opened the door, Ella couldn't believe her eyes. Her friends were all standing in the room and they were holding balloons! Ella was so happy.
Ella and her friends spent the afternoon playing and laughing. Ella was so glad that her mom had brought her friends together. She felt warm and loved.




Once upon a time there was a boy and he loved to write. He wrote about different lands and he had big dreams to be able to travel to them.
One day, he decided to write a letter to each of the different lands. He wrote about all the different things he wanted to do when he travelled there.
He posted his letters to the different lands and waited patiently to hear back. After a few weeks of waiting, he was so excited to find out that he had heard back from each of the lands! 
Each land had invited him to come and explore. He was so excited to be able to explore all the different lands. So he packed his bags and travelled to each land to explore and write about all the wonderful things he discovered. 
The end.




Once there was a young girl who felt very miserable. She was so sad that she wanted to rest. She found a quiet spot in the back yard and curled up in a ball. She stayed there for a long time, close her eyes, and rested. She felt slightly better afterwards, but not quite back to her old self. However, she knew she would eventually feel better with some more rest. So, she decided to crawl away to a sunny patch of grass and closed her eyes again. After a few moments, she felt much better! Her misery had gone away and she was happy once again. All she needed was a bit of rest.




Once there was a best friend named Bill and Chris. Bill was a little bit bigger than Chris, but Chris was a better fighter. Every day, Chris challenged Bill to a fight in their backyard. Bill would try to fight back, but Chris was too strong and would always win. 
One day, Chris wanted to challenge Bill to a different kind of fight. He told Bill that he wanted to fight with their mouths to see who could make the silliest sounds. Bill thought it sounded fun, so he said yes!
They both opened their mouths and started to make silly noises. Puffing out their cheeks and shaking their heads, they each made loud noises and even sang songs. Bill made the funniest sounds of all and after a few minutes, he was declared the winner of the mouth fight! 
Chris was not used to losing, though, so he asked to have another fight. This time, he wanted to have a normal fight and Bill was happy to agree. This time, Chris could not beat Bill. Bill was too strong for him, and after a few minutes, Bill was declared the winner of the fight. 
Chris and Bill were best friends, so even though one of them would always win, they had lots of fun playing together. 




Once upon a time, there was a bluebird that wanted to take a bath. She flew to the pond, but found the water was very dirty. She furrowed her brow, but she did not want to get her feathers all muddy.
That's when she saw a towel laying abandoned on the ground. She took the towel and set it in the pond. The water settled on top of the towel, making a clean spot for her to take a bath.
So she hopped in and bathed until the towel was soaked with mud. Even though the towel was dirty, the bluebird was clean and happy. She flew away, content with the way she had settled the problem.




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack who loved to rock. Jack would rock his chair in the backyard, rock his toys around the house, and even rock his baby sister to sleep. But one day, Jack found something new to rock - a filthy lung!
The lung was covered in dirt and grime, so Jack had to be careful as he rocked it around the yard. He cradled the lung with his hands, making sure it was safe while he rocked it.
Jack rocked it everywhere he went, taking little breaks here and there. He showed it to his sister, his friends, and even his mom and dad. Everyone thought Jack's filthy lung was so cool!
Jack kept rocking his lung. He rocked it until it was time for dinner. He rocked it until his mom sent him to bed. He even rocked it in his sleep!
Jack never stopped rocking his lung. He kept it forever, always reminding him of the special times they had rocking together.




Once upon a time, there was an angry lion. He was very big and strong. The lion roared through the forest. He was so mad that he shook the ground.
The lion had not eaten for days. He was very hungry. Everywhere he looked, he saw nothing to eat. 
Then, the lion saw something very strange. It was a pink bunny. The bunny was hopping around, looking for something to eat. The lion got very excited. He took a big leap and chased after the bunny. 
The bunny ran very fast, but the lion was faster. He got close very quickly and roared loudly. The bunny was so scared that it stopped moving. 
The lion was very hungry. But he was also very kind. He let the bunny go. Instead, he found a big apple tree and ate all the apples. He was satisfied and happy. The end.




Once upon a time there was a very hard worker. Every day, he would work and work, but he never had enough time. One day, he decided to go talk to the wise old owl.
The old owl listened carefully, and said, You must learn to work smarter, not harder. Take your time and do things one step at a time. The hard worker was so thankful, he thanked the old owl many times over.
He decided to try the old owls advice, so he started to work a little slower. Sure enough, he was able to finish all his work on time! From then on, he took time to talk to his friends and take a break every once in a while.
The moral of the story is that taking time for yourself is important. Working hard all the time wont get you anywhere, but working smarter and taking breaks can be just as rewarding.



Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog. His name was Max. Every morning, Max and his owner went on a journey. Max carried his owner on his back. Max's owner loved spending time with him.
Max was always excited to go on a new journey. They explored forests and fields. Above, the sky was blue and the sun was bright. Together, they made a special connection.
One day, they were walking along the beach. As Max carried his owner, his paws were dragging in the sandy ground. Suddenly, both of them heard a bark. It was coming from a furry puppy.
The puppy was lonely and scared. Max's owner said, Lets take him home with us. So Max and his owner carried the puppy back home. Now the puppy had a happy home.
Max and his owner were now a big happy family. Every day, they went on new journeys. They were loyal to each other and had lots of fun.




Once upon a time, there was a brown factory. Inside the factory, there was a swing. Every day, people would go to the factory to see the swing and have lots of fun. The swing was so big that everyone wanted to take turns swinging on it. The kids loved it the most. They would say, Whee! as they swayed back and forth on the swing. They laughed and played all day long.
One day, the sun went down and everyone had to go home. But before they left, they promised to come back and play on the swing at the brown factory the next day. And they did. Every single day, they would go to the factory and enjoy the big swing together. It was so much fun!




Once upon a time, there were two friends. One day, one of them got a paper. It was very delicate, like tissue paper.
He wanted to show his friend, so he carefully picked it up. But his friend warned him. He said that he must be gentle so it wouldn't get torn.
The friend was careful and he held the paper very carefully. But then, it still ripped. He was so sad.
But his friend had a good idea. He said they could tape it back together. They got some tape, and put the paper back together. When they were done, the paper was as good as new.
The friends were happy. They had fixed the delicate paper together.



 
Rosie was miserable. She wanted to sing but no one was listening. Everyone had closed the door and left her alone. 
Rosie took out the microphone and she smiled. She held it up close to her mouth and started to sing. She sang a high happy song. 
Rosie tried to reach even higher and higher notes. Suddenly, she heard clapping! Someone had opened the door and was clapping along to her song. 
Rosie was no longer miserable. She smiled, thanked her audience and put away the microphone. Now she knew, no matter what, she could always sing and share her music.



Once upon a time, there was a young parrot who lived in a tree. Every day, the parrot would see a girl baking. The parrot would watch as the girl put flour, eggs, and butter in a bowl and stir it up. 
The parrot was so curious that one day she decided to fly down from the tree and ask the girl what she was doing. The girl smiled and told the parrot she was baking a cake.
The parrot was so excited that she asked if she could help. The girl said yes and taught the parrot how to crack eggs and put the ingredients into the bowl. 
When the cake was finished, the girl gave the parrot a piece to eat. The parrot tasted the sweet cake and smiled. From then on, the parrot helped the girl bake every day. 
The end.




Once there was a little boy who was very fragile. He had long, curly hair and the bluest eyes. He would often cry when something scared him or if something he wanted was just out of reach. 
One day, he saw an adorable puppy in the window of a pet store. He wanted to take the pup home with him very badly. But, when he asked his mom if he could have the pup, she said it wasn't possible. The little boy burst into tears and his face became very sad.
His mom hugged him tightly and took him back to their house. The little boy was still crying and his mom's heart was breaking. Then, she had an idea. She went to the store and bought the puppy for her son. When she returned, the little boy's eyes lit up. He hugged his mom and the puppy as tightly as he could.
It didn't take long for the pup and the little boy to become the best of friends. He would talk to the pup like it was his best friend. He was so happy to have this special pup with him and he never wanted the pup to leave his side. He was always very gentle and careful with the pup, because he knew it was very fragile. 
The pup always stayed by his side, no matter what. Although sometimes the little boy would still get scared or upset, his pup was always there to make him feel better and it even made him




Once there was a little girl. She went out to pick some cauliflower from the garden. She was so happy when she saw that the cauliflower was so big and beautiful. She carefully picked the biggest black one and ran back inside. She washed it off, and asked her mom to cook it. Together they made a delicious cauliflower soup. The little girl ate it all up and said it was yummy. Then she smiled and again went out to pick some more cauliflower!




Once there was a child who was upset because she had to leave her playtime and go to class. She was very sad, but when she arrived at class, she felt better.
In class, the teacher told the child to fold her hands in her lap. She did it, and found it was kind of fun. She smiled at her teacher and the class.
Every week the child would come to class and fold her hands. She felt calm and peaceful and the class always seemed exciting. She was sad no more. 
The teacher was very happy too, because she could see that the child was no longer upset. She was no longer sad, she was having fun and learning.
The end.




Once upon a time there was a girl who loved fashion. Every day she liked to put on her pretty clothes. But she lived in an ugly town and none of her friends had nice things to wear.
One day, the girl had a bright idea. She decided to make her own fashion. She used bits of colourful cloth and decorated them with buttons. All of her friends thought it was wonderful.
The girl went on to make more of her own fashion. She made skirts, dresses and even hats. Her friends all asked for their own pieces, too.
Soon the girl became very famous. Everyone from the town wore her designs and people from other places came to see if they could buy some. She was very proud of her own fashion and everyone admired her. 
She had really turned ugly fashion into something beautiful.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah who like to play. But sometimes it was too dark. So Sarah's mommy and daddy went to the shop and bought a very special bulb. They put it in the middle of Sarah's room and when they switched it on the room lit up! Sarah was so happy. 
Every night before Sarah's mommy and daddy went to bed, they would switch the bulb on and Sarah would have a lovely light to play with. She would always smile and giggle when she saw the bulb and so did her mommy and daddy. 
But one day, Sarah was playing very loud in her room. The bulb started to tremble and blink on and off. It was scared of Sarah's loud noise! But Sarah's mommy and daddy were very good and gentle. They came into her room and provided a nice, warm hug. The bulb stopped trembling and stayed on. 
Sarah and her mommy and daddy were very happy. Everything in Sarah's room was back to normal and she could now play again with her special bulb - and keep it on.



Once there was a little girl named Sally. Sally wanted to drive her dad's car. Her dad said she was too young to drive, and she had to wait until she was older.
Sally was very sad. She wanted to be able to drive and show off her driving skills.
One day, her dad got an amazing trophy at work. The trophy was shaped like a car with gold wheels and a bright blue finish. Sally knew right away that this was the perfect trophy for her.
Her dad was a bit harsh, and he said no. But little Sally was not going to give up that easily. She reminded her dad of all the hard work she had done, and after a few minutes of arguing, her dad gave in.
Sally was so happy. She grabbed the car-shaped trophy and sat behind the wheel for the first time. She pretended to drive, turning the wheel and pushing the pedals with her little feet.
Sally loved her new driving trophy and spent lots of time honing her driving skills. She eventually became a great driver, and all because of her dad's special trophy.



 
Once upon a morning, there was a girl named Sally. Sally was feeling very sour, so she decided to go on an adventure. She went to the beach and found a very big sack. Her face lit up and she ran over to pick it up. 
Sally opened the sack and found a big surprise - sweets! She was so excited she couldn't believe it. Sally started grabbing handfuls of the sweet treats and put them in her pockets. 
Sally was so happy that she had found the sack that she started running back to her house. When she got home, she pulled out her pockets full of the sweets and shared them with her mom and dad. 
Sally was so happy. She had never had such a sour morning turn into such a sweet end!



 
On Sunday, a bald man came to visit the family. He was tall. Everyone said hello. The bald man raised his arms. He said, "I am here to help!" He had a big box and in it was a puppy. Everyone cheered. The puppy was so small and wiggled around! Mama said, "Let's go outside and raise the puppy together." So they went outside and played with the puppy. They all laughed and gave him many hugs and cuddles. The puppy and the bald man were now part of the family. From then on, every Sunday was a special day for them.




It was a beautiful summer day. The sun was shining and the sky was incredible blue. Mary and her father were walking outside. Mary was shaking a little jar filled with stones. 
Suddenly, a big wind blew by and shook her jar so hard that all the stones fell out! Mary started to cry, but her father picked her up and said, Dont worry Mary, its only an incredible summer day! We can find more stones. 
They searched the ground and soon found lots of stones and shells. Mary was so happy that she couldnt stop shaking her jar! She laughed and danced around with her jar filled with treasures. 
Mary and her father went back home with a big smile on their faces. It was an incredible summer day!




Once upon a time, there was a rich man. He was the wealthiest man in the town. He had a big, fancy house, and lots of nice things inside. One of the things he had was an iron.
Everyday, the man would test his iron. He wanted to make sure that it worked as well as possible. He knew he had to use it to make his clothes look their best.
So, the man would test the iron each morning, before he went to work. He would iron his nice clothes, and look his best for his job.
The iron always worked perfectly for him. He felt very happy and lucky that he had such a nice iron.
The end.



Once upon a time there was a girl who liked to ride her bike. She would ride it every day to the park and to school. One day she saw a green bike that she liked more than her old bike. She asked her mom if she could have it, and her mom said yes. The little girl was so happy she rode her new bike all day. 
The bike brought the little girl a lot of joy. That is why when the girl got married, she and her husband rode away to their new home on the green bike. Everyone cheered as they rode away. The girl felt like a princess as she rode away with her prince. 
From then on, the couple rode the green bike to the park together or around town. Riding the bike together brought them a lot of happiness and made them feel close to each other as they rode side by side. 
The couple enjoyed their marriage, and the green bike was a symbol of their love. They would ride together and make memories they would never forget.




Once upon a time there was a smart little girl named Peaches. Every day Peaches loved to play outside in the wind. She would blink in the sun, and giggle as it tickled her nose.
One day Peaches went to an opening in the park and was amazed. There were so many trees, and animals, and she layed in the grass and looked up at the sky. She blinked, and noticed something new- a bright light in the sky. Curious, she asked her dad what it was.
Her dad told her it was a star. Peaches was amazed by its beauty and wanted to learn more. She asked her dad to help her learn about the star, and he smiled and began to tell her stories about the universe and how special and intelligent the star was.
As Peaches listened, the wind blew her hair around her face and the star blinked back at her. Peaches knew that the star was special and that it was now her friend. She smiled, and knew she had made a new and magical friend.



Once upon a time, there was a dead girl. She was very sad and did not move. The people around her wanted to help, so they took her to the hospital. They were hoping that the hospital could change her and make her better. But when they got to the hospital, they realized it was too late. The dead girl did not change. She was still dead. Everyone was sad and started to cry. 
Suddenly, a miracle happened. The dead girl started to move! Everyone was filled with joy. They celebrated and thanked the hospital for helping make the change. From then on, the hospital was known as a place of miracles. It had changed the dead girl!



Once upon a time, there was a whale who was swimming in the warm ocean. She was looking for something special. She had heard about a big treasure that was guarded by a whale and she wanted to find it.
She kept swimming until, suddenly, she saw a glimmer of yellow. It was just what she had been searching for! The whale felt so happy and she opened the large chest. As she opened it, a wave of gold coins and jewels spilled out.
The whale was so excited and she wanted to take the treasure with her. But, it was so heavy that she couldn't carry it. Suddenly, a magical fish appeared and told her that if she wanted to take her treasure, she must yield to its power.
The whale nodded and, with a wave of its tail, the fish granted her wish. Now the whale had all the gold and jewels she could ever need. She was so grateful that she thanked the magical fish and went back home, feeling warm, happy and full of joy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl who liked to wear funny hats and dresses. She had a favourite hat - it was yellow and covered with stars. Her mother always gave her a big hug when she wore it!
One day, the little girl went to the park with her mom. She wanted to wear her funny hat, but it was a windy day, so the hat stayed at home. But the little girl still had fun - she ran around and played with all the other kids at the park.
When they were leaving, the little girl saw a boy wearing a red hat. He was being quite rude to the other children, pushing them and not letting them play. The little girl became very angry and shouted out to him, Hey! Thats not nice!
The little boy looked embarrassed and ran away. When the little girls mom asked why she shouted, the little girl said, I just wanted to teach him that its not okay to be rude to other people and to respect everybodys lungs!
The mom gave her a big hug and said, Youre such a kind and smart little girl!
The little girl went home and kept wearing her funny hats and dresses, but this time she wore them with a kind and gentle heart.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lily. She was only three years old and she wanted to explore. One day she asked her mom where she could go to have fun. Her mom said, "If you're ready, why don't you go explore the river?" Lily was so excited and quickly replied "Yes!" 
Lily walked down to the river and saw ducks. She also watched the water flow by. She asked the ducks, "What do you do here?" The ducks quacked and waddled away. 
Next, she asked the river, "What do you do?" The river roared in reply. Lily thought and thought, but she couldn't figure out what the river said. 
Suddenly, Lily spotted a tree. "Tree, can you help me?" She asked. The tree shook and rustled its leaves. Then it said, "Go explore the river and have fun!" And so Lily did.
She ended her adventure by the river and then went home to tell her mom all about it. Her mom smiled and said "I'm so happy you had fun exploring the river." Lily smiled back and said, "Yes, it was great!"




Once upon a time there was a sad kid. He was so sad he couldn't even smile. He had a lot of worries in his head and couldn't sleep. Every night he tried to close his eyes but he just kept thinking and thinking. Then one day something special happened.
His mommy came in and said she had a surprise for him. She opened her mouth and blow him a kiss. This made him so happy he laughed and laughed. She asked him if he wanted to play a game and he said yes.
They played the game until it was time for bed. At night she sang him a special song and said she loved him very much. This made his worries go away and he fell asleep.
When he woke up in the morning he was still very happy. He felt like he could take on all the worries of the world. He smiled and hugged his mommy tight to say thank you. He said this was the best surprise ever.




Once upon a time, there was an elephant. She was very clever.
The elephant was always worried about where she would find food to eat. Everywhere she went, she would look and search but she never found anything.
One day, when the elephant was walking through the forest, she saw a patch of tall grass. She went over and looked, and discovered that there was lots of delicious food underneath! She was so happy.
But then the elephant heard a loud noise. It was a pack of hungry lions! They had spotted the elephant and were running over to get her. 
The clever elephant quickly picked up some of the food, put it in her trunk, and ran away as fast as she could. The lions chased her, but they couldn't catch her.
The elephant was so relieved. She had found food and escaped from the lions. And now she would never have to worry about where she was going to find food again.




One day, Tom and his Daddy were playing on the road. Tom was very happy because it was a bright and sunny day. The road had lots of numbers painted on it. Tom started to count the numbers and one was more adorable than the next. Daddy watched with a smile as Tom counted up to ten! Then Daddy told Tom it was time to go home, but Tom wanted to stay and count more numbers. So Daddy said, "If you count all the numbers on the road, you can stay for a bit longer." Tom was so excited, he started counting as fast as he could. He even skipped a few numbers! But eventually, Tom counted all the numbers and Daddy was very proud. Together, the two of them walked home with big smiles on their faces.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She had colorful hair, like a rainbow. One day, she decided to make a muffin. She filled a bowl with lots of yummy ingredients, like sugar, flour and cherries. Then, Sarah put the bowl in the oven and waited patiently. Soon, the oven filled the house with the smell of muffins. 
Sarah took out the bowl and filled 12 muffin cases. They were so colorful! She put the muffins back in the oven and waited again. Finally, the muffins were ready!
Sarah took them out, the muffins were golden brown and looked delicious. Sarah was so happy and excited, that she shared the muffins with all of her friends. Everyone thought the muffins were delicious!




John was a three year old who loved playing games. One day, he was visiting his grandmother. She was an old woman who lived in a big house with lots of rooms and things. In her living room, there was a vase on the table. It was a perfect vase, with bright colors. John was so excited to see the vase and he asked his grandmother if he could have it.
His grandmother said, "Yes, but first you must wipe it clean." So John found a wipe and he carefully wiped the vase until it sparkled. He was very proud of his work.
After he finished wiping the vase, John went off to play with his toys, happy with his perfect vase. From then on, he kept it forever and thought it was the most special thing he had ever seen!




Once there was a girl who liked to take the subway. Every day she would use the regular subway. Every morning she would hop on the subway and go downtown. She would take the regular subway the whole way there.
One day, something special happened! Instead of taking the regular subway, she took a special one. It was called the express subway. On the express subway, she went much faster than she went on the regular one.
When she got downtown, she was very excited. She was happy that she had gotten there so quickly using the express subway.
From then on, she usually took the express subway. But every now and then, she would use the regular subway, so she could go at her own pace.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. She was three years old, and she loved to go outside and explore.
One day, she decided to go outside and climb a tall tree. She was scared at first, but with a determined look on her face, Jane took a deep breath and began to climb. She grabbed each branch tightly, making sure she was safe.
As she looked around from the top of the tree, she noticed something special! It was a box of sugar, tucked away at the top. Jane smiled and carefully climbed down to get the box.
When she opened the box, she was surprised! It was the most original sugar she had ever seen. Jane was so excited that she immediately started eating it.
The sugar was so sweet and delicious, and Jane had a great time. She smiled happily as she enjoyed her adventure.




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Sara and Jake. Jake had a journal that was always very special to him.
One day, they went out and decided to try a lot of things. They tasted different fruits, chocolates, and more. As they tasted each sweet thing, they wrote it down in Jake's journal.
Suddenly, Jake dropped his journal in the mud. When he tried to pick it up, it felt very dirty. He was sad because the journal was ruined. 
But Sara had an idea! She took the journal to the kitchen and washed it in soap and water. When she opened it, they both felt so happy. The journal was as clean as new.
They tasted some more things and wrote them down in the journal. Jake was so relieved! It was like it had never been dirty.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She liked to wink all the time. Every day, she would regularly wink and make everyone smile.
One day, she found something special. It was a magical wand. It had glittery stars on it and it was so sparkly. She waved the wand and made a wish. She wished for her dreams to come true.
Suddenly, the wand let out a bright light and the little girl knew her wish had come true. Then the wand stopped glowing and when the light went away, the little girl winked one last time.
That wink was the end of the magic. But the little girl's dreams would continue. Because her regular winks reminded us all that magic is real.




Mummy went to the shop to buy some food for dinner. She was hungry and wanted something nice.
When she arrived in the shop she saw that there was a lucky draw. Mummy said it was her lucky day and decided to take part.
She bought a ticket and waited to see what would happen. The lady said the winner would get a special prize.
Mummy was very excited. Soon it was time to call the winner. It was Mummy! She had won a big box of sweets.
Mummy was so happy. She couldn't wait to get home and show her family the prize. Everyone cheered when she came home. They all wanted to share the sweets.
Mummy had made a good choice to buy the lucky ticket. She was so pleased she had been so lucky. It was a very happy day!




Once upon a time, there was a team of sleepy workers. Every day they all went to sleep. One morning, the leader of the team woke them all up. He was rude and shouted "Wake up!" The team all jumped out of bed. They all got dressed and started to work.
They went around doing their jobs. They worked hard and were very tired, but the leader wouldn't let them rest. He kept ordering them to work. The team worked until dark and the leader told them to keep going.
That night, the team was so tired that they fell asleep standing up. They were so tired that even the rude leader wanted to rest. He gave them all a break and said "Go to bed now". So everyone went to bed early that night.
The next morning, the leader said "Wake up! It's time to go to work!" The team was glad they got to sleep and they worked really hard all day. And they all lived happily ever after.




One day, Mommy found a jolly card. She showed it to Tom the three year old. Tom was so excited to see it. The card was covered in lots of colours. On it there was a picture of a jolly clown. Tom couldn't believe his eyes.
Mommy asked, "Do you like the card?"
Tom nodded and smiled a big smile. He said, "Yes!"
Mommy said, "Let's cover the card with lots of stickers! We can make it look even better!"
Tom was so happy. He picked up all the stickers and started to cover the card. They stuck birthday stickers, heart stickers and stars all over the card.
When they finished the card look absolute jolly! Tom was so proud of what he made. He showed the card to everyone in the house and they all said it looked so special.
Tom was so proud of his jolly card. He loved showing it off to every one!




Once there was a little boy. He was very silly. He liked to do silly things. One day he was playing on the beach and he saw a banana. He wanted to save it for later, so he picked it up and put it in his pocket.
The boy went for a walk around the beach. He picked up shells and put them in his pocket too. He wanted to save them all.
When he got back to the beach he saw something funny. Another boy was running around with a banana. He was laughing and being very silly. The other boy was trying to save the banana, but the wind kept blowing it away.
The little boy laughed and decided to help. He ran and caught the banana, and saved it for the other boy. The silly boy was so happy. He thanked the little boy and they laughed and played together until the sun went down.



Once upon a time, there was a silly snake. He was very squirmy and always looking for something to fit in. One day he found a small hole in a tree and thought he might fit. He pushed and squirmed until he did fit inside. 
The snake wiggled around and felt very happy. But then the hole started to get smaller and smaller. He tried to get out, but he was stuck. He started to panic and squirmed with all his might. 
Just then a bird flew by. The bird saw the silly snake in the hole and used his beak to make the hole bigger so the snake could get out. The snake thanked the bird and was so relieved he didn't have to stay stuck in the hole. He slithered away, happy to be free.




Once upon a time, there was a special boy called Jimmy. He was three years old and full of energy. One day, Jimmy went for a walk and discovered an magical tree. He climbed it, up and up, until he reached the top. When he got there, he saw a beautiful cloud floating in the sky and it made a promise to Jimmy.
Jimmy's eyes lit up. "What is it?" he asked. 
The cloud said, "If you can jump down the tree and land on the ground, I'll make you successful".
Jimmy didn't give up. He took a deep breath, closed his eyes, and jumped down the tree. He landed on the ground with a soft thump and he was safe.
The cloud smiled. "Well done, Jimmy! You can now be a successful boy".
Jimmy thanked the cloud and ran home, excited to tell everyone. From then on, Jimmy had a lot of success and he remembered the promise his magical cloud had made to him.




Once upon a time, there was a yellow refrigerator. The refrigerator liked to spray! It sprayed water and it sprayed cold air all day and night. The refrigerator was very happy to spray and make things cold.
The refrigerator liked to cool down a special drink with its cool spray. It was the best drink in the world and it was kept inside of the yellow refrigerator. Everyone wanted some!
One day, the refrigerator became sad. It stopped spraying cold air, and nothing was inside! No one wanted the special drink anymore and the refrigerator was very lonely.
But then one day, a group of children came to visit the yellow refrigerator. What a surprise! They wanted to cool down their own special drinks and cool snacks. The refrigerator was so happy! It sprayed and sprayed cold air like never before, and it even sprayed some water all over the hungry children's snacks. 
The refrigerator was back to being the happy yellow spraying machine again!




Once upon a time, there was a wild rhinoceros. He wanted to build his own home. He got some mud and some sticks from the forest and he started to build. He was careful and he worked hard. 
At first, the rhinoceros was excited but then it began to rain.  He didn't want his hard work to be ruined so he needed to build a roof for his house. After more hard work, the rhinoceros finished a roof too. Now his home was safe and he could stay dry. 
The rhinoceros was so happy with his new home. He was proud of his hard work and he thought his house looked perfect. He was so happy that he invited all of his wild animal friends over to celebrate. 
The rhinoceros, his friends and all the animals in the forest had a wild party to celebrate the rhinoceros's new home. They played games and had lots of fun. Everyone was so happy and the animals all thought the rhinoceros had done a great job of building. 




Once upon a time, there was a foolish bear. He lived in a cold, dark cave. He was so foolish he spent all his time trying to find food instead of trying to keep warm.
One day, he heard crying from inside his cave. He looked closely and saw a tiny mouse. The mouse was so cold that it was shivering. The bear felt so sorry for the little mouse.
The bear wanted to help the mouse, so he surrendered all his warm blankets. He covered the mouse in the blankets to keep it warm. The mouse stopped crying and thanked the bear. The bear felt happy and warm inside.
From then on, the bear and mouse were good friends. They spent every day together, keeping each other warm. The foolish bear had finally found a way to be happy and warm - by surrendering his blankets.



Once upon a time, there lived a kind and honest little girl named Jenny. One night, Jenny was struggling to get to sleep because she had a really bad itch. She knew she had to do something, but she didn't know what. Suddenly, she heard a noise in the bathroom and she walked over to take a look.
She saw a razor lying there and she knew it wouldn't be safe to use. She knew that she was too small to use it and she started to cry. She didn't know what to do and she was getting more itchier by the second.
She tried to think of another way to make the itch go away, but she couldn't. Eventually, Jenny started to feel frustrated and she started to cry. Just then, Jenny's mom came in and asked what the matter was. When she heard the story, Jenny's mom smiled and said to her, "you want to scratch it? Here, I'll do it for you."
Jenny's mom took the razor and she scratched gently near the itch. Jenny felt relieved and the itch was gone in no time. Jenny thanked her mom, who was honest and kind, and went back to bed. She was very relieved and she felt safe knowing that her mom was there to help her.




One day, Tom and his dog Max were going on an adventure. Tom put on his shoes and grabbed his knapsack. He dropped in a smooth wooden stamp he had found at the beach.
Max ran ahead and found a big rock he wanted to explore. As they were walking, a gust of wind blew and the wooden stamp dropped out of Tom's knapsack. Tom quickly picked it up and said Wow! It's so smooth! 
Tom continued walking and soon he came across a river. It was the perfect spot to play. Max jumped into the water and Tom sat on the edge of the riverbank with his smooth stamp. He picked up a few rocks and carefully dropped them into the river. 
He smiled as he watched the ripples created by the rocks. Tom spent the rest of the day playing with Max and exploring until it was time to go home. He gently put the wooden stamp back in his knapsack, ready for his next adventure.




One day, a small rabbit was racing through the forest. He was so fast! He was racing with a fan in his mouth.
The rabbit had a race with a little mouse. He was so excited! He wanted to win. He raced and raced, but the mouse was too fast. The rabbit was sad.
But then the wind blew, and the fan made the rabbit go faster. He raced so fast that the mouse couldn't keep up. The rabbit won the race! He was so happy.
The fan cheered for the little rabbit. Everyone was so proud of him. He was a small rabbit, but with the help of the fan, he was able to become the winner.




Once there was an elderly man who loved to dance. He would take his walking stick and dance around the village everyday. Everywhere he went, the people would smile and clap as he swayed and twirled to the music. 
One day, the elderly man felt a tickle on his nose, when he reached up his hand he felt two furry feet and a long tail. It was a little mouse who had climbed onto his face to watch the man dance. The man laughed and kept dancing, and the mouse sat on his nose as if it were a seat. 
The elderly man and the little mouse danced around together for a long time. People were amazed as the little mouse sneaked peeks from the old man's nose. Whenever the music stopped, the mouse would run away, but always come back the next day so they could keep dancing. 
The old man and the mouse kept dancing and bringing laughter to the village. People loved to watch them, and the elderly man's joy was felt by all.




Once upon a time, there was a bear. He was the most special bear of all the other bears because he was always wearing a bright blue scarf.
The bear liked to explore and one day he came to a place he had never seen before. It was a very strange place and he didn't know why he had arrived there.
The bear looked around but he could not see any other animals. He thought he was alone. Suddenly he heard a noise, like a whisper and then he disappeared.
The bear was gone and no one knew where he had gone. He had just disappeared. Everyone was sad but they could not find the bear.
But then one day, the bear came back! He had been to an unknown place and he was wearing a different scarf. He was a very happy bear and everyone was so excited to see him! The bear had learnt a lot and he always wore a scarf to remind himself of his adventure. 
Everyone was so happy that the bear had returned safe and sound and they all lived happily ever after.




Tony had a bucket. He was very lazy and he did not want to pass the bucket. So he kept the bucket close to him and he just looked at it.
One day, Tony's mom said, "Tony, you need to pass the bucket to your brother. You can't keep it all to yourself." Tony was very sad. He knew he had to pass the bucket to his brother but he was so lazy.
Tony slowly walked up to his brother and handed him the bucket. His brother smiled and said thank you. Tony felt happy when he saw his brother smile.
After he passed the bucket Tony felt better. He knew that passing the bucket was the right thing to do. Tony was no longer lazy and he was happy with himself.



Billy wanted to go outside and play. It had been raining earlier, so there were puddles everywhere. He got a kick out of jumping and splashing in them. His mum said, "Okay, but be careful. Remember, you have to act bad in these puddles, okay?"
Billy said that he would and went outside. Everywhere he looked, there were big puddles. He jumped and skipped around them. He tried to stay away from the bigger and harder puddles. But no matter how hard he tried, he always ended up in the biggest, hardest puddles! 
Billy was having so much fun that he didn't even realize how wet he was getting. He just kept running and jumping around. His mum came out after a while and laughed as she saw him jumping around in the big, hard puddles. Then, she took his hand and said, "Come on! Time to get out of the puddles and act good now." 
Billy smiled and ran inside to get change of clothes. He had lots of fun, but he was happy to have followed his mum's advice to act bad outside and act good when he came inside.




Once upon a time there was a very peaceful spot in the woods. All the animals liked to come there because it was so peaceful and calm. 
One day a rabbit spotted something strange in the spot. He was very curious and wanted to know what it was so he rushed over. 
When he got there he saw a little cub playing in the spot, making it even more peaceful. The rabbit was so happy he found a friend to play with and they became best buddies. They both loved playing in the spot. 
Every day, the rabbit and the cub would rush to their spot to play games and have fun. They stayed there for hours, until the sun went down in the sky.
