The two friends were always so happy in their peaceful spot.




The player was wet. He had been playing in the rain, and now he was wet. He kept playing, even though his pyjamas were heavy and wet. He kept going, and running around, having fun. He twirled and turned, and his wet pyjamas flapping around him.
The player felt happy, and he kept doing his dance. He laughed and smiled, as the rain kept falling. But soon, he started feeling cold. So, he stopped and saw the big puddles on the ground. He wanted to keep playing, but he knew he had to go in. He was already very wet!
So he ran inside, and then changed out of his wet pyjamas. He put on some warm, dry clothes and shoes. And once he was dry and warm again, he started to play again. He smiled, because he had kept playing even when it was wet.




Once there was a little boy who was very excited to try cooking. He decided to make a snack for all his family. He grabbed a bowl, put some ingredients in it and started to mix them together.
While he was mixing, he accidentally dropped bits of the mix onto the kitchen table. He felt embarrassed and tried wiping them clean with a napkin. But the napkin wouldn't take all the pieces away, so he was still ashamed.
When it was finished cooking, he proudly carried the snack in a plate and showed it to his family. They were so happy and proud of him. They clapped and praised him for his delicious snack.
The little boy was so thrilled. He had made something by himself and everyone was impressed. From that day on he kept practicing in the kitchen and making delicious snacks for his family.




Once upon a time, there was a football. It was so heavy that it weighed a lot. To make sure it weighed the right amount, Sarah and her friends decided to take it to the store.
When they arrived, the storekeeper started to weigh the football. But Sarah and her friends saw something disgusting! A big bug was crawling all over the scale.
They screamed in shock and ran away, leaving the football behind. The storekeeper laughed and weighed the football. It was just the right weight!
The storekeeper then took the football outside and Sarah and her friends played a game of football with it. They all had so much fun!




Once, a poor family lived in a small house. The father was often away at work and the mother had to look after their three children all on her own. Every year the mother insisted that the children saved a little bit of money. 
The eldest child was 7, the middle child was 5 and the youngest child was only 3. The youngest child was too young to understand why his mother insisted that they save money but he listened to her anyways.
One day, the mother insisted that the children put their money in the bank. The eldest and middle children each had five dollars and the youngest just had one. He thought it was too little to save but his mother said it was a good start.
Even though he was only three, the youngest child was determined to save money like his mother insisted. Every week he added a cents or two to his money box until he eventually had enough to put in the bank. 
When he did, the mother said that he was a clever boy for following her instructions and would be rewarded for it one day. The youngest child smiled, knowing that he did the right thing.




Once upon a time, there was a beautiful and independent prince. He lived in a castle and had a wonderful life with all of his servants. One day, the prince decided it was time to remove himself from his life of luxury and comfort. He wanted to see what the outside world was like and experience life on his own.
He traveled for many days, walking and exploring. He even climbed a mountain, far away from the castle. Finally, he arrived in a lovely village filled with friendly people. He stayed there for many weeks and made many new friends. Everyone loved the prince, who was so brave and independent. 
One day, he realized it was time to remove himself from the village and head back to his castle. He said goodbye to all his new friends, hugged them tightly, and started his journey back home. He was happy that he was able to visit the village, and even happier that he could be independent and make his own decisions. 
The prince never forgot his wonderful adventure and continued to live his life in the castle feeling independent and strong.




Once there was a little girl who was very excited. She ran around the house and she was even more excited when she saw the ice-cream. She grabbed it and went to the park to eat it!
But when she got there she realised that she had forgotten her spoon at home. She looked all around the park but she couldn't find one.
So she decided to use her finger to eat the ice-cream instead. She licked it and it melted in her mouth. It was delicious!
After she finished the ice-cream she ran home to find her spoon. She wanted to make sure she never forgot it again!




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Tony and Sue. They liked to play together every day and have lots of fun. One day, Tony had an amazing idea  they should have their own operation! They spent all morning collecting stones, leaves and flowers and arranging them in a circle.
The whole morning was so much fun! When they had finished, they had a special stone in the middle, and it was called their own operation. Tony and Sue danced around it, made up silly songs and had lots of giggles.
The next day, Tony and Sue played a new game called own operation. They made up some funny questions and took turns answering them. It was so much fun that they played all day! Every day Tony and Sue played the own operation game. They weren't sure how they got the idea but they both agreed it was the best game they had ever played.




Once upon a time, there were two friends named Jack and Jill. They wanted to explore the wide world around them. Jack was a bit worried, so he and Jill decided to build a raft. 
Jack was very clever and knew that the raft needed to be flexible. They worked hard and created the best raft ever!
The next day, Jack and Jill had to wait for the raft to dry. Jill got anxious and asked Jack why they had to delay. Jack explained that the raft needed to get dry and strong before they could go. 
Finally, the raft was ready! Jack and Jill hopped onto the raft and went off to have their great adventure. They had so much fun saying goodbye to the delay.
The End.




The little girl was so happy. She moved around the room, looking for something to do. Suddenly, she found something that made her even happier - her mommy's laundry basket! It was full of colorful, clean clothes and she couldn't help but smile. She moved closer to the basket and started taking out the clothes. She put them on the bed and waved her hands in the air, enjoying the feeling of the soft fabrics between her fingers.
Suddenly, her mommy appeared in the room. Smiling, she said, "What a delicious surprise! You're helping mommy with the laundry." She moved closer and sat next to the little girl. Together, they folded the clothes and put them in neat piles. The little girl was so proud of herself for helping her mommy. 
When they were finally done, her mommy took out a delicious snack for the little girl. Together, they enjoyed the snack and drank some cool lemonade while they talked about what they were going to do next. 
The little girl had a great day - first helping with the laundry, then eating a delicious snack!




George was feeling very tired. All day he had been running around the park with his friends and he was exhausted. When he got home his mom told him it was time to relax. George knew that meant he had to sit down and take a break. He plopped himself onto the couch and got comfortable.
George kicked off his shoes and relaxed. He felt his muscles start to loosen. Then he remembered something fun he had seen earlier. It was a big blue stamp! He knew exactly where it was and he wanted to get it. He hopped off the couch and ran to the kitchen drawer.
It was a funny rubber stamp that said "dependable" in big cursive letters. George's mom said it was a reminder that he could always be counted on. George smiled and squeezed the stamp in his hand. Then he ran back to the couch and plopped down again. Holding the stamp close, he relaxed and felt happy.



Mary was outside with her family. She saw a pretty balloon in the sky. The balloon was red and white. It was cold outside. Mary wanted to get the balloon. She asked her dad for help. Her dad stretched out his arms and reached for the balloon. He got it! Mary was so excited. She hugged the balloon and laughed. She said that it was the best day ever. Everyone was happy and had a lot of fun. They spent the day playing with the balloon. They laughed, sang and ate snacks. The cold wind carried the balloon higher and higher. Finally, it disappeared into the sky. Mary waved goodbye to her special balloon. It was an unforgettable day.




Once upon a time, two kids were playing at the beach. They had a really fun raft that they used to sail in the water. The kids were so excited!
Suddenly a big wave came and knocked the raft away. The raft was shooting through the water, and the two kids were so helpless. They were getting further and further away.
The kids shouted and waved their arms, trying to get someone to help. Just then, a big boat came and rescued them.
The big boat brought them back to the beach and their raft. They hugged each other and thanked the boat for saving them.
The two kids went back to playing and having fun. They never forgot the time that the big boat saved them from feeling helpless.




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Bob. Bob really wanted to be a gardener when he grew up. He loved playing in the garden and looking for special things like roots.
One day Bob went out to the garden to look for a special root. He saw a big puddle and hoped he could find something special in the wet mud near the puddle. He carefully put his hands in the mud. He felt something squishy and hard. He carefully pulled it out and saw a big, brown root.
Bob was so excited. He ran inside to show his mom the special root he found. His mom was very proud of Bob and told him he could be a gardener just like he wanted when he grew up.
Bob was very happy. He kept the special root safe and hoped he would someday find more special things in the garden.



Once there was a bear. The bear was gentle and he liked to care for others. One day, the bear had an idea. He wanted to find a nice cave to call his home. So, the gentle bear looked and looked until he found the perfect cave. It had soft dirt and a cozy cave entrance. The bear decided to start some plants inside the cave. He wanted to care for them and make sure they were alive and healthy. He watered every day and even sang a gentle song to them as they grew. Everyone was very happy in the cave, and the plants grew stronger every day. The bear was very proud of his new home, and he always made sure to care for it, just like he would for all his other friends.



 
Once there was a little girl. She loved to play with yarn. She had a big box full of colorful yarn. Every day she took it out and began to make things. 
One day she decided to make a doll. She took little bits of yarn and started to twist and tie them together. As she was pushing them to make the doll she heard a loud noise. It was coming from outside!
The girl looked out the window. There was a big, yellow bulldozer. It was pushing piles of dirt from one end of the yard to the other. The girl was surprised! She watched the bulldozer for a few moments and then quickly ran back to finish making her doll. 
The next day, the little girl was in the yard. She had her yarn with her. She squatted down and started to push the yarn together. All of a sudden, she heard the noise of the bulldozer again. She looked up and smiled. It was back, pushing its big piles of dirt around the yard!




Once there was a little boy. He was three years old. His mom and dad wanted to measure him to see how tall he was. 
The little boy was excited. He watched his parents take out a measure. It was a long, thin, tight piece of string.
They started to measure from the top of his head to the floor. They had to be very careful to make sure it was tight. 
When his mom and dad put the measure up against the wall, something funny happened. They both let out a gasp as the measure struck the wall!
The little boy was so surprised. He was sure he had grown so much! But his parents told him he was still the same height as before. 
The little boy smiled because he knew his mom and dad still love him. He knew he didn't have to be tall to be special to them.




Once upon a time there was a thirsty squirrel. He was looking for something to drink. He hopped over to the tree outside his house and saw a nut. The nut was tasty and he wanted to drink the nut juice. He took a big bite and the nut juice filled his tummy. He was so happy!
The squirrel now hopped around the tree looking for more nuts. He found more and more tasty nuts. He quickly ate each one and drank the nut juice. He was so happy and his tummy was full.
The squirrel kept looking until he couldn't find any more nuts. He was sad there were no more to drink, but he was still very happy his tummy was full and he was no longer thirsty. He thanked the tree for the tasty nuts and thanked the nut juice for making him full.
The squirrel hoped there would be more tasty nuts soon so he could drink their juice again. He went back to his house and lay down for a nap. He was happy he had enjoyed the delicious nut juice.




Once upon a time there was a boy. His mommy gave him a spool of thread for his birthday. The thread was clean and pretty. He was so excited to have it. 
The boy wanted to play with the thread. He asked his mommy for a needle so he could make something special. His mommy brought him a sharp needle. He was so excited. 
The boy took the thread and needle and got to work. He threaded the needle and began to sew. He made a beautiful blanket. He was so proud of it. 
After he was done with the blanket, he showed it to his mommy. She was so happy. She hugged her son and thanked him for making such a beautiful creation. Everyone was happy. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a cute baby girl. She was just three years old and she loved to crawl. She would crawl everywhere in the house. One day, she saw something weird and exciting on the floor. She crawled closer and found a big, colourful umbrella. It was a fake umbrella, but the little girl didn't know that. She was so happy, she started to crawl around the house with the umbrella. She pretended that it was raining, and that she was dry and safe under the umbrella. She crawled around her bedroom and down the hallway, until she got to the kitchen. She suddenly heard her mom and dad laughing. They saw that the little girl was crawling and playing with the fake umbrella. She grinned and kept crawling, pretending the rain was still coming down.



Once upon a time, there was a tiger who was lovely. Every day he would go on walks through the forest. One day, while he was walking, he saw something strange and out of the corner of his eye he saw a monster appear! The monster had huge teeth and sharp claws, but the tiger was brave and faced the monster. Suddenly, the monster said, "Don't be scared, I'm a friendly monster. I just want to be your friend!" The tiger was so surprised. He was scared of the monster, but now he realized the monster was nice. The two new friends talked and explored the forest together. They became the best of friends and the tiger was very happy to have a new friend. The tiger and the monster would always have lots of fun, and the tiger knew that he had found a companion he could love forever.



Once upon a time, there was a kind bear. He lived in a big pine forest with all his animal friends. Every day, he would order food from the nearby village and everyone would enjoy it together.
One day, the bear ordered something special: a delicious pineapple! He was so excited to share it with his friends. All the animals gathered around, and the bear smiled as he passed out the pineapple to each of them.
The animals ate their delicious pineapple and thanked the bear for his kindness. From then on, the bear always ordered a pineapple whenever he wanted to give a special treat to his animal friends. 
And they all lived happily ever after!




Once upon a time, there was a family who were very generous. Every day they would rub each other's backs, give big hugs and share their toys. They were all very happy and they made each other smile.
One special day, they decided to go outside and rub the warm sand between their toes. The sun was shining down on them and the family laughed and said it felt so special!
They were so generous that even a little bird flew down and landed on their shoulders. The family were so happy, they just kept rubbing and rubbing the bird's feathers. 
The bird was so pleased that it flew away and came back with a surprise for the family. It dropped a nice, juicy worm at their feet and all the family laughed. 
The family were so generous that day that it made the little bird very happy. They all went inside and gave each other big hugs. That night, the family went to bed with smiles on their faces. 




Once upon a time, there was a graceful point. It made a funny noise. Every morning, when the sun was shining, it would shake and bounce.
One day, a little boy saw the point. He wanted to play and have fun with it. He reached out to remove the point and his mom said, "No, don't touch it".
But the boy didn't listen. He found the point really fun and he wanted to keep it. So he removed the point from the ground and took it away. 
He had an amazing day playing with the point, but at the end of it, he had to put it back where he found it. He put it back with a graceful point, so it would stay safe. 
The boy said goodbye to the point and waved. He was glad that he made a new friend.




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jake who wanted to go on an adventure. He was very cheerful and couldn't wait to explore. So, he grabbed his bags, gave his Mum a big hug and ran out the door. He was ready to go!
Jake hurried down the street, past the park and across a bridge. He was getting very tired so he decided to take a break. Up ahead he saw a big, tall building - it was a hotel! Jake was so excited he ran as fast as he could. 
When he arrived at the hotel, he was surprised to find that the lobby was very crowded. Everyone was smiling and laughing - they were very cheerful. Jake made lots of new friends and had lots of fun.
Finally it was time to go home. Jake said goodbye to his new friends and hurried off back where he came from. He had had a wonderful adventure and couldn't wait for his next one!




Jill and Tom were playing in the park. They were having a lot of fun throwing the paper in the air and running around. Suddenly, they heard a loud scream coming from the bushes. They wondered what was going on and went to take a look. They noticed the bushes were shaking and heard the scream again. Jill leaned over to take a peek and saw a hidden rabbit hiding in the bushes! It was trembling and scared, so Jill scooped it up onto her lap. Tom started to giggle and pat it on its head. The rabbit felt safe and stopped screaming. They both gave it some of their paper to chew on and it was happy. Tom and Jill took it home and showed it to their mom. She was so surprised and excited to finally meet the little rabbit.




Once upon a time there was an adventurous girl. She was wearing a cozy scarf over her shoulders and she loved going to new places. 
One day, the girl invited her friends to join her in a secret place. When they arrived, they saw a big hill in the middle of a meadow.
The girl and her friends laughed when they saw the hill and started running up and down, zig zagging all around it. They were having so much fun.
Before they left, the girl invited them to come back and explore the hill the next day. She made sure to bring her own scarf so she could be warm and cozy.
The next day, the girl and her friends laughed again while they explored and climbed up and down the hill. They had so many adventures and ended their day feeling happy and tired.



 
Once upon a time, there were two brothers. Both brothers were quite ordinary, but one seemed to like pastries more than the other. 
One day, the brother who liked pastries the most asked his mom for a special pastry. His mom said yes and went out to the store. Before she came back, the other brother noticed that something special seemed to be happening. 
When their mom got back, she was holding a big, sweet pastry. She gave it to the brother who liked pastries the most and he was so happy! 
The other brother was so excited, too. He asked if he could have some of the pastry and his mom said yes! 
They both ate the pastry and it was so delicious. They enjoyed it so much and it seemed like this ordinary pastry was the best one ever. 
The end.



Mum and Dad were going out, and Mum was very excited. She had a new dress with a big zipper on the back.
Mum asked her little girl if she wanted to help her get ready. The girl was so excited because Mum said they could paint her nails. She liked to dress up and pretend she was a princess.
Mum made some pretty designs on her nails with the paint. Then they went to the mirror to look at her sparkly nails. The girl smiled at herself and felt so excited.
Mum helped her put on the dress with the zipper. The girl twirled around and showed off her dress and nails.
Mum and Dad said she looked beautiful. She couldn't wait to show off her new look to all her friends.




Once there was a little boy. He liked to explore with his Dad. One day, Dad said, "Let's go and explore near the lake!" So, they went.
The lake was so big. The boy looked carefully, and he could see something unusual in the water. He said to his Dad, "Look! What is that?"
Dad said it was a fish, and he was very surprised.
The boy was very brave. He decided to manage to catch the fish with his hands. He tried so hard and eventually he did it! He was so proud of himself.
The fish was very unusual - it was blue! But it was also really friendly. Dad and the boy took it back home and kept it as a pet. The boy was so happy he could manage to catch the fish, and he kept it as a special reminder of his day exploring the lake.




Bob was walking by the beach when he saw something in the water. It was a wave which made him very excited. He clapped and shouted, Yay! 
But then, another wave came and it was really big and made a lot of noise. Bob did not understand why the wave was so rude, so he ran away from it. 
Bob hid behind a bush and the wave could not see him. It seemed satisfied with scaring him away and went away. 
Bob waited for a few minutes and then walked to the beach again. He looked at the waves and understood why they can be so big and scary. They are just being wild and free, like animals. 
Bob smiled and decided to be brave and not run away anymore when the waves get bigger. He decided to be brave, like a big boy. 
Bob stayed at the beach and watched the waves. He waved his hands to them and said, I am not scared of you anymore.




Once there was a strong bench. Every day, a little boy would come to the bench and hang his coat on it. 
The bench was outside a big house. The little boy's mom and dad lived in the house. He liked going to the bench every day after school. 
One day, a big gust of wind blew. It blew so hard that the bench moved a little bit! The coat slipped off the bench and got blown away. 
The little boy ran after his coat. He ran and ran until the coat got stuck in a tree. He was so happy and he gave the tree a big hug. 
Then he went back to the bench and hung his coat there. He smiled, because he was so glad that the strong bench hadn't been blown away.




Once upon a time, there was a modern mule. The mule was very strong and brave. One day, it was asked to do a very difficult job. Many people watched in admiration as the mule worked hard and accomplished the task. When the job was done, the people were so happy that they all applauded. The mule was so happy that it jumped and ran around in circles. Everyone applauded even louder. The mule felt so proud. From then on, the mule's feats of strength and bravery were celebrated with much applause. The end.




Once there was a little girl who liked to behave. Everywhere she went, she always tried to be very good.
One day, the little girl found a battery in the street. She was very excited. She thought the battery could be useful. So she took it home.
When she got home she showed the battery to her mommy. Her mommy said the battery was useful because it could help to power some of their things at home. So the little girl put the battery to good use.
The little girl was very happy. She liked knowing that she had found something useful. From that day on, the little girl was very careful to always behave!




One day, Tom and his mom were walking in the park. Tom saw a white, smelly fog coming in. He was scared and asked his mom what it was. She said it was just fog. Tom wanted to see it up close and asked his mom if they could lift the fog.
His mom told him that they couldn't lift the fog, but they could walk through it. So, they walked slowly into the fog. Tom saw how smelly it was. He also noticed that the fog felt heavy and thick.
At first, Tom was scared of the fog. But as he kept walking, he started to feel brave. Soon, he was leading his mom and having fun as they explored the smelly fog. 
They laughed and smiled as they played in the fog. In the end, Tom and his mom had a great time!



Charlie was a little bear who lived in a forest. Every winter, Charlie would remain warm and cozy in his den. But one year was different. One winter, the snow was particularly filthy. It wasn't white and fluffy like other winters. There were big brown patches all over the snow. Charlie didn't like the filthy winter at all. He wished for the snow to be white again. 
One day, he decided to do something about the dirty snow. He grabbed a twig and shook it back and forth. He tried to brush the dirt away. 
Gradually, the snow started to look brighter and brighter. Charlie was very proud of himself. Soon enough, his forest was full of clean white snow. He smiled with joy and reminded himself to stay positive during the winter.



 Once upon a time there was a ugly fan. The fan was very old and it stood in the corner of the room. One day, the fan stopped working. so the family had to leave it behind. The family was sad that the old fan was gone, but they knew it was time to get a new one. So they went out and found a shiny new fan. The new fan was big and worked perfectly. The family was so happy! They left the ugly old fan behind and started to enjoy the nice cool breeze from the new fan.




One day, there was a very loud noise. It came from over the mountain. The three year old looked outside and saw a giant throwing rocks. 
The three year old was scared and called his mom. His mom told him to stay inside. So he stood by the window and watched the giant throw rocks at the mountain.
The mountain was getting bigger and bigger. The giant threw more and more rocks until it was so loud that the three year old had to cover his ears. 
Eventually, the giant stopped and the mountain grew so big that the three year old couldn't see it anymore. He ran outside and could not believe his eyes. The giant had made a huge mountain!




Once there was a tall man. He had a drum. He loved keeping it with him. He took it everywhere he went. He kept tapping it with his hands when he was happy. He kept smiling and laughing when he played the drum.
One day, he saw a small girl dancing when she heard the drum. She was so happy, she jumped and twirled around. He kept playing the drum and the girl kept dancing. Everyone around started to clap and the man kept playing for her.
Soon, the man gave the drum to the little girl. She kept hugging it and was so happy. He kept watching her as she danced around with the drum. He smiled at her and she smiled back.
That day, they both kept playing the drum together.




Once upon a time, there was a girl called Emma. Emma's mommy said it was time for Emma to learn how to put on her own dress by herself. Emma was so excited. She picked out an interesting dress, it was pink with big yellow flowers.
Mommy showed Emma how to put the dress on, and how to do up the buttons. Emma carefully followed her mommy's lead. She felt so proud when she finished. Mommy clapped and cheered, so happy that Emma had learnt how to put on her own dress.
Now, whenever Emma wants to put on her dress, she knows which buttons to do up and can do it all by herself. Mommy comes along to help if she needs it, but Emma is so proud that she can do it all by herself.



Once upon a time there was a Mommy and Daddy. They went to the store and bought some yummy ingredients.
When they came home, Mommy and Daddy mixed together all the ingredients. It smelled really nice!
Mommy and Daddy took a taste and it was terrible! They both made funny faces and said that they would never mix those ingredients together again. 
Mommy and Daddy decided to try something else. They mixed together some strawberries and cream.
This time when they tasted it, the taste was delightful! They both smiled and said that this was much better than their first try.
From then on, Mommy and Daddy mixed only delicious things together. They never mixed anything terrible again.




Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was only three years old and she loved lollipops. One night she was sad, so her mommy came to give her a hug. She felt better after her mommy hugged her.
Then her mommy gave her a lollipop. It was a very yummy lollipop and it was easy to eat. The little girl smiled and felt happy again.
The little girl kept the lollipop and hugged her mommy tightly. Then they both hugged each other and the little girl was so happy.
That was how the little girl and her mommy shared their happy moment. With hugs and lollipops, they were happy that day.



 
Once upon a time there was a bossy dog named Max. He always wanted things to go his way. He liked to hurry around so that he could get everything done.
One day, Max went for a walk with his new friends. They decided to play tag and hurry around the park. They all laughed and had a lot of fun.
Max was the fastest runner and he was so bossy! He would tell the others to hurry up and keep up with him. He even tried to teach them his special running style. 
But, deep down Max was just trying to get the most out of their fun game. He wanted everyone to have as much fun as he did. 
The others were happy to learn Max's running style and when they stopped, everyone agreed that they had all had a great time.




One day, two green birds were flying in the sky. They were looking for something special. Suddenly, the birds saw a cloud of oxygen. It was like a big, white bush.
The birds wanted to catch the oxygen, so they flew closer. With one big swoop, they caught the oxygen in their beaks.
The birds were so excited that they had caught the oxygen. It felt like they were flying on a breeze. So they flew back home with the oxygen in their beaks.
At home, the birds put the oxygen in a jar. It was like a green balloon in the jar.
Every day the birds looked at the oxygen in the jar and smiled. They were the only ones that had caught the special cloud of oxygen.




Once upon a time, there was a restless little mouse. Everywhere he went, his tiny feet tapped and twirled. He was so excited to explore and have fun!
One day, the mouse noticed that his friend the bunny had been very sad. The bunny had quit playing and running around like he used to. So the mouse asked him what was wrong.
The bunny told the mouse that hed stopped loving the things he used to love, like playing and going on adventures. The bunny wanted to feel excited and happy again.
The mouse felt sad to see his friend so restless. He was determined to help! He promised to take the bunny on a surprise adventure.
The two friends skipped and hopped through the woods together. When they reached a large meadow, the pair laughed and rolled around in the grass. The bunny was so happy again!
The little mouse was glad he quit his own games for a day, and showed his friend the power of love. It was much better than being restless!




Once there was a little girl. Every evening she loved to play in the garden. On this particular evening, she was playing princess. She twirled and twirled until she was all finished. 
When evening came, she put on her pale dress and went to bed. It was her special bedtime routine. 
After her parents tucked her in, they walked outside to look up at the night sky. Hundreds of tiny stars were shining in the pale sky. It was a beautiful sight. 
Eventually, the little girl fell asleep with a smile on her face. She had finished another perfect evening.




Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was only three years old but she was brave and daring. One day, she went for a bike ride with her mom. As they rode, they came to a bridge. The bridge was dark and spooky and Lucy was scared. But her mom told her to "Go faster, Lucy!" So Lucy put her feet to the pedals and pedaled as fast as she could! She felt the wind on her face as she sped across the bridge. She felt brave and strong. Mom smiled and gave Lucy a big hug when they were safely on the other side. From then on, Lucy was not so scared of the dark bridge.




Once there was a girl who wanted to play with her friends. She had her equipment ready and went outside to find them. She saw them playing in the garden.
The girl ran to her friends and asked what they were doing. They said they were playing a game. She asked if she could join but they said no. They all had a drink to celebrate and the girl felt sad.
The girl went back inside and saw her favorite toy lying on the floor. It was dead. She started to cry.
Suddenly, the girl heard a tapping sound. She saw that it was coming from her dead toy. She was surprised and went closer to it. The toy was magically alive and had a drink in its hand! It said it was a special drink that could bring dead things to life.
The girl was so excited and had a drink too. Right away, her toy became alive and the girl hugged it. She and her toy went back outside and joined her friends for some fun. From that day, the girl never felt sad again!




Once there was a boy who loved to watch the dark butterflies soar in the sky. Every day he would go outside and look up, hoping to catch a glimpse of the dark colors.
One day, he saw one of the butterflies fluttering right by him. He reached out his hand, but it flew away. So he decided to chase it.
He ran as fast as he could, but the butterfly always stayed a few steps ahead. Then, all of a sudden, the butterfly stopped and hovered above the boy. He gasped in surprise and looked up at the dark butterfly as it glided above him.
The boy stared as he watched the butterfly soar up high. He wanted to be up there with it too. So the boy closed his eyes and jumped up into the sky. He felt the soft air blowing against his face, and he opened his eyes.
The boy was soaring with the dark butterfly. He laughed and felt the wind rustling through his hair. Everywhere he looked, there were butterflies dancing in the sky. He felt so happy and free, as he soared around in the dark blue sky.



 
One day, a family was getting ready to go outside. Mom and Dad put on their hats and coats and told the little boy to prepare. He grabbed his own hat and coat and headed outside. When he opened the door, he saw a clumsy mosquito flying around the porch. He wanted to catch the mosquito, but it flew away before he could. Mom and Dad said it was ok because there were enough other things to do outside. So the family went out and had a wonderful day in the sunshine.



Once upon a time, a little boy went out to play. He saw a pipe on the ground and decided to pick it up. The pipe was empty but he thought it would be fun to try to fill it.
The little boy ran back home to ask his mom. Together, they gathered some things from the backyard. They got some stones, twigs, leaves and grass and put them into the pipe.
Once it was filled, the little boy proudly ran outside to show all of his friends. They all laughed and ran off to play together. The little boy played with the pipe all day, gathering up different things and filling it again and again.
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a whale swimming in the middle of the sea. He was startled by a loud splash. He peered into the water expecting to see something, but nothing was there. He was frightened, so he decided to sit still, hoping the strange noise wouldn't come back. Suddenly, he felt a tap on his back and heard a voice. He quickly turned around and saw a small fish. The fish said "Hello whale. Why are you so frightened?"
The whale replied, "I thought something was coming to get me."
The fish smiled and said, "Don't worry, you're safe here. Sit and be calm."
The whale thanked the fish and sat down. He felt better knowing that the fish was there and he was no longer frightened. From then on, the whale and the fish were friends, and they stayed together even when the sea was full of strange sounds.




Once upon a time there was a flower who was very hungry. The flower was so small and quiet, but it was so beautiful. The petals of the flower were a deep pink color. Every day the flower looked around hoping to find food. 
One day, he noticed a butterfly with a big yellow tie. The flower watched as the butterfly flew close by. As the butterfly floated across, he accidentally dropped the tie. The flower was so excited! He quickly reached out with his stem and grabbed the tie. He used the tie to tie his stem to the ground.
The tie gave the flower all the food and water he needed to grow. The little flower bloomed and grew the prettiest petals ever seen. He glowed with happiness and thanked the butterfly. He was no longer hungry and could finally smile. From that day on, the tie was the flower's prize.




Once upon a time there was a lady who loved to soak. She would soak in the tub every day for hours. She felt so relaxed and happy when she soaked.
One day she found a very special print. It was deep and blue and looked like the ocean. It was so beautiful! She wanted to keep it, so she bought it.
When she got home, she soaked with the print in the tub. She looked at it and thought about how deep the ocean was. She closed her eyes and imagined the ocean waves and how peaceful it was.
When she went to bed that night, she was so happy. She had been able to soak and enjoy the beautiful print. She knew she had a special treat that she could enjoy every night.




John and his mom were getting ready to start a new project. They were going to plant a garden. John was very excited - he wanted it to be the best garden ever!
John and his mom decided to plant some carrots, peppers, tomatoes and squash. They made a plan to water the plants every day and to make sure the garden was growing well.
John and his mom planted the seeds. They felt very humble, knowing that their garden was a special gift from nature.
The next morning, John raced out to the garden to check on the plants. He found that little green sprouts were growing where he had planted the seeds. He was so excited to see the plants!
John and his mom continued to plan and take care of their garden. With their love and effort, their garden flourished. In the end, they were so proud of their humble garden that they had planted together.



Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She was very excited because she was going to the park with her mom. When they arrived, Sarah saw a big surprise - a big hill! She couldn't believe it.
Sarah ran up the hill as fast as she could. She stopped when she reached the top. From there, she could see everything - the trees, the blue sky and all the birds flying around.
Sarah was so excited that she ran down the hill again and again. She liked the feeling of the wind in her hair as she went. Then, something else caught her eye - a little hill.
She walked over to it and started to climb. It was much smaller than the big hill, but it was just as much fun. After a few more runs up and down the little hill, it was time to go home.
Sarah was so happy and surprised that she'd found the little hill. She hugged her mom tight and said goodbye to the park. As they walked home, Sarah couldn't wait to come back and play on the hills again.




Once there was a little girl called Lucy. She was three years old and loved to celebrate.
Every month, Lucy's family would get together and have a party. They would dance and eat cake and sing songs. Lucy's favorite part was when her dad would take out a big bow and tie it around her wrist. It made her feel so special!
But one day, something bad happened. Lucy got very sick and she was stuck in the hospital for weeks. She was so helpless and felt lonely without her family.
But finally, Lucy got better! And her family came to the hospital to celebrate. They all hugged her, gave her lots of presents and took her out for ice cream. As a special surprise, they even brought out the big bow and tied it around her wrist again.
This time, Lucy was feeling much better and she celebrated with all her heart, knowing she was surrounded by people who loved her.



Once upon a time, there was a man. He wanted to go for a swim, but when he looked, the pool seemed empty. He was very sad.
He looked around, and saw that the park was empty too. He decided to keep looking and found a pond. He was happy when he saw that the pond was not empty.
He took off his shoes, and put his toes in the water. The water was really cold, but it seemed nice. He started to swim around in the pond.
He swam around and around, and had lots of fun. After a while, he noticed it was getting dark, so he got out of the pond and put his shoes back on.
He was still happy that he had been able to swim in the pond. He waved goodbye and started to walk home. He was glad that he had found the pond. The End.



Once upon a time, there was a shy fairy who lived in the forest. She liked to play and have fun but was always very careful. One day, she decided to pack for a trip. She put some food, her favourite flower and a few shiny rocks in a basket and tied it up with a ribbon. Then she flew away to find adventure.
The fairy saw a meadow and some animals. She tried to talk to them but they were too shy. Suddenly, she heard a breeze coming from behind a tree. Peeking carefully, the fairy saw two little elves dancing around. She loved the music they were playing, so she flew closer to say hello.
The elves were so excited to meet the fairy. They gave her a big hug and said she was welcome to stay with them. The three of them danced and played all night until the sun came up. The next morning, the fairy said goodbye and packed her basket for the journey back home. 
The fairy was so thankful for the wonderful night she had spent with the elves. She took a deep breath and flew away, off to find her next adventure.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Zoe. Zoe was three years old and she loved cheese. One day Zoe went to the shop with her mum. She saw a big wheel of cheese and shouted "Cheese!" excitedly. Her mum laughed and pointed to the clear sky above.
Zoe decided it was time to go outside and play. She put on her shoes and ran out into the garden. She began to shout "Cheese!" as loud as she could. She ran around shouting cheerfully until she was out of breath. 
After awhile Zoe's neighbours heard her shouting. They all came out to their gardens and soon more people had joined in. Everyone was shouting "Cheese!" and it echoed around the neighbourhood. Zoe loved hearing the sound of so many voices shouting the same word.
The day soon came to an end and everyone went back to their homes. But now whenever Zoe went out to play, she always shouted "Cheese" as loud as she could!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Rose. She loved to explore the world around her. One day, she decided to explore a new garden. As she walked around, she noticed a beautiful rose. She wanted to get a closer look, so she reached out to pick it up. But it was too high! Just when she was about to give up, she noticed a bee carrying the rose in its wings. She took a deep breath and jumped. She was able to grab the rose, and carefully lifted it up  triumphantly!
The rose had a spicy scent, and Rose just couldn't get enough of it. She took the rose inside and decided to give it Water to keep it fresh. She was so proud of herself! She taught herself that no matter how tricky something looked, it was possible with enough determination and courage. 
From then on, Rose was never afraid to lift anything, no matter how big or small it was. She believed that she could get anything she set her mind to.




Once upon a time, there was a small red planet in the sky. It was full of secrets and adventures.
One day, an explorer wanted to find out what was hidden there. So the explorer went to find a key to unlock the planet.
The explorer searched and searched and finally found the key. They were so excited! The explorer grabbed the key and ran to the planet.
When they reached it, the explorer quickly put the key in the door and unlocked it. Suddenly, a magical world was revealed!
The explorer smiled and went for an adventure in the red planet. They had so much fun! And their exploration was only the beginning.




Once upon a time there was a band. They loved to make music and try to learn new things.
The band was very dirty. Everywhere they went they made a big mess. Soon the whole town was a very dirty place. 
Everyone started to grumble and complain about how dirty it was. The band was worried, but they were determined to learn how to clean it up. 
The band started getting everyone involved. They worked together to pick up all the trash and put it in the bin. Everyone helped to wipe down the walls and windows. 
When they were all done, the town was nice and clean again. The band was very proud of themselves. They all had learned how important it was to keep the town clean.




Once there was a family who was all ready to sail. The mother and father, and their three year old daughter. They went out to the sea, and their boat bobbed up and down in the water. They had a sail and a flag, too.
The wind was just right and the family set sail. The little girl could see the sea on either side. As they sailed, the ocean was so wide and beautiful.
The family sailed for a little while and then suddenly a huge wave came along! It knocked the boat and the family was ready to stay balanced. Luckily, everything was okay.
The family sailed and sailed and sailed, exploring different places. Finally they decided to go home. They put up their sail, and and headed back to the harbor. They were glad they had a safe and wonderful journey.




Once there was a lovely little seed. It was special, because it had the power to grow. One day, its owner took it, and put it into a soft bag.
The seed was placed in a spot that was full of sunshine. Every day, the sun shone on the little seed.
Soon, the seed started to grow. It grew bigger and bigger, until it broke the bag. Then it started to grow taller and taller. Soon it looked like a beautiful tree.
The tree was full of leaves and branches. It grew taller and taller, until it was the tallest thing in the field. Everyone who saw it was amazed at how beautiful it was. 
The seed had grown from something small to something huge. It was a reminder to everyone that with enough love, hard work and patience, anything can grow.




Once upon a time there was an image. It was a white image and it was very special. Every day the image called out, but no one ever heard it. It was very sad.
Then one day, something amazing happened. A special little girl heard the call. She stopped and looked around. She saw the white image and smiled.
The little girl knew what to do. She waved and said "hello". The image smiled back. The little girl was so happy.
From then on, the little girl would visit the image every day. They would laugh and talk and the image was no longer sad. Because of the sweet little girl, the image was happy.




One day, a little girl went for a walk in the park. She saw something high up in the sky. It was a hot day and the sun was shining so the little girl decided to lie down in the grass and rest. She spread out a big, warm blanket and fell asleep.
As she was sleeping, the sun was melting the blanket. Little by little, the blanket became smaller and smaller until it was just a few squares. The little girl woke up and saw that her blanket had melted! She was so surprised!
The little girl was sad she didn't have her blanket anymore. But then she smiled and decided to look for some leaves and make a new blanket. She gathered some big, beautiful leaves and put them together. She was so happy to have a new blanket to keep her warm!




Once upon a time, there was a mighty bear. He was strong and brave - the strongest bear in the whole wood. He was so mighty, that every day he would go out and find treats for himself. One day, as he was roaming around, he suddenly realized he had lost his treats! He was very sad and couldn't think of what to do.
Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was a small voice, but it called out to him: "Mighty Bear, don't be sad - I know where the treats are!" The bear was so excited - he followed the voice until he finally found what he was looking for: the treats! He was so happy that his treats were back, he hugged the little voice and thanked them.
It was then that the bear realized the tiny voice belonged to a little mouse! The mouse had found the bear's treats, and wanted to help the bear by letting him know. The bear was so grateful that he thanked the mouse for being so kind, and offered to share his treats with the mouse too. 
The two new friends shared the treats and from then on, they would always look out for each other, so that no one would ever have to lose their treats again.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved exploring in the garden and finding out about the different things she could see.
One day, Lily was looking at the drain in the garden. It was very dirty and she wanted to know why. She asked her mum, "Why is the drain dirty?".
Her mum answered and said, "Well Lily, the dirt comes from inside the drain and it makes it dirty."
Lily thought about this for a moment and said, "Yes, but why is it inside the drain?"
Her mum smiled and said, "It's because the water from the rain fills up the drain and brings all the dirt with it."
Lily was so excited to learn this new thing and she said, "That's amazing!"
From then on, Lily was always curious about the drain and wanted to learn more about it.




Once there was a little girl named Jane. She was three years old and very curious. She liked to explore the world and see new things.
One day, she was playing in her garden when she saw something very interesting. It was a blackboard! She had never seen one before. She was so excited that she ran to show her mum.
Mum explained that it was a blackboard and it could be used for writing. Jane wanted to try writing on it. She grabbed a chalk from her mum and began to draw on the board.
She made lots of small scribbles and lines. Sometimes, some of it looked kind of like a word. Jane was having so much fun! She kept trying different shapes and lines.
When she was done, she had made lots of interesting shapes on the board. Jane was very proud of her work. She smiled and hugged her mum, happy to have tried something new.



Once upon a time there was a nice girl called Lisa. Lisa wanted to go to the big, important maze. But before she could go, Lisa had to do something first.
She had to clean the maze!
So Lisa got all the cleaning things she needed and started to clean. She had a mop for mopping the floor and a brush for brushing the walls. She had to be very careful because the maze was important!
When Lisa had finished cleaning, the maze looked so beautiful. Lisa was very proud of her work and skipped around the maze.
Lisa was finally ready to go to the maze. She went in and had a lovely time. She explored all the different corners and pathways and it felt like she was discovering a new world.
The end.



Once upon a time, there lived two friends called Lucy and Jack. They both loved to play in an oak tree in Lucy's garden. Every day, Lucy and Jack would climb the big oak tree, pass the leaves and giggle. They felt so free and joyful.
One day, when Lucy and Jack were playing, they saw a baby bird struggling to fly. At first they felt sad, but then they decided to help teach the baby bird how to fly. They patiently showed him how to flap his wings. It couldn't fly right away, so they taught him again and again.
 
At last, the baby bird lifted off the ground! Lucy and Jack were so delighted their faces lit up with delight. Then they started to laugh, a healthy and happy laugh that filled the whole garden. The baby bird flew away while Lucy and Jack waved goodbye. From that day on, they were the best of friends!




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jim. Jim had a very special hand. No one else had a hand like it. It was so special because it was original.
 
Every day, Jim would go to the playground and play. One day, he came across a big pile of toys. Jim didn't know what to do with them, so he decided to sort them. He started to pick up each one and tried to decide where it should go.
Once Jim was done sorting, it was time to put the toys away. He put each toy in the right place with his original hand. As he was finishing, Jim noticed that other kids were admiring his hand. 
They all wanted hands like Jim's so they could be just as smart and organized. Jim smiled, feeling proud. With his special, original hand, Jim was able to sort toys and be the best at it!




Charlie was a curious boy. He liked to go outside and explore the world. One day, Charlie saw a tall cloud in the sky. He wanted to know what it was like to balance on a cloud. He was excited and he wanted to try it.
So, he thought of a plan. He ran to the park and found a big ladder he could use. He carried it over to the cloud and carefully placed it against the cloud. He started climbing the ladder, higher and higher towards the top of the tall cloud.
He was a little bit scared, but he kept climbing. When he reached the top, he was surprised to find out that the cloud was a fluffy, soft cushion! He lay down safely on the top of the cloud and balanced there.
He opened his arms wide, looked around and smiled. It was a magical feeling! He lay there for a while, floating around in the sky until it was time to go home.



 
Once there was a little girl named Amy. The grass was very green and the sky was very blue. Amy liked to pick flowers and play in the park. One day she saw something pale in the park that she liked - a big lollipop. 
Amy knew she had to count how many lollipops she saw. She counted one, two, three and four. But then she could not count any more. 
All of a sudden, a big bird flew down and swept up one of the lollipops with its beak. Amy quickly counted again and found she still had three lollipops she could enjoy. 
Amy ran right home and sat on the porch. She unwrapped the lollipops and began to enjoy them. She smiled as each lick tasted like sweet, sugary apple. 
Amy was happy she got to count the lollipops and eat them too!




Once upon a time there were two friends. They were Jack and Jill. Jack liked to play games. But Jill liked to jump and run.
One day, Jack wanted to play a game. He held up a switch and asked Jill to play. Jill looked at the switch and said no. She refused to play with the switch.
Jack got mad and started to yell. He said it was a brilliant game. But Jill still said no. She wouldn't even look at the switch.
Jack was very sad. He couldn't understand why Jill didn't want to play with him. Then he smiled and said she could just jump and run. And Jill smiled too. She was happy to play with Jack. They had lots of fun.



Once upon a time, there was a selfish little girl named Sally. Sally never wanted to share her toys with anyone, not even with her best friend. 
One day, Sally got a cold, and she sneezed and sneezed. She was so stuffy she couldn't even play with her toys anymore. Her mom got her a nice, soft rag and said, Sally, use this to wipe your nose and keep yourself clean.
But Sally, who was so selfish, wouldn't even share her rag with her friend when they made houses out of blocks together. She said, This rag is only for me.
Fortunately, Sally had a mom who was wise and kind. She reminded Sally that it's important to share and to not always be so selfish. So Sally finally shared her rag and they both felt happy. 
The End.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Jordan. Jordan had very long hair and his Mum wanted to give him a little haircut. So, one Saturday morning, they went to the hairdresser. 
The hairdresser supplied Jordan with a big cape to wear. Then, she brushed his hair and snipped away at it with the scissors. Jordan quite enjoyed the feeling of the brush in his hair.
After a few minutes, the haircut was finished. Jordan's Mum smiled when she saw the finished look. She said that Jordan was the most handsome boy she had ever seen. She gave Jordan a big hug and a kiss.
Once they got home, Mum put a big mirror in front of Jordan. He looked in the mirror and was very happy with his little haircut. He knew he looked smart and he knew others would think so too.




Jolly Joe was walking through the woods one day when he saw something sparkly in a bush. He went in to take a peek and he was so surprised to find a pot of gold! It glittered in the bright sunshine and sparkled like a million stars.
Joe couldn't believe his luck, he quickly grabbed hold of the pot and brought it out of the bush. He looked around to see if anyone had noticed, but he was all alone. Joe was so excited to show his pot of gold to his friends.
So, with the pot of gold clutched tightly in his hand, Joe quickly ran back home. As soon as he arrived, he shouted to his friends that he had discovered a pot of gold.
His friends were so excited and jolly, they all cheered and hugged him with joy. Joe's story of the pot of gold was the talk of the town and everyone wanted to see it for themselves.
Joe then proudly showed everyone his pot of gold. It shone brightly in everyone's eyes and everyone was happy for Joe and his precious pot of gold.




Once there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to decorate her room. She wanted it to be beautiful and sparkly. 
One day, Lily and her mommy went to the store. She saw a big roll of looping, flexible ribbon. She was so excited that she could use it to decorate her room.
When they got home, Lily grabbed a chair so she could reach her wall. She used the ribbon to make long, colorful loops around her wall. When she was finished, it looked so pretty!
Lily was so happy with her decoration. She wanted to show everyone, so she called all her friends over to admire her loops. Everyone gasped at her beautiful wall decoration.
Finally, Lilys mommy hung up a big, sparkly sign near the loops. It said, Lilys Room, and it was just perfect.
The End!




Once there was a little girl named Chloe. She was three years old and she loved to travel. One day, Chloe went to the mall with her mom. She was so excited, she couldn't help but smile. 
Chloe ran around the mall, looking at all the amazing things she could buy. She spotted a bright teddy bear and asked her mom if she could buy it. Her mom said she could, and Chloe was so happy she screamed!
Chloe's mom said that it was time to go home, but Chloe wanted to stay. Her mom said she could come back again soon, because it was so easy to travel to the mall. So Chloe smiled and said, "Okay, let's go!" 
Chloe and her mom said goodbye to the mall, and Chloe was already dreaming about the next time she would get to travel there.




Once there was a little girl who loved her sweater. It was pink and orange, with lots of sparkles. Every day she would rock in her chair while wearing it.
One day, it got too small for her. She was very sad. Her mommy said, "Be patient. I'll find you a new sweater."
So, every day the little girl waited patiently. She tried other sweaters, but none of them felt quite as good as her pink and orange one.
Then one day, when she was rocking in her chair, her mommy brought her a new sweater. It was pink and orange, too, but this one had even more sparkles.
The little girl was so happy! She put on the sweater and rocked in her chair, feeling so happy and comfortable.
From that day on, the little girl always rocked in her chair wearing her new pink and orange sweater.




Once upon a time, there was a little child. The child was playing in a muddy puddle and was having lots of fun! But soon the child was very dirty and needed a wash.
The child's mama saw her and smiled. She was so happy to see the child having so much fun, but knew it was time for a wash. The mama was so compassionate, she said "come, it's time for a wash".
So the child begrudgingly followed her mama to the bathroom. The mama filled the bath with warm water, and began to scrub the child until she was nice and clean. The child felt so much better after the wash, and was so grateful to her mama for taking such good care of her. 
The end.



Once there was a mommy and a daddy. Together, they had a special symbol. It was a ring, like a circle. It had mild colors, like yellow and pink. They liked it very much. 
One day, the mommy and the daddy decided to marry. They put on the special symbol on each other's fingers. Everyone cheered as they smiled and kissed. They were so happy! 
After they were married, the mommy and daddy danced together. They twirled around and around, holding hands. Everyone smiled and laughed. It was a happy time for all. 
The special symbol was a reminder of their special day. It would be a symbol of love and happiness that they would always share.




Dave was a 3 year old boy who wanted to understand lotion. He asked his mom, "What is lotion?"
His mom smiled and said, "It is a special kind of liquid that helps keep your skin soft and smooth."
Dave seemed to understand. He knew that when his skin was itchy and dry, a lotion could help make it better.
His mom had a bottle of special lotion that she used on Dave. He liked how it made his skin feel as she rubbed it in.
Dave looked around and saw lots of different lotions available. He was so excited to choose his favorite one. He pointed at one lotion and said, "This one!" It said it was for sensitive skin and it smelled like strawberries.
His mom smiled and said, "That's a good choice, honey!"
Dave grinned and couldn't wait to try it out. He was so glad he understood lotion now!




One day, there was a dependable farm. On the farm, all kinds of animals lived happily. They had plenty of food and sunshine. One day, something unexpected happened. A strong wind came and broke the fence around the farm. The animals were scared and started running all around.
Luckily, they had a dependable farmer. The farmer saw the broken fence and he worked really hard to fix it. He repaired the fence with lots of pieces of wood. Soon, the fence was as good as new.
The animals on the farm were so happy. They had their farm and their dependable farmer back. They played and laughed, enjoying their days in the sunshine. They were so thankful for the dependable farmer who had come to the rescue.
And all the animals lived happily ever after.




Once there was a wild number. It enjoyed travelling and exploring the world. One day, the number found itself on an island and it noticed that it had no fuel to get off. It was very worried, so it decided to look around for some fuel. After a while, it noticed a big boat in the distance. It ran as fast as it could and was happy to find fuel inside. The number loaded the fuel onto its boat and sailed away. It had an amazing adventure and was glad that it found the fuel. The end.




Once upon a time there was a seed. It was small and round, and it lived in the dirt. Every day it grew bigger. The seed was filled with a special power - the power of space. 
Soon, the seed grew into a flower. Its petals were very beautiful, and its strong stem reached high into the air. The flower spread its petals wide, and it started to open. Inside was a deep, secret space. 
The flower stayed in the dirt, and its space slowly filled up with different things. Soon, that tiny secret space held many great things. It became a place to grow memories, happiness, and lots of love. 
The flower's special space was so deep that it filled the whole world. Everyone loved to visit the special flower, and they filled it with laughter and joy. 
And that is how the deep, special space started to grow.



Once upon a time there were two friends who lived on the earth. One day, they wanted to go exploring. Together they set off on a big adventure.
First, they came across a smelly house. The friends said to one another, "Let's go inside and see what's in there!" They knocked on the door but no one answered.
Then they decided to try the next house. This one didn't smell so bad. They knocked on the door, and the door opened. Out stepped a friendly lady, who smiled and said hello. The friends said hello too, and asked if they could look inside. She said yes, so they went in and saw lots of fun things. 
They said goodbye to the lady and continued their adventure. They saw a river and even a waterfall. They had a wonderful time and laughed a lot. When it started to get dark, their adventure came to an end.
They said goodbye to the earth and promised to come back for another adventure soon.




Once there was a little boy, he was very curious. He was walking in the park and he saw a furry cross on the ground. He looked at the cross and he started to stare at it. 
The boy moved closer and closer to the cross until he was right in front of it. He noticed that the cross was very soft and furry like a kitten. He couldn't stop looking at it and wanted to touch it. 
The little boy slowly moved his hand towards the cross and as soon as he touched it, it came to life! The cross suddenly began to move and the boy was very surprised. The cross jumped on him and started to lick his face. 
The little boy started to laugh and hug the furry cross. He had never seen a cross like this before and he was so happy! From that day on, the little boy was best friends with the furry cross. They would play and explore the park together.




Once there was a little girl who loved to bake. She was a very unusual baker and made some of the most delicious treats! One day, the little girl and her mom decided to make a special treat for her friends. They mixed up some fruits, chocolate and a secret ingredient to make a yummy cake.
The little girl was so excited she could hardly wait to bring it to her friends. She wanted to share it with everyone and asked her mom if she could be a dancer too! Her mom said yes and the little girl started to dance. She twirled and spun and did all kinds of unusual moves!
When she got to her friends' house, she presented them with the cake. Everyone was so impressed that they all wanted to try a piece. The little girl was so happy that her baking and dancing made her friends so happy. It was a really special day!



Once there was a happy little boy named Billy. Every day, he liked to jump around and have lots of fun. One day, he saw something that made him very happy. It was a big lemon!
Billy wanted to get the lemon, so he jumped as high as he could. He jumped so high that he touched the top of the lemon tree. He was so proud of himself.
Billy couldn't wait to show off his lemon to his friends. It was so big and yellow! Everyone was surprised to see it, and it soon became very popular. 
Billy enjoyed his lemon so much that he'd jump up and down with excitement. He was very proud that everyone wanted to see his lemon. From then on, he was known as the boy with the very popular lemon.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Jane. Jane was very small and loved to skip. Every morning she would wake up and skip around her house. She would skip around the kitchen, the living room, and even the garden.
One morning Jane was looking out the window. She saw a bright, clear sky and she was so excited. She wanted to go outside and skip in the sunshine.
Jane put on her red shoes and skipped outside. She skipped around the garden, over the flowers and around the trees. She even skipped so high that she could touch the sky!
Eventually Jane got tired. She stopped, sat down and began to suck her thumb. She looked up to the sky and saw a big, white cloud. The cloud was so clear and as Jane watched it, she drifted away into a peaceful sleep.
When Jane woke up she was still looking up at the clear sky. She smiled, hopped up and skipped away. She was so happy that she had a lovely day of skipping in the sunshine.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Jack. He wanted to play with his bucket. So, he held it tight and started running around the garden. Suddenly, Jack got very dizzy. He wobbled and wobbled until he suddenly fell down. He started crying and mention his mommy.
His mommy heard his cries and quickly ran to find him. When she did, she saw him holding a bucket, lying on the ground. She asked him what happened and Jack explained that he got so dizzy while playing. His mom comforted him with a hug and then they went inside.
Jack was happy that his mom was so understanding. He felt better after they talked it out. From that day on, Jack remembered to take it slow and not make himself too dizzy. He still enjoyed playing with his bucket, only a bit more slowly.



Once upon a time, there was a jolly boy who loved to walk. Every time he was outside he was always on the lookout for new places to explore. One evening, it was getting dark and he was getting tired so he thought it was time to go home. Before he left, he decided to take a moment to pray. He closed his eyes, folded his hands and asked God to help him find lots of new places to walk the next day. After he finished his prayer, he started his walk home. He was happy and content, because he felt that God had heard his prayer. He knew that the next day he would have lots of fun, discovering new places to explore. 
The end.




One day, there was a shy little girl named Lucy. She was getting ready to throw something in the mailbox. She was holding a letter that she had written.
Lucy was feeling very brave. She looked both ways and then threw the letter into the mailbox. It landed with a thump. 
When Lucy saw her letter in the mailbox, she clapped her hands and laughed. She was so happy that she had made it. 
Lucy's mom walked up behind her and said, "I'm so proud of you for being brave and throwing that letter in the mailbox!" Lucy smiled and nodded. 
She was proud of herself too! She had been very shy when she had gone to the mailbox, but she was glad she had dared to throw the letter inside.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Graham. He had a telephone that he loved very much. Graham used to play with it all the time, talking to his friends and family. One day, Graham had a silly idea. He decided to drop the telephone in the river while he was walking by.
At first, he thought it was fun, but then he started to feel bad. He regretted what he had done. It was foolish to throw the telephone away. Graham was sorry for his mistake and wished he could take it back.
He tried to forget about what he had done, but he could not. Every time he saw a telephone, he remembered his mistake. Graham learned his lesson, never to be foolish again.




Once there was a generous plastic. Everyone liked him because he was nice to everyone. One day he went out for a walk and he saw a big scare. He was so scared, he ran back to his house. He told his family all about it and they decided to help him.
The family took the plastic to the scare and they all said "Hello!" To the scare. The scare was so surprised, it started to smile. The scare realized that the plastic was very generous and that he was no longer scared.
From then on, the plastic and the scare became best friends. They would play together every day and the generous plastic helped keep everyone safe. It was a great reminder for everyone to always be generous.




One day, Jack went for a walk in the park. It was a sunny day and he wanted to have some fun. As he walked around, Jack saw a tall man waving his hands at him from far away. Jack waved back and smiled at the man.
Next, Jack walked to the toilet. He wanted to take a break from walking. When he got to the toilet, he saw that it was very weak. It was almost falling down. Jack was scared but he decided to go in anyway. He quickly went and then left.
Finally, Jack walked back to the park. But he was very tired. He lay down on the grass and waved his hands goodbye to the park. He was so weak that he fell asleep right away. When he woke up, it was already dark. Jack got up and waved goodbye to the park again. He was so happy and tired. And he knew it was time to go home.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who wanted to help her mommy. Every day she watched her mommy do chores and loved to try and help. One day, her mommy asked her to go outside and bring her a twig.
The little girl was so excited. She ran out of the house and started looking for the perfect twig. She looked around the yard, but couldn't find the right one. She kept looking and looking, but no twigs seemed right.
The little girl was getting very tired, but she was so persistent. She kept looking until finally, she found the perfect twig. She picked it up and ran back inside.
Mommy was so impressed! She thanked the little girl for being so persistent and for finding the perfect twig. The little girl was so proud of herself for being such a big help. From that day on, the little girl always tried her best to bring Mommy whatever she asked for.




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jake. Jake loved eating cereal and he especially liked the wild berries in his cereal. 
One morning, Jake kept worrying about where to find more wild berries. He asked his mom if he could go outside and look for them, but she said no. Jake was getting worried because he wanted to eat his wild cereal. 
Suddenly, Jake remembered something. The night before, he had seen a wild bush outside his window and it was covered with wild berries. Jake was so excited, he ran outside to find the bush. 
As soon as he reached the bush, it was full of wild berries and more. Jake happily picked some of the berries and ran back inside with them.
He was so happy to have his wild cereal again. From then on, Jake never worried about where to find wild berries again.




Mommy and Daddy were very excited. They were going to get a new baby! Every day, Mommy and Daddy brought something new for the baby. They put it in the drawer. The baby had lots of toys and nice clothes.
One day, the baby was being very naughty. He kept taking the toys out of the drawer. Mommy and Daddy told him not to do it. But the naughty baby still did it!
Mommy and Daddy decided to spoil the baby. They bought him even more toys! Now the baby was very happy and stopped taking things out of the drawer. Every day, Mommy and Daddy would play with the baby and his new toys. The baby was happy and so were Mommy and Daddy.




Once there was a ball. It was round and bouncy. The ball wanted to get away. It wanted to go high in the sky. It started to roll. It rolled and rolled until it saw a triangle. The triangle was really tall and high. The ball decided to kick it.
So the ball kicked the triangle. And the triangle flew really high in the sky until it was a tiny dot. The ball was so happy. It had gone really high in the sky.
Then the ball came down and went home. It rolled and rolled until it was safe and sound with its family. It would never forget the time it kicked the triangle and went high in the sky.



One day, a mommy and her little daughter went to the store. The mommy bought yummy things, like pasta and nice smelling flowers. Then the mommy and her daughter went to the park.
On the way to the park, the little girl rolled down the hill. It felt so nice and fun! Then she saw some smelly things on the ground. 
The little girl asked her mommy what those smelly things were. The mommy said those were big pieces of pasta. The little girl thought it was very funny and started rolling the pasta down the hill. 
The little girl and her mommy laughed and laughed until they had to go home. They both had a lot of fun rolling the smelly pasta.




Once upon a time there was a brave girl called Jane. Jane wanted to explore the deep woods but it was raining and so everything was wet. She was a bit scared but she took a deep breath and stepped inside.
The woods were gloomy and her steps made the leaves tremble as she walked. Jane was excited but soon she started to get scared as the dark trees seemed to close in around her. Suddenly it became so quiet and Jane started to tremble. Her wet feet felt cold and she was too scared to go on.
But then, out of the corner of her eye, she spotted something dull on the ground. It was a big, brown leaf! Jane bent down to pick it up and felt courage fill her heart. She knew she could explore the deep woods if she just stayed brave.
Jane clenched the leaf tight in her hand and kept on walking. She was so brave that she wasn't scared at all - not even when the leaves continued to tremble beneath her feet.




Once there was a little girl called Jane. She was three years old. One day, Jane saw a pretty photo. The photo was of a lady. Jane liked the photo, so she decided to keep it. 
Every day, Jane looked at the photo. She liked to see the pretty lady in the photo. But then one day, Jane decided to leave the photo with her friend, Harry. 
Harry liked the photo too. So he was happy when Jane showed him the photo. He asked Jane if he could have it and she said yes. 
So Jane left the pretty photo with Harry. She said goodbye to the photo and walked away. Jane was sad to leave the photo, but she knew that Harry would look after it.




Once there was a kid who wanted to travel. He packed his bag and set off on an adventure. 
The kid traveled through the woods, but it was uncomfortable. He came across a lot of bugs, and he had to duck low to avoid the branches. He was hot and sweaty, but he kept going. 
The kid traveled on until he found a pond. He sat down and splashed around in the cool water. It was such a relief after the rough journey! 
After this, the kid was ready to go home. He felt so happy and proud of his adventure. He had seen so many new things during his travels, and he couldn't wait to tell everyone about them!



 
Once upon a time, there was a fearful hippo. He was feeling scared and lonely, so he went for a long walk. His long legs carried him around the meadow, across the river and up the hill. 
The hippo was very tired by the time he reached the top of the hill, so he lay down in the warm sunshine and rested. He felt the gentle breeze cool his skin as he rested, and soon his fear and loneliness disappeared.
