The hippo enjoyed resting in the sunshine, so he did it often. After a while he even made some friends who liked to rest with him. They would spend all day, every day, resting together on the hill. 
And that is the story of the fearful hippo. He found a place to safely rest and eventually made some friends.




Once there was a little boy who loved animals. He wanted to find a fierce animal, so he set out on a hike in the woods. He walked for a long time and eventually, he saw something coming towards him. He got closer and realized it was a tiger! He was scared and wanted to run, but he wanted to take a look. The tiger was so fierce! He was almost trembling, but he kept looking at the tiger all the same. He stayed still, and the tiger started to come closer and closer. The little boy was scared, but he wanted to take a look. He was amazed by the tiger's beauty, and he watched as it slowly passed by. When it was gone, the little boy was so relieved and happy that he had seen such a fantastic animal. He sat in the woods for a while, thinking about his journey, when suddenly he heard a sound from behind. He turned around and there was the tiger again! It was coming back for him! He was scared, but he stayed still and watched. The tiger came closer and closer. He was about to run for it when the tiger stopped and just looked at the boy. It looked at him with a fierce gaze, and the little boy slowly started to smile. He knew that the tiger was not going to hurt him. He thanked it for the wondrous experience and the tiger slowly walked away. The little boy went home, happy and with a story he'd never forget.




Once there was a little girl called Chloe who loved to whistle. Every morning she would run out of her house, pick up a rubber and whistle as loudly as she could! 
Chloe loved her whistle so much that one day, when she lost it, she felt very guilty. She had never lost anything before and searched high and low for it. 
Just when Chloe was about to give up, she got an idea and ran back home. She searched her bedroom and found her rubber under the bed. It had the whistle inside it and she could now whistle again!
Chloe was so happy that she leapt around the room, whistling loudly and laughing with delight. She was very relieved and no longer felt guilty. Thank goodness she had found her rubber!




Once upon a time there was a strong hanger. It was so strong it could hold lots of clothes. One day a little girl decided to poke the hanger. She wanted to see how strong it was. She poked it very hard and it didn't break! The little girl was very happy that the hanger was strong. She kept on poking the hanger and it never broke. She kept poking it until she was done. From then on, she was sure that the hanger was very strong and it could hold a lot of clothes. The end!



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to dance. All day she would run and twirl, sing and feel the music. But all was not great, for her right heel often hurt.
So one day she went to the doctor. He looked and said it was different from a normal heel. He was sad and said she could no longer dance or run.
The little girl was so sad and felt like crying. But then an amazing thing happened. The doctor said he could help. She felt better already!
He told her to wear a special shoe, it was called an orthopedic shoe. It had a big arch and very strong sides. The little girl was so happy, she knew she could continue to dance. 
Every day she would feel the music and dance with the shoe. The orthopedic shoe protected her heel and made it feel different and better. 
The little girl was so pleased, she's danced ever since. 
The End




Once there was a clever cricket called Jack. Every morning Jack would take a bath at the same time. He would jump in the water and have lots of fun. 
One day, Jack was very excited. He wanted to take a bath earlier than usual. So he set off early to the pond. 
When he got there he noticed the water was much clearer and the sun was shining brighter. Jack was so pleased, he couldn't help but jump right into the pond and start bathing. 
He had lots of fun and enjoyed splashing the water around. He stayed in the pond for a long time, but then he remembered he had to do something else. Jack hopped out of the pond and was on his way. 
Jack was very happy he had managed to take an extra bath. He knew he had been extra clever and he couldn't wait to tell his friends about it.



Mother had some money, and so she went to the store to buy something nice. She looked around and saw lots of things she wanted. But eventually, she chose a new toy.
The toy made lots of noise, and mother said she was sorry to the other people in the store, who were trying to keep it quiet. So she wrapped up the toy and took it home.
When mother got home, it was time for dinner. But, before she ate, she gave the toy to her little daughter. The toddler was so excited and she hugged the toy tightly.
Mother smiled, happy to see her daughter having so much fun with the new toy. She was glad that she had bought it.
That night, she tucked her little daughter into bed with her new toy. It was nice and quiet, and soon the little girl was fast asleep in her bed with her toy by her side.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Sue. Sue liked to go outside and play. One day she decided to go out in the sun and play.
But it was hot outside, too hot for Sue to stay out there for very long. So after a few minutes, Sue decided to go home.
But as she was walking, Sue heard a loud noise! It was a man in jail, yelling and banging on the walls with his fists.
Sue was scared, so she ran home quickly. When she got there, she told her mom all about the loud noise and how scared she was. 
But her mom told her not to worry. She explained that the man was in jail and he was only trying to make a loud noise to get out.
The next day, Sue decided to go back out and play. But first, her mom reminded her to be careful and pay attention. Sue said okay and went out and played.
This time, when Sue heard the loud noise, she didn't run away. She figured out that the man was just trying to strike the jail walls and get out, and she felt better knowing that. 
So after the man stopped making noise, Sue went back to playing. And she felt safe and happy.




One day, John went for a ride in a pink automobile. He was excited to go for a ride, and he tasted the warm summer air. It was very sweet!
The car hummed down the street. John looked out the window and saw little birds hopping from tree to tree. He waved to them and they sang back.
John noticed the car had stopped. He looked out the window and saw that he had arrived at a candy shop! He was excited for a sweet treat. He hopped out of the car and ran to the store.
Inside the store, there were all sorts of candy. He looked around and saw lollipops, gummy worms, and chocolates. But what made him smile the most was a big jar of pink gummy bears. He could not wait to taste it.
John quickly grabbed the jar and ran to the car. On the ride home, he savored every bite of the gummy bears. They tasted like sunshine and summer. 
When he arrived back home, John waved goodbye to the car and went inside to tell everyone about his sweet adventure.



Once upon a time, there was a beautiful princess. She loved to go exploring and one day she went deep into the forest.
Suddenly, a big, scary bear appeared! She was so scared that she ran away as fast as she could. The bear chased her, but she was much too fast! Each time the bear came closer, she kicked the ground with her feet and ran even faster!
Finally, the princess outran the bear and made it safely home. She was so relieved and happy that she had been brave and kicked the ground.
The princess would never forget her adventure, deep in the forest.




Yuki was a happy 3 year old. He loved to collect things. One day, he saw a helicopter in his yard. He was so excited he ran over and started collecting it.
Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. He was scared, so he quickly put the helicopter back down. His mom came out to see what happened, and she saw a stupid dog running around. The dog had been playing with the helicopter.
Yuki was very sad and angry. But his mom said not to worry. She told Yuki, "We'll get you a better one. We'll go to the store tomorrow and collect a new helicopter."
Yuki was very excited. He couldn't wait to go to the store. He knew he had to be careful when collecting his new helicopter, so it wouldn't be stolen by a silly, stupid dog.




Once there was a farmer who had a big flock of sheep. Every day, the farmer would wake up early and go and check on his sheep. One day when he went to check on his sheep, he was worried. None of the sheep were there! He looked around, but no sheep were in sight.
The farmer was very worried, so he called out for his sheep. He shouted, "Sheep! Where are my sheep?" He listened for a response, but all he heard was silence. He searched everywhere, but still no sheep!
The farmer got very angry and started to demand that his sheep return. "Sheep! I demand that you come back to the farm this instant!" he shouted.
Suddenly, he heard some noises coming from the nearby woods. He ran towards the woods, and what did he see? His sheep! All of his sheep had been hiding in the woods. They had been worried, and so they had gone to hide.
The farmer was very relieved. He thanked the sheep for returning, and they happily returned to the farm. From then on, the farmer made sure to check on his sheep every day.




Once there was a little girl named Emma. She liked to play outdoors. One day she noticed a hoop on the ground and she was so excited. She picked it up and started to inspect it. She thought it seemed so fun and shiny.
When she looked closer, she noticed it was quite messy. There were bits of leaves, sticks and dirt all around it. She thought that was a bit strange. But Emma wasn't scared, she was curious.
She decided to play with the hoop, so she held it and started to run. She felt like she was flying. She played for a very long time and felt so happy.
At the end of the day, Emma was so tired but she was also very content. She looked back at the hoop and saw how messy it was. But it still seemed like so much fun.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Jenny. She was very happy to be three. One day, Jenny asked her mom for a present. Her mom said she would have to be very good first. 
Jenny knew she wasn't always good, so she tried her very best. She shared her toys with her friends and obeyed her mom. 
When the day came to get her present, Jenny was so excited! Her mom handed her a shiny box. Jenny opened it and found a beautiful doll inside! 
Jenny was feeling so guilty she had asked for a present that she started to cry. Her mom said it was alright, that she loved Jenny no matter what. 
Jenny hugged her mom and thanked her for the present. Her mom said that no matter how bad Jenny felt, her mom would always love her.




Today, Jim was very excited. He wanted to go for a jog. He put on his special shoes, and said to himself, "I'm ready!" He tied the laces nice and tight, so he wouldn't trip. He took a deep breath, and began to jog. He felt so healthy and alive.
Jim ran until his feet were tired of running. He stopped and felt his heart racing. This made him smile. He looked around and saw lots of happy people. He said hello to each one of them, with a big smile. They smiled back.
Jim untied his laces, and decided to take it slowly back home. Every now and then he would take a few things to make sure he stayed healthy. It was a very enjoyable jog.
When he got back home, he was very pleased. He had a long, healthy jog, and he'd made some new friends. He was so proud of himself. He quickly went inside, said hello to his family, and went to bed. He was definitely ready to do some more jogging tomorrow.




Once upon a time there was a girl. Her name was Sue. Every day Sue loved to dance. 
One day, Sue asked her mommy for a special pair of gloves. Her mommy said yes and gave her a pair of red gloves that sparkled in the sun.
Sue put on her new gloves and danced in her backyard. She spun and twirled until the sun started to set. Soon the air was getting hot.
Sue took off the red gloves and put them into her pocket. She kept on dancing until her mommy called her inside.
The next day, Sue put on the red gloves and danced some more! She was so happy that she had a special way to dance and keep cool.




Teddy was very eager to go outside and explore. His mom opened the front door and Teddy peeked out. He saw a shiny new bike and he started to jump around in excitement. He ran over to the bike and started to peddle. Teddy peddled around the front yard and he was so proud of himself. He kept peddling and he explored all around the neighborhood, showing off his new bike. He was so excited to explore. Eventually, it was time for Teddy to go in for the night. His mom smiled at his eagerness and Teddy couldn't wait to ride his bike again the following day.



Once upon a time, there was a very hairy gorilla. The gorilla lived in the jungle and he loved to tell stories. Every day he would tell a different story about his life in the jungle.
One day, a little 3 year old child was walking through the jungle. He heard the gorilla telling stories, and he wanted to listen. He crept closer and closer, until he was sitting right beside the gorilla.
The little child listened carefully to the gorilla's stories. He was so excited to hear them, and he asked the gorilla to tell him another one. The gorilla chuckled and began to tell another story.
The little child loved the stories, and he spent many happy hours listening to the gorilla tell them. He was so glad that he found the hairy gorilla in the jungle.




Once upon a time, there was a factory. Inside, workers chewed all day. They chewed candy, chocolate, and lollipops. The factory was very successful. Everyone was happy and had lots of treats.
One day, a worker found something special. It was a giant gumball machine! Everyone was so excited. The worker chewed and chewed until the giant gumball came out. Inside was the most delicious flavor.
The workers wanted to share their delight. So, they went and shared the gum with everyone. Everyone chewed, laughed and was delighted.
The factory was so successful people came from all over the world to enjoy their delicious treats. The factory workers were happy and did lots of fun things. They were proud of their factory and all their chewy treats!



 Once upon a time, there were two mighty friends. Their names were Jack and Jill. Jack and Jill lived together, and they were always having lots of fun. One day, Jack had an important challenge for them to try. He wanted them to resist the strong wind.
Jack and Jill were mighty, so they took on the challenge. They stood with their feet planted firmly on the ground and resisted the wind. The wind blew and blew, but Jack and Jill wouldn't give up. Finally, after a long time, Jack and Jill won.
They both felt very proud that they had resisted the wind. They celebrated their win by dancing and singing together. They were very happy that they had been victorious against the mighty wind.




Once upon a time there was a hill. It was big and green, but it was also very dirty. Every day, a little girl went up the hill to play.
One day, she saw something amazing. In the middle of the hill were lots of pretty flowers blooming. They were all sorts of colors like yellow and pink. The little girl was so happy to see them.
She went to the hill every day after that to see the flowers bloom. Soon, the whole hill was filled with beautiful flowers. Everywhere she looked she saw them blooming and it made the hill look so pretty.
The flowers stayed there for many weeks until it got too cold for them. Then one day, the little girl went back up the hill and the flowers were gone. But she remembered how beautiful the hill had looked when the flowers were blooming.




Once upon a time there was a girl. She was very special, because she could create wonderful things. Every day she would make something new. Today she wanted to make a rag doll.
She looked around and found some rags that had holes in them. She was very careful because she didn't want the holes to get bigger. Then she cut out shapes and put them together.
The girl was so happy with what she made. It was a nice little rag doll. She held it close and gave it a name. "I will call you Raggie," she said.
The girl spent a lot of time with Raggie. She would take it for long walks and tell it stories. She was very careful about keeping it safe.
The girl and Raggie became good friends. Everywhere she went, Raggie was by her side. It was a special friendship she would never forget.



Max was feeling guilty. He had snuck some sausages from the kitchen and had been caught. His mum was very angry and he felt bad.
But Max loved sausages, so he decided to go get some more. He ran to the kitchen and grabbed a big handful. But then he heard his mum coming and was too scared to move. 
He had to decide what to do. He did not want to get into more trouble so he put the sausages back. He felt guilty but knew it was the right thing to do. 
Max ran out from the kitchen and his mum saw him. She came over and gave him a big hug. She said he had made the right decision and that made him feel happy. 
From then on, Max always asked his mum before taking food. He was glad he had decided to put the sausages back.



 Tiara was so excited to go to her birthday party. She loved birthdays - they were so fun! At the party, there were so many colorful decorations. Her favorite color was pink and she saw lots of pink balloons, streamers and cupcakes. 
Tiara couldn't believe that there was a cake with her name on it! It was pink and covered in sprinkles. It had colorful candles on top, which she was so excited to blow out. 
Then everyone sang "Happy Birthday" and Tiara blew out all the candles. She got to have a piece of the cake and it was so yummy and sweet. She ate it with a big smile on her face.
When it was time to go, Tiara was sad to leave. She told her friends she wanted to stay and eat cake forever! But it was time to go home. She said goodbye, hugged all her friends, and left the colorful party.




Once upon a time, there was a young boy who loved to gaze at the sky. He could see clouds of white with rays of sunshine coming from behind them. All of a sudden, he noticed a missile flying in the sky. He watched it with wide eyes as it moved across the sky. The missile flew so high, beyond the thick clouds.
The young boy couldn't take his eyes off of the missile and was soon joined by other excited children. They all held hands and enjoyed watching the missile. After a while, the missile disappeared into the distance. The children all said goodbye to it and smiled, happy to have seen something so special. 
The young boy was mesmerized by what he saw. He continued to gaze up at the sky imagining the missile in his mind's eye. He then thought to himself that, no matter how far away the missile went, he would never forget it.




Once there were two friends, Jack and Jill, who loved playing together. One day, they both became very excited when they found out they were twins! They were so alike, even their parents couldn't tell them apart.
The twins loved spending time together. They would often go on adventures in the park and play hide-and-seek. They were the best of friends.
One day, Jack and Jill were playing tag. They were running so fast they got tangled up and soon became one. They were so close, they were like one person!
The twins found it hard to move around together, so they decided to become tight friends. They always stayed close and looked out for each other. Now, whenever they go on an adventure, they know they will never be alone.



On a bright, sunny day, there was a chubby little goose who wanted to go on an adventure. She snapped her wings and off she flew! She flew over rivers, hills and trees, and had a wonderful time exploring the world.
Pretty soon, the little goose was getting tired. She snapped her wings and started flying back to her home. But when she got there, she was surprised to find a chubby little fox waiting for her. The fox sat still and smiled at her, and she was too tired to fly away. 
The fox asked if the goose wanted to be his friend. The goose nodded and the fox motioned for her to follow. He led her to the edge of a forest, and with a snap of his tail he opened a secret door that led under the ground.
The little goose was amazed and curious. She stepped inside and what she saw made her heart smile. Everywhere she looked it was filled with chubby little animals who welcomed her with open wings. They showed her around and told her stories, and before she knew it, the sun was setting and it was time to go home.
The little goose said goodbye to all her new animal friends, and with a snap of her wings she flew back home. Every day after that she would come back and visit her animal friends, and they would always have wonderful adventures together.




Once upon a time there was a big truck. It wanted to deliver some big boxes. But it had a problem, it was feeling very dizzy. It felt like it couldn't see straight. All of it's lights were spinning around and around.
Suddenly, a friendly eye appeared. The eye looked at the truck very carefully. It asked what was wrong. The truck told the eye about its dizziness.
The eye said that it knew just the thing. It said that it could help get the truck to its destination.
The eye went to work, spinning around with the truck. Gradually, the truck's dizziness went away.
Finally the truck was able to make its delivery. It beamed with pride. The eye was happy too, it had helped the truck and made a new friend.



Once there was a Dad and a little girl. The little girl wanted to help Dad so she looked to see what he was doing. He was using a hammer and trying to balance a board on a wall. He wanted the board to stay up so it was very important that he was careful and did a good job.
The little girl saw what Dad was doing and asked if she could help. Dad said yes and gave her the hammer. She tried to balance the board on the wall just like Dad showed her but it wasn't very easy. She tried again and again until finally she found the right way to balance it.
Dad smiled and said the little girl had done a very good job. She was so happy she had been able to help and it felt really good. From that day on she loves to help Dad with his projects using her hammer and finding the right balance.




The bookshelf was very big and very heavy. Dad wanted to know how heavy it was, so he asked Mom to help him weigh it. They got the kitchen scale and put the bookshelf on top of it. When they saw the numbers, they knew how heavy it was.
The bookshelf was too heavy for one person to lift. Dad said it was too weak and that it needed to be stronger. Mom and Dad took their tools and got to work. They strengthened the bookshelf and made it stronger. 
The next day, Dad weighed it again. This time, the bookshelf was much lighter. Dad said it was perfect now! Mom and Dad were very happy and they both gave the bookshelf a big hug.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lucy. She loved to explore and have fun adventures.
One day, Lucy found a crack in the ground. She was really curious and wanted to see what was inside. She squatted down and looked inside. Much to her delight, she saw something shiny!
Lucy reached inside and pulled out a flexible stick. She had no idea what it was for, but she wanted it for her own. She started to play with it like a toy.
Suddenly, a voice came from the sky. "Lucy, don't play with that! It's dangerous," the voice said. Lucy felt scared and dropped the stick.
The voice urged her to get away from the crack and take some steps back. Lucy did as she was told and stepped back away from the crack. 
She realised that the voice was right. This was an adventure, but not one she would go on again.




Molly was weak, but she always smiled. One day, she went to the store to find a special pillow. She wanted to be comfortable while she relaxed. When she got to the store, there were so many pillows to choose from! She picked one that was bright green, her favourite colour.
Molly was very happy as she walked home with her new pillow. It felt so soft and fluffy. She held it tight and smiled the whole way.
At home she put her pillow in her room and she was so excited to try it out. She lay down and hugged it. It was so comfy that she couldnt help but smile.
Molly was so pleased with her new pillow. It made her so happy! She realized that her pillow was the perfect cure for her when she felt weak. With a big smile on her face, Molly snuggled up to her pillow and fell fast asleep.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Jenny and she had a tire. She liked to bounce and roll it around the garden. One day, she rolled it too fast and it went away from her! She watched as it rolled further away until it stopped. Jenny was scared but she knew she had to get it back.
She chased after the tire but it was impossible for her to catch it. She looked around and found some help from a big animal. It was a horse! The horse was nice and it offered to help her.
The horse galloped after the tire and soon Jenny saw it stop. The tire was very fragile and the horse was careful not to break it. Jenny was relieved and thanked the horse. She grabbed the tire and the horse gave her a ride back home.
That night, Jenny hugged her tire and said thank you. She had learned an important lesson - never surrender when it comes to something you love.




Once there was a family of three - mom, dad and a little girl. They lived together very happily and spoke the same language.
One day, the mom and dad wanted the little girl to learn something new. So they decided to pass on a different language to her. They found a language teacher who was flexible and taught her in a way that she could understand.
The little girl was happy to learn something new and very soon, she began to speak the language with her teacher. She was so pleased with how quickly she was learning it and even tried to speak the new language with her mom and dad.
They were so proud of her! With her hard work and her teachers help, she was now able to speak two languages and was much more flexible to understand and learn new things. 
The family was very happy and thankful for the new language they were able to pass on to the little girl!



 
Yesterday, a lazy farmer named Bob had a lot of work to do. But he was too lazy to do it, so he just stayed in bed. Then he heard something. It was a loud bang! He looked outside and saw a beautiful deer running away. Bob had just seen a hunter shoot his gun at the deer. He quickly got dressed and went out to the field. He scolded the hunter for shooting animals and told him never to do it again. And from then on, Bob made sure he was never lazy, so he would always be ready to help animals when they needed it.




Once upon a time there was a little boy who was very brave. He wanted to find something exciting to do.
So he decided to explore the dangerous forest. He held a fork in one hand while he wandered through the trees. But then he heard a loud noise.
He saw a nasty creature with big teeth. It was a big scary wolf! It began to run towards the boy. He knew he had to run away.
The boy ran as fast as he could. Suddenly he stumbled and his fork fell on the ground. The wolf saw it and wanted to eat it. 
The little boy was scared but he grabbed the fork and he said, "No! this fork is mine!" The wolf growled. The little boy was brave and he used his fork to fight back. He kept waving it at the wolf and he shouted, "Go away! Go away!"
The wolf was scared and it ran away. The little boy had saved himself and the fork! He was very proud of himself. He had been brave and he had used the fork to protect himself!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had an adventure to go on. She paused to look up at the big chimney in the sky. It was so tall and organized. She paused again and decided this was the place for her!
She was brave enough to climb the chimney. When she got to the top, she realized there was a special surprise waiting for her. She saw a beautiful blue balloon and a twinkly star. She grabbed them and smiled with joy.
She paused to look around. The view at the top of the chimney was amazing. She could see the town she lived in and the river nearby. She was so happy. She climbed down and started back home with her precious gifts. 
The little girl was proud of herself for being brave enough to climb the chimney. Wherever she went, she would take her balloon and star. They would remind her to always be brave.




One day, two friends were walking through the forest. They stopped to discuss what they would do when they reached the clearing in the trees. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise and saw a giant. The giant was very hot and was breathing heavily.
The two friends stared at the giant for a moment, their eyes wide with disbelief. Then the tall creature spoke in a booming voice. "Do not be afraid", the giant said. "My name is Jake. I come from the sky. Let us talk and discuss".
The friends nodded and stepped closer to the giant. They talked and discussed what his life was like in the sky. Jake told them about the hot sun and the cold stars. He talked about the beautiful rainbows and the storms that made him feel scared. 
When the friends said goodbye to Jake, they knew they would always remember this day in the forest. It was a day they would never forget.




Once upon a time, there was a jar that was very rare. It was covered in colorful paint and sparkles. Everyone wanted it because it was so special.
One day, the jar decided it wanted to decorate. It made a plan to get some pretty things to decorate itself. So it hopped out the door and went on an adventure!
Along the way it picked up pretty leaves, glimmering gems and shimmering rocks. It put the colorful pieces all around the jar until it was completely covered. It looked so special, everyone wanted it even more!
When the jar was done decorating, it hopped back home. It loved how it shined and sparkled, it was so proud of itself. Everyone was so amazed by the jar and it was happy it found the perfect way to decorate.




Once upon a time there was an incredible girl. She had a very special camera. She loved to take pictures and when she looked at them, she felt so happy and excited.
One day, she decided to take her camera to the park. She saw lots of beautiful things - trees, flowers, birds and squirrels. She wanted to capture it all, so she included all sorts of amazing things in her photos.
When she finished taking pictures, she was very pleased. She had taken the most incredible photos! She was so proud that she wanted to show her camera to everyone.
But when she got home and looked at her photos, she was even more amazed. There was so much beauty in them - more than she ever could have imagined.
She was so excited about her photos that she decided to share them with her family and friends. They all thought the pictures were incredible!
The girl was so proud of her camera and all the wonderful photos she had taken. She realized that with her camera, she could capture anything and tell incredible stories with her pictures.




Once there was a boy named Jack. He was very impatient and wanted to eat right away. His mom gave him a big steak to eat. He was so excited and quickly tried to part it with his fork and knife. He was so impatient he kept stabbing at it. He was so excited that he made a mess with the steak. He ended up eating it with his hands. He ate it so fast that it almost disappeared. He smiled and asked for another steak. His mom said no and gave him a carrot instead. He was not too happy about that so he picked up his plate and ran away.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who liked to count. She counted everything, from the leaves on the trees to the stars in the sky. Today, her mommy made her some sour toast for breakfast. The little girl was clever, so she decided to count the pieces of toast. She counted one, two and three. After she ate the toast, her tummy felt so good!
Next, the little girl wanted to count something else. She thought and thought and finally she got an idea. She wanted to count the pets in her house. One by one, she counted her cats and her hamster. When she was finished counting, she hugged them all and had a happy smile on her face.
Finally it was time to go to bed. The little girl was tired, so she snuggled into her bed and started to count sheep. One, two, three...she was soon fast asleep.
The end.



Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sarah. She was a jolly 3 year old who loved to explore the world around her. 
One day, Sarah went for a walk in the park. Suddenly, she saw a beautiful spear lying on the ground. It had shiny silver blades and its handle was decorated with pretty jewels. She smiled and picked it up. 
But then a scary man jumped out from the bushes. He shouted at Sarah and she began to cry. He tried to snatch the spear from her. With all her strength, Sarah held onto it and she wouldn't let him take it away. 
The man yelled in anger and finally he gave up. He ran away and Sarah was now safe. She held the spear up to the sky and cheered. It felt good to be strong. 
Suddenly, a jolly old man appeared from behind a tree. He smiled at Sarah and asked her where she got the spear. She told him the story and he laughed. As a reward, he gave her an extra special spear with a rainbow handle and sparkly silver blades. 
Sarah was so happy. She thanked the old man and gave him a big hug. She clutched the two spears tight to her heart and ran home, tearing with joy.



 
Once upon a time, there was a laser. It was very very shiny and it glowed like a star. One day, a little boy saw it and said, "Wow!" He wanted to play with the laser so he waved his hands and the laser moved around. It was so much fun!
The boy played with the laser all day, moving it in the air and making it twinkle. After a while, he was so hungry that he stopped playing and looked around. Suddenly, he saw a tasty treat on the ground. It was a big cookie with a big smiley face. It looked yummy!
The boy got very excited and waved his hands for the laser to come to him. He put the laser on top of the cookie and bam! - the cookie was gone. Where did it go? It flew up in the air and was never seen again! 
The boy was very satisfied and said, "Yum! That was a tasty treat!"  He played with the laser some more and went home with a happy heart.




Once there was a girl named Lucy. She loved crayons! She had all different colors of crayons. One day, she found a very unusual crayon. It was a color she had never seen before. She opened up her crayon box and carefully placed the unusual crayon inside. 
She closed her crayon box and went outside to play. While she was playing, she saw a lot of different animals. She saw a bird, a squirrel and a rabbit too. The animals were so fun to watch!
After a while, she went back inside and opened up her crayon box again. There were so many colorful crayons inside! She smiled at how pretty they were, and she picked up the unusual crayon to color with. She was so excited to see what kind of pictures she could make with it! 
Lucy had fun coloring with her crayons. When she was done, she closed the crayon box and put it away. It was time for bed now! She was happy to have the unusual crayon in her box, and couldn't wait to use it again soon!




Molly the sheep was very messy. She had straw all over her wool and mud on her hooves. But Molly loved to make a mess. One day, she decided she wanted to go on an adventure. So, she parted from her home and set off on a journey.
Molly walked for a long time. She came across many interesting things and enjoyed looking at them all. Eventually, she reached a meadow full of wildflowers. She bounded through them, leaping high in the air, and getting even messier.
Further along her journey, Molly came across a big lake. She trotted straight into the water and started to splash around. As she played, the sun was setting in the sky. Molly was so happy that she decided to stay and watch the sunset.
Molly wished she could stay in the meadow forever, but she knew it was time to part. With a final skip and jump, she set off back home. And Molly was happier than ever before, because she'd had an amazing adventure.



Once upon a time, there was a little boat. The boat wanted to sail. So, it went to a stream. The stream started out small but it got bigger and bigger.
The boat sailed down the stream. It went over little bumps and around big rocks. It went past big trees and small stones. 
Soon, the boat reached a huge drain. The boat stopped in front of it. It was going to be a challenge, but the boat started to sail.
It sailed through the drain, through some tight turns and around some big bends. But it kept going and going. 
Finally, the boat made it through the drain and out to the other side. It could see the open ocean! The boat was ready to sail the great big sea.




One day, Susie was at the beach. She saw something that was very beautiful: pretty shells on the sand.
Then, Susie saw something else. It had tiny legs and eyes. She asked her mom what it was. Her mom said it was a shrimp.
Susie was very excited. She wanted to pick it up and take it home. Her mom said it was too small, so instead they went to the store and bought a bigger, nice one.
When they got home, Susie wanted to put the shrimp in her special aquarium. She put the shrimp in and said goodbye to the pretty shells she had found at the beach.
Susie was very happy. She got to replace the shells with a beautiful shrimp!




There was a little girl named Rachel who liked to be adventurous. She liked to swing on the swings in the park. One day, while she was swinging, she saw a sign. She was excited that she had found something new. She walked closer and read the sign, it said "adventure this way". Rachel thought this sounded fun so she followed the sign. 
Rachel was so curious about what the adventure was. She asked her mom, "What is the adventure? Where is it?" Her mom smiled, "Let's go find out". She took Rachel's hand and they followed the sign. 
The sign eventually led them to a big hill. There, Rachel saw some people swinging from vines. Rachel got so excited that she wanted to try it. She went and grabbed a vine, and with help from her mom, she started swinging back and forth. She was so happy and felt so adventurous.
 Rachel was so proud of herself. She had gone on an adventure and tried something new. She said goodbye to the other swingers and waved goodbye to the sign. She was glad she followed the sign because it turned out to be a fun and exciting adventure!




Once there was a family of three who lived together. Mom, Dad, and Baby. Mom and Dad disagreed about what to make for dinner. Dad wanted to make a steak, but Mom wanted to make a pan of macaroni and cheese. Baby wanted both! Mom and Dad disagreed and eventually Dad made the steak.
Mom went to check on Baby and found that he had taken a pan from the kitchen. Mom asked Baby what he was doing and he said he was making macaroni and cheese. Mom was a bit jealous that Baby wanted to make macaroni and cheese instead of steak.
So, Mom and Dad decided to work together to make both the steak and the macaroni and cheese. They all ate together and it was a delicious dinner. From then on, Mom, Dad and Baby agreed to disagree and make both meals whenever they had disagreements.




One day, a girl named Sarah decided to go for a jog in the park. Her mom and dad said she had to stay on the path. Sarah was excited to go for a jog, so she started running. With each step, she could feel her lungs working hard. She hadn't gone very far when she saw something strange. It looked like a person, but it was fake! It was made of plastic. Sarah was scared and turned around to go back. When she got back to the path, she started to slow down until she was back to her original jogging speed. Sarah thought it was funny that she had seen something so fake during her jog. She was glad that she hadn't gone too far off the path. From then on, she always stayed on the path when she went jogging.




Today Jenny and Joe were planning a port. They hopped on Joe's bike and started pedalling. The wind blew in their faces as they cycled down the bumpy road.
When they arrived at the port, they were met by a terrible sight. The sea was rough and the waves were crashing on the shore. Jenny and Joe were scared and started running back to their bike.
Suddenly, something caught their eye. In the distance, Jenny and Joe could see a big pirate ship. They decided to go and take a closer look. They stepped onto the gangplank, and ventured onto the ship.
Inside the ship, Jenny and Joe found a treasure chest filled with candy! They decided to take the candy with them and head back to the bike. As they cycled back home, both Jenny and Joe knew that their day of planning a port had been a great success!



Once upon a time, there was a white thief. He was sneaky and liked to take things. One day, he was walking in the dark, trying to be sneaky and sneaky, when all of a sudden something bright caught his eye. It was shining brightly in the night sky. It was a white star, shining brighter than any of the others. The thief was so taken by this star that he decided to take it. He climbed up to the sky and grabbed the star.
At first, the thief was very happy, as he had never seen anything so beautiful. But then, the star began to shine even brighter. It lit up all around him and the thief had become scared. He started to run away, but no matter how fast he ran, the light was always behind him.
The star was too powerful for the thief and the thief dropped it back into the night sky. The star continued to shine, brighter than ever before.
From then on, the white star shined in the night sky, reminding us all not to take what isn't ours. It reminds us to stay away from thieves, who can only cause trouble. The star continues to shine and make the night sky beautiful.




Lou was clumsy. He tripped over his own feet and fell onto his knee. He was sad and regretted not being more careful. His mom saw what happened and came to give him a hug. She told Lou it was okay and kissed his knee to make it better.
His mom gave him a hug and said he could try being careful again. Lou nodded and said he would try. He looked at his knee and saw that it was still sore. He looked at his mom again and she smiled at him.
Lou smiled back. He was glad that he had a mom to take care of him. Even though he had made a mistake, he knew his mom still loved him. He was determined to be more careful next time - to never regret tripping on his clumsy feet again.




Once there was a naughty girl named Rose. She never stopped giggling and running around the house. Every day the family would go for a stroll in the park, but Rose would always be in a naughty mood.
One day, something special arrived. It was an invitation for Rose's parents to a marriage. Rose was very excited and asked her parents what a marriage was. They told her that it was a special event where two people decided to live together in love.
The day of the marriage arrived, and Rose got ready to join her parents. They all dressed up nicely and everyone at the marriage was so happy. Rose couldn't stop laughing and clapping with joy. 
At the end of the day, Rose hugged her parents and told them this was the best day ever. She was so happy at the marriage, and promised that she would always be a good girl.



Once there was an adorable sailboat. It wanted to go the beach and have an adventure, so it set off one calm morning. But it quickly missed its home and its family.
So it decided to ask the wind to help it. The wind happily agreed and took the sailboat back to its house. 
The sailboat was so happy to see its family again, and it asked the wind to remind it if it ever felt homesick again. The wind said it would, and the sailboat felt much better.
The sailboat had a wonderful adventure, and when it returned home, its family was waiting for it. The sailboat was so pleased and knew it could always come home.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had a jar. It was a white jar. She was very happy with it.
One day, another girl saw the white jar. She wanted it very much. When the first girl said no, the other girl became very angry. She started to hate the first girl.
The angry girl then started to shout and she hit the white jar with her hand. She made a big hole in it. The first girl was very sad. Now she could not use her white jar anymore.
The two girls never spoke again. The first girl was sad and she really hated the other girl for destroying her white jar.




Once upon a time there was a fat lady. She was walking down the street one day when she saw something scary! It was a big bug. She screamed so loud! The bug was scared and ran away.
The fat lady was so relieved. She took a big breath and said "whew!". Then she laughed and kept walking.
But then she saw something else that made her scream! It was a big dog barking at her! She screamed so loud that the dog ran away. 
The fat lady was very happy. She felt safe again. She laughed and kept walking until she got home. 
The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived in a village. Everyone in the village would speak to her very kindly when she walked around. One day, she was feeling very tired. She yawned and rubbed her eyes.
The little girl found a quiet tree and she sat down beneath it. She closed her eyes and started dreaming. In her dream she was back in the village. She spoke to all the people she knew there and they replied back with words of kindness.
The little girl felt happy and her tiredness went away. Her dream lasted all night until morning came. As the sun rose in the sky, she woke up and happily returned to the village where she could speak to all the wonderful people who lived there.




John looked out of the window. He felt so hot inside. He didn't like spring. He HATED it! The air outside was so uncomfortable. He felt like he was melting!
John's mom looked at him sympathetically. She pointed outside. She was trying to show him something, but he couldn't see anything. He squinted harder and saw a few flowers in the garden.
John became excited and ran outside. He looked closely at the flowers. Suddenly, he felt the harsh wind on his skin. He didn't like it! The wind was too cold and it made him feel like he was freezing. He quickly ran back inside.
John looked out of the window again. He HATED spring. It was too hot, too cold and so uncomfortable. He wished it was summer soon.




Once there was a lucky little mouse. He was very small, like a brick. One day, he went outside to explore the world.
As he went, the mouse saw some ripe apples. He wanted to try them, but they were too high for him to reach. He thought and thought, until he had an idea.
The mouse squeezed his eyes and his fur together. He squeezed until he was as small as a brick. This made him small enough to squeeze through the grass and get to the apples.
He nibbled away at the juicy fruit. It was the best treat he had ever tasted.
After he finished, he squeezed back into his normal size. He felt so lucky that he had been able to find such a delicious snack. He scampered away, feeling very full and happy.




Once, there was a very brave girl. Her name was Anna. One day, Anna was walking in the dark woods and she suddenly saw a golden box. She opened it and found a magical Power inside. When Anna used the Power, she started to win every game she played. She was very grateful for her special Power. 
At night, Anna was afraid of the dark. But then she remembered her magical Power and felt brave again. She could use the Power to win any challenge and it made her feel safe. 
Whenever Anna faced something dark and scary, she knew she had the Power to win. She was so grateful to have this special Power and it made her even stronger. 
And, with her Power, Anna was able to conquer any fear and keep on winning!




One evening, Daisy looked outside her window and saw a big, bright moon. She was so excited that she skipped outside with her special polishing cloth. Daisy wanted to make the moon sparkle and shine so she used gentle strokes to polish the moon's surface. Every time Daisy moved her cloth, the moon twinkled even brighter in the sky. When Daisy was finished, the moon was glowing so brightly she had to use her hands to protect her eyes. Daisy smiled with joy and she decided to polish the moon every night.




Once upon a time, there was an adorable bunny. He hopped around all day, looking for things to do. One day, he was very brave and decided to venture away from his home.
As he hopped into the woods, he heard a loud noise. He thought it might be a hunter! He was very scared, so he stayed still and waited. But then he saw something he didn't expect - a little green frog!
The frog looked super cute and he wasn't scared at all. He hopped over to the frog and they said hello together. The bunny felt much better now that he knew there was nothing to scare him.
They decided to be friends and explore the woods together. As they were having fun, the hunter showed up! But the bunny and the frog were brave and stayed still. The hunter was so busy looking for something to catch that he didn't notice the adorable friends. The bunny and the frog were happy - they were safe from being scared!



Once upon a time there was a valley deep in the forest. In this valley, there lived a helpful bird. 
One day, the bird heard a noise coming from the sky. The noise was clapping! Wonder who it could be he thought. 
He flew up into the air and saw a little girl clapping in delight. The bird floated around the girl in silence, watching. The girl smiled up at the bird and started to clap even louder. 
The bird was so happy that he started to clap back. The girl was so delighted that both of them clapped together. 
As the sun began to set, the bird said goodbye and flew away. He was thankful that he had a chance to meet such a helpful friend.




Once upon a time, there was an unusual barrel. It was blue and green and it smelled funny. Two friends, named Jack and Jane, were bored and decided to pretend the barrel was a house. They pretended to be the mommy and daddy and their stuffed animals were the babies.
Jack and Jane pretended the barrel was a real house. They opened their pretend door and pretended to walk inside and  sit on pretend chairs. Jack and Jane also pretended they had yummy food to eat. They laughed and smiled as they pretended to eat dinner together.
Next, they pretended the barrel was a magic house. They grabbed their stuffed animals and pretended to fly around the room with them. They twirled and laughed until they were all very tired and had to take a nap.
Finally, they pretended the barrel was a boat on the ocean. They sailed around the room and sang songs. They laughed and splashed around until it was time to go home. Jack and Jane hugged each other and said goodbye, each one of them happy to have had such a fun and unusual pretend adventure.




Once there was a small family. They had a daughter, and one day they wanted to make something special for her. So they went to the shop and bought an oven.
When they brought the oven home, they were very careful with it because it was made of fragile material and it could break easily.
The daughter was so excited for her new oven. She loved to play with it and pretend to bake something. But one day she was careless and dropped it. The oven broke into pieces, and the family was very sad.
They all missed the oven very much and never bought a new one. They knew that no oven would ever be quite the same.




Once there was a little boy named Bob. Bob could not open the drawer in his bedroom. The drawer was so difficult to unlock! He tried again and again and still could not open it.
Bob was very frustrated and started to cry. Then his mom came into the room. She saw the drawer that was giving Bob so much difficulty. She smiled, and said, Dont worry Bob, I can help you unlock the drawer.
Bob's mom put her hand on the drawer and softly whispered, Unlock! Suddenly, the drawer opened! Bob was so happy and surprised. He opened the drawer and found lots of games and toys! He was so excited and thanked his mom for helping him unlock the drawer.
From then on, Bob was excited to play with the toys he found in the drawer. He could not believe that unlocking the drawer was so easy!




Once upon a time there was a nosy figure. He enjoyed looking around and being nosy. He often left his home to explore what was beyond.
One day he decided to leave on a new adventure. He packed his bag and left home with a big smile on his face.
He walked for a long time until he came across a strange house. He was curious and nosy so he peeked through the window. Inside he saw a big table and he was excited to explore!
He opened the door slowly and went inside. He was welcomed by a friendly voice from the kitchen. It was the voice of a woman who was baking something delicious.
The nosy figure asked the woman what she was baking. She said she was making a special cake for her daughters birthday. The figure was so happy that he thanked the woman for the invitation to join the celebration.
He stayed for a while, played with the other children and laughed. When it was time to go home, he thanked the woman again and left with a big smile on his face. He had had a wonderful time!




Once upon a time there was a man. He was strong and kind. Every morning he would go to the store, buy some food and bring it back to his house.
One day, he brought home some yummy purple fruit. He cut up the fruit and put it in a bowl. He used a spoon to put some of the pieces in his mouth and said, "Yum!"
The man smiled and asked his little daughter if she wanted some of the yummy fruit. She smiled and said yes. He used a spoon to give her a piece, and she smiled and said, "Yum!"
The man and his daughter enjoyed the yummy purple fruit together. It was so delicious! They both smiled and said, "Yum!" at the same time.




Once upon a time, there was a small rhinoceros. He lived in the forest and was very lucky. One day he wanted to explore, so he started walking through the trees.
Suddenly, he felt something strange in the air. He looked around, but he could not see anything. He started to tremble. He was so scared! He knew he had to be brave, so he decided to keep walking.
He slowly walked through the woods until he finally reached a clearing. In the clearing was a big hole in the ground. The small rhinoceros started to tremble even more. He was so scared! He slowly inched closer to the edge of the hole. Then he saw something inside the hole.
It was a lucky four-leaf clover! The small rhinoceros felt so happy. He was no longer scared. He knew that it was a sign that he was very lucky! He carefully picked up the clover and took it with him back to his home in the forest. He knew that from that day on he would always feel lucky.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very hungry and she went looking for food. She walked and walked, but she couldnt find anything to eat. She was sad and started to frown.
Then, she heard a noise. She looked up and saw a bird sitting on a tree branch sticking out from a tall neck of the tree. The bird was singing and hopping from tree to tree.
The little girl was so excited. She knew the bird had a nest filled with food. She reached up to get it, but it was too high. She frowned again.
But then, the bird flew down and landed on the little girls neck. She was so surprised, she almost forgot about being hungry.
The bird looked at her with its tiny beady eyes and sang. The little girl smiled and told the bird thank you. She ate the food the bird brought and felt happy and full.




Once upon a time there was a fake flower. It felt so real that when you touched it, it seemed like a real flower. Everyone wanted to have a fake flower just like it.
But one day, it vanished. No one knew where it went. Everyone was so sad that the flower was gone.
The next day, something strange happened. The flower reappeared, as if by magic. Everyone was so happy that it was back!
The fake flower seemed to pull a trick and no one knew how it happened. They all touched the flower again, just to make sure it was real. It was still fake, but it still felt real to them.
Everyone was happy that the fake flower was there, whatever the mysterious trick was. They all kept the flower safe, and it stayed with them for a long, long time.




Once there was a little girl who couldn't manage to keep her room clean. She had lots of toys, and it was always a mess. But no matter how hard she tried, she couldn't seem to make it look neat.
One day, her mom came into the room. She was surprised at how dirty it was. The little girl was embarrassed and started to cry.
But her mom was very kind. She helped the little girl gather all her toys and put them in the toy box. When it was all done, the room was much cleaner.
The little girl was so happy! Now she knew how to manage her room and make it stay neat. She promised her mom she would keep it that way. And that's what she did.




Once there was a nice bottle. His name was Fancy. He lived on top of the mountain. Every day he waved to the birds who flew by.
One day a little boy found Fancy. His name was Jack. He took him home. Jack showed him to his mommy and daddy. They said he was a fancy bottle.
Jack liked to take Fancy everywhere. He put him in his pocket and took him to the park. He showed him to the ducks swimming in the pond. 
They had so much fun together. They explored the park, played games, and even ate ice-cream. 
Jack kept Fancy safe and they stayed friends forever.



The Little Prince lived in a kingdom far away. He had a purple cape that was very attractive. One day, he was feeling quite bold and decided he was going to make a demand of the King. He gathered his courage and marched right up to the throne. The King was very surprised to see a small boy in the palace, but he welcomed him in. 
The Little Prince said, "I want a purple pony!" The King said he had never heard such an outrageous demand before and he couldn't believe such a little prince could be so daring. But the Prince stood his ground and would not back down. So, the King gave in and granted him his wish. 
The Little Prince was overjoyed and thanked the King for his kindness. He ran out of the palace with a smile on his face, eager to jump on the back of his new purple pony!




Once upon a time there was a brave boy named Will. One day Will went to the park with his mommy. While they were walking Will saw a kitty in a tree. Will knew the kitty needed help, so he asked his mommy if he could rescue the kitty.
His mommy nodded yes and Will started to climb the tree. It was an easy climb and soon Will was close enough to the kitty to scoop her up. He carefully grabbed the kitty and climbed down the tree.
Will's mommy smiled when he reached the bottom. Will smiled too, proud of the rescue. He showed the kitty to his mommy and they took the kitty home.
The kitty was so happy and thankful to Will for the rescue. Will was happy too, knowing he saved the kitty. He often thought of that rescue and he never forgot how proud it made him feel.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl who wanted a piece of chalk. She went outside and saw a white rock on the ground. It looked sweet and she wanted it. She picked it up and brought it home. 
She was very happy because it was a piece of chalk! She got out some paper and drew a beautiful picture with it. The colors were bright and cheerful.
When she was done, she wanted to share it with her mom. She ran inside and showed her the pretty picture. Her mom was so happy with it and smiled at the little girl. 
The little girl was very proud of her picture and thanked her mom for the chalk. It had been a very sweet day!



Once upon a time, there was a rabbit. He was hopping around in a big field and all the other animals were watching him. Suddenly, he stopped and looked up into the sky. He saw something so far, far away!
He knew he wanted to go there and see what it was. So he started to dive deep into the sky. He went higher and higher, ever so quickly. Finally, he could see it - a big, beautiful rainbow! He was so happy to be there.
But all of a sudden, it started to rain! He needed shelter right away or he would get wet. The rabbit was so scared, he didn't know what to do.
He looked around and saw a deep dark hole nearby. He decided it was the perfect place to hide. So he dove deep inside the hole, away from the rain. He stayed inside the hole until the rain stopped, then went out to explore.
The rabbit was so excited to have gone on such an adventure! He was glad he had been brave enough to dive deep and find the rainbow.




Once there was a town by the sea. The sea was very calm, but one day there was a huge flood. Everyone was scared and ran for their lives. But there was one little girl who had been at the beach that day and she wasn't scared. She insisted on staying put.
The little girl was very competitive and she didn't want to be scared like the others. She wanted to face the flood and prove to herself that she could. So when the water started to rise around her, she stayed put, insisting on staying right where she was.
The water kept getting higher and higher until her feet were nearly in it. She didn't dare move, but she was a little scared. The flood was so powerful that it was beginning to wash away the sand beneath her feet.
But the little girl wouldn't move. She kept insisting that she would stand her ground and not be scared. Suddenly, the waves stopped and the water began to go down. The girl had won - she had stayed and faced the flood. She had been brave and competitive enough to beat the water. She was brave and big and strong, and she was beaming with pride.




Once upon a time, there was a girl named Susie. She had a very special bag. Inside the bag were three special pins. She wanted to add a fourth pin to her bag. 
Every day, she looked for a special pin to add to her collection. Everywhere she looked was very boring. She looked in her room, the kitchen, and even the park, but she couldn't find a special pin. 
Then one day, while Susie was walking near the beach, she noticed something shiny in the sand. She picked up the shiny object. It was a very special pin! She was so happy. She added the pin to her bag with the other three. Now she had a total of four special pins. 
Susie was very proud of her pins and she never stopped looking for more. She found lots of shiny pins, but none of them were as special as the one she had found near the beach.




Once upon a time, there was a clumsy little butterfly. She bounced from flower to flower all day. One day, she saw a little girl. They played tag together, and the butterfly bounced so fast it was hard to catch her! 
The little girl giggled as the butterfly zig-zagged and bounced around her. The butterfly felt so happy with her new friend, she decided to stay in the garden to play every day. 
The days were filled with bouncing, chasing and giggles. The butterfly kept getting clumsier and clumsier, especially when she tried to do flips and tricks! But the little girl thought it was all so funny. 
The little girl wanted to keep the butterfly forever, so they named her. "Butterfly!" they cried out together! It was a very happy time in the garden. 
And the butterfly and little girl lived happily ever after, bouncing around the garden and having lots of fun!



 
Once upon a time, there was a gray fox. He was hunting for food but he was very hungry and couldn't find anything. Then he saw steam coming out of a hole in the ground. He peered inside the hole, and there were big, round mushrooms. The fox was so excited! He quickly grabbed some of the mushrooms and put them in his sack. 
Then, he heard a loud noise. He was scared and knew he had to hide. But he didn't know where to go! He saw a bush nearby, so he ran and hid behind it. He was safe! While he was hiding, the fox watched the steam coming out of the hole. It was very cozy there and he felt safe. 
Eventually, the noise stopped. The fox cautiously peeked out from behind the bush and saw it was safe. He grabbed the mushrooms, said thank you to the hole, and ran off. He found a nice place to enjoy his meal, and he was very happy. 
The End




Once there were two friends, Tom and Jack. Tom noticed something and he said, "Jack, look at that line over there. It looks so organized and straight". Jack nodded. "Let's go and pinch it with our fingers", Tom said.
So the two friends went over to the line. Tom and Jack each took one side and started to pinch the line. It was so much fun! They laughed and pinch the line for a long time until it wasn't so organized anymore.
Finally, Tom said, "That was a great idea Jack. Now let's find another line to pinch". So they went off to find another line. They had lots of fun and pinched many lines that day.



Once upon a time, there was a sleepy little rubber duck. He dreamed of the day he could fly away, far above the clouds, and explore the world.
But he couldn't fly quite yet. He needed to spruce up a bit and make himself more presentable. So every morning, he would take his rubbers and polish until his feathers shone bright yellow.
It often took a long time for the rubber duck to polish all his feathers, but it was well worth it. With a sparkle on his wings, he flew higher and higher towards the clouds.
At the end of each day, he looked down upon the world, content with all the places he's been and all the things he's seen. He knew that his polishing had payed off. Sleepy or not, the rubber duck was ready to explore!




Once there was a little girl named Amy who was very bored. She wanted something interesting to do. So she decided to go for a walk and explore. As she walked, she heard a loud rumbling sound. She looked up to see a tornado coming her way. She quickly hid behind a bush.
While she was hiding, Amy noticed a bright rainbow in the sky. She watched in awe as the tornado passed. When it was gone, Amy ran back home to tell her family what she had seen.
Amy was so excited to share her story of the tornado. But then she realized that it wasn't as interesting as she thought it would be. It was boring. Amy wasn't scared anymore. In fact, she was looking forward to seeing more tornadoes!



Once upon a time there was a boy named Jack. He was only three years old and he wanted to explore the world. He had a special chamber that he could trust and keep all of his treasures safe. One day he decided to explore his back yard. He was amazed at how charming the trees and the birds were.
As he wandered about he found a magic doorway leading deep into the earth. He wondered what it would be like to explore this magical chamber. So he grabbed his trusty flashlight and started his adventure.
Jack made it to the chamber and he was so excited. Inside he found a charming mouse who gave him a friendly smile. He wanted to stay and explore longer but he had to get back home soon.
Jack knew he could trust the chamber and he thanked the mouse before heading back home. From then on, he visited the chamber every chance he got, and he learned lots of amazing things. Jack will always remember the charming chamber and how much he trusted it.




Once upon a time, there were two friends living in a forest. One day, they wanted to pick some fruit for breakfast. They started to quarrel about which kind to pick.
"I want to pick the big, juicy red berries," said the one.
"No, I want to get the small, green apples," the other exclaimed.
They argued and argued, until eventually they both said, "Let's just get both kinds of fruit!"
So, the two friends picked a big, juicy red berry for one friend and a small, green apple for the other. They were so happy to finally agree on something.
They ate the fruit together and had a great breakfast. Since then, they always agreed to share and picked different kinds of fruit. 
The End.




One day, Lily and Jack went to the park to play. As they were walking, they suddenly discovered something strange! It was a language they had never heard before. They decided to explore and find out what it meant.
They followed the strange sounds to a big tree and saw some birds talking to each other. They were chirping and singing in a new way! Lily and Jack were so excited about their discovery.
As they listened, they realized the birds were talking about something bitter. Lily tried to make the same sounds, but couldn't quite get it right. She kept trying, but couldn't make any of the same words the birds were saying.
Jack had an idea. He got a notebook and started to write down the different sounds they were making. After a while, they figured out the birds were talking about a bitter fruit they found in the park!
Lily and Jack were so proud of their discovery. They had learned a new language! From then on, they kept exploring the park and learning different words from the birds.




Once there was an ant who was very modest. He never took more than he needed, so all his friends liked him. 
One day, he had to carry a fork to the top of a hill. But he was so tiny, he couldn't carry it by himself. So he asked his friends for help. 
But his friends were too busy doing their own thing, so the ant had to carry the fork all by himself. He suffered along the way, and it took him a long time to make it to the top. 
When he got there, he was exhausted. But he was so proud of himself for making it to the top. He felt happy that he had done it all by himself.




One day, a restless thing went outside. It ran and ran and ran, until it reached a big tree. It looked up and saw the branches wiggling around in the wind. But it wasn't ready to go home yet, so it kept going. 
It ran until it came across a small lake. It looked at the shining water and it wanted to go in, so it did! It splashed around for a long time and had lots of fun. 
Then, the thing got tired, so it decided it was time to go home. It hopped out of the lake and picked up a special shiny stone on the way back. When it got home, it showed the stone to its family and everyone was happy. 
The thing was relieved to be home, and it was very happy with its shiny stone. It had had a great day of being restless and exploring.




Once upon a time, there was a chubby girl. She loved going to the park and meeting new friends. One day, she went to the park and saw a strawberry bush. She was so excited!
She went closer and saw that there were strawberies growing all over the bush. With a smile on her face, she picked a few of the sweet, juicy strawberries and started eating them right away. Yum!
Suddenly, there was a funny noise behind her. When she looked back, she saw her new friends, a puppy and a kitty, laughing at her! They thought it was funny to see her eating the strawberries.
The girl laughed too. She thought it was funny and shared some of the strawberries with her new friends. Then, they all played and laughed together in the park for the rest of the day.




Once upon a time, there was a popular boy called Jack. He was always exploring and looking for exciting things. 
One day, he went to the park and he saw something he had never seen before. It was a spear. He looked at it carefully. It was very shiny and long. 
Jack decided he wanted to try it out, so he picked it up and tried to throw it. But it was too heavy and it only moved a little bit. He tried again and again, but he couldn't get it to go far. 
He was about to give up, when he saw some older kids playing. They were throwing the spear very far! Jack looked at them carefully and he noticed that they were using the bigger end of the spear! 
So Jack tried it too and it worked! He could throw the spear much further and it made him very happy. Now he could play with the older kids. 
The end.



Once upon a time there was a tall parrot. He lived in the jungle with all the other animals. Every day he would sing and call out to the other animals. One day a little boy heard the parrot's call. He went to the jungle to find the tall parrot. When the boy found the parrot, he was very excited. The little boy asked the parrot if he could take him home with him. The parrot said yes and they became the best of friends. The little boy's parents were very happy to see the tall parrot. From then on the little boy and the parrot were always together.




Once upon a time there was a boy. He was 3 years old. His name was Tommy. Tommy was troubled. He had a toy gun. It was his favorite toy. 
One night Tommy was playing with his gun. He wanted to keep it safe. So he decided to put it in a box. 
But Tommy accidentally left the box outside in the rain. The next morning, Tommy realized the gun was wet. He started crying and his mommy came over to help. 
Mommy used an old towel to dry the gun. She shined it and cleaned it up until it was just like new. Tommy was very happy and his troubles went away. 
And they all lived happily ever after.



 
Once there was a bee who loved to fly. Every day, he included flying in his day. But then one day, he picked up something heavy while he flew. The bee flew with it as fast as he could, but it was too heavy!
The bee dropped the heavy thing to the ground. He bounced and rolled until it stopped at the feet of a young girl, who was out playing. 
She picked up the heavy thing and smiled. Inside the heavy thing was something special  a new ball for the girl to play with! She thanked the bee for including it for her and ran off to play.
The bee smiled and flew away, happy he was able to help the girl. From then on, he always included helping others in his day.



Once upon a time, there was a ranch. On the ranch there was one cow, one horse and one goat. They were all very hungry!
The cow said to the horse and the goat, "Let's get married!" The horse and the goat thought it was a great idea. 
So the cow, the horse, and the goat got married. The other animals on the ranch watched and cheered.
After their wedding, everyone was filled with joy. All the animals on the ranch were happy except for one thing they were still very hungry. 
But then one day there was a big surprise! A farmer drove up to the ranch with a big truck full of food. Everyone was so happy - they could eat all they wanted!
The three animals that got married - the cow, the horse and the goat - were very thankful. They lived on the ranch and were never hungry again!



Once upon a time there were two soldiers. They were very big and strong. Every day they would study how to be brave and fight bad people. One day they saw a huge army on the horizon. The two soldiers held their breath. But instead of fighting, the huge army ran away! The two soldiers had won and were very proud. They studied hard and they were now heroes!




Once there was a Mommy and a baby. The baby loved to slide. He had a slide in his backyard and he loved to slide down it. Mommy had something else she wanted the baby to slide on too - a stove! The stove wasn't in the backyard, but it was in the kitchen. It had four legs and a flat top. Mommy showed baby how to slide on it. He tried it and found it was really fun to slide on the stove!
He slid fast across the stove, back and forth and round and round. Mommy was so pleased to see baby having such a fun time. Baby loved to slide on the stove and did it every day. It was his favorite activity ever!




Once upon a time there was a car, and the car was broken! The car's owner went to find a mechanic. When the mechanic arrived, it was unusual - he was very small!
The mechanic explained what was wrong with the car; he said it needed a new part. He said the part was hard to find, but he was confident he could get it. 
The mechanic went away and worked hard to find the part. When he returned, he fixed the car with the special part. The car was happy and ran perfectly again!
The mechanic was very pleased with himself. He explained to the car's owner how he had fixed the car. The car's owner thanked the mechanic, and they all went home. The end.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lola. She loved to collect things. Every week she went on a new adventure to find something special. 
One sunny day, Lola went to a special place called the 'big wardrobe'. Lola knew that old wardrobes were like treasure chests, full of fun and interesting things. She was so excited as she opened the tall wardrobe. Inside, she saw something shiny and twinkly - a long, colourful scarf!
Lola had found an extra special treasure that day. She carefully put it in her backpack and ran home to show mum. 
Mum was so impressed with Lola's collection. She found a special place to display the scarf - on the wall above Lola's bed. That way, Lola could admire her find every day.
The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very happy and loved to dress up in colorful clothes. One day, she decided to go on an adventure.
She put on her colorful dress and went outside. She walked for a long time until finally, she reached a magical oasis. She was filled with joy! The oasis was full of colorful plants and colorful birds. She had never seen such beauty before!
The little girl was happy and danced around the oasis. She found a shallow pool with rainbow fish swimming in it. She stayed there to play, having the time of her life in her colorful dress. 
In the end, she said goodbye to the oasis and made a promise to come back soon. With a smile on her face and her colorful dress waving in the wind, she returned home.




Once upon a time, there lived a wealthy man. He had lots of fancy things, such as a big house with lots of toys. One day, he saw a jet in the sky. He was so excited that he wanted to show it to his family and friends.
He took all of his family and friends outside and pointed to the jet. He said, "Look at that! That's a jet!" Everyone was amazed and wanted to know what it was. So the wealthy man explained it to them.
He said, "A jet is a type of airplane. It's very fast, so it can take us to lots of exciting places. Would you like to go on a ride?"
Everyone cheered in excitement and the wealthy man took them all for a ride in the jet. They had the best time flying around and seeing all of the sights. From then on, the wealthy man took his family and friends for rides in the jet whenever he could.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Martha. Martha loved playing outside, with her tree and her friends. One day, she heard someone scream. She went to see who it was and saw it was her mum. 
Mum was really upset and told Martha there was bad news. Martha was so scared but her mum hugged her, cuddled her and said everything would be all right. 
Martha asked what was wrong and her mum said it was OK and that Martha didn't need to worry. All she needed to do was go to bed and get some sleepy. 
So Martha did as her mum said, ran upstairs, got into bed and went off to sleep. Her mum tiptoed in a few hours later and gave her a gentle kiss. When Martha woke up, the news was gone and everything was all right again.




Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She wanted to watch a movie but there was no TV in her house. But then her mommy said, "Let's go to the movies!"
