One day, Timmy's mom forgot to supply him with sunscreen before they went to the park. Timmy didn't want to stop playing to put on sunscreen, so he kept playing in the sun. 
Unfortunately, Timmy got a bad sunburn and had to go to the hospital. He was very sad and in a lot of pain. Timmy learned that it's important to always wear sunscreen and to listen to his parents when they supply him with things to keep him safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, as they were walking in the park, Lily saw a stick on the ground. She picked it up and started to play with it.
Suddenly, a dog appeared out of nowhere. Lily was scared because she had never seen this dog before. The dog barked loudly and ran towards her. Lily was so scared that she didn't know what to do. But then, the dog stopped and wagged its tail. Lily realized that the dog just wanted to play.
Lily threw the stick for the dog to fetch. The dog ran after it and brought it back to her. Lily was so happy that she wanted to give the dog a big hug. But the dog didn't like hugs and instead, it bit her hand. Lily was embarrassed because all her friends saw what happened. From that day on, Lily learned to be careful when playing with dogs.



Once upon a time, there was a big gorilla who lived in a jungle. He was very obedient and always listened to his mommy gorilla. One day, he was feeling very thirsty and went to the river to drink some water. But the river was too far away and he was tired. Just then, a kind monkey came by and offered to bring him some water. The gorilla was very happy and said thank you to the monkey. From that day on, the gorilla and the monkey became good friends and played together in the jungle. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, she saw a rag on the ground. It was dirty and torn. Lily wanted to throw it away, but her mom told her to pick it up and bring it inside. 
Lily didn't want to touch the rag because it was yucky, but her mom said that it was important to help clean up. So, she came back outside with a pair of gloves on and picked up the rag. 
When she brought the rag inside, her mom washed it and it became clean again. Lily learned that even though something may seem dirty or useless, it can still be useful if you take care of it. She felt happy that she helped her mom and learned something new.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toy cars and make them zoom around the room. One day, Timmy's mom took him to a big building called a museum. Timmy saw lots of cool things like big bones and shiny rocks. He liked the museum a lot.
But then, Timmy saw a man who couldn't hear anything. His mom told him the man was deaf, which meant he couldn't hear. Timmy felt sad for the man and wanted to help him. So, Timmy took out one of his toy cars and made it zoom around in front of the man. The man smiled and clapped his hands.
From that day on, Timmy always brought a toy car with him whenever he went to the museum. He liked to make them zoom around for the deaf man and make him smile. And Timmy learned that even though someone couldn't hear, they could still have fun and be happy.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a tooth that was wiggly and ready to come out. One day, she was playing with her friend, Timmy, when he accidentally knocked her tooth out. Lily started to cry because it hurt.
Timmy said, "I'm sorry, Lily. Please forgive me."
Lily calmed down a little and said, "It's okay, Timmy. I forgive you."
But later that night, Lily's tooth started to hurt even more. Her parents took her to the dentist, but it was too late. The dentist said they couldn't save the tooth and it had to be taken out.
Lily was very sad and upset. She wished she could go back in time and not play with Timmy that day. But she knew that she had already forgiven him and it wasn't his fault.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her garden and look at the pretty flowers. One day, she saw a big yellow butterfly fluttering around. It was so pretty that she followed it around the garden. 
As she followed the butterfly, she saw a little bird sitting on a branch. The bird was singing a peaceful song. Lily stopped to listen to the bird's song and felt very calm. She realized that even though the butterfly was beautiful, the peaceful song of the bird made her feel even happier. 
From that day on, Lily loved to look at the flowers and listen to the birds in her garden. She found that it brought her a lot of peace and happiness. And every time she saw a yellow butterfly, she remembered the peaceful feeling she had when she listened to the little bird's song.



Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. She saw a big, red slide and asked her mommy if she could ride it. Her mommy said yes and helped Lily climb up the ladder to the top of the slide.
Lily was so excited to ride down the slide, but then she saw a boy at the bottom who looked embarrassed. She asked him a question, "Are you okay?" The boy said he was fine, but Lily could tell he was embarrassed because his face turned red.
Lily rode down the slide and when she got to the bottom, she saw why the boy was embarrassed. He had accidentally dropped his ice cream cone and it had landed on his shirt. Lily felt bad for him and offered to share her own ice cream with him. The boy was happy and they became friends. From that day on, Lily always made sure to ask people if they were okay and to share her treats with them.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was sick and had to go to the hospital. There, she met a nice nurse who gave her medicine and made her feel better. Lily liked the nurse because she was kind.
One day, Lily was feeling better and wanted to play. She saw other kids playing and wanted to join in, but she couldn't run and jump like them. This made her frustrated. But then, she saw the other kids clapping and decided to join in. She clapped her hands and felt happy.
The nurse saw Lily clapping and smiled. She was happy to see Lily feeling better and having fun. From then on, Lily would often clap with the other kids and the nurse would join in too. They all became good friends and had fun together.



Once upon a time, there was a man who loved to climb. He climbed high up on the mountains and looked at the number of trees and birds below. He felt happy when he was up high. One day, he saw a little girl who was lost. The man climbed down and helped her find her way home. The little girl was happy and hugged the man. From that day on, the man climbed not just for himself, but to help others too.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a green dress and loved to play outside. One day, she went to the park and saw a man with a whistle. He blew the whistle and it made a loud noise. Lily was scared at first, but then she saw that the man was a coach for a soccer team.
The coach gave Lily a ticket to watch the game. She was so excited and ran home to tell her mom. "Mommy, mommy! I got a ticket to see the soccer game!" Lily said. Her mom was happy for her and they went to the game together. They cheered for the green team and had a lot of fun.
After the game, Lily went up to the coach and said, "Thank you for the ticket. I had so much fun watching the game and hearing your whistle." The coach smiled and said, "You're welcome, Lily. I'm glad you enjoyed it." From that day on, Lily loved soccer and always remembered the day she got a ticket to see her first game.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to festivals with her family. One day, Lily and her family went to a festival in the park. They ate yummy food and played games.
Suddenly, Lily saw a surprise! A big, fluffy bunny was hopping around the festival. Lily was so happy and ran to pet the bunny. But when she got back to her family, she found out her little brother had fallen in the filthy mud. 
Lily's mommy cleaned up her brother and they continued to have fun at the festival. They watched a parade and danced to the music. At the end of the day, Lily was tired but very happy because she had a lot of fun and saw a surprise bunny.



One sunny day, a little girl named Lily went to the park to play. She saw a pretty butterfly and tried to catch it, but it flew away. Lily felt sad and said, "Butterfly, please come back."
Suddenly, a boy named Max came over and said, "Hi Lily, do you want to play with me?"
Lily smiled and said, "Yes, please!" They played on the swings and slides. After a while, Max gave Lily a piece of gum to chew. Lily accidentally swallowed it and said, "Oops, I'm sorry."
Max laughed and said, "It's okay, Lily. Let's go get some ice cream instead." They walked to the ice cream truck and saw the butterfly again. Lily said, "Look Max, the butterfly came back!" Max smiled and said, "Wow, that's amazing!" They enjoyed their ice cream and watched the butterfly fly away.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, Timmy's mom suggested that they go on a walk in the park. Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, please!"
As they walked, Timmy saw a big black dog. He got scared and hid behind his mom. His mom told him not to be afraid and said that the dog was friendly. Timmy peeked out from behind his mom and saw that the dog was wagging its tail. He smiled and said, "Doggy, you're nice!"
They continued their walk and saw a group of children playing. Timmy wanted to play with them, but he was shy. His mom suggested that he go say hello. Timmy took a deep breath and walked over to the children. They welcomed him with open arms and Timmy couldn't stop smiling. He had so much fun playing with his new friends.
At the end of the day, Timmy was tired but happy. He hugged his mom and said, "Thank you for suggesting we go on a walk. I had so much fun and made new friends!" His mom smiled and said, "I'm glad you had a good time, Timmy."



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had long hair and his mommy said it was time for a haircut. Timmy didn't want a haircut because he thought it would look silly.
One day, Timmy and his friend Billy were playing outside. They decided to race each other to the big tree at the end of the street. Timmy was running so fast that his hair was flying everywhere. Billy laughed and said, "You need a haircut, Timmy!"
Timmy got mad and said, "No, I don't want a silly haircut!" He ran home crying and his mommy tried to comfort him. But Timmy was still sad and refused to get a haircut. 
Sadly, Timmy's hair got so long that he tripped over it while running and hurt himself badly. His mommy took him to the hospital and the doctors couldn't fix his broken leg. Timmy learned that sometimes it's better to listen to grown-ups and get a silly haircut than to get hurt.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to walk with her cane because it helped her balance. One day, she went to the park with her mommy and saw a pretty balloon. She wanted to hold it, but it kept floating away. 
Her mommy had an idea and gave her a string to attach to the balloon. Lily was so happy because now she could hold the balloon without it flying away. They played at the park for a while and then decided to have a snack. 
Lily's mommy gave her some chips that were really spicy. Lily didn't like them very much, but she still ate them because she didn't want to waste food. After they finished their snack, they walked home together, holding hands and enjoying the sunshine.



Once upon a time, there was a good boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy and his friends were playing when they found a gun on the ground. Timmy knew that guns were dangerous and could hurt people. 
Timmy said to his friends, "We need to prevent anyone from getting hurt by this gun. Let's tell an adult." 
They found Timmy's mom and told her about the gun. She called the police and they came to take the gun away. Timmy felt proud that he helped prevent someone from getting hurt. 
Timmy's mom said, "You did a good thing, Timmy. It's important to always tell an adult if you find something dangerous like a gun." Timmy smiled and knew he did the right thing.



Once upon a time, there was a long and tall lumber tree in the forest. One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk in the forest and saw the lumber tree. She said, "Wow, that's a big tree!" 
Suddenly, a squirrel appeared and said to Lily, "Watch out, that tree can slap you with its branches!" Lily was scared and asked the squirrel, "Why would the tree do that?" 
The squirrel replied, "Sometimes trees get angry and they use their branches to protect themselves." Lily nodded and said, "Okay, I will be careful." Then she continued her walk through the forest, admiring the trees and animals she saw along the way.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and eat candy. One day, her mommy asked her to clean up her toys before she could have any candy. Lily didn't want to clean up, but she understood that it was important to follow her mommy's order.
As she was cleaning up, she noticed that her little brother was struggling to put away his toys. Lily thought it was only fair to help her brother, so she did. Her mommy was so proud of her for being kind and understanding.
From that day on, Lily always made sure to help others when they needed it. She learned that being fair and understanding can make the world a better place.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and ride her bike. One day, she was riding her bike on the sidewalk when she saw her friend Emma.
"Hi Emma!" Lily said.
"Hi Lily!" Emma said.
They rode their bikes together and laughed as they pedaled. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. It was the traffic on the street.
"Wow, that's loud!" Lily said.
"I know, it's so busy today," Emma said.
They decided to ride their bikes away from the traffic and onto a quiet street. But Lily's bike was being stubborn and wouldn't go.
"Come on, bike! Don't be stubborn!" Lily said.
Emma helped Lily fix her bike and they rode away, still laughing and having fun.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a large teddy bear that he loved to play with every day. One day, Timmy lost his teddy bear and he started to worry. He looked everywhere, but he couldn't find his teddy bear. 
Timmy's mom noticed that he was in trouble and asked him what was wrong. Timmy told his mom that he couldn't find his teddy bear and he was worried. His mom told him not to worry and that they would find his teddy bear together. 
They searched the entire house and finally found the teddy bear under Timmy's bed. Timmy was so happy to have his teddy bear back and he hugged it tightly. His mom told him that it's okay to worry sometimes, but it's important to ask for help when we are in trouble. 
Timmy and his mom had a big hug and Timmy went to bed with his teddy bear, feeling safe and happy.



Once upon a time, there was a family of ducks. Mama duck, Papa duck, and their little ducklings lived in a pond. They loved to swim and play together.
One day, a big storm came and the pond flooded. The family had to find a new home. They waddled around and finally noticed a big tree with a hole in it. It was the perfect new home for them.
Papa duck said, "This is a successful find! We can all fit inside and stay dry." Mama duck agreed and they all happily moved into their new home.
The little ducklings were so happy to have a new home and they quacked and played all day long. They loved their family and were so grateful to have found a safe place to live.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, Lily's mom told her they were going to a march to prevent sickness. Lily didn't know what that meant, but she was excited to go with her mom.
At the march, Lily saw lots of people walking and holding signs. They all wanted to keep everyone healthy. Lily's mom explained that they were trying to stop germs from spreading.
Suddenly, Lily's friend sneezed. Lily's mom quickly gave her a tissue to cover her mouth. "That's how we can prevent germs from spreading," Lily's mom said. "We want everyone to be healthy."
Lily felt happy knowing that they were all working together to keep each other healthy. She held her mom's hand and continued walking in the march with a big smile on her face.



Once upon a time, there was a big white truck with four wheels. The truck's driver was a nice man who loved to call his friends on his phone. One day, while driving his truck, he saw a little bird with a hurt wing. The man stopped his truck and called his friend who knew how to help hurt birds.
The man's friend came quickly and they put the little bird in a small white box. They drove to the bird hospital where the bird got better. The man felt happy that he could help the little bird and he continued to call his friends to help others in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to skip and jump around in the park. One day, she went to her grandma's house for lunch. Her grandma made her favorite food, pasta! Lily was so happy and ate all her pasta.
After lunch, Lily went outside to play in the garden. She saw a bird trying to fly but it was foolish and kept falling down. Lily felt sad for the bird and decided to help. She picked up the bird and gently placed it on a branch. The bird was happy and flew away. Lily felt proud of herself for helping the bird.
As the sun set, Lily went back inside for dinner. Her grandma made her another plate of pasta. Lily was so full but she ate it all because she loved her grandma's cooking. After dinner, Lily went to bed feeling happy and content.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her dolls and teddy bears. One day, Lily and her mommy went outside to wait for a taxi. They were going to the park to play on the swings and slide. 
While they were waiting, Lily saw a man who looked grumpy. He was holding a big bag and pacing back and forth. Lily's mommy told her not to talk to strangers and to stay close to her. 
Finally, the taxi arrived and Lily and her mommy got inside. As they drove away, Lily looked out the window and saw the grumpy man getting into another taxi. She wondered where he was going and what was in his bag. But she was happy to be going to the park to play.



One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mom. She loved to run around and play with her friends. While playing, she accidentally poked her toe on a rock. It hurt a lot and she started crying.
Her mom saw her crying and asked, "What happened, Lily?"
"I poked my toe on a rock, Mommy. It hurts," said Lily.
"I'm sorry, sweetie. Let me see your toe," said her mom. She looked at the toe and saw that it was red and swollen. "We need to clean it and put a band-aid on it," she said.
Lily's mom cleaned the toe and put a band-aid on it. "All better now," she said.
"Thank you, Mommy. I'm not sorry anymore," said Lily, smiling.



Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max had a big collar that was red and shiny. It was very impressive. Max loved to play with his ball in the park. One day, Max saw a little girl crying. He went up to her and asked, "Why are you sad?" The little girl said, "I lost my teddy bear and I don't know where it is." Max said, "Don't worry, I know where your teddy bear is. Follow me!" Max led the little girl to a bush where her teddy bear was hiding. The little girl was so happy and thanked Max for his help. From that day on, Max and the little girl became best friends and played together in the park every day.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her purse. It was a pink purse with sparkles on it. One day, Lily went to the park with her mom. She brought her purse with her because she wanted to use it to put her toys in.
When they got to the park, they saw a boy playing with a noisy toy truck. Lily's mom asked the boy if he could please play with his truck somewhere else because it was too noisy. The boy said okay and moved to a different spot.
Lily was happy because she could play with her toys in peace. She opened her purse and put her toys inside. Then, she looked up and saw a butterfly flying by. She said to her mom, "Look, mommy! A butterfly!" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, it's so pretty." Lily was so happy to see the butterfly and she knew she could always use her purse to keep her toys safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little bird with a pretty feather. The bird loved to fly and sing, but one day it got lost in the woods. The little bird felt scared and alone in the dark forest.
Suddenly, it saw a light and flew towards it. It was a small house where a little girl was reading a book quietly. The bird felt happy to see someone and landed on the window sill.
The girl saw the bird and smiled. She gently picked up the bird and gave it some seeds to eat. The bird felt grateful and stayed with the girl. They read books together and had fun. But one day, the bird saw its family flying in the sky and felt sad. The girl understood and let the bird fly away. The bird felt happy to be reunited with its family and the girl felt happy for the bird.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a journal where she wrote about her adventures. One day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a puppy and wanted to pet it, but the puppy's owner said it wasn't safe to touch him. Lily was sad but understood that the puppy needed to be kept safe. 
As she walked around the park, she saw a butterfly and said, "Hello, butterfly! You are so pretty!" The butterfly flew away, but Lily was happy she got to say hello. Later, she went home and wrote about her day in her journal. She wrote about the puppy and the butterfly, and how she learned it's important to stay safe.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to ride the subway with her mommy. One day, they got on the subway and Lily saw a bright light. She pointed to it and said, "Mommy, look at the pretty light!" Her mommy smiled and said, "Yes, it's very pretty."
As they rode the subway, Lily started to count the stops. "One, two, three," she said. Her mommy asked, "How many stops do we have left?" Lily counted and said, "Two more stops!"
Suddenly, a man on the subway said to Lily, "You're very good at counting! Can you count to ten?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, I can count to ten!" And she counted all the way to ten for the man. He clapped his hands and said, "Wow, you're very smart!" Lily felt very proud of herself.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside with his friends. One day, they decided to build a tent in the backyard. Timmy was so proud when they finished the tent. They all went inside and played games.
Suddenly, it started to rain very hard. The rain made the tent wet and it started to leak. Timmy and his friends got very wet and cold. They tried to fix the tent, but it was too late. The tent fell down and they had to go inside the house.
Timmy was sad that their tent broke. He wished it didn't happen. His friends tried to cheer him up, but he still felt sad. Timmy learned that sometimes bad things happen, even when you try your best.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, he went to the park to play with his friends. They ran and played and had lots of fun. 
Suddenly, Timmy saw a shiny pin on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his friend. "Look what I found!" he said. 
His friend replied, "Wow, that's cool! Let's go print some pictures of it!" 
Timmy and his friend ran to the nearby store and printed pictures of the pin. They were so lively and excited about their new discovery. They couldn't wait to show their other friends. 
From that day on, Timmy always kept the pin in his pocket and would show it to anyone who asked. It was his special treasure.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys on the soft carpet in his room. One day, Timmy accidentally dropped his toy car on the carpet and it got stuck in the fibers. 
"Oh no!" cried Timmy. "My car is stuck! Can you help me, Mommy?"
"Of course, dear," said Timmy's helpful mom. She got a pair of scissors and carefully cut the carpet fibers around the car, freeing it from the carpet's grip.
"Wow, Mommy, you're so sharp with those scissors!" exclaimed Timmy.
"Thank you, Timmy," replied his mom with a smile. "I'm just glad I could help."



Once upon a time, there was a kind man who lived in a small house. The man had a big garden with lots of flowers and vegetables. He would provide the vegetables to his neighbors and they were very happy.
One day, a harsh storm came and destroyed the man's garden. The man was sad because he couldn't provide vegetables for his neighbors anymore. But his neighbors came to help him and they worked together to make the garden beautiful again.
After a few weeks, the garden was even better than before. The man was happy because he could provide vegetables to his neighbors again. And the neighbors were happy because they could eat fresh vegetables. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to read books, especially ones with lots of pictures. One day, she went to the library with her mom to find a new book to read. 
Lily found a book with a small page, but she insisted on getting it because she liked the cover. Her mom tried to explain that the book might be too hard for her to read, but Lily didn't listen. 
When they got home, Lily tried to read the book, but it was too hard for her. She got frustrated and started to cry. Her mom came over and asked what was wrong. Lily explained that she couldn't read the book because the page was too small. 
Her mom hugged her and said, "It's okay, we can find another book with bigger pages." Lily smiled and felt better. From then on, she always listened to her mom's advice when it came to picking out books to read.



Once upon a time, there was a big mountain called a volcano. The volcano was very restless and made loud noises. The people who lived nearby were scared of the volcano. They did not want it to erupt and make hot lava come out. 
One day, a brave boy named Timmy decided to climb up the volcano. He wanted to see what was inside. As he climbed higher and higher, he felt scared because the volcano was shaking. But he kept going until he reached the top. 
When he got to the top, Timmy looked inside and saw red hot lava. It was very bright and made him feel scared. He quickly climbed back down and told everyone what he saw. They were very thankful to Timmy for being so brave and warned others to stay away from the restless volcano.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very hungry and he wanted to eat some cookies. He went to his mom and said, "Mommy, I am hungry. Can I have some cookies please?" His mom said, "Yes, Timmy. I will give you some cookies."
Timmy was happy and he ran to the kitchen. He saw the cookies on a hook and he tried to reach them, but he was too short. He went back to his mom and said, "Mommy, can you please get the cookies for me? They are on the hook and I can't reach them." His mom said, "Of course, Timmy. I will get them for you."
Timmy was very happy and he ate his cookies. He said to his mom, "Thank you for getting the cookies for me. I love you." His mom said, "You're welcome, Timmy. I love you too." And they hugged each other. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to sing and dance. One day, she found a blue note on the ground. It was so pretty! She picked it up and showed it to her mommy.
"Look, mommy! A blue note!" Lily said.
"That's lovely, dear. Why don't you sing a song and we can clap along?" mommy replied.
Lily started to sing and mommy clapped to the beat. They had so much fun together. From that day on, Lily kept the blue note in her pocket and sang with it every day.



Once upon a time, there was a sheep named Baa. Baa had very soft wool that everyone loved to touch. One day, Baa wanted to play a joke on his friends. He hid behind a tree and jumped out to surprise them. They all laughed and thought it was funny.
But Baa was not careful and he accidentally got his wool stuck on a branch. His friends tried to help him, but they couldn't get him free. Baa was scared and didn't know what to do. Luckily, a kind farmer came by and saw what had happened. He carefully untangled Baa's wool and set him free.
From then on, Baa learned to be more careful when playing jokes on his friends. And everyone was happy that Baa was safe and sound. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who lived in a cozy house with her mommy and daddy. One day, she saw a bird fly into the chimney. She wanted to help the bird, so she asked her mommy and daddy to help her.
"I saw a bird fly into the chimney. Can we help it?" asked Lily.
Her mommy and daddy discussed it and decided to call a chimney sweep to help. The chimney sweep came and took the bird out of the chimney. Lily was happy that the bird was safe.
Later that day, Lily's mommy and daddy praised her for being honest and telling them about the bird. They told her that it's always important to tell the truth. Lily felt proud of herself for doing the right thing. From that day on, she always looked out for animals in need.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved cars and dreamed of driving a great automobile when he grew up. 
One night, Timmy went to bed and had a wonderful dream about driving a shiny red car with big wheels. He drove through the countryside and saw cows and horses grazing in the fields. 
When Timmy woke up, he told his mommy about his dream and how he wanted to drive a great automobile like the one in his dream. His mommy smiled and told him that he could be anything he wanted to be when he grew up, even a race car driver! 
From that day on, Timmy worked hard in school and studied about cars. He knew that one day, he would drive a great automobile just like in his dream.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park with her friends. One day, Lily saw a race happening in the park. She watched as the runners ran really fast. Lily felt happy when she saw the runners get a medal.
Lily went home and told her mom about the race. She said, "I hope I can run like them one day and get a medal too!" Her mom smiled and said, "I know you can do it, Lily!" 
The next day, Lily went to the park and practiced running. She made sure her shoes were tidy and ready to go. She ran as fast as she could and didn't give up. Her hard work paid off because she won a medal in the race! Lily was so happy and proud of herself.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved going to the beach with his mommy and daddy. He loved playing in the sand and feeling the soft waves on his toes. 
One day, Timmy and his family went to the beach. Timmy was having so much fun building a sandcastle with his bucket and shovel. Suddenly, Timmy saw a little bird that had hurt its wing. Timmy felt sad for the bird and wanted to help it. 
Timmy asked his mommy, "Can we help the birdie?" His mommy replied, "Let's pray for the birdie to feel better." Timmy closed his eyes and prayed for the birdie. 
After they finished praying, Timmy and his family went back to playing in the sand. But when they were leaving the beach, Timmy saw that the birdie was not moving anymore. He asked his mommy, "Is the birdie okay?" His mommy sadly replied, "No, Timmy. The birdie has gone to heaven." Timmy felt very sad and hugged his mommy tightly.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went on a trip with her family to a big hotel. Everything was normal at first. They went swimming and ate yummy food. 
But then, Lily slipped on the wet floor and hurt her leg. She had to go to the hospital. The doctors said she couldn't walk for a long time. 
Lily was sad because she couldn't play with her family anymore. She had to stay in the hotel room all day. Her family went out to have fun without her. 
In the end, Lily had to go home in a wheelchair. She missed the rest of the trip and wished she never slipped. The end.



Once upon a time, there was a big, strong, and reliable tree. It lived in a forest for many, many years. The tree had lots of little seeds that it would scatter every year. The little seeds would grow into new trees.
One day, a little squirrel named Sammy came to the tree. Sammy loved to play on the tree's branches. The tree liked Sammy, too. The tree told Sammy about its seeds that it would scatter soon. Sammy was excited and wanted to help.
The tree and Sammy made a plan. When the time came, Sammy would help scatter the seeds. The day came, and Sammy took the seeds and ran all around the forest. He scattered the seeds far and wide. Soon, new trees began to grow, just like the big, strong, and reliable tree. The forest became a beautiful place, and Sammy and the tree were very happy.



Once upon a time, there was a soft bunny who lived near a river. The bunny liked to feel the soft grass under his feet and the warm sun on his face. He would hop around and play by the river all day long.
One day, the bunny met a new friend by the river. It was a small duck. The duck liked to swim in the river and feel the cool water on her feathers. The bunny and the duck played together every day. They would run and swim and have lots of fun.
As the days went by, the bunny and the duck became best friends. They would always take care of each other and share their toys. They loved to feel the soft grass and the cool river water together. And they lived happily ever after by the river.



One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a wild dog near his house. Tim was scared, but he wanted to be brave. He knew he had to do something to make the dog go away.
Tim had an idea. He ran inside his house and picked up his flashlight. He thought maybe the light would make the dog leave. He went back outside and turned on the flashlight.
The wild dog saw the bright light and got scared. It ran away from Tim's house. Tim was happy that his idea worked. He knew that he was brave and could protect his home. Now, Tim always keeps his flashlight with him, just in case.



Once upon a time, there was a long cat named Tom. Tom liked to store his toys in a big box. One day, Tom saw a screen in his house. He had never seen it before. He wanted to play with it.
Tom's friend, Sam the dog, came over. "What is that?" asked Sam. "I don't know," said Tom. "Let's find out!" They played near the screen, but they were careful not to touch it.
Later, Mom came home. She saw Tom and Sam by the screen. "You found the new TV!" she said. "Let's watch a fun show!" Tom and Sam were happy. They watched a show about a cat and a dog who were friends, just like them.



Once upon a time, there was an elderly man. He loved to play with balloons. One day, he found a big, red balloon in his yard.
He wanted to see how high the balloon could go. So, he started to push the balloon up into the sky. The balloon went higher and higher. The elderly man was very happy.
As the balloon went up, a little bird saw it. The bird liked the balloon too. The bird helped the elderly man push the balloon even higher. They all had lots of fun together. And they became the best of friends.



Once upon a time, there was a big melon field. In the field, many melons grew. Some were big, and some were small. All the melons wanted to be the best melon in the field. They were very competitive.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to the field. She wanted to pick a melon to take home. All the melons wanted Lily to pick them. They tried to show her how big and round they were.
Lily looked at all the melons. She saw a small melon hiding behind the big ones. It was not as big as the others, but it was very pretty. Lily picked the small melon and took it home. The big melons learned that it is not always the biggest or the most competitive that wins. Sometimes, it's the little things that make us happy.



Once upon a time, there was a lovely cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to eat fish. One day, Kitty could not find any fish to eat. She was very sad and hungry. Kitty knew she needed to find fish, but she did not know where to look.
Kitty asked her friend, Doggy, where to find fish. Doggy told her that fish live in water. They both went to the pond to look for fish. But there was a problem. Kitty was scared of water! She did not want to go near it.
Kitty was sad but she needed the fish. Doggy had an idea. He found a long stick and gave it to Kitty. Kitty used the stick to catch the fish without going into the water. She was very happy and thanked Doggy for his help. They both went home with full bellies and big smiles.



Once upon a time, there was a tiny house with a warm fireplace. In the house lived a kind cat and a weak mouse. The cat was big and strong, but the mouse was small and not strong.
One cold day, the mouse was trying to get warm by the fireplace. But he was too weak to move close to the fire. The cat saw the mouse and felt sad for him. So, the cat decided to lend a paw to the mouse.
The cat gently picked up the weak mouse and put him close to the fireplace. The mouse felt warm and happy. From that day on, the cat and the mouse became best friends. They always helped each other and stayed warm by the fireplace together.



Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play in the park. One day, when Spot was playing, he saw a high tree. In the tree, there was a cross. Spot wanted to get the cross, but he could not reach it because it was too high.
Spot had an idea. He ran home to find something to replace the cross with. He found a ball. Spot thought, "If I throw the ball high, it might knock the cross down." So, Spot took the ball and ran back to the park.
Spot threw the ball high into the tree. The ball hit the cross, and the cross fell down. Spot was so happy! He picked up the cross and played with it all day. And from that day on, Spot and the cross were best friends.



One day, a little boy named Tim found a mitten on the ground. It was a disgusting mitten. It was dirty and smelly. Tim wanted to help find the owner of the mitten.
He asked his friend, Sally, "Is this your mitten?" Sally looked at the mitten and said, "No, it's not mine. It's too dirty. Let's shut the door so it doesn't come inside."
Tim and Sally went to their friend, Max. Tim asked, "Max, is this your mitten?" Max looked at the disgusting mitten and said, "No, that's not mine. I don't like dirty mittens."
Finally, Tim went to his mom. He showed her the mitten and asked, "Mom, is this your mitten?" Tim's mom laughed and said, "No, sweetie. That's a very dirty mitten. Let's wash it and put it in the lost and found box."
Tim felt good that he tried to help find the owner of the mitten. He knew that someone would be happy to find their mitten clean and safe.



Once upon a time, there was a big hole in the ground. Many animals liked to play near the hole. They were all friends, but sometimes they were competitive. They liked to see who could jump over the hole the fastest.
One day, a little rabbit came to the hole. He wanted to use his strong legs to jump over the hole. His friends, a squirrel and a bird, were watching him. The squirrel was very fast at climbing trees, and the bird could fly high in the sky. They both wanted to be the best at jumping over the hole too.
The rabbit, squirrel, and bird took turns jumping over the hole. They all tried their best to be the fastest. In the end, they all jumped over the hole and were happy. They learned that it was fun to be competitive, but it was more important to have fun and be friends.



One day, a little boy named Tim wanted to do something fun. He thought and thought, and then he had an idea. He would make a model! Tim was very excited to start.
Tim got his toy blocks and started to build his model. He put one block on top of another, making it taller and taller. Soon, the model was so tall that it made Tim feel dizzy just looking at it.
Suddenly, the dizzy model began to wobble and shake. Tim tried to hold it steady, but it was too late. The model fell down with a big crash! Tim was sad at first, but then he decided to build a new model. This time, he would make it stronger and not so dizzy. And that's what he did.



One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They played in the sand and had a lot of fun. Tim was very happy. He liked to feel the sand on his feet. He saw a big hole in the sand and ran to it.
"Mom, look at this big hole!" Tim said. His mom looked at the hole and felt anxious. She did not want Tim to get hurt. "Be careful, Tim," she said. Tim wondered who made the big hole, and he wanted to find out.
Tim started to dig in the sand near the big hole. He dug and dug, but he did not find anything. He was sad. Then, the sand started to fall into the big hole, and Tim fell in too. His mom tried to help him, but she could not. Tim was stuck in the hole, and they could not get out. They both felt very sad.



Once upon a time, there was a loud dog named Stitch. Stitch loved to play and laugh with his friends. They played in the park every day.
One day, while they were playing, Stitch found a big, red ball. He and his friends started to play with the ball. They threw it, kicked it, and had so much fun. Stitch laughed a lot because he was very happy.
At the end of the day, Stitch and his friends were tired but happy. They said goodbye and went to their homes. Stitch couldn't wait to play with the ball and laugh with his friends again tomorrow.



Once, in a small town, there was a loud dog named Spot. Spot liked to play with a big red ball. One day, Spot saw a girl named Sue. Sue was sad because her boot was lost.
Spot wanted to help Sue. He looked all around the town for the boot. He looked in the park, behind the big tree, and near the pond. Then, Spot saw the boot near the pond. He barked loud and ran to Sue to offer her the boot.
Sue was so happy to see her boot. She hugged Spot and said, "Thank you, Spot!" The people in the town were proud of Spot for helping Sue. The moral of the story is that it is good to help others when they need it.



Once upon a time, there was a lively lizard. He liked to play in the sun all day. He was green and loved to run and jump.
One hot day, the lively lizard found a big ice cube. The ice cube was cold and wet. The lizard liked how it felt on his skin. He played with the ice cube all day.
As the sun shone brightly, the ice cube began to melt. It got smaller and smaller. The lively lizard was sad to see his ice cube go away. But he knew he could find more fun things to play with in the sun. And so, the lively lizard kept playing and having fun, even after his ice cube friend melted away.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to eat berries. One day, she went to the park to find some berries to eat. She saw a big bush with lots of red berries on it. Sue was very happy.
Sue started to pick the berries and put them in her bag. After a while, she saw a small boy named Tim. Tim was sitting on a seat, looking sad. Sue asked Tim why he was sad. Tim said he was ashamed because he had no berries to eat.
Sue wanted to help Tim. She thought about what to do. Then she got an idea. Sue shared her berries with Tim. They both ate the berries together and were very happy. Sue and Tim became good friends and always shared their berries with each other.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play near the water. One day, he saw an empty kayak by the water. He was very happy and wanted to try it.
Tim took a big step into the kayak. But he did not know how to make it go. He tried and tried, but the kayak would not move. Tim felt sad and wanted to give up.
A kind lady saw Tim and came to help. She showed him how to use the paddle. Tim tried again, and this time the kayak moved! He was so happy and thanked the kind lady. The moral of the story is to never give up and ask for help when you need it.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was playing in his room when he heard a noise. It was a harsh sound, like a big bang. Tim was scared, but he wanted to find out what it was.
He went to the bathroom and found a surprise. The toilet was making the noise! Tim said, "Why are you so loud, toilet?" The toilet said, "I'm sorry, Tim. I didn't mean to scare you. I just needed help."
Tim wanted to help the toilet, so he called his mom. His mom came and fixed the toilet. The toilet said, "Thank you, Tim and Mom!" Tim was happy he could help, and the toilet was quiet again.



One day, a lively dog named Spot came to a new home. He was so happy to arrive at the big house. Spot wagged his tail and jumped up and down. He knew he was going to have so much fun with his new family.
Spot went inside the house and took a look around. He saw a big chair, a soft bed, and some fun toys. Spot played with the toys and ran all around the house. He loved his new home and his new family.
At night, Spot curled up in his soft bed. He was very tired from all the fun he had during the day. He closed his eyes and went to sleep. Spot knew that tomorrow would be another fun day in his new home.



Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Mia. Mia liked to play in her backyard. One day, she found a big copper pot. The pot was heavy. Mia wanted to know how much the pot weighed.
Mia asked her big brother, Tom, to help her. Tom tried to lift the pot, but it was too heavy for him too. They both felt sad. They wanted to know how much the pot weighed, but they could not lift it.
Then, Mia had an idea. She ran to the shed and found a big stick. Mia and Tom put the stick under the pot. They both pushed down on the stick. The pot lifted off the ground. Mia and Tom were happy. They found out how much the pot weighed. They played with the copper pot all day long.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom had a guitar. It was a modern guitar. It was big and shiny. Tom loved to play his guitar every day.
One day, Tom played his guitar near a big tree. A little bird came and sat on the tree. The bird liked the music. The bird started to sing. Tom was happy and he smiled.
Tom and the bird became best friends. They played music together every day. The bird sang and Tom played his guitar. Everyone who heard them would smile too. And they all lived happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a little red car. This car loved to drive all day long. It would drive up and down the long road, going fast and slow. The car was very happy when it could drive.
One day, the little red car felt a pain in one of its wheels. It could not drive as fast as before. The car was sad because it loved to drive. The car needed help to fix the pain.
A nice man saw the little red car and wanted to help. He looked at the wheel and found a small rock. The man took the rock out and the pain was gone. The little red car was so happy. It could drive up and down the long road again, all day long.



Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a little girl named Mia. She had a toy cat that she loved very much. Mia and her cat did everything together. They played, ate, and slept together. One day, Mia had a dream about a perfect place with lots of gold.
In the dream, Mia and her cat woke up in a big garden. The sun was shining, and the sky was blue. Mia said to her cat, "Wow! Look at all the gold!" Her cat meowed happily. They played in the garden, and the gold sparkled in the sun.
Mia and her cat found a big tree with a swing. They took turns swinging, and the gold leaves fell from the tree. Mia laughed, and her cat purred. They played in the garden until the sun went down. Then, they woke up from the dream, but they knew they would always remember the perfect place with lots of gold.



Once upon a time, there was a large bear. The bear was very big and strong. He lived in the woods with his friends.
One day, a storm came. The wind blew and the rain fell. The large bear wanted to help his friends. So, he decided to create a shelter for them. He used sticks and leaves to make the shelter. It was a safe place for all his friends to stay.
When the storm was over, the sun came out. The large bear and his friends were happy and safe in the shelter. They played and had fun together. And they knew they could always count on their big, strong friend, the large bear, to help them.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play games. One day, he found a new game. He was very happy.
Tim played the game with his friend, Sam. They played the game all day. It was a loud game. They laughed and shouted. "This game is so much fun!" said Tim. "I love this game!" said Sam.
Tim and Sam played until they complete the game. They were very proud. They played the game again and again. They had a great day.



Once upon a time, there was a brilliant dog named Max. Max loved to do exercise every day. He would run, jump, and play with his friends in the park. Max was very happy when he did exercise.
One day, Max met a new friend named Lily. Lily was a little dog who did not know how to do exercise. Max wanted to help Lily. So, Max showed Lily how to run, jump, and play. Lily tried to do exercise like Max.
Soon, Lily learned how to do exercise too. Max and Lily had lots of fun doing exercise together. They became the best of friends. And they lived happily ever after, doing exercise every day.



One day, a boy named Tim was very bored. He did not want to play with his toys. He did not want to watch TV. He wanted to do something new and fun. He looked out the window and saw a big open space outside. He thought it would be fun to go there and play.
Tim put on his shoes and went out to the big space. He saw a funny looking rock. The rock could talk! The rock said, "Hi, I am Rocky. I am a talking rock. Do you want to play with me?" Tim was very happy. He played with Rocky all day.
After a while, Tim said, "Rocky, I want to go home now. Can you come with me?" Rocky said, "Yes, I can come with you. But first, you have to find my special rock friend. She is hiding in this space. If you find her, we can all go home together." Tim looked and looked. He found the special rock friend. They all went home together and had lots of fun. Tim was not bored anymore.



Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Finn. Finn was an adorable fish who lived in the big sea. He had many friends, but he missed his best friend, Sam the shark. Sam went away to find food for his family.
One day, Finn decided to find Sam. He swam far away from his home. He asked other fish if they saw Sam, but no one knew where he was. Finn felt sad and missed Sam even more.
Then, Finn saw a big shadow. He thought it was Sam and swam fast to see him. But it was not Sam. It was a mean shark who wanted to eat Finn. Finn tried to swim away, but the mean shark was too fast. The mean shark ate Finn. Finn never got to see his best friend Sam again.



Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot liked to search for things. One day, he saw a big, red ball. Spot wanted the ball. He felt envious of the ball's owner.
Spot asked the owner, "Can I play with the ball, please?" The owner said, "Yes, but you must wait. I will go get it for you." Spot sat and waited.
After a short wait, the owner came back with the ball. Spot was so happy. He played with the ball all day. In the end, Spot was not envious anymore. He learned that it was fun to share and play with others.



One day, a curious little cat named Kitty went for a walk. She saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. Kitty jumped and climbed up the tree. She looked around and saw many things. She saw a house, a dog, and a bird. Kitty was very happy.
Kitty heard a voice from below. It was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy said, "Kitty, come down! You are too high!" Kitty looked down and saw Timmy. She was scared but wanted to be brave. So, she tried to climb down the tree.
Kitty's stomach started to hurt. She thought, "I must quit climbing!" Kitty called out to Timmy, "Help! My stomach hurts!" Timmy saw Kitty was in pain. He ran inside his house and asked his mom for help. Timmy's mom came out and helped Kitty down from the tree.
Kitty was safe on the ground. Timmy's mom said, "Kitty, you should not climb so high. It can be dangerous." Kitty nodded and thanked Timmy and his mom. She promised to be more careful next time. Kitty and Timmy became good friends and played together every day.



Once upon a time, there was an old man who lived in a small house. He had a little dog named Spot. They were good friends. The old man liked to say "thank you" to Spot, because Spot was always helping him. One day, the old man saw a big box in his yard. He did not know where it came from. He thought, "Maybe there is a nice surprise inside."
The old man and Spot opened the box. Inside, they found a big toy. It was a pretty toy with many colors. The old man did not know the price of the toy, but he knew it must be special. He said, "Spot, we must find out who left this toy for us, so we can say thank you."
The old man and Spot went to their friend, the little girl next door. The little girl said she did not leave the toy. They went to the big tree in the park, where many kids played. They asked the kids, but no one knew about the toy. The old man and Spot felt sad, because they could not say thank you.
Then, they saw a small note under the toy. The note said, "To the old man and Spot, thank you for being good friends. Enjoy this toy. Love, the people in the big house." The old man and Spot went to the big house and said thank you to the people. They were very happy.
From that day on, the old man and Spot played with the toy every day. They knew that saying thank you was very important. And they always remembered to be kind to others, just like the people in the big house were kind to them.



Once upon a time, there was a little puppy named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball in the park. One day, he saw a big tree and wanted to get a closer look. Spot leaned on the tree to sniff it, but the tree was not strong. The tree fell down with a loud crash!
A little girl named Lily saw what happened. She felt sorry for the tree and for Spot. She knew that they should not lean on things that are not strong. Lily decided to help Spot learn a lesson.
Together, they planted a new tree in the park. Spot and Lily took care of the tree every day. As the tree grew, they learned to be careful and respect nature. They also learned that when they make a mistake, they can fix it by doing something good. And from that day on, Spot never leaned on a tree again.



Once upon a time, there was a big, wide tree. A little boy named Tim and a small cat named Kitty played near the tree. They liked to put stones in the deep hole under the tree.
One day, Tim said, "Let's put more stones in the hole!" Kitty meowed and they put many stones in the hole. They were having fun, but they did not know that the hole was home to a sad bug.
The sad bug said, "Please, do not put more stones in my home." But Tim and Kitty did not hear the bug. They kept putting stones in the hole until it was full.
The sad bug's home was gone. Tim and Kitty went home, not knowing they had made the bug very sad. The bug had to find a new home, but it was not easy. The bug cried and wished Tim and Kitty had listened.



One day, a little girl named Lily went on a journey. She walked down a peaceful path with her toy bunny. They saw a big rock and sat down to rest.
"Mr. Bunny, do you like our journey?" Lily asked her toy.
"Yes, Lily, I love it!" said Mr. Bunny in a soft voice.
They played on the rock for a while. Then, they walked back home, happy from their fun journey.



Once upon a time, there was a mysterious avocado. This avocado was very special. It could talk and walk. One day, the avocado met a tomato. They became good friends. They played and laughed together every day.
After a while, the avocado and the tomato fell in love. They decided to marry each other. All their friends, like the apple and the carrot, came to their wedding. Everyone was happy and excited.
The avocado and the tomato lived happily ever after. They had many adventures together. They were the best of friends and loved each other very much. And the mysterious avocado was not so mysterious anymore, because it had found a true friend in the tomato.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to read books. One day, he went to the library with his mom. The library was a big place with many books.
In the library, Tim saw an ugly frog. The frog could talk! The frog said, "Hello, Tim! Do you want to read a book with me?" Tim was scared at first, but then he said, "Okay, Mr. Frog."
They sat down and the frog offered Tim a book. They read the book together and had lots of fun. After they finished, Tim said, "Thank you, Mr. Frog. I like reading books with you." The ugly frog smiled and said, "I like reading books with you too, Tim. Come back soon!" Tim promised to come back and read more books with the frog.



Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy had a crazy toy named Spike. Spike was a funny toy with a big smile and wild hair. Amy loved to play with Spike all day long.
One day, Amy decided to sort her toys. She put all the big toys in one box and all the small toys in another box. Spike wanted to help Amy sort the toys. Spike said, "Amy, can I help you sort the toys?" Amy smiled and said, "Yes, Spike, you can help me."
Spike and Amy worked together to sort the toys. They laughed and had fun while they worked. When they finished, Amy gave Spike a big hug. "Thank you for helping me, Spike," said Amy. Spike smiled and said, "You're welcome, Amy. I love to help you." And they continued to play happily ever after.



Once upon a time, there was a fireman. He was not ugly, but he was not pretty either. He was just a fireman. He liked to help people and be nice. He had a big red truck that he drove around town.
One day, the fireman saw a cat in a tree. The cat was scared and could not get down. The fireman wanted to be helpful, so he got a big ladder. He climbed up and saved the cat. The cat was happy and said "meow, thank you!"
After that, the fireman went to the park. He saw a little girl who was sad. Her ball was stuck in a bush. The fireman wanted to be helpful again. He got the ball out of the bush and gave it to the little girl. She was happy and said "thank you, fireman!" The fireman smiled and knew that it was a good day to be a fireman.



One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They walked slow on the sand, looking for shells. Tim found a big, pretty shell and showed it to his mom. She smiled and said, "What a nice shell, Tim!"
A little crab came out of the shell and said, "Hello! I'm Carl the Crab. Can we play?" Tim was happy to meet Carl. They played a fun game where Carl would hide in the sand and Tim would try to find him. Each time Tim found Carl, he would repeat, "I found you, Carl!"
As the sun went down, Tim knew it was time to go home. He said goodbye to Carl and thanked him for playing. Carl went back into his shell and waved goodbye with his little claw. Tim and his mom walked slow back to their car, excited to come back to the beach another day.



Once upon a time, there was a white cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play outside in the sun. Every day, Fluffy would go outside at noon to play with her friends.
One day, Fluffy saw a big butterfly. The butterfly could change colors! It changed from red to blue to green. Fluffy thought the butterfly was so pretty. She wanted to play with it.
Fluffy and the butterfly played all day. They ran in the grass and jumped in the air. When the sun went down, Fluffy and the butterfly said goodbye. Fluffy went home and told her mom about her new friend. She couldn't wait to play with the butterfly again tomorrow.



One day, a little girl named Lucy went outside to play. The sky was clear and the sun was shining. Lucy saw her friend Tom playing with a kite. "Hi, Tom!" she said. "Can I play too?"
Tom said, "Sure! Let's fly the kite together." They took turns holding the kite string. The wind was strong, and the kite flew high. They laughed and had fun. But then, dark clouds began to appear in the sky. Tom said, "We should go inside. I heard there might be a hurricane."
Lucy and Tom ran back to their houses just as the rain started to fall. Inside, they watched as the wind blew and the rain poured. The hurricane was very big and loud. After a while, the storm stopped, and the sky became clear again.
Lucy went outside to see if the kite was still there. She found it stuck in a tree. Tom came out too, and they both worked together to get the kite down. They were happy they had listened to the warning about the hurricane and stayed safe inside. Now they could play with the kite again on another clear day.



Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a toy phone. He liked to play with it a lot. One day, Tim had a bad day. He was sad.
Tim's mom saw him and asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "I don't know, Mom. I just feel bad." His mom had an idea to make him feel better. She said, "Let's tell jokes to each other. Maybe that will make you happy."
Tim and his mom sat down with the toy phone. They took turns telling jokes to each other. Tim's mom said, "Why did the chicken cross the road?" Tim thought and said, "I don't know, Mom. Why?" His mom said, "To get to the other side!" They both laughed.
Tim told a joke too. He said, "Why do cows wear bells?" His mom said, "I don't know, Tim. Why?" Tim said, "Because their horns don't work!" They both laughed again.
They kept telling jokes and laughing. Tim felt happy again. The bad day was gone. From that day on, Tim and his mom would tell jokes to each other when they felt bad. And the toy phone was always there to help them share their jokes.



One day, a kind little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw a lost dog. The dog was sad. Lily wanted to help the dog return home.
Lily asked the dog, "What is your name?" The dog said, "My name is Max." Lily said, "Let's find your home, Max!" They walked and looked for Max's home. They met a big, mean dog. The mean dog did not want them to pass. Lily said, "Please let us pass. We are looking for Max's home."
The big, mean dog saw how kind Lily was. The mean dog felt bad and let them pass. They walked more and found Max's home. Max's family had a surprise for Lily. They gave her a big thank you hug. Lily was happy she helped Max return home.



Once upon a time, there was a lovely little town. In this town, there was a big library. Many kids loved to go there and read books.
One day, a girl named Lily went to the library. She picked a book about a cat. Lily sat down and read the book. She liked the cat in the story.
Lily had an idea. She wanted to send a letter to the cat. So, she wrote a letter and put it in a box. She asked her mom to send the box to the cat. Lily was happy, and she knew the cat would be happy too.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved the beach. He liked to play in the sand and swim in the water. One day, Tim went to the beach with his mom and dad. When they got there, they saw that the beach was filthy. There was trash everywhere.
Tim was sad. He wanted to play, but he didn't like the dirty beach. His mom and dad told him to believe that they could make it clean. So, they all started to pick up the trash. They put the trash in bags and threw it away.
After they cleaned up the beach, it was not filthy anymore. Tim was happy. He played in the sand and swam in the water all day. He believed that he could make the beach clean, and he did. Tim, his mom, and his dad had a great day at the beach.



One day, a little caterpillar named Tim was walking in the garden. He saw a big tree with sour apples. Tim thought they would taste yummy. He went up to the tree and started eating the apples.
Soon, a big bird named Bob came and said, "Stop eating my apples! They are mine!" Tim did not listen and kept eating. Bob was very angry. He wanted to teach Tim a lesson.
Bob waited until Tim was full and slow. Then, Bob strike Tim with his wing. Tim fell down from the tree and could not move. He was very sad and hurt.
Moral: Always listen to others and do not take what is not yours.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lily loved to play outside with her friends, but one day she fell down and got hurt. She cried and ran to her mom.
Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't cry, Lily. It will be okay." Lily's mom put a band-aid on her hurt knee. She told Lily to go inside and rest. Lily went to her room and fell asleep.
While she was sleeping, she had a dream about a magical land with gold everywhere. She saw a kind talking bird who said, "Hello, Lily! I see that you are hurt. I will help you feel better." The bird gave her a gold coin and told her to keep it under her pillow while she slept. 
Lily woke up and found the gold coin under her pillow. She showed it to her mom and dad, and they all smiled. Lily's knee didn't hurt anymore, and she knew it was because of the magic gold coin. From that day on, Lily always believed in the magic of her dreams.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Youth. She had a delicate toy cat that she loved very much. Youth and her cat were best friends. They played together every day and had a lot of fun.
One sunny day, Youth and her cat went to the park to play. They ran around, played hide and seek, and had a picnic. When it was time to go home, Youth started to feel tired. She was so tired that she forgot her delicate cat at the park.
The next morning, Youth woke up and could not find her cat. She started to feel sad. She looked everywhere in her house, but her cat was not there. Then she remembered that she left her cat at the park. Youth ran to the park and found her delicate cat sitting under a tree. She was so happy to see her cat and promised never to leave it behind again.



One day, a boy named Tim went to the zoo with his mom. They saw many animals. Tim loved the zoo. He saw a big, filthy pig. The pig was very dirty. Tim wanted to help the pig.
Tim asked his mom if he could clean the pig. His mom said no. Tim was sad. He wanted the pig to be clean and happy. He thought of a plan to surprise the pig.
Tim found a big bucket of water. He threw the water on the filthy pig. The pig was surprised! The pig became clean and happy. Tim's mom saw what he did and smiled. Tim was happy that he helped the pig at the zoo.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was very hungry and wanted to eat some cake. But his mommy was not at home, and he didn't know how to use a fork. He tried to eat the cake with his hands, but it was too messy.
Suddenly, he saw a big truck zoom by. It was carrying lots of cakes. Timmy thought it would be fun to follow the truck. He ran after it, but he didn't look both ways and crossed the street without looking. 
It was very dangerous, and a car hit him. Timmy got hurt very badly and had to go to the hospital. The moral of the story is that it's important to always look both ways before crossing the street.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to drink milk every day. One day, her mom gave her a cup of milk that tasted funny. Lily was troubled and didn't know what to do. She wanted to ask her mom about it, but she was afraid. 
Lily decided to ask her dad for help. Her dad listened to her and asked her to show him the milk. He smelled it and realized that it was spoiled. He explained to Lily that it's important to ask questions when we are unsure about something, especially when it comes to our health. 
From that day on, Lily learned to ask questions when she was troubled or unsure about something. She knew that it was better to ask and get an answer than to stay quiet and worry. And she never drank spoiled milk again!



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the park. One day, he saw a big, wild dog running around. Timmy got scared and ran away.
Timmy's mommy saw him running and asked, "What's wrong, Timmy?"
"A big, wild dog is chasing me!" Timmy said.
Mommy said, "Don't worry, I'll protect you with my shield." She held out her arms and made a big circle around Timmy.
"Please, mommy, can we go home now?" Timmy asked.
Mommy picked up Timmy and said, "Sure thing, let's go home." They walked away, safe and sound.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in her backyard, where she had a big tree with lots of branches to climb. One day, while she was playing, she saw a raven sitting on a branch. The raven looked at Lily and said, "Hello little girl, can you bring me some food?"
Lily was surprised that the raven could talk, but she wanted to help. She went inside and brought some bread crumbs. The raven ate them and said, "Thank you, you are a dependable friend."
From that day on, Lily would bring food for the raven every day. They became good friends and would talk for hours. One day, the raven said, "Lily, I have to go now. But I will always remember you as my dependable friend."
Lily was sad to see the raven go, but she knew they would always be friends. She looked up at the tree and smiled, knowing that her new friend would always be there, even if she couldn't see him.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to jump on her cushion. One day, Lily's brother Jack came into her room and accidentally broke her cushion. Lily was very upset and started to cry.
Jack felt bad and wanted to make it better. He asked Lily, "What can I do to make you happy?"
Lily told Jack that she wanted a new cushion. Jack promised to buy her a new one. Lily stopped crying and smiled. She was happy that Jack was going to get her a new cushion.
The next day, Jack went to the store and bought a new cushion for Lily. When he came back, he gave it to her and she hugged him. Lily was no longer upset and was grateful that Jack had listened to her and got her a new cushion.



Once upon a time, there was a kind farmer who had a big cow. One day, the cow saw a little bird stuck in a tree. The cow said, "Oh no, little birdie! I will help you!" The cow rushed over to the tree and used her big nose to push the birdie out of the tree. The little birdie said, "Thank you, generous cow! You saved me!" The cow replied, "No problem, little birdie. I am happy to help." And they became friends forever.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who had a brother named Max. Max was very messy and always made a big mess in their room. One day, Lily decided to clean up their room and make it tidy. She picked up all the toys and put them in their toy box.
After she was finished, she decided to pour some juice for her and Max to drink. Max was so happy that Lily had made the room tidy and poured him some juice. They sat together and drank their juice while looking at their clean and tidy room. From that day on, Max tried to be less messy and helped Lily keep their room tidy.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the grass. One day, he saw a green frog hopping around. Timmy wanted to touch the frog, but he was scared. 
Timmy's mom saw him looking at the frog and asked, "Do you want to touch the frog, Timmy?" 
Timmy replied, "Yes, but I am scared." 
His mom said, "Don't be scared. The frog won't hurt you. It's just a little green frog." 
So, Timmy reached out and touched the frog. He felt its bumpy skin and smiled. His mom said, "Did you know that your brain helps you feel things like the frog's bumpy skin?" 
Timmy was amazed and said, "Wow! My brain is so cool!" From that day on, Timmy loved to touch and explore everything he saw outside.



Once upon a time, there was a green bull named Billy. Billy loved to eat grass and play with his friends in the field. One day, Billy was feeling sad because he lost his favorite toy.
His friend, a little girl named Lily, saw that Billy was feeling down. She asked him what was wrong. "I lost my toy," Billy said with a sad face. "Oh no!" Lily said. "I will help you find it."
They searched high and low, but they couldn't find the toy. Finally, Lily spotted something green in the grass. "Is this your toy?" she asked. Billy was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You're the best friend ever!" From that day on, Billy and Lily played together all the time and had lots of fun.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her pen. One day, she was going to her friend's house to play. She wanted to bring her pen with her to show her friend her drawings. 
Lily asked her mom, "Mommy, can you carry my pen for me? I don't want to lose it." 
Her mom replied, "Sure, I will keep it safe in my pocket." 
Lily was happy that her pen was safe with her mom. When they arrived at her friend's house, Lily showed her friend her drawings. Her friend loved them and they had so much fun playing together. 
At the end of the day, Lily's mom gave her back her pen. Lily was happy that her pen was safe and sound. She hugged her mom and said, "Thank you for carrying my pen for me!"



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to cook with her mommy in the kitchen. They made yummy food like pancakes and cookies. One day, Lily decided to be creative and make her own special dish. She mixed together some cereal and milk in a bowl and called it "Lily's special breakfast". 
After breakfast, it was time to take a bath. Lily's mommy got out the shampoo and washed her hair. Lily loved how the shampoo smelled like flowers. She splashed around in the tub and pretended she was a mermaid. 
Later that day, Lily and her mommy went to the park. They played on the swings and went down the slide. Lily had so much fun that she didn't want to leave. But when they got home, Lily's mommy had a surprise for her. She had bought some paint and paper so they could be creative and make some artwork. Lily painted a picture of her and her mommy cooking in the kitchen. It was a beautiful picture and Lily was very proud of it.



Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. He had a red car, a yellow truck, and a blue train. But his favorite toy was a green pipe that he found in his backyard.
One day, Timmy's big sister came to play with him. She saw the green pipe and said, "That's a stupid toy. Why do you even care about it?" Timmy felt sad, but he didn't say anything.
Later that day, Timmy and his sister were playing outside. They were running and laughing when suddenly, Timmy's sister tripped and fell. She scraped her knee and started to cry. Timmy remembered the green pipe and ran to get it. He used it as a straw to blow bubbles and make his sister laugh. She stopped crying and hugged him. "You're the best brother ever," she said.
From that day on, Timmy's sister never called the green pipe a stupid toy again. She learned that it didn't matter what something looked like, as long as it made someone happy. Timmy was happy too, because he knew that he could always care for his sister when she needed him.



Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a wallet that was very important to her. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. She put her wallet on the bench and forgot about it. When she came back, her wallet was gone. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. 
Lily was sad because she had her favorite toy in the wallet. Her mom told her not to worry and they went to the lost and found. They found the wallet, but it was ugly because someone had scribbled on it. Lily was happy to have her wallet back, but sad that it looked so bad. 
Her mom told her not to worry and took out a sticker from her bag. She said, "Let's cover the ugly scribbles with this pretty sticker." Lily was excited and helped her mom cover the scribbles. Now her wallet looked beautiful again, and she was happy to have her favorite toy back.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and spin around in circles. One day, Lily decided to play a game of hide-and-seek with her friends. She ran and hid behind a wall, but the wall was weak and started to wobble.
Lily's friends searched and searched, but they couldn't find her. Suddenly, the weak wall collapsed and Lily fell down. She wasn't hurt, but she was scared. 
After that day, Lily learned to be careful when playing near weak walls. She also realized that spinning around wasn't always the safest thing to do. From then on, Lily made sure to play safely and have fun with her friends.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat melons, especially the juicy watermelon. One day, her mom brought home a big, round melon from the store. Lily was so excited to eat it, but she didn't know how to cut it open. 
Her mom showed her how to cut the melon, but it was messy and hard work. Lily decided that next time, she would ask her mom to cut it for her. From that day on, Lily enjoyed her melons without making a mess.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the garden with her toys. One day, she found a bean in the dirt. It was small and brown and looked funny. 
Lily decided to plant the bean in the ground and water it every day. She hoped it would grow big and strong like the trees in the park. But the bean struggled to grow. It was too small and weak. 
Lily felt sad, but she didn't give up. She kept watering the bean and talking to it every day. And slowly, the bean started to grow taller and taller. It was still funny-looking, but Lily didn't mind. She was happy that the bean was growing and getting stronger.



Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, her mom gave her a shiny coin to play with. Lily was so happy and she put the coin in her pocket. 
Later that day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. They were playing on the swings and having so much fun. But then, Lily started to climb up the slide. Her friends told her it was dangerous and she should behave. 
Lily listened to her friends and came down from the slide. She showed them the coin her mom gave her and they were all amazed at how high it shined in the sun. They all wanted to see it up close and Lily let them take turns holding it. It was a great day at the park and Lily learned to behave and share her special coin with her friends.
