Once there was a boy named John. He was only three years old and already he loved golf. He asked his mom if he could play golf, and she said yes.
So one day, John went to the golf course with his mom and dad. He was so excited! He tried to hit the ball but it didnt go very far. His dad said, John, keep trying! Youll get better each time.
John tried again and again. He would swing his club, but the ball would only go a few feet. He was getting frustrated. But his dad said, John, dont give up. Look at how the professionals do it.
So John kept trying and finally he hit the ball right into the hole! He was so excited. He shouted, I did it! His mom and dad gave him a big hug.
John had a lot of fun that day, even though it was messy. He kept trying, and that made all the difference.




Once there was a little girl named Amy who came across a toe on the ground. She was so surprised to see it.
Amy asked, "What does the toe belong to?" She looked around but couldn't see anyone.
The toe was cold, so it must have been outside for a while. Amy decided the toe must have belonged to a snowman.
Amy picked up the toe and began to look for a snowman who might have lost it. She searched everywhere, but couldn't find a snowman. 
Finally, Amy had an idea. She ran back home and grabbed a yellow scarf; she tied it around the toe and put it on top of a snowman she had just made.
Amy smiled and said to the snowman, "Now you have a toe to belong!"




Once there was a boy named Mark. Mark loved adventure. He was always looking for something fun to do.
One day, Mark went to the park. He saw a melon on the ground. He picked up the melon and looked at it closely.
Mark was curious. He wanted to find out what was inside. So he decided to replace the melons green skin with something else. He looked around and found some cute stickers. He carefully stuck them on the melon to make it look even more charming.
Mark took the melon home with him and showed his mom. Mom was very surprised. She asked Mark what he was going to do with the melon. Mark replied "Im going to open it and eat what's inside!" Mom smiled and said, "That sounds like fun! Let me help you."
So Mark and his mom opened the melon. Inside, they found some delicious, juicy melon. They both had fun eating the melon together. Mark thought it was the best adventure ever!




Once there was a little girl named Lila. She didn't like going to the circus because she was always so nervous. She always felt funny when the clowns where around. She really hated clowns.
One day, Lila went to the circus with her family. She was so scared of the clowns. But then, when she was walking in the circus, one clown came up to her and said "Hello, little girl". Lila was so nervous and she said to the clown "I don't like clowns. I hate them!".
The clown smiled and said "That's OK, I don't like them either". Lila was so surprised and said "You don't like clowns?". The clown replied "No, I just want to make you smile".
Lila smiled and said "Thanks". From that day on, Lila wasn't scared of clowns anymore. And she started to enjoy going to the circus.




Once there were two friends named Bob and Jack. Bob had built a very tall tower with lots of blocks. Jack was very proud of him and wanted to play too. 
Jack said to Bob, "Can I help you build the tower?"
Bob said, "Sure!"
So they worked together to build the tower together until it was very tall. Then they both relaxed and admired their work.
Bob asked, "Can I show you something special?" 
Jack said, "Yes!"
Bob showed Jack his special network. He had connected all the blocks together in a very neat pattern. Jack was very proud of Bob. 
They relaxed and enjoyed the day playing with their tower. They were happy and proud of their work.



Tina wanted to organize her toys but she was feeling shy. She wasn't sure if her brother, Ben, would help her.
"Hey, Ben do want to organize my toys with me?" Tina asked.
Ben smiled at her. "Sure! Let's do it together."
Tina was so excited! She got peanuts to use as markers for the toys.
"We can put the peanuts here to show where each toy should go," she said.
Ben smiled. "That looks great. We can organize even more things like this." 
Tina and Ben worked together and got all of Tina's toys in the right place. 
Tina was so happy she gave Ben a big hug. 
"Thanks for helping me!" she said.
Ben grinned. "Any time!"




Bella was three years old and excited to go to the park. She had been watching more birds and squirrels outside her window lately and wanted to see them in person. As she put on her shoes, her mom said to her, "Be sure to be calm at the park. Can you manage that?" Bella nodded and smiled.
At the park, Bella was amazed. The trees were tall and the sky a bright blue. She saw several ducks and birds around the pond. But what she was most excited about was all the oranges that were on the trees! She had never seen oranges on trees before. 
Bella plucked one off the tree, put it in her pocket, and ran to find her mom. Smiling, Bella gave her mom the orange. "Mommy, I managed to find an orange!"
Her mom smiled and laughed. She gave Bella a hug and said, "Yes you did! You did a great job - let's all calm down and enjoy these oranges." 
Bella, her mom, and their friends all sat down and ate the oranges, laughing and enjoying the sunny day. Bella spent the rest of the day running around and watching the birds, but she never forgot how she managed to find the orange.




Once upon a time, there was a big scaredy-cat. His name was David and he was very frightened of everything. He especially didn't like loud noises. 
One day, David heard a loud bang from the kitchen. He ran inside and saw that the fridge door was wide open. He was so scared, he started to yell "Who is there?"
Suddenly, he heard a tiny voice from inside the fridge. It was a mouse. The mouse said, "It was me! I accidentally opened the fridge door when I was trying to find something to eat!"
David was so relieved that he started to laugh. He said, "It's okay, little mouse. Let's find some food for you." The two of them searched around the kitchen until they found some cheese and the mouse was very happy. 
David and the little mouse became good friends and they shared food together every day. They both laughed and played and David never felt afraid again.




Once there was a little girl called Daisy. Daisy was three years old and she loved going on the subway. One morning, Daisy was ready to go on the subway but it was raining heavily. 
She told her mom, "Mom, I'm sad we can't zip on the subway today." 
Her mom said, "I know, Daisy, but the subway won't be safe if it keeps raining. We could go on the bus instead." 
Daisy said, "I want to zip on the subway. Please?!" 
Her mom said, "Ok, let's zip on the subway if the rain stops." They waited and waited, and then finally the rain stopped and the sky was full of blue. Daisy and her mom zipped on the subway and had a great time.




Once upon a time, there was a generous flower. She grew in a sunny field next to a big tree. The tree provided the flower with shade and the sun gave her warmth. 
One day, the flower felt so grateful for all the things the tree had done for her that she decided to thank it. She stood tall and said, "Thank you, tree! You have been so generous and kind to me." 
The tree replied, "You're welcome, flower! It's nice to be thanked." 
The flower and the tree became good friends. Together they watched the sun rise and they shared stories until the night came. 
That's how the flower and the tree came to be the best of friends. Every day, they enjoyed watching the sun rise and playing together in the shade.




Once upon a time there was a little fox called Fluffy. Fluffy loved to march and explore. One day, Fluffy saw a tray in the middle of the forest. It looked interesting. 
She said to herself, "Let me go see what's on the tray." So she marched over to see what it was.
When Fluffy reached the tray, she saw that it was full of colourful, playful toys. She said to herself, "Wow! This looks fun!"
Then, a friendly squirrel appeared and said, "Do you want to play together?"
Fluffy smiled and said, "Yes, I'd love to!"
So, Fluffy and the friendly squirrel had lots of fun playing together with the toys on the tray. They laughed and played until the sun set and it was time to go home. 
Fluffy thanked the squirrel for all the fun and said goodbye. She marched back home with a smile, excited to come back and play again another day.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Bob. He was hungry and he wanted to get something to eat. So he went to the kitchen. 
He opened the fridge and saw a delicious lemon cake inside. He grabbed it and cut it into slices. 
But when Bob wanted to eat his cake, he heard his mom shout: 
"Bob! You need to take a shower first!" 
Bob did not want to take a shower, he wanted to eat the cake! He started to cry and shout: 
"No mommy, I don't want to take a shower!" 
But his mom did not listen to him. She said that he needs to take a shower before he eats his cake. 
Bob was so sad, but he knew that his mom was right. So he went to the bathroom and took a shower. 
When he was done, he came back to the kitchen and saw that his mom had put a plate full of cake on the table. He was so happy and he ate all the cake slices in no time. 
Bob was no longer hungry, but he was very happy and his mom was very proud of him too!




Peter was a happy three year old. Every morning, he woke early and went outside to play. He liked to look up in the sky and see the bright, blue birds fly.
One day, Peter was in the yard when something special happened. He heard a funny sound coming from the tree. When he looked closely, he saw a little blue bird. He climbed up the tree and the bird said, Hello!
Hello! Peter said.
My name is Lucy, and Im looking for a new place to live. Can you help me?
Yes! Peter said.
So he took Lucy home and showed her his original birdhouse. It was blue, with a little window and door.
This is perfect, Lucy said. Its just what I was looking for! Thank you so much!
Peter smiled and was glad that he could help Lucy. He watched as she flew into the birdhouse and settled in. From then on, every morning when Peter woke, Lucy would be there to greet him, happy and chirping away.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kay. Kay was very excited because it was pizza day! She got dressed quickly and rushed to the kitchen, where the smell of delicious pizza filled the air.
"This smells yummy!" Kay exclaimed.
Mom smiled and said, "I'm sure it will be very tasty, Kay."
Kay watched as Mom took out some plates and forks. Then she spread out some napkins and said, "This will be very useful!"
Kay quickly grabbed a slice of pizza and started eating it. It was even more delicious than it smelled! She took another slice and offered it to Mom, who smiled and said, "Thank you, Kay. This pizza is delicious." 
Kay and Mom kept eating until every last slice was gone. Then Kay jumped up and said, "That was a really useful pizza!"




Once upon a time, there was a chubby little bear named Tim. He loved to explore the woods around his home. One day, he found something special. He discovered a big pot bubbling away. He peered inside and saw something he had never seen before - soup! Tim was excited to find this soup and he couldn't wait to try it.
He asked the pot, "What is this soup?" The soup answered in a bubbling voice "I am a delicious vegetable soup!" Tim was so excited. He decided to try some of the soup to see how it tasted. He slurped up a spoonful and smiled widely. It was so yummy!
Tim wanted to share the delicious soup with his friends. He ran off to find his pals. As he searched, he shouted to everyone, "Come on, come and try the soup I discovered! It's the best soup ever!" 
Soon, lots of Tim's friends had gathered around the pot to try the yummy soup. They all slurped it up and smiled widely. 
"This soup is so delicious," said one of Tim's friends.
"Yes!" Tim agreed. "My discovery was the best!" Everyone cheered and they all enjoyed the soup together. 
The moral of the story: Discovering something wonderful can be even more enjoyable when shared with friends!




Once upon a time there was a smart nurse. She was always happy and loved to skip around the hospital. Every day she skipped to the patients' rooms and made them smile.
One day, she saw a little boy in the corner. He was sad, so the nurse asked him why he was so sad.
The little boy said, "I want to skip, but I don't know how."
The nurse said, "Oh, it's okay. I can help you learn. Come on, let's try!"
So the nurse and the little boy skipped around the hospital. The little boy got better and better at skipping with each step, until finally he was skipping just like the nurse.
They both laughed and smiled, and the little boy's sadness was gone. From then on, the nurse and the little boy skipped around the hospital every day, making everyone happy.




Once upon a time, there was a princess named Claire. Claire lived in a castle and was very popular.
One day, Claire went for a walk in the woods. She heard a strange noise and went to investigate.
Suddenly, a wizard appeared! The wizard said, "I can grant you one wish!"
Claire thought for a moment and then said, "I'd like to know a special spell!"
The wizard said, "No! That's too hard for you. I won't give it to you!"
Claire replied, "But why not? I'm very smart!"
The wizard said, "It's too powerful. I can't let you use it."
So Claire sadly refused and went home. She never got the spell, but she was still happy and popular! The End.




Once upon a time there was a chubby bear who lived in a forest. One day the bear was so thirsty he could hardly think. He wandered around trying to find something to drink.
Suddenly, he saw something that made him so happy! He had discovered a pool of steam. He put his face close to it and took a big drink. He was so thankful that he had found something to drink.
The bear said, "Thank you steam, you have saved me!" 
The steam replied, "You are so welcome. I am happy I could help you."
The bear thanked the steam once more and then continued on his way. He was so grateful for the steam, he never forgot it!




Once upon a time, there was a duck. He was strong and powerful. He lived in a pond near the forest.
One day, the duck saw something moving near the forest. It was a little boy. The duck quacked him and said, "Hi there! What are you doing here?"
The little boy looked scared. He said, "I'm trying to resist the bad wolf!"
The duck laughed and said, "That's a brave thing to do. Here, let me help you!"
The duck and the little boy worked together and soon, the bad wolf ran away. The duck was so strong and powerful that the wolf was too afraid to stay.
The little boy thanked the duck and said, "You are really brave. Thank you for helping me resist the bad wolf!"
The duck replied, "Don't worry. I'm always here to help!"



Once there was an old barn in a quiet meadow. Every day the animals would come out to play, and the barn was home to an old horse. The horse would gently neigh and the other animals would talk with him.
One day, the animals noticed something strange. A little girl came and stood outside the barn. She had a basket of food and some carrots. She was very gentle and the animals were curious.
The horse walked up to the girl. He softly pushed his muzzle against her hand and she smiled. She whispered something in the horse's ear.
The horse broke into a trot and the animals followed behind him. He ran up to the little girl and she laughed. She put the carrots in his mane and gave him a hug.
The animals were so happy. Even the chickens were chirping. The old horse talked to the girl, and she listened to all the stories he wanted to tell. 
The little girl left after giving the animals food and love. The animals waved goodbye and the old horse said "Thank You" in a gentle neigh.



 
Once upon a time, there were three friends. The friends were all named Lucy, Millie and Bill. They were all very helpful, always helping each other out in any way they could. 
One day, Bill said to the girls, I have an idea! Lets stay together and all four of us will have lots of fun! The girls were very excited and agreed to unite as friends.
They went to the park together and played games. They had so much fun that they wanted to stay together forever. They laughed and smile and were very happy. 
Millie said, We should always stay together and always stay helpful to each other. That way, we can have lots of fun, every single day. Lucy and Bill agreed and they all gave each other a high-five to make sure that their plan worked. The friends hugged each other and decided to stay together forever. 
The end.




John was a generous boy who liked to perform. Everyday, he would do tricks for his family and friends and make them laugh. One day John had a very special trick to show. He put out his thumb and said,"Watch this".
John's mom watched and said,"What are you going to do, honey?"
John looked up at her with a huge smile and said,"I'm going to make my thumb disappear!"
John closed his fist and waved it around, then opened it slowly. Sure enough, his thumb had vanished! John's family and friends were amazed and cheered with laughter.
John had performed the best trick yet. He was so proud of himself. From then on, he kept performing amazing tricks, and everyone continued to be amazed.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Molly. One day Molly was feeling very busy, which made her sad. But her mommy was there to make her feel better.
"What's wrong Molly?" Mommy asked.
Molly answered "I'm busy and sad."
Mommy smiled and said "Let's take a break together. We can do something fun."
Mommy opened a big folder. It was filled with pictures of happy things. Molly looked closely at the pictures and started to feel better.
"Look Molly", said Mommy, "a fish, and a tree, and a butterfly!"
Molly laughed as she pointed at all of the happy things in the folder. Mommy looked at Molly and put her arm around her.
"We'll look at these together," said Mommy, "It's ok to be busy. But don't forget, I'm here to comfort you too."
Molly smiled and said "Thank you Mommy" And they started looking at the happy things in the folder together.




Mum and Ben were friends. They liked to play together.
Today they wanted to go on an adventure. They went west, along the path.
Mum said, "Let's jog. It will be fun!" Ben was excited.
They jogged together, buzzing with energy. They stopped to take a break by a big tree.
Mum said, "I have a tasty surprise for you!" She pulled out an apple and smiled at Ben. 
Ben gasped, "Wow! Is it for me?" 
Mum nodded and said, "Yes, it's all for you. Enjoy!" 
Ben happily took a bite of the tasty apple. He felt so lucky to have a best friend like Mum.




One day there was a large guard. He was tall and had a big smile. He walked around the town and said hello to everyone he met.
One day he met a little girl. She was very small and had bright eyes. She asked the guard, "Will you play with me?" The guard said, "Yes, I would love to play with you!"
The guard then took the little girl to a river. He said, "Let me show you how to wash your hands." He showed her how to splash some water on her hands and how to rub them together. 
The little girl smiled and said, "This is fun!" The guard smiled back and said, "It sure is!"
After they finished washing their hands, the guard gave the little girl a hug. He said, "It was so nice to meet you. I'll see you around!"
The little girl smiled, waved goodbye, and ran back home. She was proud of herself for learning how to wash her hands.



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She saw a beautiful rose and wanted to get closer. She put out her hand and the rose felt smooth.
The little girl smiled, and said Hi rose!
The rose responded with a gentle voice, Hello!
Surprised, the little girl jumped back. She asked, Are you alive? 
The rose replied, Yes, I am alive! I arrived at this garden today. I am so happy to meet you!
The little girl smiled and said, Me too! She moved closer and touched the rose petals with her hand. The rose smiled and said, Thank you for being so gentle.
The little girl hugged the rose, feeling happy and excited. From that day on, the little girl and the beautiful rose were the best friends.




Once upon a time there was a little boy named Bobby. He loved to play outside and loved the ocean. One day, Bobby went to the beach. He saw the mighty waves crashing against the shore. He loved the way the water waved back and forth! Bobby belonged in the ocean.
He went running into the water. Suddenly, Bobby noticed a large wave coming for him. He was scared and ran out of the ocean. When the wave passed, Bobby felt brave! He balled his fists and ran back into the ocean.
Bobby looked out to the horizon. He noticed something hop in and out of the waves. It was a dolphin! Bobby waved, calling out to the dolphin. The dolphin waved back, making Bobby feel like he belonged in the sea. Together they spent a wonderful day, playing in the mighty waves.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Jenny. She loved to skip in the park. One day as she was feeling happy, she saw a big lollipop lying on the grass. Jenny ran over and picked it up.
"It's mine now," she said, taking a big lick. 
Suddenly, an old man with a frown on his face approached her. "That's my lollipop," he said in a stern voice.
Jenny felt ashamed. She was too embarrassed to say anything and just gave him the lollipop.
The old man thanked her. He said, "You should never take something that doesn't belong to you."
Jenny nodded. "I'm sorry," she said, and ran off to skip in the park. 
From then on, Jenny remembered the old man's words. She always asked permission before taking things that weren't hers.




They were both eager for food. Little Tucker and his mommy were in the kitchen and Tucker was chewing on an apple. His mommy was sorting the laundry.
"Tucker, don't get your apple in the laundry," his mommy said, shaking her finger.
Tucker stopped chewing and looked at his mommy. He grinned, then whispered, "Sorry, Mommy."
"It's okay. Just don't do it again," his mommy said with a smile.
Tucker cheered and continued to chew his apple. He was so happy to be with his mommy. They were both eager to get their lunch. 
The laundry was soon finished and Tucker and his mommy sat down to have lunch. Tucker was happy, content to just sit and chew his food.
What a great time for Tucker and his mommy!



Musa was a little boy who loved to explore the world. One day, he decided to take a ride in his neighbour's car. He asked the driver for a joyride and the driver said yes.
Musa was so excited as he got into the front seat. As the driver started the car, Musa shouted with joy.
But when they reached the beach, Musa felt a bit scared. There was no one around and the sky was dark. The driver urged Musa to get out, so Musa slowly opened the door and kneeled on the sand. His little heart was full of fear.
The driver saw that Musa was scared and said, "It's alright, Musa. I'll stay with you until the sun rises."
Musa smiled, reassured by the driver's kind words. The two of them stayed there until the sun slowly rose in the sky and the fear slowly faded away. 
That day, Musa learned that he should never be fearful, no matter what.




John was a young boy. One day, he decided to organize a truck parade. He lined up his collection of trucks in the driveway and waited for his friends to arrive. 
Suddenly, a distant truck sounded its horn. Everyone got excited as the truck slowly crept closer. After a few minutes, it stopped in front of John's house. Prom its cab emerged a tall man.
John ran up to him and asked, "Can you help me organize my trucks?" 
The man smiled and said, "Of course! I can show you how to arrange them in a line."
John nodded his head and the two of them got to work. Soon, the driveway was full of brightly colored trucks that they had organized together. 
John and the man stood back and admired their work. John was so happy that he thanked the man and asked if he could join the parade too. 
The man smiled again and said, "It would be my pleasure!" He jumped in his truck and drove away with the rest of the trucks in tow.
John watched them until they were just a distant memory. He was so proud of what he had accomplished that day.




Once upon a time there was a huge book. The book was loved by a little girl named Sue. Every day she would give the book a huge hug.
One day, Sues mommy gave her a pair of scissors. You can use these to cut, her mom said.
Sue was so excited. She grabbed the scissors and ran straight to the huge book. Sue started cutting and cutting. She trimmed the pages into shapes, drew lines and designs. She was so proud of all the new shapes she made.
Suddenly, Sue heard someone calling her name. It was her mommy. Sue, why did you cut the book? Mommy asked. She looked really mad.
Sue was scared, but she was brave to admit her mistake. I wanted to make it look pretty, she said. 
Mommy gave Sue a hug. I know you meant well, but next time, you must ask permission before you cut anything, okay? 
Sue nodded her head, and she and her mommy hugged the huge book together.




Jim was out for a jog one morning. He ran down the street and noticed something. He could hear a noise coming from the house at the end of the block. He stopped and listened. Then he heard it again. It sounded like someone crying. 
Jim ran to the house. He saw a thin woman at the door. She was crying. He asked her what was wrong.
"My son," she said. "He's gone. He was playing in the park but now I can't find him. I've been calling his name but he isn't coming home."
"Maybe he's still in the park," Jim said. "Let's go together and look for him. I'll help you."
The woman thanked him. So they went to the park. They searched but there was no sign of the little boy.
Just then, Jim heard a noise in the bushes. He looked closely and saw a thin arm reaching out. He smiled and said, "I think I found him!"
Jim and the woman gathered the little boy out of the bushes and hugged him. He was happy to be back with his mum.
They all thanked Jim for his help and the little boy gave him a big hug. And after that, Jim went back to his jog.




Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was 3 years old and very creative. One day, Lucy was playing outside when she saw a big, green vine. She wanted to climb it, so she asked her mom if she could. Her mom said yes, so she jumped up and grabbed it. 
"Make sure you don't delay," said Lucy's mom. "Okay mom!" Lucy said.
So she started climbing. She went higher and higher until she got to the top. From up there, she could see her whole house and the trees in the backyard. 
"Wow, it's so nice up here," Lucy said. 
She looked around and noticed some beautiful pink flowers growing on the vine. She saw that they were going to bloom soon, so she didn't want to delay. She quickly picked them and ran down the vine. 
"Look Mommy, I got some flowers for us! Lucy said. 
Her mom smiled and thanked her for the flowers. 
"See, I knew you were creative," her mom said. 
Lucy smiled and hugged her mom. It was a great day and Lucy was so happy.




Once upon a time there was a chubby little bear called Ben. He had lots of friends who he liked to play with every day. 
One day, Ben and his friends were playing in the park when they saw a big green bean in the grass. "Look what I found!" Ben said. 
Ben's friends were excited and asked him what the bean was. "I don't know," said Ben. 
Ben's friends all had ideas of what to do with the bean. One suggested they cook it. Another suggested they play games with it. 
But Ben just smiled and said he had a different idea. Then he hugged the bean tight and held it in his arms.
His friends laughed and Ben laughed too. "This bean is my new friend," Ben said. 
And that's how Ben got his new chubby green friend and they have been together ever since.




Once upon a time, there was a morning sun. It shone down on a small kitchen where two little friends were busy.
"Let's cook some breakfast!" said one.
"Sure!" said the other.
The two got to work. One friend put an iron in some water, and the other took some food from the fridge.
"I'll make some eggs!" said the first friend. "But I need something to cook them on!"
The second friend went to the closet and took out a flexible pan.
"This pan is perfect!" he said. "Let's cook!"
So the two friends cooked some eggs. They stirred them up with a spoon until they were ready. 
Finally, they both sat down to eat. It was a delicious breakfast that they had cooked together!




Once upon a time, there was a fair princess named Lucy. She had golden hair and rosy cheeks. Lucy was playing in the garden when suddenly a big cloud of smoke appeared! She was very scared, but the smoke began to change. It turned into a big, fluffy, white dog.
"Hello, Princess Lucy", said the dog.
Lucy was very surprised. "Hi, Dog. What's your name?"
"My name is Cloudy. I'm here to take you on an adventure!", said the dog.
"Really?", asked Lucy.
Cloudy nodded his head.
So, Lucy and Cloudy flew off in the sky. They saw many things that were beautiful and strange. Everywhere they went, people said how fair Lucy looked, with her golden hair and rosy cheeks. 
At the end of the day, Cloudy flew Lucy back to her garden. She gave him a big hug and thanked him for the wonderful adventure. 
Cloudy smiled and said, "It was my pleasure. I'll come back soon!" Then he flew off into the sky, leaving a trail of fluffy white smoke behind him. 
Lucy watched until the smoke faded away. 
The end.



Mum was getting ready to go out. She put on a dress and asked her daughter, "Are you ready, dear?"
The little girl nodded excitedly and said, "Yes! I'm ready. I'm wearing my pretty dress."
Mum smiled and said, "Okay, let's go outside and play. Remember to stay safe and play nice."
The girl skipped outside to the garden. She loved to explore and find out what she could discover.
Mum watched her daughter play happily. She was happy that her daughter was safe and was glad to have prepared the dress for her.
The little girl found a big tree and a pond full of frogs. She was excited and called out to her mum, "Look, mummy! I'm playing with my dress and I'm safe."
Mum smiled and said, "I'm glad you're being safe. Have fun, my darling."
The girl smiled and continued to explore the garden. She was so happy to be having fun in her pretty dress!




The sun was shining brighter than ever. Lucy and Jack had been playing outside in the open fields for what seemed like hours.
"Let's get ice cream!" said Lucy.
"No, I don't want ice cream," disagreed Jack.
Lucy felt sad and started to cry. "But why not, Jack?" she asked.
Jack was quiet for a moment, and then he said, "Let's find the river instead. We can clean our skin and cool down!"
Lucy stopped crying and smiled. "Great idea, Jack!" she said.
So, Lucy and Jack ran as fast as they could to the river. They dipped their toes and splashed their arms, then they laughed and played some more.
When it was almost time to go home, Jack and Lucy agreed that the river was much more fun than getting ice cream!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to play.
One day, Sarah wanted to sort her toys. She grabbed her buckets, dolls and blocks and started sorting. She got so busy that she didn't notice the drain in the floor.
When she was almost done, Sarah's foot got stuck in the drain. It was stuck so tight that Sarah couldn't get it out! She started to cry.
Just then, Sarah's mom came in. She saw what had happened and asked "What's wrong, Sarah?" Sarah replied through her tears: "My foot is stuck in the drain!" 
Mom said "Let me help you. Don't worry, I know how to sort this out!" She crouched down and grabbed Sarah's foot. With a long, strong pull she managed to free Sarah's foot from the drain.
Sarah was so happy! She thanked her mom and hugged her tight. From then on, Sarah was more careful when she was sorting.




Once upon a time there was a boy named Tom. Tom loved to play and have adventures in the forest near his home. One day, as he was walking through the forest he heard a soft voice. He stopped to listen and the voice said, "Hello Tom! I am a magical fairy".
Tom was so excited and asked, "What can you do?" The fairy smiled and said, "I can do lots of things, but I'm very intelligent so I can make special things happen."
Tom asked the fairy if it could make him fly. The fairy thought for a moment then said, "Yes, I can make it happen. But you have to stop for a minute. Can you do that?"
Tom stopped and the fairy waved his wand. Tom felt himself start to float and smiled with delight. He waved goodbye to the fairy and flew away feeling very lucky to have a magical fairy friend.




Once upon a time, there was a family with a little girl. Her name was Chloe. 
One day, her mommy took her to the backyard. Chloe saw something wonderful waiting for her. It was a slide! She was so glad. 
Chloe's mommy said, "Chloe, mommy is here to provide you this slide. You can go down the slide whenever you want!"
Chloe was so excited. She said, "Yay, yippee!" 
Her mommy smiled, and Chloe instantly ran over to the slide and climbed onto it. She went up, down, up, down sliding all day.
Chloe was so glad that she had a slide in her backyard. She thanked her mommy for providing it, and Chloe smiled and laughed as she played.




Robbie was walking down the hill. It was a bright, red day. Robbie was wearing his red cap. 
He saw a mailbox at the bottom of the hill. He was curious. He had never seen a mailbox before. 
He asked his mom what it was.
"That's a mailbox," said his mom. "It's where people mail letters."
Robbie was excited. He wanted to mail a letter. 
His mom told him he could mail a letter if he wanted to. Robbie found a piece of paper and wrote a letter to his best friend. 
He went to the mailbox and put the letter inside. He felt very proud that he had mailed it all by himself.




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ella. Ella's mom gave her a hammer with a big red handle. She was so excited to go play with it!
Ella went outside with her hammer and looked around. She saw a big tree in the garden and thought it would be fun to hammer it. She started to hammer the tree with the hammer and it felt so good.
Suddenly, Ella's mom called out to her.
"Ella, come here," she said.
Ella went back inside as her mom said, "You cannot play with a hammer if you don't eat healthy food."
Ella was sad that she couldn't play with the hammer but she still wanted to stay healthy. So, Ella decided to find some healthy snacks and start eating them. She found some carrots and apples, so she enjoyed eating them.
After eating healthy food, Ella felt so much better. She was so happy that she could go play with the hammer again. She continued to hammer the tree and was very proud of her healthy snacks.



 
There was a little girl named Jenny. She had bright blue eyes and long, curly brown hair. She always liked to look in the mirror and see how beautiful her hair was. One day, Jenny's mom took her to the park.
Jenny was running around and playing with the other kids when she saw a girl with long, blond hair. Jenny thought she looked so attractive! She wanted her own hair to look like that. 
"Mommy, can I look like the girl in the park?" Jenny asked.
Her mother smiled and said, "You can, Jenny. Let's go get you some clips and bows for your hair."
Jenny was so excited! She couldn't wait to see how pretty her hair would look with the new accessories. 
When she looked in the mirror, Jenny was amazed. She was so proud of her beautiful, curly brown hair! She couldn't stop smiling. 
From then on, Jenny loved to look in the mirror and check out her pretty hair. She was so happy when she saw how attractive it was!




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Annie. Annie had a special pole that she loved and she always played with it in her backyard. One day, Annie wanted to show her pole to her friends. She ran to their yards and waved the pole in the air. Her friends laughed and clapped their hands. 
Annie was so proud that she kneeled down on the ground and hugged her pole. But when she stood up, the pole had cracked and the tip was broken. Annie felt very ashamed. She ran and hid behind a bush. 
Her friends found her and asked, "What's wrong, Annie?" 
Annie replied, "My pole is broken. I'm so ashamed." 
One of her friends said, "Don't be sad. We'll help you fix it." 
All of her friends knelt down around her and together they put the pole back together.
The next day, Annie was playing with her pole again and she was so happy. She knew she had great friends who always there to help.




It was the day of the festival. Everyone was excited and dressed up in their brightest clothes. The sun was shining, making it a fair day.
Alice and her family were ready to march in the parade. They all wore their sweetest smiles and waved to their friends as they marched. 
Alice could hardly contain her excitement. She shouted, 'Mummy, let's march faster!'
Mummy laughed and said, 'No Alice, we must march like everyone else!' 
Alice and her family continued to march around the festival until they reached the end. They were all very tired, but happy. 
Alice said, 'Mummy, that was such a fun festival! Can we go again tomorrow?'
Mummy smiled and said, 'We'll see, but for now let's go home and have a rest.' 
Alice and her family held hands and marched back home after a very fun and fair day at the festival.




Once there was a girl who loved to play. She owned three toys; a teddy bear, a ball and a piece of wool. Every day she would make up games for these three toys. 
One day, she was playing with the wool when an idea came to her. She said to the wool "Let's be crazy!" The wool just lay there. 
The girl was a little disappointed, so she hopped up and ran over to the teddy bear. To the teddy bear she said, "Let's go crazy!" 
The bear smiled and said "Yes! Let's go crazy, with the wool!" 
So the girl, the teddy bear and the piece of wool all ran around in circles and laughed and shouted until they were all out of breath. After that, they lay down in a heap and the girl said, "That was so much fun!" 
The playmates all agreed and they had many more days of playing crazy together.



Mom was worried. Her little girl was feeling troubled and sad. Mom wanted to help her feel better.
"Let's clean," Mom said.
The little girl looked up questioningly. "Clean?" she asked.
"Yes," Mom laughed. "Let's go to the sea and clean the beach together. Will you help me?"
The little girl smiled and nodded yes. Mom grabbed her broom and they went outside.
When they reached the sea, the little girl was excited. Together, they worked hard to pick up any rubbish they saw. They found a lot of cans and bottles. After they finished, they looked around and everything was clean.
The little girl was happy. She hugged Mom and smiled. Mom smiled back. She was happy too. Her daughter was no longer troubled and could enjoy this special moment at the sea.




Billy was a cheerful three year old boy who liked to explore the world around him. One warm day, he invited his friend Timmy to borrow his bike and go for a ride.
"Hey Timmy!" Billy shouted as he handed over a tangerine-orange helmet. "I can lend you my bike so we can go on an adventure!"
"Cool!" Timmy exclaimed as he grabbed the helmet. "Thanks Billy!"
The two boys put on their helmets and started riding down the street. As the wind brushed against their faces, they laughed and cheered with joy. After a while, they came up to a nearby hill. Billy waved his hand, signaling for Timmy to go first.
Timmy pedaled faster and faster, racing down the hill. Billy cheered him on as he laughed and clapped his hands. Finally, Timmy crossed the finish line and the two boys high-fived each other.
Billy and Timmy had a great time spending the day together. The sun was setting as they returned the helmets and went home, their cheeks rosy and smiles wide.




Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Fred. He lived in a nest in the east, close to the sea.
One morning, Fred felt anxious. He wanted to fly far away. He asked his mama, Can I go flying? Please?
His mama said, Yes, of course! You can go east, just be careful. And come back before dark.
Fred felt happy and excited. He spread his wings and took off into the sky.
He flew east, over the forest and the river, until he came to a big mountain. It was so high, he could not see the top. He was scared, but also excited.
He kept flying and eventually he reached the peak of the mountain. He looked down and saw a lake so blue, it was like a piece of the sky. He felt so happy, he flew circles in the air.
When the sun started to set, Fred flew back home. He was so tired, but he was also happy. He flew back to his nest in the east and cuddled up in his mamas wings.
The End.




Once upon a time there was a girl named Sally. She had a purple pillow that she loved very much. Whenever she was sad or hurt, she would cuddle up with her pillow and think.
One day Sally was feeling very lonely. She thought of how nice it would be to have a friend to play with. She put her head down on her pillow, closed her eyes and thought.
Suddenly, Sally heard a voice from the pillow! It said, "What's wrong Sally? You seem so sad!"
Sally was so surprised she jumped up! She asked, "Who are you?"
The pillow said, "My name is Purple Pillow. I'm here to be your friend!"
Sally smiled. She thought that a purple pillow as a friend was better than nothing. "All right then," she said, "Let's be friends!"
And from that day on, Sally and her purple pillow were best friends. They played and talked and laughed every day. Sally was never lonely again.




Timmy was so excited. His mommy had said he could pick out whatever he wanted at the store. So he followed her around as she put things in her cart. He looked at all the toys and so many things he wanted to buy. 
Suddenly he saw something that caught his eye - a bright red tray. He was so excited and couldn't wait to get it! He asked his mom, "Can I buy it?"
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can buy it. But it's harmless, so be careful!" 
So with a big smile, Timmy got the tray. He hugged it tight and that night, he showed it to all his friends. Everyone agreed the tray was fun and harmless. 
Timmy's mom was happy too - she was glad that Timmy was able to buy something he was so excited about.
The End




Once upon a time there was a mommy, a daddy and a baby. They were going on a walk down a long road.
The baby was so excited. He jumped up and down with joy. "Wheeee!," he yelled.
Suddenly, the road got a little bumpy. The baby was frightened.
Mommy asked, "Are you alright, baby?"
The baby said, "Yes, I'm okay. This road is bumpy. I'm a little scared."
Daddy smiled and said, "It's okay to be scared. We'll make sure you're safe."
The mommy and daddy held tight onto the baby's hands and led him along the road. He was no longer scared and smiled happily.
The end.




Once upon a time there was a kid called Joe. Joe liked to keep his room tidy and organised. One day, his friend came over to play in his room. Joe showed his friend all his neat toys, but then they started to quarrel over them.
"That's my toy!" shouted Joe. 
"No, it's mine!" shouted his friend back.
The two of them were having a big quarrel and they couldn't agree. Joe started to get upset and began to cry. 
Just then, his mum came into the room. She saw the two kids quarreling and she knew she had to do something.
She sat them both down and said, "Now, now. It's alright to play with the same toys, but you must take turns. That's the only way to be fair." 
Joe and his friend both agreed to be fair. Then they started to play nice and have fun with Joe's tidy room.




Once upon a time there was a silly rabbit, her name was Roxy. Roxy was always looking for adventures.
One day, Roxy saw a map. She thought it looked so exciting. "Let's go explore!" she said to her friends, Flip and Bob.
They all grabbed their backpacks, put on warm clothes and got ready to adventure. They took the map with them and followed the directions.
Roxy looked up and pointed. "Look everyone! There's a castle up there!"
So, they all ran up to the castle and when they got there, there was a big sign that said, "TIE A RIBBON HERE TO CLAIM THIS CASTLE!"
Roxy smiled and rummaged through her backpack. She pulled out a long, green ribbon and began to tie it to the castle wall.
When she was done, her friends cheered.
"Congratulations Roxy! You found the castle!" said Flip.
Roxy smiled with pride and said happily, "We have a castle now!"




Jack was so excited today because he was going to the park! He put on his pants and ran outside in the sun. He felt important because he could do so many things.
On the way to the park, Jack saw a funny looking dog. He asked his mom why the dog didn't have pants. Mom told Jack he belonged in the wild so he didn't need pants. Jack thought that was funny.
When they finally arrived at the park, Jack ran to the playground. He went straight to the slides and slid down the dry, slippery slides. He loved the park!
Jack and his mom walked to a grassy spot where he could play catch with his new ball. He threw the ball as hard as he could, but it didn't go very far. He was getting frustrated when his mom said "Jack, that ball doesn't belong here. Why don't we find a place to put it so other kids can play with it too?"
Jack agreed and they found a big bin behind the slide. Jack threw the ball inside the bin and felt proud that he found a place for it to belong.




Once upon a time, there was a hairy neighbor who lived next door. Everyday, he rose early and went outside to do his chores.
One day, a curious three-year-old boy watched his neighbor as he left his house. He heard his neighbor say, "Good morning beautiful day!"
The curious boy followed him. When his neighbor heard the boy's footsteps, he turned around and smiled. "Oh hello there! How can I help you?" he asked.
The boy replied, "I just wanted to know why you rise so early everyday."
The neighbor replied, "Well, I wake up early so that I can do all my chores in the morning. Then I can have the rest of the day for fun!"
The boy smiled and thanked his neighbor for his wise advice. He went back home and thought about all the fun things he could do if he rose early. 
From that day on, the curious boy rose early everyday, happy with the knowledge his neighbor had shared.




Once upon a time, there was a strong ostrich who lived in the jungle. He was very proud and refused to surrender to any other animal.
One day, a lion sauntered into the jungle and challenged the ostrich for the title of king. The ostrich refused to back down.
The lion thundered, "I must be king of the jungle. Surrender or face the consequences!"
The ostrich stood proud and shouted, "Never! I will never surrender!"
The lion roared, but the ostrich was not scared. He stayed very strong and refused to back down. Eventually the lion gave up and left the jungle.
The ostrich remained the king of the jungle, proud and strong. He never surrendered.




Once upon a time there was a little girl called Ella. Ella was very curious and she loved exploring.
One day she went to her school and she saw a damaged blackboard near the entrance. She walked up to it and she looked around carefully.
Ella noticed that it was broken and so she wanted to repair it. She asked her teacher for help and her teacher said,
"That's an interesting challenge. Do you think you can fix it?"
Ella nodded eagerly and she got to work. She went looking for the tools she needed and eventually she managed to repair the blackboard.
"Wow, Ella. You did a great job!", her teacher said.
Ella smiled proudly. She was glad to see the blackboard fixed. It was such an interesting adventure!




Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old. One day, Sarah saw a big stair. It was very tall. She wanted to go up the stair, but it was so high. She looked scared.
Suddenly, a voice came from behind her.
"Sarah, what's wrong?" it asked.
Sarah turned around. It was her mom.
"Mom," Sarah said, "The stair is so high. I am scared."
Her mom smiled and said, "It's OK, Sarah. You can do it. Just take it one step at a time and be safe."
Sarah smiled and nodded. She took a deep breath and started walking up the stair. Every step, she said to herself "safe, safe, safe."
Finally, she made it to the top. She looked around and asked, "Mom, did I do it?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Sarah. You did it! You were very brave."
Sarah was very happy and proud of herself. She knew that she could do it if she was safe!



Kris and her mom went to the park. It was cold outside. Mom spread a blanket on the grass and they lay down.
Kris saw some big trees and asked, "Mom, what are those?"
Mom replied, "Those are trees. See the big roots coming out of the ground? That's where they get their food."
Kris was curious, so she asked, "Can we go closer and touch the roots?"
"Sure," said Mom. 
So they walked over to the tree. Kris touched the root. It felt cold and firm. She imagined it was the tree's mouth, eating up the food. She smiled and said, "This is cool!"




Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He was very excited because today he was going to play with his baseball.
Timmy ran outside with his mom and dad. He saw a big, green field and a lot of colorful flowers. He looked up into the sky and saw a big white cloud.
Timmy's dad took out a baseball and threw it up into the sky. Timmy was so excited and he jumped up and down.
Timmy chased after the baseball and the baseball flew all the way across the field. He soon found the colorful baseball sitting in the grass.
Timmy ran over to pick it up and he said to his dad, "Can I keep it?"
"Yes," his dad smiled. "Now you can always remember this day and all the fun you had jumping across the field."
And Timmy did just that. He kept the baseball close and remembered all the fun he had chasing after it.



Mama and Daddy were in the garden. Daddy found a cauliflower growing in the dirt. He was so excited and called Mama over to see.
Mama said, "That's a big cauliflower! What should we do with it?"
Daddy said, "Let's give it to Grandma. She'll love it."
Mama and Daddy went inside to get ready. Mama brought a basket and put the warm cauliflower inside. Then they brought the basket to Grandma's house.
When they arrived, Grandma was very happy. She gave Mama and Daddy hugs and thanked them for the special cauliflower. She said, "What a nice surprise!"
Mama said, "We hope you enjoy it!"
Grandma smiled and said, "I will. It's going to make a delicious dinner."



 
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was 3 years old. She had an ambition to ride on the subway all by herself.
One day, Lucy asked her mother "Can I take the subway by myself?" Her mother said, "No, it's too dangerous. You might get lost".
Lucy was angry. She wanted to prove that she was brave enough to take the subway. Then she came up with a crazy idea.
She took an ice cream and she melted it. When the ice cream melted and became a liquid, Lucy put it in a bowl. She painted her face with the liquid and it looked like she was a grown up.
When her mother saw her, she was shocked and said, "That's amazing! You look like you are 20 years old. Look at you, you crazy girl!"
"Now I can take the subway by myself," Lucy said with a smile.
So, Lucy took the subway, and she had a great time. She counted all the stops and made sure she was safe. 
When she finally reached her destination, she ran to her mother's arms and said, "Mom, I did it! I took the subway all by myself!"
Her mother smiled and hugged her tight and said, "You did it! You are so brave, my little girl."




Once upon a time there was a little lion. He was so cute and he liked to roar. He thought he was the best roarer in the land. One sunny day, the little lion went for a walk. Then he heard a loud roar! He was so surprised. He shouted "Who is there?".
The loud roar answered back, "It is me, an elephant. I roar louder than you!" The little lion was not sure. He thought he had the loudest roar. So he said back, "No I roar loudest!" Then the elephant said, "Why don't we have a roar contest and see who is right?"
The little lion agreed. He roared as loud as he could and the elephant roared louder! Everyone cheered for the elephant. The little lion was so surprised. He was happy too - the lion had made a new friend!




John was a good boy. He liked to create new things. One day, he wanted to make some boots. His mom gave him some supplies and he got to work. He glued different pieces of fabric together and sewed on some laces. When he finished, he was very proud of his boots. 
Mommy, look! he said, holding up the boots.
Oh, wow! his mom said. You did a really good job.
John smiled. He wore his new boots outside and ran around in the sunshine. He was proud of his creative work and was happy to have made something all on his own.




Once there was a brilliant boy named Jack. One day he found a hammer in the garden. Jack was excited and he ran to show his dad.
"Look, Daddy! A hammer! Can I cover it with paint?" Jack was so pleased with his find.
"Of course, my boy!" Dad said. He showed Jack how to cover it with paint. Jack worked so hard, covering and covering until the hammer was a bright red colour.
"It looks wonderful!" Jack's dad said. Jack smiled with delight.
"It's brilliant!" he said.
And from that day, Jack was never without his hammer. Everywhere he went he was sure to have it with him. He was so proud of his handyman tool.




Once upon a time there was a sand castle by the sea. It was tall and strong. Inside the castle lived a brave prince, who loved to play in the sand.
One day, a giant wave came and knocked down the castle. The prince was very sad. He looked around. Everything was gone.
Then suddenly, he heard a voice. Hello! 
He looked up. A seagull was flying above him. 
The prince asked, What can I do?
The seagull answered, Use your shovel! Sharp it in the sand and build your castle again! 
The prince felt better. He got out his shovel and began to dig. He worked and worked until he had rebuilt the sand castle.
The prince was so happy, his troubles were gone. He thanked the seagull and they played together all day in the sand.




Once upon a time, there were two friends who lived in a happy house. One day, they decided to go outside and find something to do. As they looked around, they noticed a big rock.
"Wow!" said one friend to the other, "that rock sure is big. What should we do with it?"
The other friend thought for a moment, then had a great idea. "Let's add some cheerful colors to the rock!" she said excitedly. 
The friends then took out a bunch of paint. They added lovely colors to the rock and made it a work of art. When they were finished, the friends stepped back to admire their work. 
The cheerful colors made the rock even more beautiful. Both friends smiled and hugged each other to show their happiness. 
They then decided they had found the perfect thing to do and they ran back to their happy house, ready to tell their families all about it.




One day, a young girl named Claire was walking in the park. She saw a wish tree shining in the sun. It had many sparkling leaves, each one holding a wish.
Claire thought hard about what her wish might be. Finally, she decided to choose one. She looked around at all the wish leaves. One of them was pale, like the sunlight that sparkled off of all the others. Claire smiled as she plucked it off the tree.
"What did you choose?" asked a friendly voice behind her.
Claire turned around and saw an older woman. Claire explained that she'd chosen the pale wish leaf.
"Ah, a wise choice! Not all the wishes will come true, but you never know," said the woman. She winked at Claire before walking away.
Claire smiled and looked back at the tree. She tucked her wish leaf into her pocket and made a secret wish. She smiled and skipped home, confident that her wish would come true.



Once upon a time, there was a clumsy princess who had found some treasure. She was so happy, she started to spin around. 
The princess spun and spun until she was so dizzy, she couldn't stand. She fell onto the ground and the treasure went flying all over the place. 
Suddenly, a small mouse appeared and asked, "Why are you spinning, Princess?" 
The princess replied, "I was so excited about finding this treasure that I got carried away!"
The mouse smiled, and said, "That's okay! Let's gather up the treasure and you can spin all you want!" 
So the two of them gathered up all the treasure, and the princess spun until she was dizzy again. 
When everything was back in its place, the mouse said, "That was so fun! We should do it again!"
The princess replied, "Yes, let's! I'm never going to stop spinning!"
And so the princess and the mouse enjoyed their spinning treasure adventure every day.



 
Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was only 3 years old. She had a special toy. It was a silver bear. 
The little girl loved her silver bear. Every day she would sit with it and talk to it. 
One day the little girl's mom asked her why she loved her silver bear so much. The little girl said, "Because he is so silly!"
Her mom laughed and said "Silly bear, why do you sit with my daughter every day?"
The silver bear just stayed quiet, but the little girl knew what it was thinking. It was thinking, "Because she loves me and I love her too!"




Once upon a time, there was a boy named Bob. Bob was three years old and he was very curious. He liked to explore the world around him.
One day, Bob decided to explore in the woods near his home. He went deep into the woods, until he came upon a clearing. In the middle of the clearing, Bob saw a strange figure dancing around the fire.
Bob was scared and he began to cry. The strange figure stopped dancing and said, "Don't be scared, Bob. I'm just here to have some fun and dance. Would you like to join me?"
Bob nodded his head and hesitantly began to dance with the figure. Bob soon forgot his fear and began to enjoy himself. The night passed quickly and soon it was time to go back home.
Bob and the figure said goodbye and Bob ran back home, feeling happy and excited. He couldn't believe what had just happened! Bob had faced his fear and discovered something new and exciting.




Once upon a time two friends, kids named Jack and Jill, were playing together. Jack was jumping into a pool, hoping to make a big splash.
Jill watched from the edge: "Jack, don't dive too deep!"
But Jack didn't listen and dived in as deep as he could.
Jill was worried so she followed Jack and dived after him. She caught up with him and they both bobbed up to the top of the pool together.
Jack smiled at Jill and said: "Thanks for finding me. You're very polite."
Jill laughed. "It's alright. We should stay at the top though, ok?"
Jack agreed. They swam around the top of the pool and had lots of fun. The time went too quickly and before they knew it, it was time to go home.
Both Jack and Jill hugged each other goodbye and promised to play together soon.




Once upon a time, there was a thin little boy named Tim. He wanted nothing more than to skip down the street. One day, he saw an oyster in the road and smiled. "Hello, oyster!" he said.
The oyster said, "Hi, Tim! Why don't you skip through my town with me?" Tim said, "Yes!" and the two of them started to skip.
They skipped and skipped until they were very tired. Then the oyster said, "It's time for me to go now. Bye, Tim!" And before Tim could say anything, the oyster was gone.
Tim smiled, wiped the sweat from his forehead and started skipping home. He skipped until he arrived just before dark. He had really enjoyed his adventure and thought about the oyster all the way home.




Once upon a time there was a bald man named Bob. Bob had a big yellow cube that he needed to load. He tried to pick it up, but it was too big and heavy.
Oh no! said Bob.
Just then, a small boy walked by. His name was Sam.
Hi, Sam said Bob. Can you help me? I need to load this cube.
Sam smiled. Yes! I can help.
Sam and Bob worked together to load the cube. It was so big and heavy, but they finally managed to do it.
Thank you, Sam! said Bob. I couldnt have done it without you!
Sam smiled. Youre welcome! Im glad I could help.




John was a little boy who really loved cars. He had a big red car and it was his favourite. Every day, he would take his car for a drive.
One day, John was driving around when he drove into a dark tunnel. He could hardly see anything but he kept driving until suddenly, he heard a loud crash. His car had gone over a broken fence at the end of the tunnel.
John got out of his car and looked at the broken fence. He thought it was so strange. He wanted to know who had put the fence there. 
Just then, a big bus drove up to the tunnel. Out popped a friendly man who said to John, "What are you doing in this tunnel?" John told the man about the broken fence and asked him who had put it up.
The man smiled and said, "I'm the one who built this fence and put it here. You see, I wanted to keep everyone safe and make sure that no one got hurt by driving into this tunnel. But it looks like my fence is broken now."
John thanked the man for being so kind and said goodbye. He drove away happy and content, having cleared up the mystery of the broken fence in the tunnel.



Once upon a time, there was a brave bunny named Buttons. Buttons was always on an adventure and today he was exploring a nearby forest. As he explored, he stumbled upon a broken kite and noticed it needed some repairs. 
Buttons decided he wanted to repair the kite and he searched high and low for the things he would need. He gathered twigs, leaves, and string. He then closed his eyes and thought about what else he would need. Suddenly, Buttons remembered that he had forgotten something very important: a nose!
Buttons knew he could ask for help. He spotted a very friendly looking fox in the forest. He hopped over and asked him very politely, "Do you have a nose that I can borrow to repair this kite?" 
The fox was crazy! He had a special nose that looked like a star that he was willing to lend to Buttons. Buttons was so excited. He thanked the fox and quickly got to work repairing the kite. After what seemed like forever, Buttons had successfully repaired the kite. He thanked the fox one more time and was off on the next adventure!




There was once a fair beetle named Jake. Jake was a happy beetle. Every day, Jake would find something fun to do. 
One day, Jake saw a big hill. He wanted to climb it! He set off at a slow pace, so he could enjoy the view.
When he reached the top, he found something wonderful. What was it? A big pile of flowers! He smiled, then he quickly jumped in them. He rolled around and laughed until he was finished.
Suddenly, he heard a voice. "What are you doing up here?" It was Mr. Fox.
Jake stayed very still, but he was too late. Mr. Fox had already seen him.
Jake spoke up. "I was just playing. It was so fair!"
"Good!" said Mr. Fox. "You have been very brave. Now you can finish your climb down the hill."
Jake thanked Mr. Fox, then he headed down the hill. He had had so much fun, but he was glad to be home. Jake was a fair beetle, and he was happy to finish his climb.




Once upon a time there lived a big, strong bear. His name was Ben. He loved living in the forest and every day he would explore it.
One morning, he came across a small campfire. It was near a clearing. He got closer and saw two rabbits sitting by the fire. All of a sudden, Ben heard them talking about a strange, thin smoke.
He walked over to them and said, Whats that smoke?
The rabbits turned and saw Ben. One of them, whose name was Terry, said, Hello there! We were just discussing this thin smoke we can smell. It smells kind of weird. Do you know what it is?
Ben sniffed the air and said, I think its a campfire smoke. You know, like when you light a campfire. Its smell is different to other smoke and its very thin.
The rabbits thanked him and they all said goodbye. Ben went on his way, happy that he got to help the two little rabbits.




Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl called Rose. She was three years old and always looking for things to explore.
One day, she found a really soft thing by the river. She couldn't tell what it was, so she decided to grab it to take a closer look.
When she got home, her mom asked, What did you find, Rose?
I found this soft thing! Rose said, holding up the thing she had grabbed.
Rose's mom smiled. That's a teddy bear, she said. Let's put it on your bed so you can hug it whenever you want.
Rose was delighted. She hugged it tightly and happily went to sleep with her new soft thing by her side.




Once upon a time there was a little girl named Daisy. She was 3 years old and loved playing outside. One day, she went out into the garden and saw a pile of clay. She was so excited and started to poke it with her fingers!
Daisy said, "I love playing with clay!"
Then she started making all kinds of things with it. She made a pretty flower, a beautiful bird, and even a sparkly butterfly. They all looked so nice and she was so proud of her work.
Next, she decided to make a surprise for her mom. She carefully poked the clay with her fingers and shaped it into a heart. Then she added some extra special touches, like some dots, curves and swirls.
When she was done, she said, "Look mom, I made this for you. Isn't it pretty?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Oh Daisy, that's beautiful! Thank you so much."
Daisy was so happy that her mom liked her surprise. She hugged her mom tightly and said, "You're welcome."




Once upon a time, there were two friends, Tom and Mandy. Tom was very brave, and Mandy was very clever. One day, Tom and Mandy were walking through the forest. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise behind them.
They stopped and looked around. A scary monster was running towards them! Tom and Mandy were so scared!
Tom grabbed the nearest weapon he could find--a big stick. He bravely rushed at the monster, waving the stick and shouting. Mandy was impressed by Tom's courage.
"You are so brave!" cried Mandy.
"Haha, I have to be!" said Tom as he continued to rush at the monster.
The monster was no match for Tom's bravery and the weapon he was carrying. After a few more rushes, the monster backed away and ran away.
Mandy thanked Tom for his bravery and intelligence.
"You saved us!" she said.
Tom smiled and said, "You're welcome, my friend!"




Once there was a boy named Jack. He was three years old and he loved to play. One day he saw a big truck outside and he went over to take a look. He asked the driver, "What are you loading into the truck?" The driver smiled and said, "I'm loading an opera." 
Jack was very curious. He asked, "What's an opera?" The driver said, "It's a type of high singing. The voice is loud and beautiful. Would you like to hear it?"
Jack said "Yes", so the driver opened the door of the truck and played a recording of the opera. The sound was so beautiful that Jack could not believe his ears! He said, "Wow! That's so high. I want to do that too!" 
The driver smiled and said, "You can learn to sing opera if you practice. Let's go get you started!" Jack was so excited and the driver took him away to learn the beautiful opera music.




Once upon a time, there was a nosy little boy named John. He spent every day exploring his garden and asking his parents lots of questions. One afternoon, while he was out playing, he saw a bright yellow space ship hovering above him. "Oh wow!" John exclaimed. He wanted to find out more, so he shouted up to the space ship, "Who are you?"
A little figure suddenly appeared in the ship's window. "Howdy! My name is Roger and I'm visiting from outer space." John was so excited, he asked "Can I come up and visit you?"
Roger laughed and said, "Sure! Hop on and I'll take you for a spin!" So, with a leap, John climbed aboard and away they flew into the sky. Compared to John's bedroom, the inside of the space ship was huge. There were all kinds of amazing gadgets, buttons and switches. 
John spent the afternoon playing with Roger and learning all about life in outer space. Before long, it was time to go home. As he waved goodbye, John wondered when he'd get to spend another day in outer space.
